original: Ṛgveda
analyzed: ṛgveda
translated: Ṛg Veda

original: agnim īḷe purohitaṃ yajñasya devam ṛtvijam /
analyzed: agnim īḍe purohitam yajñasya devam ṛtvijam
translated: I praise Agni, the priest, the god, the officiant of the sacrifice,

original: hotāraṃ ratnadhātamam //
analyzed: hotāram ratna dhātamam
translated: The priest, the bestower of treasures.

original: agniḥ pūrvebhir ṛṣibhir īḍyo nūtanair uta /
analyzed: agniḥ pūrvebhiḥ ṛṣibhiḥ īḍyaḥ nūtanaiḥ uta
translated: Agni is to be praised by the ancient seers and by the new ones as well.

original: sa devāṃ eha vakṣati //
analyzed: sa devān ā iha vakṣati
translated: He will lead the gods here.

original: agninā rayim aśnavat poṣam eva divedive /
analyzed: agninā rayim aśnavat poṣam eva dive dive
translated: Through Agni, one obtains wealth and nourishment day by day,

original: yaśasaṃ vīravattamam //
analyzed: yaśasam vīravattamam
translated: Glorious, most excellent in heroes.

original: agne yaṃ yajñam adhvaraṃ viśvataḥ paribhūr asi /
analyzed: agne yam yajñam adhvaram viśvatas paribhūḥ asi
translated: O Agni, whatever sacrifice or offering you attend on all sides,

original: sa id deveṣu gacchati //
analyzed: saḥ id deveṣu gacchati
translated: That indeed goes to the gods.

original: agnir hotā kavikratuḥ satyaś citraśravastamaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ hotā kavi kratuḥ satyaḥ citra śravastamaḥ
translated: Agni, the priest, of wise resolve, true, most famous for wondrous deeds,

original: devo devebhir ā gamat //
analyzed: devaḥ devebhiḥ ā gamat
translated: The god, may he come with the gods.

original: yad aṅga dāśuṣe tvam agne bhadraṃ kariṣyasi /
analyzed: yat aṅga dāśuṣe tvam agne bhadram kariṣyasi
translated: Whatever good you will do, O Agni, to the worshipper,

original: tavet tat satyam aṅgiraḥ //
analyzed: tava id tat satyam aṅgiraḥ
translated: That, O Angiras, is your truth.

original: upa tvāgne divedive doṣāvastar dhiyā vayam /
analyzed: upa tvā agne dive dive doṣāvastar dhiyā vayam
translated: To you, O Agni, day by day, O layer of the dust, we come with our thought,

original: namo bharanta emasi //
analyzed: namaḥ bharantaḥ emasi
translated: Bearing homage, we come to you.

original: rājantam adhvarāṇāṃ gopām ṛtasya dīdivim /
analyzed: rājantam adhvarāṇām gopām ṛtasya dīdivim
translated: The king of sacrifices, the guardian of truth, the radiant one,

original: vardhamānaṃ sve dame //
analyzed: vardhamānam sve dame
translated: Growing in his own abode.

original: sa naḥ piteva sūnave 'gne sūpāyano bhava /
analyzed: sa naḥ pitā iva sūnave gne su upāyanaḥ bhava
translated: Be easy of access to us, O Agni, like a father to his son.

original: sacasvā naḥ svastaye //
analyzed: sacasva naḥ svastaye
translated: Be with us for our welfare.

original: vāyav ā yāhi darśateme somā araṅkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: vāyo ā yāhi darśata ime somāḥ araṅkṛtāḥ
translated: O Vayu, come to show yourself. These Soma juices are prepared.

original: teṣām pāhi śrudhī havam //
analyzed: teṣām pāhi śrudhi havam
translated: Protect them and listen to the call.

original: vāya ukthebhir jarante tvām acchā jaritāraḥ /
analyzed: vāyo ukthebhiḥ jarante tvām acchā jaritāraḥ
translated: O Vayu, the singers serve thee with lauds, the pressers of Soma,

original: sutasomā aharvidaḥ //
analyzed: suta somāḥ ahar vidaḥ
translated: knowing the day.

original: vāyo tava prapṛñcatī dhenā jigāti dāśuṣe /
analyzed: vāyo tava prapṛñcatī dhenā jigāti dāśuṣe
translated: O Vayu, thy flowing milk goes forth to the worshipper,

original: urūcī somapītaye //
analyzed: urūcī soma pītaye
translated: wide and far, for the drinking of Soma.

original: indravāyū ime sutā upa prayobhir ā gatam /
analyzed: indra vāyū ime sutāḥ upa prayobhiḥ ā gatam
translated: O Indra and Vayu, these juices are pressed: come hither with your teams.

original: indavo vām uśanti hi //
analyzed: indavaḥ vām uśanti hi
translated: The drops delight you both.

original: vāyav indraś ca cetathaḥ sutānāṃ vājinīvasū /
analyzed: vāyo indraḥ ca cetathaḥ sutānām vājinīvasū
translated: O Vayu and Indra, you two rich in spoil, are mindful of the juices.

original: tāv ā yātam upa dravat //
analyzed: tau ā yātam upa dravat
translated: Come ye hither, run ye hither.

original: vāyav indraś ca sunvata ā yātam upa niṣkṛtam /
analyzed: vāyo indraḥ ca sunvataḥ ā yātam upa niṣkṛtam
translated: O Vayu and Indra, come to the worshipper's libation, to the place of worship.

original: makṣv itthā dhiyā narā //
analyzed: makṣū itthā dhiyā narā
translated: Be swift, O heroes, with this thought.

original: mitraṃ huve pūtadakṣaṃ varuṇaṃ ca riśādasam /
analyzed: mitram huve pūta dakṣam varuṇam ca riśādasam
translated: I invoke Mitra, whose power is pure, and Varuna, the foe-destroyer,

original: dhiyaṃ ghṛtācīṃ sādhantā //
analyzed: dhiyam ghṛtācīm sādhantā
translated: accomplishing the ghee-filled thought.

original: ṛtena mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāvṛdhāv ṛtaspṛśā /
analyzed: ṛtena mitrāvaruṇau ṛtāvṛdhau ṛta spṛśā
translated: By law, O Mitra-Varuna, law-increasing, law-observing ones,

original: kratum bṛhantam āśāthe //
analyzed: kratum bṛhantam āśāthe
translated: ye have attained great holy power.

original: kavī no mitrāvaruṇā tuvijātā urukṣayā /
analyzed: kavī naḥ mitrāvaruṇā tuvi jātau uru kṣayā
translated: O sages Mitra-Varuna, of mighty birth, of wide dominion,

original: dakṣaṃ dadhāte apasam //
analyzed: dakṣam dadhāte apasam
translated: ye bestow skill and ability.

original: aśvinā yajvarīr iṣo dravatpāṇī śubhas patī /
analyzed: aśvinā yajvarīḥ iṣaḥ dravat pāṇī śubhaḥ patī
translated: O Asvins, whose food is to be offered, whose hands move swiftly, lords of splendour,

original: purubhujā canasyatam //
analyzed: puru bhujā canasyatam
translated: rich in possessions, accept (the sacrifice).

original: aśvinā purudaṃsasā narā śavīrayā dhiyā /
analyzed: aśvinā puru daṃsasā narā śavīrayā dhiyā
translated: O Asvins, ye men who give abundant gifts, with your mighty thought

original: dhiṣṇyā vanataṃ giraḥ //
analyzed: dhiṣṇyā vanatam giraḥ
translated: make ye our songs to be desired.

original: dasrā yuvākavaḥ sutā nāsatyā vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: dasrā yuvākavaḥ sutāḥ nāsatyā vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: O Nāsatyas, wondrous, young, the pressed Soma juices, with trimmed grass,

original: ā yātaṃ rudravartanī //
analyzed: ā yātam rudravartanī
translated: Come, O you who travel with the Rudras!

original: indrā yāhi citrabhāno sutā ime tvāyavaḥ /
analyzed: indra ā yāhi citra bhāno sutāḥ ime tvāyavaḥ
translated: O Indra, come, O you of wondrous light, these juices are ready for you,

original: aṇvībhis tanā pūtāsaḥ //
analyzed: aṇvībhiḥ tanā pūtāsaḥ
translated: Purified with the finest vessels.

original: indrā yāhi dhiyeṣito viprajūtaḥ sutāvataḥ /
analyzed: indra ā yāhi dhiyā iṣitaḥ vipra jūtaḥ sutāvataḥ
translated: O Indra, come, urged on by the thought, urged on by the poet, by the pressers of the Soma,

original: upa brahmāṇi vāghataḥ //
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi vāghataḥ
translated: To the prayers of the priest.

original: indrā yāhi tūtujāna upa brahmāṇi harivaḥ /
analyzed: indra ā yāhi tūtujānaḥ upa brahmāṇi harivas
translated: O Indra, come, urged on, O you who love the bay steeds, to the prayers,

original: sute dadhiṣva naś canaḥ //🔽omāsaś carṣaṇīdhṛto viśve devāsa ā gata /🔽dāśvāṃso dāśuṣaḥ sutam //🔽viśve devāso apturaḥ sutam ā ganta tūrṇayaḥ /🔽usrā iva svasarāṇi //
analyzed: sute dadhiṣva naḥ canaḥ  omāsaḥ carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ viśve devāsaḥ ā gata  dāśvāṃsaḥ dāśuṣaḥ sutam  viśve devāsaḥ apturaḥ sutam ā ganta tūrṇayaḥ  usrāḥ iva svasarāṇi
translated: In the pressed (Soma), enjoy our praise.

original: viśve devāso asridha ehimāyāso adruhaḥ /🔽medhaṃ juṣanta vahnayaḥ //🔽pāvakā naḥ sarasvatī vājebhir vājinīvatī /🔽yajñaṃ vaṣṭu dhiyāvasuḥ //🔽codayitrī sūnṛtānāṃ cetantī sumatīnām /🔽yajñaṃ dadhe sarasvatī //🔽maho arṇaḥ sarasvatī pra cetayati ketunā /🔽dhiyo viśvā vi rājati //
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ asridhaḥ ehimāyāsaḥ adruhaḥ 🔽medham juṣanta vahnayaḥ 🔽pāvakā naḥ sarasvatī vājebhiḥ vājinīvatī 🔽yajñam vaṣṭu dhiyāvasuḥ 🔽codayitrī sūnṛtānām cetantī sumatīnām 🔽yajñam dadhe sarasvatī 🔽mahaḥ arṇaḥ sarasvatī pra cetayati ketunā 🔽dhiyaḥ viśvāḥ vi rājati
translated: The all-supporting, all-invigorating, all-pervading, all-encompassing, all-pervading, all-embracing, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading, all-pervading

original: surūpakṛtnum ūtaye sudughām iva goduhe /
analyzed: su rūpa kṛtnum ūtaye sudughām iva go duhe
translated: The beautiful, the bountiful, like a milch-cow for the milking,

original: juhūmasi dyavidyavi //
analyzed: juhūmasi dyavidyavi
translated: We worship, O Heaven and Earth.

original: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya somapāḥ piba /
analyzed: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya soma pāḥ piba
translated: Come to our offerings: drink the Soma, O thou who lovest Soma.

original: godā id revato madaḥ //
analyzed: go dāḥ id revataḥ madaḥ
translated: The gift of kine is a gladdening draught.

original: athā te antamānāṃ vidyāma sumatīnām /
analyzed: athā te antamānām vidyāma sumatīnām
translated: So may we know thee among the best of those who show compassion,

original: mā no ati khya ā gahi //
analyzed: mā naḥ ati khyaḥ ā gahi
translated: Come not thou to us with thy most terrible form.

original: parehi vigram astṛtam indram pṛcchā vipaścitam /
analyzed: parehi vigram astṛtam indram pṛccha vipaścitam
translated: Go to the unvanquished combatant: ask thou the wise Indra,

original: yas te sakhibhya ā varam //
analyzed: yaḥ te sakhibhyaḥ ā varam
translated: Who is better than thy friends.

original: uta bruvantu no nido nir anyataś cid ārata /
analyzed: uta bruvantu naḥ nidaḥ niḥ anyatas cit ārata
translated: And let the curses speak to us from whatever place they come,

original: dadhānā indra id duvaḥ //
analyzed: dadhānāḥ indraḥ id duvaḥ
translated: Granting to Indra his due service.

original: uta naḥ subhagāṃ arir voceyur dasma kṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: uta naḥ subhagām ariḥ voceyuḥ dasma kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: And let the wondrous men proclaim us fortunate in our homes,

original: syāmed indrasya śarmaṇi //
analyzed: syāma id indrasya śarmaṇi
translated: May we be in Indra's protection.

original: em āśum āśave bhara yajñaśriyaṃ nṛmādanam /
analyzed: ā īm āśum āśave bhara yajña śriyam nṛ mādanam
translated: Bring hither the swift one to the swift one, the glory of sacrifice, the gladdener of men,

original: patayan mandayatsakham //
analyzed: patayat mandayatsakham
translated: The friend who makes glad as he falls.

original: asya pītvā śatakrato ghano vṛtrāṇām abhavaḥ /🔽prāvo vājeṣu vājinam //
analyzed: asya pītvā śatakrato ghanaḥ vṛtrāṇām abhavaḥ  prāvaḥ vājeṣu vājinam
translated: Having drunk of this, O thou of a hundred powers, thou hast become the slayer of the forts of foes,🔽Thou hast urged on the strong one in the contests.

original: taṃ tvā vājeṣu vājinaṃ vājayāmaḥ śatakrato /
analyzed: tam tvā vājeṣu vājinam vājayāmaḥ śatakrato
translated: We urge thee on in the contests, O thou of a hundred powers, thee the strong one,

original: dhanānām indra sātaye //
analyzed: dhanānām indra sātaye
translated: O Indra, to win the spoil.

original: yo rāyo 'vanir mahān supāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā /
analyzed: yaḥ rāyaḥ vaniḥ mahān su pāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā
translated: He who is the great bestower of wealth, a good deliverer, a friend to the worshipper,

original: tasmā indrāya gāyata //
analyzed: tasmai indrāya gāyata
translated: To him sing ye to Indra.

original: ā tv etā ni ṣīdatendram abhi pra gāyata /
analyzed: ā tu eta ni sīdata indram abhi pra gāyata
translated: Come hither, sit ye down: sing ye forth to Indra,

original: sakhāya stomavāhasaḥ //
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ stoma vāhasaḥ
translated: Friends, who bring praise as their gift.

original: purūtamam purūṇām īśānaṃ vāryāṇām /
analyzed: purutamam purūṇām īśānam vāryāṇām
translated: Most frequent of the frequent, lord of good things,

original: indraṃ some sacā sute //🔽sa ghā no yoga ā bhuvat sa rāye sa purandhyām /
analyzed: indram some sacā sute  sa ghā naḥ yoge ā bhuvat sa rāye sa purandhyām
translated: Indra, with Soma pressed, is he.🔽He shall be our helper in the fight, in wealth, in the assembly.

original: gamad vājebhir ā sa naḥ //
analyzed: gamat vājebhiḥ ā sa naḥ
translated: May he come to us with his powers.

original: yasya saṃsthe na vṛṇvate harī samatsu śatravaḥ /
analyzed: yasya saṃsthe na vṛṇvate harī samatsu śatravaḥ
translated: Whose bay steeds in the contest the foes do not resist,

original: tasmā indrāya gāyata //
analyzed: tasmai indrāya gāyata
translated: Sing ye to him, to Indra.

original: sutapāvne sutā ime śucayo yanti vītaye /
analyzed: suta pāvne sutāḥ ime śucayaḥ yanti vītaye
translated: To the purifier of the juice these pure (drops) go for his enjoyment,

original: somāso dadhyāśiraḥ //
analyzed: somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ
translated: The Soma-drops, O Indra, to the head of him who offers.

original: tvaṃ sutasya pītaye sadyo vṛddho ajāyathāḥ /
analyzed: tvam sutasya pītaye sadyas vṛddhaḥ ajāyathāḥ
translated: Thou, for the drinking of the juice, art born anew, grown strong at once,

original: indra jyaiṣṭhyāya sukrato //
analyzed: indra jyaiṣṭhyāya sukrato
translated: O Indra, for preeminence, O very wise one.

original: ā tvā viśantv āśavaḥ somāsa indra girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā viśantu āśavaḥ somāsaḥ indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: Let the swift Soma-drops enter thee, O Indra, lover of the song,

original: śaṃ te santu pracetase //🔽tvāṃ stomā avīvṛdhan tvām ukthā śatakrato /🔽tvāṃ vardhantu no giraḥ //
analyzed: śam te santu pracetase  tvām stomāḥ avīvṛdhan tvām ukthā śatakrato  tvām vardhantu naḥ giraḥ
translated: Be they for thy good understanding.🔽The praises have exalted thee, the lauds, O thou of a hundred powers.🔽Let our songs make thee grow in strength.

original: akṣitotiḥ saned imaṃ vājam indraḥ sahasriṇam /
analyzed: a kṣita ūtiḥ sanet imam vājam indraḥ sahasriṇam
translated: May he, whose help never fails, accept this treasure, O Indra, the thousandfold,

original: yasmin viśvāni pauṃsyā //🔽mā no martā abhi druhan tanūnām indra girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: yasmin viśvāni pauṃsyā  mā naḥ martāḥ abhi druhan tanūnām indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: In which all manly powers are contained.🔽Let not mortal foes, O Indra, lover of the song, injure our bodies.

original: īśāno yavayā vadham //
analyzed: īśānaḥ yavaya vadham
translated: Be thou the lord to avert the blow.

original: yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣaṃ carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ /
analyzed: yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ
translated: They yoke the ruddy one, the moving one, the one who stands around.

original: rocante rocanā divi //
analyzed: rocante rocanā divi
translated: The luminous lights shine in the sky.

original: yuñjanty asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe /
analyzed: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe
translated: They yoke his two desirable tawny horses on the two-wheeled chariot,

original: śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛvāhasā //
analyzed: śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā
translated: The red ones, the bold ones, the ones who carry men.

original: ketuṃ kṛṇvann aketave peśo maryā apeśase /
analyzed: ketum kṛṇvan a ketave peśaḥ maryāḥ a peśase
translated: Making a banner for the bannerless, you make a body for the bodiless.

original: sam uṣadbhir ajāyathāḥ //
analyzed: sam uṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ
translated: You were born together with the dawns.

original: ād aha svadhām anu punar garbhatvam erire /
analyzed: āt aha svadhām anu punar garbha tvam erire
translated: They have again come to their own nature, to the state of being an embryo,

original: dadhānā nāma yajñiyam //
analyzed: dadhānāḥ nāma yajñiyam
translated: Bearing the sacrificial name.

original: vīḷu cid ārujatnubhir guhā cid indra vahnibhiḥ /
analyzed: vīḷu cit ārujatnubhiḥ guhā cit indra vahnibhiḥ
translated: With the impetuous ones, even the hidden one, O Indra, with the fires,

original: avinda usriyā anu //
analyzed: avindaḥ usriyāḥ anu
translated: You have found the cows.

original: devayanto yathā matim acchā vidadvasuṃ giraḥ /
analyzed: devayantaḥ yathā matim acchā vidadvasum giraḥ
translated: The god-adoring ones, as by thought, have sought with their praises the one who finds good things,

original: mahām anūṣata śrutam //🔽indreṇa saṃ hi dṛkṣase saṃjagmāno abibhyuṣā /
analyzed: mahām anūṣata śrutam  indreṇa sam hi dṛkṣase saṃjagmānaḥ a bibhyuṣā
translated: The great one, the famous one.🔽For you are seen together with Indra, the fearless one,

original: mandū samānavarcasā //
analyzed: mandū samāna varcasā
translated: The one of equal splendor, the one who delights.

original: anavadyair abhidyubhir makhaḥ sahasvad arcati /
analyzed: anavadyaiḥ abhidyubhiḥ makhaḥ sahasvat arcati
translated: The sacrifice praises with the faultless ones, the radiant ones,

original: gaṇair indrasya kāmyaiḥ //
analyzed: gaṇaiḥ indrasya kāmyaiḥ
translated: With Indra's desirable groups.

original: ataḥ parijmann ā gahi divo vā rocanād adhi /
analyzed: atas parijman ā gahi divaḥ vā rocanāt adhi
translated: From here, O wanderer, come, from the light of the sky,

original: sam asminn ṛñjate giraḥ //🔽ito vā sātim īmahe divo vā pārthivād adhi /
analyzed: sam asmin ṛñjate giraḥ  itas vā sātim īmahe divaḥ vā pārthivāt adhi
translated: In this one the praises rejoice.🔽From here we seek the victory, from the sky or from the earth,

original: indram maho vā rajasaḥ //
analyzed: indram mahaḥ vā rajasaḥ
translated: Indra, from the great realm or from the sky.

original: indram id gāthino bṛhad indram arkebhir arkiṇaḥ /
analyzed: indram id gāthinaḥ bṛhat indram arkebhiḥ arkiṇaḥ
translated: Indra, the singers with their lofty praise, Indra, the chanters with their songs,

original: indraṃ vāṇīr anūṣata //🔽indra id dharyoḥ sacā sammiśla ā vacoyujā /
analyzed: indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata  indraḥ id haryoḥ sacā sammiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā
translated: The voices have sung forth to Indra.🔽Indra, yoked with the two bay steeds, is closely joined with the two who are yoked with speech.

original: indro vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: Indra is the golden one with the thunderbolt.

original: indro dīrghāya cakṣasa ā sūryaṃ rohayad divi /
analyzed: indraḥ dīrghāya cakṣase ā sūryam rohayat divi
translated: Indra raised the sun to the sky, for the sake of the far-seeing eye.

original: vi gobhir adrim airayat //
analyzed: vi gobhiḥ adrim airayat
translated: He drove away the mountain with the cows.

original: indra vājeṣu no 'va sahasrapradhaneṣu ca /
analyzed: indra vājeṣu naḥ vaḥ sahasra pradhaneṣu ca
translated: O Indra, in our battles, in the contests for a thousand prizes,

original: ugra ugrābhir ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: ugraḥ ugrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: The strong one, with your strong aids.

original: indraṃ vayam mahādhana indram arbhe havāmahe /
analyzed: indram vayam mahādhane indram arbhe havāmahe
translated: We call on Indra, the great one, we call on Indra, the young one,

original: yujaṃ vṛtreṣu vajriṇam //
analyzed: yujam vṛtreṣu vajriṇam
translated: The yoked one, the wielder of the thunderbolt, in the battles with Vritra.

original: sa no vṛṣann amuṃ caruṃ satrādāvann apā vṛdhi /
analyzed: sa naḥ vṛṣan amum carum satrādāvan apa ā vṛdhi
translated: O bull, make this oblation increase for us, O you who are to be invoked in the assembly,

original: asmabhyam apratiṣkutaḥ //
analyzed: asmabhyam apratiṣkutaḥ
translated: For us, O you who are not to be resisted.

original: tuñjetuñje ya uttare stomā indrasya vajriṇaḥ /
analyzed: tuñjetuñje ye uttare stomāḥ indrasya vajriṇaḥ
translated: The higher praises of the wielder of the thunderbolt, Indra,

original: na vindhe asya suṣṭutim //
analyzed: na vindhe asya suṣṭutim
translated: I do not find his eulogy.

original: vṛṣā yūtheva vaṃsagaḥ kṛṣṭīr iyarty ojasā /
analyzed: vṛṣā yūthā iva vaṃsagaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ iyarti ojasā
translated: Like a bull in the herd, he urges the people with his might,

original: īśāno apratiṣkutaḥ //
analyzed: īśānaḥ apratiṣkutaḥ
translated: The lord, the irresistible one.

original: ya ekaś carṣaṇīnāṃ vasūnām irajyati /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ carṣaṇīnām vasūnām irajyati
translated: He who alone rules over the wealth of the people,

original: indraḥ pañca kṣitīnām //
analyzed: indraḥ pañca kṣitīnām
translated: Indra, over the five peoples.

original: indraṃ vo viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ /
analyzed: indram vaḥ viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ
translated: We invoke Indra from all sides for the people.

original: asmākam astu kevalaḥ //
analyzed: asmākam astu kevalaḥ
translated: May he be ours alone.

original: endra sānasiṃ rayiṃ sajitvānaṃ sadāsaham /
analyzed: ā indra sānasim rayim sa jitvānam sadāsaham
translated: O Indra, bring us wealth that shall be enjoyed and ever conquer,

original: varṣiṣṭham ūtaye bhara //🔽ni yena muṣṭihatyayā ni vṛtrā ruṇadhāmahai /
analyzed: varṣiṣṭham ūtaye bhara  ni yena muṣṭi hatyayā ni vṛtrā ruṇadhāmahai
translated: The most excellent, to aid us.🔽By which we may smite down the Vr̥itras, and by which we may win

original: tvotāso ny arvatā //
analyzed: tvotāsaḥ ni arvatā
translated: The cattle, O thou whom our prayers have helped.

original: indra tvotāsa ā vayaṃ vajraṃ ghanā dadīmahi /
analyzed: indra tvotāsaḥ ā vayam vajram ghanā dadīmahi
translated: O Indra, we whose help thou art, we will hurl the bolt as 'twere a stone,

original: jayema saṃ yudhi spṛdhaḥ //
analyzed: jayema sam yudhi spṛdhaḥ
translated: That we may conquer in the fight our foes.

original: vayaṃ śūrebhir astṛbhir indra tvayā yujā vayam /
analyzed: vayam śūrebhiḥ astṛbhiḥ indra tvayā yujā vayam
translated: With thee to aid, O Indra, we, with heroes and with weapons,

original: sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ //🔽mahāṃ indraḥ paraś ca nu mahitvam astu vajriṇe /
analyzed: sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ  mahān indraḥ paras ca nu mahi tvam astu vajriṇe
translated: May overcome the foemen.🔽Great is Indra, and beyond is his greatness: to the wielder of the bolt be homage.

original: dyaur na prathinā śavaḥ //
analyzed: dyauḥ na prathinā śavaḥ
translated: His might is like the broad expanse of heaven.

original: samohe vā ya āśata naras tokasya sanitau /
analyzed: samohe vā ye āśata naraḥ tokasya sanitau
translated: Or those who come to the assembly, men to the contest of offspring,

original: viprāso vā dhiyāyavaḥ //🔽yaḥ kukṣiḥ somapātamaḥ samudra iva pinvate /
analyzed: viprāsaḥ vā dhiyāyavaḥ  yaḥ kukṣiḥ soma pātamaḥ samudraḥ iva pinvate
translated: Or the sages who long for the hymn.🔽His belly, best to drink the Soma, swells like the sea,

original: urvīr āpo na kākudaḥ //
analyzed: urvīḥ āpaḥ na kākudaḥ
translated: The spacious waters like a reservoir.

original: evā hy asya sūnṛtā virapśī gomatī mahī /
analyzed: eva hi asya sūnṛtā virapśī gomatī mahī
translated: So is his bounty, his wide-spreading grace, his great and rich enjoyment of the kine,

original: pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe //
analyzed: pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe
translated: Like a ripe branch to the worshipper.

original: evā hi te vibhūtaya ūtaya indra māvate /
analyzed: eva hi te vibhūtayaḥ ūtayaḥ indra māvate
translated: So are thy mighty powers, O Indra, thy succours to the worshipper,

original: sadyaś cit santi dāśuṣe //
analyzed: sadyas cit santi dāśuṣe
translated: Even now are they for him who offers.

original: evā hy asya kāmyā stoma ukthaṃ ca śaṃsyā /
analyzed: eva hi asya kāmyā stomaḥ uktham ca śaṃsyā
translated: So is his praise worthy of desire, and the hymn and laud worthy of song,

original: indrāya somapītaye //
analyzed: indrāya soma pītaye
translated: To Indra for the drinking of the Soma.

original: indrehi matsy andhaso viśvebhiḥ somaparvabhiḥ /
analyzed: indra ihi matsi andhasaḥ viśvebhiḥ soma parvabhiḥ
translated: Come to me, O Indra, to the juice, with all the Soma feasts.

original: mahāṃ abhiṣṭir ojasā //
analyzed: mahān abhiṣṭiḥ ojasā
translated: Great is the protection with might.

original: em enaṃ sṛjatā sute mandim indrāya mandine /
analyzed: ā īm enam sṛjata sute mandim indrāya mandine
translated: Send him forth, O Soma-presser, the gladdener, to gladden Indra,

original: cakriṃ viśvāni cakraye //
analyzed: cakrim viśvāni cakraye
translated: The doer of all things to be done.

original: matsvā suśipra mandibhi stomebhir viśvacarṣaṇe /
analyzed: matsva su śipra mandibhiḥ stomebhiḥ viśvacarṣaṇe
translated: Rejoice, O thou of beautiful brows, with the gladdening hymns, O thou who art worshipped by all.

original: sacaiṣu savaneṣv ā //
analyzed: sacā eṣu savaneṣu ā
translated: Be thou present at these libations.

original: asṛgram indra te giraḥ prati tvām ud ahāsata /
analyzed: asṛgram indra te giraḥ prati tvām ud ahāsata
translated: The songs have flowed forth to thee, O Indra, and have risen up to thee,

original: ajoṣā vṛṣabham patim //
analyzed: ajoṣāḥ vṛṣabham patim
translated: The bountiful one, the bull, the lord.

original: saṃ codaya citram arvāg rādha indra vareṇyam /
analyzed: sam codaya citram arvāk rādhaḥ indra vareṇyam
translated: Impel hither, O Indra, the wondrous, the excellent gift.

original: asad it te vibhu prabhu //
analyzed: asat id te vibhu prabhu
translated: It is thine, O mighty one, to bestow.

original: asmān su tatra codayendra rāye rabhasvataḥ /
analyzed: asmān su tatra codaya indra rāye rabhasvataḥ
translated: There, O Indra, impel us to wealth, to the possession of wealth,

original: tuvidyumna yaśasvataḥ //
analyzed: tuvi dyumna yaśasvataḥ
translated: O thou of mighty splendour, to glorious wealth.

original: saṃ gomad indra vājavad asme pṛthu śravo bṛhat /
analyzed: sam gomat indra vājavat asme pṛthu śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: O Indra, bestow on us the wide, the glorious fame, accompanied with cattle and strength,

original: viśvāyur dhehy akṣitam //
analyzed: viśva āyuḥ dhehi akṣitam
translated: Enduring through all life.

original: asme dhehi śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ sahasrasātamam /
analyzed: asme dhehi śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam sahasra sātamam
translated: Bestow on us great fame, O Indra, and glory most worthy of a thousand,

original: indra tā rathinīr iṣaḥ //
analyzed: indra tāḥ rathinīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: Those irresistible gifts.

original: vasor indraṃ vasupatiṃ gīrbhir gṛṇanta ṛgmiyam /
analyzed: vasoḥ indram vasu patim gīrbhiḥ gṛṇantaḥ ṛgmiyam
translated: Praising with hymns the wealthy Indra, the lord of wealth, who is to be praised,

original: homa gantāram ūtaye //🔽sutesute nyokase bṛhad bṛhata ed ariḥ /
analyzed: homa gantāram ūtaye  sutesute nyokase bṛhat bṛhate ā id ariḥ
translated: Call him, O Hotar, to come to our help.🔽To Indra, the great, the far-reaching, the mighty, the enemy,

original: indrāya śūṣam arcati //
analyzed: indrāya śūṣam arcati
translated: The worshipper offers praise.

original: gāyanti tvā gāyatriṇo 'rcanty arkam arkiṇaḥ /
analyzed: gāyanti tvā gāyatriṇaḥ rcanti arkam arkiṇaḥ
translated: The singers sing thee, the praisers praise thy praise,

original: brahmāṇas tvā śatakrata ud vaṃśam iva yemire //
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ tvā śatakrato ud vaṃśam iva yemire
translated: The Brahmans, O thou of a hundred sacrifices, have lifted thee up like a beam.

original: yat sānoḥ sānum āruhad bhūry aspaṣṭa kartvam /
analyzed: yat sānoḥ sānum āruhat bhūri aspaṣṭa kartvam
translated: When thou hast mounted from ridge to ridge, to do many deeds,

original: tad indro arthaṃ cetati yūthena vṛṣṇir ejati //
analyzed: tat indraḥ artham cetati yūthena vṛṣṇiḥ ejati
translated: Then Indra thinks of that matter, the bull moves with a troop.

original: yukṣvā hi keśinā harī vṛṣaṇā kakṣyaprā /
analyzed: yukṣvā hi keśinā harī vṛṣaṇā kakṣya prā
translated: Yoke thy two strong, swift horses, O thou whose abode is in the lap,

original: athā na indra somapā girām upaśrutiṃ cara //
analyzed: athā naḥ indra soma pāḥ girām upaśrutim cara
translated: Then, O Indra, come to the hearing of our songs, as a drinker of Soma.

original: ehi stomāṃ abhi svarābhi gṛṇīhy ā ruva /🔽brahma ca no vaso sacendra yajñaṃ ca vardhaya //
analyzed: ehi stomān abhi svara abhi gṛṇīhi ā ruva  brahma ca naḥ vaso sacā indra yajñam ca vardhaya
translated: Come, sing to the praises, sing them forth, roar out.🔽And, O Vasu, be thou with our prayer, and increase our sacrifice.

original: uktham indrāya śaṃsyaṃ vardhanam puruniṣṣidhe /
analyzed: uktham indrāya śaṃsyam vardhanam puru niṣṣidhe
translated: Praise to Indra is to be extolled, an increase to the lord of many men.

original: śakro yathā suteṣu ṇo rāraṇat sakhyeṣu ca //🔽tam it sakhitva īmahe taṃ rāye taṃ suvīrye /
analyzed: śakraḥ yathā suteṣu naḥ rāraṇat sakhyeṣu ca  tam id sakhi tve īmahe tam rāye tam su vīrye
translated: As Sakra rejoices in our libations, and in our friendships.🔽We seek him for friendship, him for wealth, him for hero strength.

original: sa śakra uta naḥ śakad indro vasu dayamānaḥ //
analyzed: sa śakraḥ uta naḥ śakat indraḥ vasu dayamānaḥ
translated: May that Indra be able to give us wealth, bestowing it, the mighty.

original: suvivṛtaṃ sunirajam indra tvādātam id yaśaḥ /
analyzed: suvivṛtam sunirajam indra tvādātam id yaśaḥ
translated: Well-opened, well-unbarred, O Indra, is thy fame.

original: gavām apa vrajaṃ vṛdhi kṛṇuṣva rādho adrivaḥ //
analyzed: gavām apa vrajam vṛdhi kṛṇuṣva rādhaḥ adrivas
translated: Increase the herd of cattle, make our wealth grow, O thou of the stone.

original: nahi tvā rodasī ubhe ṛghāyamāṇam invataḥ /
analyzed: nahi tvā rodasī ubhe ṛghāyamāṇam invataḥ
translated: For the two world-halves, O thou who art not to be resisted, do not restrain thee when thou art eager.

original: jeṣaḥ svarvatīr apaḥ saṃ gā asmabhyaṃ dhūnuhi //
analyzed: jeṣaḥ svarvatīḥ apaḥ sam gāḥ asmabhyam dhūnuhi
translated: Shake out for us the waters that are full of light, and the milks.

original: āśrutkarṇa śrudhī havaṃ nū cid dadhiṣva me giraḥ /
analyzed: āśrut karṇa śrudhi havam nu cit dadhiṣva me giraḥ
translated: O thou with ears that hear, hear the invocation, and now do thou accept my songs.

original: indra stomam imam mama kṛṣvā yujaś cid antaram //
analyzed: indra stomam imam mama kṛṣva yujaḥ cit antaram
translated: O Indra, make this hymn of mine more powerful than the powerful.

original: vidmā hi tvā vṛṣantamaṃ vājeṣu havanaśrutam /
analyzed: vidma hi tvā vṛṣantamam vājeṣu havana śrutam
translated: We know thee as the most powerful in battles, thou who hearest the invocation.

original: vṛṣantamasya hūmaha ūtiṃ sahasrasātamām //
analyzed: vṛṣantamasya hūmahe ūtim sahasra sātamām
translated: We call on the most powerful one for help, the best at winning a thousand.

original: ā tū na indra kauśika mandasānaḥ sutam piba /🔽navyam āyuḥ pra sū tira kṛdhī sahasrasām ṛṣim //
analyzed: ā tū naḥ indra kauśika mandasānaḥ sutam piba  navyam āyuḥ pra su tira kṛdhi sahasra sām ṛṣim
translated: Come now to me, O Indra, O Kausitaki, rejoicing, drink the pressed (Soma).🔽Extend anew the life of the Rishi, make him a thousandfold.

original: pari tvā girvaṇo gira imā bhavantu viśvataḥ /
analyzed: pari tvā girvaṇaḥ giraḥ imāḥ bhavantu viśvatas
translated: May these songs of mine, O thou who lovest the song, be around thee on every side.

original: vṛddhāyum anu vṛddhayo juṣṭā bhavantu juṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: vṛddha āyum anu vṛddhayaḥ juṣṭāḥ bhavantu juṣṭayaḥ
translated: May the dear offerings be dear to the one whose life is increased, to the ever-waxing one.

original: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhan samudravyacasaṃ giraḥ /
analyzed: indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan samudra vyacasam giraḥ
translated: All the songs have increased Indra, who is as vast as the ocean.

original: rathītamaṃ rathīnāṃ vājānāṃ satpatim patim //
analyzed: rathītamam rathīnām vājānām satpatim patim
translated: The best of charioteers, the lord of strength, the lord.

original: sakhye ta indra vājino mā bhema śavasas pate /
analyzed: sakhye te indra vājinaḥ mā bhema śavasaḥ pate
translated: In thy friendship, O Indra, O mighty one, we are not afraid, O lord of strength.

original: tvām abhi pra ṇonumo jetāram aparājitam //
analyzed: tvām abhi pra ṇonumaḥ jetāram aparājitam
translated: We utter praises to thee, the conqueror, the unconquered one.

original: pūrvīr indrasya rātayo na vi dasyanty ūtayaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvīḥ indrasya rātayaḥ na vi dasyanti ūtayaḥ
translated: The gifts of Indra are many, his aids are not to be despised,

original: yadī vājasya gomata stotṛbhyo maṃhate magham //
analyzed: yadī vājasya gomata stotṛbhyaḥ maṃhate magham
translated: If he delights in the wealth of the bountiful one for the praisers.

original: purām bhindur yuvā kavir amitaujā ajāyata /
analyzed: purām bhinduḥ yuvā kaviḥ amita ojāḥ ajāyata
translated: The breaker of forts, the young sage, of infinite power, was born.

original: indro viśvasya karmaṇo dhartā vajrī puruṣṭutaḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ viśvasya karmaṇaḥ dhartā vajrī puruṣṭutaḥ
translated: Indra, the supporter of all action, the wielder of the thunderbolt, is praised by many.

original: tvaṃ valasya gomato 'pāvar adrivo bilam /
analyzed: tvam valasya gomataḥ pāvaḥ adrivas bilam
translated: You, O Indra, the breaker of forts, have opened the cave of the wealthy Vala.

original: tvāṃ devā abibhyuṣas tujyamānāsa āviṣuḥ //🔽tavāhaṃ śūra rātibhiḥ praty āyaṃ sindhum āvadan /
analyzed: tvām devāḥ a bibhyuṣaḥ tujyamānāsaḥ āviṣuḥ  tava aham śūra rātibhiḥ prati āyam sindhum āvadan
translated: The fearless gods, being purified, have come to you.🔽O hero, I have come to you with gifts, addressing the river.

original: upātiṣṭhanta girvaṇo viduṣ ṭe tasya kāravaḥ //
analyzed: upātiṣṭhanta girvaṇaḥ viduḥ ṭe tasya kāravaḥ
translated: The knowers of your work, O lover of song, have approached you.

original: māyābhir indra māyinaṃ tvaṃ śuṣṇam avātiraḥ /
analyzed: māyābhiḥ indra māyinam tvam śuṣṇam avātiraḥ
translated: O Indra, with your magical powers you have overthrown the magician Shushna.

original: viduṣ ṭe tasya medhirās teṣāṃ śravāṃsy ut tira //
analyzed: viduḥ te tasya medhirāḥ teṣām śravāṃsi ud tira
translated: The wise ones know your work; their glories rise up.

original: indram īśānam ojasābhi stomā anūṣata /
analyzed: indram īśānam ojasā abhi stomāḥ anūṣata
translated: The praises have sung to Indra, the lord of power,

original: sahasraṃ yasya rātaya uta vā santi bhūyasīḥ //
analyzed: sahasram yasya rātayaḥ uta vā santi bhūyasīḥ
translated: whose gifts are a thousand, or even more than that.

original: agniṃ dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasam /
analyzed: agnim dūtam vṛṇīmahe hotāram viśva vedasam
translated: We choose Agni as our messenger, the priest who knows all,

original: asya yajñasya sukratum //
analyzed: asya yajñasya sukratum
translated: the wise one of this sacrifice.

original: agnimagniṃ havīmabhiḥ sadā havanta viśpatim /
analyzed: agnim agnim havīmabhiḥ sadā havanta viśpatim
translated: Agni, Agni, with offerings they always invoke the lord of the people,

original: havyavāham purupriyam //
analyzed: havyavāham puru priyam
translated: the bearer of oblations, dear to many.

original: agne devāṃ ihā vaha jajñāno vṛktabarhiṣe /
analyzed: agne devān iha ā vaha jajñānaḥ vṛktabarhiṣe
translated: O Agni, bring the gods hither to the one who has strewn the sacred grass,

original: asi hotā na īḍyaḥ //
analyzed: asi hotā naḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: you are the invoked priest.

original: tāṃ uśato vi bodhaya yad agne yāsi dūtyam /
analyzed: tām uśataḥ vi bodhaya yat agne yāsi dūtyam
translated: Awaken those who long for you, when, O Agni, you go on an errand,

original: devair ā satsi barhiṣi //
analyzed: devaiḥ ā satsi barhiṣi
translated: Sit on the sacred grass with the gods.

original: ghṛtāhavana dīdivaḥ prati ṣma riṣato daha /
analyzed: ghṛta āhavana dīdivas prati sma riṣataḥ daha
translated: O Agni, whose oblation is ghee, shine forth, burn the wicked one.

original: agne tvaṃ rakṣasvinaḥ //
analyzed: agne tvam rakṣasvinaḥ
translated: O Agni, protect us from the Raksases.

original: agnināgniḥ sam idhyate kavir gṛhapatir yuvā /
analyzed: agninā agniḥ sam idhyate kaviḥ gṛhapatiḥ yuvā
translated: Agni is kindled by Agni, the wise, the young householder,

original: havyavāḍ juhvāsyaḥ //
analyzed: havyavāṭ juhū āsyaḥ
translated: the bearer of oblations, with the ladle as his mouth.

original: kavim agnim upa stuhi satyadharmāṇam adhvare /
analyzed: kavim agnim upa stuhi satya dharmāṇam adhvare
translated: Praise Agni, the wise one, whose ways are true, at the sacrifice,

original: devam amīvacātanam //
analyzed: devam amīva cātanam
translated: the god who drives away misfortune.

original: yas tvām agne haviṣpatir dūtaṃ deva saparyati /
analyzed: yaḥ tvām agne haviṣpatiḥ dūtam deva saparyati
translated: O Agni, when the lord of oblations, the god, honors you as a messenger,

original: tasya sma prāvitā bhava //
analyzed: tasya sma prāvitā bhava
translated: be his forerunner.

original: yo agniṃ devavītaye haviṣmāṃ āvivāsati /
analyzed: yaḥ agnim deva vītaye haviṣmān āvivāsati
translated: He who invites Agni with oblations for the feast of the gods,

original: tasmai pāvaka mṛḷaya //
analyzed: tasmai pāvaka mṛḍaya
translated: be gracious to him, O purifying one.

original: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdivo 'gne devāṃ ihā vaha /
analyzed: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdivas gne devān iha ā vaha
translated: O purifying one, O shining one, O Agni, bring the gods hither

translated: The sisters go on their way, the cousins as Adhvaryus.

original: pṛñcatīr madhunā payaḥ //
analyzed: pṛñcatīḥ madhunā payaḥ
translated: Besprinkling the milk with honey.

original: amūr yā upa sūrye yābhir vā sūryaḥ saha /
analyzed: amūḥ yāḥ upa sūrye yābhiḥ vā sūryaḥ saha
translated: Those which are above the sun, or with which the sun is together,

original: tā no hinvantv adhvaram //
analyzed: tāḥ naḥ hinvantu adhvaram
translated: May they impel our sacrifice.

original: apo devīr upa hvaye yatra gāvaḥ pibanti naḥ /
analyzed: apaḥ devīḥ upa hvaye yatra gāvaḥ pibanti naḥ
translated: I invoke the divine waters, where our cows drink,

original: sindhubhyaḥ kartvaṃ haviḥ //
analyzed: sindhubhyaḥ kartvam haviḥ
translated: The oblation to be offered to the rivers.

original: apsv antar amṛtam apsu bheṣajam apām uta praśastaye /
analyzed: apsu antar amṛtam apsu bheṣajam apām uta praśastaye
translated: In the waters is the nectar, in the waters the medicine, for the praise of the waters.

original: devā bhavata vājinaḥ //
analyzed: devāḥ bhavata vājinaḥ
translated: O gods, be ye strong.

original: apsu me somo abravīd antar viśvāni bheṣajā /
analyzed: apsu me somaḥ abravīt antar viśvāni bheṣajā
translated: In the waters, Soma has told me, are all the medicines,

original: agniṃ ca viśvaśambhuvam āpaś ca viśvabheṣajīḥ //
analyzed: agnim ca viśva śambhuvam āpaḥ ca viśva bheṣajīḥ
translated: And Agni who is auspicious to all, and the waters which are all-healing.

original: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajaṃ varūthaṃ tanve mama /
analyzed: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajam varūtham tanve mama
translated: O waters, provide the remedy, the protection for my body.

original: jyok ca sūryaṃ dṛśe //🔽idam āpaḥ pra vahata yat kiṃ ca duritam mayi /
analyzed: jyok ca sūryam dṛśe  idam āpaḥ pra vahata yat kim ca duritam mayi
translated: And long to see the sun.🔽O waters, carry away whatever evil there is in me,

original: yad vāham abhidudroha yad vā śepa utānṛtam //🔽āpo adyānv acāriṣaṃ rasena sam agasmahi /🔽payasvān agna ā gahi tam mā saṃ sṛja varcasā //
analyzed: yat vā aham abhidudroha yat vā śepe uta anṛtam  āpaḥ adya anu acāriṣam rasena sam agasmahi  payasvān agne ā gahi tam mā sam sṛja varcasā
translated: If I have run against you, or spoken falsely or untruthfully.🔽Today, O waters, I have gone along with you, we have united with the sap.🔽O Agni, come with the sap, unite me with splendour.

original: sam māgne varcasā sṛja sam prajayā sam āyuṣā /
analyzed: sam mā agne varcasā sṛja sam prajayā sam āyuṣā
translated: O Agni, unite me with splendour, with offspring, with life,

original: vidyur me asya devā indro vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ //
analyzed: vidyuḥ me asya devāḥ indraḥ vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: May the gods know me, may Indra know me with the Rishis.

original: kasya nūnaṃ katamasyāmṛtānām manāmahe cāru devasya nāma /
analyzed: kasya nūnam katamasya amṛtānām manāmahe cāru devasya nāma
translated: Whose, indeed, of the immortal gods do we think of the beautiful name?

original: ko no mahyā aditaye punar dāt pitaraṃ ca dṛśeyam mātaraṃ ca //
analyzed: kaḥ naḥ mahyai aditaye punar dāt pitaram ca dṛśeyam mātaram ca
translated: Who will give us back to great Aditi, so that I may see my father and mother?

original: agner vayam prathamasyāmṛtānām manāmahe cāru devasya nāma /
analyzed: agneḥ vayam prathamasya amṛtānām manāmahe cāru devasya nāma
translated: Of Agni, the first of the immortal gods, we think of the beautiful name.

original: sa no mahyā aditaye punar dāt pitaraṃ ca dṛśeyam mātaraṃ ca //
analyzed: sa naḥ mahyai aditaye punar dāt pitaram ca dṛśeyam mātaram ca
translated: He will give us back to great Aditi, so that I may see my father and mother.

original: abhi tvā deva savitar īśānaṃ vāryāṇām /
analyzed: abhi tvā deva savitar īśānam vāryāṇām
translated: To you, O god Savitar, the lord of good things,

original: sadāvan bhāgam īmahe //
analyzed: sadā avan bhāgam īmahe
translated: O ever-present one, we pray for a share.

original: yaś cid dhi ta itthā bhagaḥ śaśamānaḥ purā nidaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ cit hi te itthā bhagaḥ śaśamānaḥ purā nidaḥ
translated: For whoever, O Bhaga, is here striving before the dawn,

original: adveṣo hastayor dadhe //
analyzed: a dveṣaḥ hastayoḥ dadhe
translated: He places non-hatred in his hands.

original: bhagabhaktasya te vayam ud aśema tavāvasā /
analyzed: bhaga bhaktasya te vayam ud aśema tava avasā
translated: We, devoted to Bhaga, may we rise up through your grace.

original: mūrdhānaṃ rāya ārabhe //🔽nahi te kṣatraṃ na saho na manyuṃ vayaś canāmī patayanta āpuḥ /
analyzed: mūrdhānam rāyaḥ ārabhe  nahi te kṣatram na sahaḥ na manyum vayaḥ cana amī patayantaḥ āpuḥ
translated: I grasp the head of wealth.🔽For your power, your strength, your wrath, your vigor none have attained.

original: nemā āpo animiṣaṃ carantīr na ye vātasya praminanty abhvam //
analyzed: na imāḥ āpaḥ animiṣam carantīḥ na ye vātasya praminanti abhvam
translated: These waters do not move without winking, nor do they measure the greatness of the wind.

original: abudhne rājā varuṇo vanasyordhvaṃ stūpaṃ dadate pūtadakṣaḥ /
analyzed: abudhne rājā varuṇaḥ vanasya ūrdhvam stūpam dadate pūta dakṣaḥ
translated: King Varuna, the son of Abugdhana, of pure power, gives a lofty sanctuary in the forest.

original: nīcīnā sthur upari budhna eṣām asme antar nihitāḥ ketavaḥ syuḥ //
analyzed: nīcīnā sthuḥ upari budhne eṣām asme antar nihitāḥ ketavaḥ syuḥ
translated: Their depths are low, their summit is high; their signs should be hidden within us.

original: uruṃ hi rājā varuṇaś cakāra sūryāya panthām anvetavā u /
analyzed: urum hi rājā varuṇaḥ cakāra sūryāya panthām anvetavai u
translated: For king Varuna has made a wide path for Surya to follow.

original: apade pādā pratidhātave 'kar utāpavaktā hṛdayāvidhaś cit //
analyzed: a pade pādā pratidhātave kaḥ uta apavaktā hṛdayāvidhaḥ cit
translated: In the trackless place he has made a path for the foot to tread; he has made a way for the heart to find its way.

original: śataṃ te rājan bhiṣajaḥ sahasram urvī gabhīrā sumatiṣ ṭe astu /
analyzed: śatam te rājan bhiṣajaḥ sahasram urvī gabhīrā sumatiḥ ṭe astu
translated: A hundred, O king, are thy physicians, a thousand; wide and deep be thy favour to us.

original: bādhasva dūre nirṛtim parācaiḥ kṛtaṃ cid enaḥ pra mumugdhy asmat //
analyzed: bādhasva dūre nirṛtim parācais kṛtam cit enaḥ pra mumugdhi asmat
translated: Drive away far away Nirrti; free us even from the sin we have committed.

original: amī ya ṛkṣā nihitāsa uccā naktaṃ dadṛśre kuha cid diveyuḥ /
analyzed: amī ye ṛkṣāḥ nihitāsaḥ uccā naktam dadṛśre kuha cit divā īyuḥ
translated: These stars that are set high, that shine by night, nowhere do they shine by day.

original: adabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni vicākaśac candramā naktam eti //
analyzed: adabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni vicākaśat candramāḥ naktam eti
translated: The bonds of Varuna are unbroken; the moon goes forth at night.

original: tat tvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānas tad ā śāste yajamāno havirbhiḥ /
analyzed: tat tvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānaḥ tat ā śāste yajamānaḥ havirbhiḥ
translated: To thee, O king, I come with prayer, worshipping; the sacrificer with oblations implores thee.

original: aheḷamāno varuṇeha bodhy uruśaṃsa mā na āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ //
analyzed: a heḍamānaḥ varuṇa iha bodhi uru śaṃsa mā naḥ āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ
translated: Be not wrathful here, O Varuna; be thou a good friend, O thou of wide sway, do not thou destroy our life.

original: tad in naktaṃ tad divā mahyam āhus tad ayaṃ keto hṛda ā vi caṣṭe /
analyzed: tat id naktam tat divā mahyam āhuḥ tat ayam ketaḥ hṛdaḥ ā vi caṣṭe
translated: This they say to me by night and by day; this the star shines forth in my heart.

original: śunaḥśepo yam ahvad gṛbhītaḥ so asmān rājā varuṇo mumoktu //
analyzed: śunaḥśepaḥ yam ahvat gṛbhītaḥ saḥ asmān rājā varuṇaḥ mumoktu
translated: May king Varuna deliver us from that for which the seized Shunahshepa called.

original: śunaḥśepo hy ahvad gṛbhītas triṣv ādityaṃ drupadeṣu baddhaḥ /
analyzed: śunaḥśepaḥ hi ahvat gṛbhītaḥ triṣu ādityam dru padeṣu baddhaḥ
translated: For Shunahshepa was seized and bound in three Drupada snares.

original: avainaṃ rājā varuṇaḥ sasṛjyād vidvāṃ adabdho vi mumoktu pāśān //
analyzed: ava enam rājā varuṇaḥ sasṛjyāt vidvān adabdhaḥ vi mumoktu pāśān
translated: May King Varuna set him free, the wise one, the undeceiving one, may he release the bonds.

original: ava te heḷo varuṇa namobhir ava yajñebhir īmahe havirbhiḥ /
analyzed: ava te heḍaḥ varuṇa namobhiḥ ava yajñebhiḥ īmahe havirbhiḥ
translated: We implore thee, O Varuna, with salutations, with sacrifices, with oblations, to remove thy wrath.

original: kṣayann asmabhyam asura pracetā rājann enāṃsi śiśrathaḥ kṛtāni //
analyzed: kṣayan asmabhyam asura pracetāḥ rājan enāṃsi śiśrathaḥ kṛtāni
translated: O Asura, O wise one, O king, do thou forgive the offences we have committed against thee.

original: ud uttamaṃ varuṇa pāśam asmad avādhamaṃ vi madhyamaṃ śrathāya /
analyzed: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam vi madhyamam śrathāya
translated: Loosen thou the highest bond of Varuna from us, loosen the lowest, loosen the middle one.

original: athā vayam āditya vrate tavānāgaso aditaye syāma //
analyzed: atha vayam āditya vrate tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma
translated: Then may we, O Aditya, in thy vow, be sinless and free from guilt before Aditi.

original: yac cid dhi te viśo yathā pra deva varuṇa vratam /
analyzed: yat cit hi te viśaḥ yathā pra deva varuṇa vratam
translated: Whatever vow of thine, O god Varuna, we have transgressed, O god, like men in the assembly,

original: minīmasi dyavidyavi //🔽mā no vadhāya hatnave jihīḷānasya rīradhaḥ /
analyzed: minīmasi dyavi dyavi  mā naḥ vadhāya hatnave jihīḍānasya rīradhaḥ
translated: We confess it, O thou of wide dominion.🔽Do not lay to our charge, O thou who art to be invoked, the sin committed in secret,

original: mā hṛṇānasya manyave //
analyzed: mā hṛṇānasya manyave
translated: Or the sin committed in wrath.

original: vi mṛḷīkāya te mano rathīr aśvaṃ na saṃditam /
analyzed: vi mṛḷīkāya te manaḥ rathīḥ aśvam na saṃditam
translated: We loosen thy mind from the desire to injure, like a swift horse from the rein,

original: gīrbhir varuṇa sīmahi //
analyzed: gīrbhiḥ varuṇa sīmahi
translated: With our hymns, O Varuna.

original: parā hi me vimanyavaḥ patanti vasyaiṣṭaye /
analyzed: parā hi me vimanyavaḥ patanti vasyaiṣṭaye
translated: For my people who are not angry with me fly away to choose what is better,

original: vayo na vasatīr upa //
analyzed: vayaḥ na vasatīḥ upa
translated: Like birds to their nests.

original: kadā kṣatraśriyaṃ naram ā varuṇaṃ karāmahe /
analyzed: kadā kṣatra śriyam naram ā varuṇam karāmahe
translated: When shall we honour the man who is the glory of the Kshatriyas, Varuna,

original: mṛḷīkāyorucakṣasam //
analyzed: mṛḷīkāya uru cakṣasam
translated: To the one with eyes like lotus petals.

original: tad it samānam āśāte venantā na pra yucchataḥ /
analyzed: tat id samānam āśāte venantā na pra yucchataḥ
translated: They both desire this common thing, not straying, not missing.

original: dhṛtavratāya dāśuṣe //
analyzed: dhṛta vratāya dāśuṣe
translated: To the one who keeps his vows, to the worshipper.

original: vedā yo vīnām padam antarikṣeṇa patatām /
analyzed: vedā yaḥ vīnām padam antarikṣeṇa patatām
translated: He knows the place of the flying birds in the atmosphere.

original: veda nāvaḥ samudriyaḥ //
analyzed: veda nāvaḥ samudriyaḥ
translated: He knows the ocean-going ships.

original: veda māso dhṛtavrato dvādaśa prajāvataḥ /
analyzed: veda māsaḥ dhṛta vrataḥ dvādaśa prajāvataḥ
translated: He knows the twelve months, the one who keeps his vows, the one with offspring.

original: vedā ya upajāyate //
analyzed: vedā yaḥ upajāyate
translated: He knows the one who is born.

original: veda vātasya vartanim uror ṛṣvasya bṛhataḥ /
analyzed: veda vātasya vartanim uroḥ ṛṣvasya bṛhataḥ
translated: He knows the path of the wind, of the lofty and great one.

original: vedā ye adhyāsate //
analyzed: vedā ye adhyāsate
translated: He knows the ones who are above.

original: ni ṣasāda dhṛtavrato varuṇaḥ pastyāsv ā /
analyzed: ni ṣasāda dhṛta vrataḥ varuṇaḥ pastyāsu ā
translated: Varuṇa, who keeps his vows, has sat down in the houses,

original: sāmrājyāya sukratuḥ //
analyzed: sāmrājyāya sukratuḥ
translated: The wise one for universal sovereignty.

original: ato viśvāny adbhutā cikitvāṃ abhi paśyati /
analyzed: atas viśvāni adbhutā cikitvān abhi paśyati
translated: From here he, the wise one, looks upon all wonders,

original: kṛtāni yā ca kartvā //
analyzed: kṛtāni yā ca kartvā
translated: And upon the deeds that are to be done.

original: sa no viśvāhā sukratur ādityaḥ supathā karat /
analyzed: sa naḥ viśvāhā su kratuḥ ādityaḥ su pathā karat
translated: May that Āditya, who is very wise, make all our paths good for us,

original: pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat //
analyzed: pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translated: May he lead our lives across [the difficulties].

original: bibhrad drāpiṃ hiraṇyayaṃ varuṇo vasta nirṇijam /
analyzed: bibhrat drāpim hiraṇyayam varuṇaḥ vasta nirṇijam
translated: Wearing a golden garment, Varuṇa has put on his cleansing robe.

original: pari spaśo ni ṣedire //
analyzed: pari spaśaḥ ni sedire
translated: The spies have sat down around him.

original: na yaṃ dipsanti dipsavo na druhvāṇo janānām /
analyzed: na yam dipsanti dipsavaḥ na druhvāṇaḥ janānām
translated: Whom the envious ones do not injure, nor the haters of people,

original: na devam abhimātayaḥ //
analyzed: na devam abhimātayaḥ
translated: Nor the divine curses.

original: uta yo mānuṣeṣv ā yaśaś cakre asāmy ā /
analyzed: uta yaḥ mānuṣeṣu ā yaśaḥ cakre asāmi ā
translated: And he who has made fame among men unequalled,

original: asmākam udareṣv ā //
analyzed: asmākam udareṣu ā
translated: Is in our bellies.

original: parā me yanti dhītayo gāvo na gavyūtīr anu /
analyzed: parā me yanti dhītayaḥ gāvaḥ na gavyūtīḥ anu
translated: My thoughts go forth to you, as cows to their stalls,

original: icchantīr urucakṣasam //
analyzed: icchantīḥ uru cakṣasam
translated: Desiring the far-seeing one.

original: saṃ nu vocāvahai punar yato me madhv ābhṛtam /
analyzed: sam nu vocāvahai punar yatas me madhu ābhṛtam
translated: Let us speak together again, from where my sweet drink was brought.

original: hoteva kṣadase priyam //
analyzed: hotā iva kṣadase priyam
translated: Like a priest, you enjoy the dear (drink).

original: darśaṃ nu viśvadarśataṃ darśaṃ ratham adhi kṣami /
analyzed: darśam nu viśva darśatam darśam ratham adhi kṣami
translated: Show yourself, O you who are seen by all, show your chariot on the earth.

original: etā juṣata me giraḥ //
analyzed: etāḥ juṣata me giraḥ
translated: Accept these songs of mine.

original: imam me varuṇa śrudhī havam adyā ca mṛḷaya /
analyzed: imam me varuṇa śrudhi havam adyā ca mṛḍaya
translated: O Varuṇa, listen to this call of mine today and be gracious.

original: tvām avasyur ā cake //
analyzed: tvām avasyuḥ ā cake
translated: I have come to you, longing for help.

original: tvaṃ viśvasya medhira divaś ca gmaś ca rājasi /
analyzed: tvam viśvasya medhira divaḥ ca gmaḥ ca rājasi
translated: You rule over all this, O wise one, over heaven and earth.

original: sa yāmani prati śrudhi //
analyzed: sa yāmani prati śrudhi
translated: Listen to our call.

original: ud uttamam mumugdhi no vi pāśam madhyamaṃ cṛta /
analyzed: ud uttamam mumugdhi naḥ vi pāśam madhyamam cṛta
translated: Loosen for us the highest bond, and cut the middle one.

original: avādhamāni jīvase //🔽vasiṣvā hi miyedhya vastrāṇy ūrjām pate /
analyzed: ava adhamāni jīvase  vasiṣva hi miyedhya vastrāṇi ūrjām pate
translated: So that we may live without affliction.🔽O you who are to be worshipped, put on your dear garments, O lord of strength.

original: semaṃ no adhvaraṃ yaja //
analyzed: sā imam naḥ adhvaram yaja
translated: Worship this our sacrifice.

original: ni no hotā vareṇyaḥ sadā yaviṣṭha manmabhiḥ /
analyzed: ni naḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ sadā yaviṣṭha manmabhiḥ
translated: O Hotar, the most venerable, always the youngest, with our thoughts,

original: agne divitmatā vacaḥ //
analyzed: agne divitmatā vacaḥ
translated: O Agni, listen to our word that reaches the sky.

original: ā hi ṣmā sūnave pitāpir yajaty āpaye /
analyzed: ā hi sma sūnave pitā āpiḥ yajati āpaye
translated: For the son, the father, the supporter, sacrifices to the one who prospers.

original: sakhā sakhye vareṇyaḥ //
analyzed: sakhā sakhye vareṇyaḥ
translated: The friend is to be chosen by the friend.

original: ā no barhī riśādaso varuṇo mitro aryamā /
analyzed: ā naḥ barhīḥ riśādasaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: May the two who sit on the sacrificial grass, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, the two who slay the enemy,

original: sīdantu manuṣo yathā //
analyzed: sīdantu manuṣaḥ yathā
translated: Sit down as men do.

original: pūrvya hotar asya no mandasva sakhyasya ca /
analyzed: pūrvya hotar asya naḥ mandasva sakhyasya ca
translated: O ancient Hotar, rejoice in this our friendship,

original: imā u ṣu śrudhī giraḥ //
analyzed: imāḥ u su śrudhi giraḥ
translated: And listen to these songs of ours.

original: yac cid dhi śaśvatā tanā devaṃdevaṃ yajāmahe /
analyzed: yat cit hi śaśvatā tanā devaṃdevam yajāmahe
translated: Since we worship the gods one by one with our constant devotion,

original: tve id dhūyate haviḥ //
analyzed: tve id dhūyate haviḥ
translated: In you alone is the oblation offered.

original: priyo no astu viśpatir hotā mandro vareṇyaḥ /
analyzed: priyaḥ naḥ astu viśpatiḥ hotā mandraḥ vareṇyaḥ
translated: May the lord of the clan be dear to us, the delightful, desirable Hotar.

original: priyāḥ svagnayo vayam //
analyzed: priyāḥ su agnayaḥ vayam
translated: We are the dear ones to our own Agni.

original: svagnayo hi vāryaṃ devāso dadhire ca naḥ /
analyzed: su agnayaḥ hi vāryam devāsaḥ dadhire ca naḥ
translated: For the gods have made the dear ones to Agni worthy of our choice, and they to us.

original: svagnayo manāmahe //
analyzed: su agnayaḥ manāmahe
translated: We think of the dear ones to Agni.

original: athā na ubhayeṣām amṛta martyānām /
analyzed: athā naḥ ubhayeṣām amṛta martyānām
translated: Now, then, among both the immortals and mortals,

original: mithaḥ santu praśastayaḥ //
analyzed: mithas santu praśastayaḥ
translated: May there be mutual praises.

original: viśvebhir agne agnibhir imaṃ yajñam idaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: viśvebhiḥ agne agnibhiḥ imam yajñam idam vacaḥ
translated: O Agni, with all the fires, accept this sacrifice, this speech,

original: cano dhāḥ sahaso yaho //
analyzed: canaḥ dhāḥ sahasaḥ yaho
translated: O delightful one, O son of strength.

original: aśvaṃ na tvā vāravantaṃ vandadhyā agniṃ namobhiḥ /
analyzed: aśvam na tvā vāravantam vandadhyāḥ agnim namobhiḥ
translated: I would honor you, O Agni, like a horse with reins, with salutations,

original: samrājantam adhvarāṇām //
analyzed: samrājantam adhvarāṇām
translated: The sovereign of sacrifices.

original: sa ghā naḥ sūnuḥ śavasā pṛthupragāmā suśevaḥ /
analyzed: sa ghā naḥ sūnuḥ śavasā pṛthu pragāmā su śevaḥ
translated: May that son of ours, who goes far with his might, the kindly one,

translated: When thou art freed from the two parents by the dog, they have led thee round from the east to the west again.

original: tvam agne vṛṣabhaḥ puṣṭivardhana udyatasruce bhavasi śravāyyaḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne vṛṣabhaḥ puṣṭi vardhanaḥ udyata sruce bhavasi śravāyyaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the bull, the increaser of prosperity, thou art to be glorified by the uplifted ladle.

original: ya āhutim pari vedā vaṣaṭkṛtim ekāyur agre viśa āvivāsasi //
analyzed: yaḥ āhutim pari vedā vaṣaṭkṛtim eka āyuḥ agre viśaḥ āvivāsasi
translated: When thou knowest the offering and the Vasat cry, thou dwellest with the people in one life at first.

original: tvam agne vṛjinavartaniṃ naraṃ sakman piparṣi vidathe vicarṣaṇe /
analyzed: tvam agne vṛjina vartanim naram sakman piparṣi vidathe vicarṣaṇe
translated: Thou, O Agni, the man who goes in a crooked way, O thou who art strong, thou helpest in the assembly, O thou who art active.

original: yaḥ śūrasātā paritakmye dhane dabhrebhiś cit samṛtā haṃsi bhūyasaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ śūrasātā paritakmye dhane dabhrebhiḥ cit samṛtā haṃsi bhūyasaḥ
translated: He who in the battle of the heroes in the fight for wealth, with the feeble, with the many, thou smitest down.

original: tvaṃ tam agne amṛtatva uttame martaṃ dadhāsi śravase divedive /
analyzed: tvam tam agne amṛta tve uttame martam dadhāsi śravase dive dive
translated: Thou, O Agni, dost place that mortal in immortality, in the highest, for glory day by day,

original: yas tātṛṣāṇa ubhayāya janmane mayaḥ kṛṇoṣi praya ā ca sūraye //
analyzed: yaḥ tātṛṣāṇaḥ ubhayāya janmane mayaḥ kṛṇoṣi prayaḥ ā ca sūraye
translated: Who thirsts for both kinds of birth, thou makest him to be born again for the light of the sun.

original: tvaṃ no agne sanaye dhanānāṃ yaśasaṃ kāruṃ kṛṇuhi stavānaḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne sanaye dhanānām yaśasam kārum kṛṇuhi stavānaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, for us, for the winning of riches, make the glorious one, the poet, by praise.

original: ṛdhyāma karmāpasā navena devair dyāvāpṛthivī prāvataṃ naḥ //
analyzed: ṛdhyāma karma apasā navena devaiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī prāvatam naḥ
translated: May we prosper in the rite with the new (fire), O heaven and earth, favour us with the gods.

original: tvaṃ no agne pitror upastha ā devo deveṣv anavadya jāgṛviḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne pitroḥ upasthe ā devaḥ deveṣu anavadya jāgṛviḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, in the lap of our parents, a God, art watchful among the Gods, O thou that art irreproachable.

original: tanūkṛd bodhi pramatiś ca kārave tvaṃ kalyāṇa vasu viśvam opiṣe //
analyzed: tanū kṛt bodhi pramatiḥ ca kārave tvam kalyāṇa vasu viśvam opiṣe
translated: Be thou a former of bodies, and a thought-inspirer to the singer: thou, O auspicious one, hast filled all wealth.

original: tvam agne pramatis tvam pitāsi nas tvaṃ vayaskṛt tava jāmayo vayam /
analyzed: tvam agne pramatiḥ tvam pitā asi naḥ tvam vayaskṛt tava jāmayaḥ vayam
translated: Thou, O Agni, art a thought-inspirer, thou art our father: thou art a former of life, we are thy kinsmen.

original: saṃ tvā rāyaḥ śatinaḥ saṃ sahasriṇaḥ suvīraṃ yanti vratapām adābhya //
analyzed: sam tvā rāyaḥ śatinaḥ sam sahasriṇaḥ su vīram yanti vrata pām adābhya
translated: To thee, O thou who guardest the vow, who art to be approached, come riches in hundreds, in thousands, with brave men.

original: tvām agne prathamam āyum āyave devā akṛṇvan nahuṣasya viśpatim /
analyzed: tvām agne prathamam āyum āyave devāḥ akṛṇvan nahuṣasya viśpatim
translated: Thee, O Agni, the Gods have made the first life-giver to Âyu, the lord of Nahusha.

original: iḷām akṛṇvan manuṣasya śāsanīm pitur yat putro mamakasya jāyate //
analyzed: iḷām akṛṇvan manuṣasya śāsanīm pituḥ yat putraḥ mamakasya jāyate
translated: They have made thee the ruler of men, the food-giver, as a son of his father, of my father, is born.

original: tvaṃ no agne tava deva pāyubhir maghono rakṣa tanvaś ca vandya /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne tava deva pāyubhiḥ maghonaḥ rakṣa tanvaḥ ca vandya
translated: Do thou, O Agni, O God, with thy protecting powers, guard our wealthy patrons, and our bodies, O thou that art to be worshipped.

original: trātā tokasya tanaye gavām asy animeṣaṃ rakṣamāṇas tava vrate //
analyzed: trātā tokasya tanaye gavām asi animeṣam rakṣamāṇaḥ tava vrate
translated: Thou art the protector of offspring, of the young of cattle, ever watchful, guarding them in thy law.

original: tvam agne yajyave pāyur antaro 'niṣaṅgāya caturakṣa idhyase /
analyzed: tvam agne yajyave pāyuḥ antaraḥ niṣaṅgāya catur akṣaḥ idhyase
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the protector within the house to Yajya, to Anishangâ, thou art kindled to the four-eyed one.

original: yo rātahavyo 'vṛkāya dhāyase kīreś cin mantram manasā vanoṣi tam //
analyzed: yaḥ rāta havyaḥ vṛkāya dhāyase kīreḥ cit mantram manasā vanoṣi tam
translated: To him who offers gifts, who is free from guile, who supports the helpless, whom thou favourest, thou acceptest his prayer even if it be in the heart of a Kîra.

original: tvam agna uruśaṃsāya vāghate spārhaṃ yad rekṇaḥ paramaṃ vanoṣi tat /
analyzed: tvam agne uru śaṃsāya vāghate spārham yat rekṇaḥ paramam vanoṣi tat
translated: That which is most excellent, O Agni, which thou bestowest, the wealth which is to be desired,

original: ādhrasya cit pramatir ucyase pitā pra pākaṃ śāssi pra diśo viduṣṭaraḥ //
analyzed: ādhrasya cit pramatiḥ ucyase pitā pra pākam śāssi pra diśaḥ viduṣṭaraḥ
translated: Thou art called the counsellor of the poor, the father, thou leadest the way, thou art more skilled in the directions.

original: tvam agne prayatadakṣiṇaṃ naraṃ varmeva syūtam pari pāsi viśvataḥ /
analyzed: tvam agne prayata dakṣiṇam naram varma iva syūtam pari pāsi viśvatas
translated: O Agni, thou guardest on every side the man who offers with prepared gifts,

original: svādukṣadmā yo vasatau syonakṛj jīvayājaṃ yajate sopamā divaḥ //
analyzed: svādu kṣadmā yaḥ vasatau syona kṛt jīva yājam yajate saḥ upamā divaḥ
translated: As one who sits in pleasant places, who is kind in his dwelling, who worships the living, who is like heaven in his offerings.

original: imām agne śaraṇim mīmṛṣo na imam adhvānaṃ yam agāma dūrāt /
analyzed: imām agne śaraṇim mīmṛṣaḥ naḥ imam adhvānam yam agāma dūrāt
translated: O Agni, remember this our refuge, this path which we have gone from afar.

original: āpiḥ pitā pramatiḥ somyānām bhṛmir asy ṛṣikṛn martyānām //
analyzed: āpiḥ pitā pramatiḥ somyānām bhṛmiḥ asi ṛṣi kṛt martyānām
translated: The father is the supporter, the counsellor of the Soma-drinkers, the food of the mortals who make the Ṛṣis.

original: manuṣvad agne aṅgirasvad aṅgiro yayātivat sadane pūrvavac chuce /
analyzed: manuṣvat agne aṅgirasvat aṅgiraḥ yayāti vat sadane pūrvavat śuce
translated: O Agni, like Manu, like Aṅgiras, like Aṅgiras, like Yayāti, in the pure abode as before,

original: accha yāhy ā vahā daivyaṃ janam ā sādaya barhiṣi yakṣi ca priyam //
analyzed: accha yāhi ā vaha daivyam janam ā sādaya barhiṣi yakṣi ca priyam
translated: Come hither, bring the divine people, seat them on the sacrificial grass, and worship what is dear.

original: etenāgne brahmaṇā vāvṛdhasva śaktī vā yat te cakṛmā vidā vā /
analyzed: etena agne brahmaṇā vāvṛdhasva śaktī vā yat te cakṛma vidā vā
translated: O Agni, be strengthened by this prayer, by what power or knowledge we have performed for thee.

original: uta pra ṇeṣy abhi vasyo asmān saṃ naḥ sṛja sumatyā vājavatyā //
analyzed: uta pra neṣi abhi vasyaḥ asmān sam naḥ sṛja sumatyā vājavatyā
translated: And lead us forward to what is better, unite us with good fortune and strength.

original: indrasya nu vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī /
analyzed: indrasya nu vīryāṇi pra vocam yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī
translated: I will proclaim the manly deeds of Indra, the first which the wielder of the thunderbolt performed,

original: ahann ahim anv apas tatarda pra vakṣaṇā abhinat parvatānām //
analyzed: ahan ahim anu apaḥ tatarda pra vakṣaṇāḥ abhinat parvatānām
translated: When he slew the dragon and cleft the streams, and with his spear-point pierced the sides of the mountains.

original: ahann ahim parvate śiśriyāṇaṃ tvaṣṭāsmai vajraṃ svaryaṃ tatakṣa /
analyzed: ahan ahim parvate śiśriyāṇam tvaṣṭā asmai vajram svaryam tatakṣa
translated: He slew the dragon lying on the mountain; Tvashtar fashioned for him a light-winning thunderbolt.

original: vāśrā iva dhenavaḥ syandamānā añjaḥ samudram ava jagmur āpaḥ //
analyzed: vāśrāḥ iva dhenavaḥ syandamānāḥ añjas samudram ava jagmuḥ āpaḥ
translated: The waters flowed like milch-kine with milk, and went straight to the ocean.

original: vṛṣāyamāṇo 'vṛṇīta somaṃ trikadrukeṣv apibat sutasya /
analyzed: vṛṣāyamāṇaḥ vṛṇīta somam trikadrukeṣu apibat sutasya
translated: Desiring the bull, he chose the Soma; on the Trikakud mountains he drank the pressed (juice).

original: ā sāyakam maghavādatta vajram ahann enam prathamajām ahīnām //
analyzed: ā sāyakam maghavā adatta vajram ahan enam prathama jām ahīnām
translated: Maghavan took up his dart, the thunderbolt; he slew the first-born of the dragons.

original: yad indrāhan prathamajām ahīnām ān māyinām amināḥ prota māyāḥ /
analyzed: yat indra ahan prathama jām ahīnām āt māyinām amināḥ pra uta māyāḥ
translated: When, O Indra, thou slewest the first-born of the dragons, thou didst overcome the wiles of the enchanters.

original: āt sūryaṃ janayan dyām uṣāsaṃ tādītnā śatruṃ na kilā vivitse //
analyzed: āt sūryam janayan dyām uṣāsam tādītnā śatrum na kila vivitse
translated: When thou madest the sun, the sky, the dawn, thou didst not find an equal, much less a foe.

original: ahan vṛtraṃ vṛtrataraṃ vyaṃsam indro vajreṇa mahatā vadhena /
analyzed: ahan vṛtram vṛtrataram vyaṃsam indraḥ vajreṇa mahatā vadhena
translated: With his great thunderbolt, with his mighty weapon, Indra slew the dragon, the most wicked.

original: skandhāṃsīva kuliśenā vivṛkṇāhiḥ śayata upapṛk pṛthivyāḥ //
analyzed: skandhāṃsi iva kuliśena vivṛkṇā ahiḥ śayate upapṛc pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Like the trunks of trees cut off with an axe, the dragon lay, cut off from the earth.

original: ayoddheva durmada ā hi juhve mahāvīraṃ tuvibādham ṛjīṣam /
analyzed: a yoddhā iva durmadaḥ ā hi juhve mahā vīram tuvi bādham ṛjīṣam
translated: As one who fights not, I invoke the mighty hero, the strong, the impetuous, the great warrior.

original: nātārīd asya samṛtiṃ vadhānāṃ saṃ rujānāḥ pipiṣa indraśatruḥ //
analyzed: na atārīt asya samṛtim vadhānām sam rujā anāḥ pipiṣe indra śatruḥ
translated: He did not escape his grasp, the slayer of foes, the one who was wounded, the enemy of Indra, was crushed.

original: apād ahasto apṛtanyad indram āsya vajram adhi sānau jaghāna /
analyzed: a pād a hastaḥ apṛtanyat indram ā asya vajram adhi sānau jaghāna
translated: The one without feet or hands challenged Indra, and he struck him on the knee with his thunderbolt.

original: vṛṣṇo vadhriḥ pratimānam bubhūṣan purutrā vṛtro aśayad vyastaḥ //🔽nadaṃ na bhinnam amuyā śayānam mano ruhāṇā ati yanty āpaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣṇaḥ vadhriḥ pratimānam bubhūṣan purutrā vṛtraḥ aśayat vyastaḥ  nadam na bhinnam amuyā śayānam manaḥ ruhāṇāḥ ati yanti āpaḥ
translated: The weak one, the son of Vṛtra, wishing to be a match, was scattered in many places.🔽The waters flow over the broken river lying with its waves,

original: yāś cid vṛtro mahinā paryatiṣṭhat tāsām ahiḥ patsutaḥśīr babhūva //🔽nīcāvayā abhavad vṛtraputrendro asyā ava vadhar jabhāra /
analyzed: yāḥ cit vṛtraḥ mahinā paryatiṣṭhat tāsām ahiḥ patsutaḥśīḥ babhūva  nīcā vayāḥ abhavat vṛtra putrā indraḥ asyai ava vadhar jabhāra
translated: Whatever waters Vṛtra held back in his might, the serpent became their head and mouth.🔽The son of Vṛtra became lower, Indra took away his killing blow.

original: uttarā sūr adharaḥ putra āsīd dānuḥ śaye sahavatsā na dhenuḥ //
analyzed: uttarā sūḥ adharaḥ putraḥ āsīt dānuḥ śaye saha vatsā na dhenuḥ
translated: The son became lower, the mother lay with her calf like a cow.

original: atiṣṭhantīnām aniveśanānāṃ kāṣṭhānām madhye nihitaṃ śarīram /
analyzed: a tiṣṭhantīnām a niveśanānām kāṣṭhānām madhye nihitam śarīram
translated: In the middle of the standing, unmoving, wooden bodies, the body was placed.

original: vṛtrasya niṇyaṃ vi caranty āpo dīrghaṃ tama āśayad indraśatruḥ //
analyzed: vṛtrasya niṇyam vi caranti āpaḥ dīrgham tamaḥ ā aśayat indra śatruḥ
translated: The waters flow through the abode of Vṛtra, the enemy of Indra, he lay in long darkness.

original: dāsapatnīr ahigopā atiṣṭhan niruddhā āpaḥ paṇineva gāvaḥ /
analyzed: dāsa patnīḥ ahi gopāḥ atiṣṭhat niruddhāḥ āpaḥ paṇinā iva gāvaḥ
translated: The wives of the Dāsa, guarded by the serpent, stood, the waters were restrained like cows by a herder.

original: apām bilam apihitaṃ yad āsīd vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ apa tad vavāra //
analyzed: apām bilam apihitam yat āsīt vṛtram jaghanvām apa tat vavāra
translated: The closed abode of the waters, when he had slain Vṛtra, Indra opened it.

original: aśvyo vāro abhavas tad indra sṛke yat tvā pratyahan deva ekaḥ /
analyzed: aśvyaḥ vāraḥ abhavaḥ tat indra sṛke yat tvā pratyahan devaḥ ekaḥ
translated: Thou art the horse's excellent place, O Indra, when thou, God, alone didst slay the demon.

original: ajayo gā ajayaḥ śūra somam avāsṛjaḥ sartave sapta sindhūn //
analyzed: ajayaḥ gāḥ ajayaḥ śūra somam avāsṛjaḥ sartave sapta sindhūn
translated: Thou hast won kine, O Hero, thou hast won Soma: thou hast let loose the seven rivers to their journey.

original: nāsmai vidyun na tanyatuḥ siṣedha na yām miham akirad dhrāduniṃ ca /
analyzed: na asmai vidyut na tanyatuḥ siṣedha na yām miham akirat hrādunim ca
translated: Neither the lightning nor the thunder could resist him, nor the rain which he poured down with the hail-storm.

original: indraś ca yad yuyudhāte ahiś cotāparībhyo maghavā vi jigye //
analyzed: indraḥ ca yat yuyudhāte ahiḥ ca uta aparībhyaḥ maghavā vi jigye
translated: When Indra and the Dragon fought together, Maghavan won the victory over the heated ones.

original: aher yātāraṃ kam apaśya indra hṛdi yat te jaghnuṣo bhīr agacchat /
analyzed: aheḥ yātāram kam apaśyaḥ indra hṛdi yat te jaghnuṣaḥ bhīḥ agacchat
translated: What sawest thou, O Indra, as the Dragon's slayer, when fear came upon thee in thy heart for slaying?

original: nava ca yan navatiṃ ca sravantīḥ śyeno na bhīto ataro rajāṃsi //
analyzed: nava ca yat navatim ca sravantīḥ śyenaḥ na bhītaḥ ataraḥ rajāṃsi
translated: And when thou, like a hawk in terror, didst fly over the nine-and-ninety flowing rivers.

original: indro yāto 'vasitasya rājā śamasya ca śṛṅgiṇo vajrabāhuḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ yātaḥ vasitasya rājā śamasya ca śṛṅgiṇaḥ vajra bāhuḥ
translated: Indra hath gone, the King of what is settled, of what hath horns, of what hath thunder in his arms.

original: sed u rājā kṣayati carṣaṇīnām arān na nemiḥ pari tā babhūva //
analyzed: sa id u rājā kṣayati carṣaṇīnām arāt na nemiḥ pari tāḥ babhūva
translated: He, verily, is the King of men: he hath encompassed the peoples as the nave of the wheel.

original: etāyāmopa gavyanta indram asmākaṃ su pramatiṃ vāvṛdhāti /🔽anāmṛṇaḥ kuvid ād asya rāyo gavāṃ ketam param āvarjate naḥ //
analyzed: eta āyāma upa gavyantaḥ indram asmākam su pramatim vāvṛdhāti  anāmṛṇaḥ kuvid āt asya rāyaḥ gavām ketam param āvarjate naḥ
translated: To Indra, fain for kine, we come: his favour prospers us exceedingly.🔽Who will be the debtor of his wealth? He leadeth us to the highest prize of kine.

original: uped ahaṃ dhanadām apratītaṃ juṣṭāṃ na śyeno vasatim patāmi /
analyzed: upa id aham dhana dām apratītam juṣṭām na śyenaḥ vasatim patāmi
translated: I come to the much-invoked, the ever-present one: I fly to the loved home of the hawk.

original: indraṃ namasyann upamebhir arkair ya stotṛbhyo havyo asti yāman //
analyzed: indram namasyan upamebhiḥ arkaiḥ ya stotṛbhyaḥ havyaḥ asti yāman
translated: Worshipping Indra with these hymns of praise, he who is to be invoked by the singers on the way.

original: ni sarvasena iṣudhīṃr asakta sam aryo gā ajati yasya vaṣṭi /
analyzed: ni sarva senaḥ iṣudhīṃr asakta sam aryaḥ gāḥ ajati yasya vaṣṭi
translated: All the arrows of the all-conquering one are fixed, he hurls his sharp arrows at the enemy.

original: coṣkūyamāṇa indra bhūri vāmam mā paṇir bhūr asmad adhi pravṛddha //
analyzed: coṣkūyamāṇaḥ indra bhūri vāmam mā paṇiḥ bhūḥ asmat adhi pravṛddha
translated: O Indra, may you not be a stumbling block to us, as we strive for abundant good.

original: vadhīr hi dasyuṃ dhaninaṃ ghanenaṃ ekaś carann upaśākebhir indra /🔽dhanor adhi viṣuṇak te vy āyann ayajvānaḥ sanakāḥ pretim īyuḥ //
analyzed: vadhīḥ hi dasyum dhaninam ghanenaṃ ekaḥ caran upaśākebhiḥ indra  dhanoḥ adhi viṣuṇak te vi āyan ayajvānaḥ sanakāḥ pretim īyuḥ
translated: For you have slain the wealthy Dasyu with the strong one, O Indra, moving alone with your helpers.🔽From the yoke of the strong one, your arrows have been shot forth; the non-sacrificing ancient ones have gone to destruction.

original: parā cic chīrṣā vavṛjus ta indrāyajvāno yajvabhi spardhamānāḥ /
analyzed: parā cit śīrṣā vavṛjuḥ te indra ayajvānaḥ yajvabhi spardhamānāḥ
translated: Even their heads have been turned away, those who have not sacrificed to Indra, competing with the sacrificers.

original: pra yad divo hariva sthātar ugra nir avratāṃ adhamo rodasyoḥ //
analyzed: pra yat divaḥ harivas sthātar ugra niḥ avratān adhamaḥ rodasyoḥ
translated: O you who stand in the sky, O you of the tawny steeds, O you of fierce power, you have brought down the one without vows, the one between the two worlds.

original: ayuyutsann anavadyasya senām ayātayanta kṣitayo navagvāḥ /
analyzed: ayuyutsan anavadyasya senām ayātayanta kṣitayaḥ navagvāḥ
translated: The armies of the one without blemish have been defeated, the Navagvas have been scattered.

original: vṛṣāyudho na vadhrayo niraṣṭāḥ pravadbhir indrāc citayanta āyan //
analyzed: vṛṣāyudhaḥ na vadhrayaḥ niraṣṭāḥ pravadbhiḥ indrāt citayantaḥ āyan
translated: The ones with the bull as their weapon, the ones without a lost cow, the ones with the sharp-pointed spears, have been sent away by Indra, as they were praising him.

original: tvam etān rudato jakṣataś cāyodhayo rajasa indra pāre /
analyzed: tvam etān rudataḥ jakṣataḥ ca ayodhayaḥ rajasaḥ indra pāre
translated: You have fought with these weeping and devouring ones, O Indra, on the other side of the sky.

original: avādaho diva ā dasyum uccā pra sunvata stuvataḥ śaṃsam āvaḥ //
analyzed: avādahaḥ divaḥ ā dasyum uccā pra sunvata stuvataḥ śaṃsam āvaḥ
translated: You have struck down the Dasyu from the sky, O you who are free from sin; you have brought down the praise of the pressing and the singing.

original: cakrāṇāsaḥ parīṇaham pṛthivyā hiraṇyena maṇinā śumbhamānāḥ /
analyzed: cakrāṇāsaḥ parīṇaham pṛthivyāḥ hiraṇyena maṇinā śumbhamānāḥ
translated: The whirling ones have made the earth's enclosure beautiful with gold and gem.

original: na hinvānāsas titirus ta indram pari spaśo adadhāt sūryeṇa //
analyzed: na hinvānāsaḥ titiruḥ te indram pari spaśaḥ adadhāt sūryeṇa
translated: The swift ones have not tarried: they have set their spies around Indra with the sun.

original: pari yad indra rodasī ubhe abubhojīr mahinā viśvataḥ sīm /
analyzed: pari yat indra rodasī ubhe abubhojīḥ mahinā viśvatas sīm
translated: When thou, O Indra, hast filled both worlds full with might, on every side,

original: amanyamānāṃ abhi manyamānair nir brahmabhir adhamo dasyum indra //
analyzed: a manyamānām abhi manyamānaiḥ niḥ brahmabhiḥ adhamaḥ dasyum indra
translated: Thou hast with the Brahmans brought the Dasyu low, who thought not, who thought much.

original: na ye divaḥ pṛthivyā antam āpur na māyābhir dhanadām paryabhūvan /
analyzed: na ye divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ antam āpuḥ na māyābhiḥ dhana dām paryabhūvan
translated: They who have not reached the end of heaven and earth, have not overcome the giver of wealth with their illusions.

original: yujaṃ vajraṃ vṛṣabhaś cakra indro nir jyotiṣā tamaso gā adukṣat //
analyzed: yujam vajram vṛṣabhaḥ cakre indraḥ niḥ jyotiṣā tamasaḥ gāḥ adukṣat
translated: The strong Indra has hurled his weapon, the bolt, and has milked the cows from the darkness with the light.

original: anu svadhām akṣarann āpo asyāvardhata madhya ā nāvyānām /
analyzed: anu svadhām akṣaran āpaḥ asya avardhata madhye ā nāvyānām
translated: The waters have flowed after his will; he has grown in the midst of the Navagvas.

original: sadhrīcīnena manasā tam indra ojiṣṭhena hanmanāhann abhi dyūn //
analyzed: sadhrīcīnena manasā tam indraḥ ojiṣṭhena hanmanā ahan abhi dyūn
translated: With a mind that is in harmony, with thy most mighty blow, O Indra, thou hast smitten the Dasyus.

original: ny āvidhyad ilībiśasya dṛḷhā vi śṛṅgiṇam abhinac chuṣṇam indraḥ /🔽yāvat taro maghavan yāvad ojo vajreṇa śatrum avadhīḥ pṛtanyum //
analyzed: ni āvidhyat ilībiśasya dṛḷhā vi śṛṅgiṇam abhinat śuṣṇam indraḥ  yāvat taraḥ maghavan yāvat ojaḥ vajreṇa śatrum avadhīḥ pṛtanyum
translated: He has shattered the firm-set bolt of Iḷâviṣa; Indra has cleft the horned one, the wicked one.🔽As far as thy power, O bountiful one, as far as thy strength, with thy bolt thou hast slain the foeman, the wanderer.

original: abhi sidhmo ajigād asya śatrūn vi tigmena vṛṣabheṇā puro 'bhet /
analyzed: abhi sidhmaḥ ajigāt asya śatrūn vi tigmena vṛṣabheṇa puraḥ bhet
translated: The lightning-swift one has overcome his foes; with his sharp bull he has cleft the forts.

original: saṃ vajreṇāsṛjad vṛtram indraḥ pra svām matim atirac chāśadānaḥ //
analyzed: sam vajreṇa asṛjat vṛtram indraḥ pra svām matim atirat śāśadānaḥ
translated: With his thunderbolt Indra smote Vritra, and surpassed his own thought, being bountiful.

original: āvaḥ kutsam indra yasmiñ cākan prāvo yudhyantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ daśadyum /🔽śaphacyuto reṇur nakṣata dyām uc chvaitreyo nṛṣāhyāya tasthau //
analyzed: āvaḥ kutsam indra yasmin cākan prāvaḥ yudhyantam vṛṣabham daśadyum  śapha cyutaḥ reṇuḥ nakṣata dyām ud śvaitreyaḥ nṛṣāhyāya tasthau
translated: Thou helpest Kutsa, O Indra, in whom thou joyest, thou helpest the fighting bull, O Dasadyu.🔽The dust shaken by the hooves hath sprinkled the sky. Śvitrā's son hath stood for the victory of men.

original: āvaḥ śamaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tugryāsu kṣetrajeṣe maghavañ chvitryaṃ gām /
analyzed: āvaḥ śamam vṛṣabham tugryāsu kṣetra jeṣe maghavan śvitryam gām
translated: Thou helpest Śama, the bull, in the Tugrya lands, for the conquest of fields, O bountiful one, the white cow.

original: jyok cid atra tasthivāṃso akrañ chatrūyatām adharā vedanākaḥ //
analyzed: jyok cit atra tasthivāṃsaḥ akram śatrūyatām adharā vedanā akaḥ
translated: Even longer than this have ye stood, ye have made the sorrows of the enemies go lower.

original: triś cin no adyā bhavataṃ navedasā vibhur vāṃ yāma uta rātir aśvinā /
analyzed: tris cit naḥ adya bhavatam navedasā vibhuḥ vām yāmaḥ uta rātiḥ aśvinā
