translated: Be ye thrice to-day, O ye finders of the new, O ye Aśvins, your all-pervading favour and gift.

original: yuvor hi yantraṃ himyeva vāsaso 'bhyāyaṃsenyā bhavatam manīṣibhiḥ //
analyzed: yuvoḥ hi yantram himyā iva vāsasaḥ bhyāyaṃsenyā bhavatam manīṣibhiḥ
translated: For your contrivance is like a garment in winter, ye are to be approached by the wise.

original: trayaḥ pavayo madhuvāhane rathe somasya venām anu viśva id viduḥ /🔽traya skambhāsa skabhitāsa ārabhe trir naktaṃ yāthas trir v aśvinā divā //
analyzed: trayaḥ pavayaḥ madhu vāhane rathe somasya venām anu viśve id viduḥ  traya skambhāsa skabhitāsaḥ ārabhe tris naktam yāthaḥ tris u aśvinā divā
translated: Three are the purifiers on the chariot bearing the sweet drink. All know Soma's desire.🔽Three are the pillars, the set-up ones, the grasped ones. Three times by night ye go, O Aśvins, and three times by day.

original: samāne ahan trir avadyagohanā trir adya yajñam madhunā mimikṣatam /
analyzed: samāne ahan tris avadya gohanā tris adya yajñam madhunā mimikṣatam
translated: In the same day, three times, ye who hide the sin, three times to-day anoint the sacrifice with mead.

original: trir vājavatīr iṣo aśvinā yuvaṃ doṣā asmabhyam uṣasaś ca pinvatam //
analyzed: tris vājavatīḥ iṣaḥ aśvinā yuvam doṣā asmabhyam uṣasaḥ ca pinvatam
translated: Three times, O Asvins, with food that is full of strength, do ye two swell for us the mornings and the evenings.

original: trir vartir yātaṃ trir anuvrate jane triḥ suprāvye tredheva śikṣatam /
analyzed: tris vartiḥ yātam tris anuvrate jane tris suprāvye tredhā iva śikṣatam
translated: Go three times round, three times follow the pious man, three times the well-praised one, and learn as it were three times.

original: trir nāndyaṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvaṃ triḥ pṛkṣo asme akṣareva pinvatam //
analyzed: tris nāndyam vahatam aśvinā yuvam tris pṛkṣaḥ asme akṣarā iva pinvatam
translated: Three times do ye two, O Asvins, bring the gladdening drink, three times swell for us the portions as it were by a spell.

original: trir no rayiṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvaṃ trir devatātā trir utāvataṃ dhiyaḥ /
analyzed: tris naḥ rayim vahatam aśvinā yuvam tris devatātā tris uta avatam dhiyaḥ
translated: Three times do ye two, O Asvins, bring us wealth, three times do ye two help the deities, and three times the thoughts.

original: triḥ saubhagatvaṃ trir uta śravāṃsi nas triṣṭhaṃ vāṃ sūre duhitā ruhad ratham //
analyzed: tris saubhaga tvam tris uta śravāṃsi naḥ triṣṭham vām sūraḥ duhitā ruhat ratham
translated: Three times the state of bliss, and three times the glories for us, the daughter of the sun mounts your car three times.

original: trir no aśvinā divyāni bheṣajā triḥ pārthivāni trir u dattam adbhyaḥ /
analyzed: tris naḥ aśvinā divyāni bheṣajā tris pārthivāni tris u dattam adbhyaḥ
translated: Three times, O Asvins, the heavenly remedies, three times the earthly ones, and three times have ye given from the waters.

original: omānaṃ śaṃyor mamakāya sūnave tridhātu śarma vahataṃ śubhas patī //
analyzed: omānam śaṃyoḥ mamakāya sūnave tri dhātu śarma vahatam śubhaḥ patī
translated: The protection of the kindly one, of my son, O lords of splendour, bring the threefold one.

original: trir no aśvinā yajatā divedive pari tridhātu pṛthivīm aśāyatam /
analyzed: tris naḥ aśvinā yajatā dive dive pari tri dhātu pṛthivīm aśāyatam
translated: Three times, O Asvins, do ye two who are to be worshipped, day by day, have lain down on the earth, having the threefold one.

original: tisro nāsatyā rathyā parāvata ātmeva vātaḥ svasarāṇi gacchatam //
analyzed: tisraḥ nāsatyā rathyā parāvataḥ ātmā iva vātaḥ svasarāṇi gacchatam
translated: Three times, O Nâsatyas, with the three chariots, go to the distant regions, as the wind to its own stations.

original: trir aśvinā sindhubhiḥ saptamātṛbhis traya āhāvās tredhā haviṣ kṛtam /
analyzed: tris aśvinā sindhubhiḥ sapta mātṛbhiḥ trayaḥ āhāvāḥ tredhā haviḥ kṛtam
translated: Three times, O Asvins, with the rivers, the seven mothers, the three calls, the threefold offering have been made.

original: tisraḥ pṛthivīr upari pravā divo nākaṃ rakṣethe dyubhir aktubhir hitam //
analyzed: tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ upari pravā divaḥ nākam rakṣethe dyubhiḥ aktubhiḥ hitam
translated: You two guard the three worlds above the earth, the vault of heaven with your luminous rays.

original: kva trī cakrā trivṛto rathasya kva trayo vandhuro ye sanīḷāḥ /
analyzed: kva trī cakrā trivṛtaḥ rathasya kva trayaḥ vandhuraḥ ye sanīḍāḥ
translated: Where are the three wheels of the three-spoked chariot, where are the three seats with the three cushions?

original: kadā yogo vājino rāsabhasya yena yajñaṃ nāsatyopayāthaḥ //
analyzed: kadā yogaḥ vājinaḥ rāsabhasya yena yajñam nāsatyā upayāthaḥ
translated: When is the yoke of the strong ass, by which you, Nāsatyas, come to the sacrifice?

original: ā nāsatyā gacchataṃ hūyate havir madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhir āsabhiḥ /
analyzed: ā nāsatyā gacchatam hūyate haviḥ madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhiḥ āsabhiḥ
translated: Come, Nāsatyas, the oblation is being offered; drink the sweet drink with your honey-sweet vehicles.

original: yuvor hi pūrvaṃ savitoṣaso ratham ṛtāya citraṃ ghṛtavantam iṣyati //
analyzed: yuvoḥ hi pūrvam savitā uṣasaḥ ratham ṛtāya citram ghṛtavantam iṣyati
translated: For Savitar and Uṣas first send forth your wondrous chariot, filled with ghee, to the sacrifice.

original: ā nāsatyā tribhir ekādaśair iha devebhir yātam madhupeyam aśvinā /
analyzed: ā nāsatyā tribhiḥ ekādaśaiḥ iha devebhiḥ yātam madhu peyam aśvinā
translated: Come, Nāsatyas, with the three and the eleven, come, O Aśvins, with the gods to the sweet drink.

original: prāyus tāriṣṭaṃ nī rapāṃsi mṛkṣataṃ sedhataṃ dveṣo bhavataṃ sacābhuvā //
analyzed: pra āyuḥ tāriṣṭam niḥ rapāṃsi mṛkṣatam sedhatam dveṣaḥ bhavatam sacābhuvā
translated: Remove the evil spirits, destroy the diseases, drive away the haters, be our companions.

original: ā no aśvinā trivṛtā rathenārvāñcaṃ rayiṃ vahataṃ suvīram /
analyzed: ā naḥ aśvinā trivṛtā rathena arvāñcam rayim vahatam su vīram
translated: Bring us, O Aśvins, with the three-spoked chariot, wealth that turns this way, rich in heroes.

original: śṛṇvantā vām avase johavīmi vṛdhe ca no bhavataṃ vājasātau //
analyzed: śṛṇvantā vām avase johavīmi vṛdhe ca naḥ bhavatam vājasātau
translated: Hearing your call, I invoke you for help; be you two for our increase in the winning of booty.

original: hvayāmy agnim prathamaṃ svastaye hvayāmi mitrāvaruṇāv ihāvase /
analyzed: hvayāmi agnim prathamam svastaye hvayāmi mitrāvaruṇau iha avase
translated: I invoke Agni first for welfare; I invoke Mitra-Varuṇa here for help.

original: hvayāmi rātrīṃ jagato niveśanīṃ hvayāmi devaṃ savitāram ūtaye //
analyzed: hvayāmi rātrīm jagataḥ niveśanīm hvayāmi devam savitāram ūtaye
translated: I invoke Night, the one who sets the world to rest, I invoke the god Savitar to help.

original: ā kṛṣṇena rajasā vartamāno niveśayann amṛtam martyaṃ ca /
analyzed: ā kṛṣṇena rajasā vartamānaḥ niveśayan amṛtam martyam ca
translated: Moving with the dark dust, setting down the immortal and the mortal,

original: hiraṇyayena savitā rathenā devo yāti bhuvanāni paśyan //
analyzed: hiraṇyayena savitā rathena ā devaḥ yāti bhuvanāni paśyan
translated: Savitar, the god, goes on his golden chariot, beholding the worlds.

original: yāti devaḥ pravatā yāty udvatā yāti śubhrābhyāṃ yajato haribhyām /
analyzed: yāti devaḥ pravatā yāti udvatā yāti śubhrābhyām yajataḥ haribhyām
translated: The god goes on the paths, he goes on the high paths, he goes on the two bright ones of the worshipper.

original: ā devo yāti savitā parāvato 'pa viśvā duritā bādhamānaḥ //
analyzed: ā devaḥ yāti savitā parāvataḥ pa viśvā duritā bādhamānaḥ
translated: The god Savitar comes from afar, driving away all evils.

original: abhīvṛtaṃ kṛśanair viśvarūpaṃ hiraṇyaśamyaṃ yajato bṛhantam /🔽āsthād rathaṃ savitā citrabhānuḥ kṛṣṇā rajāṃsi taviṣīṃ dadhānaḥ //
analyzed: abhīvṛtam kṛśanaiḥ viśva rūpam hiraṇya śamyam yajataḥ bṛhantam  āsthāt ratham savitā citra bhānuḥ kṛṣṇā rajāṃsi taviṣīm dadhānaḥ
translated: The all-formed one, covered with dark ones, the golden-seated one of the worshipper, the great one,🔽Savitar, the god of wondrous light, has mounted the chariot, bearing power, with the dark dusts.

original: vi janāñ chyāvāḥ śitipādo akhyan rathaṃ hiraṇyapraugaṃ vahantaḥ /
analyzed: vi janām śyāvāḥ śiti pādaḥ akhyan ratham hiraṇyapraugam vahantaḥ
translated: The dark ones with white feet have proclaimed the people, carrying the chariot with the golden front.

original: śaśvad viśaḥ savitur daivyasyopasthe viśvā bhuvanāni tasthuḥ //
analyzed: śaśvat viśaḥ savituḥ daivyasya upasthe viśvā bhuvanāni tasthuḥ
translated: All the worlds stand in the lap of the divine Savitar, the people of the ever-present one.

original: tisro dyāvaḥ savitur dvā upasthāṃ ekā yamasya bhuvane virāṣāṭ /
analyzed: tisraḥ dyāvaḥ savituḥ dvau upasthe ekā yamasya bhuvane virāṣāh
translated: Savitar's three heavens have two seats, one in Yama's world is wide.

original: āṇiṃ na rathyam amṛtādhi tasthur iha bravītu ya u tac ciketat //
analyzed: āṇim na rathyam amṛtā adhi tasthuḥ iha bravītu yaḥ u tat ciketat
translated: They stand on the immortal path like a chariot. Let him who knows that say it here.

original: vi suparṇo antarikṣāṇy akhyad gabhīravepā asuraḥ sunīthaḥ /
analyzed: vi suparṇaḥ antarikṣāṇi akhyat gabhīra vepāḥ asuraḥ su nīthaḥ
translated: The eagle hath spread out the regions of the sky, the deep-piercing Asura, the good protector.

original: kvedānīṃ sūryaḥ kaś ciketa katamāṃ dyāṃ raśmir asyā tatāna //
analyzed: kva idānīm sūryaḥ kaḥ ciketa katamām dyām raśmiḥ asya ā tatāna
translated: Where now is Sûrya? Who hath seen him? What region hath his ray extended over?

original: aṣṭau vy akhyat kakubhaḥ pṛthivyās trī dhanva yojanā sapta sindhūn /
analyzed: aṣṭau vi akhyat kakubhaḥ pṛthivyāḥ trī dhanva yojanā sapta sindhūn
translated: He hath spread out the eight regions of the earth, the three wide-stretching paths, and the seven rivers.

original: hiraṇyākṣaḥ savitā deva āgād dadhad ratnā dāśuṣe vāryāṇi //
analyzed: hiraṇya akṣaḥ savitā devaḥ āgāt dadhat ratnā dāśuṣe vāryāṇi
translated: Savitar, the golden-eyed God, hath come hither, bringing precious treasures to the worshipper.

original: hiraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā vicarṣaṇir ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī antar īyate /
analyzed: hiraṇya pāṇiḥ savitā vicarṣaṇiḥ ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī antar īyate
translated: Savitar, golden-handed, swift to listen, goeth between the two world-halves of heaven.

original: apāmīvām bādhate veti sūryam abhi kṛṣṇena rajasā dyām ṛṇoti //
analyzed: apa amīvām bādhate veti sūryam abhi kṛṣṇena rajasā dyām ṛṇoti
translated: He driveth away evil speech, and goeth to the sun: with his dark-hued robe he overspreads the sky.

original: hiraṇyahasto asuraḥ sunīthaḥ sumṛḷīkaḥ svavāṃ yātv arvāṅ /
analyzed: hiraṇya hastaḥ asuraḥ su nīthaḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ su avām yātu arvāṅ
translated: The golden-handed Asura, the good protector, the kindly, with his own strength, hath come hither.

original: apasedhan rakṣaso yātudhānān asthād devaḥ pratidoṣaṃ gṛṇānaḥ //
analyzed: apasedhan rakṣasaḥ yātudhānān asthāt devaḥ pratidoṣam gṛṇānaḥ
translated: Driving away the Raksases and Yâtudhânas, the God hath taken up his station, praised at eve.

original: ye te panthāḥ savitaḥ pūrvyāso 'reṇavaḥ sukṛtā antarikṣe /
analyzed: ye te panthāḥ savitar pūrvyāsaḥ reṇavaḥ su kṛtāḥ antarikṣe
translated: Those ancient paths of thine, O Savitar, which are dustless, well-made in the atmosphere,

original: tebhir no adya pathibhiḥ sugebhī rakṣā ca no adhi ca brūhi deva //
analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ adya pathibhiḥ su gebhiḥ rakṣā ca naḥ adhi ca brūhi deva
translated: By those good paths of thine this day, O God, protect us, and speak to us for our welfare.

original: pra vo yahvam purūṇāṃ viśāṃ devayatīnām /
analyzed: pra vaḥ yahvam purūṇām viśām devayatīnām
translated: Your youthful, your most ancient path, O ye who are to be invoked by many clans,

original: agniṃ sūktebhir vacobhir īmahe yaṃ sīm id anya īḷate //🔽janāso agniṃ dadhire sahovṛdhaṃ haviṣmanto vidhema te /
analyzed: agnim sūktebhiḥ vacobhiḥ īmahe yam sīm id anye īḍate  janāsaḥ agnim dadhire sahaḥ vṛdham haviṣmantaḥ vidhema te
translated: Agni we invoke with hymns and songs, whom even another one delights in.🔽The people have made Agni, the strength-increasing one, the bearer of oblations. We will serve you.

original: sa tvaṃ no adya sumanā ihāvitā bhavā vājeṣu santya //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ adya sumanāḥ iha avitā bhava vājeṣu santya
translated: Be you, O Agni, well-disposed and helpful to us here, be present in the contests for booty.

original: pra tvā dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasam /
analyzed: pra tvā dūtam vṛṇīmahe hotāram viśva vedasam
translated: We choose you as our messenger, the priest who knows all,

original: mahas te sato vi caranty arcayo divi spṛśanti bhānavaḥ //
analyzed: mahaḥ te sataḥ vi caranti arcayaḥ divi spṛśanti bhānavaḥ
translated: Your rays, O Agni, shining forth, reach the sky.

original: devāsas tvā varuṇo mitro aryamā saṃ dūtam pratnam indhate /🔽viśvaṃ so agne jayati tvayā dhanaṃ yas te dadāśa martyaḥ //
analyzed: devāsaḥ tvā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā sam dūtam pratnam indhate  viśvam saḥ agne jayati tvayā dhanam yaḥ te dadāśa martyaḥ
translated: The gods, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, kindle you as their ancient messenger.🔽O Agni, he who gives you, a mortal, gains all the wealth in the world.

original: mandro hotā gṛhapatir agne dūto viśām asi /
analyzed: mandraḥ hotā gṛhapatiḥ agne dūtaḥ viśām asi
translated: You are the delightful priest, the lord of the house, O Agni, the messenger of the people.

original: tve viśvā saṃgatāni vratā dhruvā yāni devā akṛṇvata //
analyzed: tve viśvā saṃgatāni vratā dhruvā yāni devāḥ akṛṇvata
translated: In you, O Agni, are all the firm and universal vows which the gods have made.

original: tve id agne subhage yaviṣṭhya viśvam ā hūyate haviḥ /
analyzed: tve id agne subhage yaviṣṭhya viśvam ā hūyate haviḥ
translated: In you, O Agni, O most youthful one, O blessed one, all the oblation is offered.

original: sa tvaṃ no adya sumanā utāparaṃ yakṣi devān suvīryā //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ adya sumanāḥ uta aparam yakṣi devān su vīryā
translated: Be you well-disposed to us today, and serve the gods with good strength tomorrow.

original: taṃ ghem itthā namasvina upa svarājam āsate /
analyzed: tam gha īm itthā namasvinaḥ upa svarājam āsate
translated: To him, indeed, here the reverential ones sit down near their own king.

original: hotrābhir agnim manuṣaḥ sam indhate titirvāṃso ati sridhaḥ //
analyzed: hotrābhiḥ agnim manuṣaḥ sam indhate titirvāṃsaḥ ati sridhaḥ
translated: With the oblations men kindle Agni, the overcomers of the foe.

original: ghnanto vṛtram ataran rodasī apa uru kṣayāya cakrire /
analyzed: ghnantaḥ vṛtram ataran rodasī apaḥ uru kṣayāya cakrire
translated: Slaying Vr̥itra they passed through the two world-halves, and made wide room for their abode.

original: bhuvat kaṇve vṛṣā dyumny āhutaḥ krandad aśvo gaviṣṭiṣu //
analyzed: bhuvat kaṇve vṛṣā dyumnī āhutaḥ krandat aśvaḥ gaviṣṭiṣu
translated: He hath been kindled, in Kaṇva's house, the mighty, glorious, much-invoked, the Bull, who hath the steed that neighs aloud in battles for the spoil.

original: saṃ sīdasva mahāṃ asi śocasva devavītamaḥ /
analyzed: sam sīdasva mahān asi śocasva deva vītamaḥ
translated: Sit down, for thou art great: shine forth most meet to be adored by Gods.

original: vi dhūmam agne aruṣam miyedhya sṛja praśasta darśatam //
analyzed: vi dhūmam agne aruṣam miyedhya sṛja praśasta darśatam
translated: Send forth thy ruddy smoke, O Agni, meet for holy rites, most excellent, most fair to see.

original: yaṃ tvā devāso manave dadhur iha yajiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhana /
analyzed: yam tvā devāsaḥ manave iha yajiṣṭham havyavāhana
translated: Whom, O thou bearer of oblations, the Gods have set here for Manu's sake,

original: yaṃ kaṇvo medhyātithir dhanaspṛtaṃ yaṃ vṛṣā yam upastutaḥ //
analyzed: yam kaṇvaḥ medhyātithiḥ dhana spṛtam yam vṛṣā yam upastutaḥ
translated: Whom Kaṇva, Medhyâtithi, Vṛṣa, Dhanas-pṛt, whom the lauding (R̥ishis) have extolled.

original: yam agnim medhyātithiḥ kaṇva īdha ṛtād adhi /🔽tasya preṣo dīdiyus tam imā ṛcas tam agniṃ vardhayāmasi //
analyzed: yam agnim medhyātithiḥ kaṇvaḥ īdhe ṛtāt adhi  tasya pra iṣaḥ dīdiyuḥ tam imāḥ ṛcaḥ tam agnim vardhayāmasi
translated: Whom Kaṇva, Medhyâtithi, hath kindled, O Agni, from the Law,🔽May his impetuous dart shine forth: these R̥ichs have glorified him, and this Agni we exalt.

original: rāyas pūrdhi svadhāvo 'sti hi te 'gne deveṣv āpyam /
analyzed: rāyaḥ pūrdhi svadhāvas sti hi te gne deveṣu āpyam
translated: Increase our wealth, O thou of native power: for, O Agni, thou hast gained a share among the Gods.

original: tvaṃ vājasya śrutyasya rājasi sa no mṛḷa mahāṃ asi //
analyzed: tvam vājasya śrutyasya rājasi sa naḥ mṛḍa mahān asi
translated: Thou art the King of glorious strength: be gracious unto us, for thou art great.

original: ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇa ūtaye tiṣṭhā devo na savitā /🔽ūrdhvo vājasya sanitā yad añjibhir vāghadbhir vihvayāmahe //
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ u su naḥ ūtaye tiṣṭha devaḥ na savitā  ūrdhvaḥ vājasya sanitā yat añjibhiḥ vāghadbhiḥ vihvayāmahe
translated: Rise up on high, O thou who givest help, stand up as God Savitar.🔽Rise up to win us strength, when with anointed priests we call on thee.

original: ūrdhvo naḥ pāhy aṃhaso ni ketunā viśvaṃ sam atriṇaṃ daha /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ naḥ pāhi aṃhasaḥ ni ketunā viśvam sam atriṇam daha
translated: Rise up and save us from distress: with thy light burn thou every Dâsa up.

original: kṛdhī na ūrdhvāñ carathāya jīvase vidā deveṣu no duvaḥ //
analyzed: kṛdhi naḥ ūrdhvām carathāya jīvase vida deveṣu naḥ duvaḥ
translated: Make us to live erect for the course to run: find thou favour for us with the Gods.

original: pāhi no agne rakṣasaḥ pāhi dhūrter arāvṇaḥ /🔽pāhi rīṣata uta vā jighāṃsato bṛhadbhāno yaviṣṭhya //
analyzed: pāhi naḥ agne rakṣasaḥ pāhi dhūrteḥ arāvṇaḥ  pāhi rīṣataḥ uta vā jighāṃsataḥ bṛhadbhāno yaviṣṭhya
translated: Protect us, O Agni, from the Raksases, protect us from the treacherous demon.🔽Protect us from the rushing foe, or him who fain would slay: O thou of lofty flame, O Most Youthful.

original: ghaneva viṣvag vi jahy arāvṇas tapurjambha yo asmadhruk /
analyzed: ghanā iva viṣvak vi jahi arāvṇaḥ tapuḥ jambha yaḥ asmadhruk
translated: Scatter the demons on all sides as with a net: O thou whose teeth are sharp, destroy him who hates us.

original: yo martyaḥ śiśīte aty aktubhir mā naḥ sa ripur īśata //
analyzed: yaḥ martyaḥ śiśīte ati aktubhiḥ mā naḥ sa ripuḥ īśata
translated: Let not that mortal be our foe who burns with his rays beyond the light.

original: agnir vavne suvīryam agniḥ kaṇvāya saubhagam /
analyzed: agniḥ vavne su vīryam agniḥ kaṇvāya saubhagam
translated: Agni hath granted heroic strength, Agni hath granted Kanva bliss.

original: agniḥ prāvan mitrota medhyātithim agniḥ sātā upastutam //
analyzed: agniḥ prāvat mitrā uta medhyātithim agniḥ sātau upastutam
translated: Agni hath granted Medhyatithi, Mitra, and Satya, and Upasruta.

original: agninā turvaśaṃ yadum parāvata ugrādevaṃ havāmahe /
analyzed: agninā turvaśam yadum parāvataḥ ugrādevam havāmahe
translated: With Agni we invoke the God Tvashtar, to aid us, to subdue Turvasa and Yadu.

original: agnir nayan navavāstvam bṛhadrathaṃ turvītiṃ dasyave sahaḥ //
analyzed: agniḥ nayat navavāstvam bṛhat ratham turvītim dasyave sahaḥ
translated: Agni hath led Navavastv, and Brihadratha, and Turviti, and Dasyu's strength.

original: ni tvām agne manur dadhe jyotir janāya śaśvate /
analyzed: ni tvām agne manuḥ dadhe jyotiḥ janāya śaśvate
translated: Agni, Manu hath set thee down as light for the people evermore.

original: dīdetha kaṇva ṛtajāta ukṣito yaṃ namasyanti kṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: dīdetha kaṇve ṛta jātaḥ ukṣitaḥ yam namasyanti kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Kanva, born in holy Law, is kindled, whom the folk adore.

original: tveṣāso agner amavanto arcayo bhīmāso na pratītaye /
analyzed: tveṣāsaḥ agneḥ amavantaḥ arcayaḥ bhīmāsaḥ na pratītaye
translated: The flames of Agni, terrible, are irresistible, with their flashing light.

original: rakṣasvinaḥ sadam id yātumāvato viśvaṃ sam atriṇaṃ daha //
analyzed: rakṣasvinaḥ sadam id yātumāvataḥ viśvam sam atriṇam daha
translated: Burn thou to cinders, ever, Raksases and Yatudhanas, and every devouring fiend.

original: krīḷaṃ vaḥ śardho mārutam anarvāṇaṃ ratheśubham /
analyzed: krīḍam vaḥ śardhaḥ mārutam anarvāṇam ratheśubham
translated: Sing to your sporting troop of Maruts, invincible, beautiful on their cars,

original: kaṇvā abhi pra gāyata //
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ abhi pra gāyata
translated: O Kaṇvas, sing forth to them!

original: ye pṛṣatībhir ṛṣṭibhiḥ sākaṃ vāśībhir añjibhiḥ /
analyzed: ye pṛṣatībhiḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ sākam vāśībhiḥ añjibhiḥ
translated: Who with spotted spears, with swords, with ornaments,

original: ajāyanta svabhānavaḥ //
analyzed: ajāyanta sva bhānavaḥ
translated: Are born resplendent.

original: iheva śṛṇva eṣāṃ kaśā hasteṣu yad vadān /
analyzed: iha iva śṛṇve eṣām kaśāḥ hasteṣu yat vadān
translated: Even here listen to the sound of their whips in their hands when they give the signal,

original: ni yāmañ citram ṛñjate //
analyzed: ni yāmam citram ṛñjate
translated: They hasten to the wonderful goal.

original: pra vaḥ śardhāya ghṛṣvaye tveṣadyumnāya śuṣmiṇe /
analyzed: pra vaḥ śardhāya ghṛṣvaye tveṣa dyumnāya śuṣmiṇe
translated: To your roaring, impetuous troop, to him whose glory is in his might,

original: devattam brahma gāyata //
analyzed: devattam brahma gāyata
translated: Sing forth the divine hymn!

original: pra śaṃsā goṣv aghnyaṃ krīḷaṃ yac chardho mārutam /
analyzed: pra śaṃsa goṣu aghnyam krīḍam yat śardhaḥ mārutam
translated: Praise the kine, the uninjured, the sporting, the troop of Maruts,

original: jambhe rasasya vāvṛdhe //
analyzed: jambhe rasasya vāvṛdhe
translated: Which has grown in the enjoyment of the juice.

original: ko vo varṣiṣṭha ā naro divaś ca gmaś ca dhūtayaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ vaḥ varṣiṣṭhaḥ ā naraḥ divaḥ ca gmaḥ ca dhūtayaḥ
translated: Who among you is the best of men, O shakers, between heaven and earth,

original: yat sīm antaṃ na dhūnutha //
analyzed: yat sīm antam na dhūnutha
translated: When you do not shake the end?

original: ni vo yāmāya mānuṣo dadhra ugrāya manyave /
analyzed: ni vaḥ yāmāya mānuṣaḥ dadhre ugrāya manyave
translated: The human one has bent for your coming, for your fierce wrath,

original: jihīta parvato giriḥ //
analyzed: jihīta parvataḥ giriḥ
translated: The mountain-peak has bent.

original: yeṣām ajmeṣu pṛthivī jujurvāṃ iva viśpatiḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām ajmeṣu pṛthivī jujurvān iva viśpatiḥ
translated: Whose sides, like a lord of the people, the earth shakes,

original: bhiyā yāmeṣu rejate //
analyzed: bhiyā yāmeṣu rejate
translated: Trembles in fear at their coming.

original: sthiraṃ hi jānam eṣāṃ vayo mātur niretave /
analyzed: sthiram hi jānam eṣām vayaḥ mātuḥ niretave
translated: For their firm knee, their strength to go forth from their mother,

original: yat sīm anu dvitā śavaḥ //
analyzed: yat sīm anu dvitā śavaḥ
translated: When their might is after the two dawns.

original: ud u tye sūnavo giraḥ kāṣṭhā ajmeṣv atnata /
analyzed: ud u tye sūnavaḥ giraḥ kāṣṭhāḥ ajmeṣu atnata
translated: Those your sons, the songs, have been set in motion at the ends of the quarters,

original: vāśrā abhijñu yātave //
analyzed: vāśrāḥ abhijñu yātave
translated: The tears that are shed for the one who has gone to the next world.

original: tyaṃ cid ghā dīrgham pṛthum miho napātam amṛdhram /
analyzed: tyam cit gha dīrgham pṛthum mihaḥ napātam amṛdhram
translated: Even him, the long-lived, wide, faultless son,

original: pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ //
analyzed: pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ
translated: They send away with the paths.

original: maruto yad dha vo balaṃ janāṃ acucyavītana /
analyzed: marutaḥ yat ha vaḥ balam janān acucyavītana
translated: O Maruts, when you have shown your strength to the people,

original: girīṃr acucyavītana //
analyzed: girīṃr acucyavītana
translated: You have shown it to the mountains.

original: yad dha yānti marutaḥ saṃ ha bruvate 'dhvann ā /
analyzed: yat ha yānti marutaḥ sam ha bruvate dhvan ā
translated: When the Maruts go, they all speak together on the path,

original: śṛṇoti kaś cid eṣām //
analyzed: śṛṇoti kaḥ cit eṣām
translated: But no one hears them.

original: pra yāta śībham āśubhiḥ santi kaṇveṣu vo duvaḥ /
analyzed: pra yāta śībham āśubhiḥ santi kaṇveṣu vaḥ duvaḥ
translated: Go quickly with your swift ones, there is your service among the Kaṇvas.

original: tatro ṣu mādayādhvai //
analyzed: tatra u su mādayādhvai
translated: There you should rejoice.

original: asti hi ṣmā madāya vaḥ smasi ṣmā vayam eṣām /
analyzed: asti hi sma madāya vaḥ smasi sma vayam eṣām
translated: For there is this for your delight, we are this for them.

original: viśvaṃ cid āyur jīvase //
analyzed: viśvam cit āyuḥ jīvase
translated: For all life to live.

original: kad dha nūnaṃ kadhapriyaḥ pitā putraṃ na hastayoḥ /
analyzed: kad ha nūnam kadhapriyaḥ pitā putram na hastayoḥ
translated: When, O you who love the Kadra, like a father his son in his arms,

original: dadhidhve vṛktabarhiṣaḥ //
analyzed: dadhidhve vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: You hold the ones who have strewn the sacrificial grass.

original: kva nūnaṃ kad vo arthaṃ gantā divo na pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: kva nūnam kad vaḥ artham gantā divaḥ na pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Where now, where is your purpose, like that of heaven or earth?

original: kva vo gāvo na raṇyanti //
analyzed: kva vaḥ gāvaḥ na raṇyanti
translated: Where do your cows not delight?

original: kva vaḥ sumnā navyāṃsi marutaḥ kva suvitā /
analyzed: kva vaḥ sumnā navyāṃsi marutaḥ kva suvitā
translated: Where are your new favors, O Maruts, where your good fortune?

original: kvo viśvāni saubhagā //🔽yad yūyam pṛśnimātaro martāsaḥ syātana /
analyzed: kva u viśvāni saubhagā  yat yūyam pṛśni mātaraḥ martāsaḥ syātana
translated: Where are all your blessings?🔽When you, O you who have a dappled mother, are to be mortals,

original: stotā vo amṛtaḥ syāt //
analyzed: stotā vaḥ amṛtaḥ syāt
translated: Your praiser is to be an immortal.

original: mā vo mṛgo na yavase jaritā bhūd ajoṣyaḥ /
analyzed: mā vaḥ mṛgaḥ na yavase jaritā bhūt ajoṣyaḥ
translated: Let not the deer be a reviler to you in the pasture, the one who is not to be nourished.

original: pathā yamasya gād upa //
analyzed: pathā yamasya gāt upa
translated: Along the path of Yama,

original: mo ṣu ṇaḥ parāparā nirṛtir durhaṇā vadhīt /
analyzed: mā u su naḥ parāparā nirṛtiḥ durhaṇā vadhīt
translated: May Nirṛti, the evil-minded one, not strike us from afar or near.

original: padīṣṭa tṛṣṇayā saha //
analyzed: padīṣṭa tṛṣṇayā saha
translated: May she perish together with thirst.

original: satyaṃ tveṣā amavanto dhanvañ cid ā rudriyāsaḥ /
analyzed: satyam tveṣāḥ amavantaḥ dhanvam cit ā rudriyāsaḥ
translated: The true ones, the wrathful ones, even the desert, the Rudra-like ones,

original: mihaṃ kṛṇvanty avātām //
analyzed: miham kṛṇvanti avātām
translated: Make a fog without wind.

original: vāśreva vidyun mimāti vatsaṃ na mātā siṣakti /
analyzed: vāśrā iva vidyut mimāti vatsam na mātā siṣakti
translated: Like a cow, the lightning flashes, like a mother suckles her calf,

original: yad eṣāṃ vṛṣṭir asarji //
analyzed: yat eṣām vṛṣṭiḥ asarji
translated: When their rain is released.

original: divā cit tamaḥ kṛṇvanti parjanyenodavāhena /
analyzed: divā cit tamaḥ kṛṇvanti parjanyena uda vāhena
translated: Even in the day they make darkness, with Parjanya's downpour,

original: yat pṛthivīṃ vyundanti //
analyzed: yat pṛthivīm vyundanti
translated: When they drench the earth.

original: adha svanān marutāṃ viśvam ā sadma pārthivam /
analyzed: adha svanāt marutām viśvam ā sadma pārthivam
translated: Now the sounds of the Maruts, the entire abode on earth,

original: arejanta pra mānuṣāḥ //
analyzed: arejanta pra mānuṣāḥ
translated: The humans rejoice in them.

original: maruto vīḷupāṇibhiś citrā rodhasvatīr anu /
analyzed: marutaḥ vīḍu pāṇibhiḥ citrāḥ rodhasvatīḥ anu
translated: O Maruts, with your hands of lightning, along the variegated and obstructing (paths),

original: yātem akhidrayāmabhiḥ //
analyzed: yāta īm akhidra yāmabhiḥ
translated: Go with your unwearied teams!

original: sthirā vaḥ santu nemayo rathā aśvāsa eṣām /
analyzed: sthirāḥ vaḥ santu nemayaḥ rathāḥ aśvāsaḥ eṣām
translated: Firm be your wheels, O chariots, and their horses,

original: susaṃskṛtā abhīśavaḥ //
analyzed: su saṃskṛtāḥ abhīśavaḥ
translated: Well-constructed are their reins.

original: acchā vadā tanā girā jarāyai brahmaṇas patim /
analyzed: acchā vada tanā girā jarāyai brahmaṇas patim
translated: Come, speak with the song, for old age, to the lord of prayer,

original: agnim mitraṃ na darśatam //
analyzed: agnim mitram na darśatam
translated: To Agni, to Mitra, to the visible one.

original: mimīhi ślokam āsye parjanya iva tatanaḥ /
analyzed: mimīhi ślokam āsye parjanyaḥ iva tatanaḥ
translated: Measure the verse in your mouth, spread out like Parjanya,

original: gāya gāyatram ukthyam //
analyzed: gāya gāyatram ukthyam
translated: Sing the Gāyatrī, the eulogistic one.

original: vandasva mārutaṃ gaṇaṃ tveṣam panasyum arkiṇam /
analyzed: vandasva mārutam gaṇam tveṣam panasyum arkiṇam
translated: Worship the troop of Maruts, the impetuous, the laughing, the radiant.

original: asme vṛddhā asann iha //
analyzed: asme vṛddhāḥ asan iha
translated: May they be increased for us here.

original: pra yad itthā parāvataḥ śocir na mānam asyatha /
analyzed: pra yat itthā parāvataḥ śociḥ na mānam asyatha
translated: When thus from yonder distance your radiance hath been kindled like his might,

original: kasya kratvā marutaḥ kasya varpasā kaṃ yātha kaṃ ha dhūtayaḥ //🔽sthirā vaḥ santv āyudhā parāṇude vīḷū uta pratiṣkabhe /🔽yuṣmākam astu taviṣī panīyasī mā martyasya māyinaḥ //
analyzed: kasya kratvā marutaḥ kasya varpasā kam yātha kam ha dhūtayaḥ  sthirā vaḥ santu āyudhā parāṇude vīḍū uta pratiṣkabhe  yuṣmākam astu taviṣī panīyasī mā martyasya māyinaḥ
translated: By whose wisdom, O Maruts, by whose power, whom do you visit, whom, O impetuous ones?🔽Firm be your weapons for repelling, for cleaving, and for piercing.🔽Let your power be most mighty, O Rudras, against the deceitful mortal.

original: parā ha yat sthiraṃ hatha naro vartayathā guru /
analyzed: parā ha yat sthiram hatha naraḥ vartayathā guru
translated: When ye overthrow the firm, O heroes, ye roll away the heavy (stone).

original: vi yāthana vaninaḥ pṛthivyā vy āśāḥ parvatānām //
analyzed: vi yāthana vaninaḥ pṛthivyāḥ vi āśāḥ parvatānām
translated: Ye cleave asunder the trees of the earth, and the regions of the mountains.

original: nahi vaḥ śatrur vivide adhi dyavi na bhūmyāṃ riśādasaḥ /
analyzed: nahi vaḥ śatruḥ vivide adhi dyavi na bhūmyām riśādasaḥ
translated: For your foe hath found no place on the sky, nor on the earth, O ye destroyers of enemies.

original: yuṣmākam astu taviṣī tanā yujā rudrāso nū cid ādhṛṣe //
analyzed: yuṣmākam astu taviṣī tanā yujā rudrāsaḥ nu cit ādhṛṣe
translated: Let your power be mighty, O Rudras, in the fight, in the conflict, (even) against Nahuṣa.

original: pra vepayanti parvatān vi viñcanti vanaspatīn /
analyzed: pra vepayanti parvatān vi viñcanti vanaspatīn
translated: They make the mountains tremble, they rend asunder the trees.

original: pro ārata maruto durmadā iva devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā //
analyzed: pra u ārata marutaḥ durmadāḥ iva devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā
translated: Advance, O Maruts, like those who are difficult to subdue, O gods, with your whole people.

original: upo ratheṣu pṛṣatīr ayugdhvam praṣṭir vahati rohitaḥ /
analyzed: upa u ratheṣu pṛṣatīḥ ayugdhvam praṣṭiḥ vahati rohitaḥ
translated: Ye have yoked the spotted (cows) to the chariots; the red one draws the four-wheeled (chariot).

original: ā vo yāmāya pṛthivī cid aśrod abībhayanta mānuṣāḥ //
analyzed: ā vaḥ yāmāya pṛthivī cit aśrot abībhayanta mānuṣāḥ
translated: Even the earth trembled for your coming, and men were afraid.

original: ā vo makṣū tanāya kaṃ rudrā avo vṛṇīmahe /
analyzed: ā vaḥ makṣū tanāya kam rudrāḥ avaḥ vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose you, O Rudras, for your swift help, for your favour.

original: gantā nūnaṃ no 'vasā yathā puretthā kaṇvāya bibhyuṣe //
analyzed: ganta nūnam naḥ vasā yathā purā itthā kaṇvāya bibhyuṣe
translated: You must come to us with your help, as formerly to the trembling Kaṇva.

original: yuṣmeṣito maruto martyeṣita ā yo no abhva īṣate /
analyzed: yuṣmeṣitaḥ marutaḥ martya iṣitaḥ ā yaḥ naḥ abhvaḥ īṣate
translated: O Maruts, he who threatens us with terror, sent by you, sent by mortals,

original: vi taṃ yuyota śavasā vy ojasā vi yuṣmākābhir ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: vi tam yuyota śavasā vi ojasā vi yuṣmākābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Drive him away with your strength, with your vigour, with your own aids.

original: asāmi hi prayajyavaḥ kaṇvaṃ dada pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: asāmi hi prayajyavaḥ kaṇvam dada pracetasaḥ
translated: For you have helped the well-adoring Kaṇva, the far-seeing ones.

original: asāmibhir maruta ā na ūtibhir gantā vṛṣṭiṃ na vidyutaḥ //
analyzed: asāmibhiḥ marutaḥ ā naḥ ūtibhiḥ ganta vṛṣṭim na vidyutaḥ
translated: With your aids, O Maruts, with your succours, go to the rain like lightning.

original: asāmy ojo bibhṛthā sudānavo 'sāmi dhūtayaḥ śavaḥ /
analyzed: asāmi ojaḥ bibhṛtha sudānavaḥ sāmi dhūtayaḥ śavaḥ
translated: You have helped strength, O bountiful ones; you have helped the shaking power.

original: ṛṣidviṣe marutaḥ parimanyava iṣuṃ na sṛjata dviṣam //
analyzed: ṛṣi dviṣe marutaḥ parimanyavaḥ iṣum na sṛjata dviṣam
translated: O Maruts, with your wrath against the haters of the Rishi, shoot your arrow at the foe.

original: ut tiṣṭha brahmaṇas pate devayantas tvemahe /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha brahmaṇaḥ pate devayantaḥ tvā īmahe
translated: Rise up, O lord of prayer; we who long for the gods honour you.

original: upa pra yantu marutaḥ sudānava indra prāśūr bhavā sacā //
analyzed: upa pra yantu marutaḥ sudānavaḥ indra prāśūḥ bhava sacā
translated: Let the bountiful Maruts advance; be ready, O Indra, to drink.

original: tvām id dhi sahasas putra martya upabrūte dhane hite /
analyzed: tvām id hi sahasas putra martyaḥ upabrūte dhane hite
translated: For you, O son of strength, the mortal invokes when the prize is staked in the contest.

original: suvīryam maruta ā svaśvyaṃ dadhīta yo va ācake //
analyzed: su vīryam marutaḥ ā su aśvyam dadhīta yaḥ vaḥ ācake
translated: He who praises you, O Maruts, should wish for good heroism and good horses.

original: praitu brahmaṇas patiḥ pra devy etu sūnṛtā /
analyzed: praitu brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ pra devī etu sūnṛtā
translated: Let the Lord of prayer go forth, let the Goddess Sūnṛtā go.

original: acchā vīraṃ naryam paṅktirādhasaṃ devā yajñaṃ nayantu naḥ //
analyzed: acchā vīram naryam paṅkti rādhasam devāḥ yajñam nayantu naḥ
translated: Let the gods lead us to the sacrifice, to the hero, the man, the giver of the Pankti-gift.

original: yo vāghate dadāti sūnaraṃ vasu sa dhatte akṣiti śravaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vāghate dadāti sūnaram vasu sa dhatte akṣiti śravaḥ
translated: He who gives the sacrificer good wealth, he wins imperishable fame.

original: tasmā iḷāṃ suvīrām ā yajāmahe supratūrtim anehasam //
analyzed: tasmai iḷām su vīrām ā yajāmahe su pratūrtim anehasam
translated: To him we offer the sacrifice, the very heroic, the very victorious, the faultless.

original: pra nūnam brahmaṇas patir mantraṃ vadaty ukthyam /
analyzed: pra nūnam brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ mantram vadati ukthyam
translated: Now indeed the Lord of prayer speaks the hymn worthy of praise,

original: yasminn indro varuṇo mitro aryamā devā okāṃsi cakrire //
analyzed: yasmin indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā devāḥ okāṃsi cakrire
translated: In whom Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, the gods have made their abodes.

original: tam id vocemā vidatheṣu śambhuvam mantraṃ devā anehasam /
analyzed: tam id voca imāḥ vidatheṣu śambhuvam mantram devāḥ anehasam
translated: That hymn of the gods, faultless, we will call upon in the assemblies, auspicious.

original: imāṃ ca vācam pratiharyathā naro viśved vāmā vo aśnavat //
analyzed: imām ca vācam pratiharyathā naraḥ viśvā id vāmā vaḥ aśnavat
translated: Receive this speech of ours, O men; may all your desires be fulfilled.

original: ko devayantam aśnavaj janaṃ ko vṛktabarhiṣam /
analyzed: kaḥ devayantam aśnavat janam kaḥ vṛkta barhiṣam
translated: Who will find the people who serve the gods? Who will find him who has strewn the sacrificial grass?

original: prapra dāśvān pastyābhir asthitāntarvāvat kṣayaṃ dadhe //
analyzed: pra pra dāśvān pastyābhiḥ asthita antarvāvat kṣayam dadhe
translated: The giver of gifts has set himself among the houses, and has made his abode in the dwelling place.

original: upa kṣatram pṛñcīta hanti rājabhir bhaye cit sukṣitiṃ dadhe /
analyzed: upa kṣatram pṛñcīta hanti rājabhiḥ bhaye cit su kṣitim dadhe
translated: He will crush the kingdom, he will slay with the kings; even in fear he has made a good abode.

original: nāsya vartā na tarutā mahādhane nārbhe asti vajriṇaḥ //
analyzed: na asya vartā na tarutā mahādhane na arbhe asti vajriṇaḥ
translated: Of him who wields the thunderbolt there is no turning back, no failure in the great contest, no defeat.

original: yaṃ rakṣanti pracetaso varuṇo mitro aryamā /
analyzed: yam rakṣanti pracetasaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: Whom the wise ones, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, protect,

original: nū cit sa dabhyate janaḥ //
analyzed: nū cit sa dabhyate janaḥ
translated: Let no one be deceived by him.

original: yam bāhuteva piprati pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ /
analyzed: yam bāhutā iva piprati pānti martyam riṣaḥ
translated: Whom he delights as with his arms, they protect the mortal from harm.

original: ariṣṭaḥ sarva edhate //
analyzed: ariṣṭaḥ sarvaḥ edhate
translated: All prosper without affliction.

original: vi durgā vi dviṣaḥ puro ghnanti rājāna eṣām /
analyzed: vi durgā vi dviṣaḥ puras ghnanti rājānaḥ eṣām
translated: The kings of these people drive away misfortune, drive away foes, drive away the forts.

original: nayanti duritā tiraḥ //
analyzed: nayanti duritā tiras
translated: They lead away the calamities.

original: sugaḥ panthā anṛkṣara ādityāsa ṛtaṃ yate /
analyzed: su gaḥ panthāḥ anṛkṣaraḥ ādityāsaḥ ṛtam yate
translated: The path is easy, free from danger, for the Ādityas who are devoted to truth.

original: nātrāvakhādo asti vaḥ //
analyzed: na atra avakhādaḥ asti vaḥ
translated: There is no treachery for you.

original: yaṃ yajñaṃ nayathā nara ādityā ṛjunā pathā /
analyzed: yam yajñam nayathā naraḥ ādityāḥ ṛjunā pathā
translated: O Ādityas, the sacrifice which you lead, O men, by the straight path,

original: pra vaḥ sa dhītaye naśat //
analyzed: pra vaḥ sa dhītaye naśat
translated: May that lead you to your inspiration.

original: sa ratnam martyo vasu viśvaṃ tokam uta tmanā /
analyzed: sa ratnam martyaḥ vasu viśvam tokam uta tmanā
translated: That mortal who goes to the wealth, to all the offspring, and to himself,

original: acchā gacchaty astṛtaḥ //
analyzed: acchā gacchati astṛtaḥ
translated: Goes unhindered.

original: kathā rādhāma sakhāya stomam mitrasyāryamṇaḥ /
analyzed: kathā rādhāma sakhāyaḥ stomam mitrasya aryamṇaḥ
translated: How shall we, O friends, offer the praise of Mitra, Aryaman,

original: mahi psaro varuṇasya //
analyzed: mahi psaraḥ varuṇasya
translated: The great Psaras, and Varuna?

original: mā vo ghnantam mā śapantam prati voce devayantam /
analyzed: mā vaḥ ghnantam mā śapantam prati voce devayantam
translated: Do not speak against one who does not harm you, who does not revile you, who is devoted to the gods.

original: sumnair id va ā vivāse //
analyzed: sumnaiḥ id vaḥ ā vivāse
translated: I would invite you with favors.

original: caturaś cid dadamānād bibhīyād ā nidhātoḥ /
analyzed: caturaḥ cit dadamānāt bibhīyāt ā nidhātoḥ
translated: One should fear even a generous person who gives four things, from the time of his giving.

original: na duruktāya spṛhayet //🔽sam pūṣann adhvanas tira vy aṃho vimuco napāt /
analyzed: na duruktāya spṛhayet  sam pūṣan adhvanaḥ tira vi aṃhaḥ vimucaḥ napāt
translated: One should not long for a bad reputation.🔽O Pūṣan, cross over the paths, drive away misfortune, O son of Vivasvat.

original: sakṣvā deva pra ṇas puraḥ //
analyzed: sakṣva deva pra naḥ puras
translated: O god, win for us the forts.

original: yo naḥ pūṣann agho vṛko duḥśeva ādideśati /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ pūṣan aghaḥ vṛkaḥ duḥśevaḥ ādideśati
translated: O Pūṣan, if a wolf or a wicked man should threaten us,

original: apa sma tam patho jahi //
analyzed: apa sma tam pathaḥ jahi
translated: Drive him away from the paths.

original: apa tyam paripanthinam muṣīvāṇaṃ huraścitam /
analyzed: apa tyam paripanthinam muṣīvāṇam huraścitam
translated: Drive away that one who goes crookedly, the thief, the one with a wicked mind,

original: dūram adhi sruter aja //🔽tvaṃ tasya dvayāvino 'ghaśaṃsasya kasya cit /
analyzed: dūram adhi sruteḥ aja  tvam tasya dvayāvinaḥ gha śaṃsasya kasya cit
translated: Far from the path of the swift one.🔽You, with your foot, trample down the one who acts in two ways,

original: padābhi tiṣṭha tapuṣim //
analyzed: padā abhi tiṣṭha tapuṣim
translated: The one who wishes harm to anyone, the one who burns with anger.

original: ā tat te dasra mantumaḥ pūṣann avo vṛṇīmahe /
analyzed: ā tat te dasra mantumas pūṣan avaḥ vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose that most excellent wish of yours, O Dasra Pusan,

original: yena pitṝn acodayaḥ //
analyzed: yena pitṝn acodayaḥ
translated: By which you have urged on the fathers.

original: adhā no viśvasaubhaga hiraṇyavāśīmattama /
analyzed: adha naḥ viśva saubhaga hiraṇya vāśīmattama
translated: Now, O you who are all-fortunate, most rich in gold,

original: dhanāni suṣaṇā kṛdhi //
analyzed: dhanāni suṣaṇā kṛdhi
translated: Make our riches very beautiful.

original: ati naḥ saścato naya sugā naḥ supathā kṛṇu /
analyzed: ati naḥ saścataḥ naya su gā naḥ su pathā kṛṇu
translated: Lead us beyond those who compete with us, make our paths easy and good for us,

original: pūṣann iha kratuṃ vidaḥ //
analyzed: pūṣan iha kratum vidaḥ
translated: O Pusan, find wisdom here for us.

original: abhi sūyavasaṃ naya na navajvāro adhvane /
analyzed: abhi sū yavasam naya na nava jvāraḥ adhvane
translated: Lead us to the good pasture, do not be a new disease on the journey,

original: pūṣann iha kratuṃ vidaḥ //
analyzed: pūṣan iha kratum vidaḥ
translated: O Pusan, find wisdom here for us.

original: śagdhi pūrdhi pra yaṃsi ca śiśīhi prāsy udaram /
analyzed: śagdhi pūrdhi pra yaṃsi ca śiśīhi prāsi udaram
translated: Help, support, and give us strength, sharpen your own belly,

original: pūṣann iha kratuṃ vidaḥ //
analyzed: pūṣan iha kratum vidaḥ
translated: O Pusan, find wisdom here for us.

original: na pūṣaṇam methāmasi sūktair abhi gṛṇīmasi /
analyzed: na pūṣaṇam methāmasi sūktaiḥ abhi gṛṇīmasi
translated: We do not deceive Pusan, we praise him with hymns,

original: vasūni dasmam īmahe //
analyzed: vasūni dasmam īmahe
translated: We seek the wondrous one's treasures.

original: kad rudrāya pracetase mīḷhuṣṭamāya tavyase /
analyzed: kad rudrāya pracetase mīḍhuṣṭamāya tavyase
translated: To Rudra, the wise one, the most bountiful, the most worthy,

original: vocema śantamaṃ hṛde //
analyzed: vocema śantamam hṛde
translated: We speak the most pleasing word to his heart.

original: yathā no aditiḥ karat paśve nṛbhyo yathā gave /
analyzed: yathā naḥ aditiḥ karat paśve nṛbhyaḥ yathā gave
translated: As Aditi has done for us for our cattle, for men, for our cows,

original: yathā tokāya rudriyam //
analyzed: yathā tokāya rudriyam
translated: As (he is) to the offspring of Rudra.

original: yathā no mitro varuṇo yathā rudraś ciketati /
analyzed: yathā naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ yathā rudraḥ ciketati
translated: As Mitra, Varuna, and Rudra think of us,

original: yathā viśve sajoṣasaḥ //
analyzed: yathā viśve sajoṣasaḥ
translated: As all (the gods) are of one mind.

original: gāthapatim medhapatiṃ rudraṃ jalāṣabheṣajam /
analyzed: gātha patim medha patim rudram jalāṣa bheṣajam
translated: Rudra, the lord of hymns, the lord of the sacrifice, the medicine of the afflicted,

original: tac chaṃyoḥ sumnam īmahe //
analyzed: tat śaṃyoḥ sumnam īmahe
translated: We implore that bliss of the two.

original: yaḥ śukra iva sūryo hiraṇyam iva rocate /
analyzed: yaḥ śukraḥ iva sūryaḥ hiraṇyam iva rocate
translated: He who shines like the pure (sun), like gold,

original: śreṣṭho devānāṃ vasuḥ //
analyzed: śreṣṭhaḥ devānām vasuḥ
translated: The best of the gods, the treasure.

original: śaṃ naḥ karaty arvate sugam meṣāya meṣye /
analyzed: śam naḥ karati arvate sugam meṣāya meṣye
translated: May he be gracious to our horse, to the ram, to the ewe,

original: nṛbhyo nāribhyo gave //
analyzed: nṛbhyaḥ nāribhyaḥ gave
translated: To men, to women, to the cow.

original: asme soma śriyam adhi ni dhehi śatasya nṛṇām /
analyzed: asme soma śriyam adhi ni dhehi śatasya nṛṇām
translated: O Soma, place upon us the glory of a hundred men,

original: mahi śravas tuvinṛmṇam //
analyzed: mahi śravaḥ tuvi nṛmṇam
translated: Great fame, O mighty one.

original: mā naḥ somaparibādho mārātayo juhuranta /
analyzed: mā naḥ soma paribādhaḥ mā arātayaḥ juhuranta
translated: Let not the Soma-drinking, the mortal enemies, vex us, O Soma.

original: ā na indo vāje bhaja //
analyzed: ā naḥ indo vāje bhaja
translated: O Indu, grant us strength in the contest.

original: yās te prajā amṛtasya parasmin dhāmann ṛtasya /
analyzed: yāḥ te prajāḥ amṛtasya parasmin dhāman ṛtasya
translated: Those offspring of thine, O immortal one, in the highest abode of truth,

original: mūrdhā nābhā soma vena ābhūṣantīḥ soma vedaḥ //🔽agne vivasvad uṣasaś citraṃ rādho amartya /🔽ā dāśuṣe jātavedo vahā tvam adyā devāṃ uṣarbudhaḥ //
analyzed: mūrdhā nābhā soma venaḥ ābhūṣantīḥ soma vedaḥ  agne vivasvat uṣasaḥ citram rādhaḥ amartya  ā dāśuṣe jātavedaḥ vaha tvam adyā devān uṣarbudhaḥ
translated: The head, the navel, O Soma, O knower of beings, longing for thee, O Soma, the knower of beings.🔽O Agni, O Vivasvat, O dawn, your wondrous gift, O immortal one,🔽O all-knower, bring to the worshipper today the gods who rise at dawn.

original: juṣṭo hi dūto asi havyavāhano 'gne rathīr adhvarāṇām /
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ hi dūtaḥ asi havya vāhanaḥ gneḥ rathīḥ adhvarāṇām
translated: For you are a beloved messenger, O Agni, the bearer of oblations, the charioteer of sacrifices.

original: sajūr aśvibhyām uṣasā suvīryam asme dhehi śravo bṛhat //
analyzed: sajūs aśvibhyām uṣasā su vīryam asme dhehi śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: Together with the Ashvins, bestow on us, O Dawn, strength and high glory.

original: adyā dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe vasum agnim purupriyam /
analyzed: adyā dūtam vṛṇīmahe vasum agnim puru priyam
translated: Today we choose as our messenger the good Agni, dear to many,

original: dhūmaketum bhāṛjīkaṃ vyuṣṭiṣu yajñānām adhvaraśriyam //
analyzed: dhūma ketum bhāṛjīkam vyuṣṭiṣu yajñānām adhvara śriyam
translated: The smoke-bannered, the golden-hued, in the dawns, the glory of sacrifices.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ yaviṣṭham atithiṃ svāhutaṃ juṣṭaṃ janāya dāśuṣe /
analyzed: śreṣṭham yaviṣṭham atithim su āhutam juṣṭam janāya dāśuṣe
translated: The best, the youngest, the guest well-worshipped, agreeable to the people who offer,

original: devāṃ acchā yātave jātavedasam agnim īḷe vyuṣṭiṣu //
analyzed: devān acchā yātave jātavedasam agnim īḍe vyuṣṭiṣu
translated: I invoke Agni, the all-knower, to go to the gods in the dawns.

original: staviṣyāmi tvām ahaṃ viśvasyāmṛta bhojana /
analyzed: staviṣyāmi tvām aham viśvasya amṛta bhojana
translated: I will praise you, O you who are fed by all, O immortal one,

original: agne trātāram amṛtam miyedhya yajiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhana //
analyzed: agne trātāram amṛtam miyedhya yajiṣṭham havyavāhana
translated: O Agni, the protector, the immortal one, the most worthy of offerings, the bearer of oblations.

original: suśaṃso bodhi gṛṇate yaviṣṭhya madhujihvaḥ svāhutaḥ /
analyzed: su śaṃsaḥ bodhi gṛṇate yaviṣṭhya madhu jihvaḥ su āhutaḥ
translated: Be well-praised, O youngest one, to the one who sings, with a honey-sweet tongue, well-worshipped,

original: praskaṇvasya pratirann āyur jīvase namasyā daivyaṃ janam //
analyzed: praskaṇvasya pratiran āyuḥ jīvase namasya daivyam janam
translated: The responder to Pratskanva, for the sake of living a long life, I pay homage to the divine people.

original: hotāraṃ viśvavedasaṃ saṃ hi tvā viśa indhate /
analyzed: hotāram viśva vedasam sam hi tvā viśaḥ indhate
translated: The all-knowing one, for the people kindle you as the priest.

original: sa ā vaha puruhūta pracetaso 'gne devāṃ iha dravat //
analyzed: saḥ ā vaha puruhūta pracetasaḥ gne devān iha dravat
translated: O Agni, invoked by many, bring the wise gods here, O bearer of oblations.

original: savitāram uṣasam aśvinā bhagam agniṃ vyuṣṭiṣu kṣapaḥ /
analyzed: savitāram uṣasam aśvinā bhagam agnim vyuṣṭiṣu kṣapaḥ
translated: Savitar, Uṣas, the Aśvins, Bhaga, Agni, in the dawns, in the nights,

original: kaṇvāsas tvā sutasomāsa indhate havyavāhaṃ svadhvara //
analyzed: kaṇvāsaḥ tvā suta somāsaḥ indhate havyavāham su adhvara
translated: The Kaṇvas kindle you, the bearer of oblations, with well-pressed Soma, the one who offers well.

original: patir hy adhvarāṇām agne dūto viśām asi /
analyzed: patiḥ hi adhvarāṇām agne dūtaḥ viśām asi
translated: For you are the lord of sacrifices, O Agni, and the messenger of the people.

original: uṣarbudha ā vaha somapītaye devāṃ adya svardṛśaḥ //
analyzed: uṣarbudhaḥ ā vaha soma pītaye devān adya svar dṛśaḥ
translated: O you who rise at dawn, bring the gods today, who behold the light, to drink the Soma.

original: agne pūrvā anūṣaso vibhāvaso dīdetha viśvadarśataḥ /
analyzed: agne pūrvāḥ anu uṣasaḥ vibhāvaso dīdetha viśva darśataḥ
translated: O Agni, you shine forth with the earliest dawns, you who are all-seeing, O you who are radiant with light.

original: asi grāmeṣv avitā purohito 'si yajñeṣu mānuṣaḥ //
analyzed: asi grāmeṣu avitā purohitaḥ si yajñeṣu mānuṣaḥ
translated: You are the protector among the villages, you are the priest at the sacrifices of men.

original: ni tvā yajñasya sādhanam agne hotāram ṛtvijam /
analyzed: ni tvā yajñasya sādhanam agne hotāram ṛtvijam
translated: We will think of you, O Agni, as the accomplisher of the sacrifice, as the Hotar, as the priest,

original: manuṣvad deva dhīmahi pracetasaṃ jīraṃ dūtam amartyam //
analyzed: manuṣvat deva dhīmahi pracetasam jīram dūtam amartyam
translated: as the wise one, as the old messenger, as the immortal one, as in Manu's way.

original: yad devānām mitramahaḥ purohito 'ntaro yāsi dūtyam /
analyzed: yat devānām mitra mahas purohitaḥ ntaras yāsi dūtyam
translated: As the priest of the great friends of the gods, you go as a messenger among them.

original: sindhor iva prasvanitāsa ūrmayo 'gner bhrājante arcayaḥ //
analyzed: sindhoḥ iva prasvanitāsaḥ ūrmayaḥ gneḥ bhrājante arcayaḥ
translated: Like the waves of a river, O Agni, your shining flames resound.

original: śrudhi śrutkarṇa vahnibhir devair agne sayāvabhiḥ /
analyzed: śrudhi śrut karṇa vahnibhiḥ devaiḥ agne sa yāvabhiḥ
translated: Listen, O you with ears to hear, O Agni, with the accompanying gods, with the Vāhinis.

original: ā sīdantu barhiṣi mitro aryamā prātaryāvāṇo adhvaram //
analyzed: ā sīdantu barhiṣi mitraḥ aryamā prātaryāvāṇaḥ adhvaram
translated: May Mitra, Aryaman, the early risers sit down on the sacrificial grass at the sacrifice.

original: śṛṇvantu stomam marutaḥ sudānavo 'gnijihvā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇvantu stomam marutaḥ sudānavaḥ gni jihvāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: May the Maruts, the givers of good gifts, who increase truth, listen to the praise, whose tongues are Agni.

original: pibatu somaṃ varuṇo dhṛtavrato 'śvibhyām uṣasā sajūḥ //
analyzed: pibatu somam varuṇaḥ dhṛta vrataḥ śvibhyām uṣasā sajūs
translated: May Varuna, whose vow is firm, drink the Soma, in union with the two Ashvins and with dawn.

original: tvam agne vasūṃr iha rudrāṃ ādityāṃ uta /
analyzed: tvam agne vasūn iha rudrān ādityān uta
translated: You, O Agni, here the Vasus, the Rudras, and the Adityas,

original: yajā svadhvaraṃ janam manujātaṃ ghṛtapruṣam //
analyzed: yaja su adhvaram janam manu jātam ghṛta pruṣam
translated: Worship the people who are true to their vows, born from Manu, sprinkled with ghee.

original: śruṣṭīvāno hi dāśuṣe devā agne vicetasaḥ /
analyzed: śruṣṭīvānaḥ hi dāśuṣe devāḥ agne vicetasaḥ
translated: For the worshipper, O Agni, the gods who listen are wise.

original: tān rohidaśva girvaṇas trayastriṃśatam ā vaha //
analyzed: tān rohit aśva girvaṇaḥ trayastriṃśatam ā vaha
translated: Bring them, O you with red horses, O you who love praise, the thirty-three.

original: priyamedhavad atrivaj jātavedo virūpavat /
analyzed: priyamedha vat atri vat jātavedaḥ virūpa vat
translated: O Jātavedas, like Priyamedhas, like Atri, like Virūpa,

original: aṅgirasvan mahivrata praskaṇvasya śrudhī havam //
analyzed: aṅgirasvat mahi vrata praskaṇvasya śrudhi havam
translated: O you of great vows like Aṅgiras, listen to Praskanva's call.

original: mahikerava ūtaye priyamedhā ahūṣata /🔽rājantam adhvarāṇām agniṃ śukreṇa śociṣā //
analyzed: mahi keravaḥ ūtaye priyamedhāḥ ahūṣata  rājantam adhvarāṇām agnim śukreṇa śociṣā
translated: The Mahīkīras have called out for help, the Priyamedhas.🔽The king of sacrifices, Agni, with his bright radiance.

original: ghṛtāhavana santyemā u ṣu śrudhī giraḥ /
analyzed: ghṛtāhavana santi ā imāḥ u su śrudhi giraḥ
translated: O Agni, whose oblations are in ghee, listen to these songs.

original: yābhiḥ kaṇvasya sūnavo havante 'vase tvā //
analyzed: yābhiḥ kaṇvasya sūnavaḥ havante vase tvā
translated: By which the sons of Kaṇva call you for help.

original: tvāṃ citraśravastama havante vikṣu jantavaḥ /
analyzed: tvām citraśravastama havante vikṣu jantavaḥ
translated: You, O most famous in wondrous fame, are called by the people in the regions.

original: śociṣkeśam purupriyāgne havyāya voḷhave //
analyzed: śociṣkeśam puru priya agne havyāya voḷhave
translated: O Agni, whose hair is radiant, beloved by many, to carry the oblations.

original: ni tvā hotāram ṛtvijaṃ dadhire vasuvittamam /
analyzed: ni tvā hotāram ṛtvijam dadhire vasu vittamam
translated: They have made you the Hotar, the priest, best at finding wealth.

original: śrutkarṇaṃ saprathastamaṃ viprā agne diviṣṭiṣu //
analyzed: śrut karṇam saprathastamam viprāḥ agne diviṣṭiṣu
translated: O Agni, the wise ones, with ears to hear, most renowned, in the sacrifices.

original: ā tvā viprā acucyavuḥ sutasomā abhi prayaḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā viprāḥ acucyavuḥ suta somāḥ abhi prayaḥ
translated: The wise ones, with Soma pressed, have chosen you for the prize.

original: bṛhad bhā bibhrato havir agne martāya dāśuṣe //
analyzed: bṛhat bhās bibhrataḥ haviḥ agne martāya dāśuṣe
translated: Bearing great light, offering oblations, O Agni, to the mortal worshipper.

original: prātaryāvṇaḥ sahaskṛta somapeyāya santya /
analyzed: prātaryāvṇaḥ sahaskṛta soma peyāya santya
translated: To the morning and evening libations, to the Soma drinking, to the gathering.

original: ihādya daivyaṃ janam barhir ā sādayā vaso //
analyzed: iha adya daivyam janam barhiḥ ā sādaya vaso
translated: Here today, O Vasu, seat the divine people on the sacred grass.

original: arvāñcaṃ daivyaṃ janam agne yakṣva sahūtibhiḥ /🔽ayaṃ somaḥ sudānavas tam pāta tiroahnyam //
analyzed: arvāñcam daivyam janam agne yakṣva sa hūtibhiḥ  ayam somaḥ sudānavaḥ tam pāta tiroahnyam
translated: O Agni, bring the divine people hither with your invitations.🔽This Soma, O bountiful ones, drink it today, O you who are to be invoked.

original: eṣo uṣā apūrvyā vy ucchati priyā divaḥ /
analyzed: eṣā u uṣāḥ apūrvyā vi ucchati priyā divaḥ
translated: This dawn shines forth with fresh light, dear to the sky.

original: stuṣe vām aśvinā bṛhat //
analyzed: stuṣe vām aśvinā bṛhat
translated: I praise you, O Asvins, with a great hymn.

original: yā dasrā sindhumātarā manotarā rayīṇām /
analyzed: yā dasrā sindhu mātarā manotarā rayīṇām
translated: You two wondrous ones, mothers of the river, leaders of the mind in wealth,

original: dhiyā devā vasuvidā //
analyzed: dhiyā devā vasu vidā
translated: O gods, with the knowledge of good things.

original: vacyante vāṃ kakuhāso jūrṇāyām adhi viṣṭapi /
analyzed: vacyante vām kakuhāsaḥ jūrṇāyām adhi viṣṭapi
translated: Your horns are praised, on the worn-out, on the elevated place,

original: yad vāṃ ratho vibhiṣ patāt //🔽haviṣā jāro apām piparti papurir narā /
analyzed: yat vām rathaḥ vibhiḥ patāt  haviṣā jāraḥ apām piparti papuriḥ narā
translated: When your chariot flies through the regions.🔽The son of the waters nourishes with oblation, the abundant one, the men,

original: pitā kuṭasya carṣaṇiḥ //
analyzed: pitā kuṭasya carṣaṇiḥ
translated: The father of the people, the lord of the house.

original: ādāro vām matīnāṃ nāsatyā matavacasā /
analyzed: ādāraḥ vām matīnām nāsatyā mata vacasā
translated: The invocation of your thoughts, O Nāsatyas, with the words of the mind,

original: pātaṃ somasya dhṛṣṇuyā //
analyzed: pātam somasya dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: Drink the Soma with eagerness.

original: yā naḥ pīparad aśvinā jyotiṣmatī tamas tiraḥ /
analyzed: yā naḥ pīparat aśvinā jyotiṣmatī tamaḥ tiras
translated: O Asvins, the light that shall carry us across the darkness,

original: tām asme rāsāthām iṣam //
analyzed: tām asme rāsāthām iṣam
translated: Bestow that food upon us.

original: ā no nāvā matīnāṃ yātam pārāya gantave /🔽yuñjāthām aśvinā ratham //
analyzed: ā naḥ nāvā matīnām yātam pārāya gantave  yuñjāthām aśvinā ratham
translated: Come to us in the boat of our thoughts, to cross over to the goal.🔽Yoke your chariot, O Asvins.

original: aritraṃ vāṃ divas pṛthu tīrthe sindhūnāṃ rathaḥ /
analyzed: aritram vām divaḥ pṛthu tīrthe sindhūnām rathaḥ
translated: Your plough is in the wide place of heaven, your chariot in the ford of the rivers,

original: dhiyā yuyujra indavaḥ //
analyzed: dhiyā yuyujre indavaḥ
translated: The drops have been yoked with thought.

original: divas kaṇvāsa indavo vasu sindhūnām pade /
analyzed: divaḥ kaṇvāsaḥ indavaḥ vasu sindhūnām pade
translated: The drops from the sky, the Kaṇvas, in the place of the treasures of the rivers,

original: svaṃ vavriṃ kuha dhitsathaḥ //
analyzed: svam vavrim kuha dhitsathaḥ
translated: What covering do you wish to assume?

original: abhūd u bhā u aṃśave hiraṇyam prati sūryaḥ /
analyzed: abhūt u bhās u aṃśave hiraṇyam prati sūryaḥ
translated: The gold has become for the share, for the sun,

original: vy akhyaj jihvayāsitaḥ //
analyzed: vi akhyat jihvayā asitaḥ
translated: The black one has spread out his tongue.

original: abhūd u pāram etave panthā ṛtasya sādhuyā /
analyzed: abhūt u pāram etave panthāḥ ṛtasya sādhuyā
translated: The path has become for the crossing over, for the accomplishment of the rite,

original: adarśi vi srutir divaḥ //
analyzed: adarśi vi srutiḥ divaḥ
translated: The course of the sky has been seen.

original: tattad id aśvinor avo jaritā prati bhūṣati /
analyzed: tat tat id aśvinoḥ avaḥ jaritā prati bhūṣati
translated: This and that praise of the two Aśvins is fulfilled,

original: made somasya pipratoḥ //
analyzed: made somasya pipratoḥ
translated: In the intoxication of the rejoicing Soma.

original: vāvasānā vivasvati somasya pītyā girā /
analyzed: vāvasānā vivasvati somasya pītyā girā
translated: Dwelling together in the light, with the drinking of the Soma, with the voice,

original: manuṣvac chambhū ā gatam //
analyzed: manuṣvat śambhū ā gatam
translated: Come, O Shambhu, like Manu.

original: yuvor uṣā anu śriyam parijmanor upācarat /
analyzed: yuvoḥ uṣāḥ anu śriyam parijmanoḥ upācarat
translated: The dawn has attended on the glory of you two, O you who travel in different directions,

original: ṛtā vanatho aktubhiḥ //
analyzed: ṛtā vanathaḥ aktubhiḥ
translated: You have fulfilled the truth with your rays.

original: ubhā pibatam aśvinobhā naḥ śarma yacchatam /
analyzed: ubhā pibatam aśvinā ubhā naḥ śarma yacchatam
translated: You two, O Aśvins, drink, you two grant us protection,

original: avidriyābhir ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: avidriyābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: With infallible aids.

original: ayaṃ vām madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ soma ṛtāvṛdhā /
analyzed: ayam vām madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ somaḥ ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: This is your most sweet mead, pressed Soma, O you who increase the truth.

original: tam aśvinā pibataṃ tiroahnyaṃ dhattaṃ ratnāni dāśuṣe //
analyzed: tam aśvinā pibatam tiroahnyam dhattam ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: Drink that, O Aśvins, for a whole day, bestow treasures on the worshipper.

original: trivandhureṇa trivṛtā supeśasā rathenā yātam aśvinā /
analyzed: tri vandhureṇa trivṛtā supeśasā rathena ā yātam aśvinā
translated: Come, O Aśvins, with your chariot having three seats, three horses, and beautiful wheels.

original: kaṇvāso vām brahma kṛṇvanty adhvare teṣāṃ su śṛṇutaṃ havam //
analyzed: kaṇvāsaḥ vām brahma kṛṇvanti adhvare teṣām su śṛṇutam havam
translated: The Kaṇvas, O ye Aṣvins, offer up their prayer: listen ye twain to their invocation.

original: aśvinā madhumattamam pātaṃ somam ṛtāvṛdhā /
analyzed: aśvinā madhumattamam pātam somam ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: Drink, O ye Aṣvins, of the sweetest Soma, ye who increase Law.

original: athādya dasrā vasu bibhratā rathe dāśvāṃsam upa gacchatam //
analyzed: atha adya dasrā vasu bibhratā rathe dāśvāṃsam upa gacchatam
translated: And now, O Wonder-Workers, bringing treasure in your car, come nigh to Dâṣvânṣa.

original: triṣadhasthe barhiṣi viśvavedasā madhvā yajñam mimikṣatam /
analyzed: triṣadhasthe barhiṣi viśva vedasā madhvā yajñam mimikṣatam
translated: On holy grass, O ye who know all wealth, anointed with the mead, make ye the sacrifice one whole.

original: kaṇvāso vāṃ sutasomā abhidyavo yuvāṃ havante aśvinā //
analyzed: kaṇvāsaḥ vām suta somāḥ abhidyavaḥ yuvām havante aśvinā
translated: The Kaṇvas, O ye Aṣvins, with their Soma pressed, with their uplifted hands invoke you.

original: yābhiḥ kaṇvam abhiṣṭibhiḥ prāvataṃ yuvam aśvinā /
analyzed: yābhiḥ kaṇvam abhiṣṭibhiḥ prāvatam yuvam aśvinā
translated: With those protections, O ye Aṣvins, wherewith ye guarded Kaṇva,

original: tābhiḥ ṣv asmāṃ avataṃ śubhas patī pātaṃ somam ṛtāvṛdhā //
analyzed: tābhiḥ su asmān avatam śubhaḥ patī pātam somam ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: Do ye, O Lords of splendour, protect us: drink the Soma, ye who increase Law.

original: sudāse dasrā vasu bibhratā rathe pṛkṣo vahatam aśvinā /
analyzed: sudāse dasrā vasu bibhratā rathe pṛkṣaḥ vahatam aśvinā
translated: O Wonder-Workers, bring to Sudâs, O Aṣvins, on your car that beareth treasure,

original: rayiṃ samudrād uta vā divas pary asme dhattam puruspṛham //
analyzed: rayim samudrāt uta vā divas pari asme dhattam puruspṛham
translated: Food from the sea or from the sky: bestow on us abundant wealth.

original: yan nāsatyā parāvati yad vā stho adhi turvaśe /
analyzed: yat nāsatyā parāvati yat vā sthaḥ adhi turvaśe
translated: If, O Nâsatyas, ye be far away, or if ye be with Turvaga,

original: ato rathena suvṛtā na ā gataṃ sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ //
analyzed: atas rathena suvṛtā naḥ ā gatam sākam sūryasya raśmibhiḥ
translated: Come hither unto us on that well-ordered car, together with the rays of Sûrya.

original: arvāñcā vāṃ saptayo 'dhvaraśriyo vahantu savaned upa /
analyzed: arvāñcā vām saptayaḥ dhvara śriyaḥ vahantu savanā id upa
translated: Let your seven harnessed horses bring you hither to the place of sacrifice and to the feast.

original: iṣam pṛñcantā sukṛte sudānava ā barhiḥ sīdataṃ narā //
analyzed: iṣam pṛñcantā su kṛte sudānavaḥ ā barhiḥ sīdatam narā
translated: Pouring out food for the good man, O bountiful ones, sit on the sacred grass, O heroes.

original: tena nāsatyā gataṃ rathena sūryatvacā /
analyzed: tena nāsatyā gatam rathena sūrya tvacā
translated: With that chariot, O Nāsatyas, come, O ye whose covering is the sun,

original: yena śaśvad ūhathur dāśuṣe vasu madhvaḥ somasya pītaye //
analyzed: yena śaśvat ūhathuḥ dāśuṣe vasu madhvaḥ somasya pītaye
translated: With which ye always bring wealth to the worshipper to drink the sweet Soma juice.

original: ukthebhir arvāg avase purūvasū arkaiś ca ni hvayāmahe /
analyzed: ukthebhiḥ arvāk avase purūvasū arkaiḥ ca ni hvayāmahe
translated: With lauds we invoke from afar, O ye rich in treasure, with songs,

original: śaśvat kaṇvānāṃ sadasi priye hi kaṃ somam papathur aśvinā //🔽saha vāmena na uṣo vy ucchā duhitar divaḥ /
analyzed: śaśvat kaṇvānām sadasi priye hi kam somam papathuḥ aśvinā  saha vāmena naḥ uṣaḥ vi uccha duhitar divaḥ
translated: For ever have the Aṣvins drunk Soma in the dear abode of the Kaṇvas.🔽With wealth, O Dawn, do thou rise up for us, O thou who art the daughter of the sky,

original: saha dyumnena bṛhatā vibhāvari rāyā devi dāsvatī //
analyzed: saha dyumnena bṛhatā vibhāvari rāyā devi dāsvatī
translated: With great glory, O thou who shinest afar, O goddess, with wealth, O thou who givest gifts.

original: aśvāvatīr gomatīr viśvasuvido bhūri cyavanta vastave /
analyzed: aśvāvatīḥ gomatīḥ viśva su vidaḥ bhūri cyavanta vastave
translated: Rich in horses, rich in cattle, finding all that is good, they come forth in abundance to aid.

original: ud īraya prati mā sūnṛtā uṣaś coda rādho maghonām //
analyzed: ud īraya prati mā sūnṛtāḥ uṣaḥ coda rādhaḥ maghonām
translated: Send forth to me, O Dawn, thy bounties, urge forward the gift of the wealthy ones.

original: uvāsoṣā ucchāc ca nu devī jīrā rathānām /
analyzed: uvāsa uṣāḥ ucchāt ca nu devī jīrā rathānām
translated: Dawn hath shone, and the goddess hath risen, the quivers of the chariots,

original: ye asyā ācaraṇeṣu dadhrire samudre na śravasyavaḥ //
analyzed: ye asyāḥ ācaraṇeṣu dadhrire samudre na śravasyavaḥ
translated: Those who have set themselves in her ways, like glories in the ocean.

original: uṣo ye te pra yāmeṣu yuñjate mano dānāya sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: uṣaḥ ye te pra yāmeṣu yuñjate manaḥ dānāya sūrayaḥ
translated: O Dawn, those princes who yoke their thoughts to thy starting-points for the bestowal of gifts,

original: atrāha tat kaṇva eṣāṃ kaṇvatamo nāma gṛṇāti nṛṇām //
analyzed: atra aha tat kaṇvaḥ eṣām kaṇvatamaḥ nāma gṛṇāti nṛṇām
translated: Herein Kaṇva extols their name, Kaṇva most like thee of men.

original: ā ghā yoṣeva sūnary uṣā yāti prabhuñjatī /🔽jarayantī vṛjanam padvad īyata ut pātayati pakṣiṇaḥ //🔽vi yā sṛjati samanaṃ vy arthinaḥ padaṃ na vety odatī /
analyzed: ā gha yoṣā iva sūnarī uṣāḥ yāti prabhuñjatī  jarayantī vṛjanam padvat īyate ud pātayati pakṣiṇaḥ  vi yā sṛjati samanam vi arthinaḥ padam na veti odatī
translated: Dawn comes like a young woman, like a maiden, spreading out,🔽Growing old, moving on, like a bird, she makes the people fly up.🔽She sends forth the gathering, she separates the seekers, she goes like a bird to her place.

original: vayo nakiṣ ṭe paptivāṃsa āsate vyuṣṭau vājinīvati //
analyzed: vayaḥ nakir te paptivāṃsaḥ āsate vyuṣṭau vājinīvati
translated: None of the birds can overtake her when she rises, O you who are rich in spoil.

original: eṣāyukta parāvataḥ sūryasyodayanād adhi /
analyzed: eṣā ayukta parāvataḥ sūryasya udayanāt adhi
translated: She is yoked to go to the distant place, after the rising of the sun.

original: śataṃ rathebhiḥ subhagoṣā iyaṃ vi yāty abhi mānuṣān //
analyzed: śatam rathebhiḥ subhagā uṣāḥ iyam vi yāti abhi mānuṣān
translated: The fortunate one goes forth with a hundred chariots, to the men.

original: viśvam asyā nānāma cakṣase jagaj jyotiṣ kṛṇoti sūnarī /🔽apa dveṣo maghonī duhitā diva uṣā ucchad apa sridhaḥ //🔽uṣa ā bhāhi bhānunā candreṇa duhitar divaḥ /
analyzed: viśvam asyāḥ nānāma cakṣase jagat jyotiḥ kṛṇoti sūnarī  apa dveṣaḥ maghonī duhitā divaḥ uṣāḥ ucchat apa sridhaḥ  uṣe ā bhāhi bhānunā candreṇa duhitar divaḥ
translated: She sees all the various things of the world, she makes the light shine, the good one.🔽The rich one, the daughter of the sky, dispels hatred, Dawn rises, dispelling the darkness.🔽O Dawn, shine with your light, O daughter of the sky with your radiant moon,

original: āvahantī bhūry asmabhyaṃ saubhagaṃ vyucchantī diviṣṭiṣu //
analyzed: āvahantī bhūri asmabhyam saubhagam vyucchantī diviṣṭiṣu
translated: Bringing us abundant good fortune, rising in the dawns.

original: viśvasya hi prāṇanaṃ jīvanaṃ tve vi yad ucchasi sūnari /
analyzed: viśvasya hi prāṇanam jīvanam tve vi yat ucchasi sūnari
translated: For in you is the breathing and life of the whole world, when you rise, O good one.

original: sā no rathena bṛhatā vibhāvari śrudhi citrāmaghe havam //
analyzed: sā naḥ rathena bṛhatā vibhāvari śrudhi citrāmaghe havam
translated: Listen to our call, O you who are rich in wonders, with your great chariot, O you who are rich in wondrous deeds.

original: uṣo vājaṃ hi vaṃsva yaś citro mānuṣe jane /
analyzed: uṣaḥ vājam hi vaṃsva yaḥ citraḥ mānuṣe jane
translated: O Dawn, win the prize that is wondrous among the human race.

original: tenā vaha sukṛto adhvarāṃ upa ye tvā gṛṇanti vahnayaḥ //
analyzed: tena ā vaha su kṛtaḥ adhvarān upa ye tvā gṛṇanti vahnayaḥ
translated: Therefore, O Agni, bring the well-performed sacrifices to those who praise you, O bearer of oblations.

original: viśvān devāṃ ā vaha somapītaye 'ntarikṣād uṣas tvam /
analyzed: viśvān devān ā vaha soma pītaye ntarikṣāt uṣaḥ tvam
translated: Bring all the gods to drink the Soma, O Dawn, from the atmosphere.

original: sāsmāsu dhā gomad aśvāvad ukthyam uṣo vājaṃ suvīryam //
analyzed: sā asmāsu dhāḥ gomat aśvāvat ukthyam uṣaḥ vājam su vīryam
translated: Grant us, O Dawn, wealth in cattle, in horses, worthy of praise, and strength with good heroism.

original: yasyā ruśanto arcayaḥ prati bhadrā adṛkṣata /
analyzed: yasyāḥ ruśantaḥ arcayaḥ prati bhadrāḥ adṛkṣata
translated: Whose bright rays and auspicious lights have been seen,

original: sā no rayiṃ viśvavāraṃ supeśasam uṣā dadātu sugmyam //
analyzed: sā naḥ rayim viśva vāram supeśasam uṣāḥ dadātu sugmyam
translated: May that Dawn grant us wealth with all good things, beautiful, and easy to obtain.

original: ye cid dhi tvām ṛṣayaḥ pūrva ūtaye juhūre 'vase mahi /🔽sā na stomāṃ abhi gṛṇīhi rādhasoṣaḥ śukreṇa śociṣā //🔽uṣo yad adya bhānunā vi dvārāv ṛṇavo divaḥ /
analyzed: ye cit hi tvām ṛṣayaḥ pūrve ūtaye juhūre vase mahi  sā naḥ stomān abhi gṛṇīhi rādhasā uṣaḥ śukreṇa śociṣā  uṣaḥ yat adya bhānunā vi dvārau ṛṇavaḥ divaḥ
translated: You whom the Rishis of old invoked for help and protection, for great favor,🔽Accept our praises, O Dawn, with your bright radiance and bounty.🔽O Dawn, when today with your light you open the doors of heaven,

original: pra no yacchatād avṛkam pṛthu cchardiḥ pra devi gomatīr iṣaḥ //🔽saṃ no rāyā bṛhatā viśvapeśasā mimikṣvā sam iḷābhir ā /
analyzed: pra naḥ yacchatāt avṛkam pṛthu chardiḥ pra devi gomatīḥ iṣaḥ  sam naḥ rāyā bṛhatā viśva peśasā mimikṣvā sam iḷābhiḥ ā
translated: Grant us a wide and peaceful dwelling, O goddess, and food with cattle.🔽Mix us with great wealth, with all good things, with nourishment, O Dawn.

original: saṃ dyumnena viśvaturoṣo mahi saṃ vājair vājinīvati //🔽uṣo bhadrebhir ā gahi divaś cid rocanād adhi /
analyzed: sam dyumnena viśva turā uṣaḥ mahi sam vājaiḥ vājinīvati  uṣaḥ bhadrebhiḥ ā gahi divaḥ cit rocanāt adhi
translated: With all-supporting glory, O Dawn, with strength, O you who are rich in strength.🔽O Dawn, come with your auspicious gifts even from the light of heaven.

original: vahantv aruṇapsava upa tvā somino gṛham //
analyzed: vahantu aruṇapsavaḥ upa tvā sominaḥ gṛham
translated: Let the ruddy ones bring you to the house of the Soma-pressers.

original: supeśasaṃ sukhaṃ rathaṃ yam adhyasthā uṣas tvam /
analyzed: supeśasam sukham ratham yam adhyasthāḥ uṣaḥ tvam
translated: The well-formed, pleasant chariot which you have mounted, O Dawn,

original: tenā suśravasaṃ janam prāvādya duhitar divaḥ //
analyzed: tena su śravasam janam prāva adya duhitar divaḥ
translated: By that, O daughter of heaven, you have proclaimed the people who are to be well-known.

original: vayaś cit te patatriṇo dvipac catuṣpad arjuni /
analyzed: vayaḥ cit te patatriṇaḥ dvipad catuṣpad arjuni
translated: Even the birds of your feathers, and the two-footed and four-footed, O green one,

original: uṣaḥ prārann ṛtūṃr anu divo antebhyas pari //
analyzed: uṣaḥ prāran ṛtūṃr anu divaḥ antebhyaḥ pari
translated: O Dawn, you have set in motion the seasons, from the ends of the sky.

original: vyucchantī hi raśmibhir viśvam ābhāsi rocanam /
analyzed: vyucchantī hi raśmibhiḥ viśvam ābhāsi rocanam
translated: For shining with your rays, you illuminate the whole bright expanse.

original: tāṃ tvām uṣar vasūyavo gīrbhiḥ kaṇvā ahūṣata //
analyzed: tām tvām uṣar vasūyavaḥ gīrbhiḥ kaṇvāḥ ahūṣata
translated: You, O Dawn, the Kanvas have invoked with songs, seeking wealth.

original: ud u tyaṃ jātavedasaṃ devaṃ vahanti ketavaḥ /
analyzed: ud u tyam jātavedasam devam vahanti ketavaḥ
translated: The banners carry upward that Jātavedas, the god,

original: dṛśe viśvāya sūryam //
analyzed: dṛśe viśvāya sūryam
translated: The sun, for all to see.

original: apa tye tāyavo yathā nakṣatrā yanty aktubhiḥ /
analyzed: apa tye tāyavaḥ yathā nakṣatrāḥ yanti aktubhiḥ
translated: Those rays of yours move like the Tādavas, the stars, with the rays,

original: sūrāya viśvacakṣase //
analyzed: sūrāya viśva cakṣase
translated: To the sun, the all-seeing one.

original: adṛśram asya ketavo vi raśmayo janāṃ anu /
analyzed: adṛśram asya ketavaḥ vi raśmayaḥ janān anu
translated: The banners of this one are seen, the rays move along the people,

original: bhrājanto agnayo yathā //🔽taraṇir viśvadarśato jyotiṣkṛd asi sūrya /
analyzed: bhrājantaḥ agnayaḥ yathā  taraṇiḥ viśva darśataḥ jyotiṣkṛt asi sūrya
translated: Shining like fires.🔽You are the swift one, seen by all, the maker of light, O sun,

original: viśvam ā bhāsi rocanam //
analyzed: viśvam ā bhāsi rocanam
translated: You illuminate the whole bright expanse.

original: pratyaṅ devānāṃ viśaḥ pratyaṅṅ ud eṣi mānuṣān /
analyzed: pratyaṅ devānām viśaḥ pratyaṅ ud eṣi mānuṣān
translated: To the west of the people of the gods, to the west you rise to the humans,

original: pratyaṅ viśvaṃ svar dṛśe //
analyzed: pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe
translated: To the west to see the whole heaven.

original: yenā pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantaṃ janāṃ anu /
analyzed: yena pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantam janān anu
translated: By what eye of yours, O purifying one, you see the moving people,

original: tvaṃ varuṇa paśyasi //
analyzed: tvam varuṇa paśyasi
translated: You, O Varuṇa, see.

original: vi dyām eṣi rajas pṛthv ahā mimāno aktubhiḥ /
analyzed: vi dyām eṣi rajaḥ pṛthu ahā mimānaḥ aktubhiḥ
translated: You go through the vast expanse of the sky, measuring with your rays.

original: paśyañ janmāni sūrya //
analyzed: paśyam janmāni sūrya
translated: Beholding the births, O Sun.

original: sapta tvā harito rathe vahanti deva sūrya /
analyzed: sapta tvā haritaḥ rathe vahanti deva sūrya
translated: Seven bay horses draw your chariot, O god Surya,

original: śociṣkeśaṃ vicakṣaṇa //
analyzed: śociṣkeśam vicakṣaṇa
translated: You whose hair is radiant, O all-seeing one.

original: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūro rathasya naptyaḥ /
analyzed: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūraḥ rathasya naptyaḥ
translated: The seven pure mares are yoked, the granddaughters of the sun's chariot.

original: tābhir yāti svayuktibhiḥ //
analyzed: tābhiḥ yāti sva yuktibhiḥ
translated: By them he goes, by those that are well-yoked.

original: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari jyotiṣ paśyanta uttaram /
analyzed: ud vayam tamasaḥ pari jyotiḥ paśyantaḥ uttaram
translated: We have risen above the darkness, beholding the light above.

original: devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam //
analyzed: devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam
translated: We have gone to the god Surya, the light that is most excellent.

original: udyann adya mitramaha ārohann uttarāṃ divam /
analyzed: udyan adya mitra mahaḥ ārohan uttarām divam
translated: Rising today, O great friend, ascending to the highest heaven,

original: hṛdrogam mama sūrya harimāṇaṃ ca nāśaya //
analyzed: hṛd rogam mama sūrya harimāṇam ca nāśaya
translated: Remove from me, O Sun, the pain in the heart and the jaundice.

original: śukeṣu me harimāṇaṃ ropaṇākāsu dadhmasi /
analyzed: śukeṣu me harimāṇam ropaṇākāsu dadhmasi
translated: The jaundice that is in my parrots, we place in the ropanaka plants.

original: atho hāridraveṣu me harimāṇaṃ ni dadhmasi //
analyzed: atha u hāridraveṣu me harimāṇam ni dadhmasi
translated: And the jaundice that is in me, we place in the haridra plants.

original: ud agād ayam ādityo viśvena sahasā saha /🔽dviṣantam mahyaṃ randhayan mo ahaṃ dviṣate radham //
analyzed: ud agāt ayam ādityaḥ viśvena sahasā saha  dviṣantam mahyam randhayan mā u aham dviṣate radham
translated: This sun has risen with all his might and power.🔽Leading the enemy to me, may I not lead the enemy to him.

original: abhi tyam meṣam puruhūtam ṛgmiyam indraṃ gīrbhir madatā vasvo arṇavam /
analyzed: abhi tyam meṣam puru hūtam ṛgmiyam indram gīrbhiḥ madata vasvaḥ arṇavam
translated: To that invoked Indra, the ram, the worthy of praise, let us gladden with songs, with the waves of wealth, him who is to be praised with songs.

original: yasya dyāvo na vicaranti mānuṣā bhuje maṃhiṣṭham abhi vipram arcata //
analyzed: yasya dyāvaḥ na vicaranti mānuṣāḥ bhuje maṃhiṣṭham abhi vipram arcata
translated: Whose days the men do not transgress. Extol the most bountiful sage.

original: abhīm avanvan svabhiṣṭim ūtayo 'ntarikṣaprāṃ taviṣībhir āvṛtam /
analyzed: abhi īm avanvan su abhiṣṭim ūtayaḥ ntarikṣa prām taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtam
translated: They have followed him, the helper, the protector, who dwells in the atmosphere, surrounded by powers.

original: indraṃ dakṣāsa ṛbhavo madacyutaṃ śatakratuṃ javanī sūnṛtāruhat //🔽tvaṃ gotram aṅgirobhyo 'vṛṇor apotātraye śatadureṣu gātuvit /
analyzed: indram dakṣāsaḥ ṛbhavaḥ mada cyutam śatakratum javanī sūnṛtā āruhat  tvam gotram aṅgirobhyaḥ vṛṇoḥ apa uta atraye śata dureṣu gātu vid
translated: The skillful ones have followed Indra, the one who delights in the intoxicating drink, the one with a hundred powers, the one who delights in truth.🔽You have given the cattle to the Angiras, the one who knows the way to the three Apas, the one with a hundred good horses.

original: sasena cid vimadāyāvaho vasv ājāv adriṃ vāvasānasya nartayan //
analyzed: sasena cit vimadāya avahaḥ vasū ājau adrim vāvasānasya nartayan
translated: You have brought even the intoxicated one to the wealth, shaking the mountain of the one who dwells in the battle.

original: tvam apām apidhānāvṛṇor apādhārayaḥ parvate dānumad vasu /
analyzed: tvam apām apidhānā avṛṇoḥ apādhārayaḥ parvate dānumat vasu
translated: You have closed the doors of the waters, you have held back the water, the wealth that delights in the mountain.

original: vṛtraṃ yad indra śavasāvadhīr ahim ād it sūryaṃ divy ārohayo dṛśe //
analyzed: vṛtram yat indra śavasā avadhīḥ ahim āt id sūryam divi ārohayaḥ dṛśe
translated: When you, O Indra, have killed Vritra, the serpent, then you have raised the sun to the sky to be seen.

original: tvam māyābhir apa māyino 'dhamaḥ svadhābhir ye adhi śuptāv ajuhvata /
analyzed: tvam māyābhiḥ apa māyinaḥ dhamaḥ svadhābhiḥ ye adhi śuptau ajuhvata
translated: You have defeated the deceitful ones with your illusions, those who have offered oblations in the frying pan with their own powers.

original: tvam pipror nṛmaṇaḥ prārujaḥ puraḥ pra ṛjiśvānaṃ dasyuhatyeṣv āvitha //
analyzed: tvam piproḥ nṛmaṇaḥ prārujaḥ puraḥ pra ṛjiśvānam dasyu hatyeṣu āvitha
translated: You have torn down the cities of Pipru, the delight of men, you have helped Riji to victory in the slaying of the Dasyus.

original: tvaṃ kutsaṃ śuṣṇahatyeṣv āvithārandhayo 'tithigvāya śambaram /
analyzed: tvam kutsam śuṣṇa hatyeṣu āvitha arandhayaḥ tithigvāya śambaram
