translated: You have helped Kuts in the slaying of Sushna, you have broken Shambara for Atithigva.

original: mahāntaṃ cid arbudaṃ ni kramīḥ padā sanād eva dasyuhatyāya jajñiṣe //🔽tve viśvā taviṣī sadhryag ghitā tava rādhaḥ somapīthāya harṣate /
analyzed: mahāntam cit arbudam ni kramīḥ padā sanāt eva dasyu hatyāya jajñiṣe  tve viśvā taviṣī sadhryak ghitā tava rādhaḥ soma pīthāya harṣate
translated: Thou treadest down even the great heap of Dasyus with thy foot. From of old thou wast born for the slaying of the Dasyus.🔽In thee is all power, O Indra, in thee is all bounty. Thy gift delights in the drinking of Soma.

original: tava vajraś cikite bāhvor hito vṛścā śatror ava viśvāni vṛṣṇyā //
analyzed: tava vajraḥ cikite bāhvoḥ hitaḥ vṛśca śatroḥ ava viśvāni vṛṣṇyā
translated: Thy bolt is seen in thy arms, O Indra, placed (there) for the slaying of the foe, and all manly powers.

original: vi jānīhy āryān ye ca dasyavo barhiṣmate randhayā śāsad avratān /
analyzed: vi jānīhi āryān ye ca dasyavaḥ barhiṣmate randhaya śāsat avratān
translated: Discern the noble ones and those who are Dasyus. Give to the worshipper the unrestrained who are without vows.

original: śākī bhava yajamānasya coditā viśvet tā te sadhamādeṣu cākana //🔽anuvratāya randhayann apavratān ābhūbhir indraḥ śnathayann anābhuvaḥ /
analyzed: śākī bhava yajamānasya coditā viśvā id tā te sadhamādeṣu cākana  anuvratāya randhayan apavratān ābhūbhiḥ indraḥ śnathayan an ābhuvaḥ
translated: Be strong, urged on by the sacrificer. May all these be delighted with thy drinking-feasts.🔽Giving to him who follows the right, to the unrestrained, Indra, destroying those who are without support by means of his powers,

original: vṛddhasya cid vardhato dyām inakṣata stavāno vamro vi jaghāna saṃdihaḥ //
analyzed: vṛddhasya cit vardhataḥ dyām inakṣata stavānaḥ vamraḥ vi jaghāna saṃdihaḥ
translated: Thou hast penetrated even the growing heaven of the aged. The strong one, praised, has slain the one who was in the way.

original: takṣad yat ta uśanā sahasā saho vi rodasī majmanā bādhate śavaḥ /
analyzed: takṣat yat te uśanā sahasā sahaḥ vi rodasī majmanā bādhate śavaḥ
translated: When Uśanâ has fashioned thy strength with might, thy power fills the two worlds with its greatness.

original: ā tvā vātasya nṛmaṇo manoyuja ā pūryamāṇam avahann abhi śravaḥ //
analyzed: ā tvā vātasya nṛmaṇaḥ manaḥ yujaḥ ā pūryamāṇam avahan abhi śravaḥ
translated: O thou who art yoked to the mind of the wind, the men have brought thee hither, O Indra, who art filled (with Soma), to (the place of) fame.

original: mandiṣṭa yad uśane kāvye sacāṃ indro vaṅkū vaṅkutarādhi tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: mandiṣṭa yat uśane kāvye sacā indraḥ vaṅkū vaṅkutarā adhi tiṣṭhati
translated: When thou hast rejoiced in the companionship of Uśanâ in the matter of poetry, Indra, the crooked one, stands more crooked than the crooked one.

original: ugro yayiṃ nir apaḥ srotasāsṛjad vi śuṣṇasya dṛṃhitā airayat puraḥ //
analyzed: ugraḥ yayim niḥ apaḥ srotasā asṛjat vi śuṣṇasya dṛṃhitāḥ airayat puraḥ
translated: The fierce one has sent forth the waters with a current, and has loosened the bolts of the dried-up one's forts.

original: ā smā rathaṃ vṛṣapāṇeṣu tiṣṭhasi śāryātasya prabhṛtā yeṣu mandase /🔽indra yathā sutasomeṣu cākano 'narvāṇaṃ ślokam ā rohase divi //
analyzed: ā smā ratham vṛṣa pāṇeṣu tiṣṭhasi śāryātasya prabhṛtāḥ yeṣu mandase  indra yathā suta someṣu cākanaḥ narvāṇam ślokam ā rohase divi
translated: You sit in the chariots in the Vrishâpana region, in which you delight, O Sharvâta's son.🔽O Indra, as you rejoice in the Soma-pressings, you ascend the hymn that is not to be surpassed in heaven.

original: adadā arbhām mahate vacasyave kakṣīvate vṛcayām indra sunvate /
analyzed: adadāḥ arbhām mahate vacasyave kakṣīvate vṛcayām indra sunvate
translated: You gave the young one to the great Vakshya, to Kakshivat, the presser of Soma, O Indra.

original: menābhavo vṛṣaṇaśvasya sukrato viśvet tā te savaneṣu pravācyā //
analyzed: menā abhavaḥ vṛṣaṇaśvasya su krato viśvā id tā te savaneṣu pravācyā
translated: The son of Rishana, O you of great wisdom, is to be praised by all at your libations.

original: indro aśrāyi sudhyo nireke pajreṣu stomo duryo na yūpaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ aśrāyi su dhyaḥ nireke pajreṣu stomaḥ duryaḥ na yūpaḥ
translated: Indra has taken his seat in the Sudhya, in the Nirvâpa, in the Pajras, like a Duryo post for the praise.

original: aśvayur gavyū rathayur vasūyur indra id rāyaḥ kṣayati prayantā //
analyzed: aśvayuḥ gavyuḥ rathayuḥ vasūyuḥ indraḥ id rāyaḥ kṣayati prayantā
translated: Indra, the bestower of horses, cows, chariots, and wealth, distributes riches, the supporter.

original: idaṃ namo vṛṣabhāya svarāje satyaśuṣmāya tavase 'vāci /
analyzed: idam namaḥ vṛṣabhāya sva rāje satya śuṣmāya tavase vāci
translated: This homage I offer to the strong one, the king of the self-shining ones, to the one with true strength, to the mighty one.

original: asminn indra vṛjane sarvavīrāḥ smat sūribhis tava śarman syāma //
analyzed: asmin indra vṛjane sarva vīrāḥ smat sūribhiḥ tava śarman syāma
translated: In this enclosure, O Indra, may we be with our princes, all-heroic, in your protection.

original: tyaṃ su meṣam mahayā svarvidaṃ śataṃ yasya subhvaḥ sākam īrate /
analyzed: tyam su meṣam mahayā svar vidam śatam yasya su bhvaḥ sākam īrate
translated: That ram, who finds the light, I magnify, whose hundred strong ones move together.

original: atyaṃ na vājaṃ havanasyadaṃ ratham endraṃ vavṛtyām avase suvṛktibhiḥ //
analyzed: atyam na vājam havanasyadam ratham ā indram vavṛtyām avase suvṛktibhiḥ
translated: I would turn hither Indra, the chariot that goes to the call, the steed, with fair praises, for help.

original: sa parvato na dharuṇeṣv acyutaḥ sahasramūtis taviṣīṣu vāvṛdhe /🔽indro yad vṛtram avadhīn nadīvṛtam ubjann arṇāṃsi jarhṛṣāṇo andhasā //
analyzed: sa parvataḥ na dharuṇeṣu acyutaḥ sahasram ūtiḥ taviṣīṣu vāvṛdhe  indraḥ yat vṛtram avadhīt nadīvṛtam ubjan arṇāṃsi jarhṛṣāṇaḥ andhasā
translated: He is unshaken on his bases like a mountain, he has grown in strength in his thousandfold aids.🔽When Indra slew Vr̥itra who compassed the stream, and with his juice made glad the bursting waters.

original: sa hi dvaro dvariṣu vavra ūdhani candrabudhno madavṛddho manīṣibhiḥ /
analyzed: sa hi dvaraḥ dvariṣu vavraḥ ūdhani candra budhnaḥ mada vṛddhaḥ manīṣibhiḥ
translated: He, in the two worlds, in the two worlds' depths, the wise have stablished him, the wise have made him grow, him who hath Chandra for his seat, him who is strengthened by the gladdening drink.

original: indraṃ tam ahve svapasyayā dhiyā maṃhiṣṭharātiṃ sa hi paprir andhasaḥ //
analyzed: indram tam ahve su apasyayā dhiyā maṃhiṣṭha rātim sa hi papriḥ andhasaḥ
translated: I call on him with a thought that shows itself, on Indra, on the most munificent giver, for he is the bestower of the juice.

original: ā yam pṛṇanti divi sadmabarhiṣaḥ samudraṃ na subhvaḥ svā abhiṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: ā yam pṛṇanti divi sadma barhiṣaḥ samudram na su bhvaḥ svāḥ abhiṣṭayaḥ
translated: Him whom the grass-sitters in the seat of heaven fill full, as the strong ones fill the sea, their own protector.

original: taṃ vṛtrahatye anu tasthur ūtayaḥ śuṣmā indram avātā ahrutapsavaḥ //
analyzed: tam vṛtra hatye anu tasthuḥ ūtayaḥ śuṣmāḥ indram a vātāḥ ahrutapsavaḥ
translated: His aids have followed him in slaying Vr̥itra, his powers, O Indra, his unerring missiles.

original: abhi svavṛṣṭim made asya yudhyato raghvīr iva pravaṇe sasrur ūtayaḥ /🔽indro yad vajrī dhṛṣamāṇo andhasā bhinad valasya paridhīṃr iva tritaḥ //
analyzed: abhi sva vṛṣṭim made asya yudhyataḥ raghvīḥ iva pravaṇe sasruḥ ūtayaḥ  indraḥ yat vajrī dhṛṣamāṇaḥ andhasā bhinat valasya paridhīṃr iva tritaḥ
translated: His aids have flowed to him, as to a steep descent, in the wild joy of him who spreadeth out his rain.🔽When Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, with his juice, daring, hath burst the barriers of the foe, as Trita did.

original: parīṃ ghṛṇā carati titviṣe śavo 'po vṛtvī rajaso budhnam āśayat /
analyzed: pari īm ghṛṇā carati titviṣe śavaḥ paḥ vṛtvī rajasaḥ budhnam āśayat
translated: He moveth in his own moisture, his strength shineth forth: he hath encompassed the waters, and hath laid the depth of the region as a foundation.

original: vṛtrasya yat pravaṇe durgṛbhiśvano nijaghantha hanvor indra tanyatum //
analyzed: vṛtrasya yat pravaṇe durgṛbhiśvanaḥ nijaghantha hanvoḥ indra tanyatum
translated: When thou didst slay in the difficult-to-reach cavern of Vṛtra, O Indra, the thunder in his jaws.

original: hradaṃ na hi tvā nyṛṣanty ūrmayo brahmāṇīndra tava yāni vardhanā /
analyzed: hradam na hi tvā nyṛṣanti ūrmayaḥ brahmāṇi indra tava yāni vardhanā
translated: The waves do not overwhelm thee, O Indra, as they do a lake, thy own exaltations, O Brahman.

original: tvaṣṭā cit te yujyaṃ vāvṛdhe śavas tatakṣa vajram abhibhūtyojasam //🔽jaghanvāṃ u haribhiḥ sambhṛtakratav indra vṛtram manuṣe gātuyann apaḥ /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā cit te yujyam vāvṛdhe śavaḥ tatakṣa vajram abhibhūti ojasam  jaghanvām u haribhiḥ sambhṛta krato indra vṛtram manuṣe gātuyan apaḥ
translated: Even Tvaṣṭar increased the strength that is to be yoked by thee; he fashioned the thunderbolt with overwhelming might.

original: ayacchathā bāhvor vajram āyasam adhārayo divy ā sūryaṃ dṛśe //
analyzed: ayacchathāḥ bāhvoḥ vajram āyasam adhārayaḥ divi ā sūryam dṛśe
translated: With thy two thighs, O Indra, whose will is fulfilled by the two bay horses, thou didst hold the thunderbolt of iron in thy arms, for the sake of Manu, when thou didst lead the waters to the sky, to the sun, to be seen.

original: bṛhat svaścandram amavad yad ukthyam akṛṇvata bhiyasā rohaṇaṃ divaḥ /
analyzed: bṛhat svaścandram amavat yat ukthyam akṛṇvata bhiyasā rohaṇam divaḥ
translated: When they made the lofty, very bright, hymn-worthy (thunderbolt), the ascent of the sky through fear,

original: yan mānuṣapradhanā indram ūtayaḥ svar nṛṣāco maruto 'madann anu //🔽dyauś cid asyāmavāṃ aheḥ svanād ayoyavīd bhiyasā vajra indra te /
analyzed: yat mānuṣa pradhanāḥ indram ūtayaḥ svar nṛṣācaḥ marutaḥ madan anu  dyauḥ cit asya amavān aheḥ svanāt ayoyavīt bhiyasā vajre indra te
translated: When the men's leaders, the Maruts, the singers among men, were intoxicated with the call to Indra,🔽Even the sky was afraid of the roar of this serpent; the thunderbolt, O Indra, trembled with fear.

original: vṛtrasya yad badbadhānasya rodasī made sutasya śavasābhinac chiraḥ //
analyzed: vṛtrasya yat badbadhānasya rodasī made sutasya śavasā abhinat śiraḥ
translated: When thou didst cleave asunder the head of Vṛtra, as he was binding together the two worlds, with the might of the pressed (Soma), in the rapture (of battle).

original: yad in nv indra pṛthivī daśabhujir ahāni viśvā tatananta kṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: yat id nu indra pṛthivī daśabhujiḥ ahāni viśvā tatananta kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: If, O Indra, the ten-breasted earth, the days, all the cultivated fields were to stretch out (to reach thee),

original: atrāha te maghavan viśrutaṃ saho dyām anu śavasā barhaṇā bhuvat //🔽tvam asya pāre rajaso vyomanaḥ svabhūtyojā avase dhṛṣanmanaḥ /
analyzed: atra aha te maghavan viśrutam sahaḥ dyām anu śavasā barhaṇā bhuvat  tvam asya pāre rajasaḥ vyomanaḥ sva bhūti ojāḥ avase dhṛṣat manaḥ
translated: Here they say to thee, O Maghavan, thy well-known strength hath become vast, O Indra, through thy might, in accordance with the heaven.🔽Thou, on the other side of this expanse of the realm of space, with thy self-existent might, with a bold mind, for help,

original: cakṛṣe bhūmim pratimānam ojaso 'paḥ svaḥ paribhūr eṣy ā divam //
analyzed: cakṛṣe bhūmim pratimānam ojasā paḥ svar paribhūḥ eṣi ā divam
translated: Hast drawn the earth as a measure for thy strength. Thou hast gone to the waters, to the light, to the sky, as the overcomer.

original: tvam bhuvaḥ pratimānam pṛthivyā ṛṣvavīrasya bṛhataḥ patir bhūḥ /
analyzed: tvam bhuvaḥ pratimānam pṛthivyāḥ ṛṣva vīrasya bṛhataḥ patiḥ bhūḥ
translated: Thou art the measure of the earth, of the wide, lofty earth, the lord of the mighty hero.

original: viśvam āprā antarikṣam mahitvā satyam addhā nakir anyas tvāvān //
analyzed: viśvam āprāḥ antarikṣam mahitvā satyam addhā nakir anyaḥ tvāvān
translated: Thou hast filled the whole wide air with thy greatness. Verily, none other than thou is equal to thee.

original: na yasya dyāvāpṛthivī anu vyaco na sindhavo rajaso antam ānaśuḥ /
analyzed: na yasya dyāvāpṛthivī anu vyacaḥ na sindhavaḥ rajasaḥ antam ānaśuḥ
translated: Whose expanse neither the heavens nor the earth, nor the rivers have reached to the end of the realm of space.

original: nota svavṛṣṭim made asya yudhyata eko anyac cakṛṣe viśvam ānuṣak //
analyzed: na uta sva vṛṣṭim made asya yudhyataḥ ekaḥ anyat cakṛṣe viśvam ānuṣak
translated: Nor in the intoxication of his own rain did he fight against thee. Alone thou hast done all this in due order.

original: ārcann atra marutaḥ sasminn ājau viśve devāso amadann anu tvā /🔽vṛtrasya yad bhṛṣṭimatā vadhena ni tvam indra praty ānaṃ jaghantha //
analyzed: ārcan atra marutaḥ sasmin ājau viśve devāsaḥ amadan anu tvā  vṛtrasya yat bhṛṣṭimatā vadhena ni tvam indra prati ānam jaghantha
translated: The Maruts, calling here, in this battle, all the gods have been delighted with thee,🔽When thou, O Indra, with the slaying of Vṛtra, who was to be slain, didst smite down the foe.

original: ny ū ṣu vācam pra mahe bharāmahe gira indrāya sadane vivasvataḥ /
analyzed: ni u su vācam pra mahe bharāmahe giraḥ indrāya sadane vivasvataḥ
translated: We will bring forth our speech, our songs, to the great one, to Indra, in the abode of Vivasvat.

original: nū cid dhi ratnaṃ sasatām ivāvidan na duṣṭutir draviṇodeṣu śasyate //
analyzed: nu cit hi ratnam sasatām iva avidat na duṣṭutiḥ draviṇaḥ deṣu śasyate
translated: Now indeed they know the treasure as if of the good, not a bad eulogy is praised among the givers of wealth.

original: duro aśvasya dura indra gor asi duro yavasya vasuna inas patiḥ /
analyzed: duraḥ aśvasya duraḥ indra goḥ asi duraḥ yavasya vasunaḥ inaḥ patiḥ
translated: You are the finder of the horse, O Indra, the finder of the cow, the finder of the barley, the lord of wealth.

original: śikṣānaraḥ pradivo akāmakarśanaḥ sakhā sakhibhyas tam idaṃ gṛṇīmasi //
analyzed: śikṣā naraḥ pradivaḥ a kāma karśanaḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ tam idam gṛṇīmasi
translated: The man to be trained, the one who fulfills desires from the sky, the friend to friends, we praise this of you.

original: śacīva indra purukṛd dyumattama taved idam abhitaś cekite vasu /
analyzed: śacīvas indra puru kṛt dyumattama tava id idam abhitas cekite vasu
translated: O Indra, the most glorious of the bountiful, the most splendid, this wealth is sought after by you on all sides.

original: ataḥ saṃgṛbhyābhibhūta ā bhara mā tvāyato jarituḥ kāmam ūnayīḥ //
analyzed: atas saṃgṛbhya abhibhūtaḥ ā bhara mā tvāyataḥ jarituḥ kāmam ūnayīḥ
translated: Having gathered it from there, O conqueror, bring it. Do not disappoint the desire of the praising one who is not greedy.

original: ebhir dyubhiḥ sumanā ebhir indubhir nirundhāno amatiṃ gobhir aśvinā /
analyzed: ebhiḥ dyubhiḥ sumanāḥ ebhiḥ indubhiḥ nirundhānaḥ amatim gobhiḥ aśvinā
translated: With these powers, O Indra, with these drops of Soma, overcoming misfortune with cattle and horses,

original: indreṇa dasyuṃ darayanta indubhir yutadveṣasaḥ sam iṣā rabhemahi //
analyzed: indreṇa dasyum darayantaḥ indubhiḥ yuta dveṣasaḥ sam iṣā rabhemahi
translated: With Indra, destroying the Dasyus with the drops, united in hatred, may we obtain food.

original: sam indra rāyā sam iṣā rabhemahi saṃ vājebhiḥ puruścandrair abhidyubhiḥ /
analyzed: sam indra rāyā sam iṣā rabhemahi sam vājebhiḥ puru ścandraiḥ abhidyubhiḥ
translated: O Indra, may we obtain wealth and food with you, and with you abundant treasures, splendid and radiant.

original: saṃ devyā pramatyā vīraśuṣmayā goagrayāśvāvatyā rabhemahi //
analyzed: sam devyā pramatyā vīra śuṣmayā go agrayā aśvāvatyā rabhemahi
translated: May we obtain with the divine inspiration, with the strength of heroes, with the foremost of cows, with horses, and with goats.

original: te tvā madā amadan tāni vṛṣṇyā te somāso vṛtrahatyeṣu satpate /
analyzed: te tvā madāḥ amadan tāni vṛṣṇyā te somāsaḥ vṛtra hatyeṣu satpate
translated: Those intoxicating drinks have intoxicated you, those manly powers, those Soma juices, O lord of the good, in the slaying of Vrtra.

original: yat kārave daśa vṛtrāṇy aprati barhiṣmate ni sahasrāṇi barhayaḥ //
analyzed: yat kārave daśa vṛtrāṇi aprati barhiṣmate ni sahasrāṇi barhayaḥ
translated: When thou, O Indra, didst give Karava ten unconquered Vr̥itras, and to the worshipper a thousand forts.

original: yudhā yudham upa ghed eṣi dhṛṣṇuyā purā puraṃ sam idaṃ haṃsy ojasā /
analyzed: yudhā yudham upa gha id eṣi dhṛṣṇuyā purā puram sam idam haṃsi ojasā
translated: In every fight thou goest forth to battle with thy might, and from each fort thou drivest them away.

original: namyā yad indra sakhyā parāvati nibarhayo namuciṃ nāma māyinam //
analyzed: namyā yat indra sakhyā parāvati nibarhayaḥ namucim nāma māyinam
translated: When, O Indra, thou, the adorable, far away, didst slayst Namuci the sorcerer.

original: tvaṃ karañjam uta parṇayaṃ vadhīs tejiṣṭhayātithigvasya vartanī /
analyzed: tvam karañjam uta parṇayam vadhīḥ tejiṣṭhayā atithigvasya vartanī
translated: Thou slewest Karaj and Parnay with the sharpest bolt of Atithigva.

original: tvaṃ śatā vaṅgṛdasyābhinat puro 'nānudaḥ pariṣūtā ṛjiśvanā //
analyzed: tvam śatā vaṅgṛdasya abhinat puraḥ nā anudaḥ pariṣūtāḥ ṛjiśvanā
translated: Thou with the unresisted bolt of Rijiṣvan smotest the hundred forts of Vaṅgṛida.

original: tvam etāñ janarājño dvir daśābandhunā suśravasopajagmuṣaḥ /🔽ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrā navatiṃ nava śruto ni cakreṇa rathyā duṣpadāvṛṇak //
analyzed: tvam etām jana rājñaḥ dvis daśa abandhunā suśravasā upajagmuṣaḥ  ṣaṣṭim sahasrā navatim nava śrutaḥ ni cakreṇa rathyā duṣpadā avṛṇak
translated: These, the two ten of the king of the people, who came to thee for help, O thou of fair renown.🔽With thy wheel, O Indra, thou didst crush the two Dushparadas, sixty thousand and ninety-nine.

original: tvam āvitha suśravasaṃ tavotibhis tava trāmabhir indra tūrvayāṇam /
analyzed: tvam āvitha suśravasam tava ūtibhiḥ tava trāmabhiḥ indra tūrvayāṇam
translated: Thou holpest Sushravâ with thy succours, and Tûrvayâṇa with thy gracious favours.

original: tvam asmai kutsam atithigvam āyum mahe rājñe yūne arandhanāyaḥ //
analyzed: tvam asmai kutsam atithigvam āyum mahe rājñe yūne arandhanāyaḥ
translated: Thou gavest to the mighty king, the young, the blameless, Kutsa, Âtithigva, and Âyu.

original: ya udṛcīndra devagopāḥ sakhāyas te śivatamā asāma /
analyzed: yaḥ udṛci indra deva gopāḥ sakhāyaḥ te śivatamāḥ asāma
translated: O Indra, we who have been watched by thee, the God-protected friends, would fain be most auspicious to thee.

original: tvāṃ stoṣāma tvayā suvīrā drāghīya āyuḥ prataraṃ dadhānāḥ //
analyzed: tvām stoṣāma tvayā su vīrāḥ drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram dadhānāḥ
translated: Thee we will praise, with thee for our aid, O Indra, prolonging our life, bestowing easy access.

original: mā no asmin maghavan pṛtsv aṃhasi nahi te antaḥ śavasaḥ parīṇaśe /
analyzed: mā naḥ asmin maghavan pṛtsu aṃhasi nahi te antaḥ śavasaḥ parīṇaśe
translated: Do not oppress us in this battle, O bountiful one, for none can withstand the impulse of thy strength.

original: akrandayo nadyo roruvad vanā kathā na kṣoṇīr bhiyasā sam ārata //
analyzed: akrandayaḥ nadyaḥ roruvat vanā kathā na kṣoṇīḥ bhiyasā sam ārata
translated: The rivers have cried out, the woods have roared. Why have the regions of the earth trembled with fear?

original: arcā śakrāya śākine śacīvate śṛṇvantam indram mahayann abhi ṣṭuhi /
analyzed: arca śakrāya śākine śacīvate śṛṇvantam indram mahayan abhi stuhi
translated: Praise Indra, the mighty one, the powerful, exalting him, listening to him.

original: yo dhṛṣṇunā śavasā rodasī ubhe vṛṣā vṛṣatvā vṛṣabho nyṛñjate //
analyzed: yaḥ dhṛṣṇunā śavasā rodasī ubhe vṛṣā vṛṣa tvā vṛṣabhaḥ nyṛñjate
translated: He who with daring strength rules over both the worlds, the bull, the hero, is victorious as a bull.

original: arcā dive bṛhate śūṣyaṃ vacaḥ svakṣatraṃ yasya dhṛṣato dhṛṣan manaḥ /
analyzed: arca dive bṛhate śūṣyam vacaḥ svakṣatram yasya dhṛṣataḥ dhṛṣat manaḥ
translated: Praise the lofty heaven with a hymn worthy of it, whose mind is daring, bold, and mighty.

original: bṛhacchravā asuro barhaṇā kṛtaḥ puro haribhyāṃ vṛṣabho ratho hi ṣaḥ //
analyzed: bṛhat śravāḥ asuraḥ barhaṇā kṛtaḥ puras haribhyām vṛṣabhaḥ rathaḥ hi saḥ
translated: The Asura of lofty fame, made great, is a bull, a chariot with two bay horses, a leader.

original: tvaṃ divo bṛhataḥ sānu kopayo 'va tmanā dhṛṣatā śambaram bhinat /🔽yan māyino vrandino mandinā dhṛṣac chitāṃ gabhastim aśanim pṛtanyasi //
analyzed: tvam divaḥ bṛhataḥ sānu kopayaḥ vaḥ tmanā dhṛṣatā śambaram bhinat  yat māyinaḥ vrandinaḥ mandinā dhṛṣat śitām gabhastim aśanim pṛtanyasi
translated: Thou didst shake the lofty peak of heaven, thou didst break through Śambara with thy own daring.🔽When thou, daring, with thy sharp bolt, thy dart, thy weapon, didst smite the deceitful, the treacherous, the wicked.

original: ni yad vṛṇakṣi śvasanasya mūrdhani śuṣṇasya cid vrandino roruvad vanā /
analyzed: ni yat vṛṇakṣi śvasanasya mūrdhani śuṣṇasya cit vrandinaḥ roruvat vanā
translated: When thou dost crush the head of the wind, even the roaring woods of the deceitful Śuṣṇa,

original: prācīnena manasā barhaṇāvatā yad adyā cit kṛṇavaḥ kas tvā pari //
analyzed: prācīnena manasā barhaṇāvatā yat adyā cit kṛṇavaḥ kaḥ tvā pari
translated: With the ancient mind, with the lofty one, what thou dost do even now, who is there to hinder thee?

original: tvam āvitha naryaṃ turvaśaṃ yaduṃ tvaṃ turvītiṃ vayyaṃ śatakrato /
analyzed: tvam āvitha naryam turvaśam yadum tvam turvītim vayyam śatakrato
translated: Thou hast helped the man, Turvasa, and Yadu, and Vya's son Turvîti, O thou of a hundred powers.

original: tvaṃ ratham etaśaṃ kṛtvye dhane tvam puro navatiṃ dambhayo nava //
analyzed: tvam ratham etaśam kṛtvye dhane tvam puraḥ navatim dambhayaḥ nava
translated: Thou hast made the chariot of Etaṣa ready for the contest, and hast broken down nine and ninety forts.

original: sa ghā rājā satpatiḥ śūśuvaj jano rātahavyaḥ prati yaḥ śāsam invati /
analyzed: sa ghā rājā sat patiḥ śūśuvat janaḥ rāta havyaḥ prati yaḥ śāsam invati
translated: He is the King, the Lord of the brave, the people who wax strong, who sends oblations, who obeys the command.

original: ukthā vā yo abhigṛṇāti rādhasā dānur asmā uparā pinvate divaḥ //
analyzed: ukthā vā yaḥ abhigṛṇāti rādhasā dānuḥ asmai uparā pinvate divaḥ
translated: He who with his bounty praises thy lauds, the bountiful one, makes the rain of heaven to swell for him.

original: asamaṃ kṣatram asamā manīṣā pra somapā apasā santu neme /
analyzed: asamam kṣatram asamā manīṣā pra soma pāḥ apasā santu neme
translated: Unequal be the dominion, unequal the thought of these, the Soma-drinkers, who are not my friends.

original: ye ta indra daduṣo vardhayanti mahi kṣatraṃ sthaviraṃ vṛṣṇyaṃ ca //
analyzed: ye te indra daduṣaḥ vardhayanti mahi kṣatram sthaviram vṛṣṇyam ca
translated: Those, O Indra, who exalt the giver, make his dominion great, his power, and his manly might.

original: tubhyed ete bahulā adridugdhāś camūṣadaś camasā indrapānāḥ /
analyzed: tubhya id ete bahulāḥ adri dugdhāḥ camūṣadaḥ camasāḥ indra pānāḥ
translated: These many, pressed out by the stone, for thee, O Indra, the drinking bowls, the cups, the reservoirs.

original: vy aśnuhi tarpayā kāmam eṣām athā mano vasudeyāya kṛṣva //
analyzed: vi aśnuhi tarpaya kāmam eṣām athā manaḥ vasu deyāya kṛṣva
translated: Enjoy them, satisfy their wish, and then turn thy mind to give us wealth.

original: apām atiṣṭhad dharuṇahvaraṃ tamo 'ntar vṛtrasya jaṭhareṣu parvataḥ /
analyzed: apām atiṣṭhat dharuṇahvaram tamaḥ ntar vṛtrasya jaṭhareṣu parvataḥ
translated: The mountain stood in the waters, in the deep, in the darkness, in the bowels of Vritra.

original: abhīm indro nadyo vavriṇā hitā viśvā anuṣṭhāḥ pravaṇeṣu jighnate //
analyzed: abhi īm indraḥ nadyaḥ vavriṇā hitāḥ viśvāḥ anuṣṭhāḥ pravaṇeṣu jighnate
translated: Indra with his cord bound fast the rivers, and smote them all in the hollows, as they flowed.

original: sa śevṛdham adhi dhā dyumnam asme mahi kṣatraṃ janāṣāḷ indra tavyam /
analyzed: sa śevṛdham adhi dhāḥ dyumnam asme mahi kṣatram janāṣāh indra tavyam
translated: Grant us, O Indra, increasing glory, great lordship, and the joy of many people.

original: rakṣā ca no maghonaḥ pāhi sūrīn rāye ca naḥ svapatyā iṣe dhāḥ //
analyzed: rakṣā ca naḥ maghonaḥ pāhi sūrīn rāye ca naḥ su apatyai iṣe dhāḥ
translated: Protect our wealthy nobles, and our princes: give us food and wealth with noble offspring.

original: divaś cid asya varimā vi papratha indraṃ na mahnā pṛthivī cana prati /
analyzed: divaḥ cit asya varimā vi paprathe indram na mahnā pṛthivī cana prati
translated: Even the wide expanse of heaven is too narrow for him, and the earth is not broad enough.

original: bhīmas tuviṣmāñ carṣaṇibhya ātapaḥ śiśīte vajraṃ tejase na vaṃsagaḥ //
analyzed: bhīmaḥ tuviṣmān carṣaṇibhyaḥ ātapaḥ śiśīte vajram tejase na vaṃsagaḥ
translated: Fierce, mighty, he burns against the people: he sharpens his bolt for his own strength, as an archer.

original: so arṇavo na nadyaḥ samudriyaḥ prati gṛbhṇāti viśritā varīmabhiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ arṇavaḥ na nadyaḥ samudriyaḥ prati gṛbhṇāti viśritāḥ varīmabhiḥ
translated: Like the ocean, that reservoir of the rivers, he receives the widely spread abundant (waters).

original: indraḥ somasya pītaye vṛṣāyate sanāt sa yudhma ojasā panasyate //
analyzed: indraḥ somasya pītaye vṛṣāyate sanāt sa yudhmaḥ ojasā panasyate
translated: Indra, for the drinking of the Soma, becomes a bull: from of old he is the warrior, the hero, to be praised with the hymn.

original: tvaṃ tam indra parvataṃ na bhojase maho nṛmṇasya dharmaṇām irajyasi /
analyzed: tvam tam indra parvatam na bhojase mahaḥ nṛmṇasya dharmaṇām irajyasi
translated: Thou, O Indra, art not to be vanquished like a mountain: thou rulest over the great deeds of manly strength.

original: pra vīryeṇa devatāti cekite viśvasmā ugraḥ karmaṇe purohitaḥ //🔽sa id vane namasyubhir vacasyate cāru janeṣu prabruvāṇa indriyam /
analyzed: pra vīryeṇa devatāti cekite viśvasmai ugraḥ karmaṇe purohitaḥ  saḥ id vane namasyubhiḥ vacasyate cāru janeṣu prabruvāṇaḥ indriyam
translated: By his power he has surpassed the deities: he is terrible for every deed, the high priest.🔽He is to be praised in the wood by those who adore him: he proclaims his power among the people.

original: vṛṣā chandur bhavati haryato vṛṣā kṣemeṇa dhenām maghavā yad invati //
analyzed: vṛṣā chanduḥ bhavati haryataḥ vṛṣā kṣemeṇa dhenām maghavā yat invati
translated: The tawny bull is a cheerful bull: the bountiful one, when he impels the milch cow, is in peace.

original: sa in mahāni samithāni majmanā kṛṇoti yudhma ojasā janebhyaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ id mahāni samithāni majmanā kṛṇoti yudhmaḥ ojasā janebhyaḥ
translated: He, the mighty one, by his greatness makes the great battles for the people to fight with might.

original: adhā cana śrad dadhati tviṣīmata indrāya vajraṃ nighanighnate vadham //
analyzed: adhā cana śrat dadhati tviṣīmate indrāya vajram nighanighnate vadham
translated: Then indeed they give him the flashing thunderbolt to hurl, to Indra, the weapon that slays.

original: sa hi śravasyuḥ sadanāni kṛtrimā kṣmayā vṛdhāna ojasā vināśayan /
analyzed: sa hi śravasyuḥ sadanāni kṛtrimā kṣmayā vṛdhānaḥ ojasā vināśayan
translated: For he, the glorious one, the creator of the ordered abodes, increasing by the earth, destroying by his might,

original: jyotīṃṣi kṛṇvann avṛkāṇi yajyave 'va sukratuḥ sartavā apaḥ sṛjat //
analyzed: jyotīṃṣi kṛṇvan avṛkāṇi yajyave vaḥ su kratuḥ sartavai apaḥ sṛjat
translated: Making the lights free from danger for the worshipper, the very wise one set the waters free to flow.

original: dānāya manaḥ somapāvann astu te 'rvāñcā harī vandanaśrud ā kṛdhi /
analyzed: dānāya manaḥ soma pāvan astu te rvāñcā harī vandana śrut ā kṛdhi
translated: Let thy mind be inclined to give, O Soma-drinker! Bring hither thy two Bay Steeds, obedient to the call.

original: yamiṣṭhāsaḥ sārathayo ya indra te na tvā ketā ā dabhnuvanti bhūrṇayaḥ //
analyzed: yamiṣṭhāsaḥ sārathayaḥ ye indra te na tvā ketāḥ ā dabhnuvanti bhūrṇayaḥ
translated: The best of charioteers, O Indra, are they who are thine: the swift messengers do not afflict thee.

original: aprakṣitaṃ vasu bibharṣi hastayor aṣāḷhaṃ sahas tanvi śruto dadhe /
analyzed: a prakṣitam vasu bibharṣi hastayoḥ a sāḍham sahaḥ tanvi śrutaḥ dadhe
translated: In thy two hands thou bearest wealth that never fails: thou hast, O mighty one, a thousand in thy body.

original: āvṛtāso 'vatāso na kartṛbhis tanūṣu te kratava indra bhūrayaḥ //
analyzed: āvṛtāsaḥ vatāsaḥ na kartṛbhiḥ tanūṣu te kratavaḥ indra bhūrayaḥ
translated: Thy powers, O Indra, are spread out, spread forth by the singers, like the two doors of the house.

original: eṣa pra pūrvīr ava tasya camriṣo 'tyo na yoṣām ud ayaṃsta bhurvaṇiḥ /
analyzed: eṣa pra pūrvīḥ ava tasya camriṣaḥ tyaḥ na yoṣām ud ayaṃsta bhurvaṇiḥ
translated: This one hath loosed his many coverings, like a strong courser rising from the mare's embrace.

original: dakṣam mahe pāyayate hiraṇyayaṃ ratham āvṛtyā hariyogam ṛbhvasam //
analyzed: dakṣam mahe pāyayate hiraṇyayam ratham āvṛtya hari yogam ṛbhvasam
translated: He makes the mighty golden chariot, yoked with tawny steeds, to be his own by his great power.

original: taṃ gūrtayo nemanniṣaḥ parīṇasaḥ samudraṃ na saṃcaraṇe saniṣyavaḥ /🔽patiṃ dakṣasya vidathasya nū saho giriṃ na venā adhi roha tejasā //
analyzed: tam gūrtayaḥ nemanniṣaḥ parīṇasaḥ samudram na saṃcaraṇe saniṣyavaḥ  patim dakṣasya vidathasya nu sahaḥ girim na venāḥ adhi roha tejasā
translated: The singers, the pressing-stones, the sacrificial gifts, the sacrifices, like those who long for gain, will win him,🔽As a husband, for the power of the sacrifice, as a mountain with its splendour they will mount him.

original: sa turvaṇir mahāṃ areṇu pauṃsye girer bhṛṣṭir na bhrājate tujā śavaḥ /
analyzed: sa turvaṇiḥ mahān areṇu pauṃsye gireḥ bhṛṣṭiḥ na bhrājate tujā śavaḥ
translated: He, the great one, who is to be praised, in manly strength free from dust, shines forth with his might, with his splendour, like the peak of a mountain,

original: yena śuṣṇam māyinam āyaso made dudhra ābhūṣu rāmayan ni dāmani //
analyzed: yena śuṣṇam māyinam āyasaḥ made dudhraḥ ābhūṣu rāmayan ni dāmani
translated: By whom, in the intoxication of the strong one, he made the deceitful one, Śuṣṇa, dance, the terrible one, in the battles, in the bonds.

original: devī yadi taviṣī tvāvṛdhotaya indraṃ siṣakty uṣasaṃ na sūryaḥ /
analyzed: devī yadi taviṣī tvāvṛdhā ūtaye indram siṣakti uṣasam na sūryaḥ
translated: If the divine, powerful, ever-increasing strength, like the sun with the dawn, joins Indra,

original: yo dhṛṣṇunā śavasā bādhate tama iyarti reṇum bṛhad arhariṣvaṇiḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ dhṛṣṇunā śavasā bādhate tamaḥ iyarti reṇum bṛhat arhariṣvaṇiḥ
translated: He who with daring might overcomes the darkness, sends forth the dust, the great one, the delighting one.

original: vi yat tiro dharuṇam acyutaṃ rajo 'tiṣṭhipo diva ātāsu barhaṇā /
analyzed: vi yat tiras dharuṇam acyutam rajaḥ tiṣṭhipaḥ divaḥ ātāsu barhaṇā
translated: When he established the imperishable support, the realm, above the heaven, in the highest heaven,

original: svarmīḷhe yan mada indra harṣyāhan vṛtraṃ nir apām aubjo arṇavam //
analyzed: svarmīḍhe yat made indra harṣya ahan vṛtram niḥ apām aubjaḥ arṇavam
translated: In the intoxication of the sky, O Indra, in exultation, he struck down Vṛtra, and opened the watery flood.

original: tvaṃ divo dharuṇaṃ dhiṣa ojasā pṛthivyā indra sadaneṣu māhinaḥ /
analyzed: tvam divaḥ dharuṇam dhiṣe ojasā pṛthivyāḥ indra sadaneṣu māhinaḥ
translated: You, O Indra, with your might, support the support of the sky, of the earth, in your mighty places.

original: tvaṃ sutasya made ariṇā apo vi vṛtrasya samayā pāṣyārujaḥ //
analyzed: tvam sutasya made ariṇāḥ apaḥ vi vṛtrasya samayā pāṣyā arujaḥ
translated: In the intoxication of the pressed (Soma), you, O enemy, with your own strength, broke through the waters, and destroyed Vṛtra's dam.

original: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya bṛhate bṛhadraye satyaśuṣmāya tavase matim bhare /
analyzed: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya bṛhate bṛhadraye satya śuṣmāya tavase matim bhare
translated: I bring my thought to him most bounteous, lofty, of lofty wealth, to him of true prowess, to the Strong,

original: apām iva pravaṇe yasya durdharaṃ rādho viśvāyu śavase apāvṛtam //🔽adha te viśvam anu hāsad iṣṭaya āpo nimneva savanā haviṣmataḥ /
analyzed: apām iva pravaṇe yasya durdharam rādhaḥ viśvāyu śavase apāvṛtam  adha te viśvam anu ha asat iṣṭayaḥ āpaḥ nimnā iva savanā haviṣmataḥ
translated: Whose bounty, like a stream of water, is hard to stay, open to all men, for his might, for his gift.🔽May all thy wishes be fulfilled, O thou who art worshipped by all, as the streams of water flow to the low-lying ground, at the libations of the sacrificer,

original: yat parvate na samaśīta haryata indrasya vajraḥ śnathitā hiraṇyayaḥ //
analyzed: yat parvate na samaśīta haryataḥ indrasya vajraḥ śnathitā hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: When, like a mountain, it is firmly fixed, the golden thunderbolt of Indra, which is terrible.

original: asmai bhīmāya namasā sam adhvara uṣo na śubhra ā bharā panīyase /
analyzed: asmai bhīmāya namasā sam adhvare uṣaḥ na śubhraḥ ā bhara panīyase
translated: To him, the terrible one, bring the sacrifice with reverence, O Dawn, bring the beautiful one to the most excellent one,

original: yasya dhāma śravase nāmendriyaṃ jyotir akāri harito nāyase //
analyzed: yasya dhāma śravase nāma indriyam jyotiḥ akāri haritaḥ nāyase
translated: Whose abode, for glory, for fame, for power, has been made resplendent, like a chariot, with the two bays.

original: ime ta indra te vayam puruṣṭuta ye tvārabhya carāmasi prabhūvaso /
analyzed: ime te indra te vayam puruṣṭuta ye tvā ārabhya carāmasi prabhūvaso
translated: These, O Indra, are thine, and we are thine, O thou who art much praised, who depend on thee, O thou of abundant wealth.

original: nahi tvad anyo girvaṇo giraḥ saghat kṣoṇīr iva prati no harya tad vacaḥ //🔽bhūri ta indra vīryaṃ tava smasy asya stotur maghavan kāmam ā pṛṇa /
analyzed: nahi tvat anyaḥ girvaṇaḥ giraḥ saghat kṣoṇīḥ iva prati naḥ harya tat vacaḥ  bhūri te indra vīryam tava smasi asya stotuḥ maghavan kāmam ā pṛṇa
translated: For none other than thee, O lover of song, can appreciate our songs, like the two worlds, so accept this speech of ours.🔽O Indra, thy manly power is great, therefore fulfil the wish of this thy praiser, O bountiful one.

original: anu te dyaur bṛhatī vīryam mama iyaṃ ca te pṛthivī nema ojase //
analyzed: anu te dyauḥ bṛhatī vīryam mama iyam ca te pṛthivī neme ojase
translated: The lofty heaven, O Indra, and this earth are for thee, for thy strength, for thy power.

original: tvaṃ tam indra parvatam mahām uruṃ vajreṇa vajrin parvaśaś cakartitha /🔽avāsṛjo nivṛtāḥ sartavā apaḥ satrā viśvaṃ dadhiṣe kevalaṃ sahaḥ //
analyzed: tvam tam indra parvatam mahām urum vajreṇa vajrin parvaśas cakartitha  avāsṛjaḥ nivṛtāḥ sartavai apaḥ satrā viśvam dadhiṣe kevalam sahaḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, with thy thunderbolt, O Thunderer, hast cleft asunder that great, wide mountain piecemeal.🔽Thou hast let loose the waters that were pent up, and hast ever in thy might possessed all that is good.

original: nū cit sahojā amṛto ni tundate hotā yad dūto abhavad vivasvataḥ /
analyzed: nu cit sahaḥ jāḥ amṛtaḥ ni tundate hotā yat dūtaḥ abhavat vivasvataḥ
translated: Never yet hath the son of strength, the immortal, been abashed, when he hath been the priest and envoy of Vivasvan.

original: vi sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhī rajo mama ā devatātā haviṣā vivāsati //
analyzed: vi sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhiḥ rajaḥ mama ā devatātā haviṣā vivāsati
translated: He, on the most excellent paths of the region, goeth to the deities, and with the oblation chooseth what is good.

original: ā svam adma yuvamāno ajaras tṛṣv aviṣyann ataseṣu tiṣṭhati /🔽atyo na pṛṣṭham pruṣitasya rocate divo na sānu stanayann acikradat //
analyzed: ā svam adma yuvamānaḥ ajaraḥ tṛṣu aviṣyan ataseṣu tiṣṭhati  atyaḥ na pṛṣṭham pruṣitasya rocate divaḥ na sānu stanayan acikradat
translated: The undecaying one, stretching himself, goeth to his own abode, and standeth in the three unploughed furrows.🔽The back of the rain-shower shineth like a horse's back. He hath roared, like the ridge of heaven, and hath bellowed.

original: krāṇā rudrebhir vasubhiḥ purohito hotā niṣatto rayiṣāḷ amartyaḥ /
analyzed: krāṇā rudrebhiḥ vasubhiḥ purohitaḥ hotā niṣattaḥ rayiṣāh amartyaḥ
translated: The priest, the most excellent, is chosen by the Rudras and Vasus. The immortal Hotar is seated, longing for wealth.

original: ratho na vikṣv ṛñjasāna āyuṣu vy ānuṣag vāryā deva ṛṇvati //
analyzed: rathaḥ na vikṣu ṛñjasānaḥ āyuṣu vi ānuṣak vāryā devaḥ ṛṇvati
translated: Like a chariot in many places, in the lives (of men), the God, according to the custom of men, distributeth what is good.

original: vi vātajūto ataseṣu tiṣṭhate vṛthā juhūbhiḥ sṛṇyā tuviṣvaṇiḥ /
analyzed: vi vāta jūtaḥ ataseṣu tiṣṭhate vṛthā juhūbhiḥ sṛṇyā tuviṣvaṇiḥ
translated: Urged on by the wind, he standeth in the brushwood, the mighty one, with his own mouths, with the oblations.

original: tṛṣu yad agne vanino vṛṣāyase kṛṣṇaṃ ta ema ruśadūrme ajara //
analyzed: tṛṣu yat agne vaninaḥ vṛṣāyase kṛṣṇam te ema ruśat ūrme ajara
translated: When, O Agni, thou, as a bull, dost bellow at the trees, then the black one glideth on thy ruddy back, O undecaying one.

original: tapurjambho vana ā vātacodito yūthe na sāhvāṃ ava vāti vaṃsagaḥ /
analyzed: tapuḥ jambhaḥ vane ā vāta coditaḥ yūthe na sāhvām ava vāti vaṃsagaḥ
translated: The flame-mouthed one, urged on by the wind in the wood, blows like a bull in the herd.

original: abhivrajann akṣitam pājasā raja sthātuś caratham bhayate patatriṇaḥ //
analyzed: abhivrajan akṣitam pājasā rajaḥ sthātuḥ caratham bhayate patatriṇaḥ
translated: Approaching with his unfailing might, the bird fears the path of the one who stands still.

original: dadhuṣ ṭvā bhṛgavo mānuṣeṣv ā rayiṃ na cāruṃ suhavaṃ janebhyaḥ /
analyzed: dadhuḥ tvā bhṛgavaḥ mānuṣeṣu ā rayim na cārum su havam janebhyaḥ
translated: The Bhṛgus have placed you among men, wealth beautiful, easy to invoke, for the people.

original: hotāram agne atithiṃ vareṇyam mitraṃ na śevaṃ divyāya janmane //
analyzed: hotāram agne atithim vareṇyam mitram na śevam divyāya janmane
translated: The priest, O Agni, the desirable guest, a friend like Śiva, for the heavenly race.

original: hotāraṃ sapta juhvo yajiṣṭhaṃ yaṃ vāghato vṛṇate adhvareṣu /
analyzed: hotāram sapta juhvaḥ yajiṣṭham yam vāghataḥ vṛṇate adhvareṣu
translated: The priest, the best offerer, with seven oblations, whom the priests choose in the sacrifices,

original: agniṃ viśveṣām aratiṃ vasūnāṃ saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam //
analyzed: agnim viśveṣām aratim vasūnām saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam
translated: I honor Agni, the envoy of all the treasures, I go with devotion to seek the treasure.

original: acchidrā sūno sahaso no adya stotṛbhyo mitramahaḥ śarma yaccha /
analyzed: acchidrā sūno sahasaḥ naḥ adya stotṛbhyaḥ mitra mahas śarma yaccha
translated: O son of strength, grant us today, O Mitra-like one, protection, faultless, for the praisers.

original: agne gṛṇantam aṃhasa uruṣyorjo napāt pūrbhir āyasībhiḥ //
analyzed: agne gṛṇantam aṃhasaḥ uruṣya ūrjaḥ napāt pūrbhiḥ āyasībhiḥ
translated: O Agni, protect the singer from affliction, O son of strength, with your iron-bound protections.

original: bhavā varūthaṃ gṛṇate vibhāvo bhavā maghavan maghavadbhyaḥ śarma /
analyzed: bhava varūtham gṛṇate vibhāvaḥ bhava maghavan maghavadbhyaḥ śarma
translated: Be a protector, O Vibhāvasu, to the singer, be a shelter, O bountiful one, to the bountiful ones.

original: uruṣyāgne aṃhaso gṛṇantam prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jagamyāt //
analyzed: uruṣya agne aṃhasaḥ gṛṇantam prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
translated: Protect from affliction, O Agni, the singer, may the one rich in devotion come early with his prayer.

original: vayā id agne agnayas te anye tve viśve amṛtā mādayante /
analyzed: vayāḥ id agne agnayaḥ te anye tve viśve amṛtāḥ mādayante
translated: O Agni, these fires of yours, O Agni, other fires, all you immortal ones rejoice in you.

original: vaiśvānara nābhir asi kṣitīnāṃ sthūṇeva janāṃ upamid yayantha //
analyzed: vaiśvānara nābhiḥ asi kṣitīnām sthūṇā iva janān upamit yayantha
translated: Thou art the navel, O Vaiśvānara, of the people, as a pillar, going, they say, to the ends of the people.

original: mūrdhā divo nābhir agniḥ pṛthivyā athābhavad aratī rodasyoḥ /
analyzed: mūrdhā divaḥ nābhiḥ agniḥ pṛthivyāḥ atha abhavat aratī rodasyoḥ
translated: The head of the sky, the navel of the earth, then became the resting-place of the two worlds.

original: taṃ tvā devāso 'janayanta devaṃ vaiśvānara jyotir id āryāya //
analyzed: tam tvā devāsaḥ janayanta devam vaiśvānara jyotiḥ id āryāya
translated: Thee, O God Vaiśvānara, the gods have generated as light for the Ārya.

original: ā sūrye na raśmayo dhruvāso vaiśvānare dadhire 'gnā vasūni /
analyzed: ā sūrye na raśmayaḥ dhruvāsaḥ vaiśvānare dadhire gnā vasūni
translated: As the firm rays in the sun, so in Vaiśvānara Agni they have placed the treasures.

original: yā parvateṣv oṣadhīṣv apsu yā mānuṣeṣv asi tasya rājā //
analyzed: yā parvateṣu oṣadhīṣu apsu yā mānuṣeṣu asi tasya rājā
translated: Thou art the king of that which is in the mountains, in the plants, in the waters, and among men.

original: bṛhatī iva sūnave rodasī giro hotā manuṣyo na dakṣaḥ /🔽svarvate satyaśuṣmāya pūrvīr vaiśvānarāya nṛtamāya yahvīḥ //
analyzed: bṛhatī iva sūnave rodasī giraḥ hotā manuṣyaḥ na dakṣaḥ  svarvate satya śuṣmāya pūrvīḥ vaiśvānarāya nṛtamāya yahvīḥ
translated: Like the two great worlds for the son, the priest, the dexterous man, is the songs.🔽To Vaiśvānara, of true strength, of the nature of heaven, the most truthful, the young ones, the many,

original: divaś cit te bṛhato jātavedo vaiśvānara pra ririce mahitvam /
analyzed: divaḥ cit te bṛhataḥ jātavedaḥ vaiśvānara pra ririce mahi tvam
translated: Even from the great sky, O all-knower, Vaiśvānara, thy greatness hath increased.

original: rājā kṛṣṭīnām asi mānuṣīṇāṃ yudhā devebhyo varivaś cakartha //
analyzed: rājā kṛṣṭīnām asi mānuṣīṇām yudhā devebhyaḥ varivaḥ cakartha
translated: Thou art the king of the cultivated lands of men; by fighting thou hast made room for the gods.

original: pra nū mahitvaṃ vṛṣabhasya vocaṃ yam pūravo vṛtrahaṇaṃ sacante /
analyzed: pra nu mahi tvam vṛṣabhasya vocam yam pūravaḥ vṛtra haṇam sacante
translated: Now will I proclaim the greatness of the mighty one, whom the Pūrus attend as the Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: vaiśvānaro dasyum agnir jaghanvāṃ adhūnot kāṣṭhā ava śambaram bhet //
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ dasyum agniḥ jaghanvān adhūnot kāṣṭhāḥ ava śambaram bhet
translated: Vaiśvānara Agni hath smitten the Dasyu, hath crushed Kaṣṭha and shattered Śambara.

original: vaiśvānaro mahimnā viśvakṛṣṭir bharadvājeṣu yajato vibhāvā /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ mahimnā viśvakṛṣṭiḥ bharadvājeṣu yajataḥ vibhāvā
translated: Vaiśvānara, the all-supporting one, the radiant one, is worshipped among the Bharadvājas with great power.

original: śātavaneye śatinībhir agniḥ puruṇīthe jarate sūnṛtāvān //
analyzed: śātavaneye śatinībhiḥ agniḥ puruṇīthe jarate sūnṛtāvān
translated: Agni, the one with a hundred oblations, is praised by the Śatavaneys with many offerings, the one possessing truth.

original: vahniṃ yaśasaṃ vidathasya ketuṃ suprāvyaṃ dūtaṃ sadyoartham /
analyzed: vahnim yaśasam vidathasya ketum suprāvyam dūtam sadyoartham
translated: The bearer of oblations, the glorious one, the banner of the sacrifice, the well-praised one, the messenger who acts quickly,

original: dvijanmānaṃ rayim iva praśastaṃ rātim bharad bhṛgave mātariśvā //
analyzed: dvijanmānam rayim iva praśastam rātim bharat bhṛgave mātariśvā
translated: the twice-born one, like wealth that is praised, Mātariśvan carries the offering to Bhṛgu.

original: asya śāsur ubhayāsaḥ sacante haviṣmanta uśijo ye ca martāḥ /
analyzed: asya śāsuḥ ubhayāsaḥ sacante haviṣmantaḥ uśijaḥ ye ca martāḥ
translated: Both sides obey his rule, the mortal men who are eager and offer oblations,

original: divaś cit pūrvo ny asādi hotāpṛcchyo viśpatir vikṣu vedhāḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ cit pūrvaḥ ni asādi hotā āpṛcchyaḥ viśpatiḥ vikṣu vedhāḥ
translated: and the one who was seated before heaven as the priest, the one to be questioned, the lord of the people, the creator in the clans.

original: taṃ navyasī hṛda ā jāyamānam asmat sukīrtir madhujihvam aśyāḥ /🔽yam ṛtvijo vṛjane mānuṣāsaḥ prayasvanta āyavo jījananta //
analyzed: tam navyasī hṛdaḥ ā jāyamānam asmat su kīrtiḥ madhu jihvam aśyāḥ  yam ṛtvijaḥ vṛjane mānuṣāsaḥ prayasvantaḥ āyavaḥ jījananta
translated: May the one who is born anew in the heart, the one with a sweet tongue, be desired by us for his good fame,🔽whom the human priests, the living ones with oblations, have generated in the ritual.

original: uśik pāvako vasur mānuṣeṣu vareṇyo hotādhāyi vikṣu /🔽damūnā gṛhapatir dama āṃ agnir bhuvad rayipatī rayīṇām //
analyzed: uśij pāvakaḥ vasuḥ mānuṣeṣu vareṇyaḥ hotā adhāyi vikṣu  damūnāḥ gṛhapatiḥ dame ām agniḥ bhuvat rayi patiḥ rayīṇām
translated: The eager one, the purifier, the good one among men, the chosen one, the priest, is established in the clans.🔽Agni, the one who dwells in the house, the lord of the house, has become the lord of wealth among the people.

original: taṃ tvā vayam patim agne rayīṇām pra śaṃsāmo matibhir gotamāsaḥ /
analyzed: tam tvā vayam patim agne rayīṇām pra śaṃsāmaḥ matibhiḥ gotamāsaḥ
translated: We, the Gotamas, praise you, O Agni, as the lord of wealth, with our thoughts.

original: āśuṃ na vājambharam marjayantaḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jagamyāt //
analyzed: āśum na vājambharam marjayantaḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
translated: Anointing the swift one who brings booty, may the possessor of wealth come early with his thought.

original: asmā id u pra tavase turāya prayo na harmi stomam māhināya /
analyzed: asmai id u pra tavase turāya prayaḥ na harmi stomam māhināya
translated: To him, the strong one, the swift one, I offer this praise, like a chariot, to the mighty one.

original: ṛcīṣamāyādhrigava oham indrāya brahmāṇi rātatamā //
analyzed: ṛcīṣamāya adhrigave oham indrāya brahmāṇi rātatamā
translated: To the one who is eager for praise, to the one who has firm wealth, I offer prayers most dear to Indra.

original: asmā id u praya iva pra yaṃsi bharāmy āṅgūṣam bādhe suvṛkti /
analyzed: asmai id u prayaḥ iva pra yaṃsi bharāmi āṅgūṣam bādhe suvṛkti
translated: To him, as if to a swift one, I send forth, I bring forth praise, a loud cry, a good hymn.

original: indrāya hṛdā manasā manīṣā pratnāya patye dhiyo marjayanta //
analyzed: indrāya hṛdā manasā manīṣā pratnāya patye dhiyaḥ marjayanta
translated: To Indra, the ancient lord, they purify their thoughts with their heart and mind, their hymns.

original: asmā id u tyam upamaṃ svarṣām bharāmy āṅgūṣam āsyena /
analyzed: asmai id u tyam upamam svarṣām bharāmi āṅgūṣam āsyena
translated: To him, the self-shining one, the equal one, I bring forth praise with my mouth.

original: maṃhiṣṭham acchoktibhir matīnāṃ suvṛktibhiḥ sūriṃ vāvṛdhadhyai //
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭham acchoktibhiḥ matīnām suvṛktibhiḥ sūrim vāvṛdhadhyai
translated: The most bountiful one, with the best words of thought, with good hymns, I wish to strengthen the lord.

original: asmā id u stomaṃ saṃ hinomi rathaṃ na taṣṭeva tatsināya /
analyzed: asmai id u stomam sam hinomi ratham na taṣṭā iva tatsināya
translated: To him I offer this praise, like a chariot, to the one who is to be praised.

original: giraś ca girvāhase suvṛktīndrāya viśvaminvam medhirāya //
analyzed: giraḥ ca gir vāhase suvṛktī indrāya viśvaminvam medhirāya
translated: And hymns to the one who receives hymns, good hymns, all-impelling, to the wise Indra.

original: asmā id u saptim iva śravasyendrāyārkaṃ juhvā sam añje /
analyzed: asmai id u saptim iva śravasyā indrāya arkam juhvā sam añje
translated: To him, as if to a swift one, I anoint with my tongue the praise for Indra, who desires glory.

original: vīraṃ dānaukasaṃ vandadhyai purāṃ gūrtaśravasaṃ darmāṇam //
analyzed: vīram dānaukasam vandadhyai purām gūrta śravasam darmāṇam
translated: I wish to praise the hero who is the lord of gifts, the ancient one, whose fame is great, the powerful one.

original: asmā id u tvaṣṭā takṣad vajraṃ svapastamaṃ svaryaṃ raṇāya /
analyzed: asmai id u tvaṣṭā takṣat vajram su apastamam svaryam raṇāya
translated: Tvashtar has fashioned for him the thunderbolt, most excellent, most heavenly, for the fight.

original: vṛtrasya cid vidad yena marma tujann īśānas tujatā kiyedhāḥ //
analyzed: vṛtrasya cit vidat yena marma tujan īśānaḥ tujatā kiyedhāḥ
translated: With it he found the heart of Vr̥itra, and, irresistible, the wielder of the bolt, he cleft his head.

original: asyed u mātuḥ savaneṣu sadyo mahaḥ pitum papivāñ cārv annā /
analyzed: asya id u mātuḥ savaneṣu sadyas mahaḥ pitum papivān cārū annā
translated: Even in his mother's flowing streams he drank full draughts of mighty food, and then the lovely food.

original: muṣāyad viṣṇuḥ pacataṃ sahīyān vidhyad varāhaṃ tiro adrim astā //
analyzed: muṣāyat viṣṇuḥ pacatam sahīyān vidhyat varāham tiras adrim astā
translated: Vishnu, the stronger, stole away the cooking pot: he pierced the boar and cleft the rock asunder.

original: asmā id u gnāś cid devapatnīr indrāyārkam ahihatya ūvuḥ /
analyzed: asmai id u gnāḥ cit deva patnīḥ indrāya arkam ahi hatye ūvuḥ
translated: Even the Dames, the wives of Gods, have sung this hymn to Indra, the slayer of the Dragon.

original: pari dyāvāpṛthivī jabhra urvī nāsya te mahimānam pari ṣṭaḥ //
analyzed: pari dyāvāpṛthivī jabhre urvī na asya te mahimānam pari staḥ
translated: He hath filled heaven and earth that they are wide: none can surpass his greatness.

original: asyed eva pra ririce mahitvaṃ divas pṛthivyāḥ pary antarikṣāt /🔽svarāḷ indro dama ā viśvagūrtaḥ svarir amatro vavakṣe raṇāya //🔽asyed eva śavasā śuṣantaṃ vi vṛścad vajreṇa vṛtram indraḥ /
analyzed: asya id eva pra ririce mahi tvam divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt  svarāj indraḥ dame ā viśva gūrtaḥ svariḥ amatraḥ vavakṣe raṇāya  asya id eva śavasā śuṣantam vi vṛścat vajreṇa vṛtram indraḥ
translated: Even his greatness hath extended beyond the heaven and earth and the wide air's mid-region.🔽Indra, all-hail! the self-resplendent, in the house, the self-resplendent, in the bowl hath waxed to strength.🔽Even with this his power Indra with thunder rent asunder the dry, the greedy Vr̥itra.

original: gā na vrāṇā avanīr amuñcad abhi śravo dāvane sacetāḥ //
analyzed: gāḥ na vrāṇāḥ avanīḥ amuñcat abhi śravaḥ dāvane sacetāḥ
translated: He loosed the kine, the waters, and the stalls, and, thoughtful, came to Dâvârî to win renown.

original: asyed u tveṣasā ranta sindhavaḥ pari yad vajreṇa sīm ayacchat /
analyzed: asya id u tveṣasā ranta sindhavaḥ pari yat vajreṇa sīm ayacchat
translated: Even the rivers with their rush have flowed to him, when he with thunder stayed their bounds and checked them.

original: īśānakṛd dāśuṣe daśasyan turvītaye gādhaṃ turvaṇiḥ kaḥ //🔽asmā id u pra bharā tūtujāno vṛtrāya vajram īśānaḥ kiyedhāḥ /
analyzed: īśāna kṛt dāśuṣe daśasyan turvītaye gādham turvaṇiḥ kaḥ  asmai id u pra bhara tūtujānaḥ vṛtrāya vajram īśānaḥ kiyedhāḥ
translated: Favouring the worshipper, bestowing room on Turvīti, the bountiful one, the lord, making room,🔽Do thou, O Indra, verily, urged on, hurl thy thunderbolt at Vritra, O thou who hast power to crush.

original: gor na parva vi radā tiraśceṣyann arṇāṃsy apāṃ caradhyai //
analyzed: goḥ na parva vi rada tiras ca iṣyan arṇāṃsi apām caradhyai
translated: Cutting off the joints of the cow, as it were, transversely, desirous of passing through the waters.

original: asyed u pra brūhi pūrvyāṇi turasya karmāṇi navya ukthaiḥ /
analyzed: asya id u pra brūhi pūrvyāṇi turasya karmāṇi navyaḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: Do thou, verily, proclaim his ancient deeds, the deeds of the strong one, with new hymns,

original: yudhe yad iṣṇāna āyudhāny ṛghāyamāṇo niriṇāti śatrūn //
analyzed: yudhe yat iṣṇānaḥ āyudhāni ṛghāyamāṇaḥ niriṇāti śatrūn
translated: When, rejoicing in the fight, he hurls his weapons, and, irresistible, slays the foes.

original: asyed u bhiyā girayaś ca dṛḷhā dyāvā ca bhūmā januṣas tujete /
analyzed: asya id u bhiyā girayaḥ ca dṛḍhāḥ dyāvā ca bhūmā januṣaḥ tujete
translated: Through the fear of this one, verily, the firm mountains, and the sky and the earth, at his birth, trembled.

original: upo venasya joguvāna oṇiṃ sadyo bhuvad vīryāya nodhāḥ //
analyzed: upa u venasya joguvānaḥ oṇim sadyas bhuvat vīryāya nodhāḥ
translated: He, the supporter, became immediately powerful for the performance of his will, for the sake of the sacrifice.

original: asmā id u tyad anu dāyy eṣām eko yad vavne bhūrer īśānaḥ /
analyzed: asmai id u tyad anu dāyi eṣām ekaḥ yat vavne bhūreḥ īśānaḥ
translated: To this one, verily, is this their share, since he, being one, has chosen to be the lord of much.

original: praitaśaṃ sūrye paspṛdhānaṃ sauvaśvye suṣvim āvad indraḥ //
analyzed: pra etaśam sūrye paspṛdhānam sauvaśvye suṣvim āvat indraḥ
translated: He, Indra, helped the son of Sauvīṣu in the fight with the sun, in the contest, with the swift one.

original: evā te hāriyojanā suvṛktīndra brahmāṇi gotamāso akran /
analyzed: eva te hāriyojana suvṛktī indra brahmāṇi gotamāsaḥ akran
translated: Thus, O Indra, the sons of Gotama have sung to thee, O thou whose horses are tawny, these good hymns and prayers.

original: aiṣu viśvapeśasaṃ dhiyaṃ dhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jagamyāt //
analyzed: ā eṣu viśva peśasam dhiyam dhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
translated: Bestow upon them the thought that pervades all things. May the possessor of wealth come quickly in the morning with his thought.

original: pra manmahe śavasānāya śūṣam āṅgūṣaṃ girvaṇase aṅgirasvat /
analyzed: pra manmahe śavasānāya śūṣam āṅgūṣam girvaṇase aṅgirasvat
translated: We meditate on strength for the powerful one, on the hymn, like Angiras, for the lover of song.

original: suvṛktibhi stuvata ṛgmiyāyārcāmārkaṃ nare viśrutāya //
analyzed: suvṛktibhiḥ stuvate ṛgmiyāya arcāma arkam nare viśrutāya
translated: With good verses we praise the one worthy of praise, the Arka, the famous one among men.

original: pra vo mahe mahi namo bharadhvam āṅgūṣyaṃ śavasānāya sāma /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe mahi namaḥ bharadhvam āṅgūṣyam śavasānāya sāma
translated: Bring forth for him, for the powerful one, the hymn of praise, the song of praise, the great homage.

original: yenā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ padajñā arcanto aṅgiraso gā avindan //
analyzed: yena naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pada jñāḥ arcantaḥ aṅgirasaḥ gāḥ avindan
translated: By which our ancient fathers, the Angiras, knowing the path, singing praises, found the cows.

original: indrasyāṅgirasāṃ ceṣṭau vidat saramā tanayāya dhāsim /
analyzed: indrasya aṅgirasām ca iṣṭau vidat saramā tanayāya dhāsim
translated: In the impulse of Indra and the Angirases, Saramā found the food for her young.

original: bṛhaspatir bhinad adriṃ vidad gāḥ sam usriyābhir vāvaśanta naraḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ bhinat adrim vidat gāḥ sam usriyābhiḥ vāvaśanta naraḥ
translated: Brihaspati cleft the rock and found the cows. The men rejoiced with the cows.

original: sa suṣṭubhā sa stubhā sapta vipraiḥ svareṇādriṃ svaryo navagvaiḥ /
analyzed: sa suṣṭubhā sa stubhā sapta vipraiḥ svareṇa adrim svaryaḥ navagvaiḥ
translated: He, with the seven priests with good praise, with the voice, the one to be praised with the Navagvas, with the nine.

original: saraṇyubhiḥ phaligam indra śakra valaṃ raveṇa darayo daśagvaiḥ //
analyzed: saraṇyubhiḥ phaligam indra śakra valam raveṇa darayaḥ daśagvaiḥ
translated: With the swift ones, O Indra, O Shakra, with the ten swift ones, with the sound, with the roar, thou breakest the rock.

original: gṛṇāno aṅgirobhir dasma vi var uṣasā sūryeṇa gobhir andhaḥ /
analyzed: gṛṇānaḥ aṅgirobhiḥ dasma vi var uṣasā sūryeṇa gobhiḥ andhaḥ
translated: The wondrous one, praised by the Angirases, shines forth with the dawn, with the sun, with the cows.

original: vi bhūmyā aprathaya indra sānu divo raja uparam astabhāyaḥ //
analyzed: vi bhūmyāḥ aprathayaḥ indra sānu divaḥ rajaḥ uparam astabhāyaḥ
translated: Thou hast spread out the earth, O Indra, with thy back. Thou hast set the sky in the highest region.

original: tad u prayakṣatamam asya karma dasmasya cārutamam asti daṃsaḥ /
analyzed: tat u prayakṣatamam asya karma dasmasya cārutamam asti daṃsaḥ
translated: That is the most visible of his deeds, the most wondrous, the most beautiful of the gifts of the wondrous one.

original: upahvare yad uparā apinvan madhvarṇaso nadyaś catasraḥ //
analyzed: upahvare yat uparāḥ apinvat madhu arṇasaḥ nadyaḥ catasraḥ
translated: When on the slope they swelled the four rivers, the honey-sweet waters.

original: dvitā vi vavre sanajā sanīḷe ayāsya stavamānebhir arkaiḥ /
analyzed: dvitā vi vavre sana jā sanīḷe ayāsya stavamānebhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: The two, the sister and the brother, the unborn, with hymns of praise, have opened the two doors.

original: bhago na mene parame vyomann adhārayad rodasī sudaṃsāḥ //
analyzed: bhagaḥ na mene parame vyoman adhārayat rodasī su daṃsāḥ
translated: Bhaga did not think of me in the highest heaven. The skillful one has supported the two worlds.

original: sanād divam pari bhūmā virūpe punarbhuvā yuvatī svebhir evaiḥ /
analyzed: sanāt divam pari bhūmā virūpe punarbhuvā yuvatī svebhiḥ evaiḥ
translated: From of old, the two heavens, the earth, the two dissimilar ones, the two young ones, with their own people,

original: kṛṣṇebhir aktoṣā ruśadbhir vapurbhir ā carato anyānyā //
analyzed: kṛṣṇebhiḥ akta uṣāḥ ruśadbhiḥ vapurbhiḥ ā carataḥ anyā anyā
translated: are moving, marked with black, with red forms, with each other.

original: sanemi sakhyaṃ svapasyamānaḥ sūnur dādhāra śavasā sudaṃsāḥ /
analyzed: sanemi sakhyam svapasyamānaḥ sūnuḥ dādhāra śavasā su daṃsāḥ
translated: The son, desiring friendship, supporting, with power, the skillful one,

original: āmāsu cid dadhiṣe pakvam antaḥ payaḥ kṛṣṇāsu ruśad rohiṇīṣu //🔽sanāt sanīḷā avanīr avātā vratā rakṣante amṛtāḥ sahobhiḥ /
analyzed: āmāsu cit dadhiṣe pakvam antar payaḥ kṛṣṇāsu ruśat rohiṇīṣu  sanāt sanīḍāḥ avanīḥ a vātāḥ vratā rakṣante amṛtāḥ sahobhiḥ
translated: places raw milk in the ripe, the milk in the black, the red, the tawny.🔽From of old, the two young ones, the two waters, the two winds, the two immortal ones, with their powers, guard the two vows.

original: purū sahasrā janayo na patnīr duvasyanti svasāro ahrayāṇam //
analyzed: purū sahasrā janayaḥ na patnīḥ duvasyanti svasāraḥ ahrayāṇam
translated: Many thousands, the wives, the sisters, serve the roaring one.

original: sanāyuvo namasā navyo arkair vasūyavo matayo dasma dadruḥ /
analyzed: sanāyuvaḥ namasā navyaḥ arkaiḥ vasūyavaḥ matayaḥ dasma dadruḥ
translated: The new thoughts, desiring wealth, with the ancient youth, with reverence, with new hymns, have run to the wondrous one.

original: patiṃ na patnīr uśatīr uśantaṃ spṛśanti tvā śavasāvan manīṣāḥ //
analyzed: patim na patnīḥ uśatīḥ uśantam spṛśanti tvā śavasāvat manīṣāḥ
translated: The eager wives, as to a husband, the eager one, the thoughts, O you who possess power, touch you.

original: sanād eva tava rāyo gabhastau na kṣīyante nopa dasyanti dasma /
analyzed: sanāt eva tava rāyaḥ gabhastau na kṣīyante na upa dasyanti dasma
translated: From of old thy two arms, O wondrous one, have not wasted nor have been diminished in wealth.

original: dyumāṃ asi kratumāṃ indra dhīraḥ śikṣā śacīvas tava naḥ śacībhiḥ //
analyzed: dyumān asi kratumān indra dhīraḥ śikṣa śacīvas tava naḥ śacībhiḥ
translated: Thou art the glorious, the wise, the firm one, O Indra; instruct us with thy powers, O thou of mighty deeds.

original: sanāyate gotama indra navyam atakṣad brahma hariyojanāya /
analyzed: sanāyate gotamaḥ indra navyam atakṣat brahma hari yojanāya
translated: For the ancient rite, O Indra, Gotama has fashioned a new prayer for thee, O thou whose team is tawny.

original: sunīthāya naḥ śavasāna nodhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jagamyāt //
analyzed: su nīthāya naḥ śavasāna nodhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
translated: May the bountiful one, the bestower of strength, come to us with his favour, with his wealth, early in the morning.

original: tvam mahāṃ indra yo ha śuṣmair dyāvā jajñānaḥ pṛthivī ame dhāḥ /
analyzed: tvam mahān indra yaḥ ha śuṣmaiḥ dyāvā jajñānaḥ pṛthivī ame dhāḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, art great, who by thy powers hast filled the heaven and earth at birth.

original: yad dha te viśvā girayaś cid abhvā bhiyā dṛḷhāsaḥ kiraṇā naijan //
analyzed: yat ha te viśvā girayaḥ cit abhvā bhiyā dṛḍhāsaḥ kiraṇāḥ na aijan
translated: When all the mountains, O thou of terrible strength, tremble in fear at thy roar, as at the fall of a thunderbolt.

original: ā yad dharī indra vivratā ver ā te vajraṃ jaritā bāhvor dhāt /
analyzed: ā yat harī indra vivratā veḥ ā te vajram jaritā bāhvoḥ dhāt
translated: When, O Indra, thy two yoked bay steeds are yoked, then let thy praiser place thy thunderbolt in his arms,

original: yenāviharyatakrato amitrān pura iṣṇāsi puruhūta pūrvīḥ //
analyzed: yena a viharyata krato amitrān puraḥ iṣṇāsi puruhūta pūrvīḥ
translated: With which, O thou of irresistible might, thou slayest many enemies, O thou who art invoked by many, and givest them to the young, to Kutsa, the glorious one, in the battle.

original: tvaṃ satya indra dhṛṣṇur etān tvam ṛbhukṣā naryas tvaṃ ṣāṭ /🔽tvaṃ śuṣṇaṃ vṛjane pṛkṣa āṇau yūne kutsāya dyumate sacāhan //
analyzed: tvam satyaḥ indra dhṛṣṇuḥ etān tvam ṛbhukṣāḥ naryaḥ tvam sāh  tvam śuṣṇam vṛjane pṛkṣe āṇau yūne kutsāya dyumate sacā ahan
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the true hero, thou art the one who devoureth the Rbhukṣaṇs, thou art the one who giveth men.🔽Thou, O Indra, hast helped the young, the glorious one, in the battle, to the prey, to the slaughter of the wicked one.

original: tvaṃ ha tyad indra codīḥ sakhā vṛtraṃ yad vajrin vṛṣakarmann ubhnāḥ /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad indra codīḥ sakhā vṛtram yat vajrin vṛṣa karman ubhnāḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast helped that friend, O thou of manly deeds, O thou who hast the thunderbolt, when thou didst slay Vṛtra.

original: yad dha śūra vṛṣamaṇaḥ parācair vi dasyūṃr yonāv akṛto vṛthāṣāṭ //
analyzed: yat ha śūra vṛṣamaṇaḥ parācais vi dasyūṃr yonau akṛtaḥ vṛthāṣāh
translated: When, O hero, with thy far-reaching mind, thou didst make the Dasyus, O thou of mighty thoughts, powerless in their own abode.

original: tvaṃ ha tyad indrāriṣaṇyan dṛḷhasya cin martānām ajuṣṭau /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad indra a riṣaṇyan dṛḷhasya cit martānām ajuṣṭau
translated: Thou, O Indra, when thou art not to be disregarded, even of the strong, in the strife of mortals,

original: vy asmad ā kāṣṭhā arvate var ghaneva vajriñ chnathihy amitrān //
analyzed: vi asmat ā kāṣṭhāḥ arvate var ghanā iva vajrim chnathihi amitrān
translated: Drive away from us the borderers, O thou of the thunderbolt, as with a club, crush the enemies.

original: tvāṃ ha tyad indrārṇasātau svarmīḷhe nara ājā havante /
analyzed: tvām ha tyad indra arṇa sātau svarmīḍhe naraḥ ājā havante
translated: Thee, O Indra, they invoke, O thou of mighty sway, in the battle for the prize, in the contest for heaven, O hero.

original: tava svadhāva iyam ā samarya ūtir vājeṣv atasāyyā bhūt //
analyzed: tava svadhāvas iyam ā samarye ūtiḥ vājeṣu atasāyyā bhūt
translated: Thy help, O thou of true might, in this encounter hath become irresistible in the contests for booty.

original: tvaṃ ha tyad indra sapta yudhyan puro vajrin purukutsāya dardaḥ /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad indra sapta yudhyan puraḥ vajrin purukutsāya dardar
translated: Thou, O Indra, O thou of the thunderbolt, didst burst open for Purukutsa, O hero, seven forts,

original: barhir na yat sudāse vṛthā varg aṃho rājan varivaḥ pūrave kaḥ //
analyzed: barhiḥ na yat sudāse vṛthā vark aṃhaḥ rājan varivaḥ pūrave kaḥ
translated: As the grass for Sudâs, O king, in the contest, and gavest room to Pûravas.

original: tvaṃ tyāṃ na indra deva citrām iṣam āpo na pīpayaḥ parijman /
analyzed: tvam tyām naḥ indra deva citrām iṣam āpaḥ na pīpayaḥ parijman
translated: Thou, O Indra, O god, hast sent us this wonderful food, O thou who traversest the regions, like water.

original: yayā śūra praty asmabhyaṃ yaṃsi tmanam ūrjaṃ na viśvadha kṣaradhyai //
analyzed: yayā śūra prati asmabhyam yaṃsi tmanam ūrjam na viśvadha kṣaradhyai
translated: By which, O hero, thou mayest give thyself to us, and thy strength, O lord, to be drained in every way.

original: akāri ta indra gotamebhir brahmāṇy oktā namasā haribhyām /
analyzed: akāri te indra gotamebhiḥ brahmāṇi ā uktā namasā haribhyām
translated: The prayers have been uttered to thee, O Indra, by the Gotamas, with homage to the two bays.

original: supeśasaṃ vājam ā bharā naḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jagamyāt //
analyzed: supeśasam vājam ā bhara naḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
translated: Bring us the booty, O thou of fair deeds, let the possessor of wealth come to us quickly in the morning.

original: vṛṣṇe śardhāya sumakhāya vedhase nodhaḥ suvṛktim pra bharā marudbhyaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣṇe śardhāya su makhāya vedhase nodhaḥ suvṛktim pra bhara marudbhyaḥ
translated: To the Vr̥ishni host, to him the wise, the very mighty, to the Maruts bring the hymn of praise as 'twere a well-wrought song.

original: apo na dhīro manasā suhastyo giraḥ sam añje vidatheṣv ābhuvaḥ //
analyzed: apaḥ na dhīraḥ manasā suhastyaḥ giraḥ sam añje vidatheṣu ābhuvaḥ
translated: The skilful one with mind well-skilled adorns the songs, the ever-present ones, in sacrifices.

original: te jajñire diva ṛṣvāsa ukṣaṇo rudrasya maryā asurā arepasaḥ /
analyzed: te jajñire divaḥ ṛṣvāsaḥ ukṣaṇaḥ rudrasya maryāḥ asurāḥ arepasaḥ
translated: They, the lofty ones, were born in heaven, the bulls, the spotless Asuras, the bounds of Rudra.

original: pāvakāsaḥ śucayaḥ sūryā iva satvāno na drapsino ghoravarpasaḥ //
analyzed: pāvakāsaḥ śucayaḥ sūryāḥ iva satvānaḥ na drapsinaḥ ghora varpasaḥ
translated: The pure ones, bright as suns, with life that drops not off, terrible in form, and full of manly vigour.

original: yuvāno rudrā ajarā abhogghano vavakṣur adhrigāvaḥ parvatā iva /🔽dṛḷhā cid viśvā bhuvanāni pārthivā pra cyāvayanti divyāni majmanā //
analyzed: yuvānaḥ rudrāḥ ajarāḥ abhogghanaḥ vavakṣuḥ adhrigāvaḥ parvatāḥ iva  dṛḍhā cit viśvā bhuvanāni pārthivā pra cyāvayanti divyāni majmanā
translated: The young, the undecaying Rudras, the unassailable, have waxed like mountains, irresistible.🔽They shake even all the firm abodes of earth, and by their might the dwellings of the sky.

original: citrair añjibhir vapuṣe vy añjate vakṣassu rukmāṃ adhi yetire śubhe /🔽aṃseṣv eṣāṃ ni mimṛkṣur ṛṣṭayaḥ sākaṃ jajñire svadhayā divo naraḥ //
analyzed: citraiḥ añjibhiḥ vapuṣe vi añjate vakṣassu rukmān adhi yetire śubhe  aṃseṣu eṣām ni mimṛkṣuḥ ṛṣṭayaḥ sākam jajñire svadhayā divaḥ naraḥ
translated: They deck themselves with wondrous ornaments for beauty, and on their breasts they bear bright ornaments for grace.🔽They have anointed their shoulders with unguents: the men were born together by their nature from the sky.

original: īśānakṛto dhunayo riśādaso vātān vidyutas taviṣībhir akrata /
analyzed: īśāna kṛtaḥ dhunayaḥ riśādasaḥ vātān vidyutaḥ taviṣībhiḥ akrata
translated: The impetuous ones, appointed as the Lords, the R̥ibhus, have with their powers made winds and lightnings.

original: duhanty ūdhar divyāni dhūtayo bhūmim pinvanti payasā parijrayaḥ //
analyzed: duhanti ūdhar divyāni dhūtayaḥ bhūmim pinvanti payasā parijrayaḥ
translated: The milk-streams pour the heavenly juices from the udder, and the wandering ones fill the earth with milk.

original: pinvanty apo marutaḥ sudānavaḥ payo ghṛtavad vidatheṣv ābhuvaḥ /
analyzed: pinvanti apaḥ marutaḥ sudānavaḥ payaḥ ghṛtavat vidatheṣu ābhuvaḥ
translated: The bountiful Maruts swell the waters, the milk rich in ghee, in the assemblies, the supporters.

original: atyaṃ na mihe vi nayanti vājinam utsaṃ duhanti stanayantam akṣitam //
analyzed: atyam na mihe vi nayanti vājinam utsam duhanti stanayantam akṣitam
translated: They lead the strong one to the battle, as to a goal; they milk the thundering, imperishable one.

original: mahiṣāso māyinaś citrabhānavo girayo na svatavaso raghuṣyadaḥ /
analyzed: mahiṣāsaḥ māyinaḥ citra bhānavaḥ girayaḥ na svatavasaḥ raghuṣyadaḥ
translated: The mighty ones, the magicians, of wondrous light, the self-dependent ones, the swift-moving ones, like mountains,

original: mṛgā iva hastinaḥ khādathā vanā yad āruṇīṣu taviṣīr ayugdhvam //
analyzed: mṛgāḥ iva hastinaḥ khādathāḥ vanā yat āruṇīṣu taviṣīḥ ayugdhvam
translated: When you yoke your powers in the red dawns, you devour the forests, like tigers, elephants, deer.

original: siṃhā iva nānadati pracetasaḥ piśā iva supiśo viśvavedasaḥ /🔽kṣapo jinvantaḥ pṛṣatībhir ṛṣṭibhiḥ sam it sabādhaḥ śavasāhimanyavaḥ //
analyzed: siṃhāḥ iva nānadati pracetasaḥ piśāḥ iva supiśaḥ viśva vedasaḥ  kṣapaḥ jinvantaḥ pṛṣatībhiḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ sam id sabādhaḥ śavasā ahi manyavaḥ
translated: The wise ones, like roaring lions, the all-knowing ones, like the most excellent of spirits,🔽The swift ones, stimulating the spotted spears, together with the enemies, with the resolve to win booty.🔽The heroes, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,🔽The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,

original: rodasī ā vadatā gaṇaśriyo nṛṣācaḥ śūrāḥ śavasāhimanyavaḥ /🔽ā vandhureṣv amatir na darśatā vidyun na tasthau maruto ratheṣu vaḥ //🔽viśvavedaso rayibhiḥ samokasaḥ sammiślāsas taviṣībhir virapśinaḥ /
analyzed: rodasī ā vadata gaṇa śriyaḥ nṛṣācaḥ śūrāḥ śavasā ahi manyavaḥ  ā vandhureṣu amatiḥ na darśatā vidyut na tasthau marutaḥ ratheṣu vaḥ  viśva vedasaḥ rayibhiḥ samokasaḥ sammiślāsaḥ taviṣībhiḥ virapśinaḥ
translated: The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,🔽The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,🔽The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,🔽The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,🔽The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,🔽The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,🔽The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,🔽The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,🔽The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,

original: astāra iṣuṃ dadhire gabhastyor anantaśuṣmā vṛṣakhādayo naraḥ //
analyzed: astāraḥ iṣum dadhire gabhastyoḥ ananta śuṣmāḥ vṛṣa khādayaḥ naraḥ
translated: The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly, the lords of men, the lords of wealth, the lords of power,🔽The swift ones, the wise ones, the lords of the assembly,

original: hiraṇyayebhiḥ pavibhiḥ payovṛdha ujjighnanta āpathyo na parvatān /
analyzed: hiraṇyayebhiḥ pavibhiḥ payaḥ vṛdhaḥ ujjighnantaḥ āpathyaḥ na parvatān
translated: With golden-coloured purifying streams, increasing the milk, they lift up the mountains as if they were paths.

original: makhā ayāsaḥ svasṛto dhruvacyuto dudhrakṛto maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: makhāḥ ayāsaḥ svasṛtaḥ dhruva cyutaḥ dudhra kṛtaḥ marutaḥ bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: The swift, tireless, self-moving, firmly-fixed, wondrously acting Maruts, with their radiant eyes.

original: ghṛṣum pāvakaṃ vaninaṃ vicarṣaṇiṃ rudrasya sūnuṃ havasā gṛṇīmasi /🔽rajasturaṃ tavasam mārutaṃ gaṇam ṛjīṣiṇaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ saścata śriye //
analyzed: ghṛṣum pāvakam vaninam vicarṣaṇim rudrasya sūnum havasā gṛṇīmasi  rajasturam tavasam mārutam gaṇam ṛjīṣiṇam vṛṣaṇam saścata śriye
translated: We praise with invocation the son of Rudra, the active, purifying, forest-dwelling one.🔽The swift, powerful, impetuous, mighty host of Maruts, we invoke for glory.

original: pra nū sa martaḥ śavasā janāṃ ati tasthau va ūtī maruto yam āvata /
analyzed: pra nu sa martaḥ śavasā janān ati tasthau vaḥ ūtī marutaḥ yam āvata
translated: That mortal whom you, O Maruts, have helped, has stood in his strength over the people.

original: arvadbhir vājam bharate dhanā nṛbhir āpṛcchyaṃ kratum ā kṣeti puṣyati //
analyzed: arvadbhiḥ vājam bharate dhanā nṛbhiḥ āpṛcchyam kratum ā kṣeti puṣyati
translated: With horses he wins strength, with men he wins wealth, he seeks the worshipful sacrifice, he prospers.

original: carkṛtyam marutaḥ pṛtsu duṣṭaraṃ dyumantaṃ śuṣmam maghavatsu dhattana /
analyzed: carkṛtyam marutaḥ pṛtsu duṣṭaram dyumantam śuṣmam maghavatsu dhattana
translated: O Maruts, give to the generous ones a deed to be done in battles, hard to bear, glorious strength.

original: dhanaspṛtam ukthyaṃ viśvacarṣaṇiṃ tokam puṣyema tanayaṃ śataṃ himāḥ //
analyzed: dhana spṛtam ukthyam viśvacarṣaṇim tokam puṣyema tanayam śatam himāḥ
translated: May we, a hundred winters, cherish the son, the offspring, the all-conquering, the worthy of praise.

original: nū ṣṭhiram maruto vīravantam ṛtīṣāhaṃ rayim asmāsu dhatta /
analyzed: nu sthiram marutaḥ vīravantam ṛtīṣāham rayim asmāsu dhatta
translated: Now, O Maruts, bestow upon us wealth, firm, rich in heroes, overcoming the foe,

original: sahasriṇaṃ śatinaṃ śūśuvāṃsam prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jagamyāt //
analyzed: sahasriṇam śatinam śūśuvāṃsam prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
translated: Which, increasing, a hundredfold, a thousandfold, may the wealthy one, early in the morning, come to us with his mind full of riches.

original: paśvā na tāyuṃ guhā catantaṃ namo yujānaṃ namo vahantam //🔽sajoṣā dhīrāḥ padair anu gmann upa tvā sīdan viśve yajatrāḥ //
analyzed: paśvā na tāyum guhā catantam namaḥ yujānam namaḥ vahantam  sajoṣāḥ dhīrāḥ padaiḥ anu gman upa tvā sīdan viśve yajatrāḥ
translated: Like cattle to the wolf that lies in wait, homage to him who yokes, homage to him who draws.🔽The wise ones, in accord, have come with their feet; all the priests have sat down around thee.

original: ṛtasya devā anu vratā gur bhuvat pariṣṭir dyaur na bhūma //
analyzed: ṛtasya devāḥ anu vratā guḥ bhuvat pariṣṭiḥ dyauḥ na bhūma
translated: The gods have been the guardians of holy order, the heaven is the surrounding (protection), as it were, the earth.

original: vardhantīm āpaḥ panvā suśiśvim ṛtasya yonā garbhe sujātam //
analyzed: vardhanti īm āpaḥ panvā suśiśvim ṛtasya yonā garbhe su jātam
translated: The waters have increased the swelling one, well-born in the womb of holy order.

original: puṣṭir na raṇvā kṣitir na pṛthvī girir na bhujma kṣodo na śambhu //
analyzed: puṣṭiḥ na raṇvā kṣitiḥ na pṛthvī giriḥ na bhujma kṣodaḥ na śambhu
translated: She is like prosperity, like the broad earth, like a mountain, like a pleasant spring.

original: atyo nājman sargaprataktaḥ sindhur na kṣodaḥ ka īṃ varāte //
analyzed: atyaḥ na ajman sarga prataktaḥ sindhuḥ na kṣodaḥ kaḥ īm varāte
translated: Like a horse on the racecourse, urged on, like a flood, who shall restrain him in his fury?

original: jāmiḥ sindhūnām bhrāteva svasrām ibhyān na rājā vanāny atti //
analyzed: jāmiḥ sindhūnām bhrātā iva svasrām ibhyān na rājā vanāni atti
translated: Like a brother to his sister, like a king to the forests, the kinsman of the rivers eats the plants.

original: yad vātajūto vanā vy asthād agnir ha dāti romā pṛthivyāḥ //🔽śvasity apsu haṃso na sīdan kratvā cetiṣṭho viśām uṣarbhut //
analyzed: yat vāta jūtaḥ vanā vi asthāt agniḥ ha dāti romā pṛthivyāḥ  śvasiti apsu haṃsaḥ na sīdan kratvā cetiṣṭhaḥ viśām uṣarbudh
translated: When, urged on by the wind, he has stood in the woods, then Agni burns the hair of the earth.🔽The swan sinks not in the waters, he breathes; by his wisdom he is most excellent among the people; he has eaten (the plants).

original: somo na vedhā ṛtaprajātaḥ paśur na śiśvā vibhur dūrebhāḥ //
analyzed: somaḥ na vedhāḥ ṛta prajātaḥ paśuḥ na śiśvā vibhuḥ dūrebhāḥ
translated: Soma, the measurer, born of holy order, like a young animal, all-pervading, far-reaching.

original: rayir na citrā sūro na saṃdṛg āyur na prāṇo nityo na sūnuḥ //
analyzed: rayiḥ na citrā sūraḥ na saṃdṛś āyuḥ na prāṇaḥ nityaḥ na sūnuḥ
translated: Like wealth, like the variegated (sky), like the sun, like sight, like life, like the eternal son.

original: takvā na bhūrṇir vanā siṣakti payo na dhenuḥ śucir vibhāvā //🔽dādhāra kṣemam oko na raṇvo yavo na pakvo jetā janānām //
analyzed: takvā na bhūrṇiḥ vanā siṣakti payaḥ na dhenuḥ śuciḥ vibhāvā  dādhāra kṣemam okaḥ na raṇvaḥ yavaḥ na pakvaḥ jetā janānām
translated: Like a swift one to the woods, he flows to the milk, like a pure milch cow to her calf.🔽He supports security like a pleasant home, like ripe barley, the victor of the people.

original: ṛṣir na stubhvā vikṣu praśasto vājī na prīto vayo dadhāti //
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ na stubhvā vikṣu praśastaḥ vājī na prītaḥ vayaḥ dadhāti
translated: Like a sage praised by the clans through his praise, like a delighted steed, he bestows life.

original: durokaśociḥ kratur na nityo jāyeva yonāv araṃ viśvasmai //
analyzed: duroka śociḥ kratuḥ na nityaḥ jāyā iva yonau aram viśvasmai
translated: His radiance is hard to look at, his will is eternal, like a wife in her husband's house, ready for all.

original: citro yad abhrāṭ chveto na vikṣu ratho na rukmī tveṣaḥ samatsu //
analyzed: citraḥ yat abhrāṭ śvetaḥ na vikṣu rathaḥ na rukmī tveṣaḥ samatsu
translated: When he shines forth, like a white steed in the clans, like a chariot with a charioteer, resplendent in battles.

original: seneva sṛṣṭāmaṃ dadhāty astur na didyut tveṣapratīkā //
analyzed: senā iva sṛṣṭā āmam dadhāti astuḥ na didyut tveṣa pratīkā
translated: He bestows like a commander, his thunderbolt with a resplendent appearance, his weapon.

original: yamo ha jāto yamo janitvaṃ jāraḥ kanīnām patir janīnām //
analyzed: yamaḥ ha jātaḥ yamaḥ janitvam jāraḥ kanīnām patiḥ janīnām
translated: Yama, born, Yama of the people, the lover of young women, the husband of mature women.

original: taṃ vaś carāthā vayaṃ vasatyāstaṃ na gāvo nakṣanta iddham //
analyzed: tam vaḥ carātha vayam vasatyā astam na gāvaḥ nakṣante iddham
translated: You should serve him, like cows go to their stable, to the kindled one.

original: sindhur na kṣodaḥ pra nīcīr ainon navanta gāvaḥ svar dṛśīke //
analyzed: sindhuḥ na kṣodaḥ pra nīcīḥ ainot navanta gāvaḥ svar dṛśīke
translated: Like the ocean, he has filled the low-lying areas. The cows sing for the sake of seeing the heaven.

original: vaneṣu jāyur marteṣu mitro vṛṇīte śruṣṭiṃ rājevājuryam //
analyzed: vaneṣu jāyuḥ marteṣu mitraḥ vṛṇīte śruṣṭim rājā iva ajuryam
translated: In the woods, the swift one, among mortals, Mitra, chooses to be heard, like a king, his sovereignty.

original: kṣemo na sādhuḥ kratur na bhadro bhuvat svādhīr hotā havyavāṭ //
analyzed: kṣemaḥ na sādhuḥ kratuḥ na bhadraḥ bhuvat svādhīḥ hotā havyavāṭ
translated: Like a good protector, like a fortunate sacrifice, he becomes self-controlled, the priest, the carrier of oblations.
