original: haste dadhāno nṛmṇā viśvāny ame devān dhād guhā niṣīdan //
analyzed: haste dadhānaḥ nṛmṇā viśvāni ame devān dhāt guhā niṣīdan
translated: Holding in his hand all manly powers, O god, he hath bestowed the deities, sitting in the cave.

original: vidantīm atra naro dhiyandhā hṛdā yat taṣṭān mantrāṃ aśaṃsan //🔽ajo na kṣāṃ dādhāra pṛthivīṃ tastambha dyām mantrebhiḥ satyaiḥ //
analyzed: vidanti īm atra naraḥ hṛdā yat taṣṭān mantrān aśaṃsan  ajaḥ na kṣām dādhāra pṛthivīm tastambha dyām mantrebhiḥ satyaiḥ
translated: The men have found here the thought-imparting (cows), when they have uttered the hymns fashioned in the heart.🔽The goat hath upheld the earth, the wide earth; he hath propped the sky with true hymns.

original: priyā padāni paśvo ni pāhi viśvāyur agne guhā guhaṃ gāḥ //🔽ya īṃ ciketa guhā bhavantam ā yaḥ sasāda dhārām ṛtasya //
analyzed: priyā padāni paśvaḥ ni pāhi viśvāyuḥ agne guhā guham gāḥ  yaḥ īm ciketa guhā bhavantam ā yaḥ sasāda dhārām ṛtasya
translated: Guard, O thou who hast all life, the dear feet of the cattle, O Agni, the cow in the cave.🔽He who hath known thee in the cave, who hath sat down by the stream of holy order,

original: vi ye cṛtanty ṛtā sapanta ād id vasūni pra vavācāsmai //
analyzed: vi ye cṛtanti ṛtā sapantaḥ āt id vasūni pra vavāca asmai
translated: Who have spread out the paths, who have fulfilled the truth, he hath declared to him the treasures.

original: vi yo vīrutsu rodhan mahitvota prajā uta prasūṣv antaḥ //🔽cittir apāṃ dame viśvāyuḥ sadmeva dhīrāḥ sammāya cakruḥ //
analyzed: vi yaḥ vīrutsu rodhat mahitvā uta prajāḥ uta prasūṣu antar  cittiḥ apām dame viśvāyuḥ sadma iva dhīrāḥ sammāya cakruḥ
translated: He who hath obstructed the plants with his greatness, and the offspring and the young plants within,🔽The thought of the waters, all-life, in the house, the wise have made as 'twere a seat by agreement.

original: śrīṇann upa sthād divam bhuraṇyu sthātuś caratham aktūn vy ūrṇot //
analyzed: śrīṇan upa sthāt divam bhuraṇyu sthātuḥ caratham aktūn vi ūrṇot
translated: Flowing he hath mounted the heaven, the swift one hath loosed the reins of the chariot of the standing (god).

original: pari yad eṣām eko viśveṣām bhuvad devo devānām mahitvā //
analyzed: pari yat eṣām ekaḥ viśveṣām bhuvat devaḥ devānām mahitvā
translated: When one of them hath become alone, this god by his greatness over all the gods,

original: ād it te viśve kratuṃ juṣanta śuṣkād yad deva jīvo janiṣṭhāḥ //
analyzed: āt id te viśve kratum juṣanta śuṣkāt yat deva jīvaḥ janiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Then all have approved thy will, O god, since thou hast been born as the living one from the dry (wood).

original: bhajanta viśve devatvaṃ nāma ṛtaṃ sapanto amṛtam evaiḥ //
analyzed: bhajanta viśve deva tvam nāma ṛtam sapantaḥ amṛtam evaiḥ
translated: All the gods worship the truth, seeking immortality with the waters.

original: ṛtasya preṣā ṛtasya dhītir viśvāyur viśve apāṃsi cakruḥ //
analyzed: ṛtasya preṣā ṛtasya dhītiḥ viśvāyuḥ viśve apāṃsi cakruḥ
translated: The messengers of truth, the thoughts of truth, have made all life and all deeds.

original: yas tubhyaṃ dāśād yo vā te śikṣāt tasmai cikitvān rayiṃ dayasva //🔽hotā niṣatto manor apatye sa cin nv āsām patī rayīṇām //
analyzed: yaḥ tubhyam dāśāt yaḥ vā te śikṣāt tasmai cikitvān rayim dayasva  hotā niṣattaḥ manoḥ apatye sa cit nu āsām patiḥ rayīṇām
translated: To him who gives to you or obeys you, bestow wealth, O you who know.🔽The Hotar, seated in the offspring of Manu, is indeed the lord of these riches.

original: icchanta reto mithas tanūṣu saṃ jānata svair dakṣair amūrāḥ //🔽pitur na putrāḥ kratuṃ juṣanta śroṣan ye asya śāsaṃ turāsaḥ //
analyzed: icchanta retaḥ mithas tanūṣu sam jānata svaiḥ dakṣaiḥ amūrāḥ  pituḥ na putrāḥ kratum juṣanta śroṣan ye asya śāsam turāsaḥ
translated: Desiring seed in each other's bodies, they agree with their own unimpaired powers.🔽The sons of the father delight in the sacrifice, the strong ones who listen to his command.

original: vi rāya aurṇod duraḥ purukṣuḥ pipeśa nākaṃ stṛbhir damūnāḥ //
analyzed: vi rāyaḥ aurṇot duraḥ purukṣuḥ pipeśa nākam stṛbhiḥ damūnāḥ
translated: The lord of much food has opened the doors of wealth, the one to be praised has spread the vault with his hands.

original: śukraḥ śuśukvāṃ uṣo na jāraḥ paprā samīcī divo na jyotiḥ //
analyzed: śukraḥ śuśukvām uṣaḥ na jāraḥ paprā samīcī divaḥ na jyotiḥ
translated: The bright one, shining like the dawn's lover, has extended the straight path like the light of heaven.

original: pari prajātaḥ kratvā babhūtha bhuvo devānām pitā putraḥ san //
analyzed: pari prajātaḥ kratvā babhūtha bhuvaḥ devānām pitā putraḥ san
translated: By your wisdom you have become the progenitor, the father of the gods, being the son.

original: vedhā adṛpto agnir vijānann ūdhar na gonāṃ svādmā pitūnām //
analyzed: vedhāḥ adṛptaḥ agniḥ vijānan ūdhar na gonām svādmā pitūnām
translated: The wise, undaunted Agni, knowing, is like the sweet udder of the fathers to the cows.

original: jane na śeva āhūryaḥ san madhye niṣatto raṇvo duroṇe //
analyzed: jane na śevaḥ āhūryaḥ san madhye niṣattaḥ raṇvaḥ duroṇe
translated: Being worthy of invocation in the people, seated in the middle of the house, the pleasant one in the dwelling.

original: putro na jāto raṇvo duroṇe vājī na prīto viśo vi tārīt //
analyzed: putraḥ na jātaḥ raṇvaḥ duroṇe vājī na prītaḥ viśaḥ vi tārīt
translated: A son is not born, a dear one in the house, a horse is not delighted, a strong one does not lead the people across.

original: viśo yad ahve nṛbhiḥ sanīḷā agnir devatvā viśvāny aśyāḥ //
analyzed: viśaḥ yat ahve nṛbhiḥ sanīḷāḥ agniḥ deva tvā viśvāni aśyāḥ
translated: When the people are called by men with the same desire, may Agni obtain all the states of the gods.

original: nakiṣ ṭa etā vratā minanti nṛbhyo yad ebhyaḥ śruṣṭiṃ cakartha //
analyzed: nakir ṭe etā vratā minanti nṛbhyaḥ yat ebhyaḥ śruṣṭim cakartha
translated: No one diminishes these vows for men, since you have given them to these (men).

original: tat tu te daṃso yad ahan samānair nṛbhir yad yukto vive rapāṃsi //
analyzed: tat tu te daṃsaḥ yat ahan samānaiḥ nṛbhiḥ yat yuktaḥ viveḥ rapāṃsi
translated: But that is your deed, when you have slain with equal men, when you, yoked, have dispersed the enemies.

original: uṣo na jāro vibhāvosraḥ saṃjñātarūpaś ciketad asmai //
analyzed: uṣaḥ na jāraḥ vibhāvā usraḥ saṃjñāta rūpaḥ ciketat asmai
translated: Like the dawn's lover, the light-rayed one, his form is recognized, he is thought of for him.

original: tmanā vahanto duro vy ṛṇvan navanta viśve svar dṛśīke //
analyzed: tmanā vahantaḥ duraḥ vi ṛṇvan navanta viśve svar dṛśīke
translated: Carrying themselves, they have opened the doors, all sing for the sake of beholding the light.

original: vanema pūrvīr aryo manīṣā agniḥ suśoko viśvāny aśyāḥ //
analyzed: vanema pūrvīḥ aryaḥ manīṣāḥ agniḥ su śokaḥ viśvāni aśyāḥ
translated: We will obtain many noble thoughts, may Agni, well-kindled, obtain all things.

original: ā daivyāni vratā cikitvān ā mānuṣasya janasya janma //
analyzed: ā daivyāni vratā cikitvān ā mānuṣasya janasya janma
translated: Thinking of the divine laws, of the birth of the human people,

original: garbho yo apāṃ garbho vanānāṃ garbhaś ca sthātāṃ garbhaś carathām //🔽adrau cid asmā antar duroṇe viśāṃ na viśvo amṛtaḥ svādhīḥ //
analyzed: garbhaḥ yaḥ apām garbhaḥ vanānām garbhaḥ ca sthātām garbhaḥ carathām  adrau cit asmai antar duroṇe viśām na viśvaḥ amṛtaḥ svādhīḥ
translated: The embryo of the waters, the embryo of the woods, the embryo of the standing, the embryo of the moving,🔽Even in the firm house within the mountain, all the immortal one, self-dependent, of the people.

original: sa hi kṣapāvāṃ agnī rayīṇāṃ dāśad yo asmā araṃ sūktaiḥ //
analyzed: sa hi kṣapāvān agniḥ rayīṇām dāśat yaḥ asmai aram sūktaiḥ
translated: For he is the lord of the nights, of the riches. He who gives to us a portion with his hymns.

original: etā cikitvo bhūmā ni pāhi devānāṃ janma martāṃś ca vidvān //
analyzed: etā cikitvaḥ bhūmā ni pāhi devānām janma martān ca vidvān
translated: Guard these, O thou who knowest, the abodes, the birth of the gods, and men, O thou who art wise.

original: vardhān yam pūrvīḥ kṣapo virūpā sthātuś ca ratham ṛtapravītam //
analyzed: vardhān yam pūrvīḥ kṣapaḥ virūpā sthātuḥ ca ratham ṛta pravītam
translated: Whom the many varied dawns have increased, and the chariot of the standing one, which is guarded by truth.

original: arādhi hotā svar niṣattaḥ kṛṇvan viśvāny apāṃsi satyā //
analyzed: arādhi hotā svar niṣattaḥ kṛṇvan viśvāni apāṃsi satyā
translated: The priest has been successful, seated in heaven, making all his thoughts true.

original: goṣu praśastiṃ vaneṣu dhiṣe bharanta viśve baliṃ svar ṇaḥ //
analyzed: goṣu praśastim vaneṣu dhiṣe bharanta viśve balim svar naḥ
translated: In the cows he places praise, in the woods he places strength. All bring tribute to him, to the one who is heaven.

original: vi tvā naraḥ purutrā saparyan pitur na jivrer vi vedo bharanta //
analyzed: vi tvā naraḥ purutrā saparyan pituḥ na jivreḥ vi vedaḥ bharanta
translated: Men have served thee in many ways, as the son of a father, as the son of a mother, they bring the Veda.

original: sādhur na gṛdhnur asteva śūro yāteva bhīmas tveṣaḥ samatsu //🔽upa pra jinvann uśatīr uśantam patiṃ na nityaṃ janayaḥ sanīḷāḥ /🔽svasāraḥ śyāvīm aruṣīm ajuṣrañ citram ucchantīm uṣasaṃ na gāvaḥ //
analyzed: sādhuḥ na gṛdhnuḥ astā iva śūraḥ yātā iva bhīmaḥ tveṣaḥ samatsu  upa pra jinvan uśatīḥ uśantam patim na nityam janayaḥ sanīḍāḥ  svasāraḥ śyāvīm aruṣīm ajuṣram citram ucchantīm uṣasam na gāvaḥ
translated: Like a good, greedy, sitting hero, terrible like a moving one in battles.🔽The young women, longing, quicken the longing one, the husband, as the women of a man.🔽The sisters have enjoyed the dark and red one, as the cows enjoy the variegated rising dawn.

original: vīḷu cid dṛḷhā pitaro na ukthair adriṃ rujann aṅgiraso raveṇa /
analyzed: vīḷu cit dṛḷhā pitaraḥ naḥ ukthaiḥ adrim rujan aṅgirasaḥ raveṇa
translated: Even the firm, the strong, the fathers with the hymns, the Angirases with the song, rending the rock.

original: cakrur divo bṛhato gātum asme ahaḥ svar vividuḥ ketum usrāḥ //
analyzed: cakruḥ divaḥ bṛhataḥ gātum asme ahar svar vividuḥ ketum usrāḥ
translated: They have made a path for us in the great heaven. The days have found the light, the sign of the dawns.

original: dadhann ṛtaṃ dhanayann asya dhītim ād id aryo didhiṣvo vibhṛtrāḥ /
analyzed: dadhan ṛtam dhanayan asya dhītim āt id aryaḥ didhiṣvaḥ vibhṛtrāḥ
translated: Bearing the truth, producing his thought, the noble ones, desiring, have divided.

original: atṛṣyantīr apaso yanty acchā devāñ janma prayasā vardhayantīḥ //
analyzed: a tṛṣyantīḥ apasaḥ yanti acchā devām janma prayasā vardhayantīḥ
translated: The unthirsty Apsarases go to the gods, increasing their birth with their own strength.

original: mathīd yad īṃ vibhṛto mātariśvā gṛhegṛhe śyeto jenyo bhūt /
analyzed: mathīt yat īm vibhṛtaḥ mātariśvā gṛhe gṛhe śyetaḥ jenyaḥ bhūt
translated: When he was churned, when he was held by Matariśvan, he became the white, the dear one in every house.

original: ād īṃ rājñe na sahīyase sacā sann ā dūtyam bhṛgavāṇo vivāya //🔽mahe yat pitra īṃ rasaṃ dive kar ava tsarat pṛśanyaś cikitvān /🔽sṛjad astā dhṛṣatā didyum asmai svāyāṃ devo duhitari tviṣiṃ dhāt //
analyzed: āt īm rājñe na sahīyase sacā san ā dūtyam bhṛgavāṇaḥ vivāya  mahe yat pitre īm rasam dive kaḥ ava tsarat pṛśanyaḥ cikitvān  sṛjat astā dhṛṣatā didyum asmai svāyām devaḥ duhitari tviṣim dhāt
translated: When he was with the king, more powerful than the strong one, he went as a messenger, the son of Bhṛgu, to the one who was to be awakened.🔽When the great father gave him the sap for heaven, the wise one, the speckled one, ran.🔽He sent forth the lightning to him with his own strength. The god placed his own radiance in his own daughter.

original: sva ā yas tubhyaṃ dama ā vibhāti namo vā dāśād uśato anu dyūn /
analyzed: sve ā yaḥ tubhyam dame ā vibhāti namaḥ vā dāśāt uśataḥ anu dyūn
translated: He who shines for you in his own house, or who gives homage, may he give you light for a hundred winters.

original: vardho agne vayo asya dvibarhā yāsad rāyā sarathaṃ yaṃ junāsi //
analyzed: vardha u agne vayaḥ asya dvibarhāḥ yāsat rāyā sa ratham yam junāsi
translated: Increase, O Agni, his strength, his twofold strength. May he sit with wealth, whom you lead with a chariot.

original: agniṃ viśvā abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante samudraṃ na sravataḥ sapta yahvīḥ /
analyzed: agnim viśvāḥ abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante samudram na sravataḥ sapta yahvīḥ
translated: All the oblations attend on Agni, as the seven mighty rivers on the ocean.

original: na jāmibhir vi cikite vayo no vidā deveṣu pramatiṃ cikitvān //🔽ā yad iṣe nṛpatiṃ teja ānaṭ chuci reto niṣiktaṃ dyaur abhīke /
analyzed: na jāmibhiḥ vi cikite vayaḥ naḥ vidāḥ deveṣu pramatim cikitvān  ā yat iṣe nṛpatim tejaḥ ānaṭ śuci retaḥ niṣiktam dyauḥ abhīke
translated: Do not discriminate our strength through our kinsmen. Knowing, find favor with the gods.🔽When he came to the food, to the lord of men, to the light, the pure seed was deposited in the sky in front.

original: agniḥ śardham anavadyaṃ yuvānaṃ svādhyaṃ janayat sūdayac ca //
analyzed: agniḥ śardham anavadyam yuvānam svādhyam janayat sūdayat ca
translated: Agni generated the blameless, youthful host, and made it known.

original: mano na yo 'dhvanaḥ sadya ety ekaḥ satrā sūro vasva īśe /
analyzed: manaḥ na yaḥ dhvanaḥ sadyas eti ekaḥ satrā sūraḥ vasvaḥ īśe
translated: He who alone, in a moment, comes to the path, the sun always rules over wealth.

original: rājānā mitrāvaruṇā supāṇī goṣu priyam amṛtaṃ rakṣamāṇā //
analyzed: rājānā mitrāvaruṇā su pāṇī goṣu priyam amṛtam rakṣamāṇā
translated: The two kings Mitra and Varuna, with fair hands, protecting the dear immortal (cow) among the cows.

original: mā no agne sakhyā pitryāṇi pra marṣiṣṭhā abhi viduṣ kaviḥ san /🔽nabho na rūpaṃ jarimā mināti purā tasyā abhiśaster adhīhi //
analyzed: mā naḥ agne sakhyā pitryāṇi pra marṣiṣṭhāḥ abhi viduṣ kaviḥ san  nabhaḥ na rūpam jarimā mināti purā tasyāḥ abhiśasteḥ adhīhi
translated: Do not, O Agni, surpass us in our paternal friendships, being a wise poet.🔽Old age does not destroy the form of the cloud, before that curse of ours. Remember it!

original: ni kāvyā vedhasaḥ śaśvatas kar haste dadhāno naryā purūṇi /
analyzed: ni kāvyā vedhasaḥ śaśvataḥ kaḥ haste dadhānaḥ naryā purūṇi
translated: Holding in his hand many manly things, the wise creator of all, the eternal one.

original: agnir bhuvad rayipatī rayīṇāṃ satrā cakrāṇo amṛtāni viśvā //
analyzed: agniḥ bhuvat rayi patiḥ rayīṇām satrā cakrāṇaḥ amṛtāni viśvā
translated: Agni became the lord of riches, of all riches, always creating all immortal things.

original: asme vatsam pari ṣantaṃ na vindann icchanto viśve amṛtā amūrāḥ /
analyzed: asme vatsam pari santam na vindan icchantaḥ viśve amṛtāḥ amūrāḥ
translated: The wise immortals, not deluded, seeking, did not find the calf which they had shut up with us.

original: śramayuvaḥ padavyo dhiyandhās tasthuḥ pade parame cārv agneḥ //
analyzed: śramayuvaḥ padavyaḥ dhiyandhāḥ tasthuḥ pade parame cāru agneḥ
translated: Weary, following the steps, guided by thought, they stood in the highest place of the beautiful Agni.

original: tisro yad agne śaradas tvām ic chuciṃ ghṛtena śucayaḥ saparyān /
analyzed: tisraḥ yat agne śaradaḥ tvām id śucim ghṛtena śucayaḥ saparyān
translated: When, O Agni, the pure ones, with pure ghee, have served thee for three autumns,

original: nāmāni cid dadhire yajñiyāny asūdayanta tanvaḥ sujātāḥ //
analyzed: nāmāni cit dadhire yajñiyāni asūdayanta tanvaḥ su jātāḥ
translated: They have even given thee names worthy of sacrifice, and have produced their well-born bodies.

original: ā rodasī bṛhatī vevidānāḥ pra rudriyā jabhrire yajñiyāsaḥ /
analyzed: ā rodasī bṛhatī vevidānāḥ pra rudriyāḥ jabhrire yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: The worthy of sacrifice, the Rudras, have opened out the two great worlds, the heaven and the earth,

original: vidan marto nemadhitā cikitvān agnim pade parame tasthivāṃsam //🔽saṃjānānā upa sīdann abhijñu patnīvanto namasyaṃ namasyan /
analyzed: vidat martaḥ nemadhitā cikitvān agnim pade parame tasthivāṃsam  saṃjānānāḥ upa sīdan abhijñu patnīvantaḥ namasyam namasyan
translated: The mortal man who knows, the wise one, having understood, Agni who stands in the highest place.🔽Recognizing each other, they sit down together, with the wife, worshipping, worthy of worship.

original: ririkvāṃsas tanvaḥ kṛṇvata svāḥ sakhā sakhyur nimiṣi rakṣamāṇāḥ //
analyzed: ririkvāṃsaḥ tanvaḥ kṛṇvata svāḥ sakhā sakhyuḥ nimiṣi rakṣamāṇāḥ
translated: Making their own bodies tremble, protecting the friend from the friend's glance.

original: triḥ sapta yad guhyāni tve it padāvidan nihitā yajñiyāsaḥ /
analyzed: tris sapta yat guhyāni tve id padā avidan nihitā yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: When they have understood the three times seven secret, sacrificial things, hidden in your foot,

original: tebhī rakṣante amṛtaṃ sajoṣāḥ paśūñ ca sthātṝñ carathaṃ ca pāhi //
analyzed: tebhiḥ rakṣante amṛtam sajoṣāḥ paśūm ca sthātṝm caratham ca pāhi
translated: With them they guard immortality, in unison. Protect the cattle, the standing, and the moving.

original: vidvāṃ agne vayunāni kṣitīnāṃ vy ānuṣak churudho jīvase dhāḥ /
analyzed: vidvān agne vayunāni kṣitīnām vi ānuṣak śurudhaḥ jīvase dhāḥ
translated: O Agni, knowing the plans of the people, bestow the sharp (fire) for the life of the one who follows the law.

original: antarvidvāṃ adhvano devayānān atandro dūto abhavo havirvāṭ //
analyzed: antar vidvān adhvanaḥ deva yānān atandraḥ dūtaḥ abhavaḥ haviḥ vāh
translated: Knowing well the paths that lead to the gods, you have become the untiring messenger, the bearer of the offering.

original: svādhyo diva ā sapta yahvī rāyo duro vy ṛtajñā ajānan /
analyzed: su ādhyaḥ divaḥ ā sapta yahvī rāyaḥ duraḥ vi ṛta jñāḥ ajānan
translated: The seven swift (rivers) in the sky, knowing the ways of wealth, have recognized the doors that lead to truth.

original: vidad gavyaṃ saramā dṛḷham ūrvaṃ yenā nu kam mānuṣī bhojate viṭ //
analyzed: vidat gavyam saramā dṛḍham ūrvam yena ā nu kam mānuṣī bhojate viś
translated: Saramā has found the firm udder of the cow, by which she will enjoy the human feast.

original: ā ye viśvā svapatyāni tasthuḥ kṛṇvānāso amṛtatvāya gātum /
analyzed: ā ye viśvā su apatyāni tasthuḥ kṛṇvānāsaḥ amṛta tvāya gātum
translated: Those who have stood by all their own offspring, making a way to immortality,

original: mahnā mahadbhiḥ pṛthivī vi tasthe mātā putrair aditir dhāyase veḥ //
analyzed: mahnā mahadbhiḥ pṛthivī vi tasthe mātā putraiḥ aditiḥ dhāyase veḥ
translated: The great earth has stood firm by great ones. Aditi, the mother, by her sons has stood firm to support the bird.

original: adhi śriyaṃ ni dadhuś cārum asmin divo yad akṣī amṛtā akṛṇvan /
analyzed: adhi śriyam ni dadhuḥ cārum asmin divaḥ yat akṣī amṛtāḥ akṛṇvan
translated: They have placed in him the beautiful prosperity, when the immortal ones made the eyes of heaven.

original: adha kṣaranti sindhavo na sṛṣṭāḥ pra nīcīr agne aruṣīr ajānan //🔽rayir na yaḥ pitṛvitto vayodhāḥ supraṇītiś cikituṣo na śāsuḥ /
analyzed: adha kṣaranti sindhavaḥ na sṛṣṭāḥ pra nīcīḥ agne aruṣīḥ ajānan  rayiḥ na yaḥ pitṛ vittaḥ vayodhāḥ su praṇītiḥ cikituṣaḥ na śāsuḥ
translated: The red ones, O Agni, have been known, the low ones, like created rivers, flow.🔽He who is like wealth, known by the fathers, giving life, well-guided, like an observant one's command,

original: syonaśīr atithir na prīṇāno hoteva sadma vidhato vi tārīt //
analyzed: syonaśīḥ atithiḥ na prīṇānaḥ hotā iva sadma vidhataḥ vi tārīt
translated: with a pleasant head, like a guest who is satisfied, the one who spreads out, like a priest, has spread out the abode.

original: devo na yaḥ savitā satyamanmā kratvā nipāti vṛjanāni viśvā /
analyzed: devaḥ na yaḥ savitā satya manmā kratvā nipāti vṛjanāni viśvā
translated: He who is like a god, like Savitar, whose thought is true, who with his mind overthrows all peoples,

original: purupraśasto amatir na satya ātmeva śevo didhiṣāyyo bhūt //
analyzed: puru praśastaḥ amatiḥ na satyaḥ ātmā iva śevaḥ didhiṣāyyaḥ bhūt
translated: like a true desire, much praised, has become, like a dear self, to be longed for.

original: devo na yaḥ pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyā upakṣeti hitamitro na rājā /
analyzed: devaḥ na yaḥ pṛthivīm viśva dhāyas upakṣeti hita mitraḥ na rājā
translated: He who is like a god, who moves over the earth, supporting all, like a king with friendly allies,

original: puraḥsadaḥ śarmasado na vīrā anavadyā patijuṣṭeva nārī //
analyzed: puraḥsadaḥ śarma sadaḥ na vīrāḥ anavadyā pati juṣṭā iva nārī
translated: sitting in the front, sitting in the protection, like heroes, like a woman dear to her husband, without reproach.

original: taṃ tvā naro dama ā nityam iddham agne sacanta kṣitiṣu dhruvāsu /🔽adhi dyumnaṃ ni dadhur bhūry asmin bhavā viśvāyur dharuṇo rayīṇām //
analyzed: tam tvā naraḥ dame ā nityam iddham agne sacanta kṣitiṣu dhruvāsu  adhi dyumnam ni dadhuḥ bhūri asmin bhava viśvāyuḥ dharuṇaḥ rayīṇām
translated: Thee, O Agni, the men constantly attend in the house, in the firm places, the ever-kindled one.🔽They have placed in him abundant glory. Be thou, O Agni, the life of all, the supporter of riches.

original: vi pṛkṣo agne maghavāno aśyur vi sūrayo dadato viśvam āyuḥ /
analyzed: vi pṛkṣaḥ agne maghavānaḥ aśyuḥ vi sūrayaḥ dadataḥ viśvam āyuḥ
translated: Let the rich, O Agni, the lords of abundance, be bountiful, and the princes, in bestowing all life,

original: sanema vājaṃ samitheṣv aryo bhāgaṃ deveṣu śravase dadhānāḥ //
analyzed: sanema vājam samitheṣu aryaḥ bhāgam deveṣu śravase dadhānāḥ
translated: May we win strength in battles, O thou who art to be invoked by many, and obtain a share in the glory among the gods.

original: ṛtasya hi dhenavo vāvaśānāḥ smadūdhnīḥ pīpayanta dyubhaktāḥ /
analyzed: ṛtasya hi dhenavaḥ vāvaśānāḥ smadūdhnīḥ pīpayanta dyu bhaktāḥ
translated: For the milch-cows of truth, lowing to their young, have filled the udder of the one who loves the light.

original: parāvataḥ sumatim bhikṣamāṇā vi sindhavaḥ samayā sasrur adrim //
analyzed: parāvataḥ sumatim bhikṣamāṇāḥ vi sindhavaḥ samayā sasruḥ adrim
translated: The rivers, seeking favour from afar, have flowed together to the mountain.

original: tve agne sumatim bhikṣamāṇā divi śravo dadhire yajñiyāsaḥ /
analyzed: tve agne sumatim bhikṣamāṇāḥ divi śravaḥ dadhire yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: O Agni, those who are to be worshipped have placed their glory in heaven, seeking thy good will.

original: naktā ca cakrur uṣasā virūpe kṛṣṇaṃ ca varṇam aruṇaṃ ca saṃ dhuḥ //
analyzed: naktā ca cakruḥ uṣasā virūpe kṛṣṇam ca varṇam aruṇam ca sam dhuḥ
translated: Night and Dawn have made the two dissimilar forms, the black and the red, to be joined together.

original: yān rāye martān suṣūdo agne te syāma maghavāno vayaṃ ca /
analyzed: yān rāye martān suṣūdaḥ agne te syāma maghavānaḥ vayam ca
translated: O Agni, we who are mortal, whom thou hast created for wealth, may we and our wealthy ones

original: chāyeva viśvam bhuvanaṃ sisakṣy āpaprivān rodasī antarikṣam //
analyzed: chāyā iva viśvam bhuvanam sisakṣi āpaprivān rodasī antarikṣam
translated: spread out over all the world like a shadow, having filled the heaven and earth and the atmosphere.

original: arvadbhir agne arvato nṛbhir nṝn vīrair vīrān vanuyāmā tvotāḥ /
analyzed: arvadbhiḥ agne arvataḥ nṛbhiḥ nṝn vīraiḥ vīrān vanuyāma tvotāḥ
translated: With the help of thy horses, O Agni, with the men, with the heroes, may we win the men, being urged on by thee.

original: īśānāsaḥ pitṛvittasya rāyo vi sūrayaḥ śatahimā no aśyuḥ //
analyzed: īśānāsaḥ pitṛ vittasya rāyaḥ vi sūrayaḥ śata himā naḥ aśyuḥ
translated: May the princes, the lords of the wealth of the fathers, be ours for a hundred winters.

original: etā te agna ucathāni vedho juṣṭāni santu manase hṛde ca /
analyzed: etā te agne ucathāni vedhaḥ juṣṭāni santu manase hṛde ca
translated: These hymns of thine, O Agni, O wise one, may be acceptable to thy mind and heart.

original: śakema rāyaḥ sudhuro yamaṃ te 'dhi śravo devabhaktaṃ dadhānāḥ //
analyzed: śakema rāyaḥ su dhuraḥ yamam te dhi śravaḥ deva bhaktam dadhānāḥ
translated: May we be able to enjoy thy wealth, O thou of good reins, bestowing glory, O god, upon thee.

original: upaprayanto adhvaram mantraṃ vocemāgnaye /
analyzed: upaprayantaḥ adhvaram mantram vocema agnaye
translated: Let us go forward to the sacrifice and utter our prayer to Agni,

original: āre asme ca śṛṇvate //
analyzed: āre asme ca śṛṇvate
translated: To him who hears for us afar off.

original: yaḥ snīhitīṣu pūrvyaḥ saṃjagmānāsu kṛṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ snīhitīṣu pūrvyaḥ saṃjagmānāsu kṛṣṭiṣu
translated: He who in the early dawns, in the gatherings of the people,

original: arakṣad dāśuṣe gayam //
analyzed: arakṣat dāśuṣe gayam
translated: Protected the house for the worshipper.

original: uta bruvantu jantava ud agnir vṛtrahājani /
analyzed: uta bruvantu jantavaḥ ud agniḥ vṛtra hā ajani
translated: And let the people say, Agni the Vr̥itra-slayer hath arisen,

original: dhanañjayo raṇeraṇe //
analyzed: dhanañjayaḥ raṇeraṇe
translated: The winner of wealth in every fight.

original: yasya dūto asi kṣaye veṣi havyāni vītaye /
analyzed: yasya dūtaḥ asi kṣaye veṣi havyāni vītaye
translated: Whose messenger thou art in the house, thou carriest the offerings to the feast,

original: dasmat kṛṇoṣy adhvaram //🔽tam it suhavyam aṅgiraḥ sudevaṃ sahaso yaho /
analyzed: dasmat kṛṇoṣi adhvaram  tam id su havyam aṅgiraḥ su devam sahasaḥ yaho
translated: And makest the sacrifice wonderful.🔽Him, O Angiras, the people call to the fair grass, the easy to invoke,

original: janā āhuḥ subarhiṣam //🔽ā ca vahāsi tāṃ iha devāṃ upa praśastaye /
analyzed: janai āhuḥ su barhiṣam  ā ca vahāsi tām iha devām upa praśastaye
translated: The well-praised, the bountiful, the strong.🔽And thou bringest hither the Gods to be praised,

original: havyā suścandra vītaye //
analyzed: havyā su ścandra vītaye
translated: The offerings, O thou of fair rays, to the feast.

original: na yor upabdir aśvyaḥ śṛṇve rathasya kac cana /
analyzed: na upabdiḥ aśvyaḥ śṛṇve rathasya kat cana
translated: The sound of the yoke, the sound of the horse, the sound of the chariot, I hear not at all,

original: yad agne yāsi dūtyam //
analyzed: yat agne yāsi dūtyam
translated: When, O Agni, thou goest on an errand.

original: tvoto vājy ahrayo 'bhi pūrvasmād aparaḥ /
analyzed: tvotaḥ vājī ahrayaḥ bhi pūrvasmāt aparaḥ
translated: The strong steed, urged by thee, passeth beyond the former one,

original: pra dāśvāṃ agne asthāt //🔽uta dyumat suvīryam bṛhad agne vivāsasi /
analyzed: pra dāśvān agne asthāt  uta dyumat su vīryam bṛhat agne vivāsasi
translated: The liberal one standeth by, O Agni.

original: devebhyo deva dāśuṣe //
analyzed: devebhyaḥ deva dāśuṣe
translated: And thou, O Agni, bestowest on the worshipper, on the God, the God-adoring one,🔽The glorious, the heroic, the great.

original: juṣasva saprathastamaṃ vaco devapsarastamam /
analyzed: juṣasva saprathastamam vacaḥ deva psarastamam
translated: Accept the most widely spread speech, most delightful to the Gods,

original: havyā juhvāna āsani //
analyzed: havyā juhvānaḥ āsani
translated: The offerings, O thou who art worshipped, as thou sittest.

original: athā te aṅgirastamāgne vedhastama priyam /
analyzed: athā te aṅgirastama agne vedhastama priyam
translated: Then to you, O Agni, most Angiras-like, most inspired,

original: vocema brahma sānasi //
analyzed: vocema brahma sānasi
translated: we will speak the effectual prayer.

original: kas te jāmir janānām agne ko dāśvadhvaraḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ te jāmiḥ janānām agne kaḥ dāśu adhvaraḥ
translated: Who is thy kinsman among men, O Agni, who is thy worshipper?

original: ko ha kasminn asi śritaḥ //
analyzed: kaḥ ha kasmin asi śritaḥ
translated: Who is dependent on whom?

original: tvaṃ jāmir janānām agne mitro asi priyaḥ /
analyzed: tvam jāmiḥ janānām agne mitraḥ asi priyaḥ
translated: Thou art the kinsman of men, O Agni, thou art the dear friend,

original: sakhā sakhibhya īḍyaḥ //
analyzed: sakhā sakhibhyaḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: the companion to be invoked by companions.

original: yajā no mitrāvaruṇā yajā devāṃ ṛtam bṛhat /
analyzed: yaja naḥ mitrāvaruṇā yaja devān ṛtam bṛhat
translated: Worship for us Mitra and Varuna, worship the gods, the great holy order,

original: agne yakṣi svaṃ damam //
analyzed: agne yakṣi svam damam
translated: O Agni, worship thy own abode.

original: kā ta upetir manaso varāya bhuvad agne śantamā kā manīṣā /
analyzed: kā te upetiḥ manasaḥ varāya bhuvat agne śantamā kā manīṣā
translated: What is the nearest approach of the mind to the boon? What is the most auspicious thought, O Agni?

original: ko vā yajñaiḥ pari dakṣaṃ ta āpa kena vā te manasā dāśema //
analyzed: kaḥ vā yajñaiḥ pari dakṣam te āpa kena vā te manasā dāśema
translated: And who by sacrifices has attained thy favour? By what thought of thine may we serve thee?

original: ehy agna iha hotā ni ṣīdādabdhaḥ su puraetā bhavā naḥ /
analyzed: ehi agne iha hotā ni sīda adabdhaḥ su puraetā bhava naḥ
translated: Come, O Agni, sit here as Hotar, be uninjured, a good leader for us.

original: avatāṃ tvā rodasī viśvaminve yajā mahe saumanasāya devān //
analyzed: avatām tvā rodasī viśvaminve yaja mahe saumanasāya devān
translated: May the two world-halves, all-impelling, help thee. Worship the great gods for our joy.

original: pra su viśvān rakṣaso dhakṣy agne bhavā yajñānām abhiśastipāvā /
analyzed: pra su viśvān rakṣasaḥ dhakṣi agne bhava yajñānām abhiśasti pāvā
translated: Burn up all the Raksases, O Agni, be the protector of the sacrifices.

original: athā vaha somapatiṃ haribhyām ātithyam asmai cakṛmā sudāvne //
analyzed: athā vaha soma patim haribhyām ātithyam asmai cakṛma sudāvne
translated: Then bring hither the lord of the Soma with the two bay steeds. We have performed the guest-offering to the bountiful one.

original: prajāvatā vacasā vahnir āsā ca huve ni ca satsīha devaiḥ /
analyzed: prajāvatā vacasā vahniḥ āsā ca huve ni ca satsi iha devaiḥ
translated: With the word of the prosperous one I call Agni hither, and let him sit here with the gods.

original: veṣi hotram uta potraṃ yajatra bodhi prayantar janitar vasūnām //
analyzed: veṣi hotram uta potram yajatra bodhi prayantar janitar vasūnām
translated: Thou art the Hotar, and the Potri, O thou who art to be worshipped; be thou the impeller and the begetter of treasures.

original: yathā viprasya manuṣo havirbhir devāṃ ayajaḥ kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san /
analyzed: yathā viprasya manuṣaḥ havirbhiḥ devān ayajaḥ kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san
translated: As the sage, as a man, with oblations, thou hast worshipped the gods, being a sage with sages.

original: evā hotaḥ satyatara tvam adyāgne mandrayā juhvā yajasva //
analyzed: eva hotar satyatara tvam adya agne mandrayā juhvā yajasva
translated: So, O Hotar, O most truthful Agni, with thy pleasant tongue, do thou worship today.

original: kathā dāśemāgnaye kāsmai devajuṣṭocyate bhāmine gīḥ /
analyzed: kathā dāśema agnaye kā asmai deva juṣṭā ucyate bhāmine gīḥ
translated: How shall we offer to Agni, to which mortal shall the hymn, dear to the gods, be declared?

original: yo martyeṣv amṛta ṛtāvā hotā yajiṣṭha it kṛṇoti devān //
analyzed: yaḥ martyeṣu amṛtaḥ ṛtāvā hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ id kṛṇoti devān
translated: He who, among mortals, is immortal, righteous, the Hotar, best at sacrifice, makes the gods.

original: yo adhvareṣu śantama ṛtāvā hotā tam ū namobhir ā kṛṇudhvam /
analyzed: yaḥ adhvareṣu śantamaḥ ṛtāvā hotā tam u namobhiḥ ā kṛṇudhvam
translated: Him, the most delightful, the righteous, at the sacrifices, make him with your salutations.

original: agnir yad ver martāya devān sa cā bodhāti manasā yajāti //
analyzed: agniḥ yat veḥ martāya devān sa ca ā bodhāti manasā yajāti
translated: If Agni, the mortal, were to deceive the gods, he would not be aware, he would not worship with his mind.

original: sa hi kratuḥ sa maryaḥ sa sādhur mitro na bhūd adbhutasya rathīḥ /
analyzed: sa hi kratuḥ sa maryaḥ sa sādhuḥ mitraḥ na bhūt adbhutasya rathīḥ
translated: He is the wise one, he is the mortal, he is the good, he has become like a wonderful friend.

original: tam medheṣu prathamaṃ devayantīr viśa upa bruvate dasmam ārīḥ //
analyzed: tam medheṣu prathamam devayantīḥ viśaḥ upa bruvate dasmam ārīḥ
translated: The people who are devoted to the gods call him the wondrous one, the first at the sacrifices.

original: sa no nṛṇāṃ nṛtamo riśādā agnir giro 'vasā vetu dhītim /
analyzed: sa naḥ nṛṇām nṛtamaḥ riśādāḥ agniḥ giraḥ vasā vetu dhītim
translated: May Agni, the best of men, the destroyer of enemies, accept our songs and our thought with favour.

original: tanā ca ye maghavānaḥ śaviṣṭhā vājaprasūtā iṣayanta manma //
analyzed: tanā ca ye maghavānaḥ śaviṣṭhāḥ vāja prasūtāḥ iṣayanta manma
translated: And those who are most powerful, the rich ones, urged on by strength, send forth our hymn.

original: evāgnir gotamebhir ṛtāvā viprebhir astoṣṭa jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: eva agniḥ gotamebhiḥ ṛtāvā viprebhiḥ astoṣṭa jātavedāḥ
translated: Thus Agni has been praised by the righteous Gotamas, by the priests, the all-knower.

original: sa eṣu dyumnam pīpayat sa vājaṃ sa puṣṭiṃ yāti joṣam ā cikitvān //🔽abhi tvā gotamā girā jātavedo vicarṣaṇe /
analyzed: saḥ eṣu dyumnam pīpayat sa vājam sa puṣṭim yāti joṣam ā cikitvān  abhi tvā gotamāḥ girā jātavedaḥ vicarṣaṇe
translated: He has poured forth splendor, strength, and prosperity among them, and he, the wise one, has come to his own place.🔽The Gotamas, O Jātavedas, with a song, O most active one,

original: dyumnair abhi pra ṇonumaḥ //🔽tam u tvā gotamo girā rāyaskāmo duvasyati /
analyzed: dyumnaiḥ abhi pra ṇonumaḥ  tam u tvā gotamaḥ girā rāyaskāmaḥ duvasyati
translated: We exalt you with your glories.🔽Gotama, desiring wealth, serves you with a song,

original: dyumnair abhi pra ṇonumaḥ //🔽tam u tvā vājasātamam aṅgirasvad dhavāmahe /
analyzed: dyumnaiḥ abhi pra ṇonumaḥ  tam u tvā vāja sātamam aṅgirasvat havāmahe
translated: We exalt you with your glories.🔽We invoke you, O most victorious one, like the Angirases,

original: dyumnair abhi pra ṇonumaḥ //🔽tam u tvā vṛtrahantamaṃ yo dasyūṃr avadhūnuṣe /
analyzed: dyumnaiḥ abhi pra ṇonumaḥ  tam u tvā vṛtra hantamam yaḥ dasyūṃr avadhūnuṣe
translated: We exalt you with your glories.🔽We exalt you, O best slayer of foes, who shakes off the dasyus,

original: dyumnair abhi pra ṇonumaḥ //
analyzed: dyumnaiḥ abhi pra ṇonumaḥ
translated: We exalt you with your glories.

original: avocāma rahūgaṇā agnaye madhumad vacaḥ /
analyzed: avocāma rahūgaṇāḥ agnaye madhumat vacaḥ
translated: We have spoken sweet words to Agni, the clans of Rahu,

original: dyumnair abhi pra ṇonumaḥ //🔽hiraṇyakeśo rajaso visāre 'hir dhunir vāta iva dhrajīmān /
analyzed: dyumnaiḥ abhi pra ṇonumaḥ  hiraṇya keśaḥ rajasaḥ visāre hiḥ dhuniḥ vātaḥ iva dhrajīmān
translated: We exalt you with your glories.🔽With golden hair, in the expanse of the sky, the serpent Dhuni, swift like the wind,

original: śucibhrājā uṣaso navedā yaśasvatīr apasyuvo na satyāḥ //
analyzed: śuci bhrājāḥ uṣasaḥ navedāḥ yaśasvatīḥ apasyuvaḥ na satyāḥ
translated: Purely shining, like the new dawns, glorious, far-seeing, like the true ones.

original: ā te suparṇā aminantaṃ evaiḥ kṛṣṇo nonāva vṛṣabho yadīdam /
analyzed: ā te suparṇau aminantam evaiḥ kṛṣṇaḥ nonāva vṛṣabhaḥ yadi idam
translated: Your swift birds have flown to you, the black bull has bellowed at this,

original: śivābhir na smayamānābhir āgāt patanti miha stanayanty abhrā //
analyzed: śivābhiḥ na smayamānābhiḥ āgāt patanti mihaḥ stanayanti abhrā
translated: With auspicious, not with smiling, words he came. The clouds rain down, thunder, and pour forth water.

original: yad īm ṛtasya payasā piyāno nayann ṛtasya pathibhī rajiṣṭhaiḥ /
analyzed: yat īm ṛtasya payasā piyānaḥ nayan ṛtasya pathibhiḥ rajiṣṭhaiḥ
translated: When he, being dear, is led with the milk of truth, by the most direct paths of truth,

original: aryamā mitro varuṇaḥ parijmā tvacam pṛñcanty uparasya yonau //
analyzed: aryamā mitraḥ varuṇaḥ parijmā tvacam pṛñcanti uparasya yonau
translated: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna, the swift one, sprinkle the skin in the womb of the lower one.

original: agne vājasya gomata īśānaḥ sahaso yaho /
analyzed: agne vājasya gomataḥ īśānaḥ sahasaḥ yaho
translated: O Agni, lord of wealth in cattle, powerful, O son of strength,

original: asme dhehi jātavedo mahi śravaḥ //
analyzed: asme dhehi jātavedaḥ mahi śravaḥ
translated: Bestow upon us, O all-knowing one, great glory.

original: sa idhāno vasuṣ kavir agnir īḷenyo girā /
analyzed: saḥ idhānaḥ vasuṣ kaviḥ agniḥ īḍenyaḥ girā
translated: That Agni, the kindler, the good, the wise, to be praised with song,

original: revad asmabhyam purvaṇīka dīdihi //
analyzed: revat asmabhyam purvaṇīka dīdihi
translated: Shine forth for us, O you who have many worshippers, with wealth.

original: kṣapo rājann uta tmanāgne vastor utoṣasaḥ /
analyzed: kṣapaḥ rājan uta tmanā agne vastoḥ uta uṣasaḥ
translated: O Agni, O king, by yourself, in the night, and in the morning,

original: sa tigmajambha rakṣaso daha prati //
analyzed: sa tigma jambha rakṣasaḥ daha prati
translated: Burn up the Rakshas with your sharp-toothed jaws.

original: avā no agna ūtibhir gāyatrasya prabharmaṇi /
analyzed: ava naḥ agne ūtibhiḥ gāyatrasya prabharmaṇi
translated: O Agni, with your aids, in the carrying of the Gayatri,

original: viśvāsu dhīṣu vandya //
analyzed: viśvāsu dhīṣu vandya
translated: To be worshipped in all our thoughts.

original: ā no agne rayim bhara satrāsāhaṃ vareṇyam /
analyzed: ā naḥ agne rayim bhara satrāsāham vareṇyam
translated: O Agni, bring us wealth, invincible, to be chosen,

original: viśvāsu pṛtsu duṣṭaram //
analyzed: viśvāsu pṛtsu duṣṭaram
translated: Invincible in all battles.

original: ā no agne sucetunā rayiṃ viśvāyupoṣasam /
analyzed: ā naḥ agne su cetunā rayim viśvāyu poṣasam
translated: O Agni, with good guidance, bring us wealth, nourishing all life,

original: mārḍīkaṃ dhehi jīvase //🔽pra pūtās tigmaśociṣe vāco gotamāgnaye /
analyzed: mārḍīkam dhehi jīvase  pra pūtāḥ tigma śociṣe vācaḥ gotama agnaye
translated: Bestow on us the gift of life.🔽Pure are the songs, O Gotama, for Agni, the sharp-radiant one.

original: bharasva sumnayur giraḥ //
analyzed: bharasva sumnayuḥ giraḥ
translated: Bear the songs, you who are devoted to bliss.

original: yo no agne 'bhidāsaty anti dūre padīṣṭa saḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ agne bhidāsati anti dūre padīṣṭa saḥ
translated: He who would injure us, O Agni, whether near or far away, let him be smitten down.

original: asmākam id vṛdhe bhava //
analyzed: asmākam id vṛdhe bhava
translated: Be thou for our prosperity.

original: sahasrākṣo vicarṣaṇir agnī rakṣāṃsi sedhati /
analyzed: sahasra akṣaḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ agniḥ rakṣāṃsi sedhati
translated: The thousand-eyed, most active Agni drives away the Raksases.

original: hotā gṛṇīta ukthyaḥ //
analyzed: hotā gṛṇīte ukthyaḥ
translated: The Hotar priest is to be praised, worthy of lauds.

original: itthā hi soma in made brahmā cakāra vardhanam /
analyzed: itthā hi some id made brahmā cakāra vardhanam
translated: For thus, O Soma, in the rapture, the Brahman hath made thee strong,

original: śaviṣṭha vajrinn ojasā pṛthivyā niḥ śaśā ahim arcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: śaviṣṭha vajrin ojasā pṛthivyāḥ niḥ śaśāḥ ahim arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: O thou most mighty, O thou thunder-armed, thou hast cast out the Dragon from the earth, singing according to thine own dominion.

original: sa tvāmadad vṛṣā madaḥ somaḥ śyenābhṛtaḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: sa tvā amadat vṛṣā madaḥ somaḥ śyena ābhṛtaḥ sutaḥ
translated: The strong exhilarating drink hath delighted thee, O Soma, pressed by the falcon-bearer,

original: yenā vṛtraṃ nir adbhyo jaghantha vajrinn ojasārcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: yena vṛtram niḥ adbhyaḥ jaghantha vajrin ojasā arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: Wherewith, O thou of the thunder, thou slewest Vr̥itra from the waters, with might, singing according to thine own dominion.

original: prehy abhīhi dhṛṣṇuhi na te vajro ni yaṃsate /
analyzed: prehi abhīhi dhṛṣṇuhi na te vajraḥ ni yaṃsate
translated: Come hither, come and show thy might: thy bolt is never baffled.

original: indra nṛmṇaṃ hi te śavo hano vṛtraṃ jayā apo 'rcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: indra nṛmṇam hi te śavaḥ hanaḥ vṛtram jayāḥ apaḥ rcan anu sva rājyam
translated: For, Indra, thy strength is manliness: slay thou Vr̥itra, win the waters, singing according to thine own dominion.

original: nir indra bhūmyā adhi vṛtraṃ jaghantha nir divaḥ /
analyzed: niḥ indra bhūmyāḥ adhi vṛtram jaghantha niḥ divaḥ
translated: Thou slewest Vr̥itra under earth, O Indra, and under heaven.

original: sṛjā marutvatīr ava jīvadhanyā imā apo 'rcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: sṛja marutvatīḥ ava jīva dhanyāḥ imāḥ apaḥ rcan anu sva rājyam
translated: Let loose the Marut-attended floods, these waters rich in life, singing according to thine own dominion.

original: indro vṛtrasya dodhataḥ sānuṃ vajreṇa hīḷitaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtrasya dodhataḥ sānum vajreṇa hi iḍitaḥ
translated: Indra, with his bolt, hath smitten the back of Vr̥itra as he rushed on.

original: abhikramyāva jighnate 'paḥ sarmāya codayann arcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: abhikramya ava jighnate paḥ sarmāya codayan arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: Approaching, he slays them, urging the waters to destruction, shining according to his own dominion.

original: adhi sānau ni jighnate vajreṇa śataparvaṇā /
analyzed: adhi sānau ni jighnate vajreṇa śata parvaṇā
translated: He slays them on the ridge with his hundred-knotted thunderbolt.

original: mandāna indro andhasaḥ sakhibhyo gātum icchaty arcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: mandānaḥ indraḥ andhasaḥ sakhibhyaḥ gātum icchati arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: Indra, rejoicing in the juice, desires a way for his friends, shining according to his own dominion.

original: indra tubhyam id adrivo 'nuttaṃ vajrin vīryam /
analyzed: indra tubhyam id adrivas nuttam vajrin vīryam
translated: O Indra, the bolt-wielder, thine unsurpassed heroic strength, O wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: yad dha tyam māyinam mṛgaṃ tam u tvam māyayāvadhīr arcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: yat ha tyam māyinam mṛgam tam u tvam māyayā avadhīḥ arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: When thou with thy magic didst slay that magical beast, shining according to his own dominion.

original: vi te vajrāso asthiran navatiṃ nāvyā anu /
analyzed: vi te vajrāsaḥ asthiran navatim nāvyāḥ anu
translated: Thy thunderbolts have shattered ninety-nine, following the ninety-nine streams.

original: mahat ta indra vīryam bāhvos te balaṃ hitam arcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: mahat te indra vīryam bāhvoḥ te balam hitam arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: Great is thy heroic strength, O Indra, the power is set in thy arms, shining according to his own dominion.

original: sahasraṃ sākam arcata pari ṣṭobhata viṃśatiḥ /🔽śatainam anv anonavur indrāya brahmodyatam arcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: sahasram sākam arcata pari stobhata viṃśatiḥ  śatā enam anu anonavuḥ indrāya brahma udyatam arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: A thousand have sung together, twenty have shouted around,🔽A hundred have responded to him, the prayer raised to Indra, shining according to his own dominion.

original: indro vṛtrasya taviṣīṃ nir ahan sahasā sahaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtrasya taviṣīm niḥ ahan sahasā sahaḥ
translated: Indra with his might smote away Vritra's strength, with violence the violent one.

original: mahat tad asya pauṃsyaṃ vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ asṛjad arcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: mahat tat asya pauṃsyam vṛtram jaghanvān asṛjat arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: That is his great manly deed, he set free the slain Vritra, shining according to his own dominion.

original: ime cit tava manyave vepete bhiyasā mahī /
analyzed: ime cit tava manyave vepete bhiyasā mahī
translated: Even these two great ones tremble at thy wrath, in fear.

original: yad indra vajrinn ojasā vṛtram marutvāṃ avadhīr arcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: yat indra vajrin ojasā vṛtram marutvān avadhīḥ arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: When, O Indra, O wielder of the thunderbolt, with the Maruts, thou slewest Vritra, praising thy own dominion.

original: na vepasā na tanyatendraṃ vṛtro vi bībhayat /
analyzed: na vepasā na tanyatā indram vṛtraḥ vi bībhayat
translated: Not with a trembling, not with a roar did Vritra frighten Indra.

original: abhy enaṃ vajra āyasaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭir āyatārcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: abhi enam vajraḥ āyasaḥ sahasra bhṛṣṭiḥ āyata arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: The iron thunderbolt with a thousand points struck him. Praising thy own dominion.

original: yad vṛtraṃ tava cāśaniṃ vajreṇa samayodhayaḥ /
analyzed: yat vṛtram tava ca aśanim vajreṇa samayodhayaḥ
translated: When thou with thy thunderbolt didst fight against Vritra and thy own bolt,

original: ahim indra jighāṃsato divi te badbadhe śavo 'rcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: ahim indra jighāṃsataḥ divi te badbadhe śavaḥ rcan anu sva rājyam
translated: O Indra, when thou wouldst slay the dragon, thy power was bound in heaven. Praising thy own dominion.

original: abhiṣṭane te adrivo yat sthā jagac ca rejate /
analyzed: abhiṣṭane te adrivas yat sthāḥ jagat ca rejate
translated: In thy overthrow, O wielder of the thunderbolt, when the world and the moving thing tremble,

original: tvaṣṭā cit tava manyava indra vevijyate bhiyārcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: tvaṣṭā cit tava manyave indra vevijyate bhiyā arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: Even Tvashtar is terrified at thy wrath, O Indra. Praising thy own dominion.

original: nahi nu yād adhīmasīndraṃ ko vīryā paraḥ /
analyzed: nahi nu yāt adhīmasi indram kaḥ vīryā paraḥ
translated: For thou art not to be surpassed in might, O Indra, who else is greater in hero deeds?

original: tasmin nṛmṇam uta kratuṃ devā ojāṃsi saṃ dadhur arcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: tasmin nṛmṇam uta kratum devāḥ ojāṃsi sam arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: In him the gods have placed manliness, and power, and strength. Praising thy own dominion.

original: yām atharvā manuṣ pitā dadhyaṅ dhiyam atnata /
analyzed: yām atharvā manuḥ pitā dadhyaṅ dhiyam atnata
translated: The thought which Atharvan, the father of men, and Dadhyañc, spread out,

original: tasmin brahmāṇi pūrvathendra ukthā sam agmatārcann anu svarājyam //
analyzed: tasmin brahmāṇi pūrvathā indre ukthā sam agmata arcan anu sva rājyam
translated: In him the prayers of old were gathered together, O Indra. Praising thy own dominion.

original: indro madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ
translated: Indra hath waxed for joy and strength, the Vr̥itra-slayer with the men,

original: tam in mahatsv ājiṣūtem arbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra no 'viṣat //
analyzed: tam id mahatsu ājiṣu uta īm arbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra naḥ viṣat
translated: We call on him in great battles, on him in lesser ones: may he be victorious for us in contests for booty.

original: asi hi vīra senyo 'si bhūri parādadiḥ /
analyzed: asi hi vīra senyaḥ si bhūri parādadiḥ
translated: For thou art a hero to be praised, thou art a giver of abundant spoil.

original: asi dabhrasya cid vṛdho yajamānāya śikṣasi sunvate bhūri te vasu //
analyzed: asi dabhrasya cit vṛdhaḥ yajamānāya śikṣasi sunvate bhūri te vasu
translated: Thou art the helper even of the weak: thou teachest the sacrificer. To the presser of the juice is much wealth given by thee.

original: yad udīrata ājayo dhṛṣṇave dhīyate dhanā /
analyzed: yat udīrate ājayaḥ dhṛṣṇave dhīyate dhanā
translated: When the victorious ones rise up, when wealth is assigned to the daring one,

original: yukṣvā madacyutā harī kaṃ hanaḥ kaṃ vasau dadho 'smāṃ indra vasau dadhaḥ //🔽kratvā mahāṃ anuṣvadham bhīma ā vāvṛdhe śavaḥ /
analyzed: yukṣvā mada cyutā harī kam hanaḥ kam vasau dadhaḥ smām indra vasau dadhaḥ  kratvā mahān anuṣvadham bhīmaḥ ā vāvṛdhe śavaḥ
translated: Yoke thy two Bay Steeds who drop the oil: whom wilt thou slay? whom settest thou in prosperity? O Indra, set us in prosperity.🔽By wisdom, O thou of great desire, terrible, thy strength hath grown.

original: śriya ṛṣva upākayor ni śiprī harivān dadhe hastayor vajram āyasam //
analyzed: śriye ṛṣvaḥ upākayoḥ ni śiprī harivān dadhe hastayoḥ vajram āyasam
translated: The lofty, the beautiful, hath laid in his jaws, in his hands, the iron thunderbolt.

original: ā paprau pārthivaṃ rajo badbadhe rocanā divi /
analyzed: ā paprau pārthivam rajaḥ badbadhe rocanā divi
translated: He hath filled the region of the earth: he hath bound the luminous realm in heaven.

original: na tvāvāṃ indra kaś cana na jāto na janiṣyate 'ti viśvaṃ vavakṣitha //
analyzed: na tvāvān indra kaḥ cana na jātaḥ na janiṣyate ti viśvam vavakṣitha
translated: No one, O Indra, hath been born, no one shall be born like thee: thou hast waxed strong over all.

original: yo aryo martabhojanam parādadāti dāśuṣe /
analyzed: yaḥ aryaḥ marta bhojanam parādadāti dāśuṣe
translated: He who bestows on the worshipper the food of the noble man,

original: indro asmabhyaṃ śikṣatu vi bhajā bhūri te vasu bhakṣīya tava rādhasaḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ asmabhyam śikṣatu vi bhaja bhūri te vasu bhakṣīya tava rādhasaḥ
translated: may Indra teach us: distribute thou thy very ample wealth: may I enjoy thy bounty.

original: mademade hi no dadir yūthā gavām ṛjukratuḥ /
analyzed: mademade hi naḥ dadiḥ yūthā gavām ṛju kratuḥ
translated: For in every contest he hath given us the herds of cattle, he of the straight-going thought.

original: saṃ gṛbhāya purū śatobhayāhastyā vasu śiśīhi rāya ā bhara //🔽mādayasva sute sacā śavase śūra rādhase /
analyzed: sam gṛbhāya purū śata ubhayā hastyā vasu śiśīhi rāyaḥ ā bhara  mādayasva sute sacā śavase śūra rādhase
translated: Grasp thou many hundreds, O thou whose hand wields the weapon. Sharpen the wealth: bring riches.🔽Rejoice, O hero, with the pressed (Soma) for strength and bounty.

original: vidmā hi tvā purūvasum upa kāmān sasṛjmahe 'thā no 'vitā bhava //
analyzed: vidma hi tvā purūvasum upa kāmān sasṛjmahe thā naḥ vitā bhava
translated: We know thee as having much wealth: we have sent forth our wishes to thee: then be thou our protector.

original: ete ta indra jantavo viśvam puṣyanti vāryam /
analyzed: ete te indra jantavaḥ viśvam puṣyanti vāryam
translated: These men, O Indra, all tend the universal good.

original: antar hi khyo janānām aryo vedo adāśuṣāṃ teṣāṃ no veda ā bhara //
analyzed: antar hi khyaḥ janānām aryaḥ vedaḥ a dāśuṣām teṣām naḥ vedaḥ ā bhara
translated: For within the heart of men is the treasure of the niggardly: bring us that treasure.

original: upo ṣu śṛṇuhī giro maghavan mātathā iva /
analyzed: upa u su śṛṇuhī giraḥ maghavan mā atathāḥ iva
translated: Listen, O bountiful one, to the songs, as one who is not deaf.

original: yadā naḥ sūnṛtāvataḥ kara ād arthayāsa id yojā nv indra te harī //
analyzed: yadā naḥ sūnṛtāvataḥ karaḥ āt arthayāse id yojā nu indra te harī
translated: When thou wilt come to us who have fair hymns, to give us what we long for, yoke, O Indra, thy two bays.

original: akṣann amīmadanta hy ava priyā adhūṣata /
analyzed: akṣan amīmadanta hi ava priyāḥ adhūṣata
translated: They have eaten, they have rejoiced, they have sung their dear songs.

original: astoṣata svabhānavo viprā naviṣṭhayā matī yojā nv indra te harī //
analyzed: astoṣata sva bhānavaḥ viprāḥ naviṣṭhayā matī yojā nu indra te harī
translated: The sages have praised with their newest hymn, the self-shining ones: yoke, O Indra, thy two bays.

original: susaṃdṛśaṃ tvā vayam maghavan vandiṣīmahi /
analyzed: su saṃdṛśam tvā vayam maghavan vandiṣīmahi
translated: We will praise thee, O bountiful one, O thou who art fair to behold.

original: pra nūnam pūrṇavandhura stuto yāhi vaśāṃ anu yojā nv indra te harī //
analyzed: pra nūnam pūrṇa vandhura stutaḥ yāhi vaśām anu yojā nu indra te harī
translated: Now, O thou whose chariot is well-adorned, praised, go to the house of the worshipper: yoke, O Indra, thy two bays.

original: sa ghā taṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ ratham adhi tiṣṭhāti govidam /
analyzed: sa ghā tam vṛṣaṇam ratham adhi tiṣṭhāti go vidam
translated: He mounts that strong chariot which finds the cows,

original: yaḥ pātraṃ hāriyojanam pūrṇam indra ciketati yojā nv indra te harī //
analyzed: yaḥ pātram hāriyojanam pūrṇam indra ciketati yojā nu indra te harī
translated: Yoke, O Indra, thy two tawny (horses).

original: yuktas te astu dakṣiṇa uta savyaḥ śatakrato /
analyzed: yuktaḥ te astu dakṣiṇaḥ uta savyaḥ śatakrato
translated: Let thy right and thy left (horses) be yoked, O thou of a hundred powers.

original: tena jāyām upa priyām mandāno yāhy andhaso yojā nv indra te harī //🔽yunajmi te brahmaṇā keśinā harī upa pra yāhi dadhiṣe gabhastyoḥ /
analyzed: tena jāyām upa priyām mandānaḥ yāhi andhasaḥ yojā nu indra te harī  yunajmi te brahmaṇā keśinā harī upa pra yāhi dadhiṣe gabhastyoḥ
translated: With that (chariot) go to thy dear wife, rejoicing in the juice. Yoke, O Indra, thy two tawny (horses).🔽With the guiding prayer I yoke thy two tawny (horses). Come hither. Thou shalt enjoy in thy arms.

original: ut tvā sutāso rabhasā amandiṣuḥ pūṣaṇvān vajrin sam u patnyāmadaḥ //
analyzed: ud tvā sutāsaḥ rabhasāḥ amandiṣuḥ pūṣaṇvān vajrin sam u patnyā amadaḥ
translated: The impetuous juices have delighted thee, O thou who hast many friends, O thou who hast the thunderbolt. Rejoice with thy consort.

original: aśvāvati prathamo goṣu gacchati suprāvīr indra martyas tavotibhiḥ /
analyzed: aśvāvati prathamaḥ goṣu gacchati su prāvīḥ indra martyaḥ tava ūtibhiḥ
translated: In the land of horses he goes first among the cows. Well-praised is the mortal, O Indra, through thy favours.

original: tam it pṛṇakṣi vasunā bhavīyasā sindhum āpo yathābhito vicetasaḥ //🔽āpo na devīr upa yanti hotriyam avaḥ paśyanti vitataṃ yathā rajaḥ /
analyzed: tam id pṛṇakṣi vasunā bhavīyasā sindhum āpaḥ yathā abhitas vicetasaḥ  āpaḥ na devīḥ upa yanti hotriyam avaḥ paśyanti vitatam yathā rajaḥ
translated: Him thou fillest with still greater wealth, as the waters on all sides the ocean, which have one mind.🔽The divine waters approach the Hotri. They look on the extended realm as on the sky.

original: prācair devāsaḥ pra ṇayanti devayum brahmapriyaṃ joṣayante varā iva //
analyzed: prācais devāsaḥ pra nayanti devayum brahma priyam joṣayante varāḥ iva
translated: The gods lead forward the pious man with the eastern (horses). They accept the one who loves prayer, as (good) boons (are accepted).

original: adhi dvayor adadhā ukthyaṃ vaco yatasrucā mithunā yā saparyataḥ /
analyzed: adhi dvayoḥ adadhāḥ ukthyam vacaḥ yata srucā mithunā yā saparyataḥ
translated: On the two (horses) he places the hymn-worthy speech, the two who sacrifice with uplifted ladles, the two who court (Indra).

original: asaṃyatto vrate te kṣeti puṣyati bhadrā śaktir yajamānāya sunvate //
analyzed: a saṃyattaḥ vrate te kṣeti puṣyati bhadrā śaktiḥ yajamānāya sunvate
translated: Unrestrained, he dwells in your vow, he prospers. The auspicious power nourishes the sacrificer who presses the Soma.

original: ād aṅgirāḥ prathamaṃ dadhire vaya iddhāgnayaḥ śamyā ye sukṛtyayā /
analyzed: āt aṅgirāḥ prathamam dadhire vayaḥ iddha agnayaḥ śamyā ye su kṛtyayā
translated: First the Angirases obtained life, those who have kindled the sacred fires through good deeds.

original: sarvam paṇeḥ sam avindanta bhojanam aśvāvantaṃ gomantam ā paśuṃ naraḥ //
analyzed: sarvam paṇeḥ sam avindanta bhojanam aśvāvantam gomantam ā paśum naraḥ
translated: The men have found all the food of the patron, rich in horses, cattle, and other animals.

original: yajñair atharvā prathamaḥ pathas tate tataḥ sūryo vratapā vena ājani /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ atharvā prathamaḥ pathaḥ tate tatas sūryaḥ vrata pāḥ venaḥ ājani
translated: With sacrifices, Atharvan first spread out the path. Then the sun, the guardian of vows, was born from Vena.

original: ā gā ājad uśanā kāvyaḥ sacā yamasya jātam amṛtaṃ yajāmahe //
analyzed: ā gāḥ ājat uśanā kāvyaḥ sacā yamasya jātam amṛtam yajāmahe
translated: Ushanas Kavi came with the cows. We worship the immortal one born from Yama.

original: barhir vā yat svapatyāya vṛjyate 'rko vā ślokam āghoṣate divi /
analyzed: barhiḥ vā yat su apatyāya vṛjyate rkaḥ vā ślokam āghoṣate divi
translated: When the sacrificial grass is spread out for his own prosperity, or the hymn proclaims the verse in the sky,

original: grāvā yatra vadati kārur ukthyas tasyed indro abhipitveṣu raṇyati //
analyzed: grāvā yatra vadati kāruḥ ukthyaḥ tasya id indraḥ abhipitveṣu raṇyati
translated: Where the pressing stone speaks, the poet worthy of praise, there Indra delights in the contests.

original: asāvi soma indra te śaviṣṭha dhṛṣṇav ā gahi /🔽ā tvā pṛṇaktv indriyaṃ rajaḥ sūryo na raśmibhiḥ //
analyzed: asāvi somaḥ indra te śaviṣṭha dhṛṣṇo ā gahi  ā tvā pṛṇaktu indriyam rajaḥ sūryaḥ na raśmibhiḥ
translated: The Soma has been pressed for you, O Indra, most powerful one, come to the bold one.🔽May the power of the atmosphere pervade you, Indra, as the sun with its rays.

original: indram id dharī vahato 'pratidhṛṣṭaśavasam /
analyzed: indram id harī vahataḥ pratidhṛṣṭa śavasam
translated: The two bay horses carry Indra, whose power is irresistible,

original: ṛṣīṇāṃ ca stutīr upa yajñaṃ ca mānuṣāṇām //
analyzed: ṛṣīṇām ca stutīḥ upa yajñam ca mānuṣāṇām
translated: To the praises of the seers and the sacrifices of humans.

original: ā tiṣṭha vṛtrahan rathaṃ yuktā te brahmaṇā harī /
analyzed: ā tiṣṭha vṛtrahan ratham yuktā te brahmaṇā harī
translated: Mount the chariot, O slayer of Vritra, the two bay horses yoked by prayer.

original: arvācīnaṃ su te mano grāvā kṛṇotu vagnunā //
analyzed: arvācīnam su te manaḥ grāvā kṛṇotu vagnunā
translated: May the pressing-stone with its voice make thy mind turn towards us.

original: imam indra sutam piba jyeṣṭham amartyam madam /
analyzed: imam indra sutam piba jyeṣṭham amartyam madam
translated: Drink this pressed (Soma), O Indra, the best, immortal, gladdening drink.

original: śukrasya tvābhy akṣaran dhārā ṛtasya sādane //
analyzed: śukrasya tvā abhi akṣaran dhārāḥ ṛtasya sādane
translated: The streams of the pure Soma have flowed to thee in the seat of holy order.

original: indrāya nūnam arcatokthāni ca bravītana /🔽sutā amatsur indavo jyeṣṭhaṃ namasyatā sahaḥ //🔽nakiṣ ṭvad rathītaro harī yad indra yacchase /
analyzed: indrāya nūnam arcata ukthāni ca bravītana  sutāḥ amatsuḥ indavaḥ jyeṣṭham namasyata sahaḥ  nakir tvat rathītaraḥ harī yat indra yacchase
translated: To Indra, who is to be praised, speak ye also the hymns.🔽The pressed Soma-drops have longed for the highest unconquerable might.🔽None is better than thou, O Indra, when thou givest the two bay steeds.

original: nakiṣ ṭvānu majmanā nakiḥ svaśva ānaśe //
analyzed: nakir tvā anu majmanā nakir su aśvaḥ ānaśe
translated: None hath attained to thee by speed, none by good horses.

original: ya eka id vidayate vasu martāya dāśuṣe /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id vidayate vasu martāya dāśuṣe
translated: He who alone is to be known, (to give) wealth to the mortal who offers,

original: īśāno apratiṣkuta indro aṅga //
analyzed: īśānaḥ apratiṣkutaḥ indraḥ aṅga
translated: Indra, the lord, the irresistible one.

original: kadā martam arādhasam padā kṣumpam iva sphurat /
analyzed: kadā martam arādhasam padā kṣumpam iva sphurat
translated: When wilt thou crush with thy foot the wicked man, as one would a water-snake?

original: kadā naḥ śuśravad gira indro aṅga //
analyzed: kadā naḥ śuśravat giraḥ indraḥ aṅga
translated: When wilt thou listen to our song, O Indra?

original: yaś cid dhi tvā bahubhya ā sutāvāṃ āvivāsati /
analyzed: yaḥ cit hi tvā bahubhyaḥ ā sutāvān āvivāsati
translated: He who, though thou art the best, invites thee to the drinking of the pressed (Soma) for many (men),

original: ugraṃ tat patyate śava indro aṅga //
analyzed: ugram tat patyate śavaḥ indraḥ aṅga
translated: That fierce power is to be feared, O Indra.

original: svādor itthā viṣūvato madhvaḥ pibanti gauryaḥ /
analyzed: svādoḥ itthā viṣūvataḥ madhvaḥ pibanti gauryaḥ
translated: The tawny ones drink of the sweet juice, pressed out on both sides,

original: yā indreṇa sayāvarīr vṛṣṇā madanti śobhase vasvīr anu svarājyam //
analyzed: yāḥ indreṇa sa yāvarīḥ vṛṣṇā madanti śobhase vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam
translated: Those who, most friendly with Indra, rejoice in the strong one, in the glorious one, in the prosperous one, according to his own rule.

original: tā asya pṛśanāyuvaḥ somaṃ śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ asya pṛśanāyuvaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ
translated: Those, of him, the dappled, the young in strength, mix the Soma, the dappled ones.

original: priyā indrasya dhenavo vajraṃ hinvanti sāyakaṃ vasvīr anu svarājyam //🔽tā asya namasā sahaḥ saparyanti pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: priyāḥ indrasya dhenavaḥ vajram hinvanti sāyakam vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam  tāḥ asya namasā sahaḥ saparyanti pracetasaḥ
translated: The dear cows of Indra urge on the thunderbolt, the dart, the prosperous ones, according to their own dominion.🔽Those, of him, the wise, serve his strength with reverence.

original: vratāny asya saścire purūṇi pūrvacittaye vasvīr anu svarājyam //
analyzed: vratāni asya saścire purūṇi pūrva cittaye vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam
translated: They follow his many observances, for his ancient thought, the prosperous ones, according to their own dominion.

original: indro dadhīco asthabhir vṛtrāṇy apratiṣkutaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ dadhīcaḥ asthabhiḥ vṛtrāṇi apratiṣkutaḥ
translated: Indra, with Dadhyach's bones, the Vr̥itras, unresisted,

original: jaghāna navatīr nava //
analyzed: jaghāna navatīḥ nava
translated: Slew, nine and ninety.

original: icchann aśvasya yac chiraḥ parvateṣv apaśritam /
analyzed: icchan aśvasya yat śiraḥ parvateṣu apaśritam
translated: Desiring the horse's head, which was concealed in the mountains,

original: tad vidac charyaṇāvati //
analyzed: tat vidat śaryaṇāvati
translated: He found it in Saryaṇâvati.

original: atrāha gor amanvata nāma tvaṣṭur apīcyam /
analyzed: atra aha goḥ amanvata nāma tvaṣṭuḥ apīcyam
translated: Here they have discovered the name of Tvashtar, the wondrous,

original: itthā candramaso gṛhe //
analyzed: itthā candramasaḥ gṛhe
translated: Even in the house of the moon.

original: ko adya yuṅkte dhuri gā ṛtasya śimīvato bhāmino durhṛṇāyūn /
analyzed: kaḥ adya yuṅkte dhuri gāḥ ṛtasya śimīvataḥ bhāminaḥ durhṛṇāyūn
translated: Who today yokes to the pole of Law the two swift, the beautiful, the hard to tame,

original: āsanniṣūn hṛtsvaso mayobhūn ya eṣām bhṛtyām ṛṇadhat sa jīvāt //
analyzed: āsanniṣūn hṛtsvasaḥ mayobhūn yaḥ eṣām bhṛtyām ṛṇadhat sa jīvāt
translated: The two with arrows fixed, the two with hearts of iron, the two that bring bliss? He who pays them their hire shall live.

original: ka īṣate tujyate ko bibhāya ko maṃsate santam indraṃ ko anti /
analyzed: kaḥ īṣate tujyate kaḥ bibhāya kaḥ maṃsate santam indram kaḥ anti
translated: Who is it that fears? Who is it that is struck down? Who is it that hates the present Indra?

original: kas tokāya ka ibhāyota rāye 'dhi bravat tanve ko janāya //
analyzed: kaḥ tokāya kaḥ ibhāya uta rāye dhi bravat tanve kaḥ janāya
translated: Who for his children, who for his cattle, will call on him to speak for his body, for the people, for wealth?

original: ko agnim īṭṭe haviṣā ghṛtena srucā yajātā ṛtubhir dhruvebhiḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ agnim īṭṭe haviṣā ghṛtena srucā yajātai ṛtubhiḥ dhruvebhiḥ
translated: Who kindles the fire with ghee and oblation, worshipping with the eternal rites?

original: kasmai devā ā vahān āśu homa ko maṃsate vītihotraḥ sudevaḥ //
analyzed: kasmai devāḥ ā vahān āśu homa kaḥ maṃsate vītihotraḥ su devaḥ
translated: For whom do the gods bring the swift oblation? Who, the well-worshipping, well-devoted one, desires it?

original: tvam aṅga pra śaṃsiṣo devaḥ śaviṣṭha martyam /🔽na tvad anyo maghavann asti marḍitendra bravīmi te vacaḥ //
analyzed: tvam aṅga pra śaṃsiṣaḥ devaḥ śaviṣṭha martyam  na tvat anyaḥ maghavan asti marḍitā indra bravīmi te vacaḥ
translated: You, O god, most powerful one, praise the mortal.🔽There is none other than you, O bountiful one, to be appeased. I speak these words to you, O Indra.

original: mā te rādhāṃsi mā ta ūtayo vaso 'smān kadā canā dabhan /
analyzed: mā te rādhāṃsi mā te ūtayaḥ vaso smān kadā cana ā dabhan
translated: Let not your gifts, O Vasu, nor your deliverances ever fail us.

original: viśvā ca na upamimīhi mānuṣa vasūni carṣaṇibhya ā //
analyzed: viśvā ca naḥ upamimīhi mānuṣa vasūni carṣaṇibhyaḥ ā
translated: And take notice of all human treasures and bestow them on men.

original: pra ye śumbhante janayo na saptayo yāman rudrasya sūnavaḥ sudaṃsasaḥ /
analyzed: pra ye śumbhante janayaḥ na saptayaḥ yāman rudrasya sūnavaḥ su daṃsasaḥ
translated: Those who adorn themselves like the seven maidens, the sons of Rudra, on their way, the well-looking ones.

original: rodasī hi marutaś cakrire vṛdhe madanti vīrā vidatheṣu ghṛṣvayaḥ //
analyzed: rodasī hi marutaḥ cakrire vṛdhe madanti vīrāḥ vidatheṣu ghṛṣvayaḥ
translated: For the Maruts have made the two worlds to prosper. The heroes rejoice in the assemblies, the impetuous ones.

original: ta ukṣitāso mahimānam āśata divi rudrāso adhi cakrire sadaḥ /🔽arcanto arkaṃ janayanta indriyam adhi śriyo dadhire pṛśnimātaraḥ //
analyzed: te ukṣitāsaḥ mahimānam āśata divi rudrāsaḥ adhi cakrire sadaḥ  arcantaḥ arkam janayantaḥ indriyam adhi śriyaḥ dadhire pṛśni mātaraḥ
translated: They, the Rudras, have attained greatness in the sky. They have made their seat in heaven.🔽Praising the praise, producing power, the sons of Pr̥iśni have placed themselves on the glories.

original: gomātaro yac chubhayante añjibhis tanūṣu śubhrā dadhire virukmataḥ /
analyzed: go mātaraḥ yat śubhayante añjibhiḥ tanūṣu śubhrāḥ dadhire virukmataḥ
translated: When the cow-mothers shine with their ornaments, they have placed on their bodies the bright, variegated ornaments.

original: bādhante viśvam abhimātinam apa vartmāny eṣām anu rīyate ghṛtam //
analyzed: bādhante viśvam abhimātinam apa vartmāni eṣām anu rīyate ghṛtam
translated: They obstruct the one who hates them on every side; their paths are followed by the flowing of ghee.

original: vi ye bhrājante sumakhāsa ṛṣṭibhiḥ pracyāvayanto acyutā cid ojasā /🔽manojuvo yan maruto ratheṣv ā vṛṣavrātāsaḥ pṛṣatīr ayugdhvam //
analyzed: vi ye bhrājante su makhāsaḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ pracyāvayantaḥ acyutā cit ojasā  manaḥ juvaḥ yat marutaḥ ratheṣu ā vṛṣa vrātāsaḥ pṛṣatīḥ ayugdhvam
translated: Those who shine forth with their sharp weapons in good battles, shaking even what is unshaken by their strength,🔽When, O Maruts, you, swift as thought, have yoked to your chariots your spotted deer, O you who are praised by heroes.

original: pra yad ratheṣu pṛṣatīr ayugdhvaṃ vāje adrim maruto raṃhayantaḥ /
analyzed: pra yat ratheṣu pṛṣatīḥ ayugdhvam vāje adrim marutaḥ raṃhayantaḥ
translated: When you have yoked to your chariots your spotted deer, urging on the stone in the race, O Maruts,

original: utāruṣasya vi ṣyanti dhārāś carmevodabhir vy undanti bhūma //
analyzed: uta aruṣasya vi syanti dhārāḥ carmā iva udabhiḥ vi undanti bhūma
translated: And the streams of the impetuous one flow apart, they moisten the ground as with hides.

original: ā vo vahantu saptayo raghuṣyado raghupatvānaḥ pra jigāta bāhubhiḥ /
analyzed: ā vaḥ vahantu saptayaḥ raghuṣyadaḥ raghu patvānaḥ pra jigāta bāhubhiḥ
translated: Let your swift-moving chariots, O you who have swift horses, carry you; go forth with your arms.

original: sīdatā barhir uru vaḥ sadas kṛtam mādayadhvam maruto madhvo andhasaḥ //
analyzed: sīdata ā barhiḥ uru vaḥ sadaḥ kṛtam mādayadhvam marutaḥ madhvaḥ andhasaḥ
translated: Sit on the wide seat prepared on the sacred grass; rejoice, O Maruts, in the sweet juice.

original: te 'vardhanta svatavaso mahitvanā nākaṃ tasthur uru cakrire sadaḥ /
analyzed: te vardhanta svatavasaḥ mahitvanā nākam tasthuḥ uru cakrire sadaḥ
translated: They have grown, the self-powerful ones, through greatness; they have stood in the vault, they have made a wide seat.

original: viṣṇur yad dhāvad vṛṣaṇam madacyutaṃ vayo na sīdann adhi barhiṣi priye //
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ yat dhāvat vṛṣaṇam mada cyutam vayaḥ na sīdan adhi barhiṣi priye
translated: When Vishnu ran, the strong one who delights in intoxication, he sat down on the dear sacrificial grass.

original: śūrā ived yuyudhayo na jagmayaḥ śravasyavo na pṛtanāsu yetire /
analyzed: śūrāḥ iva id yuyudhayaḥ na jagmayaḥ śravasyavaḥ na pṛtanāsu yetire
translated: They are like heroes in battle, not to be turned back; they have gone forth in battles, seeking glory.

original: bhayante viśvā bhuvanā marudbhyo rājāna iva tveṣasaṃdṛśo naraḥ //
analyzed: bhayante viśvā bhuvanā marudbhyaḥ rājānaḥ iva tveṣa saṃdṛśaḥ naraḥ
translated: All beings fear the Maruts, as men do kings whose appearance is terrible.

original: tvaṣṭā yad vajraṃ sukṛtaṃ hiraṇyayaṃ sahasrabhṛṣṭiṃ svapā avartayat /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā yat vajram su kṛtam hiraṇyayam sahasra bhṛṣṭim su apāḥ avartayat
translated: When Tvashtar turned the well-fashioned thunderbolt of a thousand edges, made of gold,

original: dhatta indro nary apāṃsi kartave 'han vṛtraṃ nir apām aubjad arṇavam //
analyzed: dhatte indraḥ apāṃsi kartave han vṛtram niḥ apām aubjat arṇavam
translated: Indra held it to perform manly deeds; he slew Vritra and opened the flood-gates of the waters.

original: ūrdhvaṃ nunudre 'vataṃ ta ojasā dādṛhāṇaṃ cid bibhidur vi parvatam /
analyzed: ūrdhvam nunudre vatam te ojasā dādṛhāṇam cit bibhiduḥ vi parvatam
translated: They drove away the downward stream with their might; they cleft the mountain, though it seemed firmly fixed.

original: dhamanto vāṇam marutaḥ sudānavo made somasya raṇyāni cakrire //
analyzed: dhamantaḥ vāṇam marutaḥ sudānavaḥ made somasya raṇyāni cakrire
translated: The bountiful Maruts, blowing the wind, in the rapture of Soma, have made delightful things.

original: jihmaṃ nunudre 'vataṃ tayā diśāsiñcann utsaṃ gotamāya tṛṣṇaje /
analyzed: jihmam nunudre vatam tayā diśā asiñcan utsam gotamāya tṛṣṇaje
translated: They drove away the crooked downward stream; they caused the spring to flow for Tṛṣṇaja Gotama.

original: ā gacchantīm avasā citrabhānavaḥ kāmaṃ viprasya tarpayanta dhāmabhiḥ //
analyzed: ā gacchanti īm avasā citra bhānavaḥ kāmam viprasya tarpayanta dhāmabhiḥ
translated: The Maruts, of wondrous light, coming with help, satisfy the longing of the sage with their own powers.

original: yā vaḥ śarma śaśamānāya santi tridhātūni dāśuṣe yacchatādhi /
analyzed: yā vaḥ śarma śaśamānāya santi tri dhātūni dāśuṣe yacchata adhi
translated: Those protections of yours which are for the worshipper, grant to the worshipper in threefold measure.

original: asmabhyaṃ tāni maruto vi yanta rayiṃ no dhatta vṛṣaṇaḥ suvīram //
analyzed: asmabhyam tāni marutaḥ vi yanta rayim naḥ dhatta vṛṣaṇaḥ su vīram
translated: O Maruts, grant us those; O mighty ones, bestow on us wealth with noble heroes.

original: maruto yasya hi kṣaye pāthā divo vimahasaḥ /
analyzed: marutaḥ yasya hi kṣaye pāthāḥ divaḥ vimahasaḥ
translated: O Maruts, he whose abode is in the wide firmament of heaven,

original: sa sugopātamo janaḥ //
analyzed: sa sugopātamaḥ janaḥ
translated: He is the most prosperous of men.

original: yajñair vā yajñavāhaso viprasya vā matīnām /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ vā yajña vāhasaḥ viprasya vā matīnām
translated: Or the sacrificer's, O you who carry the sacrifice, or the sage's, O you who carry the sacrifice,

original: marutaḥ śṛṇutā havam //
analyzed: marutaḥ śṛṇutā havam
translated: O Maruts, listen to the call.

original: uta vā yasya vājino 'nu vipram atakṣata /
analyzed: uta vā yasya vājinaḥ nu vipram atakṣata
translated: Or of him whom you, O strong ones, have fashioned after the sage,

original: sa gantā gomati vraje //
analyzed: sa gantā gomati vraje
translated: He will go to the cow-rich abode.

original: asya vīrasya barhiṣi sutaḥ somo diviṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: asya vīrasya barhiṣi sutaḥ somaḥ diviṣṭiṣu
translated: On the grass of this hero, Soma is pressed at the feasts in heaven,

original: uktham madaś ca śasyate //
analyzed: uktham madaḥ ca śasyate
translated: And praise and joy are extolled.

original: asya śroṣantv ā bhuvo viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhi /
analyzed: asya śroṣantu ā bhuvaḥ viśvāḥ yaḥ carṣaṇīḥ abhi
translated: May all the people hear his call, who is over all the people,

original: sūraṃ cit sasruṣīr iṣaḥ //
analyzed: sūram cit sasruṣīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: Even the rushing streams of the sun.

original: pūrvībhir hi dadāśima śaradbhir maruto vayam /
analyzed: pūrvībhiḥ hi dadāśima śaradbhiḥ marutaḥ vayam
translated: For with many, O Maruts, with the autumn months, we have sought help,

original: avobhiś carṣaṇīnām //
analyzed: avobhiḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: And with the calls of the people.

original: subhagaḥ sa prayajyavo maruto astu martyaḥ /
analyzed: subhagaḥ sa prayajyavaḥ marutaḥ astu martyaḥ
translated: May that mortal be prosperous, O you who are to be worshipped, O Maruts,

original: yasya prayāṃsi parṣatha //
analyzed: yasya prayāṃsi parṣatha
translated: Whose prayers you further.

original: śaśamānasya vā naraḥ svedasya satyaśavasaḥ /
analyzed: śaśamānasya vā naraḥ svedasya satya śavasaḥ
translated: Of the toiling man, O heroes, of the sweating one of true strength,

original: vidā kāmasya venataḥ //
analyzed: vidā kāmasya venataḥ
translated: Know the desire of the eager one.

original: yūyaṃ tat satyaśavasa āviṣ karta mahitvanā /
analyzed: yūyam tat satya śavasaḥ āvis karta mahitvanā
translated: That, O you of true strength, you must reveal through your greatness,

original: vidhyatā vidyutā rakṣaḥ //
analyzed: vidhyatā vidyutā rakṣaḥ
translated: Strike the Raksasa with the lightning.

original: gūhatā guhyaṃ tamo vi yāta viśvam atriṇam /
analyzed: gūhata guhyam tamaḥ vi yāta viśvam atriṇam
translated: Hide the hidden darkness, destroy all the devourers,

original: jyotiṣ kartā yad uśmasi //
analyzed: jyotiḥ kartā yat uśmasi
translated: Make the light, for that we long.

original: pratvakṣasaḥ pratavaso virapśino 'nānatā avithurā ṛjīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: pratvakṣasaḥ pratavasaḥ virapśinaḥ nānatāḥ avithurāḥ ṛjīṣiṇaḥ
translated: With broad chests, impetuous, with wide mouths, not bent, not feeble, vigorous,

original: juṣṭatamāso nṛtamāso añjibhir vy ānajre ke cid usrā iva stṛbhiḥ //
analyzed: juṣṭatamāsaḥ nṛtamāsaḥ añjibhiḥ vi ānajre ke cit usrāḥ iva stṛbhiḥ
translated: Most acceptable, most delightful, with their ornaments, some have shone forth like the rays of the sun.

original: upahvareṣu yad acidhvaṃ yayiṃ vaya iva marutaḥ kena cit pathā /
analyzed: upahvareṣu yat acidhvam yayim vayaḥ iva marutaḥ kena cit pathā
translated: When ye have gone on the heights, O Maruts, like birds on some path,

original: ścotanti kośā upa vo ratheṣv ā ghṛtam ukṣatā madhuvarṇam arcate //
analyzed: ścotanti kośāḥ upa vaḥ ratheṣu ā ghṛtam ukṣata madhu varṇam arcate
translated: The reservoirs drip for you on your chariots; pour out ghee, of the colour of honey, to the worshipper.

original: praiṣām ajmeṣu vithureva rejate bhūmir yāmeṣu yad dha yuñjate śubhe /
analyzed: pra eṣām ajmeṣu vithurā iva rejate bhūmiḥ yāmeṣu yat ha yuñjate śubhe
translated: The earth trembles, as it were, at the ends of their paths, when they yoke the auspicious (chariots).

original: te krīḷayo dhunayo bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ svayam mahitvam panayanta dhūtayaḥ //🔽sa hi svasṛt pṛṣadaśvo yuvā gaṇo 'yā īśānas taviṣībhir āvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: te krīḍayaḥ dhunayaḥ bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ svayam mahitvam panayanta dhūtayaḥ  sa hi svasṛt pṛṣat aśvaḥ yuvā gaṇaḥ yāḥ īśānaḥ taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtaḥ
translated: They, the playful, shaking (them), with eyes shining brightly, the impetuous ones, exalt their own greatness.🔽For he is the leader, with dappled horses, the young troop, come hither, surrounded by his powers, the lord.

original: asi satya ṛṇayāvānedyo 'syā dhiyaḥ prāvitāthā vṛṣā gaṇaḥ //
analyzed: asi satyaḥ ṛṇayāvā anedyaḥ syāḥ dhiyaḥ prāvitā athā vṛṣā gaṇaḥ
translated: Thou art true, O creditor, uninjured, the forerunner of these thoughts, then the bull, the troop.

original: pituḥ pratnasya janmanā vadāmasi somasya jihvā pra jigāti cakṣasā /
analyzed: pituḥ pratnasya janmanā vadāmasi somasya jihvā pra jigāti cakṣasā
translated: We speak by the birth of the ancient father; the tongue of Soma moves with its eye.

original: yad īm indraṃ śamy ṛkvāṇa āśatād in nāmāni yajñiyāni dadhire //
analyzed: yat īm indram śamī ṛkvāṇaḥ āśata āt id nāmāni yajñiyāni dadhire
translated: When the Rkv-s and Sham-s have approached Indra, they have taken on themselves sacrificial names.

original: śriyase kam bhānubhiḥ sam mimikṣire te raśmibhis ta ṛkvabhiḥ sukhādayaḥ /
analyzed: śriyase kam bhānubhiḥ sam mimikṣire te raśmibhiḥ te ṛkvabhiḥ su khādayaḥ
translated: They have mingled together for glory with the beams; they, the Sukra-s, with the rays, with the Rkv-s.

original: te vāśīmanta iṣmiṇo abhīravo vidre priyasya mārutasya dhāmnaḥ //
analyzed: te vāśīmantaḥ iṣmiṇaḥ abhīravaḥ vidre priyasya mārutasya dhāmnaḥ
translated: They, with swords in their hands, impetuous, fearless, have entered the dear abode of the Maruts.

original: ā vidyunmadbhir marutaḥ svarkai rathebhir yāta ṛṣṭimadbhir aśvaparṇaiḥ /
analyzed: ā vidyunmadbhiḥ marutaḥ su arkaiḥ rathebhiḥ yāta ṛṣṭimadbhiḥ aśva parṇaiḥ
translated: O Maruts, come with your lightning-flashing, self-shining chariots, with your sharp-edged, winged horses.

original: ā varṣiṣṭhayā na iṣā vayo na paptatā sumāyāḥ //🔽te 'ruṇebhir varam ā piśaṅgaiḥ śubhe kaṃ yānti rathatūrbhir aśvaiḥ /
analyzed: ā varṣiṣṭhayā naḥ iṣā vayaḥ na paptata su māyāḥ  te ruṇebhiḥ varam ā piśaṅgaiḥ śubhe kam yānti rathatūrbhiḥ aśvaiḥ
translated: With your highest food, like birds, fly to us, O you of good magic.🔽With their ruddy, excellent, tawny, beautiful horses, with their chariot-teams, they go to (their goal).

original: rukmo na citraḥ svadhitīvān pavyā rathasya jaṅghananta bhūma //🔽śriye kaṃ vo adhi tanūṣu vāśīr medhā vanā na kṛṇavanta ūrdhvā /
analyzed: rukmaḥ na citraḥ svadhitīvān pavyā rathasya jaṅghananta bhūma  śriye kam vaḥ adhi tanūṣu vāśīḥ medhāḥ vanā na kṛṇavanta ūrdhvā
translated: Like a variegated gold ornament, the wheels of the chariot crush the earth.🔽For glory, O Maruts, do you place the sword on your bodies, and make your thoughts rise up like trees.

original: yuṣmabhyaṃ kam marutaḥ sujātās tuvidyumnāso dhanayante adrim //
analyzed: yuṣmabhyam kam marutaḥ su jātāḥ tuvidyumnāsaḥ dhanayante adrim
translated: For you, O Maruts, the well-born ones with great splendor, they prepare the stone.

original: ahāni gṛdhrāḥ pary ā va āgur imāṃ dhiyaṃ vārkāryāṃ ca devīm /🔽brahma kṛṇvanto gotamāso arkair ūrdhvaṃ nunudra utsadhim pibadhyai //
analyzed: ahāni gṛdhrāḥ pari ā vaḥ āguḥ imām dhiyam vārkāryām ca devīm  brahma kṛṇvantaḥ gotamāsaḥ arkaiḥ ūrdhvam nunudre utsadhim pibadhyai
translated: The days and the vultures have come to you, to this thought and to the divine Varkari.🔽The Gotamas, making prayer with their hymns, have raised the spring for you to drink.

original: etat tyan na yojanam aceti sasvar ha yan maruto gotamo vaḥ /
analyzed: etat tyad na yojanam aceti sasvar ha yat marutaḥ gotamaḥ vaḥ
translated: This yoke of yours, O Maruts, has been yoked, O Maruts, when Gotama saw you, he went to heaven.

original: paśyan hiraṇyacakrān ayodaṃṣṭrān vidhāvato varāhūn //
analyzed: paśyan hiraṇya cakrān ayaḥ daṃṣṭrān vidhāvataḥ varāhūn
translated: Looking at the boars with golden wheels and iron tusks running (away).

original: eṣā syā vo maruto 'nubhartrī prati ṣṭobhati vāghato na vāṇī /
analyzed: eṣā syā vaḥ marutaḥ nubhartrī prati stobhati vāghataḥ na vāṇī
translated: This, O Maruts, should be your companion, the singer's voice resounds like a priest's.

original: astobhayad vṛthāsām anu svadhāṃ gabhastyoḥ //
analyzed: astobhayat vṛthā āsām anu svadhām gabhastyoḥ
