translated: It has resounded for the barren cow according to its nature in the arms.

original: ā no bhadrāḥ kratavo yantu viśvato 'dabdhāso aparītāsa udbhidaḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ bhadrāḥ kratavaḥ yantu viśvatas dabdhāsaḥ aparītāsaḥ udbhidaḥ
translated: May our good thoughts come to us from all sides, infallible, uninjured, springing up.

original: devā no yathā sadam id vṛdhe asann aprāyuvo rakṣitāro divedive //
analyzed: devāḥ naḥ yathā sadam id vṛdhe asan aprāyuvaḥ rakṣitāraḥ dive dive
translated: May the gods be to us as ever for prosperity, unwearied guardians day by day.

original: devānām bhadrā sumatir ṛjūyatāṃ devānāṃ rātir abhi no ni vartatām /
analyzed: devānām bhadrā sumatiḥ ṛjūyatām devānām rātiḥ abhi naḥ ni vartatām
translated: May the good favour of the gods be directed to us, may the gift of the gods turn unto us.

original: devānāṃ sakhyam upa sedimā vayaṃ devā na āyuḥ pra tirantu jīvase //
analyzed: devānām sakhyam upa sedimā vayam devāḥ naḥ āyuḥ pra tirantu jīvase
translated: We have approached the friendship of the gods. May the gods prolong our life that we may live.

original: tān pūrvayā nividā hūmahe vayam bhagam mitram aditiṃ dakṣam asridham /
analyzed: tān pūrvayā nividā hūmahe vayam bhagam mitram aditim dakṣam asridham
translated: We invoke them with this ancient invitation, Bhaga, Mitra, Aditi, the blameless Daksha,

original: aryamaṇaṃ varuṇaṃ somam aśvinā sarasvatī naḥ subhagā mayas karat //
analyzed: aryamaṇam varuṇam somam aśvinā sarasvatī naḥ subhagā mayaḥ karat
translated: Aryaman, Varuna, Soma, the two Asvins. May Sarasvati make us prosperous.

original: tan no vāto mayobhu vātu bheṣajaṃ tan mātā pṛthivī tat pitā dyauḥ /
analyzed: tat naḥ vātaḥ mayobhu vātu bheṣajam tat mātā pṛthivī tat pitā dyauḥ
translated: May the wind blow for us that healing medicine, that, O mother earth, and that, O father sky.

original: tad grāvāṇaḥ somasuto mayobhuvas tad aśvinā śṛṇutaṃ dhiṣṇyā yuvam //
analyzed: tat grāvāṇaḥ soma sutaḥ mayobhuvaḥ tat aśvinā śṛṇutam dhiṣṇyā yuvam
translated: That, O pressing-stones, that are beneficent when Soma is pressed, that, O Asvins, do ye listen to, ye who are to be invoked.

original: tam īśānaṃ jagatas tasthuṣas patiṃ dhiyañjinvam avase hūmahe vayam /🔽pūṣā no yathā vedasām asad vṛdhe rakṣitā pāyur adabdhaḥ svastaye //
analyzed: tam īśānam jagataḥ tasthuṣas patim dhiyañjinvam avase hūmahe vayam  pūṣā naḥ yathā vedasām asat vṛdhe rakṣitā pāyuḥ adabdhaḥ svastaye
translated: Him, the Lord, the Ruler of the world that stands, the inspirer of the thought, we call to aid.🔽May Pûshan be to us a good increaser, a guard, a guardian, unassailable, for bliss.

original: svasti na indro vṛddhaśravāḥ svasti naḥ pūṣā viśvavedāḥ /
analyzed: svasti naḥ indraḥ vṛddha śravāḥ svasti naḥ pūṣā viśva vedāḥ
translated: May Indra, of great glory, be gracious to us: may Pûshan, who possesseth all, prosper us well.

original: svasti nas tārkṣyo ariṣṭanemiḥ svasti no bṛhaspatir dadhātu //
analyzed: svasti naḥ tārkṣyaḥ ariṣṭa nemiḥ svasti naḥ bṛhaspatiḥ dadhātu
translated: May Târkshya, whose car-wheels move not, protect us: may Brihaspati vouchsafe us happiness.

original: pṛṣadaśvā marutaḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhaṃyāvāno vidatheṣu jagmayaḥ /
analyzed: pṛṣat aśvāḥ marutaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ śubhaṃyāvānaḥ vidatheṣu jagmayaḥ
translated: The Maruts, whose steeds are dappled, whose mother is spotted, who are of fair appearance, who move in assemblies, who go on their way to the sacrifices,

original: agnijihvā manavaḥ sūracakṣaso viśve no devā avasā gamann iha //
analyzed: agni jihvāḥ manavaḥ sūra cakṣasaḥ viśve naḥ devāḥ avasā gaman iha
translated: The mind-born sons of Agni, whose eyes are the sun, may all the Gods come hither to us for our help.

original: bhadraṃ karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devā bhadram paśyemākṣabhir yajatrāḥ /
analyzed: bhadram karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devāḥ bhadram paśyema akṣabhiḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: With our ears may we hear what is good, O ye Gods: with our eyes may we behold what is good, O ye Holy Ones.

original: sthirair aṅgais tuṣṭuvāṃsas tanūbhir vy aśema devahitaṃ yad āyuḥ //
analyzed: sthiraiḥ aṅgaiḥ tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ tanūbhiḥ vi aśema deva hitam yat āyuḥ
translated: With firm limbs and bodies may we glorify God, and enjoy the full term of life appointed by the Gods.

original: śatam in nu śarado anti devā yatrā naś cakrā jarasaṃ tanūnām /
analyzed: śatam id nu śaradaḥ anti devāḥ yatrā naḥ cakrā jarasam tanūnām
translated: A hundred winters yet, O ye Gods, remain to us, where we may form our bodies into old age.

original: putrāso yatra pitaro bhavanti mā no madhyā rīriṣatāyur gantoḥ //
analyzed: putrāsaḥ yatra pitaraḥ bhavanti mā naḥ madhyā rīriṣata āyuḥ gantoḥ
translated: Where our sons shall become fathers, go not away, leaving us in the middle of our days.

original: aditir dyaur aditir antarikṣam aditir mātā sa pitā sa putraḥ /
analyzed: aditiḥ dyauḥ aditiḥ antarikṣam aditiḥ mātā sa pitā sa putraḥ
translated: Aditi is the sky, Aditi is the atmosphere, Aditi is the mother, he is the father, he is the son.

original: viśve devā aditiḥ pañca janā aditir jātam aditir janitvam //
analyzed: viśve devāḥ aditiḥ pañca janāḥ aditiḥ jātam aditiḥ janitvam
translated: The All-gods are Aditi, the five peoples, Aditi is the born, Aditi is the generating.

original: ṛjunītī no varuṇo mitro nayatu vidvān /
analyzed: ṛju nītī naḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ nayatu vidvān
translated: May Varuna, the upright one, lead us, and Mitra, the wise one.

original: aryamā devaiḥ sajoṣāḥ //
analyzed: aryamā devaiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: Aryaman, in accord with the gods.

original: te hi vasvo vasavānās te apramūrā mahobhiḥ /
analyzed: te hi vasvaḥ vasavānāḥ te apramūrāḥ mahobhiḥ
translated: For they are the lords of wealth, the bestowers of wealth, they, the irresistible ones, with their great powers,

original: vratā rakṣante viśvāhā //
analyzed: vratā rakṣante viśvāhā
translated: preserve the vows all days.

original: te asmabhyaṃ śarma yaṃsann amṛtā martyebhyaḥ /
analyzed: te asmabhyam śarma yaṃsan amṛtāḥ martyebhyaḥ
translated: May they grant us protection, the immortal ones, to mortals,

original: bādhamānā apa dviṣaḥ //
analyzed: bādhamānāḥ apa dviṣaḥ
translated: driving away the haters.

original: vi naḥ pathaḥ suvitāya ciyantv indro marutaḥ /
analyzed: vi naḥ pathaḥ suvitāya ciyantu indraḥ marutaḥ
translated: May the paths lead us to prosperity, may Indra, the Maruts,

original: pūṣā bhago vandyāsaḥ //
analyzed: pūṣā bhagaḥ vandyāsaḥ
translated: Pushan, Bhaga, the adorable ones.

original: uta no dhiyo goagrāḥ pūṣan viṣṇav evayāvaḥ /
analyzed: uta naḥ dhiyaḥ go agrāḥ pūṣan viṣṇav eva yāvaḥ
translated: And may our thoughts, O Pushan, O Vishnu, ever-moving, be foremost in obtaining cattle,

original: kartā naḥ svastimataḥ //
analyzed: kartā naḥ svastimataḥ
translated: make us prosperous.

original: madhu vātā ṛtāyate madhu kṣaranti sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: madhu vātāḥ ṛtāyate madhu kṣaranti sindhavaḥ
translated: The winds blow sweet for the righteous, the rivers flow sweet,

original: mādhvīr naḥ santv oṣadhīḥ //
analyzed: mādhvīḥ naḥ santu oṣadhīḥ
translated: may the plants be sweet for us.

original: madhu naktam utoṣaso madhumat pārthivaṃ rajaḥ /
analyzed: madhu naktam uta uṣasaḥ madhumat pārthivam rajaḥ
translated: Sweet be the night and the dawns, sweet the earthly realm,

original: madhu dyaur astu naḥ pitā //
analyzed: madhu dyauḥ astu naḥ pitā
translated: sweet be the sky, our father, to us.

original: madhumān no vanaspatir madhumāṃ astu sūryaḥ /
analyzed: madhumān naḥ vanaspatiḥ madhumān astu sūryaḥ
translated: May the tree be sweet for us, may the sun be sweet for us,

original: mādhvīr gāvo bhavantu naḥ //
analyzed: mādhvīḥ gāvaḥ bhavantu naḥ
translated: may the cows be sweet for us.

original: śaṃ no mitraḥ śaṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavatv aryamā /
analyzed: śam naḥ mitraḥ śam varuṇaḥ śam naḥ bhavatu aryamā
translated: May Mitra be gracious to us, may Varuna, may Aryaman be gracious.

original: śaṃ na indro bṛhaspatiḥ śaṃ no viṣṇur urukramaḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ indraḥ bṛhaspatiḥ śam naḥ viṣṇuḥ uru kramaḥ
translated: May Indra be gracious, may Brihaspati, may Vishnu of wide stride be gracious to us.

original: tvaṃ soma pra cikito manīṣā tvaṃ rajiṣṭham anu neṣi panthām /
analyzed: tvam soma pra cikitaḥ manīṣā tvam rajiṣṭham anu neṣi panthām
translated: You, O Soma, are the one who reveals thoughts, you lead along the straightest path.

original: tava praṇītī pitaro na indo deveṣu ratnam abhajanta dhīrāḥ //
analyzed: tava praṇītī pitaraḥ naḥ indo deveṣu ratnam abhajanta dhīrāḥ
translated: By your guidance, O Indu, the wise ancestors, in the company of gods, have obtained the treasure.

original: tvaṃ soma kratubhiḥ sukratur bhūs tvaṃ dakṣaiḥ sudakṣo viśvavedāḥ /
analyzed: tvam soma kratubhiḥ su kratuḥ bhūḥ tvam dakṣaiḥ su dakṣaḥ viśva vedāḥ
translated: You, O Soma, are the one with good resolves through your resolves, you are the one with good skill through your skills, you are the all-knowing one.

original: tvaṃ vṛṣā vṛṣatvebhir mahitvā dyumnebhir dyumny abhavo nṛcakṣāḥ //
analyzed: tvam vṛṣā vṛṣa tvebhiḥ mahitvā dyumnebhiḥ dyumnī abhavaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ
translated: You, O bull, through your powers of a bull, through your glories, have become glorious, O you who look on men.

original: rājño nu te varuṇasya vratāni bṛhad gabhīraṃ tava soma dhāma /
analyzed: rājñaḥ nu te varuṇasya vratāni bṛhat gabhīram tava soma dhāma
translated: The vows of you, O king, are those of Varuna. Your abode, O Soma, is vast and deep.

original: śuciṣ ṭvam asi priyo na mitro dakṣāyyo aryamevāsi soma //
analyzed: śuciḥ tvam asi priyaḥ na mitraḥ dakṣāyyaḥ aryamā iva asi soma
translated: You are pure, you are dear like a friend, you are more skillful than Aryaman, O Soma.

original: yā te dhāmāni divi yā pṛthivyāṃ yā parvateṣv oṣadhīṣv apsu /
analyzed: yā te dhāmāni divi yā pṛthivyām yā parvateṣu oṣadhīṣu apsu
translated: Your abodes are in the sky, on the earth, on the mountains, in the plants, in the waters.

original: tebhir no viśvaiḥ sumanā aheḷan rājan soma prati havyā gṛbhāya //
analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ viśvaiḥ sumanāḥ a heḍan rājan soma prati havyā gṛbhāya
translated: With all of them, be well-disposed and do not deceive us. O king Soma, accept the offerings.

original: tvaṃ somāsi satpatis tvaṃ rājota vṛtrahā /
analyzed: tvam soma asi sat patiḥ tvam rājā uta vṛtra hā
translated: You, O Soma, are the lord of beings, you are the king, and also the Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: tvam bhadro asi kratuḥ //
analyzed: tvam bhadraḥ asi kratuḥ
translated: You are the auspicious resolve.

original: tvaṃ ca soma no vaśo jīvātuṃ na marāmahe /
analyzed: tvam ca soma naḥ vaśaḥ jīvātum na marāmahe
translated: And you, O Soma, are our wealth, that we may live and not die.

original: priyastotro vanaspatiḥ //
analyzed: priya stotraḥ vanaspatiḥ
translated: You are the tree whose praise is dear.

original: tvaṃ soma mahe bhagaṃ tvaṃ yūna ṛtāyate /
analyzed: tvam soma mahe bhagam tvam yūne ṛtāyate
translated: You, O Soma, give great good fortune to the young man who acts righteously,

original: dakṣaṃ dadhāsi jīvase //
analyzed: dakṣam dadhāsi jīvase
translated: You bestow power for life.

original: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato rakṣā rājann aghāyataḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ soma viśvatas rakṣa rājan aghāyataḥ
translated: Protect us, O Soma, O king, from all sides from the sinner.

original: na riṣyet tvāvataḥ sakhā //
analyzed: na riṣyet tvāvataḥ sakhā
translated: May the friend of you who are protected not perish.

original: soma yās te mayobhuva ūtayaḥ santi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: soma yāḥ te mayobhuvaḥ ūtayaḥ santi dāśuṣe
translated: O Soma, those aids of yours which bring bliss to the worshipper,

original: tābhir no 'vitā bhava //
analyzed: tābhiḥ naḥ vitā bhava
translated: With them be our protector.

original: imaṃ yajñam idaṃ vaco jujuṣāṇa upāgahi /
analyzed: imam yajñam idam vacaḥ jujuṣāṇaḥ upāgahi
translated: Accepting this sacrifice and this speech, come near.

original: soma tvaṃ no vṛdhe bhava //🔽soma gīrbhiṣ ṭvā vayaṃ vardhayāmo vacovidaḥ /
analyzed: soma tvam naḥ vṛdhe bhava  soma gīrbhiḥ tvā vayam vardhayāmaḥ vacaḥ vidaḥ
translated: O Soma, be you for our prosperity.🔽O Soma, we, knowing the words, exalt you with praises.

original: sumṛḷīko na ā viśa //
analyzed: su mṛḍīkaḥ naḥ ā viśa
translated: Come to us as a very gracious one.

original: gayasphāno amīvahā vasuvit puṣṭivardhanaḥ /
analyzed: gaya sphānaḥ amīva hā vasu vid puṣṭi vardhanaḥ
translated: Nourishing the house, bringing no disease, finding wealth, increasing prosperity,

original: sumitraḥ soma no bhava //
analyzed: su mitraḥ soma naḥ bhava
translated: Be a good friend to us, O Soma.

original: soma rārandhi no hṛdi gāvo na yavaseṣv ā /
analyzed: soma rārandhi naḥ hṛdi gāvaḥ na yavaseṣu ā
translated: O Soma, delight in our heart, like cows in the pastures,

original: marya iva sva okye //
analyzed: maryaḥ iva sve okye
translated: Like a young man in his own home.

original: yaḥ soma sakhye tava rāraṇad deva martyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ soma sakhye tava rāraṇat deva martyaḥ
translated: O god, the mortal who rejoices in your friendship, O Soma,

original: taṃ dakṣaḥ sacate kaviḥ //🔽uruṣyā ṇo abhiśasteḥ soma ni pāhy aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: tam dakṣaḥ sacate kaviḥ  uruṣya naḥ abhiśasteḥ soma ni pāhi aṃhasaḥ
translated: The wise one follows him.🔽Protect us, O Soma, from the curse, guard us from affliction.

original: sakhā suśeva edhi naḥ //
analyzed: sakhā su śevaḥ edhi naḥ
translated: Be a very gracious friend to us.

original: ā pyāyasva sam etu te viśvataḥ soma vṛṣṇyam /
analyzed: ā pyāyasva sam etu te viśvatas soma vṛṣṇyam
translated: Be thou swollen, O Soma, let thy strength come to thee from all sides.

original: bhavā vājasya saṃgathe //
analyzed: bhava vājasya saṃgathe
translated: Be thou in the gathering of strength.

original: ā pyāyasva madintama soma viśvebhir aṃśubhiḥ /
analyzed: ā pyāyasva madintama soma viśvebhiḥ aṃśubhiḥ
translated: Be thou swollen, O most inebriating Soma, with all thy rays.

original: bhavā naḥ suśravastamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe //
analyzed: bhava naḥ su śravastamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe
translated: Be thou our most famous friend for increase.

original: saṃ te payāṃsi sam u yantu vājāḥ saṃ vṛṣṇyāny abhimātiṣāhaḥ /
analyzed: sam te payāṃsi sam u yantu vājāḥ sam vṛṣṇyāni abhimātiṣāhaḥ
translated: Let thy milk and thy strength be united, and thy virility, O thou who conquerest hostility.

original: āpyāyamāno amṛtāya soma divi śravāṃsy uttamāni dhiṣva //
analyzed: āpyāyamānaḥ amṛtāya soma divi śravāṃsi uttamāni dhiṣva
translated: Swollen for immortality, O Soma, bestow in heaven the highest glories.

original: yā te dhāmāni haviṣā yajanti tā te viśvā paribhūr astu yajñam /🔽gayasphānaḥ prataraṇaḥ suvīro 'vīrahā pra carā soma duryān //
analyzed: yā te dhāmāni haviṣā yajanti tā te viśvā paribhūḥ astu yajñam  gaya sphānaḥ prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ vīra hā pra cara soma duryān
translated: All those abodes of thine which they worship with oblation, may they all attend thy sacrifice.🔽Nourishing the house, overcoming, with good heroes, not slaying the weak, lead the cows, O Soma, to the stalls.

original: somo dhenuṃ somo arvantam āśuṃ somo vīraṃ karmaṇyaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: somaḥ dhenum somaḥ arvantam āśum somaḥ vīram karmaṇyam dadāti
translated: Soma gives a milch cow, Soma a swift steed, Soma a hero fit for work.

original: sādanyaṃ vidathyaṃ sabheyam pitṛśravaṇaṃ yo dadāśad asmai //🔽aṣāḷhaṃ yutsu pṛtanāsu papriṃ svarṣām apsāṃ vṛjanasya gopām /🔽bhareṣujāṃ sukṣitiṃ suśravasaṃ jayantaṃ tvām anu madema soma //
analyzed: sādanyam vidathyam sabheyam pitṛ śravaṇam yaḥ dadāśat asmai  aṣāḷham yutsu pṛtanāsu paprim svarṣām ap sām vṛjanasya gopām  bhareṣujām su kṣitim su śravasam jayantam tvām anu madema soma
translated: The guest-friend, the friend of the assembly, famed by the fathers, he who has given to him.🔽The invincible in battles, the protector in wars, the self-luminous guardian of the people of the waters,🔽The bearer of burdens, the well-established, of good fame, thee, O Soma, we will follow as thou art victorious.

original: tvam imā oṣadhīḥ soma viśvās tvam apo ajanayas tvaṃ gāḥ /
analyzed: tvam imāḥ oṣadhīḥ soma viśvāḥ tvam apaḥ ajanayaḥ tvam gāḥ
translated: Thou, O Soma, hast created all these plants, thou hast generated the waters and the cows.

original: tvam ā tatanthorv antarikṣaṃ tvaṃ jyotiṣā vi tamo vavartha //
analyzed: tvam ā tatantha uru antarikṣam tvam jyotiṣā vi tamaḥ vavartha
translated: Thou hast stretched out the wide air, thou hast dispelled the darkness with thy light.

original: devena no manasā deva soma rāyo bhāgaṃ sahasāvann abhi yudhya /
analyzed: devena naḥ manasā deva soma rāyaḥ bhāgam sahasāvan abhi yudhya
translated: With the god's mind, O god Soma, O thou who hast a thousand powers, fight for the share of wealth.

original: mā tvā tanad īśiṣe vīryasyobhayebhyaḥ pra cikitsā gaviṣṭau //
analyzed: mā tvā tanat īśiṣe vīryasya ubhayebhyaḥ pra cikitsa gaviṣṭau
translated: Let not thy power fail thee: show thyself to both parties in the contest for the prize.

original: etā u tyā uṣasaḥ ketum akrata pūrve ardhe rajaso bhānum añjate /🔽niṣkṛṇvānā āyudhānīva dhṛṣṇavaḥ prati gāvo 'ruṣīr yanti mātaraḥ //
analyzed: etāḥ u tyāḥ uṣasaḥ ketum akrata pūrve ardhe rajasaḥ bhānum añjate  niṣkṛṇvānāḥ āyudhāni iva dhṛṣṇavaḥ prati gāvaḥ ruṣīḥ yanti mātaraḥ
translated: These are the dawns that have made the light their banner: in the eastern half of the region they anoint the radiance.🔽Shaping their weapons as it were, the impetuous ones, the red cows, the mothers, go forth.

original: ud apaptann aruṇā bhānavo vṛthā svāyujo aruṣīr gā ayukṣata /
analyzed: ud apaptan aruṇāḥ bhānavaḥ vṛthā su āyujaḥ aruṣīḥ gāḥ ayukṣata
translated: The ruddy lights have flown up in the air: they have yoked the ruddy cows to their own chariot.

original: akrann uṣāso vayunāni pūrvathā ruśantam bhānum aruṣīr aśiśrayuḥ //
analyzed: akran uṣāsaḥ vayunāni pūrvathā ruśantam bhānum aruṣīḥ aśiśrayuḥ
translated: The dawns have wrought the shining light as of old: the ruddy ones have mounted the ruddy light.

original: arcanti nārīr apaso na viṣṭibhiḥ samānena yojanenā parāvataḥ /
analyzed: arcanti nārīḥ apasaḥ na viṣṭibhiḥ samānena yojanena ā parāvataḥ
translated: The women, the Apsarases, with their bands, with the same journey from afar,

original: iṣaṃ vahantīḥ sukṛte sudānave viśved aha yajamānāya sunvate //🔽adhi peśāṃsi vapate nṛtūr ivāporṇute vakṣa usreva barjaham /
analyzed: iṣam vahantīḥ su kṛte sudānave viśvā id aha yajamānāya sunvate  adhi peśāṃsi vapate nṛtūḥ iva aporṇute vakṣaḥ usrā iva barjaham
translated: bringing food to the well-worker, the bountiful, to every sacrificer who presses (the Soma).🔽She spreads out the limbs as a skilful one, she opens the womb as a cow her udder.

original: jyotir viśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvatī gāvo na vrajaṃ vy uṣā āvar tamaḥ //
analyzed: jyotiḥ viśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvatī gāvaḥ na vrajam vi uṣāḥ āvaḥ tamaḥ
translated: She makes light for all the world, the cows go forth to the fold, the dawn dispels the darkness.

original: praty arcī ruśad asyā adarśi vi tiṣṭhate bādhate kṛṣṇam abhvam /🔽svaruṃ na peśo vidatheṣv añjañ citraṃ divo duhitā bhānum aśret //
analyzed: prati arciḥ ruśat asyāḥ adarśi vi tiṣṭhate bādhate kṛṣṇam abhvam  svarum na peśaḥ vidatheṣu añjam citram divaḥ duhitā bhānum aśret
translated: The ruddy light of this one hath appeared; it spreadeth out and driveth away the black gloom.🔽The Daughter of the Sky, adorning her own back like a pin, hath raised her bright banner.

original: atāriṣma tamasas pāram asyoṣā ucchantī vayunā kṛṇoti /🔽śriye chando na smayate vibhātī supratīkā saumanasāyājīgaḥ //
analyzed: atāriṣma tamasaḥ pāram asya uṣāḥ ucchantī vayunā kṛṇoti  śriye chandaḥ na smayate vibhātī su pratīkā saumanasāya ajīgaḥ
translated: We have crossed over to the farther side of this darkness: Ushas, rising, makes her ways.🔽For glory the radiant metre shines forth, resplendent, she hath come to us for our delight.

original: bhāsvatī netrī sūnṛtānāṃ diva stave duhitā gotamebhiḥ /🔽prajāvato nṛvato aśvabudhyān uṣo goagrāṃ upa māsi vājān //
analyzed: bhāsvatī netrī sūnṛtānām divaḥ stave duhitā gotamebhiḥ  prajāvataḥ nṛvataḥ aśva budhyān uṣaḥ go agrān upa māsi vājān
translated: The Daughter of the Sky, shining with light, the leader of fair hymns, is praised by the Gotamas.🔽To those who have offspring, men, and horses, O Ushas, thou comest with the foremost of the spoil.

original: uṣas tam aśyāṃ yaśasaṃ suvīraṃ dāsapravargaṃ rayim aśvabudhyam /
analyzed: uṣaḥ tam aśyām yaśasam su vīram dāsa pravargam rayim aśva budhyam
translated: O Ushas, may I win that glory, that wealth with noble heroes, with horses, with cattle, with men,

original: sudaṃsasā śravasā yā vibhāsi vājaprasūtā subhage bṛhantam //🔽viśvāni devī bhuvanābhicakṣyā pratīcī cakṣur urviyā vi bhāti /
analyzed: su daṃsasā śravasā yā vibhāsi vāja prasūtā subhage bṛhantam  viśvāni devī bhuvanā abhicakṣyā pratīcī cakṣuḥ urviyā vi bhāti
translated: Which, O thou of fair gifts, thou shinest forth, bestowing strength, high, and most excellent.🔽The Goddess, looking on all living creatures, shineth with her eye, extending, in the west.

original: viśvaṃ jīvaṃ carase bodhayantī viśvasya vācam avidan manāyoḥ //
analyzed: viśvam jīvam carase bodhayantī viśvasya vācam avidat manāyoḥ
translated: Arousing all that moveth and is still, she hath attained the thought and speech of all.

original: punaḥpunar jāyamānā purāṇī samānaṃ varṇam abhi śumbhamānā /
analyzed: punar punar jāyamānā purāṇī samānam varṇam abhi śumbhamānā
translated: Again and again is she born, the ancient one, adorning the same hue.

original: śvaghnīva kṛtnur vija āminānā martasya devī jarayanty āyuḥ //
analyzed: śvaghnī iva kṛtnuḥ vijaḥ āminānā martasya devī jarayantī āyuḥ
translated: Like a bitch, the goddess of death, destroying, shortens the life of a mortal man.

original: vyūrṇvatī divo antāṃ abodhy apa svasāraṃ sanutar yuyoti /
analyzed: vyūrṇvatī divaḥ abodhi apa svasāram sanutar yuyoti
translated: She who unfolds the ends of the sky has awakened, she who is far-reaching separates her sister.

original: praminatī manuṣyā yugāni yoṣā jārasya cakṣasā vi bhāti //
analyzed: praminatī manuṣyā yugāni yoṣā jārasya cakṣasā vi bhāti
translated: She who measures the ages of men, the woman shines with the eye of her lover.

original: paśūn na citrā subhagā prathānā sindhur na kṣoda urviyā vy aśvait /🔽aminatī daivyāni vratāni sūryasya ceti raśmibhir dṛśānā //
analyzed: paśūn na citrā subhagā prathānā sindhuḥ na kṣodaḥ urviyā vi aśvait  a minatī daivyāni vratāni sūryasya ceti raśmibhiḥ dṛśānā
translated: The wondrous one, the fortunate one, the famous one, like a river with waters, has spread out with her horses.🔽She who transgresses the divine laws, is seen with the rays of the sun.

original: uṣas tac citram ā bharāsmabhyaṃ vājinīvati /
analyzed: uṣaḥ tat citram ā bhara asmabhyam vājinīvati
translated: O Dawn, bring that wondrous thing to us, O you who are rich in treasures,

original: yena tokaṃ ca tanayaṃ ca dhāmahe //🔽uṣo adyeha gomaty aśvāvati vibhāvari /
analyzed: yena tokam ca tanayam ca dhāmahe  uṣaḥ adyā iha gomati aśvāvati vibhāvari
translated: By which we may support our offspring and descendants.🔽O Dawn, here today, rich in cattle, rich in horses, O you who make things visible,

original: revad asme vy uccha sūnṛtāvati //
analyzed: revat asme vi uccha sūnṛtāvati
translated: Shine forth splendidly for us, O you who are rich in goodness.

original: yukṣvā hi vājinīvaty aśvāṃ adyāruṇāṃ uṣaḥ /
analyzed: yukṣvā hi vājinīvati aśvām adya aruṇām uṣaḥ
translated: Yoke, O you who are rich in treasures, your red horses this day, O Dawn,

original: athā no viśvā saubhagāny ā vaha //🔽aśvinā vartir asmad ā gomad dasrā hiraṇyavat /
analyzed: athā naḥ viśvā saubhagāni ā vaha  aśvinā vartiḥ asmat ā gomat dasrā hiraṇyavat
translated: Then bring to us all kinds of prosperity.🔽O Aśvins, bring to us a course rich in cattle, O wondrous ones, rich in gold,

original: arvāg rathaṃ samanasā ni yacchatam //
analyzed: arvāk ratham samanasā ni yacchatam
translated: Turn your chariot hither with your minds.

original: yāv itthā ślokam ā divo jyotir janāya cakrathuḥ /
analyzed: yau itthā ślokam ā divaḥ jyotiḥ janāya cakrathuḥ
translated: You who have made the hymn and the light from here from the sky for the people,

original: ā na ūrjaṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvam //
analyzed: ā naḥ ūrjam vahatam aśvinā yuvam
translated: Bring us food, O you two Aśvins.

original: eha devā mayobhuvā dasrā hiraṇyavartanī /
analyzed: ā iha devā mayobhuvā dasrā hiraṇya vartanī
translated: Come hither, O ye Gods who bring bliss, ye wondrous, golden-coloured,

original: uṣarbudho vahantu somapītaye //
analyzed: uṣarbudhaḥ vahantu soma pītaye
translated: With the dawn as your companion, to drink the Soma juice.

original: agnīṣomāv imaṃ su me śṛṇutaṃ vṛṣaṇā havam /
analyzed: agnīṣomau imam su me śṛṇutam vṛṣaṇā havam
translated: O Agni and Soma, ye mighty ones, listen to this my invocation.

original: prati sūktāni haryatam bhavataṃ dāśuṣe mayaḥ //
analyzed: prati sūktāni haryatam bhavatam dāśuṣe mayaḥ
translated: Accept the hymns, and be a source of prosperity to the worshipper.

original: agnīṣomā yo adya vām idaṃ vacaḥ saparyati /
analyzed: agnīṣomā yaḥ adya vām idam vacaḥ saparyati
translated: O Agni and Soma, he who to-day honours you with this speech,

original: tasmai dhattaṃ suvīryaṃ gavām poṣaṃ svaśvyam //
analyzed: tasmai dhattam su vīryam gavām poṣam su aśvyam
translated: Bestow upon him heroic strength, increase of cattle, and abundance of horses.

original: agnīṣomā ya āhutiṃ yo vāṃ dāśād dhaviṣkṛtim /
analyzed: agnīṣomā yaḥ āhutim yaḥ vām dāśāt haviṣkṛtim
translated: O Agni and Soma, he who brings you an oblation, who offers you a sacrificial gift,

original: sa prajayā suvīryaṃ viśvam āyur vy aśnavat //
analyzed: sa prajayā su vīryam viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnavat
translated: May he enjoy all life through offspring and heroic strength.

original: agnīṣomā ceti tad vīryaṃ vāṃ yad amuṣṇītam avasam paṇiṃ gāḥ /
analyzed: agnīṣomā ceti tat vīryam vām yat amuṣṇītam avasam paṇim gāḥ
translated: O Agni and Soma, that is your heroic strength, that ye have delivered the cow who was carried off by the robber.

original: avātiratam bṛsayasya śeṣo 'vindataṃ jyotir ekam bahubhyaḥ //🔽yuvam etāni divi rocanāny agniś ca soma sakratū adhattam /
analyzed: avātiratam bṛsayasya śeṣaḥ vindatam jyotiḥ ekam bahubhyaḥ  yuvam etāni divi rocanāni agniḥ ca soma sakratū adhattam
translated: Ye have overcome the remnant of the wicked one, ye have found the one light for many.🔽Ye two, O Agni and Soma, have set in the sky those luminous regions, ye who are of one mind.

original: yuvaṃ sindhūṃr abhiśaster avadyād agnīṣomāv amuñcataṃ gṛbhītān //
analyzed: yuvam sindhūṃr abhiśasteḥ avadyāt agnīṣomau amuñcatam gṛbhītān
translated: Ye have delivered the rivers from the curse, from blame, O Agni and Soma, ye who are held fast.

original: ānyaṃ divo mātariśvā jabhārāmathnād anyam pari śyeno adreḥ /
analyzed: ā anyam divaḥ mātariśvā jabhāra amathnāt anyam pari śyenaḥ adreḥ
translated: Mātariśvan brought one from the sky, the falcon crushed another from the mountain.

original: agnīṣomā brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānoruṃ yajñāya cakrathur u lokam //
analyzed: agnīṣomā brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānā urum yajñāya cakrathuḥ u lokam
translated: O Agni and Soma, grown strong through the Brahman, ye have made a wide space for the sacrifice.

original: agnīṣomā haviṣaḥ prasthitasya vītaṃ haryataṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām /
analyzed: agnīṣomā haviṣaḥ prasthitasya vītam haryatam vṛṣaṇā juṣethām
translated: O Agni and Soma, accept, O ye mighty ones, the offered, the enjoyed oblation, O ye who rejoice in the sacrifice.

original: suśarmāṇā svavasā hi bhūtam athā dhattaṃ yajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ //
analyzed: su śarmāṇā su avasā hi bhūtam atha ā dhattam yajamānāya śam yoḥ
translated: Be ye our good protectors, for ye are our own saviours. Then bestow on the sacrificer the boon of peace.

original: yo agnīṣomā haviṣā saparyād devadrīcā manasā yo ghṛtena /
analyzed: yaḥ agnīṣomā haviṣā saparyāt devadrīcā manasā yaḥ ghṛtena
translated: He who with oblation honours you, O Agni and Soma, with a mind inclined to the gods, with ghee,

original: tasya vrataṃ rakṣatam pātam aṃhaso viśe janāya mahi śarma yacchatam //
analyzed: tasya vratam rakṣatam pātam aṃhasaḥ viśe janāya mahi śarma yacchatam
translated: guard his vow, protect him from distress, bestow great protection on the clan and people.

original: agnīṣomā savedasā sahūtī vanataṃ giraḥ /
analyzed: agnīṣomā sa vedasā sa hūtī vanatam giraḥ
translated: O Agni and Soma, with the same desire, accept the praises together.

original: saṃ devatrā babhūvathuḥ //
analyzed: sam devatrā babhūvathuḥ
translated: Ye have become the gods' associates.

original: agnīṣomāv anena vāṃ yo vāṃ ghṛtena dāśati /
analyzed: agnīṣomau anena vām yaḥ vām ghṛtena dāśati
translated: O Agni and Soma, he who offers you with ghee,

original: tasmai dīdayatam bṛhat //
analyzed: tasmai dīdayatam bṛhat
translated: shine upon him with your great light.

original: agnīṣomāv imāni no yuvaṃ havyā jujoṣatam /
analyzed: agnīṣomau imāni naḥ yuvam havyā jujoṣatam
translated: O Agni and Soma, accept these oblations of ours.

original: ā yātam upa naḥ sacā //
analyzed: ā yātam upa naḥ sacā
translated: Come to us and unite with us.

original: agnīṣomā pipṛtam arvato na ā pyāyantām usriyā havyasūdaḥ /
analyzed: agnīṣomā pipṛtam arvataḥ naḥ ā pyāyantām usriyāḥ havyasūdaḥ
translated: O Agni and Soma, increase our strength as of a horse. Let the oblation-drinking cows be invigorated.

original: asme balāni maghavatsu dhattaṃ kṛṇutaṃ no adhvaraṃ śruṣṭimantam //
analyzed: asme balāni maghavatsu dhattam kṛṇutam naḥ adhvaram śruṣṭimantam
translated: Bestow upon us the powers of the wealthy. Make our sacrifice acceptable.

original: imaṃ stomam arhate jātavedase ratham iva sam mahemā manīṣayā /
analyzed: imam stomam arhate jātavedase ratham iva sam mahema manīṣayā
translated: This hymn we will exalt with thought, like a chariot, to the worthy Jâtavedas.

original: bhadrā hi naḥ pramatir asya saṃsady agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: bhadrā hi naḥ pramatiḥ asya saṃsadi agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: For good is our deliberation in this assembly, O Agni: let us not perish in thy friendship, O thou.

original: yasmai tvam āyajase sa sādhaty anarvā kṣeti dadhate suvīryam /
analyzed: yasmai tvam āyajase sa sādhati anarvā kṣeti dadhate su vīryam
translated: He whom thou aidest prospers: he dwells secure, he wins heroic strength.

original: sa tūtāva nainam aśnoty aṃhatir agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //🔽śakema tvā samidhaṃ sādhayā dhiyas tve devā havir adanty āhutam /
analyzed: sa tūtāva na enam aśnoti aṃhatiḥ agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava  śakema tvā samidham sādhaya dhiyaḥ tve devāḥ haviḥ adanti āhutam
translated: No evil befalls him when he comes to thee: let us not perish in thy friendship, O Agni.🔽We may kindle thee, O Agni, and accomplish our thoughts: in thee the gods enjoy the offered oblation.

original: tvam ādityāṃ ā vaha tān hy uśmasy agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: tvam ādityān ā vaha tān hi uśmasi agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: Bring thou the Âdityas, for thou hast need of them: let us not perish in thy friendship, O Agni.

original: bharāmedhmaṃ kṛṇavāmā havīṃṣi te citayantaḥ parvaṇāparvaṇā vayam /
analyzed: bharāma idhmam kṛṇavāma havīṃṣi te citayantaḥ parvaṇā aparvaṇā vayam
translated: We will bring fuel, we will make oblations to thee, thinking of thee at each season as it comes.

original: jīvātave prataraṃ sādhayā dhiyo 'gne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: jīvātave prataram sādhaya dhiyaḥ gne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: For life let us accomplish our thoughts: let us not perish in thy friendship, O Agni.

original: viśāṃ gopā asya caranti jantavo dvipac ca yad uta catuṣpad aktubhiḥ /
analyzed: viśām gopāḥ asya caranti jantavaḥ dvipad ca yat uta catuṣpad aktubhiḥ
translated: The guardians of the people move about in him, the bipeds and the quadrupeds by his light.

original: citraḥ praketa uṣaso mahāṃ asy agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: citraḥ praketaḥ uṣasaḥ mahān asi agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: Wonderful is his great appearance at the dawns: let us not perish in thy friendship, O Agni.

original: tvam adhvaryur uta hotāsi pūrvyaḥ praśāstā potā januṣā purohitaḥ /
analyzed: tvam adhvaryuḥ uta hotā asi pūrvyaḥ praśāstā potā januṣā purohitaḥ
translated: Thou art the Adhvaryu, thou the Priest most ancient, the ruler, the protector, the priest by birth.

original: viśvā vidvāṃ ārtvijyā dhīra puṣyasy agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: viśvā vidvān ārtvijyā dhīra puṣyasi agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: O wise one, thou knowest all the priestly duties: prosper thou, O Agni: let us not in thy friendship, O Agni, suffer harm.

original: yo viśvataḥ supratīkaḥ sadṛṅṅ asi dūre cit san taḷid ivāti rocase /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvatas su pratīkaḥ sadṛś asi dūre cit san taḷit iva ati rocase
translated: Thou who art beautiful on every side, thou art the same in the distance as thou art near: thou shinest forth like the sun.

original: rātryāś cid andho ati deva paśyasy agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: rātryāḥ cit andhaḥ ati deva paśyasi agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: Thou, O god, seest even through the darkness of the night: let us not in thy friendship, O Agni, suffer harm.

original: pūrvo devā bhavatu sunvato ratho 'smākaṃ śaṃso abhy astu dūḍhyaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvaḥ devāḥ bhavatu sunvataḥ rathaḥ smākam śaṃsaḥ abhī astu dūḍhyaḥ
translated: Let the car of the pouring out (of the Soma) be foremost of the gods: let our praise be irresistible.

original: tad ā jānītota puṣyatā vaco 'gne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: tat ā jānīta uta puṣyatā vacaḥ gne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: Know this, and prosper the speech of him who worships: let us not in thy friendship, O Agni, suffer harm.

original: vadhair duḥśaṃsāṃ apa dūḍhyo jahi dūre vā ye anti vā ke cid atriṇaḥ /
analyzed: vadhaiḥ duḥśaṃsām apa dūḍhyaḥ jahi dūre vā ye anti vā ke cit atriṇaḥ
translated: With thy blows drive away the evil-speaking, the irreligious, whether they be far or near:

original: athā yajñāya gṛṇate sugaṃ kṛdhy agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: athā yajñāya gṛṇate sugam kṛdhī agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: Then be easy of access to the sacrificer and to him who sings praises: let us not in thy friendship, O Agni, suffer harm.

original: yad ayukthā aruṣā rohitā rathe vātajūtā vṛṣabhasyeva te ravaḥ /
analyzed: yat ayukthāḥ aruṣā rohitā rathe vāta jūtā vṛṣabhasya iva te ravaḥ
translated: When thou hast yoked the red and the tawny (horses) to thy car, thy roar is like that of a bull urged on by the wind.

original: ād invasi vanino dhūmaketunāgne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: āt invasi vaninaḥ dhūma ketunā agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: Thou sendest forth the trees with the smoke as thy banner: let us not in thy friendship, O Agni, suffer harm.

original: adha svanād uta bibhyuḥ patatriṇo drapsā yat te yavasādo vy asthiran /
analyzed: adha svanāt uta bibhyuḥ patatriṇaḥ drapsāḥ yat te yavasādaḥ vi asthiran
translated: Even from the sound (of the wind) the birds are afraid, when thy sparks, O thou who eatest grass, have scattered themselves.

original: sugaṃ tat te tāvakebhyo rathebhyo 'gne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: sugam tat te tāvakebhyaḥ rathebhyaḥ gne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: Easy of access to thee, to thy car-warriors, O Agni, let us not, in thy friendship, O Agni, be deprived of our share of the good.

original: ayam mitrasya varuṇasya dhāyase 'vayātām marutāṃ heḷo adbhutaḥ /
analyzed: ayam mitrasya varuṇasya dhāyase vayātām marutām heḍaḥ adbhutaḥ
translated: This (cow) of Mitra and Varuna, the wonderful assembly of the Maruts, has come to the support of the law.

original: mṛḷā su no bhūtv eṣām manaḥ punar agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: mṛḷā su naḥ bhūtu eṣām manaḥ punar agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: Be gracious to us, and let their mind return to us. Let us not, in thy friendship, O Agni, be deprived of our share of the good.

original: devo devānām asi mitro adbhuto vasur vasūnām asi cārur adhvare /
analyzed: devaḥ devānām asi mitraḥ adbhutaḥ vasuḥ vasūnām asi cāruḥ adhvare
translated: Thou art the god of the gods, the wonderful Mitra. Thou art the Vasu of the Vasus, the fair one at the sacrifice.

original: śarman syāma tava saprathastame 'gne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: śarman syāma tava saprathastame gne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: May we be the possessors of thy most extensive protection. Let us not, in thy friendship, O Agni, be deprived of our share of the good.

original: tat te bhadraṃ yat samiddhaḥ sve dame somāhuto jarase mṛḷayattamaḥ /
analyzed: tat te bhadram yat samiddhaḥ sve dame soma āhutaḥ jarase mṛḍayattamaḥ
translated: That is good for thee, that being kindled in thine own abode, offered to Soma, thou art most gracious to old age.

original: dadhāsi ratnaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dāśuṣe 'gne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava //
analyzed: dadhāsi ratnam draviṇam ca dāśuṣe gne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: Thou bestowest treasure and wealth on the worshipper. Let us not, in thy friendship, O Agni, be deprived of our share of the good.

original: yasmai tvaṃ sudraviṇo dadāśo 'nāgāstvam adite sarvatātā /
analyzed: yasmai tvam su draviṇaḥ dadāśaḥ nāgāstvam adite sarvatātā
translated: To him whom thou, O good wealth-giver, hast granted freedom from guilt, O Aditi, all-nourishing,

original: yam bhadreṇa śavasā codayāsi prajāvatā rādhasā te syāma //
analyzed: yam bhadreṇa śavasā codayāsi prajāvatā rādhasā te syāma
translated: Whom thou impelest with auspicious power, with wealth in offspring, may we be his.

original: sa tvam agne saubhagatvasya vidvān asmākam āyuḥ pra tireha deva /
analyzed: sa tvam agne saubhaga tvasya vidvān asmākam āyuḥ pra tira iha deva
translated: Thou, O Agni, knowing what is good fortune, O god, extend our life here.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, Sindhu, the earth, and the sky, grant this to us.

original: dve virūpe carataḥ svarthe anyānyā vatsam upa dhāpayete /
analyzed: dve virūpe carataḥ su arthe anyā anyā vatsam upa dhāpayete
translated: Two dissimilar ones move along their own path, each one suckling a different calf.

original: harir anyasyām bhavati svadhāvāñ chukro anyasyāṃ dadṛśe suvarcāḥ //
analyzed: hariḥ anyasyām bhavati svadhāvān śukraḥ anyasyām dadṛśe su varcāḥ
translated: In one, the tawny one, who moves by his own power, is seen; in the other, the bright one, of good radiance, is seen.

original: daśemaṃ tvaṣṭur janayanta garbham atandrāso yuvatayo vibhṛtram /
analyzed: daśa imam tvaṣṭuḥ janayanta garbham atandrāsaḥ yuvatayaḥ vibhṛtram
translated: Ten young maidens, never weary, generate this wondrous embryo of Tvastr.

original: tigmānīkaṃ svayaśasaṃ janeṣu virocamānam pari ṣīṃ nayanti //
analyzed: tigma anīkam sva yaśasam janeṣu virocamānam pari sīm nayanti
translated: They lead him around, the one with sharp rays, of his own glory, shining among the people.

original: trīṇi jānā pari bhūṣanty asya samudra ekaṃ divy ekam apsu /
analyzed: trīṇi jānā pari bhūṣanti asya samudre ekam divi ekam apsu
translated: Three worlds surround him: one in the ocean, one in the sky, one in the waters.

original: pūrvām anu pra diśam pārthivānām ṛtūn praśāsad vi dadhāv anuṣṭhu //
analyzed: pūrvām anu pra diśam pārthivānām ṛtūn praśāsat vi dadhau anuṣṭhu
translated: Having established the seasons, he extends himself along the eastern direction of the earthly ones.

original: ka imaṃ vo niṇyam ā ciketa vatso mātṝr janayata svadhābhiḥ /🔽bahvīnāṃ garbho apasām upasthān mahān kavir niś carati svadhāvān //
analyzed: kaḥ imam vaḥ niṇyam ā ciketa vatsaḥ mātṝḥ janayata svadhābhiḥ  bahvīnām garbhaḥ apasām upasthāt mahān kaviḥ niḥ carati svadhāvān
translated: Who knows this your assembly? The calf, by his own power, generates the mothers.🔽The great sage, the embryo of many, moves forth from the wombs of the waters.

original: āviṣṭyo vardhate cārur āsu jihmānām ūrdhvaḥ svayaśā upasthe /
analyzed: āviṣṭyaḥ vardhate cāruḥ āsu jihmānām ūrdhvaḥ sva yaśāḥ upasthe
translated: The beautiful one grows among them, the upright one, of his own glory, in the lap of the bent ones.

original: ubhe tvaṣṭur bibhyatur jāyamānāt pratīcī siṃham prati joṣayete //
analyzed: ubhe tvaṣṭuḥ bibhyatuḥ jāyamānāt pratīcī siṃham prati joṣayete
translated: Both of them fear Tvastr as he is born; the western one receives the lion with favor.

original: ubhe bhadre joṣayete na mene gāvo na vāśrā upa tasthur evaiḥ /
analyzed: ubhe bhadre joṣayete na mene gāvaḥ na vāśrāḥ upa tasthuḥ evaiḥ
translated: Both the auspicious ones, the two breasts, are pleased with me. The cows have stood near me with their milk.

original: sa dakṣāṇāṃ dakṣapatir babhūvāñjanti yaṃ dakṣiṇato havirbhiḥ //
analyzed: sa dakṣāṇām dakṣa patiḥ babhūva añjanti yam dakṣiṇatas havirbhiḥ
translated: He has become the lord of the skillful ones among the skillful. They anoint him on the right side with oblations.

original: ud yaṃyamīti saviteva bāhū ubhe sicau yatate bhīma ṛñjan /
analyzed: ud yaṃyamīti savitā iva bāhū ubhe sicau yatate bhīmaḥ ṛñjan
translated: He stretches out his arms like Savitar, the terrible one striving for both sides.

original: uc chukram atkam ajate simasmān navā mātṛbhyo vasanā jahāti //
analyzed: ud śukram atkam ajate simasmāt navā mātṛbhyaḥ vasanā jahāti
translated: He produces the bright navel for the people. He leaves the new garments for the mothers.

original: tveṣaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇuta uttaraṃ yat sampṛñcānaḥ sadane gobhir adbhiḥ /
analyzed: tveṣam rūpam kṛṇute uttaram yat sampṛñcānaḥ sadane gobhiḥ adbhiḥ
translated: He makes the upper form variegated, when he is anointed in the abode with the cows and the waters.

original: kavir budhnam pari marmṛjyate dhīḥ sā devatātā samitir babhūva //
analyzed: kaviḥ budhnam pari marmṛjyate dhīḥ sā devatātā samitiḥ babhūva
translated: The wise thought is purified around the deep place. That assembly has become the deity.

original: uru te jrayaḥ pary eti budhnaṃ virocamānam mahiṣasya dhāma /
analyzed: uru te jrayaḥ pari eti budhnam virocamānam mahiṣasya dhāma
translated: Your far-reaching rays go around the deep place. The shining abode of the mighty one.

original: viśvebhir agne svayaśobhir iddho 'dabdhebhiḥ pāyubhiḥ pāhy asmān //
analyzed: viśvebhiḥ agne sva yaśobhiḥ iddhaḥ dabdhebhiḥ pāyubhiḥ pāhi asmān
translated: O Agni, kindled with the all-shining, self-shining, undeceiving, protecting powers, protect us.

original: dhanvan srotaḥ kṛṇute gātum ūrmiṃ śukrair ūrmibhir abhi nakṣati kṣām /
analyzed: dhanvan srotaḥ kṛṇute gātum ūrmim śukraiḥ ūrmibhiḥ abhi nakṣati kṣām
translated: He makes a path, a current, a way in the desert, he shines on the earth with bright waves.

original: viśvā sanāni jaṭhareṣu dhatte 'ntar navāsu carati prasūṣu //
analyzed: viśvā sanāni jaṭhareṣu dhatte ntar navāsu carati prasūṣu
translated: He holds all the ancient things in his belly. He moves within the nine new births.

original: evā no agne samidhā vṛdhāno revat pāvaka śravase vi bhāhi /
analyzed: eva naḥ agne samidhā vṛdhānaḥ revat pāvaka śravase vi bhāhi
translated: O Agni, thus, O purifier, grow for us with the fuel. Shine forth for great glory.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, Sindhu, the earth, and the sky, destroy that for us.

original: sa pratnathā sahasā jāyamānaḥ sadyaḥ kāvyāni baḷ adhatta viśvā /
analyzed: sa pratnathā sahasā jāyamānaḥ sadyas kāvyāni baḷ adhatta viśvā
translated: He, being born with might as of old, at once bestowed all the treasures of wisdom.

original: āpaś ca mitraṃ dhiṣaṇā ca sādhan devā agniṃ dhārayan draviṇodām //
analyzed: āpaḥ ca mitram dhiṣaṇā ca sādhan devāḥ agnim dhārayan draviṇaḥ dām
translated: The waters and the mind, and the will, accomplishing (his purpose), the gods have held Agni, the bestower of wealth.

original: sa pūrvayā nividā kavyatāyor imāḥ prajā ajanayan manūnām /
analyzed: sa pūrvayā nividā kavya tā āyoḥ imāḥ prajāḥ ajanayat manūnām
translated: He, by the ancient agreement of the wise, has generated these creatures of the Manus.

original: vivasvatā cakṣasā dyām apaś ca devā agniṃ dhārayan draviṇodām //
analyzed: vivasvatā cakṣasā dyām apaḥ ca devāḥ agnim dhārayan draviṇaḥ dām
translated: With the eye of Vivasvat, he shines on the sky and the waters. The gods have held Agni, the bestower of wealth.

original: tam īḷata prathamaṃ yajñasādhaṃ viśa ārīr āhutam ṛñjasānam /
analyzed: tam īḍata prathamam yajñasādham viśaḥ ārīḥ āhutam ṛñjasānam
translated: Him, the first to be worshipped, the fulfiller of sacrifices, the invited, the active,

original: ūrjaḥ putram bharataṃ sṛpradānuṃ devā agniṃ dhārayan draviṇodām //
analyzed: ūrjaḥ putram bharatam sṛpra dānum devāḥ agnim dhārayan draviṇaḥ dām
translated: The son of strength, the Bharata, of abundant bounty, the gods have held Agni, the bestower of wealth.

original: sa mātariśvā puruvārapuṣṭir vidad gātuṃ tanayāya svarvit /
analyzed: sa mātariśvā puru vāra puṣṭiḥ vidat gātum tanayāya svar vid
translated: He, the son of Matariśvan, of abundant nourishment, has found the way to heaven for his son.

original: viśāṃ gopā janitā rodasyor devā agniṃ dhārayan draviṇodām //
analyzed: viśām gopāḥ janitā rodasyoḥ devāḥ agnim dhārayan draviṇaḥ dām
translated: The guardian of the people, the creator of the two worlds, the gods have held Agni, the bestower of wealth.

original: naktoṣāsā varṇam āmemyāne dhāpayete śiśum ekaṃ samīcī /
analyzed: nakta uṣāsā varṇam āmemyāne dhāpayete śiśum ekam samīcī
translated: Night and Dawn, of the same form, though they hate each other, nourish the one child together.

original: dyāvākṣāmā rukmo antar vi bhāti devā agniṃ dhārayan draviṇodām //
analyzed: dyāvākṣāmā rukmaḥ antar vi bhāti devāḥ agnim dhārayan draviṇaḥ dām
translated: The heaven and earth, the golden one within shines. The gods have held Agni, the bestower of wealth.

original: rāyo budhnaḥ saṃgamano vasūnāṃ yajñasya ketur manmasādhano veḥ /
analyzed: rāyaḥ budhnaḥ saṃgamanaḥ vasūnām yajñasya ketuḥ manma sādhanaḥ veḥ
translated: The foundation of wealth, the gatherer of treasures, the ensign of sacrifice, the impeller of thought, the bearer of the oblation,

original: amṛtatvaṃ rakṣamāṇāsa enaṃ devā agniṃ dhārayan draviṇodām //
analyzed: amṛta tvam rakṣamāṇāsaḥ enam devāḥ agnim dhārayan draviṇaḥ dām
translated: The immortal gods have placed this Agni, the giver of wealth, as a protector, to guard him.

original: nū ca purā ca sadanaṃ rayīṇāṃ jātasya ca jāyamānasya ca kṣām /
analyzed: nu ca purā ca sadanam rayīṇām jātasya ca jāyamānasya ca kṣām
translated: The seat of wealth, in the past and in the present, the abode of the born and the unborn,

original: sataś ca gopām bhavataś ca bhūrer devā agniṃ dhārayan draviṇodām //🔽draviṇodā draviṇasas turasya draviṇodāḥ sanarasya pra yaṃsat /
analyzed: sataḥ ca gopām bhavataḥ ca bhūreḥ devāḥ agnim dhārayan draviṇaḥ dām  draviṇaḥ dāḥ draviṇasaḥ turasya draviṇaḥ dāḥ sa narasya pra yaṃsat
translated: The guardian of the existent and the non-existent, the gods have placed this Agni, the giver of wealth.🔽The giver of wealth, the possessor of wealth, may he bestow wealth on the strong one.

original: draviṇodā vīravatīm iṣaṃ no draviṇodā rāsate dīrgham āyuḥ //
analyzed: draviṇaḥ dāḥ vīravatīm iṣam naḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ rāsate dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: The giver of wealth, may he grant us food rich in heroes. The giver of wealth, may he bestow long life upon us.

original: evā no agne samidhā vṛdhāno revat pāvaka śravase vi bhāhi /
analyzed: eva naḥ agne samidhā vṛdhānaḥ revat pāvaka śravase vi bhāhi
translated: O Agni, thus, O purifier, be thou exalted by our fuel, shine brightly for great glory.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the ocean, the earth, and the sky grant this to us.

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham agne śuśugdhy ā rayim /
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham agne śuśugdhi ā rayim
translated: O Agni, burn away our sin, shine upon our wealth.

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham //
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Burn away our sin.

original: sukṣetriyā sugātuyā vasūyā ca yajāmahe /
analyzed: sukṣetriyā sugātuyā vasūyā ca yajāmahe
translated: We worship the one with good fields, the one with good paths, and the one with good treasures.

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham //
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Burn away our sin.

original: pra yad bhandiṣṭha eṣām prāsmākāsaś ca sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: pra yat bhandiṣṭhaḥ eṣām pra asmākāsaḥ ca sūrayaḥ
translated: When he is the most radiant of these, and our princes are the most prosperous,

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham //🔽pra yat te agne sūrayo jāyemahi pra te vayam /
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham  pra yat te agne sūrayaḥ jāyemahi pra te vayam
translated: Do thou, O Agni, purify our sin.🔽When, O Agni, we may be born as thy Sûrya-like (sons), and we may be thine,

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham //
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Do thou, O Agni, purify our sin.

original: pra yad agneḥ sahasvato viśvato yanti bhānavaḥ /
analyzed: pra yat agneḥ sahasvataḥ viśvatas yanti bhānavaḥ
translated: When the rays of thee, O Agni, the all-conquering one, come from all sides,

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham //
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Do thou, O Agni, purify our sin.

original: tvaṃ hi viśvatomukha viśvataḥ paribhūr asi /
analyzed: tvam hi viśvatomukha viśvatas paribhūḥ asi
translated: For thou, O Agni, art he who looks on all sides, who is the protector on all sides,

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham //
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Do thou, O Agni, purify our sin.🔽From all sides, O thou who lookest on all sides, deliver us,

original: dviṣo no viśvatomukhāti nāveva pāraya /
analyzed: dviṣaḥ naḥ viśvatomukha ati nāvā iva pāraya
translated: As in a ship, over the sea,

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham //
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Do thou, O Agni, purify our sin.

original: sa naḥ sindhum iva nāvayāti parṣā svastaye /
analyzed: sa naḥ sindhum iva nāvayāti parṣā svastaye
translated: Do thou carry us over (the sea) as in a ship, to well-being,

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham //
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Do thou, O Agni, purify our sin.

original: vaiśvānarasya sumatau syāma rājā hi kam bhuvanānām abhiśrīḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya sumatau syāma rājā hi kam bhuvanānām abhiśrīḥ
translated: In the good grace of Vaisvânara may we be, for he is the king of all the worlds, the overlord.

original: ito jāto viśvam idaṃ vi caṣṭe vaiśvānaro yatate sūryeṇa //
analyzed: itas jātaḥ viśvam idam vi caṣṭe vaiśvānaraḥ yatate sūryeṇa
translated: Born from this (earth), he looks around on all this (world). Vaisvânara strives with the sun.

original: pṛṣṭo divi pṛṣṭo agniḥ pṛthivyām pṛṣṭo viśvā oṣadhīr ā viveśa /
analyzed: pṛṣṭaḥ divi pṛṣṭaḥ agniḥ pṛthivyām pṛṣṭaḥ viśvāḥ oṣadhīḥ ā viveśa
translated: Agni is laid on high in the sky, on the earth, he hath entered all plants,

original: vaiśvānaraḥ sahasā pṛṣṭo agniḥ sa no divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam //
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ sahasā pṛṣṭaḥ agniḥ sa naḥ divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam
translated: Vaisvânara, laid on high with might, with Agni. May he by day and night preserve us from distress.

original: vaiśvānara tava tat satyam astv asmān rāyo maghavānaḥ sacantām /
analyzed: vaiśvānara tava tat satyam astu asmān rāyaḥ maghavānaḥ sacantām
translated: O Vaisvânara, let that be the truth of thine: may the wealthy ones attend on us with wealth.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aditi, Sindhu, the earth, and the sky, destroy that for us.

original: jātavedase sunavāma somam arātīyato ni dahāti vedaḥ /
analyzed: jātavedase sunavāma somam arātīyataḥ ni dahāti vedaḥ
translated: Let us press Soma for Jātavedas. The spell burns away the enemy.

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati durgāṇi viśvā nāveva sindhuṃ duritāty agniḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati durgāṇi viśvā nāvā iva sindhum duritā ati agniḥ
translated: May Agni carry us over all difficulties, as a boat carries (one) over the river, over evil.

original: sa yo vṛṣā vṛṣṇyebhiḥ samokā maho divaḥ pṛthivyāś ca samrāṭ /
analyzed: sa yaḥ vṛṣā vṛṣṇyebhiḥ samokāḥ mahaḥ divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ ca samrāj
translated: He who is a bull, equal to the mighty ones, the emperor of the great heaven and earth,

original: satīnasatvā havyo bhareṣu marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: satīna satvā havyaḥ bhareṣu marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: The bearer of oblations in battles, may he, accompanied by the Maruts, be our protector, O Indra.

original: yasyānāptaḥ sūryasyeva yāmo bharebhare vṛtrahā śuṣmo asti /
analyzed: yasya an āptaḥ sūryasya iva yāmaḥ bharebhare vṛtra hā śuṣmaḥ asti
translated: Whose course is not obstructed, like that of the sun, who has strength in every battle as a Vrtra-killer,

original: vṛṣantamaḥ sakhibhiḥ svebhir evair marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: vṛṣantamaḥ sakhibhiḥ svebhiḥ evaiḥ marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: The most powerful, with his own friends, may he, accompanied by the Maruts, be our protector, O Indra.

original: divo na yasya retaso dughānāḥ panthāso yanti śavasāparītāḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ na yasya retasaḥ dughānāḥ panthāsaḥ yanti śavasā a parītāḥ
translated: Whose paths, filled with power, flow from the seed of the sky,

original: taraddveṣāḥ sāsahiḥ pauṃsyebhir marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: tarat dveṣāḥ sāsahiḥ pauṃsyebhiḥ marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: Overcoming hatred, conquering with manly powers, may he, accompanied by the Maruts, be our protector, O Indra.

original: so aṅgirobhir aṅgirastamo bhūd vṛṣā vṛṣabhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sakhā san /
analyzed: saḥ aṅgirobhiḥ aṅgirastamaḥ bhūt vṛṣā vṛṣabhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sakhā san
translated: He became most brilliant among the Angirases, a bull among bulls, a friend among friends,

original: ṛgmibhir ṛgmī gātubhir jyeṣṭho marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: ṛgmibhiḥ ṛgmī gātubhiḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: The most excellent among the Rg-immersers, with the singers, may he, accompanied by the Maruts, be our protector, O Indra.

original: sa sūnubhir na rudrebhir ṛbhvā nṛṣāhye sāsahvāṃ amitrān /
analyzed: sa sūnubhiḥ na rudrebhiḥ ṛbhvā nṛṣāhye sāsahvān amitrān
translated: He, with his sons, the Rudras, the mighty ones, in the battle of men, may conquer the enemies.

original: sanīḷebhiḥ śravasyāni tūrvan marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: sanīḷebhiḥ śravasyāni tūrvan marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: Striving with his companions for glory, may he, Indra, with the Maruts, be our protector.

original: sa manyumīḥ samadanasya kartāsmākebhir nṛbhiḥ sūryaṃ sanat /
analyzed: sa manyumīḥ samadanasya kartā asmākebhiḥ nṛbhiḥ sūryam sanat
translated: He, the avenger of the angry one, with our men, has set the sun to shine.

original: asminn ahan satpatiḥ puruhūto marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: asmin ahan satpatiḥ puru hūtaḥ marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: May he, the lord of the people, much invoked, with the Maruts, be our protector, Indra.

original: tam ūtayo raṇayañ chūrasātau taṃ kṣemasya kṣitayaḥ kṛṇvata trām /
analyzed: tam ūtayaḥ raṇayam śūrasātau tam kṣemasya kṣitayaḥ kṛṇvata trām
translated: Him, the helpers delight in the battle for the hero, him the dwellings make the protector of the peaceful.

original: sa viśvasya karuṇasyeśa eko marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: sa viśvasya karuṇasya īśe ekaḥ marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: He alone is the lord of all that is to be pitied. May he, Indra, with the Maruts, be our protector.

original: tam apsanta śavasa utsaveṣu naro naram avase taṃ dhanāya /
analyzed: tam śavasaḥ utsaveṣu naraḥ naram avase tam dhanāya
translated: Him the men seek in the festivals of strength, the man for help, him for wealth.

original: so andhe cit tamasi jyotir vidan marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: saḥ andhe cit tamasi jyotiḥ vidat marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: He, finding light even in blinding darkness, may he, Indra, with the Maruts, be our protector.

original: sa savyena yamati vrādhataś cit sa dakṣiṇe saṃgṛbhītā kṛtāni /
analyzed: sa savyena yamati vrādhataḥ cit sa dakṣiṇe saṃgṛbhītā kṛtāni
translated: He rules even the most powerful with his left hand, he has gathered up the deeds with his right.

original: sa kīriṇā cit sanitā dhanāni marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: sa kīriṇā cit sanitā dhanāni marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: He wins even the poor's wealth. May he, Indra, with the Maruts, be our protector.

original: sa grāmebhiḥ sanitā sa rathebhir vide viśvābhiḥ kṛṣṭibhir nv adya /
analyzed: sa grāmebhiḥ sanitā sa rathebhiḥ vide viśvābhiḥ kṛṣṭibhiḥ nu adya
translated: He wins with villages, with chariots, he knows today with all the cultivated fields.

original: sa pauṃsyebhir abhibhūr aśastīr marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: sa pauṃsyebhiḥ abhibhūḥ aśastīḥ marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: May he, the conqueror with manly powers, overcome our foes. May Indra with the Maruts be our protector.

original: sa jāmibhir yat samajāti mīḷhe 'jāmibhir vā puruhūta evaiḥ /
analyzed: sa jāmibhiḥ yat samajāti mīḷhe jāmibhiḥ vā puruhūtaḥ evaiḥ
translated: When he, the much-invoked, has joined the twins in the conflict, or the non-twins with the swift ones,

original: apāṃ tokasya tanayasya jeṣe marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: apām tokasya tanayasya jeṣe marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: For the victory of the offspring of the waters, the son, may Indra with the Maruts be our protector.

original: sa vajrabhṛd dasyuhā bhīma ugraḥ sahasracetāḥ śatanītha ṛbhvā /
analyzed: sa vajrabhṛt dasyu hā bhīmaḥ ugraḥ sahasra cetāḥ śata nīthaḥ ṛbhvā
translated: He, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the slayer of the Dasyus, terrible, fierce,

original: camrīṣo na śavasā pāñcajanyo marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: camrīṣaḥ na śavasā pāñcajanyaḥ marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: Of a thousand thoughts, of a hundred ways, the lord of the Chamrīṣas, the Pañcajana, may Indra with the Maruts be our protector.

original: tasya vajraḥ krandati smat svarṣā divo na tveṣo ravathaḥ śimīvān /
analyzed: tasya vajraḥ krandati smat svarṣāḥ divaḥ na tveṣaḥ ravathaḥ śimīvān
translated: His thunderbolt roars, shining by itself, like the terrible and mighty roar of heaven.

original: taṃ sacante sanayas taṃ dhanāni marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: tam sacante sanayaḥ tam dhanāni marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: The wealth-givers serve him, the treasures serve him. May Indra with the Maruts be our protector.

original: yasyājasraṃ śavasā mānam uktham paribhujad rodasī viśvataḥ sīm /
analyzed: yasya ajasram śavasā mānam uktham paribhujat rodasī viśvatas sīm
translated: Whose praise, with unceasing might, encompasses the two worlds from all sides,

original: sa pāriṣat kratubhir mandasāno marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: sa pāriṣat kratubhiḥ mandasānaḥ marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: The companion, rejoicing with the sacrifices, may Indra with the Maruts be our protector.

original: na yasya devā devatā na martā āpaś cana śavaso antam āpuḥ /
analyzed: na yasya devāḥ devatā na martāḥ āpaḥ cana śavasaḥ antam āpuḥ
translated: Whose divinity, O gods, and humanity, even the waters, have not attained the end of his might,

original: sa prarikvā tvakṣasā kṣmo divaś ca marutvān no bhavatv indra ūtī //
analyzed: sa prarikvā tvakṣasā kṣmaḥ divaḥ ca marutvān naḥ bhavatu indraḥ ūtī
translated: He, the wide-ruling, with his power, of earth and heaven, may Indra with the Maruts be our protector.

original: rohic chyāvā sumadaṃśur lalāmīr dyukṣā rāya ṛjrāśvasya /
analyzed: rohit śyāvā sumat aṃśuḥ lalāmīḥ dyukṣā rāye ṛjrāśvasya
translated: The Rohita, the dark-hued, the well-formed, the spotted, the sky-loving, the swift-hoofed of Raja,

original: vṛṣaṇvantam bibhratī dhūrṣu ratham mandrā ciketa nāhuṣīṣu vikṣu //
analyzed: vṛṣaṇvantam bibhratī dhūrṣu ratham mandrā ciketa nāhuṣīṣu vikṣu
translated: Bearing the strong chariot in the reins, the pleasant one hath been thought of in the Nahusha tribes.

original: etat tyat ta indra vṛṣṇa ukthaṃ vārṣāgirā abhi gṛṇanti rādhaḥ /
analyzed: etat tyad te indra vṛṣṇe uktham vārṣāgirāḥ abhi gṛṇanti rādhaḥ
translated: This is that hymn, O Indra, O mighty one, which the men of Varsha sing to thee for bounty.

original: ṛjrāśvaḥ praṣṭibhir ambarīṣaḥ sahadevo bhayamānaḥ surādhāḥ //
analyzed: ṛjrāśvaḥ praṣṭibhiḥ ambarīṣaḥ sahadevaḥ bhayamānaḥ surādhāḥ
translated: Rijrashva with his teams, Ambarisha, Sahadeva, the fearful, the bountiful,

original: dasyūñ chimyūṃś ca puruhūta evair hatvā pṛthivyāṃ śarvā ni barhīt /
analyzed: dasyūm śimyūn ca puruhūtaḥ evaiḥ hatvā pṛthivyām śarvā ni barhīt
translated: Having slain the Dasas and Shimis with his weapons, Indra hath laid his weapons down upon the earth.

original: sanat kṣetraṃ sakhibhiḥ śvitnyebhiḥ sanat sūryaṃ sanad apaḥ suvajraḥ //
analyzed: sanat kṣetram sakhibhiḥ śvitnyebhiḥ sanat sūryam sanat apaḥ su vajraḥ
translated: He hath won the field with his bright-hued friends, he hath won the sun, he hath won the waters, the wielder of the bolt.

original: viśvāhendro adhivaktā no astv aparihvṛtāḥ sanuyāma vājam /
analyzed: viśvāhā indraḥ adhivaktā naḥ astu aparihvṛtāḥ sanuyāma vājam
translated: May Indra be our overlord, all-conquering; may we win booty, never to be defeated.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: This prayer of ours may Varuna grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

original: pra mandine pitumad arcatā vaco yaḥ kṛṣṇagarbhā nirahann ṛjiśvanā /
analyzed: pra mandine pitumat arcata vacaḥ yaḥ kṛṣṇa garbhā nirahan ṛjiśvanā
translated: To the gladdening one, the father of the hymn, let us sing the praise-song, who with Riji-shvan slew the black-wombed one.

original: avasyavo vṛṣaṇaṃ vajradakṣiṇam marutvantaṃ sakhyāya havāmahe //
analyzed: avasyavaḥ vṛṣaṇam vajra dakṣiṇam marutvantam sakhyāya havāmahe
translated: We invoke the strong one, the wielder of the bolt, the friend, accompanied by the Maruts, for our help.

original: yo vyaṃsaṃ jāhṛṣāṇena manyunā yaḥ śambaraṃ yo ahan piprum avratam /
analyzed: yaḥ vyaṃsam jāhṛṣāṇena manyunā yaḥ śambaram yaḥ ahan piprum avratam
translated: He who with joyous wrath smote Vyan, he who slew Shambara, he who killed the wicked Pipru,

original: indro yaḥ śuṣṇam aśuṣaṃ ny āvṛṇaṅ marutvantaṃ sakhyāya havāmahe //
analyzed: indraḥ yaḥ śuṣṇam aśuṣam ni āvṛṇak marutvantam sakhyāya havāmahe
translated: Indra who overthrew Shushṇa and Ashusha, him attended by the Maruts we invoke to be our friend.

original: yasya dyāvāpṛthivī pauṃsyam mahad yasya vrate varuṇo yasya sūryaḥ /
analyzed: yasya dyāvāpṛthivī pauṃsyam mahat yasya vrate varuṇaḥ yasya sūryaḥ
translated: He whose greatness is Dyaus and Prithivī, whose is Varuna in whose ordinance, whose is Surya,

original: yasyendrasya sindhavaḥ saścati vratam marutvantaṃ sakhyāya havāmahe //
analyzed: yasya indrasya sindhavaḥ saścati vratam marutvantam sakhyāya havāmahe
translated: Whose is the rivers in whose law they flow, him attended by the Maruts we invoke to be our friend.

original: yo aśvānāṃ yo gavāṃ gopatir vaśī ya āritaḥ karmaṇikarmaṇi sthiraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ aśvānām yaḥ gavām gopatiḥ vaśī yaḥ āritaḥ karmaṇi karmaṇi sthiraḥ
translated: He who is the lord of horses, the lord of cows, the powerful one, who is appointed to every rite, who stands firm in every rite,

original: vīḷoś cid indro yo asunvato vadho marutvantaṃ sakhyāya havāmahe //
analyzed: vīḍoḥ cit indraḥ yaḥ a sunvataḥ vadhaḥ marutvantam sakhyāya havāmahe
translated: Indra who is the death of even the strong who pours not libations, him attended by the Maruts we invoke to be our friend.

original: yo viśvasya jagataḥ prāṇatas patir yo brahmaṇe prathamo gā avindat /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvasya jagataḥ prāṇataḥ patiḥ yaḥ brahmaṇe prathamaḥ gāḥ avindat
translated: He who is the lord of the life of the whole moving world, who first found the cows for the Brahman,

original: indro yo dasyūṃr adharāṃ avātiran marutvantaṃ sakhyāya havāmahe //
analyzed: indraḥ yaḥ dasyūṃr adharān avātirat marutvantam sakhyāya havāmahe
translated: Indra who drove the Dasyus down to the nether world, him attended by the Maruts we invoke to be our friend.

original: yaḥ śūrebhir havyo yaś ca bhīrubhir yo dhāvadbhir hūyate yaś ca jigyubhiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ śūrebhiḥ havyaḥ yaḥ ca bhīrubhiḥ yaḥ dhāvadbhiḥ hūyate yaḥ ca jigyubhiḥ
translated: He who is to be invoked by the brave, and by the timid, who is offered by those who run, and by those who conquer,

original: indraṃ yaṃ viśvā bhuvanābhi saṃdadhur marutvantaṃ sakhyāya havāmahe //
analyzed: indram yam viśvā bhuvanā abhi saṃdadhuḥ marutvantam sakhyāya havāmahe
translated: Indra whom all beings have established, him attended by the Maruts we invoke to be our friend.

original: rudrāṇām eti pradiśā vicakṣaṇo rudrebhir yoṣā tanute pṛthu jrayaḥ /
analyzed: rudrāṇām eti pradiśā vicakṣaṇaḥ rudrebhiḥ yoṣā tanute pṛthu jrayaḥ
translated: The all-seeing one goes to the quarters of the Rudras, the consort of the Rudras spreads out her wide rays.

original: indram manīṣā abhy arcati śrutam marutvantaṃ sakhyāya havāmahe //
analyzed: indram manīṣāḥ abhī arcati śrutam marutvantam sakhyāya havāmahe
translated: Thought extols the renowned Indra, attended by the Maruts, we invoke him for friendship.

original: yad vā marutvaḥ parame sadhasthe yad vāvame vṛjane mādayāse /
analyzed: yat vā marutvas parame sadhasthe yat vā avame vṛjane mādayāse
translated: If, O Marut-accompanied one, in the highest assembly, or if in the lower gathering you delight yourself,

original: ata ā yāhy adhvaraṃ no acchā tvāyā haviś cakṛmā satyarādhaḥ //
analyzed: atas ā yāhi adhvaram naḥ acchā tvāyā haviḥ cakṛma satya rādhaḥ
translated: From there come to our sacrifice: for you we have prepared the oblation, O you whose gifts are true.

original: tvāyendra somaṃ suṣumā sudakṣa tvāyā haviś cakṛmā brahmavāhaḥ /
analyzed: tvāyā indra somam suṣuma su dakṣa tvāyā haviḥ cakṛma brahma vāhaḥ
translated: For you, O Indra, the well-formed, O you of good skill, we have pressed the Soma; for you, O you who carry the prayer, we have prepared the oblation.

original: adhā niyutvaḥ sagaṇo marudbhir asmin yajñe barhiṣi mādayasva //
analyzed: adhā niyutvas sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ asmin yajñe barhiṣi mādayasva
translated: Now, accompanied by your team and the Maruts, rejoice in this sacrifice on the sacrificial grass.

original: mādayasva haribhir ye ta indra vi ṣyasva śipre vi sṛjasva dhene /🔽ā tvā suśipra harayo vahantūśan havyāni prati no juṣasva //🔽marutstotrasya vṛjanasya gopā vayam indreṇa sanuyāma vājam /
analyzed: mādayasva haribhiḥ ye te indra vi syasva śipre vi sṛjasva dhene  ā tvā su śipra harayaḥ vahantu uśan havyāni prati naḥ juṣasva  marutstotrasya vṛjanasya gopāḥ vayam indreṇa sanuyāma vājam
translated: Rejoice, O Indra, with your bay steeds; burst forth on the broad (paths); let loose your milch-cow.🔽Let your tawny coursers bring you hither, O you of beautiful eyebrows; be pleased with our oblations, O you who are to be invoked.🔽Under the protection of the Marut-praised Vr̥itra-slayer may we win strength with Indra.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, Sindhu, Earth, and Heaven grant this to us.

original: imāṃ te dhiyam pra bhare maho mahīm asya stotre dhiṣaṇā yat ta ānaje /
analyzed: imām te dhiyam pra bhare mahaḥ mahīm asya stotre dhiṣaṇā yat te ānaje
translated: I bring to thee this hymn, great and mighty, since in this praise of thine the thoughts have gladdened me.

original: tam utsave ca prasave ca sāsahim indraṃ devāsaḥ śavasāmadann anu //
analyzed: tam utsave ca prasave ca sāsahim indram devāsaḥ śavasā amadan anu
translated: The Gods have rejoiced in Indra, the all-conquering, in the joy of the feast and in the joy of the battle.

original: asya śravo nadyaḥ sapta bibhrati dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī darśataṃ vapuḥ /
analyzed: asya śravaḥ nadyaḥ sapta bibhrati dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī darśatam vapuḥ
translated: Seven rivers bear his glory, heaven and earth his wondrous form.

original: asme sūryācandramasābhicakṣe śraddhe kam indra carato vitarturam //
analyzed: asme sūryācandramasā abhicakṣe śraddhe kam indra carataḥ vitarturam
translated: In us are the sun and moon, the two most excellent, O Indra, the two that move in their appointed course.

original: taṃ smā ratham maghavan prāva sātaye jaitraṃ yaṃ te anumadāma saṃgame /
analyzed: tam smā ratham maghavan prāva sātaye jaitram yam te anumadāma saṃgame
translated: That car, O bounteous Lord, do thou impel to victory, which we will urge on in the encounter.

original: ājā na indra manasā puruṣṭuta tvāyadbhyo maghavañ charma yaccha naḥ //
analyzed: ājā naḥ indra manasā puruṣṭuta tvāyadbhyaḥ maghavan śarma yaccha naḥ
translated: Come to us, O Indra, with thy spirit, O much-invoked! Give protection to those who have come to thee for help.

original: vayaṃ jayema tvayā yujā vṛtam asmākam aṃśam ud avā bharebhare /
analyzed: vayam jayema tvayā yujā vṛtam asmākam aṃśam ud ava bharebhare
translated: May we be victorious through thee as our ally. In every fight raise up our portion.

original: asmabhyam indra varivaḥ sugaṃ kṛdhi pra śatrūṇām maghavan vṛṣṇyā ruja //
analyzed: asmabhyam indra varivaḥ su gam kṛdhi pra śatrūṇām maghavan vṛṣṇyā ruja
translated: Make thou a wide and easy path for us, O Indra, O bounteous Lord, crush the power of our enemies.

original: nānā hi tvā havamānā janā ime dhanānāṃ dhartar avasā vipanyavaḥ /
analyzed: nānā hi tvā havamānāḥ janāḥ ime dhanānām dhartar avasā vipanyavaḥ
translated: These people here invoke thee in various ways, O thou who givest treasures, O thou who art to be won by devotion.

original: asmākaṃ smā ratham ā tiṣṭha sātaye jaitraṃ hīndra nibhṛtam manas tava //
analyzed: asmākam smā ratham ā tiṣṭha sātaye jaitram hi indra nibhṛtam manaḥ tava
translated: Mount thou our car for victory, for thou hast a victorious car, O Indra, thy spirit is firm.

original: gojitā bāhū amitakratuḥ simaḥ karmankarmañ chatamūtiḥ khajaṅkaraḥ /
analyzed: go jitā bāhū amita kratuḥ simaḥ karman karmam śatamūtiḥ khajaṅkaraḥ
translated: His arms are strong, his power is infinite, he is the hero in every deed, the hundred-aided, the crusher.

original: akalpa indraḥ pratimānam ojasāthā janā vi hvayante siṣāsavaḥ //
analyzed: akalpaḥ indraḥ pratimānam ojasā athā janāḥ vi hvayante siṣāsavaḥ
translated: Indra is fashioned after his own will, in strength he is the model. Then the people call on him, longing for spoil.

original: ut te śatān maghavann uc ca bhūyasa ut sahasrād ririce kṛṣṭiṣu śravaḥ /
analyzed: ud te śatāt maghavan ud ca bhūyasaḥ ud sahasrāt ririce kṛṣṭiṣu śravaḥ
translated: Thy fame, O Maghavan, hath risen above a hundred, and above a thousand in the battles for the spoil.

original: amātraṃ tvā dhiṣaṇā titviṣe mahy adhā vṛtrāṇi jighnase purandara //
analyzed: amātram tvā dhiṣaṇā titviṣe mahī adhā vṛtrāṇi jighnase purandara
translated: The measureless thought hath shone upon thee as great: thou shalt smite away the Vritras, O Purandara.

original: triviṣṭidhātu pratimānam ojasas tisro bhūmīr nṛpate trīṇi rocanā /
analyzed: triviṣṭi dhātu pratimānam ojasaḥ tisraḥ bhūmīḥ nṛpate trīṇi rocanā
translated: The three worlds are the model of thy strength, O lord of men, three are the regions of the sky.

original: atīdaṃ viśvam bhuvanaṃ vavakṣithāśatrur indra januṣā sanād asi //
analyzed: ati idam viśvam bhuvanam vavakṣitha a śatruḥ indra januṣā sanāt asi
translated: Thou hast grown beyond this all-surpassing world: from birth thou art, O Indra, the foe of foes.

original: tvāṃ deveṣu prathamaṃ havāmahe tvam babhūtha pṛtanāsu sāsahiḥ /
analyzed: tvām deveṣu prathamam havāmahe tvam babhūtha pṛtanāsu sāsahiḥ
translated: Thee first of all we call on in the battles, thee who hast been the conqueror in the wars.

original: semaṃ naḥ kārum upamanyum udbhidam indraḥ kṛṇotu prasave ratham puraḥ //
analyzed: sa imam naḥ kārum upamanyum udbhidam indraḥ kṛṇotu prasave ratham puras
translated: Let Indra make this our Karu, our Upamaṇyu, our Udbhid, our chariot, victorious in the race.

original: tvaṃ jigetha na dhanā rurodhithārbheṣv ājā maghavan mahatsu ca /
analyzed: tvam jigetha na dhanā rurodhitha arbheṣu ājā maghavan mahatsu ca
translated: Thou hast won the wealth, thou hast stopped the wealth in the young and the great, O Maghavan.

original: tvām ugram avase saṃ śiśīmasy athā na indra havaneṣu codaya //
analyzed: tvām ugram avase sam śiśīmasi athā naḥ indra havaneṣu codaya
translated: We sharpen thee, the strong, for aid: then, O Indra, impel us to the invocations.

original: viśvāhendro adhivaktā no astv aparihvṛtāḥ sanuyāma vājam /
analyzed: viśvāhā indraḥ adhivaktā naḥ astu aparihvṛtāḥ sanuyāma vājam
translated: May Indra be our overlord, all-conquering; may we win booty, unresisted.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: This wish of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

original: tat ta indriyam paramam parācair adhārayanta kavayaḥ puredam /
analyzed: tat te indriyam paramam parācais adhārayanta kavayaḥ purā idam
translated: This highest power of thine, O Indra, which the ancient sages have established in the east,

original: kṣamedam anyad divy anyad asya sam ī pṛcyate samaneva ketuḥ //🔽sa dhārayat pṛthivīm paprathac ca vajreṇa hatvā nir apaḥ sasarja /
analyzed: kṣamā idam anyat divi anyat asya sam ī pṛcyate samanā iva ketuḥ  sa dhārayat pṛthivīm paprathat ca vajreṇa hatvā niḥ apaḥ sasarja
translated: This other power of thine, which is in heaven, is joined together like a banner in the wind.🔽He who supports the earth, and spreads it out, and with his thunderbolt hath slain and loosed the floods,

original: ahann ahim abhinad rauhiṇaṃ vy ahan vyaṃsam maghavā śacībhiḥ //
analyzed: ahan ahim abhinat rauhiṇam vi ahan vyaṃsam maghavā śacībhiḥ
translated: Who slew the Dragon, cleft the mountain, and with might rent Vṛtra limb from limb.

original: sa jātūbharmā śraddadhāna ojaḥ puro vibhindann acarad vi dāsīḥ /
analyzed: sa jātūbharmā śraddadhānaḥ ojaḥ puras vibhindan acarat vi dāsīḥ
translated: He, the impeller, faithful, with his power, bursting the forts, hath gone to the Dâsa's wives.

original: vidvān vajrin dasyave hetim asyāryaṃ saho vardhayā dyumnam indra //
analyzed: vidvān vajrin dasyave hetim asya āryam sahaḥ vardhaya dyumnam indra
translated: Thou, knowing, O Thunderer, hast sent thy weapon to the Dasyu: thou hast strengthened the Ârya's might and fame, O Indra.

original: tad ūcuṣe mānuṣemā yugāni kīrtenyam maghavā nāma bibhrat /
analyzed: tat ūcuṣe mānuṣā imā yugāni kīrtenyam maghavā nāma bibhrat
translated: This hath he told in human generations, bearing a name to be renowned, the bounteous.

original: upaprayan dasyuhatyāya vajrī yad dha sūnuḥ śravase nāma dadhe //
analyzed: upaprayan dasyu hatyāya vajrī yat ha sūnuḥ śravase nāma dadhe
translated: The Thunderer, eager to slay the Dasyu, when he, the Son, assumed a name for glory.

original: tad asyedam paśyatā bhūri puṣṭaṃ śrad indrasya dhattana vīryāya /
analyzed: tat asya idam paśyata bhūri puṣṭam śrath indrasya dhattana vīryāya
translated: This his great nourishment have ye beheld: give to the glory of Indra your devotion.

original: sa gā avindat so avindad aśvān sa oṣadhīḥ so apaḥ sa vanāni //
analyzed: sa gāḥ avindat saḥ avindat aśvān saḥ oṣadhīḥ saḥ apaḥ sa vanāni
translated: He found the cows, he found the horses, he found the plants, he found the waters, and the woods.

original: bhūrikarmaṇe vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe satyaśuṣmāya sunavāma somam /🔽ya ādṛtyā paripanthīva śūro 'yajvano vibhajann eti vedaḥ //
analyzed: bhūri karmaṇe vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe satya śuṣmāya sunavāma somam  yaḥ ādṛtya paripanthī iva śūraḥ yajvanaḥ vibhajan eti vedaḥ
translated: To the bountiful, the bull, the strong, to him of true strength, let us press the Soma.🔽He, like a hero who stands in the way, divides the wealth of those who do not sacrifice.

original: tad indra preva vīryaṃ cakartha yat sasantaṃ vajreṇābodhayo 'him /
analyzed: tat indra pra iva vīryam cakartha yat sasantam vajreṇa abodhayaḥ him
translated: O Indra, you have done this deed like Indra, that you have awakened the sleeping serpent with your thunderbolt.

original: anu tvā patnīr hṛṣitaṃ vayaś ca viśve devāso amadann anu tvā //
analyzed: anu tvā patnīḥ hṛṣitam vayaḥ ca viśve devāsaḥ amadan anu tvā
translated: After you, your wives, your delighted people, and all the gods have rejoiced in you.

original: śuṣṇam pipruṃ kuyavaṃ vṛtram indra yadāvadhīr vi puraḥ śambarasya /
analyzed: śuṣṇam piprum kuyavam vṛtram indra yadā avadhīḥ vi puraḥ śambarasya
translated: O Indra, when you slew Shushna, Pipru, Kuya, and Vritra, and broke down the forts of Shambara,

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the Sindhu, the earth, and the sky protect us from that.

original: yoniṣ ṭa indra niṣade akāri tam ā ni ṣīda svāno nārvā /
analyzed: yoniḥ te indra niṣade akāri tam ā ni sīda svānaḥ na arvā
translated: O Indra, a place has been made for you to sit down; sit down in it, like a horse in a stable.

original: vimucyā vayo 'vasāyāśvān doṣā vastor vahīyasaḥ prapitve //
analyzed: vimucya vayaḥ vasāya aśvān doṣā vastoḥ vahīyasaḥ prapitve
translated: Having loosed the birds and the horses for rest, come in the evening for more abundant food.

original: o tye nara indram ūtaye gur nū cit tān sadyo adhvano jagamyāt /
analyzed: ā u tye naraḥ indram ūtaye guḥ nu cit tān sadyas adhvanaḥ jagamyāt
translated: These men have called Indra to their aid; he should quickly come even from afar.

original: devāso manyuṃ dāsasya ścamnan te na ā vakṣan suvitāya varṇam //
analyzed: devāsaḥ manyum dāsasya ścamnan te naḥ ā vakṣan suvitāya varṇam
translated: The gods have quelled the wrath of the Dasa; they have brought his people to prosperity.

original: ava tmanā bharate ketavedā ava tmanā bharate phenam udan /
analyzed: ava tmanā bharate keta vedāḥ ava tmanā bharate phenam udan
translated: He bears the foam himself, he who knows the signs, he bears it himself.

original: kṣīreṇa snātaḥ kuyavasya yoṣe hate te syātām pravaṇe śiphāyāḥ //
analyzed: kṣīreṇa snātaḥ kuyavasya yoṣe hate te syātām pravaṇe śiphāyāḥ
translated: Bathed in milk, O you of crooked ways, let your two breasts be for him, O you of the sharp point.

original: yuyopa nābhir uparasyāyoḥ pra pūrvābhis tirate rāṣṭi śūraḥ /
analyzed: yuyopa nābhiḥ uparasya āyoḥ pra pūrvābhiḥ tirate rāṣṭi śūraḥ
translated: The navel of the lower one is joined, the hero surpasses with his former ones.
