original: añjasī kuliśī vīrapatnī payo hinvānā udabhir bharante //
analyzed: añjasī kuliśī vīra patnī payaḥ hinvānāḥ udabhiḥ bharante
translated: The anointed, the wife of the hero, the foam, the waters, are carrying milk.

original: prati yat syā nīthādarśi dasyor oko nācchā sadanaṃ jānatī gāt /
analyzed: prati yat syā nīthā adarśi dasyoḥ okaḥ nā acchā sadanam jānatī gāt
translated: When the Dasyu's abode is seen from the light, the one who knows goes to his own seat.

original: adha smā no maghavañ carkṛtād in mā no magheva niṣṣapī parā dāḥ //
analyzed: adha smā naḥ maghavan carkṛtāt id mā naḥ maghā iva niṣṣapī parā dāḥ
translated: Now, O bountiful one, do this for us. Do not give us up, O bountiful one, like a slave.

original: sa tvaṃ na indra sūrye so apsv anāgāstva ā bhaja jīvaśaṃse /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ indra sūrye saḥ apsu anāgāstve ā bhaja jīva śaṃse
translated: You, O Indra, in the sun, in the waters, grant us freedom from sin, prosperity, and praise.

original: māntarām bhujam ā rīriṣo naḥ śraddhitaṃ te mahata indriyāya //
analyzed: mā antarām bhujam ā rīriṣaḥ naḥ śraddhitam te mahate indriyāya
translated: Do not afflict us with hunger between this and the next world. We believe in your great power, O Indra.

original: adhā manye śrat te asmā adhāyi vṛṣā codasva mahate dhanāya /🔽mā no akṛte puruhūta yonāv indra kṣudhyadbhyo vaya āsutiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: adhā manye śrat te asmai adhāyi vṛṣā codasva mahate dhanāya  mā naḥ a kṛte puruhūta yonau indra kṣudhyadbhyaḥ vayaḥ āsutim dāḥ
translated: Now I think that your mind has turned to us. O bull, urge us on for great wealth.🔽Do not, O much-invoked Indra, in the womb of the unborn, give us, who are hungry, to be devoured.

original: mā no vadhīr indra mā parā dā mā naḥ priyā bhojanāni pra moṣīḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ vadhīḥ indra mā parā dāḥ mā naḥ priyā bhojanāni pra moṣīḥ
translated: Do not kill us, O Indra, do not abandon us. Do not take away from us our dear food.

original: āṇḍā mā no maghavañ chakra nir bhen mā naḥ pātrā bhet sahajānuṣāṇi //
analyzed: āṇḍā mā naḥ maghavan śakra niḥ bhet mā naḥ pātrā bhet sahajānuṣāṇi
translated: Do not, O Maghavan, O Sakra, crush our eggs, do not crush our vessels, our own born ones.

original: arvāṅ ehi somakāmaṃ tvāhur ayaṃ sutas tasya pibā madāya /
analyzed: arvāṅ ehi soma kāmam tvā āhuḥ ayam sutaḥ tasya pibā madāya
translated: Come hitherward: they call thee longing for the Soma. This juice is shed: drink of it for thy delight.

original: uruvyacā jaṭhara ā vṛṣasva piteva naḥ śṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ //
analyzed: uru vyacāḥ jaṭhare ā vṛṣasva pitā iva naḥ śṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ
translated: O thou of ample room, be filled within: be thou, as 'twere, our father, when we call on thee.

original: candramā apsv antar ā suparṇo dhāvate divi /
analyzed: candramāḥ apsu antar ā suparṇaḥ dhāvate divi
translated: The Moon is in the waters: the bird runs through the heaven.

original: na vo hiraṇyanemayaḥ padaṃ vindanti vidyuto vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: na vaḥ hiraṇya nemayaḥ padam vindanti vidyutaḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: The lightning finds not your abode, O ye whose paths are golden. Mark ye my words, ye Twain, ye Twain, ye Twain.

original: artham id vā u arthina ā jāyā yuvate patim /
analyzed: artham id vai u arthinaḥ ā jāyā yuvate patim
translated: The wife, indeed, for the sake of gain, approaches her husband.

original: tuñjāte vṛṣṇyam payaḥ paridāya rasaṃ duhe vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: tuñjāte vṛṣṇyam payaḥ paridāya rasam duhe vittam me asya rodasī
translated: The two have pressed out strength and milk: the one gives, the other milks the juice. Mark ye my words, ye Twain, ye Twain, ye Twain.

original: mo ṣu devā adaḥ svar ava pādi divas pari /
analyzed: mā u su devāḥ adaḥ svar ava pādi divaḥ pari
translated: O ye Gods, hath this heaven not been placed here below the sky?

original: mā somyasya śambhuvaḥ śūne bhūma kadā cana vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: mā somyasya śambhuvaḥ śūne bhūma kadā cana vittam me asya rodasī
translated: Let not the blissful Soma ever fail us. Mark ye my words, ye Twain, ye Twain, ye Twain.

original: yajñam pṛcchāmy avamaṃ sa tad dūto vi vocati /
analyzed: yajñam pṛcchāmi avamam sa tat dūtaḥ vi vocati
translated: I ask the sacrifice, the youngest: he, the messenger, will tell it forth to you.

original: kva ṛtam pūrvyaṃ gataṃ kas tad bibharti nūtano vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: kva ṛtam pūrvyam gatam kaḥ tat bibharti nūtanaḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: Where is the ancient truth departed? Who bears it now? Mark ye my words, ye Twain, ye Twain, ye Twain.

original: amī ye devā sthana triṣv ā rocane divaḥ /
analyzed: amī ye devā sthana triṣu ā rocane divaḥ
translated: Ye Gods who dwell in the three luminous realms of heaven,

original: kad va ṛtaṃ kad anṛtaṃ kva pratnā va āhutir vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: kad vaḥ ṛtam kad anṛtam kva pratnā vaḥ āhutiḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: What is the truth? What is the falsehood? Where is the ancient offering? May I find this out, O ye two worlds.

original: kad va ṛtasya dharṇasi kad varuṇasya cakṣaṇam /
analyzed: kad vaḥ ṛtasya dharṇasi kad varuṇasya cakṣaṇam
translated: What is the support of truth? What is the watchfulness of Varuna?

original: kad aryamṇo mahas pathāti krāmema dūḍhyo vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: kad aryamṇaḥ mahaḥ pathā ati krāmema dūḍhyaḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: What is the great path of Aryaman? May we pass beyond all troubles. May I find this out, O ye two worlds.

original: ahaṃ so asmi yaḥ purā sute vadāmi kāni cit /
analyzed: aham saḥ asmi yaḥ purā sute vadāmi kāni cit
translated: I am he who formerly, when the juice was pressed, spoke some things.

original: tam mā vyanty ādhyo vṛko na tṛṣṇajam mṛgaṃ vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: tam mā vyanti ādhyaḥ vṛkaḥ na tṛṣṇajam mṛgam vittam me asya rodasī
translated: Let not the Adhyas, like a wolf, destroy me, like a thirsty deer. May I find this out, O ye two worlds.

original: sam mā tapanty abhitaḥ sapatnīr iva parśavaḥ /
analyzed: sam mā tapanti abhitas sapatnīḥ iva parśavaḥ
translated: They burn me on all sides, like rival wives, the ribs.

original: mūṣo na śiśnā vy adanti mādhya stotāraṃ te śatakrato vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: mūṣaḥ na śiśnā vi adanti mā adhya stotāram te śatakrato vittam me asya rodasī
translated: Like mice my privy parts gnaw at me. O thou of a hundred powers, protect the praiser. May I find this out, O ye two worlds.

original: amī ye sapta raśmayas tatrā me nābhir ātatā /
analyzed: amī ye sapta raśmayaḥ tatra me nābhiḥ ātatā
translated: These seven rays of thine are there, and my navel is stretched out.

original: tritas tad vedāptyaḥ sa jāmitvāya rebhati vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: tritaḥ tat veda āptyaḥ sa jāmi tvāya rebhati vittam me asya rodasī
translated: Trita knows that, the son of Aptri, he sings for the sake of kinship. May I find this out, O ye two worlds.

original: amī ye pañcokṣaṇo madhye tasthur maho divaḥ /
analyzed: amī ye pañca ukṣaṇaḥ madhye tasthuḥ mahaḥ divaḥ
translated: These five swift ones who stand in the middle of the great heaven,

original: devatrā nu pravācyaṃ sadhrīcīnā ni vāvṛtur vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: devatrā nu pravācyam sadhrīcīnāḥ ni vāvṛtuḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: they have turned towards the gods, in unison, the thing to be proclaimed. May I find this out, O ye two worlds.

original: suparṇā eta āsate madhya ārodhane divaḥ /
analyzed: suparṇāḥ ete āsate madhye ārodhane divaḥ
translated: The eagles sit on these, in the middle of the enclosure of the sky.

original: te sedhanti patho vṛkaṃ tarantaṃ yahvatīr apo vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: te sedhanti pathaḥ vṛkam tarantam yahvatīḥ apaḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: They keep the wolf away from the path, crossing the mighty waters. May I find this earth and heaven.

original: navyaṃ tad ukthyaṃ hitaṃ devāsaḥ supravācanam /
analyzed: navyam tat ukthyam hitam devāsaḥ su pravācanam
translated: That new hymn worthy of praise is set for the gods, easy to utter.

original: ṛtam arṣanti sindhavaḥ satyaṃ tātāna sūryo vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: ṛtam arṣanti sindhavaḥ satyam tātāna sūryaḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: The rivers flow with truth, the sun with truth, O father. May I find this earth and heaven.

original: agne tava tyad ukthyaṃ deveṣv asty āpyam /
analyzed: agne tava tyad ukthyam deveṣu asti āpyam
translated: O Agni, that hymn of yours worthy of praise exists among the gods, to be attained.

original: sa naḥ satto manuṣvad ā devān yakṣi viduṣṭaro vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: sa naḥ sattaḥ manuṣvat ā devān yakṣi viduṣṭaraḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: As a good leader among men, serve the gods for us, most wise. May I find this earth and heaven.

original: satto hotā manuṣvad ā devāṃ acchā viduṣṭaraḥ /
analyzed: sattaḥ hotā manuṣvat ā devān acchā viduṣṭaraḥ
translated: As a good leader among men, serve the gods for us, most wise.

original: agnir havyā suṣūdati devo deveṣu medhiro vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: agniḥ havyā suṣūdati devaḥ deveṣu medhiraḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: Agni purifies the oblations, the god, the wise one, among the gods. May I find this earth and heaven.

original: brahmā kṛṇoti varuṇo gātuvidaṃ tam īmahe /
analyzed: brahmā kṛṇoti varuṇaḥ gātu vidam tam īmahe
translated: The Brahman creates, Varuna knows the way. We implore him.

original: vy ūrṇoti hṛdā matiṃ navyo jāyatām ṛtaṃ vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: vi ūrṇoti hṛdā matim navyaḥ jāyatām ṛtam vittam me asya rodasī
translated: He unravels the thought in the heart. Let the new (day) be born. Let truth be found. May I find this earth and heaven.

original: asau yaḥ panthā ādityo divi pravācyaṃ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: asau yaḥ panthāḥ ādityaḥ divi pravācyam kṛtaḥ
translated: That path which is yonder, the sun in the sky, is made to be proclaimed.

original: na sa devā atikrame tam martāso na paśyatha vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: na sa devāḥ atikrame tam martāsaḥ na paśyatha vittam me asya rodasī
translated: The gods do not transgress it. Mortals do not see it. May I find this earth and heaven.

original: tritaḥ kūpe 'vahito devān havata ūtaye /
analyzed: tritaḥ kūpe vahitaḥ devān havate ūtaye
translated: Trita, thrown into a pit, invoked the gods for help.

original: tac chuśrāva bṛhaspatiḥ kṛṇvann aṃhūraṇād uru vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: tat śuśrāva bṛhaspatiḥ kṛṇvan aṃhūraṇāt uru vittam me asya rodasī
translated: Brihaspati heard that, making the distress great. May the two worlds know my wealth.

original: aruṇo mā sakṛd vṛkaḥ pathā yantaṃ dadarśa hi /
analyzed: aruṇaḥ mā sakṛt vṛkaḥ pathā yantam dadarśa hi
translated: The red wolf saw me once, as I was going along the path.

original: uj jihīte nicāyyā taṣṭeva pṛṣṭyāmayī vittam me asya rodasī //
analyzed: ud jihīte nicāyyā taṣṭā iva pṛṣṭi āmayī vittam me asya rodasī
translated: It howls, having seized me, like a weaver with a shuttle. May the two worlds know my wealth.

original: enāṅgūṣeṇa vayam indravanto 'bhi ṣyāma vṛjane sarvavīrāḥ /
analyzed: enā āṅgūṣeṇa vayam indravantaḥ bhi syāma vṛjane sarva vīrāḥ
translated: With this eulogy, may we, possessing Indra, be victorious in the contest, with all our heroes.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the Sindhu, the earth, and the sky, grant this to us.

original: indram mitraṃ varuṇam agnim ūtaye mārutaṃ śardho aditiṃ havāmahe /
analyzed: indram mitram varuṇam agnim ūtaye mārutam śardhaḥ aditim havāmahe
translated: We invoke Indra, Mitra, Varuna, Agni, the Marut host, and Aditi, for help.

original: rathaṃ na durgād vasavaḥ sudānavo viśvasmān no aṃhaso niṣ pipartana //
analyzed: ratham na durgāt vasavaḥ su dānavaḥ viśvasmāt naḥ aṃhasaḥ niḥ pipartana
translated: Like a chariot from a difficult place, O Vasus, bestowers of good gifts, deliver us from all misfortune.

original: ta ādityā ā gatā sarvatātaye bhūta devā vṛtratūryeṣu śambhuvaḥ /
analyzed: te ādityāḥ ā gata sarvatātaye bhūta devāḥ vṛtratūryeṣu śambhuvaḥ
translated: O Adityas, come hither for all-embracing help. Be present, O gods, in the battles for the slaying of Vrtra, bestowing well-being.

original: rathaṃ na durgād vasavaḥ sudānavo viśvasmān no aṃhaso niṣ pipartana //
analyzed: ratham na durgāt vasavaḥ su dānavaḥ viśvasmāt naḥ aṃhasaḥ niḥ pipartana
translated: Like a chariot from a difficult place, O Vasus, bestowers of good gifts, deliver us from all misfortune.

original: avantu naḥ pitaraḥ supravācanā uta devī devaputre ṛtāvṛdhā /
analyzed: avantu naḥ pitaraḥ su pravācanāḥ uta devī deva putre ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: May our fathers, who are to be praised well, and the two divine daughters of the gods, who increase truth,

original: rathaṃ na durgād vasavaḥ sudānavo viśvasmān no aṃhaso niṣ pipartana //
analyzed: ratham na durgāt vasavaḥ su dānavaḥ viśvasmāt naḥ aṃhasaḥ niḥ pipartana
translated: As on a chariot from a difficult place, O Vasus, givers of good gifts, deliver us from every misfortune.

original: narāśaṃsaṃ vājinaṃ vājayann iha kṣayadvīram pūṣaṇaṃ sumnair īmahe /
analyzed: narāśaṃsam vājinam vājayan iha kṣayadvīram pūṣaṇam sumnaiḥ īmahe
translated: We invoke Narāśaṃsa, the strong one, the one who delights in strength, Pūṣan, the destroyer of heroes, with favors.

original: rathaṃ na durgād vasavaḥ sudānavo viśvasmān no aṃhaso niṣ pipartana //
analyzed: ratham na durgāt vasavaḥ su dānavaḥ viśvasmāt naḥ aṃhasaḥ niḥ pipartana
translated: As on a chariot from a difficult place, O Vasus, givers of good gifts, deliver us from every misfortune.

original: bṛhaspate sadam in naḥ sugaṃ kṛdhi śaṃ yor yat te manurhitaṃ tad īmahe /
analyzed: bṛhaspate sadam id naḥ sugam kṛdhi śam yos yat te manuḥ hitam tat īmahe
translated: O Brihaspati, make our path ever easy. We seek that which is beneficial for us.

original: rathaṃ na durgād vasavaḥ sudānavo viśvasmān no aṃhaso niṣ pipartana //
analyzed: ratham na durgāt vasavaḥ su dānavaḥ viśvasmāt naḥ aṃhasaḥ niḥ pipartana
translated: As on a chariot from a difficult place, O Vasus, givers of good gifts, deliver us from every misfortune.

original: indraṃ kutso vṛtrahaṇaṃ śacīpatiṃ kāṭe nibāḷha ṛṣir ahvad ūtaye /
analyzed: indram kutsaḥ vṛtra haṇam śacīpatim kāṭe nibāḍhaḥ ṛṣiḥ ahvat ūtaye
translated: The Ṛṣi Kutsa, dwelling in Kāṭa, called upon Indra, the slayer of Vṛtra, the lord of might, for help.

original: rathaṃ na durgād vasavaḥ sudānavo viśvasmān no aṃhaso niṣ pipartana //
analyzed: ratham na durgāt vasavaḥ su dānavaḥ viśvasmāt naḥ aṃhasaḥ niḥ pipartana
translated: As on a chariot from a difficult place, O Vasus, givers of good gifts, deliver us from every misfortune.

original: devair no devy aditir ni pātu devas trātā trāyatām aprayucchan /
analyzed: devaiḥ naḥ devī aditiḥ ni pātu devaḥ trātā trāyatām aprayucchan
translated: May the Goddess Aditi, with the gods, protect us. May the protecting god guard us, ever watchful.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, Sindhu, the earth, and the sky spare us from that.

original: yajño devānām praty eti sumnam ādityāso bhavatā mṛḷayantaḥ /
analyzed: yajñaḥ devānām prati eti sumnam ādityāsaḥ bhavata mṛḍayantaḥ
translated: The sacrifice of the gods returns to the gods' favor. Be ye gracious, O Ādityas.

original: ā vo 'rvācī sumatir vavṛtyād aṃhoś cid yā varivovittarāsat //
analyzed: ā vaḥ rvācī sumatiḥ vavṛtyāt aṃhoḥ cit yā varivaḥ vittarā asat
translated: May your favour turn to us again, which is more spacious than the narrowest distress.

original: upa no devā avasā gamantv aṅgirasāṃ sāmabhi stūyamānāḥ /
analyzed: upa naḥ devāḥ avasā gamantu aṅgirasām sāmabhi stūyamānāḥ
translated: May the gods come to us with help, praised with the Sāman chants of the Angirases,

original: indra indriyair maruto marudbhir ādityair no aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat //
analyzed: indraḥ indriyaiḥ marutaḥ marudbhiḥ ādityaiḥ naḥ aditiḥ śarma yaṃsat
translated: May Indra with his powers, the Maruts with the Maruts, Aditi with the Ādityas grant us protection.

original: tan na indras tad varuṇas tad agnis tad aryamā tat savitā cano dhāt /
analyzed: tat naḥ indraḥ tat varuṇaḥ tat agniḥ tat aryamā tat savitā canaḥ dhāt
translated: May Indra, Varuṇa, Agni, Aryaman, and Savitar grant us that favour.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra and Varuṇa, Aditi, Sindhu, Earth, and Heaven, grant us that.

original: ya indrāgnī citratamo ratho vām abhi viśvāni bhuvanāni caṣṭe /
analyzed: yaḥ indra agnī citratamaḥ rathaḥ vām abhi viśvāni bhuvanāni caṣṭe
translated: O Indra and Agni, your chariot, most wonderful, which looks upon all the worlds,

original: tenā yātaṃ sarathaṃ tasthivāṃsāthā somasya pibataṃ sutasya //
analyzed: tena ā yātam sa ratham tasthivāṃsā athā somasya pibatam sutasya
translated: By that chariot come ye, standing, and drink of the pressed Soma.

original: yāvad idam bhuvanaṃ viśvam asty uruvyacā varimatā gabhīram /
analyzed: yāvat idam bhuvanam viśvam asti uruvyacā varimatā gabhīram
translated: As far as this whole world extends, wide-spread, vast, and deep,

original: tāvāṃ ayam pātave somo astv aram indrāgnī manase yuvabhyām //
analyzed: tāvān ayam pātave somaḥ astu aram indra agnī manase yuvabhyām
translated: So far let this Soma be for you to drink, easily, O Indra and Agni, to your mind.

original: cakrāthe hi sadhryaṅ nāma bhadraṃ sadhrīcīnā vṛtrahaṇā uta sthaḥ /
analyzed: cakrāthe hi sadhryak nāma bhadram sadhrīcīnā vṛtra haṇau uta sthaḥ
translated: For ye have made the auspicious name of companionship; ye two, slayers of Vr̥itra, are in unison.

original: tāv indrāgnī sadhryañcā niṣadyā vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām //
analyzed: tau indra agnī sadhryañcā niṣadyā vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām
translated: O Indra and Agni, seated in companionship, ye mighty ones, rejoice in the mighty Soma.

original: samiddheṣv agniṣv ānajānā yatasrucā barhir u tistirāṇā /
analyzed: samiddheṣu agniṣu ānajānā yata srucā barhiḥ u tistirāṇā
translated: In the kindled fires, O ye whose hands hold the offering-spoons, strewing the sacred grass,

original: tīvraiḥ somaiḥ pariṣiktebhir arvāg endrāgnī saumanasāya yātam //
analyzed: tīvraiḥ somaiḥ pariṣiktebhiḥ arvāk ā indra agnī saumanasāya yātam
translated: Come hither, O Indra and Agni, with the sharp Soma juices that have been poured out, to gladden you.

original: yānīndrāgnī cakrathur vīryāṇi yāni rūpāṇy uta vṛṣṇyāni /
analyzed: yāni indra agnī cakrathuḥ vīryāṇi yāni rūpāṇi uta vṛṣṇyāni
translated: The manly deeds, O Indra and Agni, that ye have done, the forms and powers that ye have shown,

original: yā vām pratnāni sakhyā śivāni tebhiḥ somasya pibataṃ sutasya //
analyzed: yā vām pratnāni sakhyā śivāni tebhiḥ somasya pibatam sutasya
translated: And your ancient and auspicious friendships, with these come and drink of the pressed Soma.

original: yad abravam prathamaṃ vāṃ vṛṇāno 'yaṃ somo asurair no vihavyaḥ /
analyzed: yat abravam prathamam vām vṛṇānaḥ yam somaḥ asuraiḥ naḥ vihavyaḥ
translated: That which I first declared, choosing you, this Soma is to be offered to us by the Asuras.

original: tāṃ satyāṃ śraddhām abhy ā hi yātam athā somasya pibataṃ sutasya //
analyzed: tām satyām śraddhām abhī ā hi yātam athā somasya pibatam sutasya
translated: Come hither to that true faith of mine, and then drink of the pressed Soma.

original: yad indrāgnī madathaḥ sve duroṇe yad brahmaṇi rājani vā yajatrā /
analyzed: yat indra agnī madathaḥ sve duroṇe yat brahmaṇi rājani vā yajatrā
translated: When, O Indra and Agni, ye rejoice in your own abode, or in the Brahman or the king, O ye who are to be worshipped,

original: ataḥ pari vṛṣaṇāv ā hi yātam athā somasya pibataṃ sutasya //
analyzed: atas pari vṛṣaṇau ā hi yātam athā somasya pibatam sutasya
translated: Hither, O ye mighty ones, come from thence, and then drink of the pressed Soma.

original: yad indrāgnī yaduṣu turvaśeṣu yad druhyuṣv anuṣu pūruṣu sthaḥ /
analyzed: yat indra agnī yaduṣu turvaśeṣu yat druhyuṣu anuṣu pūruṣu sthaḥ
translated: When, O Indra and Agni, ye are among the Yadus, the Turvasas, the Druhyus, the Anu, the Purus,

original: ataḥ pari vṛṣaṇāv ā hi yātam athā somasya pibataṃ sutasya //
analyzed: atas pari vṛṣaṇau ā hi yātam athā somasya pibatam sutasya
translated: Hither, O ye mighty ones, come from thence, and then drink of the pressed Soma.

original: yad indrāgnī avamasyām pṛthivyām madhyamasyām paramasyām uta sthaḥ /
analyzed: yat indra agnī avamasyām pṛthivyām madhyamasyām paramasyām uta sthaḥ
translated: When, O Indra and Agni, ye are on the lowest, the middlemost, or the highest earth,

original: ataḥ pari vṛṣaṇāv ā hi yātam athā somasya pibataṃ sutasya //
analyzed: atas pari vṛṣaṇau ā hi yātam athā somasya pibatam sutasya
translated: Therefore, O mighty ones, come hither, and then drink of the pressed Soma.

original: yad indrāgnī paramasyām pṛthivyām madhyamasyām avamasyām uta sthaḥ /
analyzed: yat indra agnī paramasyām pṛthivyām madhyamasyām avamasyām uta sthaḥ
translated: Where, O Indra and Agni, ye are on the highest earth, on the middlemost, or on the lowest,

original: ataḥ pari vṛṣaṇāv ā hi yātam athā somasya pibataṃ sutasya //
analyzed: atas pari vṛṣaṇau ā hi yātam athā somasya pibatam sutasya
translated: Therefrom, O mighty ones, come hither, and then drink of the pressed Soma.

original: yad indrāgnī divi ṣṭho yat pṛthivyāṃ yat parvateṣv oṣadhīṣv apsu /
analyzed: yat indra agnī divi ṣṭhaḥ yat pṛthivyām yat parvateṣu oṣadhīṣu apsu
translated: Where, O Indra and Agni, ye are in the sky, on the earth, on the mountains, in the plants, in the waters,

original: ataḥ pari vṛṣaṇāv ā hi yātam athā somasya pibataṃ sutasya //
analyzed: atas pari vṛṣaṇau ā hi yātam athā somasya pibatam sutasya
translated: Therefrom, O mighty ones, come hither, and then drink of the pressed Soma.

original: yad indrāgnī uditā sūryasya madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayethe /
analyzed: yat indra agnī uditā sūryasya madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayethe
translated: Where, O Indra and Agni, ye rejoice in the heaven's mid-region at sunrise, by your own nature,

original: ataḥ pari vṛṣaṇāv ā hi yātam athā somasya pibataṃ sutasya //
analyzed: atas pari vṛṣaṇau ā hi yātam athā somasya pibatam sutasya
translated: Therefrom, O mighty ones, come hither, and then drink of the pressed Soma.

original: evendrāgnī papivāṃsā sutasya viśvāsmabhyaṃ saṃ jayataṃ dhanāni /
analyzed: eva indra agnī papivāṃsā sutasya viśvā asmabhyam sam jayatam dhanāni
translated: Thus, O Indra and Agni, having drunk of the pressed (Soma), win for us all treasures.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the Sindhu, the earth, and the sky, grant this to us.

original: vi hy akhyam manasā vasya icchann indrāgnī jñāsa uta vā sajātān /
analyzed: vi hi akhyam manasā vasyaḥ icchan indra agnī jñāsaḥ uta vā sajātān
translated: For I have gone forth with my mind, desiring good, to Indra and Agni, and to kinsmen and relatives.

original: nānyā yuvat pramatir asti mahyaṃ sa vāṃ dhiyaṃ vājayantīm atakṣam //
analyzed: na anyā yuvat pramatiḥ asti mahyam sa vām dhiyam vājayantīm atakṣam
translated: To me there is no other thought than you two. I have fashioned this thought of yours, which urges (me) to exertion.

original: aśravaṃ hi bhūridāvattarā vāṃ vijāmātur uta vā ghā syālāt /
analyzed: aśravam hi bhūri dāvattarā vām vijāmātuḥ uta vā gha syālāt
translated: For we have heard that your gifts are more abundant from a brother-in-law or even from a sister's son.

original: athā somasya prayatī yuvabhyām indrāgnī stomaṃ janayāmi navyam //
analyzed: athā somasya prayatī yuvabhyām indra agnī stomam janayāmi navyam
translated: Then, intent on you two, O Indra and Agni, I beget a new hymn for the sake of Soma.

original: mā cchedma raśmīṃr iti nādhamānāḥ pitṝṇāṃ śaktīr anuyacchamānāḥ /
analyzed: mā chedma raśmīṃr iti nādhamānāḥ pitṝṇām śaktīḥ anuyacchamānāḥ
translated: Not cutting the reins, as it were, while following the powers of the fathers, (saying) May we not be deprived of offspring.

original: indrāgnibhyāṃ kaṃ vṛṣaṇo madanti tā hy adrī dhiṣaṇāyā upasthe //
analyzed: indra agnibhyām kam vṛṣaṇaḥ madanti tā hi adrī dhiṣaṇāyāḥ upasthe
translated: The strong ones rejoice in Indra and Agni, for they, the two inexhaustible ones, in the lap of Dhisana.

original: yuvābhyāṃ devī dhiṣaṇā madāyendrāgnī somam uśatī sunoti /
analyzed: yuvābhyām devī dhiṣaṇā madāya indra agnī somam uśatī sunoti
translated: The goddess Dhisana, longing for you two, O Indra and Agni, presses out the Soma for your delight.

original: tāv aśvinā bhadrahastā supāṇī ā dhāvatam madhunā pṛṅktam apsu //
analyzed: tau aśvinā bhadra hastā su pāṇī ā dhāvatam madhunā pṛṅktam apsu
translated: O Asvins, with your auspicious hands, your good hands, come and besprinkle (the Soma) with honey in the waters.

original: yuvām indrāgnī vasuno vibhāge tavastamā śuśrava vṛtrahatye /
analyzed: yuvām indra agnī vasunaḥ vibhāge tavastamā śuśrava vṛtra hatye
translated: O Indra and Agni, you two, at the distribution of wealth, are most famous for your strength in slaying Vrtra.

original: tāv āsadyā barhiṣi yajñe asmin pra carṣaṇī mādayethāṃ sutasya //
analyzed: tau āsadya barhiṣi yajñe asmin pra carṣaṇī mādayethām sutasya
translated: Having sat down on the strew at this sacrifice, rejoice in the juice, O ye two most bountiful ones.

original: pra carṣaṇibhyaḥ pṛtanāhaveṣu pra pṛthivyā riricāthe divaś ca /🔽pra sindhubhyaḥ pra giribhyo mahitvā prendrāgnī viśvā bhuvanāty anyā //
analyzed: pra carṣaṇibhyaḥ pṛtanā āhaveṣu pra pṛthivyāḥ riricāthe divaḥ ca  pra sindhubhyaḥ pra giribhyaḥ mahitvā pra indra agnī viśvā bhuvanā ati anyā
translated: You two surpass the men in battles for land, and you surpass the earth and the sky.🔽O Indra and Agni, through your greatness you surpass all other beings, the rivers and the mountains.

original: ā bharataṃ śikṣataṃ vajrabāhū asmāṃ indrāgnī avataṃ śacībhiḥ /
analyzed: ā bharatam śikṣatam vajra bāhū asmān indra agnī avatam śacībhiḥ
translated: Bring hither Bharata, O ye two whose arms are strong with the thunderbolt. O Indra and Agni, help us with your powers.

original: ime nu te raśmayaḥ sūryasya yebhiḥ sapitvam pitaro na āsan //
analyzed: ime nu te raśmayaḥ sūryasya yebhiḥ sapitvam pitaraḥ naḥ āsan
translated: These are the rays of the sun, by which the Fathers have attained companionship with him.

original: purandarā śikṣataṃ vajrahastāsmāṃ indrāgnī avatam bhareṣu /
analyzed: purandarā śikṣatam vajra hastā asmān indra agnī avatam bhareṣu
translated: O Indra and Agni, grant us protection in battles, O Purandara and Sacker of forts, O ye who wield the thunderbolt.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, Sindhu, the earth, and the sky, grant this to us.

original: tatam me apas tad u tāyate punaḥ svādiṣṭhā dhītir ucathāya śasyate /
analyzed: tatam me apaḥ tat u tāyate punar svādiṣṭhā dhītiḥ ucathāya śasyate
translated: That is extended, that is extended again. The sweetest thought is praised for utterance.

original: ayaṃ samudra iha viśvadevyaḥ svāhākṛtasya sam u tṛpṇuta ṛbhavaḥ //
analyzed: ayam samudraḥ iha viśvadevyaḥ svāhākṛtasya sam u tṛpṇuta ṛbhavaḥ
translated: This ocean, O ye all-gods, be satisfied with the oblation offered. O ye Rbhus, be satisfied.

original: ābhogayam pra yad icchanta aitanāpākāḥ prāñco mama ke cid āpayaḥ /
analyzed: ābhogayam pra yat icchanta aitana apākāḥ prāñcaḥ mama ke cit āpayaḥ
translated: When ye come hither, desiring to enjoy, some of my offerings have gone forward.

original: saudhanvanāsaś caritasya bhūmanāgacchata savitur dāśuṣo gṛham //
analyzed: saudhanvanāsaḥ caritasya bhūmanā agacchata savituḥ dāśuṣaḥ gṛham
translated: O sons of Sudhanvan, come to the house of the worshipper Savitar, to the place of the sacrifice.

original: tat savitā vo 'mṛtatvam āsuvad agohyaṃ yac chravayanta aitana /
analyzed: tat savitā vaḥ mṛta tvam āsuvat agohyam yat śravayantaḥ aitana
translated: That immortality, O ye all-gods, Savitar has granted you, which ye have come to proclaim, not to be concealed.

original: tyaṃ cic camasam asurasya bhakṣaṇam ekaṃ santam akṛṇutā caturvayam //
analyzed: tyam cit camasam asurasya bhakṣaṇam ekam santam akṛṇuta caturvayam
translated: That very cup which the Asura drank, ye have made to be of four kinds, though it was one.

original: viṣṭvī śamī taraṇitvena vāghato martāsaḥ santo amṛtatvam ānaśuḥ /
analyzed: viṣṭvī śamī taraṇi tvena vāghataḥ martāsaḥ santaḥ amṛta tvam ānaśuḥ
translated: The mortal men have attained immortality by the swiftness of the sacrificial horse, by the swiftness of the sacrificial horse.

original: saudhanvanā ṛbhavaḥ sūracakṣasaḥ saṃvatsare sam apṛcyanta dhītibhiḥ //
analyzed: saudhanvanāḥ ṛbhavaḥ sūra cakṣasaḥ saṃvatsare sam apṛcyanta dhītibhiḥ
translated: The sons of Sudhanvan, the Rbhus, with eyes of light, in the year were united by their thoughts.

original: kṣetram iva vi mamus tejanenaṃ ekam pātram ṛbhavo jehamānam /
analyzed: kṣetram iva vi mamuḥ tejanena ekam pātram ṛbhavaḥ jehamānam
translated: Like a field they have divided with a plough, the Rbhus have extended the single vessel.

original: upastutā upamaṃ nādhamānā amartyeṣu śrava icchamānāḥ //
analyzed: upastutāḥ upamam nādhamānāḥ amartyeṣu śravaḥ icchamānāḥ
translated: Praised, not despised, seeking glory among the immortals, longing for fame,

original: ā manīṣām antarikṣasya nṛbhyaḥ sruceva ghṛtaṃ juhavāma vidmanā /
analyzed: ā manīṣām antarikṣasya nṛbhyaḥ srucā iva ghṛtam juhavāma vidmanā
translated: We will offer with knowledge the thought of the atmosphere, like ghee in a ladle.

original: taraṇitvā ye pitur asya saścira ṛbhavo vājam aruhan divo rajaḥ //
analyzed: taraṇi tvā ye pituḥ asya saścire ṛbhavaḥ vājam divaḥ rajaḥ
translated: Those who, O Rbhus, have followed after this father of yours, have mounted the strength of the sky's realm.

original: ṛbhur na indraḥ śavasā navīyān ṛbhur vājebhir vasubhir vasur dadiḥ /
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ naḥ indraḥ śavasā navīyān ṛbhuḥ vājebhiḥ vasubhiḥ vasuḥ dadiḥ
translated: Rbhukṣan, Indra, is newer by might, Rbhukṣan by his powers, Vasu by his riches.

original: yuṣmākaṃ devā avasāhani priye 'bhi tiṣṭhema pṛtsutīr asunvatām //
analyzed: yuṣmākam devāḥ avasā ahani priye bhi tiṣṭhema pṛtsutīḥ a sunvatām
translated: O gods, in your abode, in the one dear to you, we will stand in the battles with the unpressed (juice) of the non-offerers.

original: niś carmaṇa ṛbhavo gām apiṃśata saṃ vatsenāsṛjatā mātaram punaḥ /
analyzed: niḥ carmaṇaḥ ṛbhavaḥ gām apiṃśata sam vatsena asṛjata mātaram punar
translated: O Rbhus, ye have loosened the cow from the skin, ye have united her again with the calf, with the mother.

original: saudhanvanāsaḥ svapasyayā naro jivrī yuvānā pitarākṛṇotana //
analyzed: saudhanvanāsaḥ su apasyayā naraḥ jivrī yuvānā pitarā akṛṇotana
translated: O sons of Sudhanvan, with your skill ye have made the old, the young, the father and mother.

original: vājebhir no vājasātāv aviḍḍhy ṛbhumāṃ indra citram ā darṣi rādhaḥ /
analyzed: vājebhiḥ naḥ vājasātau aviḍḍhi ṛbhumān indra citram ā darṣi rādhaḥ
translated: Help us, O Indra, in the winning of booty, O thou of Rbhukṣan's might, show forth thy wondrous bounty.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, Sindhu, the earth, and the sky, grant this to us.

original: takṣan rathaṃ suvṛtaṃ vidmanāpasas takṣan harī indravāhā vṛṣaṇvasū /
analyzed: takṣan ratham suvṛtam vidmanā apasaḥ takṣan harī indra vāhā vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: They fashioned the well-made chariot with skill, they fashioned the two strong horses, Indra's bearers.

original: takṣan pitṛbhyām ṛbhavo yuvad vayas takṣan vatsāya mātaraṃ sacābhuvam //🔽ā no yajñāya takṣata ṛbhumad vayaḥ kratve dakṣāya suprajāvatīm iṣam /
analyzed: takṣan pitṛbhyām ṛbhavaḥ yuvat vayaḥ takṣan vatsāya mātaram sacābhuvam  ā naḥ yajñāya takṣata ṛbhumat vayaḥ kratve dakṣāya su prajāvatīm iṣam
translated: The Rbhus fashioned youth for the two parents, they fashioned the mother to be with the calf.🔽Fashion for us strength with the Rbhus for our sacrifice, food rich in offspring for our rite.

original: yathā kṣayāma sarvavīrayā viśā tan naḥ śardhāya dhāsathā sv indriyam //
analyzed: yathā kṣayāma sarva vīrayā viśā tat naḥ śardhāya dhāsatha su indriyam
translated: That we may dwell with a people rich in brave men, bestow on our troop that, O Indra, which is good.

original: ā takṣata sātim asmabhyam ṛbhavaḥ sātiṃ rathāya sātim arvate naraḥ /
analyzed: ā takṣata sātim asmabhyam ṛbhavaḥ sātim rathāya sātim arvate naraḥ
translated: Fashion for us, O Rbhus, victory, victory for the chariot, victory for the horse, O men.

original: sātiṃ no jaitrīṃ sam maheta viśvahā jāmim ajāmim pṛtanāsu sakṣaṇim //
analyzed: sātim naḥ jaitrīm sam maheta viśvahā jāmim ajāmim pṛtanāsu sakṣaṇim
translated: Fashion for us the victorious, ever-conquering, the kinsman, the non-kinsman, the conqueror in battles.

original: ṛbhukṣaṇam indram ā huva ūtaya ṛbhūn vājān marutaḥ somapītaye /
analyzed: ṛbhukṣaṇam indram ā huve ūtaye ṛbhūn vājān marutaḥ soma pītaye
translated: I invoke Indra, the possessor of the Rbhus, the Rbhus, the strong ones, the Maruts, for the drinking of the Soma.

original: ubhā mitrāvaruṇā nūnam aśvinā te no hinvantu sātaye dhiye jiṣe //
analyzed: ubhā mitrāvaruṇā nūnam aśvinā te naḥ hinvantu sātaye dhiye jiṣe
translated: Both Mitra and Varuna, and now the two Asvins, may they impel us to gain, to thought, to victory.

original: ṛbhur bharāya saṃ śiśātu sātiṃ samaryajid vājo asmāṃ aviṣṭu /
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ bharāya sam śiśātu sātim samarya jit vājaḥ asmān aviṣṭu
translated: May the Rbhun, for the bearing, fashion the victory, may the battle-conquering strength be with us.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra and Varuna, Aditi, the Sindhu, the earth, and the sky, grant this to us.

original: īḷe dyāvāpṛthivī pūrvacittaye 'gniṃ gharmaṃ surucaṃ yāmann iṣṭaye /
analyzed: īḍe dyāvāpṛthivī pūrva cittaye gnim gharmam su rucam yāman iṣṭaye
translated: I invoke heaven and earth for our first thought, Agni the hotar for the desired journey.

original: yābhir bhare kāram aṃśāya jinvathas tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ bhare kāram aṃśāya jinvathaḥ tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which you two sustain and invigorate the sacrificer for the sake of the share, by those very aids, O Ashvins, come.

original: yuvor dānāya subharā asaścato ratham ā tasthur vacasaṃ na mantave /
analyzed: yuvoḥ dānāya subharāḥ asaścataḥ ratham ā tasthuḥ vacasam na mantave
translated: Your inexhaustible and well-laden gifts have mounted the chariot to be praised.

original: yābhir dhiyo 'vathaḥ karmann iṣṭaye tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ dhiyaḥ vathaḥ karman iṣṭaye tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which thoughts you assist for the sake of desired action, by those very aids, O Ashvins, come.

original: yuvaṃ tāsāṃ divyasya praśāsane viśāṃ kṣayatho amṛtasya majmanā /
analyzed: yuvam tāsām divyasya praśāsane viśām kṣayathaḥ amṛtasya majmanā
translated: Of those two, in the governance of the divine, you two sustain the people by the power of immortality.

original: yābhir dhenum asvam pinvatho narā tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ dhenum a svam pinvathaḥ narā tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which you two, O heroes, make the milch cow swell for the owner, by those very aids, O Ashvins, come.

original: yābhiḥ parijmā tanayasya majmanā dvimātā tūrṣu taraṇir vibhūṣati /
analyzed: yābhiḥ parijmā tanayasya majmanā dvimātā tūrṣu taraṇiḥ vibhūṣati
translated: By which the swift one, by the power of the son, the one with two mothers, adorns himself in the waters.

original: yābhis trimantur abhavad vicakṣaṇas tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ trimantuḥ abhavat vicakṣaṇaḥ tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which the wise one became threefold, by those very aids, O Ashvins, come.

original: yābhī rebhaṃ nivṛtaṃ sitam adbhya ud vandanam airayataṃ svar dṛśe /
analyzed: yābhiḥ rebham nivṛtam sitam adbhyaḥ ud vandanam airayatam svar dṛśe
translated: By which you two raised up the hidden and white Rebha from the waters to see the light.

original: yābhiḥ kaṇvam pra siṣāsantam āvataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ kaṇvam pra siṣāsantam āvatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye helped Kaṇva when he thirsted for the spoil, come hither unto us, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhir antakaṃ jasamānam āraṇe bhujyuṃ yābhir avyathibhir jijinvathuḥ /
analyzed: yābhiḥ antakam jasamānam āraṇe bhujyum yābhiḥ avyathibhiḥ jijinvathuḥ
translated: By which ye helped Antaka Jasamāna in the conflict, by which ye quickened Bhujyu with unfailing succours,

original: yābhiḥ karkandhuṃ vayyaṃ ca jinvathas tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ karkandhum vayyam ca jinvathaḥ tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye quickened Karkandhu and Vya, come hither unto us, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhiḥ śucantiṃ dhanasāṃ suṣaṃsadaṃ taptaṃ gharmam omyāvantam atraye /
analyzed: yābhiḥ śucantim dhanasām suṣaṃsadam taptam gharmam omyāvantam atraye
translated: By which ye helped Śucanti, the well-praised, the wealthy, the heated caldron, for Atri,

original: yābhiḥ pṛśnigum purukutsam āvataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ pṛśnigum purukutsam āvatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye helped Pṛśnigū and Purukutsa, come hither unto us, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhiḥ śacībhir vṛṣaṇā parāvṛjam prāndhaṃ śroṇaṃ cakṣasa etave kṛthaḥ /
analyzed: yābhiḥ śacībhiḥ vṛṣaṇā parāvṛjam pra andham śroṇam cakṣase etave kṛthaḥ
translated: By which mighty ones ye made Parāvṛja, the blind and lame, to see and walk,

original: yābhir vartikāṃ grasitām amuñcataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ vartikām grasitām amuñcatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye set free Vartikā when she was swallowed up, come hither unto us, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhiḥ sindhum madhumantam asaścataṃ vasiṣṭhaṃ yābhir ajarāv ajinvatam /
analyzed: yābhiḥ sindhum madhumantam asaścatam vasiṣṭham yābhiḥ ajarau ajinvatam
translated: By which ye set free the honey-rich Sindhu, and quickened Vasiṣṭha, ye who are undecaying,

original: yābhiḥ kutsaṃ śrutaryaṃ naryam āvataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ kutsam śrutaryam naryam āvatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye helped Kutsa, Śruta, and Narya, come hither unto us, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhir viśpalāṃ dhanasām atharvyaṃ sahasramīḷha ājāv ajinvatam /
analyzed: yābhiḥ viśpalām dhanasām atharvyam sahasramīḍhe ājau ajinvatam
translated: By which ye quickened Vishpala, the son of Dhanasa, the son of Atharvan, in a thousand battles,

original: yābhir vaśam aśvyam preṇim āvataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ vaśam aśvyam preṇim āvatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye helped Vasu, the son of Ashva, the son of Preni, come hither unto us, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhiḥ sudānū auśijāya vaṇije dīrghaśravase madhu kośo akṣarat /
analyzed: yābhiḥ sudānū auśijāya vaṇije dīrghaśravase madhu kośaḥ akṣarat
translated: By which, O ye bountiful ones, for the merchant Auṣija of far-famed glory, the honey-cell was opened,

original: kakṣīvantaṃ stotāraṃ yābhir āvataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: kakṣīvantam stotāram yābhiḥ āvatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye helped the singer Kakshîvân, come hither unto us, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhī rasāṃ kṣodasodnaḥ pipinvathur anaśvaṃ yābhī ratham āvataṃ jiṣe /
analyzed: yābhiḥ rasām kṣodasā udnaḥ pipinvathuḥ an aśvam yābhiḥ ratham āvatam jiṣe
translated: By which ye filled the stream of the Rasâ, the untethered car, by which ye helped to victory,

original: yābhis triśoka usriyā udājata tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ triśokaḥ usriyāḥ udājata tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye caused Tri-shak to win the kine, come hither unto us, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhiḥ sūryam pariyāthaḥ parāvati mandhātāraṃ kṣaitrapatyeṣv āvatam /
analyzed: yābhiḥ sūryam pariyāthaḥ parāvati mandhātāram kṣaitrapatyeṣu āvatam
translated: By which ye went round the sun in the distance, by which ye helped Mandhâtar in the Kshétrapatis,

original: yābhir vipram pra bharadvājam āvataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ vipram pra bharadvājam āvatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye helped the sage Bharadvaja, come hither unto us, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhir mahām atithigvaṃ kaśojuvaṃ divodāsaṃ śambarahatya āvatam /
analyzed: yābhiḥ mahām atithigvam kaśojuvam divodāsam śambara hatye āvatam
translated: By which ye helped the mighty Atithigva, the son of Kashya, at the slaying of Shambara,

original: yābhiḥ pūrbhidye trasadasyum āvataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ pūḥ bhidye trasadasyum āvatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye helped Pûrbhidya and Trasadasyu, come hither unto us, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhir vamraṃ vipipānam upastutaṃ kaliṃ yābhir vittajāniṃ duvasyathaḥ /
analyzed: yābhiḥ vamram vipipānam upastutam kalim yābhiḥ vitta jānim duvasyathaḥ
translated: By which ye helped the thirsty, the praised, the drinking, the quarrelsome, by which ye served the wealthy,

original: yābhir vyaśvam uta pṛthim āvataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ vyaśvam uta pṛthim āvatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye aided the horseless and the footman, come hither, O ye Asvins, with those aids of yours.

original: yābhir narā śayave yābhir atraye yābhiḥ purā manave gātum īṣathuḥ /
analyzed: yābhiḥ narā śayave yābhiḥ atraye yābhiḥ purā manave gātum īṣathuḥ
translated: By which ye gave Narâṣansa and Atrî, by which ye gave of old to Manu passage,

original: yābhiḥ śārīr ājataṃ syūmaraśmaye tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ śārīḥ ājatam syūmaraśmaye tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye helped Sâri to Sûmerashmi, come hither, O ye Asvins, with those aids of yours.

original: yābhiḥ paṭharvā jaṭharasya majmanāgnir nādīdec cita iddho ajmann ā /
analyzed: yābhiḥ paṭharvā jaṭharasya majmanā agniḥ na adīdet citaḥ iddhaḥ ajman ā
translated: By which ye helped Patshûpada with the might of his belly, as Agni, kindled, shines with splendour,

original: yābhiḥ śaryātam avatho mahādhane tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ śaryātam avathaḥ mahā dhane tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye aided Saryâta in the great contest, come hither, O ye Asvins, with those aids of yours.

original: yābhir aṅgiro manasā niraṇyatho 'graṃ gacchatho vivare goarṇasaḥ /
analyzed: yābhiḥ aṅgiraḥ manasā niraṇyathaḥ gram gacchathaḥ vivare go arṇasaḥ
translated: By which ye, with the thought of Angiras, went forth, and went before the opening of the stall of kine,

original: yābhir manuṃ śūram iṣā samāvataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ manum śūram iṣā samāvatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye helped the hero Manu with your food, come hither, O ye Asvins, with those aids of yours.

original: yābhiḥ patnīr vimadāya nyūhathur ā gha vā yābhir aruṇīr aśikṣatam /
analyzed: yābhiḥ patnīḥ vimadāya nyūhathuḥ ā gha vā yābhiḥ aruṇīḥ aśikṣatam
translated: By which ye brought the wives to Vimada, and by which ye led the ruddy cows to Ghu,

original: yābhiḥ sudāsa ūhathuḥ sudevyaṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ sudāse ūhathuḥ su devyam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye brought Sudâs to fair felicity, come hither, O ye Asvins, with those aids of yours.

original: yābhiḥ śantātī bhavatho dadāśuṣe bhujyuṃ yābhir avatho yābhir adhrigum /
analyzed: yābhiḥ śantātī bhavathaḥ dadāśuṣe bhujyum yābhiḥ avathaḥ yābhiḥ adhrigum
translated: By which ye help the generous man, O ye who give all blessings, by which Bhujyu, by which Adhrigu,

original: omyāvatīṃ subharām ṛtastubhaṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: omyāvatīm subharām ṛta stubham tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye aid the faithful one, easy to yoke, who extols you with the song of praise, come hither, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhiḥ kṛśānum asane duvasyatho jave yābhir yūno arvantam āvatam /
analyzed: yābhiḥ kṛśānum asane duvasyathaḥ jave yābhiḥ yūnaḥ arvantam āvatam
translated: By which ye help the poor man in his work, by which the young horse in his speed,

original: madhu priyam bharatho yat saraḍbhyas tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: madhu priyam bharathaḥ yat saraḍbhyaḥ tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: The sweet and pleasant food which ye bring to the cranes, come hither, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhir naraṃ goṣuyudhaṃ nṛṣāhye kṣetrasya sātā tanayasya jinvathaḥ /
analyzed: yābhiḥ naram goṣuyudham nṛṣāhye kṣetrasya sātā tanayasya jinvathaḥ
translated: By which ye quicken the man who fights for cattle, who conquers in the strife for land and sons,

original: yābhī rathāṃ avatho yābhir arvatas tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //
analyzed: yābhiḥ avathaḥ yābhiḥ arvataḥ tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam
translated: By which ye help the chariot, by which the horse, come hither, O ye Asvins, with those aids.

original: yābhiḥ kutsam ārjuneyaṃ śatakratū pra turvītim pra ca dabhītim āvatam /
analyzed: yābhiḥ kutsam ārjuneyam śata kratū pra turvītim pra ca dabhītim āvatam
translated: By which ye helped Kutsa, son of Ârjuna, and Satakratu helped Turvîti and Dabhîti,

original: yābhir dhvasantim puruṣantim āvataṃ tābhir ū ṣu ūtibhir aśvinā gatam //🔽apnasvatīm aśvinā vācam asme kṛtaṃ no dasrā vṛṣaṇā manīṣām /
analyzed: yābhiḥ dhvasantim puruṣantim āvatam tābhiḥ u su ūtibhiḥ aśvinā gatam  apnasvatīm aśvinā vācam asme kṛtam naḥ dasrā vṛṣaṇā manīṣām
translated: By which ye helped Dhvasanti and Purushanti, come hither, O ye Asvins, with those aids.🔽O ye Asvins, make our speech effectual for us, O ye wondrous, mighty ones, accept our thought.

original: adyūtye 'vase ni hvaye vāṃ vṛdhe ca no bhavataṃ vājasātau //
analyzed: a dyūtye vase ni hvaye vām vṛdhe ca naḥ bhavatam vājasātau
translated: For help in gambling, I invoke you, and be ye for our increase in the winning of booty.

original: dyubhir aktubhiḥ pari pātam asmān ariṣṭebhir aśvinā saubhagebhiḥ /
analyzed: dyubhiḥ aktubhiḥ pari pātam asmān ariṣṭebhiḥ aśvinā saubhagebhiḥ
translated: With your radiant lights, O ye Aṣvins, guard us, with your infallible and happy favours.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: This may Varuṇa and Mitra grant us, and Aditi and Sindhu and the Heaven.

original: idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotir āgāc citraḥ praketo ajaniṣṭa vibhvā /
analyzed: idam śreṣṭham jyotiṣām jyotiḥ āgāt citraḥ praketaḥ ajaniṣṭa vibhvā
translated: This light hath come, the best of lights, the wondrous, the all-pervading light is born.

original: yathā prasūtā savituḥ savāyaṃ evā rātry uṣase yonim āraik //
analyzed: yathā prasūtā savituḥ savāyam evā rātrī uṣase yonim āraik
translated: As Savitar's own offspring hath it sprung: thus hath the Night brought forth the Dawns to their abode.

original: ruśadvatsā ruśatī śvetyāgād āraig u kṛṣṇā sadanāny asyāḥ /
analyzed: ruśat vatsā ruśatī śvetyā agāt āraik u kṛṣṇā sadanāni asyāḥ
translated: The ruddy Cow with ruddy calf hath come, the white hath come to her white place of meeting.

original: samānabandhū amṛte anūcī dyāvā varṇaṃ carata āmināne //
analyzed: samāna bandhū amṛte anūcī dyāvā varṇam carataḥ āmināne
translated: The two Immortal Sisters, of one kindred, move on, in varied form, the same appointed way.

original: samāno adhvā svasror anantas tam anyānyā carato devaśiṣṭe /
analyzed: samānaḥ adhvā svasroḥ anantaḥ tam anyā anyā carataḥ deva śiṣṭe
translated: The path of the two Sisters is one and endless: on it the two move, directed by the Gods.

original: na methete na tasthatuḥ sumeke naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe //🔽bhāsvatī netrī sūnṛtānām aceti citrā vi duro na āvaḥ /🔽prārpyā jagad vy u no rāyo akhyad uṣā ajīgar bhuvanāni viśvā //
analyzed: na methete na tasthatuḥ sumeke naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe  bhāsvatī netrī sūnṛtānām aceti citrā vi duraḥ naḥ āvaḥ  prārpyā jagat vi u naḥ rāyaḥ akhyat uṣāḥ ajīgaḥ bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: They do not rest, they do not cease from labour: Night and Dawn, of unlike form, are of one mind.🔽The radiant, the leader of fair hymns, hath shone forth: the wondrous hath opened the doors and come to us.🔽She hath disclosed the moving world, and shown us riches: Dawn hath brought forth all living creatures into life.

original: jihmaśye caritave maghony ābhogaya iṣṭaye rāya u tvam /
analyzed: jihmaśye caritave maghonī ābhogaye iṣṭaye rāye u tvam
translated: Thou, for the sake of wealth, hast bent the wealthy to our service, to our sacrifice, O thou who movest in a straight line.

original: dabhram paśyadbhya urviyā vicakṣa uṣā ajīgar bhuvanāni viśvā //
analyzed: dabhram paśyadbhyaḥ urviyā vicakṣe uṣāḥ ajīgaḥ bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: Looking on the feeble with wide-spread vision, Dawn hath filled all the worlds with life again.

original: kṣatrāya tvaṃ śravase tvam mahīyā iṣṭaye tvam artham iva tvam ityai /🔽visadṛśā jīvitābhipracakṣa uṣā ajīgar bhuvanāni viśvā //
analyzed: kṣatrāya tvam śravase tvam mahīyai iṣṭaye tvam artham iva tvam ityai  visadṛśā jīvitā abhipracakṣe uṣāḥ ajīgaḥ bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: For the Kshatriya art thou, for glory, for greatness, for worship, for gain, for prosperity.🔽The unlike, the like, the living, the dead, hath Dawn filled all the worlds with life again.

original: eṣā divo duhitā praty adarśi vyucchantī yuvatiḥ śukravāsāḥ /
analyzed: eṣā divaḥ duhitā prati adarśi vyucchantī yuvatiḥ śukra vāsāḥ
translated: This Daughter of the Sky hath been beheld, the youthful Maid, clad in her robe of light, rising.

original: viśvasyeśānā pārthivasya vasva uṣo adyeha subhage vy uccha //
analyzed: viśvasya īśānā pārthivasya vasvaḥ uṣaḥ adyā iha subhage vi uccha
translated: Mistress of all the wealth that is upon the earth, O blessed Dawn, rise up for us this day.

original: parāyatīnām anv eti pātha āyatīnām prathamā śaśvatīnām /
analyzed: parāyatīnām anu eti pāthaḥ āyatīnām prathamā śaśvatīnām
translated: She followeth the paths of those that go away, the first of those that come, and those that stay.

original: vyucchantī jīvam udīrayanty uṣā mṛtaṃ kaṃ cana bodhayantī //
analyzed: vyucchantī jīvam udīrayantī uṣāḥ mṛtam kam cana bodhayantī
translated: Rising, she bringeth back the living to the light, and wakens up some one among the dead.

original: uṣo yad agniṃ samidhe cakartha vi yad āvaś cakṣasā sūryasya /
analyzed: uṣaḥ yat agnim samidhe cakartha vi yat āvaḥ cakṣasā sūryasya
translated: O Dawn, when thou didst kindle Agni, and didst open with the light of Sûrya,

original: yan mānuṣān yakṣyamāṇāṃ ajīgas tad deveṣu cakṛṣe bhadram apnaḥ //
analyzed: yat mānuṣān yakṣyamāṇām ajīgaḥ tat deveṣu cakṛṣe bhadram apnaḥ
translated: When thou didst fill with life the men who were about to worship, thou didst make them happy among the Gods.

original: kiyāty ā yat samayā bhavāti yā vyūṣur yāś ca nūnaṃ vyucchān /
analyzed: kiyāti ā yat samayā bhavāti yāḥ vyūṣuḥ yāḥ ca nūnam vyucchān
translated: How far away, how near she cometh, she who hath risen, and she who now is rising,

original: anu pūrvāḥ kṛpate vāvaśānā pradīdhyānā joṣam anyābhir eti //
analyzed: anu pūrvāḥ kṛpate vāvaśānā pradīdhyānā joṣam anyābhiḥ eti
translated: She who hath set, and she who yet will set, the lowing Cow regardeth those that went before, and with the others cometh to the place of rest.

original: īyuṣ ṭe ye pūrvatarām apaśyan vyucchantīm uṣasam martyāsaḥ /
analyzed: īyuḥ ṭe ye pūrvatarām apaśyan vyucchantīm uṣasam martyāsaḥ
translated: Those mortals who have seen thee rising in the east before us, in the dawns, have passed away.

original: asmābhir ū nu praticakṣyābhūd o te yanti ye aparīṣu paśyān //
analyzed: asmābhiḥ u nu praticakṣya abhūt ā u te yanti ye aparīṣu paśyān
translated: But thou hast become visible to us, and they who shall see thee in the west are going away.

original: yāvayaddveṣā ṛtapā ṛtejāḥ sumnāvarī sūnṛtā īrayantī /🔽sumaṅgalīr bibhratī devavītim ihādyoṣaḥ śreṣṭhatamā vy uccha //
analyzed: yāvayat dveṣāḥ ṛta pāḥ ṛtejāḥ sumnāvarī sūnṛtāḥ īrayantī  su maṅgalīḥ bibhratī deva vītim iha adya uṣaḥ śreṣṭhatamā vi uccha
translated: Driving away hostilities, righteous, full of holy fervour, sending forth pleasant and delightful sounds,🔽Bringing good fortune, bearing the divine way, shine forth this day, O Dawn, most excellent.

original: śaśvat puroṣā vy uvāsa devy atho adyedaṃ vy āvo maghonī /
analyzed: śaśvat purā uṣāḥ vi uvāsa devī atho adyā idam vi āvaḥ maghonī
translated: Dawn hath shone forth in the east, the divine, the wealthy, and now she shines forth here.

original: atho vy ucchād uttarāṃ anu dyūn ajarāmṛtā carati svadhābhiḥ //
analyzed: atha u vi ucchāt uttarām anu dyūn ajarā amṛtā carati svadhābhiḥ
translated: And she hath shone forth, and will shine forth in the days to come, immortal and undecaying, moving in her own power.

original: vy añjibhir diva ātāsv adyaud apa kṛṣṇāṃ nirṇijaṃ devy āvaḥ /🔽prabodhayanty aruṇebhir aśvair oṣā yāti suyujā rathena //
analyzed: vi añjibhiḥ divaḥ ātāsu adyaut apa kṛṣṇām nirṇijam devī āvaḥ  prabodhayantī aruṇebhiḥ aśvaiḥ ā uṣāḥ yāti su yujā rathena
translated: With her own rays she hath shone forth to-day from the sky, and the divine hath put away the black covering.🔽She goes on her way, O Dawn, with her well-yoked chariot, with her ruddy horses, waking (men).

original: āvahantī poṣyā vāryāṇi citraṃ ketuṃ kṛṇute cekitānā /🔽īyuṣīṇām upamā śaśvatīnāṃ vibhātīnām prathamoṣā vy aśvait //
analyzed: āvahantī poṣyā vāryāṇi citram ketum kṛṇute cekitānā  īyuṣīṇām upamā śaśvatīnām vibhātīnām prathamā uṣāḥ vi aśvait
translated: Bringing desirable boons, she makes a wonderful sign, the watchful one.🔽Of the ever-moving, the shining, the distant dawns, Dawn with her horses hath shone forth.

original: ud īrdhvaṃ jīvo asur na āgād apa prāgāt tama ā jyotir eti /
analyzed: ud īrdhvam jīvaḥ asuḥ naḥ āgāt apa prāgāt tamaḥ ā jyotiḥ eti
translated: The living soul, the immortal, hath come up; it hath gone away from the east; light cometh to the darkness.

original: āraik panthāṃ yātave sūryāyāganma yatra pratiranta āyuḥ //🔽syūmanā vāca ud iyarti vahni stavāno rebha uṣaso vibhātīḥ /
analyzed: āraik panthām yātave sūryāya aganma yatra pratirante āyuḥ  syūmanā vācaḥ ud iyarti vahniḥ stavānaḥ rebhaḥ uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: To the path that leads to the sun, to the place where they restore life.🔽The weaver raises the voice, the singer praises the shining dawns.

original: adyā tad uccha gṛṇate maghony asme āyur ni didīhi prajāvat //
analyzed: adyā tat uccha gṛṇate maghoni asme āyuḥ ni didīhi prajāvat
translated: Today, raise that up for the singer, O bountiful one, show us life with offspring.

original: yā gomatīr uṣasaḥ sarvavīrā vyucchanti dāśuṣe martyāya /
analyzed: yāḥ gomatīḥ uṣasaḥ sarva vīrāḥ vyucchanti dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: The dawns that shine with cattle, with all heroes, for the mortal who offers.

original: vāyor iva sūnṛtānām udarke tā aśvadā aśnavat somasutvā //
analyzed: vāyoḥ iva sūnṛtānām udarke tāḥ aśva dāḥ aśnavat soma sutvā
translated: At the end of the delights that are like Vayu's, he who gives horses obtains them through Soma pressing.

original: mātā devānām aditer anīkaṃ yajñasya ketur bṛhatī vi bhāhi /
analyzed: mātā devānām aditeḥ anīkam yajñasya ketuḥ bṛhatī vi bhāhi
translated: The mother of the gods, the face of Aditi, shine forth, O great one, as the banner of sacrifice.

original: praśastikṛd brahmaṇe no vy ucchā no jane janaya viśvavāre //
analyzed: praśasti kṛt brahmaṇe naḥ vi uccha ā naḥ jane janaya viśva vāre
translated: Shining for the Brahman who bestows praise, generate for us in our people, O all-powerful one.

original: yac citram apna uṣaso vahantījānāya śaśamānāya bhadram /
analyzed: yat citram apnaḥ uṣasaḥ vahanti ījānāya śaśamānāya bhadram
translated: Whatever wonderful thing the dawns bring to the man who strives, who desires, for the one who presses,

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May that be blessed for us, may it be blessed for our children. May Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the Sindhu, the earth and the sky bless it for us.

original: imā rudrāya tavase kapardine kṣayadvīrāya pra bharāmahe matīḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ rudrāya tavase kapardine kṣayadvīrāya pra bharāmahe matīḥ
translated: These thoughts we offer to Rudra, the mighty one with matted locks, the one who destroys heroes,

original: yathā śam asad dvipade catuṣpade viśvam puṣṭaṃ grāme asminn anāturam //
analyzed: yathā śam asat dvipade catuṣpade viśvam puṣṭam grāme asmin anāturam
translated: So that there may be well-being for the two-footed and the four-footed, for all that is nourished in this village, free from disease.

original: mṛḷā no rudrota no mayas kṛdhi kṣayadvīrāya namasā vidhema te /
analyzed: mṛḷa naḥ rudra uta naḥ mayaḥ kṛdhi kṣayadvīrāya namasā vidhema te
translated: Be gracious to us, O Rudra, and make us prosperous. With homage we will worship thee, O thou who hast slain heroes.

original: yac chaṃ ca yoś ca manur āyeje pitā tad aśyāma tava rudra praṇītiṣu //
analyzed: yat śam ca yoḥ ca manuḥ āyeje pitā tat aśyāma tava rudra praṇītiṣu
translated: That which Manu, our father, offered, that which he, the wise one, offered, may we obtain that in thy guidance, O Rudra.

original: aśyāma te sumatiṃ devayajyayā kṣayadvīrasya tava rudra mīḍhvaḥ /
analyzed: aśyāma te sumatim deva yajyayā kṣayadvīrasya tava rudra mīḍhvaḥ
translated: May we obtain thy favour by worshipping the gods, O thou who hast slain heroes, O Rudra, O bountiful one.

original: sumnāyann id viśo asmākam ā carāriṣṭavīrā juhavāma te haviḥ //
analyzed: sumnāyan id viśaḥ asmākam ā cara ariṣṭa vīrāḥ juhavāma te haviḥ
translated: Mayst thou, rejoicing, come to our people. We will offer thee our oblations, O thou who hast slain heroes.

original: tveṣaṃ vayaṃ rudraṃ yajñasādhaṃ vaṅkuṃ kavim avase ni hvayāmahe /
analyzed: tveṣam vayam rudram yajñasādham vaṅkum kavim avase ni hvayāmahe
translated: We invoke for help the terrible Rudra, the fulfiller of sacrifices, the crooked one, the wise one.

original: āre asmad daivyaṃ heḷo asyatu sumatim id vayam asyā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: āre asmat daivyam heḍaḥ asyatu sumatim id vayam asya ā vṛṇīmahe
translated: May the divine wrath of this one turn away from us. We choose his favour.

original: divo varāham aruṣaṃ kapardinaṃ tveṣaṃ rūpaṃ namasā ni hvayāmahe /
analyzed: divaḥ varāham aruṣam kapardinam tveṣam rūpam namasā ni hvayāmahe
translated: We invoke with homage the red boar of heaven, the curly-haired one, the terrible form.

original: haste bibhrad bheṣajā vāryāṇi śarma varma cchardir asmabhyaṃ yaṃsat //🔽idam pitre marutām ucyate vacaḥ svādoḥ svādīyo rudrāya vardhanam /
analyzed: haste bibhrat bheṣajā vāryāṇi śarma varma chardiḥ asmabhyam yaṃsat  idam pitre marutām ucyate vacaḥ svādoḥ svādīyaḥ rudrāya vardhanam
translated: May he, bearing in his hand the healing remedies, grant us protection, a coat of mail, and safety.🔽This speech is spoken to the father of the Maruts, the sweet, sweeter, to Rudra, the enhancer.

original: rāsvā ca no amṛta martabhojanaṃ tmane tokāya tanayāya mṛḷa //
analyzed: rāsvā ca naḥ amṛta marta bhojanam tmane tokāya tanayāya mṛḷa
translated: Grant us, O immortal one, food for mortals. Be gracious to us, to our offspring, to our sons.

original: mā no mahāntam uta mā no arbhakam mā na ukṣantam uta mā na ukṣitam /
analyzed: mā naḥ mahāntam uta mā naḥ arbhakam mā naḥ ukṣantam uta mā naḥ ukṣitam
translated: Neither our great one nor our little one, neither our bull nor our bullock,

original: mā no vadhīḥ pitaram mota mātaram mā naḥ priyās tanvo rudra rīriṣaḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ vadhīḥ pitaram mā uta mātaram mā naḥ priyāḥ tanvaḥ rudra rīriṣaḥ
translated: Neither our father nor our mother slay thou, O Rudra, nor our dear bodies afflict.

original: mā nas toke tanaye mā na āyau mā no goṣu mā no aśveṣu rīriṣaḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ toke tanaye mā naḥ āyau mā naḥ goṣu mā naḥ aśveṣu rīriṣaḥ
translated: Neither in our children nor in our offspring, neither in our kine nor in our horses afflict thou us.

original: vīrān mā no rudra bhāmito vadhīr haviṣmantaḥ sadam it tvā havāmahe //
analyzed: vīrān mā naḥ rudra bhāmitaḥ vadhīḥ haviṣmantaḥ sadam id tvā havāmahe
translated: Slay not our heroes, O Rudra, from the front: we ever call on thee with offerings.

original: upa te stomān paśupā ivākaraṃ rāsvā pitar marutāṃ sumnam asme /🔽bhadrā hi te sumatir mṛḷayattamāthā vayam ava it te vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: upa te stomān paśu pāḥ iva akaram rāsvā pitar marutām sumnam asme  bhadrā hi te sumatiḥ mṛḍayattama athā vayam avaḥ id te vṛṇīmahe
translated: I have brought thy praises, O Father, as a herdsman his cattle: grant thou the Maruts' favour to us.🔽For blessed is thy most gracious favour: then we choose thee for our own.

original: āre te goghnam uta pūruṣaghnaṃ kṣayadvīra sumnam asme te astu /
analyzed: āre te go ghnam uta pūruṣa ghnam kṣayadvīra sumnam asme te astu
translated: Far be thy bolt that slays the bull and man: be thou propitious to our hero sons.

original: mṛḷā ca no adhi ca brūhi devādhā ca naḥ śarma yaccha dvibarhāḥ //
analyzed: mṛḷa ca naḥ adhi ca brūhi deva adhā ca naḥ śarma yaccha dvibarhāḥ
translated: Be gracious unto us, and speak to us, O God: and grant us shelter, thou of double strength.

original: avocāma namo asmā avasyavaḥ śṛṇotu no havaṃ rudro marutvān /
analyzed: avocāma namaḥ asmai avasyavaḥ śṛṇotu naḥ havam rudraḥ marutvān
translated: We have spoken this prayer to thee, O Rudra: may he, the bountiful, hear our call.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, Sindhu, Earth, and Heaven, grant us this boon.

original: citraṃ devānām ud agād anīkaṃ cakṣur mitrasya varuṇasyāgneḥ /🔽āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ sūrya ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca //
analyzed: citram devānām ud agāt anīkam cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya agneḥ  āprāḥ dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūryaḥ ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca
translated: The wondrous form of the gods hath risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni.🔽It hath filled the heaven and earth and the atmosphere. The sun is the soul of the moving and unmoving world.

original: sūryo devīm uṣasaṃ rocamānām maryo na yoṣām abhy eti paścāt /
analyzed: sūryaḥ devīm uṣasam rocamānām maryaḥ na yoṣām abhī eti paścāt
translated: The sun approaches the shining goddess Dawn, as a youth his wife from behind.

original: yatrā naro devayanto yugāni vitanvate prati bhadrāya bhadram //
analyzed: yatrā naraḥ devayantaḥ yugāni vitanvate prati bhadrāya bhadram
translated: Where men who delight in the gods stretch out the yokes, one after another, for the good (to come).

original: bhadrā aśvā haritaḥ sūryasya citrā etagvā anumādyāsaḥ /
analyzed: bhadrāḥ aśvāḥ haritaḥ sūryasya citrāḥ etagvāḥ anumādyāsaḥ
translated: The good, the green horses of the sun, the variegated, the spotted, the most delightful,

original: namasyanto diva ā pṛṣṭham asthuḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti sadyaḥ //
analyzed: namasyantaḥ divaḥ ā pṛṣṭham asthuḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti sadyas
translated: bowing, have gone to the back of the sky. They go round the heaven and earth in a moment.

original: tat sūryasya devatvaṃ tan mahitvam madhyā kartor vitataṃ saṃ jabhāra /🔽yaded ayukta haritaḥ sadhasthād ād rātrī vāsas tanute simasmai //
analyzed: tat sūryasya deva tvam tat mahi tvam madhyā kartoḥ vitatam sam jabhāra  yadā id ayukta haritaḥ sadhasthāt āt rātrī vāsaḥ tanute simasmai
translated: That is the godhead of the sun, that is his greatness. He hath gathered in the middle of the work what was spread out.🔽When he hath yoked the green (horses) from the abode, then night weaves a garment for him to wear.

original: tan mitrasya varuṇasyābhicakṣe sūryo rūpaṃ kṛṇute dyor upasthe /
analyzed: tat mitrasya varuṇasya abhicakṣe sūryaḥ rūpam kṛṇute dyoḥ upasthe
translated: That is the look of Mitra and Varuna. The sun makes a form in the lap of the sky.

original: anantam anyad ruśad asya pājaḥ kṛṣṇam anyad dharitaḥ sam bharanti //
analyzed: anantam anyat ruśat asya pājaḥ kṛṣṇam anyat haritaḥ sam bharanti
translated: One part of his is endless, shining; the other, dark, the green ones gather together.

original: adyā devā uditā sūryasya nir aṃhasaḥ pipṛtā nir avadyāt /
analyzed: adyā devāḥ uditā sūryasya niḥ aṃhasaḥ pipṛta niḥ avadyāt
translated: Today, O gods, having risen at sunrise, deliver us from affliction, from blame.

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, Sindhu, the earth, and heaven, grant this to us.

original: nāsatyābhyām barhir iva pra vṛñje stomāṃ iyarmy abhriyeva vātaḥ /
analyzed: nāsatyābhyām barhiḥ iva pra vṛñje stomān iyarmi abhriyā iva vātaḥ
translated: I spread out my praises to the Nâsatyas like a grass-covering, I urge them like the wind urging the clouds.

original: yāv arbhagāya vimadāya jāyāṃ senājuvā nyūhatū rathena //
analyzed: yau arbhagāya vimadāya jāyām senā juvā nyūhatuḥ rathena
translated: Who with a youthful host and car, O Nâsatyas, brought to the sonless Vimada a wife.

original: vīḷupatmabhir āśuhemabhir vā devānāṃ vā jūtibhiḥ śāśadānā /
analyzed: vīḍu patmabhiḥ āśu hemabhiḥ vā devānām vā jūtibhiḥ śāśadānā
translated: With shafts that fly like lightning, or the swift-moving winds of the gods, that are ever ready to strike.

original: tad rāsabho nāsatyā sahasram ājā yamasya pradhane jigāya //
analyzed: tat rāsabhaḥ nāsatyā sahasram ājā yamasya pradhane jigāya
translated: There the ass of the Nâsatyas won a thousand in the contest with Yama.

original: tugro ha bhujyum aśvinodameghe rayiṃ na kaś cin mamṛvāṃ avāhāḥ /
analyzed: tugraḥ ha bhujyum aśvinā uda meghe rayim na kaḥ cit mamṛvān avāhār
translated: Tugra, no one could win for Bhujyu, the son of Âdhim, wealth, though he offered his daughter.

original: tam ūhathur naubhir ātmanvatībhir antarikṣaprudbhir apodakābhiḥ //
analyzed: tam ūhathuḥ naubhiḥ ātmanvatībhiḥ antarikṣa prudbhiḥ apodakābhiḥ
translated: Ye carried him away in your self-moving ships, that cleave the waters and the air.

original: tisraḥ kṣapas trir ahātivrajadbhir nāsatyā bhujyum ūhathuḥ pataṅgaiḥ /
analyzed: tisraḥ kṣapaḥ tris ahā ativrajadbhiḥ nāsatyā bhujyum ūhathuḥ pataṅgaiḥ
translated: With three nights and three days, O Nâsatyas, ye carried Bhujyu away with your winged (steeds) that travel far.

original: samudrasya dhanvann ārdrasya pāre tribhī rathaiḥ śatapadbhiḥ ṣaḷaśvaiḥ //
analyzed: samudrasya dhanvan ārdrasya pāre tribhiḥ rathaiḥ śata padbhiḥ ṣaṣ aśvaiḥ
translated: On the shore of the moist ocean, with three chariots, with a hundred wheels, and six horses.

original: anārambhaṇe tad avīrayethām anāsthāne agrabhaṇe samudre /
analyzed: an ārambhaṇe tat avīrayethām an āsthāne agrabhaṇe samudre
translated: Ye made it ready for him, O Nâsatyas, in the ocean, where there is no support, no foothold, no grasping hold.

original: yad aśvinā ūhathur bhujyum astaṃ śatāritrāṃ nāvam ātasthivāṃsam //
analyzed: yat aśvinau ūhathuḥ bhujyum astam śata aritrām nāvam ātasthivāṃsam
translated: When ye, O Asvins, raised Bhujyu up from the pit, when ye took to the ship that had a hundred oars.

original: yam aśvinā dadathuḥ śvetam aśvam aghāśvāya śaśvad it svasti /
analyzed: yam aśvinā dadathuḥ śvetam aśvam agha aśvāya śaśvat id svasti
translated: The white horse which ye gave to Aghaçva, that he might ever have prosperity,

original: tad vāṃ dātram mahi kīrtenyam bhūt paidvo vājī sadam id dhavyo aryaḥ //
analyzed: tat vām dātram mahi kīrtenyam bhūt paidvaḥ vājī sadam id havyaḥ aryaḥ
translated: That gift of yours shall be great and worthy of fame, the strong steed is ever to be invoked, the noble.

original: yuvaṃ narā stuvate pajriyāya kakṣīvate aradatam purandhim /
analyzed: yuvam narā stuvate pajriyāya kakṣīvate aradatam purandhim
translated: Ye Heroes, for the son of Pajra ye cleft the dam for Kakshivan.

original: kārotarāc chaphād aśvasya vṛṣṇaḥ śataṃ kumbhāṃ asiñcataṃ surāyāḥ //
analyzed: kārotarāt śaphāt aśvasya vṛṣṇaḥ śatam kumbhān asiñcatam surāyāḥ
translated: From the hoof of the brown horse ye poured a hundred jars of Surâ.

original: himenāgniṃ ghraṃsam avārayethām pitumatīm ūrjam asmā adhattam /
analyzed: himena agnim ghraṃsam avārayethām pitumatīm ūrjam asmai adhattam
translated: Ye turned away the frost from Agni, ye bestowed on him food that was rich in children.

original: ṛbīse atrim aśvināvanītam un ninyathuḥ sarvagaṇaṃ svasti //
analyzed: ṛbīse atrim aśvinā avanītam ud ninyathuḥ sarva gaṇam svasti
translated: Ye, O ye Asvins, raised up Atri from the pit, ye brought him back with all his members safe and sound.

original: parāvataṃ nāsatyānudethām uccābudhnaṃ cakrathur jihmabāram /
analyzed: parāvatam nāsatyā anudethām uccābudhnam cakrathuḥ jihma bāram
translated: Ye, O Nâsatyas, raised up Parâvata, ye made the well with the high edge and the crooked rim.

original: kṣarann āpo na pāyanāya rāye sahasrāya tṛṣyate gotamasya //🔽jujuruṣo nāsatyota vavrim prāmuñcataṃ drāpim iva cyavānāt /
analyzed: kṣaran āpaḥ na pāyanāya rāye sahasrāya tṛṣyate gotamasya  jujuruṣaḥ nāsatya uta vavrim prāmuñcatam drāpim iva cyavānāt
translated: The waters flowed for the sake of drink, for a thousand, for the thirsty Gotama.🔽Ye, O Nâsatyas, unloosed the twisted entrails of Jujurûsha, as one draws out a dart.

original: prātirataṃ jahitasyāyur dasrād it patim akṛṇutaṃ kanīnām //
analyzed: prātiratam jahitasya āyuḥ dasrā āt id patim akṛṇutam kanīnām
translated: Ye restored the life of the abandoned one, and made the husband of the little wife come back from the Dâsas.

original: tad vāṃ narā śaṃsyaṃ rādhyaṃ cābhiṣṭiman nāsatyā varūtham /
analyzed: tat vām narā śaṃsyam rādhyam ca abhiṣṭiman nāsatyāḥ varūtham
translated: That, O Heroes, is to be praised and accomplished by you, O Nâsatyas, your protection, which is most to be desired.

original: yad vidvāṃsā nidhim ivāpagūḷham ud darśatād ūpathur vandanāya //🔽tad vāṃ narā sanaye daṃsa ugram āviṣ kṛṇomi tanyatur na vṛṣṭim /
analyzed: yat vidvāṃsā nidhim iva apagūḍham ud darśatāt ūpathuḥ vandanāya  tat vām narā sanaye daṃsaḥ ugram āvis kṛṇomi tanyatuḥ na vṛṣṭim
translated: When, knowing it, ye have raised up to the worshipper the treasure that was hidden as in a pit.🔽That, O Heroes, I make manifest to you, your terrible power for conquest, like the thunder-cloud for the rain.

original: dadhyaṅ ha yan madhv ātharvaṇo vām aśvasya śīrṣṇā pra yad īm uvāca //
analyzed: dadhyaṅ ha yat madhu ātharvaṇaḥ vām aśvasya śīrṣṇā pra yat īm uvāca
translated: When Dadhyac, son of Atharvan, spoke to you, what he had learned from the head of the horse, the sweet drink.

original: ajohavīn nāsatyā karā vām mahe yāman purubhujā purandhiḥ /
analyzed: ajohavīt nāsatyā karā vām mahe yāman puru bhujā purandhiḥ
translated: Kara, the bountiful, the wise, invoked you, O Nâsatyas, on his great journey.

original: śrutaṃ tac chāsur iva vadhrimatyā hiraṇyahastam aśvināv adattam //
analyzed: śrutam tat śāsuḥ iva vadhrimatyāḥ hiraṇyahastam aśvinau adattam
translated: That was heard, as if by a judge, of Vadhrimatî: to the man with the golden hand, O ye Aṣvins, ye gave a son.

original: āsno vṛkasya vartikām abhīke yuvaṃ narā nāsatyāmumuktam /
analyzed: āsnaḥ vṛkasya vartikām abhīke yuvam narā nāsatya amumuktam
translated: Ye, O Heroes, Nâsatyas, set free the cripple of the wolf, in the presence of the wolf.

original: uto kavim purubhujā yuvaṃ ha kṛpamāṇam akṛṇutaṃ vicakṣe //🔽caritraṃ hi ver ivācchedi parṇam ājā khelasya paritakmyāyām /🔽sadyo jaṅghām āyasīṃ viśpalāyai dhane hite sartave praty adhattam //
analyzed: uta u kavim puru bhujā yuvam ha kṛpamāṇam akṛṇutam vicakṣe  caritram hi veḥ iva acchedi parṇam ājā khelasya paritakmyāyām  sadyas jaṅghām āyasīm viśpalāyai dhane hite sartave prati adhattam
translated: And the wise one, O ye bountiful ones, ye made to look around, when he was striving to look.🔽For the cripple's foot was cut off, as it were, by the moving of the foot, in the contest of the cripple and the lame.🔽Ye set the iron leg of Viṣpalâ straight, that she might go to the appointed place in the race.

original: śatam meṣān vṛkye cakṣadānam ṛjrāśvaṃ tam pitāndhaṃ cakāra /
analyzed: śatam meṣān vṛkye cakṣadānam ṛjrāśvam tam pitā andham cakāra
translated: The father made R̥ijrâṣva blind, who gave a hundred rams to the she-wolf.

original: tasmā akṣī nāsatyā vicakṣa ādhattaṃ dasrā bhiṣajāv anarvan //
analyzed: tasmai akṣī nāsatyāḥ vicakṣe ādhattam dasrā bhiṣajau anarvan
translated: Therefore, O ye Nâsatyas, ye who see afar, ye wondrous, mighty Physicians, grant us sight.

original: ā vāṃ rathaṃ duhitā sūryasya kārṣmevātiṣṭhad arvatā jayantī /
analyzed: ā vām ratham duhitā sūryasya kārṣma iva atiṣṭhat arvatā jayantī
translated: The daughter of Sûrya hath mounted your car, as 'twere to win the prize, and to win with the steed.

original: viśve devā anv amanyanta hṛdbhiḥ sam u śriyā nāsatyā sacethe //
analyzed: viśve devāḥ anu amanyanta hṛdbhiḥ sam u śriyā nāsatyā sacethe
translated: All the Gods have approved it with their hearts. With glory, O Nâsatyas, ye are united.

original: yad ayātaṃ divodāsāya vartir bharadvājāyāśvinā hayantā /🔽revad uvāha sacano ratho vāṃ vṛṣabhaś ca śiṃśumāraś ca yuktā //
analyzed: yat ayātam divodāsāya vartiḥ bharadvājāya aśvinā  revat uvāha sacanaḥ rathaḥ vām vṛṣabhaḥ ca śiṃśumāraḥ ca yuktā
translated: When ye came to the dwelling of Divodâsa, O ye Aṣvins, ye were borne by the two horses.🔽Your car, which is rich in gifts and which moves at will, was yoked, the bull and the porpoise.

original: rayiṃ sukṣatraṃ svapatyam āyuḥ suvīryaṃ nāsatyā vahantā /
analyzed: rayim su kṣatram su apatyam āyuḥ su vīryam nāsatyā vahantā
translated: Bearing wealth, good rule, self-protection, life, and good hero strength, O Nâsatyas, ye came.

original: ā jahnāvīṃ samanasopa vājais trir ahno bhāgaṃ dadhatīm ayātam //🔽pariviṣṭaṃ jāhuṣaṃ viśvataḥ sīṃ sugebhir naktam ūhathū rajobhiḥ /
analyzed: ā jahnāvīm samanasā upa vājaiḥ tris ahnaḥ bhāgam dadhatīm ayātam  pariviṣṭam jāhuṣam viśvatas sīm sugebhiḥ naktam ūhathuḥ rajobhiḥ
translated: To the Jahnu, which is full of thought, which bears the portion of the day thrice, ye came with your strength.🔽The son of Jahnu, who is surrounded on all sides, ye have carried in your easy paths, in the night, in the regions.

original: vibhindunā nāsatyā rathena vi parvatāṃ ajarayū ayātam //
analyzed: vibhindunā nāsatyā rathena vi parvatān ajarayū ayātam
translated: With your car, O Nâsatyas, which cleaves in pieces, ye came to the mountains, which are without decay.

original: ekasyā vastor āvataṃ raṇāya vaśam aśvinā sanaye sahasrā /
analyzed: ekasyāḥ vastoḥ āvatam raṇāya vaśam aśvinā sanaye sahasrā
translated: Ye have come to the one place for the battle, to the contest, O ye Aṣvins, for the sake of a thousand.

original: nir ahataṃ ducchunā indravantā pṛthuśravaso vṛṣaṇāv arātīḥ //
analyzed: niḥ ahatam ducchunāḥ indravantā pṛthuśravasaḥ vṛṣaṇau arātīḥ
translated: Ye have driven away the evil reports, O ye two who are like Indra, the evil reports of Prithuṣravas.

original: śarasya cid ārcatkasyāvatād ā nīcād uccā cakrathuḥ pātave vāḥ /
analyzed: śarasya cit ārcatkasya avatāt ā nīcāt uccā cakrathuḥ pātave vāḥ
translated: From the very tip of the arrow you have saved him, from low and from high you have made the water flow for his drinking.

original: śayave cin nāsatyā śacībhir jasuraye staryam pipyathur gām //
analyzed: śayave cit nāsatyā śacībhiḥ jasuraye staryam pipyathuḥ gām
translated: Even for Sayu, O Nāsatyas, with your powers, you have filled the cow with milk for Jasura.

original: avasyate stuvate kṛṣṇiyāya ṛjūyate nāsatyā śacībhiḥ /
analyzed: avasyate stuvate kṛṣṇiyāya ṛjūyate nāsatyā śacībhiḥ
translated: To the needy one who praises, to the one who is black, to the one who is straight, O Nāsatyas, with your powers,

original: paśuṃ na naṣṭam iva darśanāya viṣṇāpvaṃ dadathur viśvakāya //
analyzed: paśum na naṣṭam iva darśanāya viṣṇāpvam dadathuḥ viśvakāya
translated: You have given the all-supporting Vishṇāpva, like a lost animal, to be seen.

original: daśa rātrīr aśivenā nava dyūn avanaddhaṃ śnathitam apsv antaḥ /
analyzed: daśa rātrīḥ aśivena nava dyūn avanaddham śnathitam apsu antar
translated: For ten nights, for nine days with misfortune, bound, torn apart, in the waters,

original: viprutaṃ rebham udani pravṛktam un ninyathuḥ somam iva sruveṇa //
analyzed: viprutam rebham udani pravṛktam ud ninyathuḥ somam iva sruveṇa
translated: The scattered one, the singing one, thrown into the water, you have brought up with the ladle, like Soma.

original: pra vāṃ daṃsāṃsy aśvināv avocam asya patiḥ syāṃ sugavaḥ suvīraḥ /
analyzed: pra vām daṃsāṃsi aśvinau avocam asya patiḥ syām sugavaḥ su vīraḥ
translated: I have proclaimed your deeds, O Aśvins. May I be the lord of this one, rich in good cattle and good heroes.

original: uta paśyann aśnuvan dīrgham āyur astam ivej jarimāṇaṃ jagamyām //
analyzed: uta paśyan aśnuvan dīrgham āyuḥ astam iva id jarimāṇam jagamyām
translated: May I, seeing and enjoying, go to old age, as it were, to the setting, to a long life.

original: madhvaḥ somasyāśvinā madāya pratno hotā vivāsate vām /
analyzed: madhvaḥ somasya aśvinā madāya pratnaḥ hotā vivāsate vām
translated: Of the sweet Soma, O Aśvins, for the sake of joy, the ancient Hotṛ invites you.

original: barhiṣmatī rātir viśritā gīr iṣā yātaṃ nāsatyopa vājaiḥ //
analyzed: barhiṣmatī rātiḥ viśritā gīḥ iṣā yātam nāsatyā upa vājaiḥ
translated: The offering with the sacrificial grass, the well-known praise, come with food, O Nāsatyas, with your powers.

original: yo vām aśvinā manaso javīyān rathaḥ svaśvo viśa ājigāti /
analyzed: yaḥ vām aśvinā manasaḥ javīyān rathaḥ su aśvaḥ viśaḥ ājigāti
translated: The chariot of yours, O Aśvins, which is swifter than thought, which goes to the people with good horses,

original: yena gacchathaḥ sukṛto duroṇaṃ tena narā vartir asmabhyaṃ yātam //
analyzed: yena gacchathaḥ su kṛtaḥ duroṇam tena narā vartiḥ asmabhyam yātam
translated: By which ye go to the abode of the righteous, by that way, O heroes, come to our dwelling.

original: ṛṣiṃ narāv aṃhasaḥ pāñcajanyam ṛbīsād atrim muñcatho gaṇena /
analyzed: ṛṣim narau aṃhasaḥ pāñcajanyam ṛbīsāt atrim muñcathaḥ gaṇena
