translated: Ye heroes, with your company, deliver Atri from the R̥ishi, from the fivefold people, from the snare, from trouble.

original: minantā dasyor aśivasya māyā anupūrvaṃ vṛṣaṇā codayantā //
analyzed: minantā dasyoḥ aśivasya māyāḥ anupūrvam vṛṣaṇā codayantā
translated: Overcoming the Dasyu's guile, O ye auspicious, urging on the mighty one in order.

original: aśvaṃ na gūḷham aśvinā durevair ṛṣiṃ narā vṛṣaṇā rebham apsu /
analyzed: aśvam na gūḍham aśvinā durevaiḥ ṛṣim narā vṛṣaṇā rebham apsu
translated: The horse, O ye Aṣvins, hidden in the Duris, the R̥ishi, O ye Heroes, in the waters, the mighty one, the singer, Rebha.

original: saṃ taṃ riṇītho viprutaṃ daṃsobhir na vāṃ jūryanti pūrvyā kṛtāni //🔽suṣupvāṃsaṃ na nirṛter upasthe sūryaṃ na dasrā tamasi kṣiyantam /
analyzed: sam tam riṇīthaḥ viprutam daṃsobhiḥ na vām jūryanti pūrvyā kṛtāni  suṣupvāṃsam na nirṛteḥ upasthe sūryam na dasrā tamasi kṣiyantam
translated: Ye brought him forth, the scattered one, with your powers. Your ancient deeds are not decayed, O ye two.🔽Ye found the sleeping one in the lap of Nirr̥iti, the sun, O ye Wonder-Workers, in the darkness.

original: śubhe rukmaṃ na darśataṃ nikhātam ud ūpathur aśvinā vandanāya //🔽tad vāṃ narā śaṃsyam pajriyeṇa kakṣīvatā nāsatyā parijman /
analyzed: śubhe rukmam na darśatam nikhātam ud ūpathuḥ aśvinā vandanāya  tat vām narā śaṃsyam pajriyeṇa kakṣīvatā nāsatyā parijman
translated: Ye raised up, O ye Aṣvins, for Vandin, the beautiful, the lovely, the buried treasure.🔽That, O ye Heroes, is to be extolled of you, O ye Nâsatyas, by the son of Pajra, by Kakṣīvān, the far-extending.

original: śaphād aśvasya vājino janāya śataṃ kumbhāṃ asiñcatam madhūnām //
analyzed: śaphāt aśvasya vājinaḥ janāya śatam kumbhān asiñcatam madhūnām
translated: From the hoof of the strong horse ye poured for the people a hundred jars of meath.

original: yuvaṃ narā stuvate kṛṣṇiyāya viṣṇāpvaṃ dadathur viśvakāya /
analyzed: yuvam narā stuvate kṛṣṇiyāya viṣṇāpvam dadathuḥ viśvakāya
translated: Ye, O ye Heroes, to the singer Kṛiṣṇiya, to Viṣṇâpû, to Viśvaka, gave a portion.

original: ghoṣāyai cit pitṛṣade duroṇe patiṃ jūryantyā aśvināv adattam //
analyzed: ghoṣāyai cit pitṛṣade duroṇe patim jūryantyai aśvinau adattam
translated: Ye gave a husband to the old woman Ghosâ, in the house of the Fathers, to the decrepit one, O ye Aṣvins.

original: yuvaṃ śyāvāya ruśatīm adattam mahaḥ kṣoṇasyāśvinā kaṇvāya /
analyzed: yuvam śyāvāya ruśatīm adattam mahaḥ kṣoṇasya aśvinā kaṇvāya
translated: You gave the dark one the ruddy one, O Açvins, the great wealth of the field to Kaṇva.

original: pravācyaṃ tad vṛṣaṇā kṛtaṃ vāṃ yan nārṣadāya śravo adhyadhattam //
analyzed: pravācyam tat vṛṣaṇā kṛtam vām yat nārṣadāya śravaḥ adhyadhattam
translated: That deed, O ye mighty ones, is to be proclaimed of you, that ye bestowed glory on Nṛṣad.

original: purū varpāṃsy aśvinā dadhānā ni pedava ūhathur āśum aśvam /
analyzed: purū varpāṃsi aśvinā dadhānā ni pedavaḥ ūhathuḥ āśum aśvam
translated: Endowed with many forms, O ye Aṣvins, ye bore away the swift horse, the swift courser,

original: sahasrasāṃ vājinam apratītam ahihanaṃ śravasyaṃ tarutram //
analyzed: sahasra sām vājinam apratītam ahi hanam śravasyam tarutram
translated: The thousand-winner, the strong, the irresistible, the dragon-slayer, the glorious, the protector.

original: etāni vāṃ śravasyā sudānū brahmāṅgūṣaṃ sadanaṃ rodasyoḥ /
analyzed: etāni vām śravasyā sudānū brahma āṅgūṣam sadanam rodasyoḥ
translated: These, O ye bountiful, are your glories, the prayer and praise, the seat of you two world-halves,

original: yad vām pajrāso aśvinā havante yātam iṣā ca viduṣe ca vājam //
analyzed: yat vām pajrāsaḥ aśvinā havante yātam iṣā ca viduṣe ca vājam
translated: When the Pajras call you, O ye Aṣvins, come with food and strength to him who knows.

original: sūnor mānenāśvinā gṛṇānā vājaṃ viprāya bhuraṇā radantā /
analyzed: sūnoḥ mānena aśvinā gṛṇānā vājam viprāya bhuraṇā radantā
translated: Praised by the son's homage, O ye Aṣvins, grinding the food for the sage, O ye active ones,

original: agastye brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānā saṃ viśpalāṃ nāsatyāriṇītam //
analyzed: agastye brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānā sam viśpalām nāsatyā ariṇītam
translated: Growing in strength through the prayer of Agastya, ye brought him the Nâsatyas' company.

original: kuha yāntā suṣṭutiṃ kāvyasya divo napātā vṛṣaṇā śayutrā /
analyzed: kuha yāntā suṣṭutim kāvyasya divaḥ napātā vṛṣaṇā śayutrā
translated: Where are ye going, O ye two sons of heaven, O ye mighty ones, to the praise of Kavya?

original: hiraṇyasyeva kalaśaṃ nikhātam ud ūpathur daśame aśvināhan //
analyzed: hiraṇyasya iva kalaśam nikhātam ud ūpathuḥ daśame aśvinā ahan
translated: Ye have raised up, O ye Aṣvins, in the tenth (day) the horse that was buried as 'twere a jar of gold.

original: yuvaṃ cyavānam aśvinā jarantam punar yuvānaṃ cakrathuḥ śacībhiḥ /
analyzed: yuvam cyavānam aśvinā jarantam punar yuvānam cakrathuḥ śacībhiḥ
translated: Ye, O ye Aṣvins, have made the old Chyavâna young again with your mighty powers.

original: yuvo rathaṃ duhitā sūryasya saha śriyā nāsatyāvṛṇīta //
analyzed: yuvoḥ ratham duhitā sūryasya saha śriyā nāsatyā avṛṇīta
translated: Choose ye the chariot, O ye Nâsatyas, the daughter of Sûrya, with glory, for your own.

original: yuvaṃ tugrāya pūrvyebhir evaiḥ punarmanyāv abhavataṃ yuvānā /🔽yuvam bhujyum arṇaso niḥ samudrād vibhir ūhathur ṛjrebhir aśvaiḥ //
analyzed: yuvam tugrāya pūrvyebhiḥ evaiḥ punarmanyau abhavatam yuvānā  yuvam bhujyum arṇasaḥ niḥ samudrāt vibhiḥ ūhathuḥ ṛjrebhiḥ aśvaiḥ
translated: Ye, being young, were made again the friends of Tugra with the ancient rites.🔽Ye brought Bhujyu out of the sea, out of the ocean, with your horses that are fleet and strong.

original: ajohavīd aśvinā taugryo vām proḷhaḥ samudram avyathir jaganvān /
analyzed: ajohavīt aśvinā taugryaḥ vām proḍhaḥ samudram avyathiḥ jaganvān
translated: Taugrîya called on you, O ye Aṣvins: he went with a swift step to the sea that never fails.

original: niṣ ṭam ūhathuḥ suyujā rathena manojavasā vṛṣaṇā svasti //
analyzed: niḥ tam ūhathuḥ su yujā rathena manaḥ javasā vṛṣaṇā svasti
translated: Ye brought him forth with a well-yoked chariot, O ye mighty, with a car that has the speed of thought.

original: ajohavīd aśvinā vartikā vām āsno yat sīm amuñcataṃ vṛkasya /
analyzed: ajohavīt aśvinā vartikā vām āsnaḥ yat sīm amuñcatam vṛkasya
translated: Taugrîya called on you, O ye Aṣvins: when ye set free the sheep that was the wolf's prey,

original: vi jayuṣā yayathuḥ sānv adrer jātaṃ viṣvāco ahataṃ viṣeṇa //
analyzed: vi jayuṣā yayathuḥ sānū adreḥ jātam viṣvācaḥ ahatam viṣeṇa
translated: Ye went away with conquering might, and left the mountain's ridge, and struck down the born foe with poison.

original: śatam meṣān vṛkye māmahānaṃ tamaḥ praṇītam aśivena pitrā /
analyzed: śatam meṣān vṛkye māmahānam tamaḥ praṇītam aśivena pitrā
translated: Taugrîya called on you, O ye Aṣvins: a hundred rams, a great and terrible darkness, led by an inauspicious sire,

original: ākṣī ṛjrāśve aśvināv adhattaṃ jyotir andhāya cakrathur vicakṣe //
analyzed: ā akṣī ṛjrāśve aśvinau adhattam jyotiḥ andhāya cakrathuḥ vicakṣe
translated: Ye gave to Ṛijrâṣva, O ye Aṣvins: ye gave the blind man light and power to see.

original: śunam andhāya bharam ahvayat sā vṛkīr aśvinā vṛṣaṇā nareti /
analyzed: śunam andhāya bharam ahvayat sā vṛkīḥ aśvinā vṛṣaṇā narā iti
translated: Taugrîya called on you, O ye Aṣvins: the she-wolf, O ye mighty, O ye men, carried off the sheep.

original: jāraḥ kanīna iva cakṣadāna ṛjrāśvaḥ śatam ekaṃ ca meṣān //
analyzed: jāraḥ kanīnaḥ iva cakṣadānaḥ ṛjrāśvaḥ śatam ekam ca meṣān
translated: The young man Ṛijrâṣva gave a hundred and one rams, as if he had given them with his eyes.

original: mahī vām ūtir aśvinā mayobhūr uta srāmaṃ dhiṣṇyā saṃ riṇīthaḥ /
analyzed: mahī vām ūtiḥ aśvinā mayaḥ bhūḥ uta srāmam dhiṣṇyā sam riṇīthaḥ
translated: Your help, O Aṣvins, is the earth, the bounteous: ye heal the malady that wastes the body.

original: athā yuvām id ahvayat purandhir āgacchataṃ sīṃ vṛṣaṇāv avobhiḥ //🔽adhenuṃ dasrā staryaṃ viṣaktām apinvataṃ śayave aśvinā gām /
analyzed: athā yuvām id ahvayat purandhiḥ āgacchatam sīm vṛṣaṇau avobhiḥ  adhenum dasrā staryam viṣaktām apinvatam śayave aśvinā gām
translated: Now Purandhi hath invoked you, O ye mighty: come hither unto us with your protecting help.🔽Ye wonder-workers, for Śayu ye have filled with milk the cow that was barren, and had lost her calf.

original: yuvaṃ śacībhir vimadāya jāyāṃ ny ūhathuḥ purumitrasya yoṣām //
analyzed: yuvam śacībhiḥ vimadāya jāyām ni ūhathuḥ purumitrasya yoṣām
translated: With your own powers ye brought the wife of Vimada, the woman of Purumitra, to her husband.

original: yavaṃ vṛkeṇāśvinā vapanteṣaṃ duhantā manuṣāya dasrā /
analyzed: yavam vṛkeṇa aśvinā vapantā iṣam duhantā manuṣāya dasrā
translated: Ye, O ye Wonder-workers, for the sake of Yava, who was bound with a snare, have milked the cow for Manu.

original: abhi dasyum bakureṇā dhamantoru jyotiś cakrathur āryāya //
analyzed: abhi dasyum bakureṇa dhamantā uru jyotiḥ cakrathuḥ āryāya
translated: Ye have with the Baka's help destroyed the Dasyu, and have made the light of the Ārya to shine forth.

original: ātharvaṇāyāśvinā dadhīce 'śvyaṃ śiraḥ praty airayatam /
analyzed: ātharvaṇāya aśvinā dadhīce śvyam śiraḥ prati airayatam
translated: Ye, O ye Aṣvins, have restored to Atharvan his head of horse, which had been cut off.

original: sa vām madhu pra vocad ṛtāyan tvāṣṭraṃ yad dasrāv apikakṣyaṃ vām //
analyzed: sa vām madhu pra vocat ṛtāyan tvāṣṭram yat dasrau apikakṣyam vām
translated: He, who hath spoken truth, hath told you of the sweet drink, which, O ye Wonder-workers, was in Tvaṣṭar's keeping.

original: sadā kavī sumatim ā cake vāṃ viśvā dhiyo aśvinā prāvatam me /🔽asme rayiṃ nāsatyā bṛhantam apatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ rarāthām //
analyzed: sadā kavī sumatim ā cake vām viśvāḥ dhiyaḥ aśvinā prāvatam me  asme rayim nāsatyāḥ bṛhantam apatyasācam śrutyam rarāthām
translated: I ever seek your favour, O ye wise ones: vouchsafe to me all thoughts, O ye Âsyins.🔽Grant us, O ye Nâsatyas, wealth that is great, with offspring and renown, and easy to be gained.

original: hiraṇyahastam aśvinā rarāṇā putraṃ narā vadhrimatyā adattam /
analyzed: hiraṇyahastam aśvinā rarāṇā putram narā vadhrimatyai adattam
translated: Ye, O ye Heroes, have given to Vadhrimatî a son with golden hands, whom ye have brought to life.

original: tridhā ha śyāvam aśvinā vikastam uj jīvasa airayataṃ sudānū //
analyzed: tridhā ha śyāvam aśvinā vikastam ud jīvase airayatam sudānū
translated: The black horse, O Asvins, ye have thrice restored to life, and set him free to move about.

original: etāni vām aśvinā vīryāṇi pra pūrvyāṇy āyavo 'vocan /
analyzed: etāni vām aśvinā vīryāṇi pra pūrvyāṇi āyavaḥ vocan
translated: These are your manly deeds, O Asvins, which the living have declared to me, your ancient deeds.

original: brahma kṛṇvanto vṛṣaṇā yuvabhyāṃ suvīrāso vidatham ā vadema //
analyzed: brahma kṛṇvantaḥ vṛṣaṇā yuvabhyām su vīrāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema
translated: Performing holy rites, O ye mighty, with you, may we, having brave sons, speak in the assembly.

original: ā vāṃ ratho aśvinā śyenapatvā sumṛḷīkaḥ svavāṃ yātv arvāṅ /
analyzed: ā vām rathaḥ aśvinā śyena patvā su mṛḍīkaḥ su avām yātu arvāṅ
translated: O Asvins, may your car, swift as a hawk, well-disposed, and of itself, come hither.

original: yo martyasya manaso javīyān trivandhuro vṛṣaṇā vātaraṃhāḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ martyasya manasaḥ javīyān tri vandhuraḥ vṛṣaṇā vāta raṃhāḥ
translated: Which is swifter than the mind of a mortal, having three seats, O ye mighty, and bearing the wind.

original: trivandhureṇa trivṛtā rathena tricakreṇa suvṛtā yātam arvāk /
analyzed: tri vandhureṇa trivṛtā rathena tri cakreṇa suvṛtā yātam arvāk
translated: Come hither on your car with three seats and three horses, well-constructed, with three wheels.

original: pinvataṃ gā jinvatam arvato no vardhayatam aśvinā vīram asme //
analyzed: pinvatam gāḥ jinvatam arvataḥ naḥ vardhayatam aśvinā vīram asme
translated: Cause our cows to swell with milk, quicken our horses, and increase our heroes, O Asvins, among us.

original: pravadyāmanā suvṛtā rathena dasrāv imaṃ śṛṇutaṃ ślokam adreḥ /
analyzed: pravat yāmanā suvṛtā rathena dasrau imam śṛṇutam ślokam adreḥ
translated: O ye two wondrous ones, on your well-constructed car, which goes straight forward, listen to this hymn of the mountain.

original: kim aṅga vām praty avartiṃ gamiṣṭhāhur viprāso aśvinā purājāḥ //
analyzed: kim aṅga vām prati avartim gamiṣṭhā āhuḥ viprāsaḥ aśvinā purājāḥ
translated: Why do the priests, O Asvins, the ancient ones, say that you are the most backward to come to the worshipper?

original: ā vāṃ śyenāso aśvinā vahantu rathe yuktāsa āśavaḥ pataṅgāḥ /
analyzed: ā vām śyenāsaḥ aśvinā vahantu rathe yuktāsaḥ āśavaḥ pataṅgāḥ
translated: O Asvins, let your swift hawks, your swift birds, yoked to your car, bring you hither.

original: ye apturo divyāso na gṛdhrā abhi prayo nāsatyā vahanti //
analyzed: ye apturaḥ divyāsaḥ na gṛdhrāḥ abhi prayaḥ nāsatyā vahanti
translated: Which carry you, O Nâsatyas, the swift ones, the divine ones, not the greedy ones, like birds to the place of sacrifice.

original: ā vāṃ rathaṃ yuvatis tiṣṭhad atra juṣṭvī narā duhitā sūryasya /🔽pari vām aśvā vapuṣaḥ pataṅgā vayo vahantv aruṣā abhīke //
analyzed: ā vām ratham yuvatiḥ tiṣṭhat atra juṣṭvī narā duhitā sūryasya  pari vām aśvāḥ vapuṣaḥ pataṅgāḥ vayaḥ vahantu aruṣāḥ abhīke
translated: The young maiden, the beloved of men, hath mounted your car here, the daughter of Sûrya.🔽Let your horses, your winged forms, your ruddy steeds, bring you near to us.

original: ud vandanam airataṃ daṃsanābhir ud rebhaṃ dasrā vṛṣaṇā śacībhiḥ /
analyzed: ud vandanam airatam daṃsanābhiḥ ud rebham dasrā vṛṣaṇā śacībhiḥ
translated: Ye have raised up the hymn of praise with your wondrous powers, ye have raised up the song of praise, O ye Wonder-Workers, with your might.

original: niṣ ṭaugryam pārayathaḥ samudrāt punaś cyavānaṃ cakrathur yuvānam //
analyzed: niḥ taugryam pārayathaḥ samudrāt punar cyavānam cakrathuḥ yuvānam
translated: Ye have delivered Taugrya from the sea, and ye have made Chyavana young again.

original: yuvam atraye 'vanītāya taptam ūrjam omānam aśvināv adhattam /
analyzed: yuvam atraye vanītāya taptam ūrjam omānam aśvinau adhattam
translated: Ye have given to Atri, to the lowly one, strength, food, and heat, O ye Aṣvins.

original: yuvaṃ kaṇvāyāpiriptāya cakṣuḥ praty adhattaṃ suṣṭutiṃ jujuṣāṇā //🔽yuvaṃ dhenuṃ śayave nādhitāyāpinvatam aśvinā pūrvyāya /
analyzed: yuvam kaṇvāya apiriptāya cakṣuḥ prati adhattam suṣṭutim jujuṣāṇā  yuvam dhenum śayave nādhitāya apinvatam aśvinā pūrvyāya
translated: Ye have restored to Kanva, to the afflicted one, his eye, accepting his praise.🔽Ye have caused the cow to swell for the ancient one, for Sarya, O ye Aṣvins.

original: amuñcataṃ vartikām aṃhaso niḥ prati jaṅghāṃ viśpalāyā adhattam //
analyzed: amuñcatam vartikām aṃhasaḥ niḥ prati jaṅghām viśpalāyai adhattam
translated: Ye have delivered the mouse from destruction, and have given back the leg to Viṣpala.

original: yuvaṃ śvetam pedava indrajūtam ahihanam aśvinādattam aśvam /
analyzed: yuvam śvetam pedavaḥ indra jūtam ahi hanam aśvinā adattam aśvam
translated: Ye have given to Pedu the white horse, urged on by Indra, the horse that slays the dragon,

original: johūtram aryo abhibhūtim ugraṃ sahasrasāṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vīḍvaṅgam //
analyzed: johūtram aryaḥ abhibhūtim ugram sahasra sām vṛṣaṇam vīḍu aṅgam
translated: The horse that neighs aloud, the noble one, the overcomer, the strong one, the thousand winner, the mighty one.

original: tā vāṃ narā sv avase sujātā havāmahe aśvinā nādhamānāḥ /
analyzed: tā vām narā su avase sujātā havāmahe aśvinā nādhamānāḥ
translated: To you, O ye Heroes, to you, O ye Well-born, we call for aid, O ye Aṣvins, we who are afflicted.

original: ā na upa vasumatā rathena giro juṣāṇā suvitāya yātam //🔽ā śyenasya javasā nūtanenāsme yātaṃ nāsatyā sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ upa vasumatā rathena giraḥ juṣāṇā suvitāya yātam  ā śyenasya javasā nūtanena asme yātam nāsatyā sajoṣāḥ
translated: Come to us with your treasure-laden car, accepting our songs, come for our welfare.🔽Come to us, O Nāsatyas, with the fresh swiftness of the falcon, in unison.

original: have hi vām aśvinā rātahavyaḥ śaśvattamāyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau //
analyzed: have hi vām aśvinā rāta havyaḥ śaśvattamāyāḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: For I, O Aśvins, who offer gifts, call you at the latest twilights, at the break of dawn.

original: ā vāṃ ratham purumāyam manojuvaṃ jīrāśvaṃ yajñiyaṃ jīvase huve /
analyzed: ā vām ratham puru māyam manaḥ juvam jīra aśvam yajñiyam jīvase huve
translated: I invoke your chariot, which is full of wisdom, which is swift as thought, which has swift horses, which is worthy of sacrifice, for the sake of life.

original: sahasraketuṃ vaninaṃ śatadvasuṃ śruṣṭīvānaṃ varivodhām abhi prayaḥ //🔽ūrdhvā dhītiḥ praty asya prayāmany adhāyi śasman sam ayanta ā diśaḥ /
analyzed: sahasra ketum vaninam śatadvasum śruṣṭīvānam varivaḥ dhām abhi prayaḥ  ūrdhvā dhītiḥ prati asya prayāmani adhāyi śasman sam ayanta ā diśaḥ
translated: Which has a thousand banners, which is rich in a hundred treasures, which listens, which is bountiful, which goes to the sacrifice.🔽My thought has been raised up to him as he moves along. The quarters of the sky have come together in his praise.

original: svadāmi gharmam prati yanty ūtaya ā vām ūrjānī ratham aśvināruhat //
analyzed: svadāmi gharmam prati yanti ūtayaḥ ā vām ūrjānī ratham aśvinā āruhat
translated: I delight in the hot drink. The aids come back to him. The two rich in food have mounted your chariot, O Aśvins.

original: saṃ yan mithaḥ paspṛdhānāso agmata śubhe makhā amitā jāyavo raṇe /
analyzed: sam yat mithas paspṛdhānāsaḥ agmata śubhe makhāḥ amitāḥ jāyavaḥ raṇe
translated: When you, the glorious ones, the unlimited ones, who are born for victory, have come together, striving against each other, in the contest.

original: yuvor aha pravaṇe cekite ratho yad aśvinā vahathaḥ sūrim ā varam //
analyzed: yuvoḥ aha pravaṇe cekite rathaḥ yat aśvinā vahathaḥ sūrim ā varam
translated: Your chariot is observed on the sloping (mountain), O you two, when you carry the lord, the excellent one.

original: yuvam bhujyum bhuramāṇaṃ vibhir gataṃ svayuktibhir nivahantā pitṛbhya ā /
analyzed: yuvam bhujyum bhuramāṇam vibhiḥ gatam sva yuktibhiḥ nivahantā pitṛbhyaḥ ā
translated: You two, when Bhujyu was crushed in the whirlpool, were brought to the fathers by your own yokings.

original: yāsiṣṭaṃ vartir vṛṣaṇā vijenyaṃ divodāsāya mahi ceti vām avaḥ //
analyzed: yāsiṣṭam vartiḥ vṛṣaṇā vijenyam divodāsāya mahi ceti vām avaḥ
translated: When ye go on your way, O ye Mighty Ones, to the house of Divodasa, your great favour seeks you.

original: yuvor aśvinā vapuṣe yuvāyujaṃ rathaṃ vāṇī yematur asya śardhyam /
analyzed: yuvoḥ aśvinā vapuṣe yuvāyujam ratham vāṇī yematuḥ asya śardhyam
translated: O ye Aṣvins, for the sake of your beauty ye have yoked your car, and your voice has come to this feast.

original: ā vām patitvaṃ sakhyāya jagmuṣī yoṣāvṛṇīta jenyā yuvām patī //
analyzed: ā vām pati tvam sakhyāya jagmuṣī yoṣā vṛṇīta jenyā yuvām patī
translated: As a young woman goes to her husband, to win you for a friend, I choose you, O ye excellent, as my lords.

original: yuvaṃ rebham pariṣūter uruṣyatho himena gharmam paritaptam atraye /🔽yuvaṃ śayor avasam pipyathur gavi pra dīrgheṇa vandanas tāry āyuṣā //
analyzed: yuvam rebham pariṣūteḥ uruṣyathaḥ himena gharmam paritaptam atraye  yuvam śayoḥ avasam pipyathuḥ gavi pra dīrgheṇa vandanaḥ tāri āyuṣā
translated: Ye have saved Revata from Parīṣṭi, and the hot-rayed sun from the cold for Atri.🔽Ye have filled the cow for Śaya, and with long life have ye saved Vandan.

original: yuvaṃ vandanaṃ nirṛtaṃ jaraṇyayā rathaṃ na dasrā karaṇā sam invathaḥ /
analyzed: yuvam vandanam nirṛtam jaraṇyayā ratham na dasrā karaṇā sam invathaḥ
translated: Ye have quickened the feeble Vandan with old age, as if he were a car, O ye Wonder-Workers.

original: kṣetrād ā vipraṃ janatho vipanyayā pra vām atra vidhate daṃsanā bhuvat //
analyzed: kṣetrāt ā vipram janathaḥ vipanyayā pra vām atra vidhate daṃsanā bhuvat
translated: Ye have brought the sage from the field by the way of the birds: may your favour be bestowed on us here.

original: agacchataṃ kṛpamāṇam parāvati pituḥ svasya tyajasā nibādhitam /
analyzed: agacchatam kṛpamāṇam parāvati pituḥ svasya tyajasā nibādhitam
translated: Ye have gone to the feeble one who was languishing afar, who was hindered by the sickness of his father.

original: svarvatīr ita ūtīr yuvor aha citrā abhīke abhavann abhiṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: svarvatīḥ itas ūtīḥ yuvoḥ aha citrāḥ abhīke abhavan abhiṣṭayaḥ
translated: Your ways are heavenly, your help is near: your wondrous aids have been near to us.

original: uta syā vām madhuman makṣikārapan made somasyauśijo huvanyati /
analyzed: uta syā vām madhumat makṣikā arapat made somasya auśijaḥ huvanyati
translated: And the honey-sweet bee of you two, O ye sons of Uṣija, is called to the Soma-feast.

original: yuvaṃ dadhīco mana ā vivāsatho 'thā śiraḥ prati vām aśvyaṃ vadat //
analyzed: yuvam dadhīcaḥ manaḥ ā vivāsathaḥ u thā śiraḥ prati vām aśvyam vadat
translated: You two restored Dadhyach's mind, then the horse's head spoke to you.

original: yuvam pedave puruvāram aśvinā spṛdhāṃ śvetaṃ tarutāraṃ duvasyathaḥ /
analyzed: yuvam pedave puru vāram aśvinā spṛdhām śvetam tarutāram duvasyathaḥ
translated: You two, O Ashvins, served the generous Pedu, the white horse of the army, the one who saves from death.

original: śaryair abhidyum pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraṃ carkṛtyam indram iva carṣaṇīsaham //
analyzed: śaryaiḥ abhidyum pṛtanāsu duṣṭaram carkṛtyam indram iva carṣaṇīsaham
translated: With arrows, shining in battles, hard to overcome, to be praised, like Indra, the conqueror of men.

original: kā rādhad dhotrāśvinā vāṃ ko vāṃ joṣa ubhayoḥ /
analyzed: kā rādhat hotrā aśvinā vām kaḥ vām joṣaḥ ubhayoḥ
translated: Who will offer you, O Ashvins, what gift? Who will please you both?

original: kathā vidhāty apracetāḥ //
analyzed: kathā vidhāti apracetāḥ
translated: How will one of little thought arrange it?

original: vidvāṃsāv id duraḥ pṛcched avidvān itthāparo acetāḥ /
analyzed: vidvāṃsau id duraḥ pṛcchet avidvān itthā aparaḥ acetāḥ
translated: The wise one should ask the doors, the ignorant one, standing thus, of little thought.

original: nū cin nu marte akrau //
analyzed: nū cit nu marte akrau
translated: Never will he be among mortals.

original: tā vidvāṃsā havāmahe vāṃ tā no vidvāṃsā manma vocetam adya /
analyzed: tā vidvāṃsā havāmahe vām tā naḥ vidvāṃsā manma vocetam adya
translated: We call you, the wise ones, we call you, the wise ones. Speak to us today.

original: prārcad dayamāno yuvākuḥ //
analyzed: prārcat dayamānaḥ yuvākuḥ
translated: The young one, shining, praises you.

original: vi pṛcchāmi pākyā na devān vaṣaṭkṛtasyādbhutasya dasrā /
analyzed: vi pṛcchāmi pākyā na devān vaṣaṭkṛtasya adbhutasya dasrā
translated: I ask the accomplished gods about the wonderful Vashat-offering, O wonder-workers.

original: pātaṃ ca sahyaso yuvaṃ ca rabhyaso naḥ //
analyzed: pātam ca sahyasaḥ yuvam ca rabhyasaḥ naḥ
translated: Protect us, you who are to be overcome together and separately.

original: pra yā ghoṣe bhṛgavāṇe na śobhe yayā vācā yajati pajriyo vām /
analyzed: pra yā ghoṣe bhṛgavāṇe na śobhe yayā vācā yajati pajriyaḥ vām
translated: The one who shines in the cry of the Bhrigus, in the beauty, by which speech one worships you, the Pajri ones,

original: praiṣayur na vidvān //
analyzed: praiṣayuḥ na vidvān
translated: The one who is sent forth, like a wise one.

original: śrutaṃ gāyatraṃ takavānasyāhaṃ cid dhi rirebhāśvinā vām /
analyzed: śrutam gāyatram takavānasya aham cit hi rirebha aśvinā vām
translated: I have heard the Gayatri, the Takavan, of you two, O Ashvins. For I have rejoiced.

original: ākṣī śubhas patī dan //
analyzed: ā akṣī śubhaḥ patī dan
translated: The eye of the lord of the good.

original: yuvaṃ hy āstam maho ran yuvaṃ vā yan niratataṃsatam /
analyzed: yuvam hi āstam mahaḥ ran yuvam vā yat niratataṃsatam
translated: You two indeed are the great ones of the world, you two who have attained the highest.

original: tā no vasū sugopā syātam pātaṃ no vṛkād aghāyoḥ //🔽mā kasmai dhātam abhy amitriṇe no mākutrā no gṛhebhyo dhenavo guḥ /
analyzed: tā naḥ vasū su gopā syātam pātam naḥ vṛkāt aghāyoḥ  mā kasmai dhātam abhī amitriṇe na u mā akutrā naḥ gṛhebhyaḥ dhenavaḥ guḥ
translated: Be good protectors for us, O Vasus, protect us from the wicked wolf.🔽Do not give us to any enemy, do not take away our cows from our houses.

original: stanābhujo aśiśvīḥ //
analyzed: stanābhujaḥ aśiśvīḥ
translated: The suckling calves should not be without their mothers.

original: duhīyan mitradhitaye yuvāku rāye ca no mimītaṃ vājavatyai /
analyzed: duhīyan mitradhitaye yuvāku rāye ca naḥ mimītam vājavatyai
translated: Yielding milk for the friend's son, measure for us wealth for the sake of strength,

original: iṣe ca no mimītaṃ dhenumatyai //
analyzed: iṣe ca naḥ mimītam dhenumatyai
translated: And for us food, for the sake of the milch cow.

original: aśvinor asanaṃ ratham anaśvaṃ vājinīvatoḥ /
analyzed: aśvinoḥ asanam ratham an aśvam vājinīvatoḥ
translated: The chariot seat of the two Ashvins, without horses, of the two rich in wealth,

original: tenāham bhūri cākana //
analyzed: tena aham bhūri cākana
translated: By that I have become very powerful.

original: ayaṃ samaha mā tanūhyāte janāṃ anu /
analyzed: ayam samaha mā janān anu
translated: This one, O people, should not oppress me as I go along.

original: somapeyaṃ sukho rathaḥ //
analyzed: soma peyam sukhaḥ rathaḥ
translated: The pleasant chariot, fit for drinking Soma.

original: adha svapnasya nir vide 'bhuñjataś ca revataḥ /
analyzed: adha svapnasya niḥ vide bhuñjataḥ ca revataḥ
translated: Now the wise one knows the way of sleep and of the one who has eaten well.

original: ubhā tā basri naśyataḥ //
analyzed: ubhā tā basri naśyataḥ
translated: Both of them perish quickly.

original: kad itthā nṝṃḥ pātraṃ devayatāṃ śravad giro aṅgirasāṃ turaṇyan /
analyzed: kad itthā nṝn pātram devayatām śravat giraḥ aṅgirasām turaṇyan
translated: Where is the vessel of men who worship the gods? The songs of the Angirases are heard as they hasten,

original: pra yad ānaḍ viśa ā harmyasyoru kraṃsate adhvare yajatraḥ //
analyzed: pra yat ānaṭ viśaḥ ā harmyasya uru kraṃsate adhvare yajatraḥ
translated: When he has brought the people to the house of the sacrifice, the one to be worshipped stretches out his arm in the sacrifice.

original: stambhīd dha dyāṃ sa dharuṇam pruṣāyad ṛbhur vājāya draviṇaṃ naro goḥ /
analyzed: stambhīt ha dyām sa dharuṇam pruṣāyat ṛbhuḥ vājāya draviṇam naraḥ goḥ
translated: He, the pillar, hath filled heaven with its prop, the R̥ibhu for the steed's strength, the men for the cow's wealth.

original: anu svajām mahiṣaś cakṣata vrām menām aśvasya pari mātaraṃ goḥ //
analyzed: anu sva jām mahiṣaḥ cakṣata vrām menām aśvasya pari mātaram goḥ
translated: The mighty bull hath looked upon his own herd, the mother of the horse, the mother of the cow.

original: nakṣad dhavam aruṇīḥ pūrvyaṃ rāṭ turo viśām aṅgirasām anu dyūn /
analyzed: nakṣat havam aruṇīḥ pūrvyam rāj turaḥ viśām aṅgirasām anu dyūn
translated: The red one hath obtained the ancient worship, the strong one in the Angirases' tribes through the days.

original: takṣad vajraṃ niyutaṃ tastambhad dyāṃ catuṣpade naryāya dvipāde //
analyzed: takṣat vajram niyutam tastambhat dyām catuṣpade naryāya dvipāde
translated: He hath fashioned the bolt, hath propped the chariot, for the man's use the four-footed, for the two-footed.

original: asya made svaryaṃ dā ṛtāyāpīvṛtam usriyāṇām anīkam /
analyzed: asya made svaryam dāḥ ṛtāya apīvṛtam usriyāṇām anīkam
translated: In his wild joy he gave the heaven to be born, the company of the cows, the first to be covered.

original: yad dha prasarge trikakum nivartad apa druho mānuṣasya duro vaḥ //🔽tubhyam payo yat pitarāv anītāṃ rādhaḥ suretas turaṇe bhuraṇyū /
analyzed: yat ha prasarge trikakubh nivartat apa druhaḥ mānuṣasya duraḥ var  tubhyam payaḥ yat pitarau anītām rādhaḥ su retaḥ turaṇe bhuraṇyu
translated: When he, at the beginning, turned the three-peaked (mountain), he drove away the foes of human kind.🔽The milk which your parents brought to you, the gift, O strong one, in the race, the young damsel,

original: śuci yat te rekṇa āyajanta sabardughāyāḥ paya usriyāyāḥ //🔽adha pra jajñe taraṇir mamattu pra rocy asyā uṣaso na sūraḥ /🔽indur yebhir āṣṭa sveduhavyaiḥ sruveṇa siñcañ jaraṇābhi dhāma //
analyzed: śuci yat te rekṇaḥ āyajanta sabardughāyāḥ payaḥ usriyāyāḥ  adha pra jajñe taraṇiḥ mamattu pra roci asyāḥ uṣasaḥ na sūraḥ  induḥ yebhiḥ āṣṭa sveduhavyaiḥ sruveṇa siñcam jaraṇā abhi dhāma
translated: The pure wealth which they offered you, the milk of the cow who yields much when milked.🔽Let the swift one be born and rejoice, like the sun at the rising of this dawn.🔽With what offerings they have brought, with the ladle pouring, the moon, with the hot libations, the light.

original: svidhmā yad vanadhitir apasyāt sūro adhvare pari rodhanā goḥ /
analyzed: su idhmā yat vanadhitiḥ apasyāt sūraḥ adhvare pari rodhanā goḥ
translated: When the fire-pan, the wood-cutter, the pot, the sun at the sacrifice, the enclosure of the cow,

original: yad dha prabhāsi kṛtvyāṃ anu dyūn anarviśe paśviṣe turāya //
analyzed: yat ha prabhāsi kṛtvyān anu dyūn anarviśe paśviṣe turāya
translated: When thou shinest in the Krittikâs, through the days, to the swift one who seeks cattle in the desert.

original: aṣṭā maho diva ādo harī iha dyumnāsāham abhi yodhāna utsam /🔽hariṃ yat te mandinaṃ dukṣan vṛdhe gorabhasam adribhir vātāpyam //
analyzed: aṣṭā mahaḥ divaḥ ādaḥ harī iha dyumnāsāham abhi yodhānaḥ utsam  harim yat te mandinam dukṣan vṛdhe go rabhasam adribhiḥ vātāpyam
translated: Eight great ones, O sky, from the beginning, thy two bay steeds here, for the sake of glory, to the battle-field.🔽When they have pressed for thee the tawny, the gladdening, for increase, the vigorous, the stone-pressed, the wind-quickened.

original: tvam āyasam prati vartayo gor divo aśmānam upanītam ṛbhvā /
analyzed: tvam āyasam prati vartayaḥ goḥ divaḥ aśmānam upanītam ṛbhvā
translated: Thou turnest back the iron one of the cow, the stone of the sky, O mighty one, that is hurled.

original: kutsāya yatra puruhūta vanvañ chuṣṇam anantaiḥ pariyāsi vadhaiḥ //
analyzed: kutsāya yatra puruhūta vanvam śuṣṇam anantaiḥ pariyāsi vadhaiḥ
translated: Where, O thou who art invoked by many, thou didst win for Kutsa, Sûṣṇa, with endless encompassing blows.

original: purā yat sūras tamaso apītes tam adrivaḥ phaligaṃ hetim asya /
analyzed: purā yat sūraḥ tamasaḥ apīteḥ tam adrivas phaligam hetim asya
translated: Before the sun hath gone forth from the darkness, O stone-thrower, thou hast hurled at him the stone.

original: śuṣṇasya cit parihitaṃ yad ojo divas pari sugrathitaṃ tad ādaḥ //🔽anu tvā mahī pājasī acakre dyāvākṣāmā madatām indra karman /
analyzed: śuṣṇasya cit parihitam yat ojaḥ divaḥ pari su grathitam tat ādaḥ  anu tvā mahī pājasī a cakre dyāvākṣāmā madatām indra karman
translated: Thou hast taken away the strength of Sûṣṇa, which was well-bound round the sky.🔽The great earth hath followed thee, O thou who art to be praised, for the sake of the work of Indra, who rejoices in the sky and earth.

original: tvaṃ vṛtram āśayānaṃ sirāsu maho vajreṇa siṣvapo varāhum //
analyzed: tvam vṛtram āśayānam sirāsu mahaḥ u vajreṇa siṣvapaḥ varāhum
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast with the great thunderbolt shaken Vṛtra, who lay in the channels, and the boar.

original: tvam indra naryo yāṃ avo nṝn tiṣṭhā vātasya suyujo vahiṣṭhān /
analyzed: tvam indra naryaḥ yām avaḥ nṝn tiṣṭhāḥ vātasya su yujaḥ vahiṣṭhān
translated: O thou who art to be praised by men, O Indra, stand by those men, the best yoked by the wind.

original: yaṃ te kāvya uśanā mandinaṃ dād vṛtrahaṇam pāryaṃ tatakṣa vajram //
analyzed: yam te kāvyaḥ uśanāḥ mandinam dāt vṛtra haṇam pāryam tatakṣa vajram
translated: The weapon which Kaṇva, Uśanâ, the gladdener, gave thee, the thunderbolt, which fashioneth the foe of Vṛtra.

original: tvaṃ sūro harito rāmayo nṝn bharac cakram etaśo nāyam indra /
analyzed: tvam sūraḥ haritaḥ rāmayaḥ nṝn bharat cakram etaśaḥ na ayam indra
translated: Thou art the Sun, O Indra, to the two bays, and carriest men: this wheel is not a chariot.

original: prāsya pāraṃ navatiṃ nāvyānām api kartam avartayo 'yajyūn //
analyzed: prāsya pāram navatim nāvyānām api kartam avartayaḥ yajyūn
translated: Thou hast turned back the ninety rivers to their source, and broughtest the wicked to their end.

original: tvaṃ no asyā indra durhaṇāyāḥ pāhi vajrivo duritād abhīke /
analyzed: tvam naḥ asyāḥ indra durhaṇāyāḥ pāhi vajrivas duritāt abhīke
translated: Protect us, O Indra, from this evil, O wielder of the thunderbolt, from misfortune in the conflict.

original: pra no vājān rathyo aśvabudhyān iṣe yandhi śravase sūnṛtāyai //🔽mā sā te asmat sumatir vi dasad vājapramahaḥ sam iṣo varanta /
analyzed: pra naḥ vājān rathyaḥ aśva budhyān iṣe yandhi śravase sūnṛtāyai  mā sā te asmat sumatiḥ vi dasat vāja pramahas sam iṣaḥ varanta
translated: Grant us, O thou who movest in beautiful paths, strength that is to be won by horses and chariots, food for the sake of glory and truth.🔽Let not thy favour be far from us, O thou who art most to be worshipped in the winning of strength. Let them bring us food.

original: ā no bhaja maghavan goṣv aryo maṃhiṣṭhās te sadhamādaḥ syāma //
analyzed: ā naḥ bhaja maghavan goṣu aryaḥ maṃhiṣṭhāḥ te sadhamādaḥ syāma
translated: O bountiful one, give us a share in the noble cows. May we be the most liberal at thy feast.

original: pra vaḥ pāntaṃ raghumanyavo 'ndho yajñaṃ rudrāya mīḷhuṣe bharadhvam /
analyzed: pra vaḥ pāntam raghu manyavaḥ ndhaḥ yajñam rudrāya mīḍhuṣe bharadhvam
translated: Bring to the sacrifice for Rudra the bountiful, O ye who are swift to be angry, your own protector.

original: divo astoṣy asurasya vīrair iṣudhyeva maruto rodasyoḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ astoṣi asurasya vīraiḥ iṣudhyā iva marutaḥ rodasyoḥ
translated: With the heroes of the Asura, the lord of heaven, the Maruts, as if for enjoyment, of the two worlds.

original: patnīva pūrvahūtiṃ vāvṛdhadhyā uṣāsānaktā purudhā vidāne /🔽starīr nātkaṃ vyutaṃ vasānā sūryasya śriyā sudṛśī hiraṇyaiḥ //
analyzed: patnī iva pūrva hūtim vāvṛdhadhyai uṣāsānaktā purudhā vidāne  starīḥ nā atkam vyutam vasānā sūryasya śriyā sudṛśī hiraṇyaiḥ
translated: Let Dawn and Night, who know full well, be magnified with the first invocation, as with a wife.🔽The beautiful one, clothed in the cloud, is lovely with the rays of the sun.

original: mamattu naḥ parijmā vasarhā mamattu vāto apāṃ vṛṣaṇvān /
analyzed: mamattu naḥ parijmā vasarhā mamattu vātaḥ apām vṛṣaṇvān
translated: Let the swift one, the lord of the day, rejoice us, let the wind, which is strong with the waters, rejoice us.

original: śiśītam indrāparvatā yuvaṃ nas tan no viśve varivasyantu devāḥ //
analyzed: śiśītam indrāparvatā yuvam naḥ tat naḥ viśve varivasyantu devāḥ
translated: Cool us, O Indra and Parvata, ye two, and may all the Gods be gracious unto us in this.

original: uta tyā me yaśasā śvetanāyai vyantā pāntauśijo huvadhyai /
analyzed: uta tyā me yaśasā śvetanāyai vyantā huvadhyai
translated: And may the two who protect me, with glory, with white light, be invoked by the Uṣija (people).

original: pra vo napātam apāṃ kṛṇudhvam pra mātarā rāspinasyāyoḥ //🔽ā vo ruvaṇyum auśijo huvadhyai ghoṣeva śaṃsam arjunasya naṃśe /
analyzed: pra vaḥ napātam apām kṛṇudhvam pra mātarā rāspinasya āyoḥ  ā vaḥ ruvaṇyum auśijaḥ huvadhyai ghoṣa iva śaṃsam arjunasya naṃśe
translated: Make ye for me the offspring of the waters, the mothers of Râspî.🔽I invoke your roaring one, O Uṣija, as the voice proclaims the share of the brown one.

original: pra vaḥ pūṣṇe dāvana āṃ acchā voceya vasutātim agneḥ //
analyzed: pra vaḥ pūṣṇe dāvane ām acchā voceya vasutātim agneḥ
translated: To you, O Pûshan, the giver, I will go forward, to announce the bounty of Agni.

original: śrutam me mitrāvaruṇā havemota śrutaṃ sadane viśvataḥ sīm /
analyzed: śrutam me mitrāvaruṇā havā imā uta śrutam sadane viśvatas sīm
translated: Heard is my call, O Mitra-Varuṇa, heard in every place in the assembly.

original: śrotu naḥ śroturātiḥ suśrotuḥ sukṣetrā sindhur adbhiḥ //
analyzed: śrotu naḥ śrotu rātiḥ su śrotuḥ su kṣetrā sindhuḥ adbhiḥ
translated: May the bountiful one, the very bountiful one, the good field, the river with the waters, hear us.

original: stuṣe sā vāṃ varuṇa mitra rātir gavāṃ śatā pṛkṣayāmeṣu pajre /
analyzed: stuṣe sā vām varuṇa mitra rātiḥ gavām śatā pṛkṣayāmeṣu pajre
translated: I praise that your favour, O Varuṇa and Mitra, the hundred gifts of kine, O you who have Pûru for your friend.

original: śrutarathe priyarathe dadhānāḥ sadyaḥ puṣṭiṃ nirundhānāso agman //
analyzed: śrutarathe priyarathe dadhānāḥ sadyas puṣṭim nirundhānāsaḥ agman
translated: Possessing the well-known chariot, the dear chariot, they have come, bestowing immediate prosperity.

original: asya stuṣe mahimaghasya rādhaḥ sacā sanema nahuṣaḥ suvīrāḥ /
analyzed: asya stuṣe mahi maghasya rādhaḥ sacā sanema nahuṣaḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: I praise the bounty of him, the very bountiful one. Together with Nahusha may we possess good heroes.

original: jano yaḥ pajrebhyo vājinīvān aśvāvato rathino mahyaṃ sūriḥ //
analyzed: janaḥ yaḥ pajrebhyaḥ vājinīvān aśvāvataḥ rathinaḥ mahyam sūriḥ
translated: The people who, rich in horses, in chariots, in wealth, is my lord for the Pûrus.

original: jano yo mitrāvaruṇāv abhidhrug apo na vāṃ sunoty akṣṇayādhruk /
analyzed: janaḥ yaḥ mitrāvaruṇau abhidruh apaḥ na vām sunoti akṣṇayā adruh
translated: The man who is hostile to Mitra and Varuna, who pours out libations to you crookedly, not straightly,

original: svayaṃ sa yakṣmaṃ hṛdaye ni dhatta āpa yad īṃ hotrābhir ṛtāvā //
analyzed: svayam sa yakṣmam hṛdaye ni dhatte āpa yat īm hotrābhiḥ ṛtāvā
translated: He himself lays down consumption in his heart, if you, O truthful ones, send it with your offerings.

original: sa vrādhato nahuṣo daṃsujūtaḥ śardhastaro narāṃ gūrtaśravāḥ /
analyzed: sa vrādhataḥ nahuṣaḥ daṃsu jūtaḥ śardhastaraḥ narām gūrta śravāḥ
translated: That troop of yours, O Nahusha, is most bountiful, most famous among men, most impetuous.

original: visṛṣṭarātir yāti bāḷhasṛtvā viśvāsu pṛtsu sadam ic chūraḥ //
analyzed: visṛṣṭa rātiḥ yāti bāḷha sṛtvā viśvāsu pṛtsu sadam id śūraḥ
translated: The one who goes with powerful driving, his bounty released, is always a hero in all battles.

original: adha gmantā nahuṣo havaṃ sūreḥ śrotā rājāno amṛtasya mandrāḥ /
analyzed: adha gmantā nahuṣaḥ havam sūreḥ śrota rājānaḥ amṛtasya mandrāḥ
translated: Now let the ten kings of the immortal, the cheerful ones, come to the invocation of the sun.

original: nabhojuvo yan niravasya rādhaḥ praśastaye mahinā rathavate //
analyzed: nabhaḥ juvaḥ yat niravasya rādhaḥ praśastaye mahinā rathavate
translated: When they release their bounty, which is yoked to the clouds, for the praise of the one who has chariots through his greatness.

original: etaṃ śardhaṃ dhāma yasya sūrer ity avocan daśatayasya naṃśe /
analyzed: etam śardham dhāma yasya sūreḥ iti avocan daśatayasya naṃśe
translated: This troop of yours, O sun, which they call the one with ten shares,

original: dyumnāni yeṣu vasutātī rāran viśve sanvantu prabhṛtheṣu vājam //
analyzed: dyumnāni yeṣu vasutātiḥ rāran viśve sanvantu prabhṛtheṣu vājam
translated: In which they rejoice, the bestowers of wealth, may they all win strength in the sacrifices.

original: mandāmahe daśatayasya dhāser dvir yat pañca bibhrato yanty annā /🔽kim iṣṭāśva iṣṭaraśmir eta īśānāsas taruṣa ṛñjate nṝn //
analyzed: mandāmahe daśatayasya dhāseḥ dvis yat pañca bibhrataḥ yanti annā  kim iṣṭa aśvaḥ iṣṭa raśmiḥ ete īśānāsaḥ taruṣe ṛñjate nṝn
translated: We delight in the bounty of the one with ten shares, when the five bearers go twice for food.🔽Why do the ones with desirable horses and desirable reins, the lords, strive for men?

original: hiraṇyakarṇam maṇigrīvam arṇas tan no viśve varivasyantu devāḥ /
analyzed: hiraṇya karṇam maṇi grīvam arṇaḥ tat naḥ viśve varivasyantu devāḥ
translated: The one with golden ears, with a jewel on his neck, the water-one - may all the gods favor us with that.

original: aryo giraḥ sadya ā jagmuṣīr osrāś cākantūbhayeṣv asme //
analyzed: aryaḥ giraḥ sadyas ā jagmuṣīḥ ā usrāḥ cākantu ubhayeṣu asme
translated: Let the noble songs come quickly, and let the dawns be gracious to us both.

original: catvāro mā maśarśārasya śiśvas trayo rājña āyavasasya jiṣṇoḥ /
analyzed: catvāraḥ mā maśarśārasya śiśvaḥ trayaḥ rājñaḥ āyavasasya jiṣṇoḥ
translated: Four are mine, of Maśarśara's son, three of King Āyavasa, the victorious.

original: ratho vām mitrāvaruṇā dīrghāpsāḥ syūmagabhastiḥ sūro nādyaut //
analyzed: rathaḥ vām mitrāvaruṇā dīrgha apsāḥ syūma gabhastiḥ sūraḥ na adyaut
translated: Your chariot, O Mitra and Varuṇa, with long reins, with rays gathered in, shines like the sun today.

original: pṛthū ratho dakṣiṇāyā ayojy ainaṃ devāso amṛtāso asthuḥ /
analyzed: pṛthuḥ rathaḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ ayoji ā enam devāsaḥ amṛtāsaḥ asthuḥ
translated: The chariot is yoked for the southern quarter. The immortal gods have mounted it.

original: kṛṣṇād ud asthād aryā vihāyāś cikitsantī mānuṣāya kṣayāya //🔽pūrvā viśvasmād bhuvanād abodhi jayantī vājam bṛhatī sanutrī /
analyzed: kṛṣṇāt ud asthāt aryā vihāyāḥ cikitsantī mānuṣāya kṣayāya  pūrvā viśvasmāt bhuvanāt abodhi jayantī vājam bṛhatī sanutrī
translated: From the dark one the noble one has arisen, looking on, seeking the abode for human habitation.🔽She has awakened earlier than all beings, the victorious, the powerful, the great, the helper.

original: uccā vy akhyad yuvatiḥ punarbhūr oṣā agan prathamā pūrvahūtau //
analyzed: uccā vi akhyat yuvatiḥ punarbhūḥ ā uṣāḥ agan prathamā pūrva hūtau
translated: The young woman has risen up again, the dawn has come, first to be invoked in the morning.

original: yad adya bhāgaṃ vibhajāsi nṛbhya uṣo devi martyatrā sujāte /
analyzed: yat adya bhāgam vibhajāsi nṛbhyaḥ uṣaḥ devi martyatrā sujāte
translated: O dawn, O goddess, well-born, when you distribute today's portion among men in the mortal world,

original: devo no atra savitā damūnā anāgaso vocati sūryāya //🔽gṛhaṃgṛham ahanā yāty acchā divedive adhi nāmā dadhānā /
analyzed: devaḥ naḥ atra savitā damūnāḥ anāgasaḥ vocati sūryāya  gṛhaṃgṛham ahanā yāti acchā dive dive adhi nāmā dadhānā
translated: May the god Savitar, the kindly one, declare us free from guilt to the sun.🔽Day by day she goes to every house, bestowing names,

original: siṣāsantī dyotanā śaśvad āgād agramagram id bhajate vasūnām //
analyzed: siṣāsantī dyotanā śaśvat āgāt agram agram id bhajate vasūnām
translated: Seeking, shining, she comes always to the foremost, she obtains the foremost of treasures.

original: bhagasya svasā varuṇasya jāmir uṣaḥ sūnṛte prathamā jarasva /
analyzed: bhagasya svasā varuṇasya jāmiḥ uṣaḥ sūnṛte prathamā jarasva
translated: Sister of Bhaga, kinswoman of Varuna, O Dawn, be thou most bountiful and first to prosper us.

original: paścā sa daghyā yo aghasya dhātā jayema taṃ dakṣiṇayā rathena //🔽ud īratāṃ sūnṛtā ut purandhīr ud agnayaḥ śuśucānāso asthuḥ /
analyzed: paścā sa daghyāḥ yaḥ aghasya dhātā jayema tam dakṣiṇayā rathena  ud īratām sūnṛtāḥ ud purandhīḥ ud agnayaḥ śuśucānāsaḥ asthuḥ
translated: Let him be last who hath the thought of evil: with our right-handed car let us subdue him.🔽Let the delights, the thoughts of men arise, and let the fires be kindled, shining brightly.

original: spārhā vasūni tamasāpagūḷhāviṣ kṛṇvanty uṣaso vibhātīḥ //🔽apānyad ety abhy anyad eti viṣurūpe ahanī saṃ carete /
analyzed: spārhā vasūni tamasā apagūḍhā āvis kṛṇvanti uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ  apa anyat eti abhi anyat eti viṣurūpe ahanī sam carete
translated: The lovely treasures which the darkness veils, the Dawns reveal them as they shine in splendour.🔽One day goes downward, one comes up again: the two unlike in form move round about us.

original: parikṣitos tamo anyā guhākar adyaud uṣāḥ śośucatā rathena //
analyzed: parikṣitoḥ tamaḥ anyā guhā akaḥ adyaut uṣāḥ śośucatā rathena
translated: The one is hidden in the compass of the sky, the other shines with splendour on her car.

original: sadṛśīr adya sadṛśīr id u śvo dīrghaṃ sacante varuṇasya dhāma /
analyzed: sadṛśīḥ adya sadṛśīḥ id u śvas dīrgham sacante varuṇasya dhāma
translated: Like unto these of yesterday are those of to-day, and those of to-morrow: they attend on Varuṇa's far-extended sway.

original: anavadyās triṃśataṃ yojanāny ekaikā kratum pari yanti sadyaḥ //
analyzed: anavadyāḥ triṃśatam yojanāni ekaikā kratum pari yanti sadyas
translated: Blameless, each one a hundred leagues in breadth, they all at once go round about the sacrifice.

original: jānaty ahnaḥ prathamasya nāma śukrā kṛṣṇād ajaniṣṭa śvitīcī /
analyzed: jānatī ahnaḥ prathamasya nāma śukrā kṛṣṇāt ajaniṣṭa śvitīcī
translated: She knoweth the first day's name: from out the dark the bright and radiant One hath sprung to life.

original: ṛtasya yoṣā na mināti dhāmāharahar niṣkṛtam ācarantī //
analyzed: ṛtasya yoṣā na mināti dhāma ahar ahar niṣkṛtam ācarantī
translated: The Lady of eternal Law transgresseth not the bounds of heaven, but moves each day in ordered course.

original: kanyeva tanvā śāśadānāṃ eṣi devi devam iyakṣamāṇam /
analyzed: kanyā iva tanvā śāśadānā ām eṣi devi devam iyakṣamāṇam
translated: Like a young maiden, thou, O Goddess, goest forth to meet the God who longs for thee.

original: saṃsmayamānā yuvatiḥ purastād āvir vakṣāṃsi kṛṇuṣe vibhātī //
analyzed: saṃsmayamānā yuvatiḥ purastāt āvis vakṣāṃsi kṛṇuṣe vibhātī
translated: The young woman, remembering, shines forth in front, making her radiant forms manifest.

original: susaṃkāśā mātṛmṛṣṭeva yoṣāvis tanvaṃ kṛṇuṣe dṛśe kam /
analyzed: su saṃkāśā mātṛ mṛṣṭā iva yoṣā āvis tanvam kṛṇuṣe dṛśe kam
translated: Well-formed, like a woman adorned by her mother, you make your body visible to someone.

original: bhadrā tvam uṣo vitaraṃ vy uccha na tat te anyā uṣaso naśanta //
analyzed: bhadrā tvam uṣaḥ vitaram vi uccha na tat te anyāḥ uṣasaḥ naśanta
translated: You, O Ushas, are auspicious, shining forth your expanse. No other dawn can surpass that of yours.

original: aśvāvatīr gomatīr viśvavārā yatamānā raśmibhiḥ sūryasya /
analyzed: aśvāvatīḥ gomatīḥ viśva vārāḥ yatamānāḥ raśmibhiḥ sūryasya
translated: Rich in horses, rich in cattle, granting all boons, striving with the rays of the sun,

original: parā ca yanti punar ā ca yanti bhadrā nāma vahamānā uṣāsaḥ //🔽ṛtasya raśmim anuyacchamānā bhadrambhadraṃ kratum asmāsu dhehi /
analyzed: parā ca yanti punar ā ca yanti bhadrā nāma vahamānāḥ uṣāsaḥ  ṛtasya raśmim anuyacchamānā bhadram bhadram kratum asmāsu dhehi
translated: They go away and come back again, the dawns bearing auspicious names.🔽Following the ray of truth, bestow upon us ever better and better resolve.

original: uṣo no adya suhavā vy ucchāsmāsu rāyo maghavatsu ca syuḥ //
analyzed: uṣaḥ naḥ adya su havā vi uccha asmāsu rāyaḥ maghavatsu ca syuḥ
translated: O Ushas, most invoked, shine forth for us today. Let there be riches among us and among the wealthy.

original: uṣā ucchantī samidhāne agnā udyan sūrya urviyā jyotir aśret /
analyzed: uṣāḥ ucchantī samidhāne agnau udyan sūryaḥ urviyā jyotiḥ aśret
translated: As Ushas shines, kindling the fire, the rising sun with its vast light shines forth.

original: devo no atra savitā nv artham prāsāvīd dvipat pra catuṣpad ityai //
analyzed: devaḥ naḥ atra savitā nu artham prāsāvīt dvipad pra catuṣpad ityai
translated: May the god Savitar here bestow upon us the object, for the sake of bipeds and quadrupeds.

original: aminatī daivyāni vratāni praminatī manuṣyā yugāni /
analyzed: a minatī daivyāni vratāni praminatī manuṣyā yugāni
translated: Surpassing the divine ordinances, surpassing the human ages,

original: īyuṣīṇām upamā śaśvatīnām āyatīnām prathamoṣā vy adyaut //
analyzed: īyuṣīṇām upamā śaśvatīnām āyatīnām prathamā uṣāḥ vi adyaut
translated: Of the ever-present, the past, the present, the future dawns, the first dawn shines forth.

original: eṣā divo duhitā praty adarśi jyotir vasānā samanā purastāt /🔽ṛtasya panthām anv eti sādhu prajānatīva na diśo mināti //
analyzed: eṣā divaḥ duhitā prati adarśi jyotiḥ vasānā samanā purastāt  ṛtasya panthām anu eti sādhu prajānatī iva na diśaḥ mināti
translated: This is the Daughter of the Sky, she hath appeared, clad in light, the same as of old, in front.🔽She followeth the path of holy Order aright, and like one knowing well she never errs in the directions.

original: upo adarśi śundhyuvo na vakṣo nodhā ivāvir akṛta priyāṇi /
analyzed: upa u adarśi śundhyuvaḥ na vakṣaḥ nodhāḥ iva āvis akṛta priyāṇi
translated: She hath appeared like a young girl's bosom, like a bride, making dear things manifest.

original: admasan na sasato bodhayantī śaśvattamāgāt punar eyuṣīṇām //
analyzed: admasad na sasataḥ bodhayantī śaśvattamā agāt punar eyuṣīṇām
translated: She, who awaketh the sleeping, the living, hath come again, the best of those who come.

original: pūrve ardhe rajaso aptyasya gavāṃ janitry akṛta pra ketum /
analyzed: pūrve ardhe rajasaḥ aptyasya gavām janitrī akṛta pra ketum
translated: In the eastern half of the region of the waters she hath made the sign of the birth of the cows.

original: vy u prathate vitaraṃ varīya obhā pṛṇantī pitror upasthā //
analyzed: vi u prathate vitaram varīyaḥ ā ubhā pṛṇantī pitroḥ upasthā
translated: She spreadeth out the wide extended region, filling the two worlds, the place of the parents.

original: eved eṣā purutamā dṛśe kaṃ nājāmiṃ na pari vṛṇakti jāmim /
analyzed: eva id eṣā purutamā dṛśe kam na ajāmim na pari vṛṇakti jāmim
translated: Even this one, most ancient, seeketh some one to look upon, and chooseth not a sister for a brother.

original: arepasā tanvā śāśadānā nārbhād īṣate na maho vibhātī //🔽abhrāteva puṃsa eti pratīcī gartārug iva sanaye dhanānām /🔽jāyeva patya uśatī suvāsā uṣā hasreva ni riṇīte apsaḥ //
analyzed: arepasā tanvā śāśadānā nā arbhāt īṣate na mahaḥ vibhātī  abhrātā iva puṃsaḥ eti pratīcī gartāruh iva sanaye dhanānām  jāyā iva patye uśatī su vāsāḥ uṣāḥ hasrā iva ni riṇīte apsaḥ
translated: With a body free from wrinkles, shining, she goeth not to the young man, nor to the great one.🔽She cometh like a brotherless girl to the man, like a woman of the pit to win the wealth.🔽Like a wife, eager for her husband, in fair raiment, like a maid with a hundred wiles, Dawn winneth the waters.

original: svasā svasre jyāyasyai yonim āraig apaity asyāḥ praticakṣyeva /
analyzed: svasā svasre jyāyasyai yonim āraik apaiti asyāḥ praticakṣya iva
translated: The sister to the elder sister's womb goeth, as it were, to her own place, as it were, to her own face.

original: vyucchantī raśmibhiḥ sūryasyāñjy aṅkte samanagā iva vrāḥ //
analyzed: vyucchantī raśmibhiḥ sūryasya añji aṅkte samana gā iva vrāḥ
translated: She shines with the rays of the sun, like a flock of birds with their leader.

original: āsām pūrvāsām ahasu svasṝṇām aparā pūrvām abhy eti paścāt /🔽tāḥ pratnavan navyasīr nūnam asme revad ucchantu sudinā uṣāsaḥ //
analyzed: āsām pūrvāsām svasṝṇām aparā pūrvām abhī eti paścāt  tāḥ pratna vat navyasīḥ nūnam asme revat ucchantu su dināḥ uṣāsaḥ
translated: Of these, her elder sisters, the later one approaches the earlier one,🔽May they shine for us now, the new dawns, as of old, bringing wealth, with fair days.

original: pra bodhayoṣaḥ pṛṇato maghony abudhyamānāḥ paṇayaḥ sasantu /🔽revad uccha maghavadbhyo maghoni revat stotre sūnṛte jārayantī //🔽aveyam aśvaid yuvatiḥ purastād yuṅkte gavām aruṇānām anīkam /
analyzed: pra bodhaya uṣaḥ pṛṇataḥ maghoni a budhyamānāḥ paṇayaḥ sasantu  revat uccha maghavadbhyaḥ maghoni revat stotre sūnṛte jārayantī  ava iyam aśvait yuvatiḥ purastāt yuṅkte gavām aruṇānām anīkam
translated: Awake, O Dawn, the bountiful ones, the wealthy ones; let the niggards lie asleep.🔽Shine wealth on the wealthy ones, O Dawn, wealth on the singer, O thou who givest joy.🔽This young Dawn, the courser's mate, hath risen in front, and yoked the team of ruddy steeds.

original: vi nūnam ucchād asati pra ketur gṛhaṃgṛham upa tiṣṭhāte agniḥ //
analyzed: vi nūnam ucchāt asati pra ketuḥ gṛhaṃgṛham upa tiṣṭhāte agniḥ
translated: Now will she surely rise, the light of heaven: Agni is present in each house.

original: ut te vayaś cid vasater apaptan naraś ca ye pitubhājo vyuṣṭau /
analyzed: ud te vayaḥ cit vasateḥ apaptan naraḥ ca ye pitu bhājaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: Thy birds have flown up from thy resting-place, and the men who share the father's gifts at early morn.

original: amā sate vahasi bhūri vāmam uṣo devi dāśuṣe martyāya //🔽astoḍhvaṃ stomyā brahmaṇā me 'vīvṛdhadhvam uśatīr uṣāsaḥ /
analyzed: amā sate vahasi bhūri vāmam uṣaḥ devi dāśuṣe martyāya  astoḍhvam stomyāḥ brahmaṇā me vīvṛdhadhvam uśatīḥ uṣāsaḥ
translated: To him who worships thou bringest much good, O Dawn, O Goddess, to the mortal worshipper.🔽Ye are to be praised, to be lauded with prayer: ye have increased, ye loving Dawns.

original: yuṣmākaṃ devīr avasā sanema sahasriṇaṃ ca śatinaṃ ca vājam //
analyzed: yuṣmākam devīḥ avasā sanema sahasriṇam ca śatinam ca vājam
translated: By your assistance, O ye Goddesses, may we win a thousandfold and hundredfold strength.

original: prātā ratnam prātaritvā dadhāti taṃ cikitvān pratigṛhyā ni dhatte /
analyzed: prātar ratnam prātaritvā dadhāti tam cikitvān pratigṛhya ni dhatte
translated: He who gives a gift in the morning obtains a treasure in the morning. The wise one, having accepted it, places it.

original: tena prajāṃ vardhayamāna āyū rāyas poṣeṇa sacate suvīraḥ //
analyzed: tena prajām vardhayamānaḥ āyuḥ rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sacate su vīraḥ
translated: With that he prospers in offspring, in life, and is united with prosperity in wealth and good heroes.

original: sugur asat suhiraṇyaḥ svaśvo bṛhad asmai vaya indro dadhāti /
analyzed: suguḥ asat su hiraṇyaḥ su aśvaḥ bṛhat asmai vayaḥ indraḥ dadhāti
translated: He becomes easy to yoke, rich in good horses and gold. Indra bestows great strength upon him.

original: yas tvāyantaṃ vasunā prātaritvo mukṣījayeva padim utsināti //
analyzed: yaḥ tvāyantam vasunā prātaritvaḥ mukṣī jayā iva padim utsināti
translated: He who, having come to him in the morning with wealth, drives him away like one who has lost his chariot.

original: āyam adya sukṛtam prātar icchann iṣṭeḥ putraṃ vasumatā rathena /🔽aṃśoḥ sutam pāyaya matsarasya kṣayadvīraṃ vardhaya sūnṛtābhiḥ //🔽upa kṣaranti sindhavo mayobhuva ījānaṃ ca yakṣyamāṇaṃ ca dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: ā ayam adya su kṛtam prātar icchan iṣṭeḥ putram vasumatā rathena  aṃśoḥ sutam pāyaya matsarasya kṣayadvīram vardhaya sūnṛtābhiḥ  upa kṣaranti sindhavaḥ mayobhuvaḥ ījānam ca yakṣyamāṇam ca dhenavaḥ
translated: Desiring the well-done, he comes in the morning, the son of sacrifice, on a wealth-laden chariot.🔽Make the son of Amsu drink the intoxicating drink, increase the hero-destroying one with pleasant words.🔽The blissful rivers flow to the sacrificer and the one who will sacrifice, the cows.

original: pṛṇantaṃ ca papuriṃ ca śravasyavo ghṛtasya dhārā upa yanti viśvataḥ //
analyzed: pṛṇantam ca papurim ca śravasyavaḥ ghṛtasya dhārāḥ upa yanti viśvatas
translated: The bountiful ones, the famous ones, the full ones, the ones who fill, the streams of ghee flow to him from all sides.

original: nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi tiṣṭhati śrito yaḥ pṛṇāti sa ha deveṣu gacchati /
analyzed: nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi tiṣṭhati śritaḥ yaḥ pṛṇāti sa ha deveṣu gacchati
translated: He who stands on the back of the vault, supported, and makes offerings, he goes to the gods.

original: tasmā āpo ghṛtam arṣanti sindhavas tasmā iyaṃ dakṣiṇā pinvate sadā //
analyzed: tasmai āpaḥ ghṛtam arṣanti sindhavaḥ tasmai iyam dakṣiṇā pinvate sadā
translated: From him the waters, the ghee, flow, the rivers. From him this sacrificial fee always swells.

original: dakṣiṇāvatām id imāni citrā dakṣiṇāvatāṃ divi sūryāsaḥ /
analyzed: dakṣiṇāvatām id imāni citrā dakṣiṇāvatām divi sūryāsaḥ
translated: These wondrous gifts are for the liberal giver: in heaven the liberal giver's suns are shining.

original: dakṣiṇāvanto amṛtam bhajante dakṣiṇāvantaḥ pra tiranta āyuḥ //
analyzed: dakṣiṇāvantaḥ amṛtam bhajante dakṣiṇāvantaḥ pra tirante āyuḥ
translated: The liberal giver wins immortal life, and lengthens out his days.

original: mā pṛṇanto duritam ena āran mā jāriṣuḥ sūrayaḥ suvratāsaḥ /
analyzed: mā pṛṇantaḥ duritam enaḥ āran mā jāriṣuḥ sūrayaḥ su vratāsaḥ
translated: Let not the liberal princes suffer harm, nor those who keep good statutes die before their time.

original: anyas teṣām paridhir astu kaś cid apṛṇantam abhi saṃ yantu śokāḥ //🔽amandān stomān pra bhare manīṣā sindhāv adhi kṣiyato bhāvyasya /🔽yo me sahasram amimīta savān atūrto rājā śrava icchamānaḥ //
analyzed: anyaḥ teṣām paridhiḥ astu kaḥ cit a pṛṇantam abhi sam yantu śokāḥ  amandān stomān pra bhare manīṣā sindhau adhi kṣiyataḥ bhāvyasya  yaḥ me sahasram amimīta savān a tūrtaḥ rājā śravaḥ icchamānaḥ
translated: Let some other be their barrier who give not: let griefs fall on the niggard.🔽I bring the measured hymns to the two rivers, to the two who are the source of all that is.🔽The King who measured out a thousand libations for me, the King who never turns aside, who longs for glory.

original: śataṃ rājño nādhamānasya niṣkāñ chatam aśvān prayatān sadya ādam /
analyzed: śatam rājñaḥ nādhamānasya niṣkām śatam aśvān prayatān sadyas ādam
translated: A hundred neck-chains of the king who bends his bow, a hundred well-harnessed horses hath he gained at once.

original: śataṃ kakṣīvāṃ asurasya gonāṃ divi śravo 'jaram ā tatāna //
analyzed: śatam kakṣīvān asurasya gonām divi śravaḥ jaram ā tatāna
translated: A hundred of Kakshîvân's Asura kine hath he spread out to fame in heaven that knows no age.

original: upa mā śyāvāḥ svanayena dattā vadhūmanto daśa rathāso asthuḥ /
analyzed: upa mā śyāvāḥ svanayena dattāḥ vadhūmantaḥ daśa rathāsaḥ asthuḥ
translated: Ten chariots with their teams have come to me, given by the black steeds with their neighing sound.

original: ṣaṣṭiḥ sahasram anu gavyam āgāt sanat kakṣīvāṃ abhipitve ahnām //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ sahasram anu gavyam āgāt sanat kakṣīvān abhipitve ahnām
translated: Sixty thousand kine have followed after him, Kakshîvân, when he went to visit the kings.

original: catvāriṃśad daśarathasya śoṇāḥ sahasrasyāgre śreṇiṃ nayanti /
analyzed: catvāriṃśat daśa rathasya śoṇāḥ sahasrasya agre śreṇim nayanti
translated: The forty steeds of Dasha-ratha lead the way before the thousand, as a row of cars.

original: madacyutaḥ kṛśanāvato atyān kakṣīvanta ud amṛkṣanta pajrāḥ //
analyzed: mada cyutaḥ kṛśanāvataḥ atyān kakṣīvantaḥ ud amṛkṣanta pajrāḥ
translated: The sons of Kakshivat, the sons of Pajra, have won the horses of the swift one, the one who drips with joy.

original: pūrvām anu prayatim ā dade vas trīn yuktāṃ aṣṭāv aridhāyaso gāḥ /
analyzed: pūrvām anu prayatim ā dade vaḥ trīn yuktām aṣṭau ari dhāyasaḥ gāḥ
translated: I have accepted your earlier offering, three yoked oxen, eight ploughs,

original: subandhavo ye viśyā iva vrā anasvantaḥ śrava aiṣanta pajrāḥ //
analyzed: su bandhavaḥ ye viśyāḥ iva vrāḥ anasvantaḥ śravaḥ aiṣanta pajrāḥ
translated: The well-bound ones, like a flock of birds, the sons of Pajra, seeking fame with their ploughs.

original: āgadhitā parigadhitā yā kaśīkeva jaṅgahe /
analyzed: āgadhitā parigadhitā yā kaśīkā iva jaṅgahe
translated: The one who is pressed down and surrounded, who is like a lump of flesh in the stomach,

original: dadāti mahyaṃ yādurī yāśūnām bhojyā śatā //
analyzed: dadāti mahyam yādurī yāśūnām bhojyā śatā
translated: The one from Yadu gives me a hundred sheep to be slaughtered, to be enjoyed.

original: upopa me parā mṛśa mā me dabhrāṇi manyathāḥ /
analyzed: upa upa me parā mṛśa mā me dabhrāṇi manyathāḥ
translated: Come to me, touch me, do not think of me as a stranger.

original: sarvāham asmi romaśā gandhārīṇām ivāvikā //
analyzed: sarvā aham asmi romaśā gandhārīṇām iva avikā
translated: I am all hairy, like a sheep of the Gandhari tribe.

original: agniṃ hotāram manye dāsvantaṃ vasuṃ sūnuṃ sahaso jātavedasaṃ vipraṃ na jātavedasam /
analyzed: agnim hotāram manye dāsvantam vasum sūnum sahasaḥ jātavedasam vipram na jātavedasam
translated: I regard Agni as the priest, the bountiful, the good son of strength, the all-knowing god, the sage, the all-knowing god.

original: ya ūrdhvayā svadhvaro devo devācyā kṛpā /
analyzed: yaḥ ūrdhvayā su adhvaraḥ devaḥ devācyā kṛpā
translated: The god who with his upward course, who with his godlike glance,

original: ghṛtasya vibhrāṣṭim anu vaṣṭi śociṣājuhvānasya sarpiṣaḥ //
analyzed: ghṛtasya vibhrāṣṭim anu vaṣṭi śociṣā ājuhvānasya sarpiṣaḥ
translated: With his flame he looks along the spreading of the ghee, of the invited ghee.

original: yajiṣṭhaṃ tvā yajamānā huvema jyeṣṭham aṅgirasāṃ vipra manmabhir viprebhiḥ śukra manmabhiḥ /
analyzed: yajiṣṭham tvā yajamānāḥ huvema jyeṣṭham aṅgirasām vipra manmabhiḥ viprebhiḥ śukra manmabhiḥ
translated: We invoke you as the best priest, O you who are to be sacrificed to, the best of the Angirases, O sage, with our thoughts, with the pure thoughts of the sages.

original: parijmānam iva dyāṃ hotāraṃ carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: parijmānam iva dyām hotāram carṣaṇīnām
translated: The priest of men, who shines like the sky,

original: śociṣkeśaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ yam imā viśaḥ prāvantu jūtaye viśaḥ //
analyzed: śociṣkeśam vṛṣaṇam yam imāḥ viśaḥ prāvantu jūtaye viśaḥ
translated: Him whose hair is flame, the mighty one, whom these people have delighted for the race, for the race.

original: sa hi purū cid ojasā virukmatā dīdyāno bhavati druhantaraḥ paraśur na druhantaraḥ /
analyzed: sa hi purū cit ojasā virukmatā dīdyānaḥ bhavati druhantaraḥ paraśuḥ na druhantaraḥ
translated: For he, even many, with his might, with his splendour, shines forth, more terrible, more terrible than an axe.

original: vīḷu cid yasya samṛtau śruvad vaneva yat sthiram /
analyzed: vīḍu cit yasya samṛtau śruvat vanā iva yat sthiram
translated: Even the firm wood which he has in his mouth creaks, as if in a forest, when it is shaken.

original: niḥṣahamāṇo yamate nāyate dhanvāsahā nāyate //
analyzed: niḥṣahamāṇaḥ yamate nāyate dhanvāsahāḥ nāyate
translated: Overcoming, he rules, he leads, he leads the bowmen to victory.

original: dṛḷhā cid asmā anu dur yathā vide tejiṣṭhābhir araṇibhir dāṣṭy avase 'gnaye dāṣṭy avase /
analyzed: dṛḍhā cit asmai anu duḥ yathā vide tejiṣṭhābhiḥ araṇibhiḥ dāṣṭī avase gnaye dāṣṭī avase
translated: Even the firm ones he makes to tremble, that he may find them, with his sharpest sparks, to win him help, to win him help for Agni.

original: pra yaḥ purūṇi gāhate takṣad vaneva śociṣā /
analyzed: pra yaḥ purūṇi gāhate takṣat vanā iva śociṣā
translated: He who penetrates many strongholds, as if with a forest, with his flame,

original: sthirā cid annā ni riṇāty ojasā ni sthirāṇi cid ojasā //
analyzed: sthirā cit annā ni riṇāti ojasā ni sthirāṇi cit ojasā
translated: Even the firm food he cuts through with his might, even the firm ones with his might.

original: tam asya pṛkṣam uparāsu dhīmahi naktaṃ yaḥ sudarśataro divātarād aprāyuṣe divātarāt /
analyzed: tam asya pṛkṣam uparāsu dhīmahi naktam yaḥ sudarśataraḥ divā tarāt a prāyuṣe divā tarāt
translated: We will think of his food in the lower (regions), he who is more beautiful by night than by day, for one who has not attained life, than by day.

original: ād asyāyur grabhaṇavad vīḷu śarma na sūnave /
analyzed: āt asya āyuḥ grabhaṇavat vīḷu śarma na sūnave
translated: His life-giving protection, like a strong rope, is a refuge for his son.

original: bhaktam abhaktam avo vyanto ajarā agnayo vyanto ajarāḥ //🔽sa hi śardho na mārutaṃ tuviṣvaṇir apnasvatīṣūrvarāsv iṣṭanir ārtanāsv iṣṭaniḥ /
analyzed: bhaktam a bhaktam avaḥ vyantaḥ ajarāḥ agnayaḥ vyantaḥ ajarāḥ 🔽sa hi śardhaḥ na mārutam tuviṣvaṇiḥ apnasvatīṣu urvarāsu iṣṭaniḥ ārtanāsu iṣṭaniḥ
translated: The unfed and the fed have passed away, the ageless fires have passed away.🔽For he is like the Marut host, very mighty, in the fruitful fields which are to be tilled, in the afflicted ones which are to be tilled.

original: ādad dhavyāny ādadir yajñasya ketur arhaṇā /
analyzed: ādat havyāni ādadiḥ yajñasya ketuḥ arhaṇā
translated: He takes the offerings, he takes the signs of the sacrifice, he is worthy of worship.

original: adha smāsya harṣato hṛṣīvato viśve juṣanta panthāṃ naraḥ śubhe na panthām //
analyzed: adha sma asya harṣataḥ hṛṣīvataḥ viśve juṣanta panthām naraḥ śubhe na panthām
translated: Now all men delight in his path, in the auspicious path, as in the auspicious path, he who rejoices in joy.

original: dvitā yad īṃ kīstāso abhidyavo namasyanta upavocanta bhṛgavo mathnanto dāśā bhṛgavaḥ /
analyzed: dvitā yat īm kīstāsaḥ abhidyavaḥ namasyantaḥ upavocanta bhṛgavaḥ mathnantaḥ dāśāḥ bhṛgavaḥ
translated: When the two-horsed, the pressing stones, the irresistible, the Bhrgus, worshipping, have spoken to him, the Bhrgus, grinding the Dâsas,

original: agnir īśe vasūnāṃ śucir yo dharṇir eṣām /
analyzed: agniḥ īśe vasūnām śuciḥ yaḥ dharṇiḥ eṣām
translated: Agni is the lord of the Vasus, the pure one of them, the supporter.

original: priyāṃ apidhīṃr vaniṣīṣṭa medhira ā vaniṣīṣṭa medhiraḥ //
analyzed: priyān apidhīṃr vaniṣīṣṭa medhiraḥ ā vaniṣīṣṭa medhiraḥ
translated: May he, the wise one, delight in the dear oblations, may he, the wise one, delight in the oblations.

original: viśvāsāṃ tvā viśām patiṃ havāmahe sarvāsāṃ samānaṃ dampatim bhuje satyagirvāhasam bhuje /
analyzed: viśvāsām tvā viśām patim havāmahe sarvāsām samānam dampatim bhuje satya gir vāhasam bhuje
translated: We call thee the lord of all the people, the common lord of all the people, to enjoy, the bearer of true hymns, to enjoy.

original: atithim mānuṣāṇām pitur na yasyāsayā /
analyzed: atithim mānuṣāṇām pituḥ na yasya āsayā
translated: The guest of men, whose dwelling is the father's house,

original: amī ca viśve amṛtāsa ā vayo havyā deveṣv ā vayaḥ //
analyzed: amī ca viśve amṛtāsaḥ ā vayaḥ havyā deveṣu ā vayaḥ
translated: And all these immortal ones, the birds, the oblations, the strength, among the gods, the strength.

original: tvam agne sahasā sahantamaḥ śuṣmintamo jāyase devatātaye rayir na devatātaye /
analyzed: tvam agne sahasā sahantamaḥ śuṣmintamaḥ jāyase devatātaye rayiḥ na devatātaye
translated: Thou, O Agni, art born most mighty, most powerful, for the service of the gods, as wealth for the service of the gods.

original: śuṣmintamo hi te mado dyumnintama uta kratuḥ /
analyzed: śuṣmintamaḥ hi te madaḥ dyumnintamaḥ uta kratuḥ
translated: For thy joy is most powerful, thy wisdom most glorious.

original: adha smā te pari caranty ajara śruṣṭīvāno nājara //
analyzed: adha smā te pari caranti ajara śruṣṭīvānaḥ na ajara
translated: Therefore they ever attend on thee, O undecaying one, obedient, as on the undecaying one.

original: pra vo mahe sahasā sahasvata uṣarbudhe paśuṣe nāgnaye stomo babhūtv agnaye /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe sahasā sahasvate uṣarbudhe paśuṣe na agnaye stomaḥ babhūtu agnaye
translated: For you, O mighty one, who are to be invoked at dawn, for the sake of cattle, let the praise be for Agni.

original: prati yad īṃ haviṣmān viśvāsu kṣāsu joguve /
analyzed: prati yat īm haviṣmān viśvāsu kṣāsu joguve
translated: When he, the one who offers oblations, is invoked in all the assemblies,

original: agre rebho na jarata ṛṣūṇāṃ jūrṇir hota ṛṣūṇām //
analyzed: agre rebhaḥ na jarate ṛṣūṇām jūrṇiḥ hotar ṛṣūṇām
translated: The singer, like the oldest of the strong ones, the priest, the oldest of the strong ones.

original: sa no nediṣṭhaṃ dadṛśāna ā bharāgne devebhiḥ sacanāḥ sucetunā maho rāyaḥ sucetunā /
analyzed: sa naḥ nediṣṭham dadṛśānaḥ ā bhara agne devebhiḥ sacanāḥ sucetunā mahaḥ rāyaḥ sucetunā
translated: He, most near to us, may be seen, bring (us), O Agni, in accord with the gods, by good choice, great riches, by good choice.

original: mahi śaviṣṭha nas kṛdhi saṃcakṣe bhuje asyai /
analyzed: mahi śaviṣṭha naḥ kṛdhi saṃcakṣe bhuje asyai
translated: Make us great, O most powerful one, to enjoy this (earth).

original: mahi stotṛbhyo maghavan suvīryam mathīr ugro na śavasā //
analyzed: mahi stotṛbhyaḥ maghavan su vīryam mathīḥ ugraḥ na śavasā
translated: O bountiful one, give to the praisers great heroism, the strong one by his power.

original: ayaṃ jāyata manuṣo dharīmaṇi hotā yajiṣṭha uśijām anu vratam agniḥ svam anu vratam /
analyzed: ayam jāyata manuṣaḥ dharīmaṇi hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ uśijām anu vratam agniḥ svam anu vratam
translated: This one is born among men, the supporter, the priest, most worthy of sacrifice, according to the rule of the skilful ones, Agni according to his own rule.

original: viśvaśruṣṭiḥ sakhīyate rayir iva śravasyate /
analyzed: viśva śruṣṭiḥ sakhīyate rayiḥ iva śravasyate
translated: He, the all-hearing one, is sought as a friend, like wealth, he is sought for glory.

original: adabdho hotā ni ṣadad iḷas pade parivīta iḷas pade //
analyzed: adabdhaḥ hotā ni sadat iḷaḥ pade parivītaḥ iḷaḥ pade
translated: The undeceiving priest has sat down in the place of the altar, surrounded in the place of the altar.

original: taṃ yajñasādham api vātayāmasy ṛtasya pathā namasā haviṣmatā devatātā haviṣmatā /
analyzed: tam yajñasādham api vātayāmasi ṛtasya pathā namasā haviṣmatā devatātā haviṣmatā
translated: We invite him, the fulfiller of sacrifice, along the path of truth, with reverence, with oblations, with the gods, with oblations.

original: sa na ūrjām upābhṛty ayā kṛpā na jūryati /
analyzed: sa naḥ ūrjām upābhṛtī ayā kṛpā na jūryati
translated: He, having brought us nourishment, his grace does not grow old.

original: yam mātariśvā manave parāvato devam bhāḥ parāvataḥ //
analyzed: yam mātariśvā manave parāvataḥ devam bhāḥ parāvataḥ
translated: Whom Mātariśvan brought from afar to Manu, the god, the light, from afar.

original: evena sadyaḥ pary eti pārthivam muhurgī reto vṛṣabhaḥ kanikradad dadhad retaḥ kanikradat /
analyzed: evena sadyas pari eti pārthivam muhur gir retaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ kanikradat dadhat retaḥ kanikradat
translated: With his own strength he quickly goes around the earthly one, the bull, the hummer, bearing seed, the hummer,

original: śataṃ cakṣāṇo akṣabhir devo vaneṣu turvaṇiḥ /
analyzed: śatam cakṣāṇaḥ akṣabhiḥ devaḥ vaneṣu turvaṇiḥ
translated: looking with a hundred eyes, the god, in the woods, seeking his own.

original: sado dadhāna upareṣu sānuṣv agniḥ pareṣu sānuṣu //
analyzed: sadaḥ dadhānaḥ upareṣu sānuṣu agniḥ pareṣu sānuṣu
translated: Placing his seat on the lower heights, Agni on the higher heights.

original: sa sukratuḥ purohito damedame 'gnir yajñasyādhvarasya cetati kratvā yajñasya cetati /
analyzed: sa su kratuḥ purohitaḥ damedame gniḥ yajñasya adhvarasya cetati kratvā yajñasya cetati
translated: He, the wise one, the priest, in every house, Agni, knows the sacrifice and the rite. He knows the sacrifice with his wisdom.

original: kratvā vedhā iṣūyate viśvā jātāni paspaśe /🔽yato ghṛtaśrīr atithir ajāyata vahnir vedhā ajāyata //
analyzed: kratvā vedhāḥ iṣūyate viśvā jātāni paspaśe  yatas ghṛtaśrīḥ atithiḥ ajāyata vahniḥ vedhāḥ ajāyata
translated: With his wisdom the finder is sent forth, he looks on all beings.🔽From whom the guest, rich in ghee, is born, the finder, the carrier, is born.

original: kratvā yad asya taviṣīṣu pṛñcate 'gner aveṇa marutāṃ na bhojyeṣirāya na bhojyā /
analyzed: kratvā yat asya taviṣīṣu pṛñcate gneḥ marutām na bhojyā iṣirāya na bhojyā
translated: When he is anointed in his mighty powers, he seeks Agni's favor, the Maruts' food, eager for food.

original: sa hi ṣmā dānam invati vasūnāṃ ca majmanā /
analyzed: sa hi sma dānam invati vasūnām ca majmanā
translated: For he impels us to the bestowal of wealth, and by his might

original: sa nas trāsate duritād abhihrutaḥ śaṃsād aghād abhihrutaḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ trāsate duritāt abhihrutaḥ śaṃsāt aghāt abhihrutaḥ
translated: He protects us from evil, from the reviler, from the sinner, from the reviler.

original: viśvo vihāyā aratir vasur dadhe haste dakṣiṇe taraṇir na śiśrathac chravasyayā na śiśrathat /
analyzed: viśvaḥ vihāyāḥ aratiḥ vasuḥ dadhe haste dakṣiṇe taraṇiḥ na śiśrathat śravasyayā na śiśrathat
translated: The all-embracing, the all-enjoying, the wealthy one, the finder, placed in his right hand, the swift one did not relax, not relaxing through desire for fame.

original: viśvasmā id iṣudhyate devatrā havyam ohiṣe /🔽viśvasmā it sukṛte vāram ṛṇvaty agnir dvārā vy ṛṇvati //
analyzed: viśvasmai id iṣudhyate devatrā havyam ohiṣe  viśvasmai id su kṛte vāram ṛṇvati agniḥ dvārā vi ṛṇvati
translated: He is to be invoked for all who long for food, for the oblation to be offered to the gods.🔽For all who are good he opens the door, Agni opens the door.

original: sa mānuṣe vṛjane śantamo hito 'gnir yajñeṣu jenyo na viśpatiḥ priyo yajñeṣu viśpatiḥ /
analyzed: sa mānuṣe vṛjane śantamaḥ hitaḥ gniḥ yajñeṣu jenyaḥ na viśpatiḥ priyaḥ yajñeṣu viśpatiḥ
translated: He is placed as the most delightful in the human abode, Agni, the adorable one at sacrifices, like a dear lord of the people, a dear lord of the people at sacrifices.

original: sa havyā mānuṣāṇām iḷā kṛtāni patyate /
analyzed: sa havyā mānuṣāṇām iḷā kṛtāni patyate
translated: He rules over the oblations and the offerings made by men.

original: sa nas trāsate varuṇasya dhūrter maho devasya dhūrteḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ trāsate varuṇasya dhūrteḥ mahaḥ devasya dhūrteḥ
translated: He delivers us from the noose of Varuṇa, from the great noose of the god.

original: agniṃ hotāram īḷate vasudhitim priyaṃ cetiṣṭham aratiṃ ny erire havyavāhaṃ ny erire /
analyzed: agnim hotāram īḍate vasu dhitim priyam cetiṣṭham aratim ni erire havya vāham ni erire
translated: They invoke Agni as the Hotar, the bestower of goods, they have placed him, the most acceptable, the envoy, they have placed him, the bearer of oblations.

original: viśvāyuṃ viśvavedasaṃ hotāraṃ yajataṃ kavim /
analyzed: viśvāyum viśva vedasam hotāram yajatam kavim
translated: The all-life, all-knowing Hotar, the priest, the wise one.

original: devāso raṇvam avase vasūyavo gīrbhī raṇvaṃ vasūyavaḥ //
analyzed: devāsaḥ raṇvam avase vasūyavaḥ gīrbhiḥ raṇvam vasūyavaḥ
translated: The gods, seeking wealth, have made the delightful one their helper, have made the delightful one their helper.

original: yaṃ tvaṃ ratham indra medhasātaye 'pākā santam iṣira praṇayasi prānavadya nayasi /
analyzed: yam tvam ratham indra medha sātaye pākā santam iṣira praṇayasi pra anavadya nayasi
translated: The chariot which you, O Indra, lead forward, though not yet ready, for the sacrifice, O active one, you lead forward, faultless one, you lead forward.

original: sadyaś cit tam abhiṣṭaye karo vaśaś ca vājinam /
analyzed: sadyas cit tam abhiṣṭaye karaḥ vaśaḥ ca vājinam
translated: Even now you make him ready for help, and the strong one obedient.

original: sāsmākam anavadya tūtujāna vedhasām imāṃ vācaṃ na vedhasām //
analyzed: sa asmākam anavadya tūtujāna vedhasām imām vācam na vedhasām
translated: O faultless one, accept this speech of ours, of the priests, of the priests.

original: sa śrudhi yaḥ smā pṛtanāsu kāsu cid dakṣāyya indra bharahūtaye nṛbhir asi pratūrtaye nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: sa śrudhi yaḥ smā pṛtanāsu kāsu cit dakṣāyyaḥ indra bhara hūtaye nṛbhiḥ asi pratūrtaye nṛbhiḥ
translated: Listen to him who in any battles is worthy of choice, O Indra, for the sake of strength, with men, art thou ready for the sake of strength, with men.

original: yaḥ śūraiḥ svaḥ sanitā yo viprair vājaṃ tarutā /🔽tam īśānāsa iradhanta vājinam pṛkṣam atyaṃ na vājinam //
analyzed: yaḥ śūraiḥ svar sanitā yaḥ vipraiḥ vājam tarutā  tam īśānāsaḥ iradhanta vājinam pṛkṣam atyam na vājinam
translated: He who with heroes wins the light, who with sages the booty,🔽Him, the strong one, the lords impel, the swift one, as 'twere a swift horse.

original: dasmo hi ṣmā vṛṣaṇam pinvasi tvacaṃ kaṃ cid yāvīr araruṃ śūra martyam parivṛṇakṣi martyam /
analyzed: dasmaḥ hi sma vṛṣaṇam pinvasi tvacam kam cit yāvīḥ ararum śūra martyam parivṛṇakṣi martyam
translated: For thou, O Indra, dost swell the skin of the strong one, the wondrous one. Some mortal thou dost encompass with thy favour, O hero, some mortal.

original: indrota tubhyaṃ tad dive tad rudrāya svayaśase /
analyzed: indra uta tubhyam tat dive tat rudrāya sva yaśase
translated: To Indra, to thee, O Indra, that is heaven, that is Rudra, of thine own glory.

original: mitrāya vocaṃ varuṇāya saprathaḥ sumṛḷīkāya saprathaḥ //🔽asmākaṃ va indram uśmasīṣṭaye sakhāyaṃ viśvāyum prāsahaṃ yujaṃ vājeṣu prāsahaṃ yujam /
analyzed: mitrāya vocam varuṇāya saprathaḥ su mṛḷīkāya saprathaḥ  asmākam vaḥ indram uśmasi iṣṭaye sakhāyam viśvāyum prāsaham yujam vājeṣu prāsaham yujam
translated: To Mitra, to Varuna, I proclaim the far-reaching, to the very gracious one, the far-reaching one.🔽Thou dost favour us, O Indra, for prosperity, the friend of all life, the conqueror, the yoke-fellow in battles, the conqueror, the yoke-fellow.

original: asmākam brahmotaye 'vā pṛtsuṣu kāsu cit /🔽nahi tvā śatru starate stṛṇoṣi yaṃ viśvaṃ śatruṃ stṛṇoṣi yam //
analyzed: asmākam brahma ūtaye vā pṛtsuṣu kāsu cit  nahi tvā śatruḥ starate stṛṇoṣi yam viśvam śatrum stṛṇoṣi yam
translated: For our holy power, for our help, in all the battles that are fought,🔽For no foe of thine is there a foe whom thou dost crush, whom thou dost crush, every foe.

original: ni ṣū namātimatiṃ kayasya cit tejiṣṭhābhir araṇibhir notibhir ugrābhir ugrotibhiḥ /
analyzed: ni su nama atimatim kayasya cit tejiṣṭhābhiḥ araṇibhiḥ notibhiḥ ugrābhiḥ ugra ūtibhiḥ
translated: Thou crushest the pride of every one who is haughty, with thy most burning, most impetuous, most terrible aids, with thy terrible aids.

original: neṣi ṇo yathā purānenāḥ śūra manyase /
analyzed: neṣi naḥ yathā purā anenāḥ śūra manyase
translated: Lead us as in the days of old, O hero, as thou thinkest fit.

original: viśvāni pūror apa parṣi vahnir āsā vahnir no accha //🔽pra tad voceyam bhavyāyendave havyo na ya iṣavān manma rejati rakṣohā manma rejati /
analyzed: viśvāni pūroḥ apa parṣi vahniḥ āsā vahniḥ naḥ accha  pra tat voceyam bhavyāya indave havyaḥ na yaḥ iṣavān manma rejati rakṣaḥ hā manma rejati
translated: Pass over all the forts of the foe, O Agni, come hither, O Agni, come to us.🔽That I may tell it to the prosperous Indra, to him who deserves the oblation, who delights in the strong drink, who delights in the hymn, the slayer of foes, who delights in the hymn.

original: svayaṃ so asmad ā nido vadhair ajeta durmatim /
analyzed: svayam saḥ asmat ā nidaḥ vadhaiḥ ajeta durmatim
translated: He alone, with his own snares and weapons, shall overcome the evil-minded one who is against us.

original: ava sraved aghaśaṃso 'vataram ava kṣudram iva sravet //
analyzed: ava sravet agha śaṃsaḥ vataram ava kṣudram iva sravet
translated: Let the evildoer flow away, let him flow away to a lower place, let him flow away like a little thing.

original: vanema tad dhotrayā citantyā vanema rayiṃ rayivaḥ suvīryaṃ raṇvaṃ santaṃ suvīryam /
analyzed: vanema tat hotrayā citantyā vanema rayim rayivas su vīryam raṇvam santam su vīryam
translated: We will win that by our well-ordered worship, we will win wealth, O wealthy one, with good heroes, we will win the kindly one, with good heroes.

original: durmanmānaṃ sumantubhir em iṣā pṛcīmahi /
analyzed: durmanmānam su mantubhiḥ ā īm iṣā pṛcīmahi
translated: We will win the one of evil thoughts with the well-wishers, with food, with the wide one.

original: ā satyābhir indraṃ dyumnahūtibhir yajatraṃ dyumnahūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: ā satyābhiḥ indram dyumna hūtibhiḥ yajatram dyumna hūtibhiḥ
