translated: With the true invocations, with the glory-calling invocations, we will win Indra, the worthy of sacrifice, with the glory-calling invocations.

original: praprā vo asme svayaśobhir ūtī parivarga indro durmatīnāṃ darīman durmatīnām /
analyzed: pra prāḥ vaḥ asme sva yaśobhiḥ ūtī parivarge indraḥ durmatīnām darīman durmatīnām
translated: May Indra, with his own glory and help, come to us, the repeller of misfortunes, the breaker of misfortunes.

original: svayaṃ sā riṣayadhyai yā na upeṣe atraiḥ /
analyzed: svayam sā riṣayadhyai yā naḥ upeṣe atraiḥ
translated: She who does not come to us with these, that one will be destroyed by herself.

original: hatem asan na vakṣati kṣiptā jūrṇir na vakṣati //🔽tvaṃ na indra rāyā parīṇasā yāhi pathāṃ anehasā puro yāhy arakṣasā /
analyzed: hatā īm asat na vakṣati kṣiptā jūrṇiḥ na vakṣati 🔽tvam naḥ indra rāyā parīṇasā yāhi pathām anehasā puras yāhi arakṣasā
translated: She will be destroyed, she will not speak, like a cast-off worn-out rope, she will not speak.

original: sacasva naḥ parāka ā sacasvāstamīka ā /
analyzed: sacasva naḥ parāke ā sacasva astamīke ā
translated: Be with us in the morning, be with us in the evening.

original: pāhi no dūrād ārād abhiṣṭibhiḥ sadā pāhy abhiṣṭibhiḥ //
analyzed: pāhi naḥ dūrāt ārāt abhiṣṭibhiḥ sadā pāhi abhiṣṭibhiḥ
translated: Protect us from afar, from near, with thy help, always protect us with thy help.

original: tvaṃ na indra rāyā tarūṣasograṃ cit tvā mahimā sakṣad avase mahe mitraṃ nāvase /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra rāyā tarūṣasā ugram cit tvā mahimā sakṣat avase mahe mitram na avase
translated: Thou, O Indra, with wealth that is most desired, even the mighty one, mayst thou be pleased to help us, as a great friend to help us.

original: ojiṣṭha trātar avitā rathaṃ kaṃ cid amartya /
analyzed: ojiṣṭha trātar avitā ratham kam cit amartya
translated: Most powerful, O immortal one, be the protector, the helper of some chariot.

original: anyam asmad ririṣeḥ kaṃ cid adrivo ririkṣantaṃ cid adrivaḥ //
analyzed: anyam asmat ririṣeḥ kam cit adrivas ririkṣantam cit adrivas
translated: Be angry with another than us, O thou with the thunderbolt, with him who is angry with us, O thou with the thunderbolt.

original: pāhi na indra suṣṭuta sridho 'vayātā sadam id durmatīnāṃ devaḥ san durmatīnām /
analyzed: pāhi naḥ indra suṣṭuta sridhaḥ vayātā sadam id durmatīnām devaḥ san durmatīnām
translated: Protect us, O Indra, well praised, from the foe, always from evil counsels, as a god from evil counsels.

original: hantā pāpasya rakṣasas trātā viprasya māvataḥ /
analyzed: hantā pāpasya rakṣasaḥ trātā viprasya māvataḥ
translated: Slayer of the wicked Rakshas, protector of the pious and the wealthy.

original: adhā hi tvā janitā jījanad vaso rakṣohaṇaṃ tvā jījanad vaso //
analyzed: adhā hi tvā janitā jījanat vaso rakṣaḥ haṇam tvā jījanat vaso
translated: For truly, O Vasu, thy sire begat thee, O Vasu, to slay the Rakshas.

original: endra yāhy upa naḥ parāvato nāyam acchā vidathānīva satpatir astaṃ rājeva satpatiḥ /
analyzed: ā indra yāhi upa naḥ parāvataḥ na ayam acchā vidathāni iva satpatiḥ astam rājā iva satpatiḥ
translated: Come to us, O Indra, from afar, as one who sits in the assembly, as a lord of the assembly, come hither, as a king, a lord of the assembly.

original: havāmahe tvā vayam prayasvantaḥ sute sacā /
analyzed: havāmahe tvā vayam prayasvantaḥ sute sacā
translated: We call upon thee, O Indra, we who are ready with our gifts, with the pressed (Soma).

original: putrāso na pitaraṃ vājasātaye maṃhiṣṭhaṃ vājasātaye //
analyzed: putrāsaḥ na pitaram vājasātaye maṃhiṣṭham vājasātaye
translated: Like sons their father, for the winning of strength, most liberal, for the winning of strength.

original: pibā somam indra suvānam adribhiḥ kośena siktam avataṃ na vaṃsagas tātṛṣāṇo na vaṃsagaḥ /
analyzed: pibā somam indra suvānam adribhiḥ kośena siktam avatam na vaṃsagaḥ tātṛṣāṇaḥ na vaṃsagaḥ
translated: Drink the Soma, O Indra, pressed with stones, poured into the trough, like one who thirsts, like one who thirsts.

original: madāya haryatāya te tuviṣṭamāya dhāyase /
analyzed: madāya haryatāya te tuviṣṭamāya dhāyase
translated: For the rapture, for thy spotted (steed), for thy most powerful support.

original: ā tvā yacchantu harito na sūryam ahā viśveva sūryam //🔽avindad divo nihitaṃ guhā nidhiṃ ver na garbham parivītam aśmany anante antar aśmani /
analyzed: ā tvā yacchantu haritaḥ na sūryam ahā viśvā iva sūryam  avindat divaḥ nihitam guhā nidhim veḥ na garbham parivītam aśmani anante antar aśmani
translated: Let thy bay steeds bring thee hither, as all (men) bring hither the sun.🔽He hath found the treasure laid up in the cave of heaven, as a son in the womb, enclosed in the rock, in the endless rock.

original: vrajaṃ vajrī gavām iva siṣāsann aṅgirastamaḥ /
analyzed: vrajam vajrī gavām iva siṣāsan aṅgirastamaḥ
translated: The wielder of the thunderbolt, like a bull to the stalls of cattle, longing for the draught, most Angiras-like.

original: apāvṛṇod iṣa indraḥ parīvṛtā dvāra iṣaḥ parīvṛtāḥ //
analyzed: apāvṛṇot iṣaḥ indraḥ parīvṛtāḥ dvāraḥ iṣaḥ parīvṛtāḥ
translated: Indra hath opened the doors of the stalls, the doors of the stalls.

original: dādṛhāṇo vajram indro gabhastyoḥ kṣadmeva tigmam asanāya saṃ śyad ahihatyāya saṃ śyat /
analyzed: dādṛhāṇaḥ vajram indraḥ gabhastyoḥ kṣadma iva tigmam asanāya sam śyat ahi hatyāya sam śyat
translated: Firmly grasping the thunderbolt in his arms, sharpening the sharp one, as it were, for slaying, for slaying the dragon.

original: saṃvivyāna ojasā śavobhir indra majmanā /
analyzed: saṃvivyānaḥ ojasā śavobhiḥ indra majmanā
translated: Sharpening, O Indra, with thy strength and might, with thy power.

original: taṣṭeva vṛkṣaṃ vanino ni vṛścasi paraśveva ni vṛścasi //
analyzed: taṣṭā iva vṛkṣam vaninaḥ ni vṛścasi paraśu eva ni vṛścasi
translated: Thou cuttest down the tree, as it were, with an axe, thou cuttest down, as it were, with an axe.

original: tvaṃ vṛthā nadya indra sartave 'cchā samudram asṛjo rathāṃ iva vājayato rathāṃ iva /
analyzed: tvam vṛthā nadyaḥ indra sartave ccha samudram asṛjaḥ rathān iva vājayataḥ rathān iva
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast set the rivers free to flow, as it were, chariots, to the ocean, to the ocean.

original: ita ūtīr ayuñjata samānam artham akṣitam /
analyzed: itas ūtīḥ ayuñjata samānam artham akṣitam
translated: From this side and from that side they have yoked the unfailing common object.

original: dhenūr iva manave viśvadohaso janāya viśvadohasaḥ //
analyzed: dhenūḥ iva manave viśva dohasaḥ janāya viśva dohasaḥ
translated: Like milch cows for Manu, for all to milk, for the people, for all to milk.

original: imāṃ te vācaṃ vasūyanta āyavo rathaṃ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣiṣuḥ sumnāya tvām atakṣiṣuḥ /
analyzed: imām te vācam vasūyantaḥ āyavaḥ ratham na dhīraḥ su apāḥ atakṣiṣuḥ sumnāya tvām atakṣiṣuḥ
translated: These living beings, longing for wealth, have fashioned this speech of thine, like a skilful charioteer, have fashioned it for thy bliss.

original: śumbhanto jenyaṃ yathā vājeṣu vipra vājinam /
analyzed: śumbhantaḥ jenyam yathā vājeṣu vipra vājinam
translated: Extolling the noble one, as for strength, O sage, the strong one in battles for booty,

original: atyam iva śavase sātaye dhanā viśvā dhanāni sātaye //
analyzed: atyam iva śavase sātaye dhanā viśvā dhanāni sātaye
translated: Like a swift steed for glory, for winning wealth, for gaining all treasures, for winning wealth.

original: bhinat puro navatim indra pūrave divodāsāya mahi dāśuṣe nṛto vajreṇa dāśuṣe nṛto /
analyzed: bhinat puraḥ navatim indra pūrave divodāsāya mahi dāśuṣe nṛto vajreṇa dāśuṣe nṛto
translated: Thou brakest down, O Indra, the nine-and-ninety forts for Puru, for the great worshipper Divodasa, with thy bolt, for the worshipper, with thy bolt.

original: atithigvāya śambaraṃ girer ugro avābharat /
analyzed: atithigvāya śambaram gireḥ ugraḥ avābharat
translated: For Atithigva the strong one brought down from the mountain the fortress of Sambara,

original: maho dhanāni dayamāna ojasā viśvā dhanāny ojasā //
analyzed: mahaḥ dhanāni dayamānaḥ ojasā viśvā dhanāni ojasā
translated: Great treasures, bestowing them with might, all treasures, bestowing them with might.

original: indraḥ samatsu yajamānam āryam prāvad viśveṣu śatamūtir ājiṣu svarmīḷheṣv ājiṣu /
analyzed: indraḥ samatsu yajamānam āryam prāvat viśveṣu śatamūtiḥ ājiṣu svarmīḷheṣu ājiṣu
translated: Indra, in the battles, the lord of a hundred powers, the sacrificer, the noble one, in all the contests, in the contests for the light,

original: manave śāsad avratān tvacaṃ kṛṣṇām arandhayat /
analyzed: manave śāsat avratān tvacam kṛṣṇām arandhayat
translated: He, ruling over Manu, the one of no vows, burst asunder the black skin,

original: dakṣan na viśvaṃ tatṛṣāṇam oṣati ny arśasānam oṣati //
analyzed: dakṣan na viśvam tatṛṣāṇam oṣati ni arśasānam oṣati
translated: He slays the one who is not satisfied with all his strength, the one who is not satisfied with his strength.

original: sūraś cakram pra vṛhaj jāta ojasā prapitve vācam aruṇo muṣāyatīśāna ā muṣāyati /
analyzed: sūraḥ cakram pra vṛhat jātaḥ ojasā prapitve vācam aruṇaḥ muṣāyati īśānaḥ ā muṣāyati
translated: The ruddy one, with his might, hath extended the wheel, the newly-born one, in the morning, hath taken away the voice, the lord hath taken away the voice.

original: uśanā yat parāvato 'jagann ūtaye kave /
analyzed: uśanāḥ yat parāvataḥ jagan ūtaye kave
translated: When Uśanâ hath gone away from us to bring us aid, O Sage,

original: sumnāni viśvā manuṣeva turvaṇir ahā viśveva turvaṇiḥ //
analyzed: sumnāni viśvā manuṣā iva turvaṇiḥ ahā viśvā iva turvaṇiḥ
translated: All blessings for man, as 'twere for all the days, for all the days.

original: sa no navyebhir vṛṣakarmann ukthaiḥ purāṃ dartaḥ pāyubhiḥ pāhi śagmaiḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ navyebhiḥ vṛṣa karman ukthaiḥ purām dartar pāyubhiḥ pāhi śagmaiḥ
translated: Protect us, O thou of manly deeds, with new lauds, with forts that give security, with auspicious forts.

original: divodāsebhir indra stavāno vāvṛdhīthā ahobhir iva dyauḥ //
analyzed: divodāsebhiḥ indra stavānaḥ vāvṛdhīthāḥ ahobhiḥ iva dyauḥ
translated: Extolled by the Divodâsas, O Indra, wax mighty as the heaven waxes great through the days.

original: indrāya hi dyaur asuro anamnatendrāya mahī pṛthivī varīmabhir dyumnasātā varīmabhiḥ /
analyzed: indrāya hi dyauḥ asuraḥ anamnata indrāya mahī pṛthivī varīmabhiḥ dyumna sātā varīmabhiḥ
translated: For to Indra the Asura heaven bends in worship, to Indra the mighty earth with wide expanses, to Indra with wide expanses for the winning of glory.

original: indraṃ viśve sajoṣaso devāso dadhire puraḥ /
analyzed: indram viśve sajoṣasaḥ devāsaḥ dadhire puras
translated: All the Gods in unison have set Indra in the van.

original: indrāya viśvā savanāni mānuṣā rātāni santu mānuṣā //
analyzed: indrāya viśvā savanāni mānuṣā rātāni santu mānuṣā
translated: To Indra all libations of men must be offered, must be offered to Indra.

original: viśveṣu hi tvā savaneṣu tuñjate samānam ekaṃ vṛṣamaṇyavaḥ pṛthak svaḥ saniṣyavaḥ pṛthak /🔽taṃ tvā nāvaṃ na parṣaṇiṃ śūṣasya dhuri dhīmahi /
analyzed: viśveṣu hi tvā savaneṣu tuñjate samānam ekam vṛṣamaṇyavaḥ pṛthak svar saniṣyavaḥ pṛthak  tam tvā nāvam na parṣaṇim śūṣasya dhuri dhīmahi
translated: For in all the libations they urge thee, the one mighty one, the impetuous, each according to his will, each according to his will.🔽Thee, O Indra, we make our boat that shall carry us over, on the pole of strength.

original: indraṃ na yajñaiś citayanta āyava stomebhir indram āyavaḥ //
analyzed: indram na yajñaiḥ citayantaḥ āyavaḥ stomebhiḥ indram āyavaḥ
translated: Men must glorify Indra with sacrifices, must glorify Indra with praises.

original: vi tvā tatasre mithunā avasyavo vrajasya sātā gavyasya niḥsṛjaḥ sakṣanta indra niḥsṛjaḥ /
analyzed: vi tvā tatasre mithunāḥ avasyavaḥ vrajasya sātā gavyasya niḥsṛjaḥ sakṣantaḥ indra niḥsṛjaḥ
translated: The pairs have scattered thee about, the helpers, to let loose the stall of the kine that is to be gained. They long to let loose the stall, O Indra, they long.

original: yad gavyantā dvā janā svar yantā samūhasi /🔽āviṣ karikrad vṛṣaṇaṃ sacābhuvaṃ vajram indra sacābhuvam //
analyzed: yat gavyantā dvā janā svar yantā samūhasi  āvis karikrat vṛṣaṇam sacābhuvam vajram indra sacābhuvam
translated: When two people, striving for the heavenly world, you bring together.🔽The bull who roars, the companion, the thunderbolt, O Indra, the companion.

original: viduṣ ṭe asya vīryasya pūravaḥ puro yad indra śāradīr avātiraḥ sāsahāno avātiraḥ /
analyzed: viduḥ te asya vīryasya pūravaḥ puraḥ yat indra śāradīḥ avātiraḥ sāsahānaḥ avātiraḥ
translated: The Pūrus know this deed of your power, O Indra, when you overthrew the forts in the autumn, conquering, overthrew.

original: śāsas tam indra martyam ayajyuṃ śavasas pate /
analyzed: śāsaḥ tam indra martyam ayajyum śavasaḥ pate
translated: O Indra, lord of power, punish that mortal who does not worship.

original: mahīm amuṣṇāḥ pṛthivīm imā apo mandasāna imā apaḥ //🔽ād it te asya vīryasya carkiran madeṣu vṛṣann uśijo yad āvitha sakhīyato yad āvitha /
analyzed: mahīm amuṣṇāḥ pṛthivīm imāḥ apaḥ mandasānaḥ imāḥ apaḥ  āt id te asya vīryasya carkiran madeṣu vṛṣan uśijaḥ yat āvitha sakhīyataḥ yat āvitha
translated: You have enjoyed this vast earth, these waters, O you who rejoice in these waters.🔽The sages, O bull, have extolled this deed of your power in the feasts, when you helped the eager ones, helped the eager ones who are worthy of praise.

original: cakartha kāram ebhyaḥ pṛtanāsu pravantave /
analyzed: cakartha kāram ebhyaḥ pṛtanāsu pravantave
translated: You have done this deed for them, to make them victorious in battles.

original: te anyāmanyāṃ nadyaṃ saniṣṇata śravasyantaḥ saniṣṇata //
analyzed: te anyām anyām nadyam saniṣṇata śravasyantaḥ saniṣṇata
translated: They have gained one after another the rivers, desiring fame, have gained.

original: uto no asyā uṣaso juṣeta hy arkasya bodhi haviṣo havīmabhiḥ svarṣātā havīmabhiḥ /
analyzed: uta u naḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ juṣeta hi arkasya bodhi haviṣaḥ havīmabhiḥ svarṣātā havīmabhiḥ
translated: And may he favor us of this dawn, being self-luminous, with the oblations of the hymn and the Arka, with the oblations.

original: yad indra hantave mṛdho vṛṣā vajriñ ciketasi /
analyzed: yat indra hantave mṛdhaḥ vṛṣā vajrim ciketasi
translated: When, O Indra, the bull, you think of slaying the enemies, O wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: ā me asya vedhaso navīyaso manma śrudhi navīyasaḥ //
analyzed: ā me asya vedhasaḥ navīyasaḥ manma śrudhi navīyasaḥ
translated: Listen to this new hymn of mine, O you who are to be praised with new hymns.

original: tvaṃ tam indra vāvṛdhāno asmayur amitrayantaṃ tuvijāta martyaṃ vajreṇa śūra martyam /
analyzed: tvam tam indra vāvṛdhānaḥ asmayuḥ amitrayantam tuvi jāta martyam vajreṇa śūra martyam
translated: You, O Indra, having grown strong, the mortal who hates his friends, the mortal who is mighty, O mighty one, with your thunderbolt, O hero,

original: jahi yo no aghāyati śṛṇuṣva suśravastamaḥ /
analyzed: jahi yaḥ naḥ aghāyati śṛṇuṣva su śravastamaḥ
translated: Destroy the mortal who injures us. Listen as the most famous one.

original: riṣṭaṃ na yāmann apa bhūtu durmatir viśvāpa bhūtu durmatiḥ //
analyzed: riṣṭam na yāman apa bhūtu durmatiḥ viśvā apa bhūtu durmatiḥ
translated: May misfortune be destroyed in our going, may all misfortune be destroyed.

original: tvayā vayam maghavan pūrvye dhana indratvotāḥ sāsahyāma pṛtanyato vanuyāma vanuṣyataḥ /
analyzed: tvayā vayam maghavan pūrvye dhane indra tva utāḥ sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ vanuyāma vanuṣyataḥ
translated: By you, O bountiful one, in the ancient wealth, O Indra, may we be supported, may we conquer the enemy, may we win the one who is to be won.

original: nediṣṭhe asminn ahany adhi vocā nu sunvate /
analyzed: nediṣṭhe asmin ahani adhi vocāḥ nu sunvate
translated: In this nearest day, may we speak to you, O you who are to be praised.

original: asmin yajñe vi cayemā bhare kṛtaṃ vājayanto bhare kṛtam //🔽svarjeṣe bhara āprasya vakmany uṣarbudhaḥ svasminn añjasi krāṇasya svasminn añjasi /
analyzed: asmin yajñe vi cayema bhare kṛtam vājayantaḥ bhare kṛtam  svar jeṣe bhare āprasya vakmani uṣarbudhaḥ svasmin añjasi krāṇasya svasmin añjasi
translated: In this sacrifice, may we distribute the wealth that has been gained, O you who delight in wealth, the wealth that has been gained.🔽For the sake of heaven, bring the speech of the one who is to be praised, O you who rise at dawn, in your own abode, O you who are to be praised in your own abode.

original: ahann indro yathā vide śīrṣṇāśīrṣṇopavācyaḥ /
analyzed: ahan indraḥ yathā vide śīrṣṇā a śīrṣṇā upavācyaḥ
translated: Indra has struck as he knows, to be praised with the head, with the head.

original: asmatrā te sadhryak santu rātayo bhadrā bhadrasya rātayaḥ //
analyzed: asmatrā te sadhryak santu rātayaḥ bhadrāḥ bhadrasya rātayaḥ
translated: Here may your gifts be with us, the good gifts of the good one.

original: tat tu prayaḥ pratnathā te śuśukvanaṃ yasmin yajñe vāram akṛṇvata kṣayam ṛtasya vār asi kṣayam /
analyzed: tat tu prayaḥ pratnathā te śuśukvanam yasmin yajñe vāram akṛṇvata kṣayam ṛtasya vār asi kṣayam
translated: That is the ancient, good-looking favor of yours, in which sacrifice you made the Varuṇa rite your abode, the abode of the Varuṇa rite.

original: vi tad vocer adha dvitāntaḥ paśyanti raśmibhiḥ /🔽sa ghā vide anv indro gaveṣaṇo bandhukṣidbhyo gaveṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: vi tat voceḥ adha dvitā antar paśyanti raśmibhiḥ  sa ghā vide anu indraḥ gaveṣaṇaḥ bandhu kṣidbhyaḥ gaveṣaṇaḥ
translated: Do thou proclaim that, for they see it with their rays, even in the daytime.🔽He, indeed, knows, Indra, the seeker of cattle, for the friends who seek cattle.

original: nū itthā te pūrvathā ca pravācyaṃ yad aṅgirobhyo 'vṛṇor apa vrajam indra śikṣann apa vrajam /
analyzed: nu itthā te pūrvathā ca pravācyam yat aṅgirobhyaḥ vṛṇoḥ apa vrajam indra śikṣan apa vrajam
translated: Now here and formerly is to be proclaimed what thou didst give to the Angirases, thou didst open the stall, O Indra, thou didst open the stall, instructing.

original: aibhyaḥ samānyā diśāsmabhyaṃ jeṣi yotsi ca /
analyzed: ā ebhyaḥ samānyā diśā asmabhyam jeṣi yotsi ca
translated: To these, to us, in the common direction, thou wilt win and fight.

original: sunvadbhyo randhayā kaṃ cid avrataṃ hṛṇāyantaṃ cid avratam //🔽saṃ yaj janān kratubhiḥ śūra īkṣayad dhane hite taruṣanta śravasyavaḥ pra yakṣanta śravasyavaḥ /
analyzed: sunvadbhyaḥ randhaya kam cit avratam hṛṇāyantam cit avratam  sam yat janān kratubhiḥ śūraḥ īkṣayat dhane hite taruṣanta śravasyavaḥ pra yakṣanta śravasyavaḥ
translated: To the worshippers thou wilt give some who is not firm, thou wilt give some who is not firm.🔽When the hero looked on the people with his rites, when the wealth was distributed, the glory-seekers strove, the glory-seekers strove.

original: tasmā āyuḥ prajāvad id bādhe arcanty ojasā /
analyzed: tasmai āyuḥ prajāvat id bādhe arcanti ojasā
translated: To him they sing praise with strength, with offspring and life, for support.

original: indra okyaṃ didhiṣanta dhītayo devāṃ acchā na dhītayaḥ //
analyzed: indre okyam didhiṣanta dhītayaḥ devān acchā na dhītayaḥ
translated: The thoughts of Indra, the thoughts which go to the gods, they desire the abode.

original: yuvaṃ tam indrāparvatā puroyudhā yo naḥ pṛtanyād apa taṃtam id dhataṃ vajreṇa taṃtam id dhatam /
analyzed: yuvam tam indrāparvatā puroyudhā yaḥ naḥ pṛtanyāt apa taṃtam id hatam vajreṇa taṃtam id hatam
translated: You two, O Indra and Parvata, the foremost warriors, him who would fight against us, him you two destroy with the thunderbolt, him you two destroy.

original: dūre cattāya cchantsad gahanaṃ yad inakṣat /
analyzed: dūre cattāya chantsat gahanam yat inakṣat
translated: Far away he has gone to the hidden place which he has sought to penetrate.

original: asmākaṃ śatrūn pari śūra viśvato darmā darṣīṣṭa viśvataḥ //
analyzed: asmākam śatrūn pari śūra viśvatas darmā darṣīṣṭa viśvatas
translated: O hero, may the law crush our enemies on every side, may it crush them on every side.

original: ubhe punāmi rodasī ṛtena druho dahāmi sam mahīr anindrāḥ /🔽abhivlagya yatra hatā amitrā vailasthānam pari tṛḷhā aśeran //
analyzed: ubhe punāmi rodasī ṛtena druhaḥ dahāmi sam mahīḥ an indrāḥ  abhivlagya yatra hatāḥ amitrāḥ vailasthānam pari tṛḍhāḥ aśeran
translated: With the law I purify both the heavens and the earth. I burn the great, powerless ones who hate.🔽Where the enemies, struck down, lie covered, and the violent ones have settled around the place of slaughter.

original: abhivlagyā cid adrivaḥ śīrṣā yātumatīnām /
analyzed: abhivlagya cit adrivas śīrṣā yātumatīnām
translated: Even though covered, O wielder of the thunderbolt, the heads of the sorceresses,

original: chindhi vaṭūriṇā padā mahāvaṭūriṇā padā //
analyzed: chinddhi vaṭūriṇā padā mahā vaṭūriṇā padā
translated: Cut off with the great thunderbolt, with the foot of the great thunderbolt.

original: avāsām maghavañ jahi śardho yātumatīnām /
analyzed: ava āsām maghavam jahi śardhaḥ yātumatīnām
translated: O Maghavan, strike down the abode of the sorceresses.

original: vailasthānake armake mahāvailasthe armake //
analyzed: vailasthānake armake mahāvailasthe armake
translated: In the place of slaughter, in the place of the great slaughter.

original: yāsāṃ tisraḥ pañcāśato 'bhivlaṅgair apāvapaḥ /
analyzed: yāsām tisraḥ pañcāśataḥ bhivlaṅgaiḥ apāvapaḥ
translated: Of those whom you struck down with three hundred and fifty blows,

original: tat su te manāyati takat su te manāyati //
analyzed: tat su te manāyati takat su te manāyati
translated: That is pleasing to your mind, that is very pleasing to your mind.

original: piśaṅgabhṛṣṭim ambhṛṇam piśācim indra sam mṛṇa /
analyzed: piśaṅga bhṛṣṭim ambhṛṇam piśācim indra sam mṛṇa
translated: The tawny-sparked, the tender, the demoness, O Indra, crush them.

original: sarvaṃ rakṣo ni barhaya //
analyzed: sarvam rakṣaḥ ni barhaya
translated: Destroy all the Raksases.

original: avar maha indra dādṛhi śrudhī naḥ śuśoca hi dyauḥ kṣā na bhīṣāṃ adrivo ghṛṇān na bhīṣāṃ adrivaḥ /
analyzed: avas mahaḥ indra dādṛhi śrudhi naḥ śuśoca hi dyauḥ kṣā na adrivas ghṛṇāt na adrivas
translated: O Indra, be gracious, listen to us. The sky has indeed shone forth, O you who have thunderbolts, the earth has shone forth, O you who have thunderbolts, with the terrible, with the terrible.

original: śuṣmintamo hi śuṣmibhir vadhair ugrebhir īyase /
analyzed: śuṣmintamaḥ hi śuṣmibhiḥ vadhaiḥ ugrebhiḥ īyase
translated: For with the most powerful of the powerful, with the terrible weapons, you go forth.

original: apūruṣaghno apratīta śūra satvabhis trisaptaiḥ śūra satvabhiḥ //
analyzed: a pūruṣa ghnaḥ apratīta śūra satvabhiḥ trisaptaiḥ śūra satvabhiḥ
translated: The slayer of no man, the unconquered hero, with the thirty-seven heroic beings.

original: vanoti hi sunvan kṣayam parīṇasaḥ sunvāno hi ṣmā yajaty ava dviṣo devānām ava dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: vanoti hi sunvan kṣayam parīṇasaḥ sunvānaḥ hi sma yajati ava dviṣaḥ devānām ava dviṣaḥ
translated: The Soma-presser gains the abode of wealth, the Soma-presser worships with oblations, the Soma-presser overcomes the foes of the gods.

original: sunvāna it siṣāsati sahasrā vājy avṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sunvānaḥ id siṣāsati sahasrā vājī a vṛtaḥ
translated: The Soma-presser strives for thousands, the strong one not to be turned aside.

original: sunvānāyendro dadāty ābhuvaṃ rayiṃ dadāty ābhuvam //
analyzed: sunvānāya indraḥ dadāti ābhuvam rayim dadāti ābhuvam
translated: Indra gives to the Soma-presser prosperity, he gives wealth with prosperity.

original: ā tvā juvo rārahāṇā abhi prayo vāyo vahantv iha pūrvapītaye somasya pūrvapītaye /
analyzed: ā tvā juvaḥ rārahāṇāḥ abhi prayaḥ vāyo vahantu iha pūrva pītaye somasya pūrva pītaye
translated: Let the young horses, eager to win, bring thee hither, O Vayu, with the pole, to drink the Soma first, to drink the Soma first.

original: ūrdhvā te anu sūnṛtā manas tiṣṭhatu jānatī /
analyzed: ūrdhvā te anu sūnṛtā manaḥ tiṣṭhatu jānatī
translated: Let thy mind, which delights in the truth, stand erect, which knows.

original: niyutvatā rathenā yāhi dāvane vāyo makhasya dāvane //
analyzed: niyutvatā rathena ā yāhi dāvane vāyo makhasya dāvane
translated: Come with the team-drawn chariot to give, O Vayu, to give of the sacrifice.

original: mandantu tvā mandino vāyav indavo 'smat krāṇāsaḥ sukṛtā abhidyavo gobhiḥ krāṇā abhidyavaḥ /
analyzed: mandantu tvā mandinaḥ vāyo indavaḥ smat krāṇāsaḥ su kṛtāḥ abhidyavaḥ gobhiḥ krāṇāḥ abhidyavaḥ
translated: Let the gladdening drops gladden thee, O Vayu, our well-made, far-reaching aids, with the cows, far-reaching aids.

original: yad dha krāṇā iradhyai dakṣaṃ sacanta ūtayaḥ /
analyzed: yat ha krāṇāḥ iradhyai dakṣam sacante ūtayaḥ
translated: When the far-reaching ones are to be praised, the aids attend on the strong one.

original: sadhrīcīnā niyuto dāvane dhiya upa bruvata īṃ dhiyaḥ //
analyzed: sadhrīcīnāḥ niyutaḥ dāvane dhiyaḥ upa bruvate īm dhiyaḥ
translated: The teams, which come together, call on him to give, call on him to give with the thoughts.

original: vāyur yuṅkte rohitā vāyur aruṇā vāyū rathe ajirā dhuri voḷhave vahiṣṭhā dhuri voḷhave /
analyzed: vāyuḥ yuṅkte rohitā vāyuḥ aruṇā vāyuḥ rathe ajirā dhuri voḷhave vahiṣṭhā dhuri voḷhave
translated: Vayu yokes the red ones, Vayu the ruddy ones, Vayu the swift ones to the chariot, to the pole, to the most excellent pole, to the pole.

original: pra bodhayā purandhiṃ jāra ā sasatīm iva /🔽pra cakṣaya rodasī vāsayoṣasaḥ śravase vāsayoṣasaḥ //
analyzed: pra bodhaya purandhim jāraḥ ā sasatīm iva  pra cakṣaya rodasī vāsaya uṣasaḥ śravase vāsaya uṣasaḥ
translated: Awaken Purandhi, O lover, as if she were sleeping.🔽Open the two worlds, clothe the dawns, clothe them for glory, clothe them for glory.

original: tubhyam uṣāsaḥ śucayaḥ parāvati bhadrā vastrā tanvate daṃsu raśmiṣu citrā navyeṣu raśmiṣu /
analyzed: tubhyam uṣāsaḥ śucayaḥ parāvati bhadrā vastrā tanvate daṃsu raśmiṣu citrā navyeṣu raśmiṣu
translated: For you the pure dawns weave beautiful garments in the distance, in the rays, variegated, in the new rays.

original: tubhyaṃ dhenuḥ sabardughā viśvā vasūni dohate /🔽ajanayo maruto vakṣaṇābhyo diva ā vakṣaṇābhyaḥ //
analyzed: tubhyam dhenuḥ sabardughā viśvā vasūni dohate  ajanayaḥ marutaḥ vakṣaṇābhyaḥ divaḥ ā vakṣaṇābhyaḥ
translated: For you the cow, yielding all milk, milks out all good things.🔽The Maruts have generated you from the wombs, from the heavenly wombs.

original: tubhyaṃ śukrāsaḥ śucayas turaṇyavo madeṣūgrā iṣaṇanta bhurvaṇy apām iṣanta bhurvaṇi /
analyzed: tubhyam śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ turaṇyavaḥ madeṣu ugrāḥ iṣaṇanta bhurvaṇi apām iṣanta bhurvaṇi
translated: For you the bright, pure, swift ones, in their joys, the terrible ones, extend themselves, in the joy of the waters, in the joy of the waters.

original: tvāṃ tsārī dasamāno bhagam īṭṭe takvavīye /
analyzed: tvām tsārī dasamānaḥ bhagam īṭṭe takvavīye
translated: The swift one, the youngest, the fortunate one, chooses you for the Takavya people.

original: tvaṃ viśvasmād bhuvanāt pāsi dharmaṇāsuryāt pāsi dharmaṇā //
analyzed: tvam viśvasmāt bhuvanāt pāsi dharmaṇā asuryāt pāsi dharmaṇā
translated: You protect all beings by your righteous law, you protect by your righteous law from the Asura.

original: tvaṃ no vāyav eṣām apūrvyaḥ somānām prathamaḥ pītim arhasi sutānām pītim arhasi /
analyzed: tvam naḥ vāyo eṣām apūrvyaḥ somānām prathamaḥ pītim arhasi sutānām pītim arhasi
translated: You, O Vayu, of these (libations), the most ancient, deserve first to drink the Soma, of the pressed (juices), you deserve to drink.

original: uto vihutmatīnāṃ viśāṃ vavarjuṣīṇām /
analyzed: uta u vihutmatīnām viśām vavarjuṣīṇām
translated: And of the many tribes that move in different directions, that are eager (for booty),

original: viśvā it te dhenavo duhra āśiraṃ ghṛtaṃ duhrata āśiram //
analyzed: viśvāḥ id te dhenavaḥ duhre āśiram ghṛtam duhrate āśiram
translated: All the milch-cows yield thee the sweet, they yield ghee, the sweet, for the sweet.

original: stīrṇam barhir upa no yāhi vītaye sahasreṇa niyutā niyutvate śatinībhir niyutvate /
analyzed: stīrṇam barhiḥ upa naḥ yāhi vītaye sahasreṇa niyutā niyutvate śatinībhiḥ niyutvate
translated: The grass is strewn: come to us for the feast, with a thousand, with ten thousand teams, with a hundred teams, with ten thousand teams.

original: tubhyaṃ hi pūrvapītaye devā devāya yemire /
analyzed: tubhyam hi pūrva pītaye devāḥ devāya yemire
translated: For thee, O God, the Gods have prepared the first draught of the Soma.

original: pra te sutāso madhumanto asthiran madāya kratve asthiran //
analyzed: pra te sutāsaḥ madhumantaḥ asthiran madāya kratve asthiran
translated: Thy gladdening juices have been pressed, they have been pressed for the rite.

original: tubhyāyaṃ somaḥ paripūto adribhi spārhā vasānaḥ pari kośam arṣati śukrā vasāno arṣati /
analyzed: tubhya ayam somaḥ paripūtaḥ adribhiḥ spārhā vasānaḥ pari kośam arṣati śukrā vasānaḥ arṣati
translated: This Soma, purified with stones, wearing desirable forms, flows around the vat, flows around, wearing bright forms.

original: tavāyam bhāga āyuṣu somo deveṣu hūyate /🔽vaha vāyo niyuto yāhy asmayur juṣāṇo yāhy asmayuḥ //
analyzed: tava ayam bhāgaḥ āyuṣu somaḥ deveṣu hūyate  vaha vāyo niyutaḥ yāhi asmayuḥ juṣāṇaḥ yāhi asmayuḥ
translated: This Soma is thy share among the living beings, is offered to the Gods.🔽O Vayu, bring thy teams, come with those that belong to thee, come, delighting, with those that belong to thee.

original: ā no niyudbhiḥ śatinībhir adhvaraṃ sahasriṇībhir upa yāhi vītaye vāyo havyāni vītaye /
analyzed: ā naḥ niyudbhiḥ śatinībhiḥ adhvaram sahasriṇībhiḥ upa yāhi vītaye vāyo havyāni vītaye
translated: With thy reins, with thy hundred reins, with thy thousand reins, come to the sacrifice for the feast, O Vayu, come to the offerings for the feast.

original: tavāyam bhāga ṛtviyaḥ saraśmiḥ sūrye sacā /
analyzed: tava ayam bhāgaḥ ṛtviyaḥ sa raśmiḥ sūrye sacā
translated: This is thy proper share, O Vayu, with the rays of the sun.

original: adhvaryubhir bharamāṇā ayaṃsata vāyo śukrā ayaṃsata //
analyzed: adhvaryubhiḥ bharamāṇāḥ ayaṃsata vāyo śukrāḥ ayaṃsata
translated: The priests, bearing (the Soma), have come with the bright (rays), O Vayu, have come.

original: ā vāṃ ratho niyutvān vakṣad avase 'bhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni vītaye vāyo havyāni vītaye /
analyzed: ā vām rathaḥ niyutvān vakṣat avase bhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni vītaye vāyo havyāni vītaye
translated: May thy team-borne chariot bring you for help to our well-ordered sacrifices, to the feast, O Vayu, to the offerings, to the feast.

original: pibatam madhvo andhasaḥ pūrvapeyaṃ hi vāṃ hitam /
analyzed: pibatam madhvaḥ andhasaḥ pūrvapeyam hi vām hitam
translated: Drink ye of the sweet juice, for the first draught is set forth for you.

original: vāyav ā candreṇa rādhasā gatam indraś ca rādhasā gatam //
analyzed: vāyo ā candreṇa rādhasā gatam indraḥ ca rādhasā gatam
translated: O Vayu and Indra, come with the moon and with bounty, come with bounty.

original: ā vāṃ dhiyo vavṛtyur adhvarāṃ upemam indum marmṛjanta vājinam āśum atyaṃ na vājinam /
analyzed: ā vām dhiyaḥ vavṛtyuḥ adhvarān upa imam indum marmṛjanta vājinam āśum atyam na vājinam
translated: Your thoughts have turned to the rites, they have anointed this swift and strong juice, the swift and strong horse.

original: teṣām pibatam asmayū ā no gantam ihotyā /
analyzed: teṣām pibatam asmayū ā naḥ gantam iha ūtyā
translated: Of these, drink ye, come to us, come hither.

original: indravāyū sutānām adribhir yuvam madāya vājadā yuvam //
analyzed: indra vāyū sutānām adribhiḥ yuvam madāya vāja dā yuvam
translated: O Indra and Vayu, with the stones, for the rapture, ye who give strength, for the rapture.

original: ime vāṃ somā apsv ā sutā ihādhvaryubhir bharamāṇā ayaṃsata vāyo śukrā ayaṃsata /
analyzed: ime vām somāḥ apsu ā sutāḥ iha adhvaryubhiḥ bharamāṇāḥ ayaṃsata vāyo śukrāḥ ayaṃsata
translated: These your Somas, pressed in the waters, have come hither, brought by the Adhvaryus, O Vayu, the bright ones have come.

original: ete vām abhy asṛkṣata tiraḥ pavitram āśavaḥ /
analyzed: ete vām abhī asṛkṣata tiras pavitram āśavaḥ
translated: These have flowed forth to you across the filter, the swift ones.

original: yuvāyavo 'ti romāṇy avyayā somāso aty avyayā //
analyzed: yuvāyavaḥ ti romāṇi avyayā somāsaḥ ati avyayā
translated: The young Somas have flowed through the fleecy cloth, the young Somas.

original: ati vāyo sasato yāhi śaśvato yatra grāvā vadati tatra gacchataṃ gṛham indraś ca gacchatam /
analyzed: ati vāyo sasataḥ yāhi śaśvataḥ yatra grāvā vadati tatra gacchatam gṛham indraḥ ca gacchatam
translated: O Vayu, pass beyond the ever-moving, go where the pressing-stone speaks, go to the house, go to the house, O Indra.

original: vi sūnṛtā dadṛśe rīyate ghṛtam ā pūrṇayā niyutā yātho adhvaram indraś ca yātho adhvaram //
analyzed: vi sūnṛtā dadṛśe rīyate ghṛtam ā pūrṇayā niyutā yāthaḥ adhvaram indraḥ ca yāthaḥ adhvaram
translated: The truth is seen, the ghee is poured out, full of you, the appointed ones come to the sacrifice, come to the sacrifice, O Indra.

original: atrāha tad vahethe madhva āhutiṃ yam aśvattham upatiṣṭhanta jāyavo 'sme te santu jāyavaḥ /
analyzed: atra aha tat vahethe madhvaḥ āhutim yam aśvattham upatiṣṭhanta jāyavaḥ sme te santu jāyavaḥ
translated: Here they say: Carry that sweet oblation, the ashvattha tree which the prosperous ones attend upon. Let prosperity be ours.

original: sākaṃ gāvaḥ suvate pacyate yavo na te vāya upa dasyanti dhenavo nāpa dasyanti dhenavaḥ //
analyzed: sākam gāvaḥ suvate pacyate yavaḥ na te vāyo upa dasyanti dhenavaḥ na apa dasyanti dhenavaḥ
translated: Let the barley ripen together with the well-milking cow. Let not your milch cows be lost to us. Let not your milch cows be lost.

original: ime ye te su vāyo bāhvojaso 'ntar nadī te patayanty ukṣaṇo mahi vrādhanta ukṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ime ye te su vāyo bāhu ojasaḥ ntar nadī te patayanti ukṣaṇaḥ mahi vrādhantaḥ ukṣaṇaḥ
translated: These, O Vayu, who are in your mighty arms, who fly within the rivers as bulls, they increase greatly as bulls.

original: dhanvañ cid ye anāśavo jīrāś cid agiraukasaḥ /
analyzed: dhanvam cit ye anāśavaḥ jīrāḥ cit a giraukasaḥ
translated: Even the slow ones, the old ones who dwell in the mountains,

original: sūryasyeva raśmayo durniyantavo hastayor durniyantavaḥ //
analyzed: sūryasya iva raśmayaḥ durniyantavaḥ hastayoḥ durniyantavaḥ
translated: are hard to restrain in your hands, like the rays of the sun, hard to restrain.

original: pra su jyeṣṭhaṃ nicirābhyām bṛhan namo havyam matim bharatā mṛḷayadbhyāṃ svādiṣṭham mṛḷayadbhyām /
analyzed: pra su jyeṣṭham nicirābhyām bṛhat namaḥ havyam matim bharata mṛḍayadbhyām svādiṣṭham mṛḍayadbhyām
translated: Bring the best, the highest, the oblation, the homage, the thought, to be appeased by the two most powerful, the sweetest, to be appeased.

original: tā samrājā ghṛtāsutī yajñeyajña upastutā /
analyzed: tā samrājā ghṛta āsutī yajñeyajñe upastutā
translated: Those two Emperors, longing for ghee, praised at each sacrifice,

original: athainoḥ kṣatraṃ na kutaś canādhṛṣe devatvaṃ nū cid ādhṛṣe //
analyzed: atha enoḥ kṣatram na kutas cana ādhṛṣe deva tvam nu cit ādhṛṣe
translated: their lordship is not to be overcome by anyone, their godhead is not to be overcome.

original: adarśi gātur urave varīyasī panthā ṛtasya sam ayaṃsta raśmibhiś cakṣur bhagasya raśmibhiḥ /
analyzed: adarśi gātuḥ urave varīyasī panthāḥ ṛtasya sam ayaṃsta raśmibhiḥ cakṣuḥ bhagasya raśmibhiḥ
translated: The path of the vast expanse has been seen, the path of truth has been joined with the rays, the eye of Bhaga with the rays.

original: dyukṣam mitrasya sādanam aryamṇo varuṇasya ca /
analyzed: dyukṣam mitrasya sādanam aryamṇaḥ varuṇasya ca
translated: The seat of Dyu, of Mitra, of Aryaman, of Varuna,

original: athā dadhāte bṛhad ukthyaṃ vaya upastutyam bṛhad vayaḥ //
analyzed: athā dadhāte bṛhat ukthyam vayaḥ upastutyam bṛhat vayaḥ
translated: Then they bestow the great, the worthy of lauds, the great life,

original: jyotiṣmatīm aditiṃ dhārayatkṣitiṃ svarvatīm ā sacete divedive jāgṛvāṃsā divedive /
analyzed: jyotiṣmatīm aditim dhārayat kṣitim svarvatīm ā sacete dive dive jāgṛvāṃsā dive dive
translated: The radiant, earth-supporting Aditi, the heaven-reaching, they who are watchful day by day, watchful day by day.

original: jyotiṣmat kṣatram āśāte ādityā dānunas patī /
analyzed: jyotiṣmat kṣatram āśāte ādityā dānunas patī
translated: The radiant lordship the Adityas have gained, the lords of the gift.

original: mitras tayor varuṇo yātayajjano 'ryamā yātayajjanaḥ //
analyzed: mitraḥ tayoḥ varuṇaḥ yātayat janaḥ ryamā yātayat janaḥ
translated: Mitra and Varuna of that people who offer sacrifice, Aryaman of that people who offer sacrifice.

original: ayam mitrāya varuṇāya śantamaḥ somo bhūtv avapāneṣv ābhago devo deveṣv ābhagaḥ /
analyzed: ayam mitrāya varuṇāya śantamaḥ somaḥ bhūtu avapāneṣu ābhagaḥ devaḥ deveṣu ābhagaḥ
translated: This is the most delightful Soma for Mitra and Varuna, becoming a share in the libations, a god, a share among the gods.

original: taṃ devāso juṣerata viśve adya sajoṣasaḥ /
analyzed: tam devāsaḥ juṣerata viśve adya sajoṣasaḥ
translated: May the All-Gods rejoice in him today, of one mind.

original: tathā rājānā karatho yad īmaha ṛtāvānā yad īmahe //
analyzed: tathā rājānā karathaḥ yat īmahe ṛtāvānā yat īmahe
translated: Thus, O Kings, do ye make it, as we implore you, O ye who are righteous, as we implore you.

original: yo mitrāya varuṇāyāvidhaj jano 'narvāṇaṃ tam pari pāto aṃhaso dāśvāṃsam martam aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya avidhat janaḥ narvāṇam tam pari pātaḥ aṃhasaḥ dāśvāṃsam martam aṃhasaḥ
translated: The man who injures Mitra and Varuna, protect him from the unerring evil, the mortal who gives offerings from the evil.

original: tam aryamābhi rakṣaty ṛjūyantam anu vratam /
analyzed: tam aryamā abhi rakṣati ṛjūyantam anu vratam
translated: Aryaman protects him who acts righteously, who follows the rule,

original: ukthair ya enoḥ paribhūṣati vrataṃ stomair ābhūṣati vratam //
analyzed: ukthaiḥ yaḥ enoḥ paribhūṣati vratam stomaiḥ ābhūṣati vratam
translated: He who adorns their rule with hymns, adorns it with praises.

original: namo dive bṛhate rodasībhyām mitrāya vocaṃ varuṇāya mīḷhuṣe sumṛḷīkāya mīḷhuṣe /
analyzed: namaḥ dive bṛhate rodasībhyām mitrāya vocam varuṇāya mīḷhuṣe su mṛḷīkāya mīḷhuṣe
translated: Homage to the sky, to the great heaven and earth. To Mitra I call, to bountiful Varuna, to the very gracious bountiful one.

original: indram agnim upa stuhi dyukṣam aryamaṇam bhagam /
analyzed: indram agnim upa stuhi dyukṣam aryamaṇam bhagam
translated: Praise Indra and Agni, the sky-dwelling Aryaman and Bhaga.

original: jyog jīvantaḥ prajayā sacemahi somasyotī sacemahi //
analyzed: jyok jīvantaḥ prajayā sacemahi somasya ūtī sacemahi
translated: May we live long, united with offspring, may we be united with Soma's overlordship.

original: ūtī devānāṃ vayam indravanto maṃsīmahi svayaśaso marudbhiḥ /
analyzed: ūtī devānām vayam indravantaḥ maṃsīmahi sva yaśasaḥ marudbhiḥ
translated: With the overlordship of the gods, may we be regarded as self-famous, with Indra and the Maruts.

original: agnir mitro varuṇaḥ śarma yaṃsan tad aśyāma maghavāno vayaṃ ca //
analyzed: agniḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ śarma yaṃsan tat aśyāma maghavānaḥ vayam ca
translated: May Agni, Mitra, Varuna grant us protection. May we, the wealthy ones, and you, obtain that.

original: suṣumā yātam adribhir gośrītā matsarā ime somāso matsarā ime /
analyzed: suṣuma yātam adribhiḥ go śrītāḥ matsarāḥ ime somāsaḥ matsarāḥ ime
translated: Come, O ye two, with the stones, accompanied by the cows, these gladdening Soma-juices, these gladdening ones.

original: ā rājānā divispṛśāsmatrā gantam upa naḥ /🔽ime vām mitrāvaruṇā gavāśiraḥ somāḥ śukrā gavāśiraḥ //
analyzed: ā rājānā divispṛśā asmatrā gantam upa naḥ  ime vām mitrāvaruṇā gavāśiraḥ somāḥ śukrāḥ gavāśiraḥ
translated: Come hither, O ye two kings, ye who touch the sky, come hither to us.🔽These, O Mitra-Varuna, the Soma-juices with the heads of cows, the bright ones with the heads of cows.

original: ima ā yātam indavaḥ somāso dadhyāśiraḥ sutāso dadhyāśiraḥ /
analyzed: ime ā yātam indavaḥ somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ sutāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ
translated: Come hither, O ye two, these drops, these Soma-juices with curds on their heads, these pressed juices with curds on their heads.

original: uta vām uṣaso budhi sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ /
analyzed: uta vām uṣasaḥ budhi sākam sūryasya raśmibhiḥ
translated: Or at your rising, O Dawn, together with the rays of the sun,

original: suto mitrāya varuṇāya pītaye cārur ṛtāya pītaye //
analyzed: sutaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya pītaye cāruḥ ṛtāya pītaye
translated: The juice is pressed for Mitra, for Varuna to drink, the beautiful one for the righteous to drink.

original: tāṃ vāṃ dhenuṃ na vāsarīm aṃśuṃ duhanty adribhiḥ somaṃ duhanty adribhiḥ /
analyzed: tām vām dhenum na vāsarīm aṃśum duhanti adribhiḥ somam duhanti adribhiḥ
translated: They milk your cow, as it were, the dawn, with the stones, they milk the Amsu with the stones, they milk the Soma with the stones.

original: asmatrā gantam upa no 'rvāñcā somapītaye /
analyzed: asmatrā gantam upa naḥ rvāñcā soma pītaye
translated: Come hither to us, turn ye hitherward to drink the Soma.

original: ayaṃ vām mitrāvaruṇā nṛbhiḥ sutaḥ soma ā pītaye sutaḥ //
analyzed: ayam vām mitrāvaruṇā nṛbhiḥ sutaḥ somaḥ ā pītaye sutaḥ
translated: This Soma, O Mitra-Varuṇa, is pressed for you by men, pressed for you to drink.

original: prapra pūṣṇas tuvijātasya śasyate mahitvam asya tavaso na tandate stotram asya na tandate /
analyzed: pra pra pūṣṇaḥ tuvi jātasya śasyate mahi tvam asya tavasaḥ na tandate stotram asya na tandate
translated: The greatness of the mighty-born Pūṣan is proclaimed, the majesty of this impetuous one does not fail, the praise of this does not fail.

original: arcāmi sumnayann aham antyūtim mayobhuvam /
analyzed: arcāmi sumnayan aham antyūtim mayobhuvam
translated: I worship, seeking bliss, the most near-approaching, the gladdener,

original: viśvasya yo mana āyuyuve makho deva āyuyuve makhaḥ //
analyzed: viśvasya yaḥ manaḥ āyuyuve makhaḥ devaḥ āyuyuve makhaḥ
translated: The god who has come to the thought of all, the sacrifice, who has come to the sacrifice.

original: pra hi tvā pūṣann ajiraṃ na yāmani stomebhiḥ kṛṇva ṛṇavo yathā mṛdha uṣṭro na pīparo mṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: pra hi tvā pūṣan ajiram na yāmani stomebhiḥ kṛṇve ṛṇavaḥ yathā mṛdhaḥ uṣṭraḥ na pīparaḥ mṛdhaḥ
translated: O Pūṣan, I make thee swift as a horse in the journey, as a debt by means of the hymns, as a foe by means of the hymns, as a foe by means of the hymns.

original: huve yat tvā mayobhuvaṃ devaṃ sakhyāya martyaḥ /
analyzed: huve yat tvā mayobhuvam devam sakhyāya martyaḥ
translated: I call on thee, O god, the gladdener, as a mortal (calls) on a friend,

original: asmākam āṅgūṣān dyumninas kṛdhi vājeṣu dyumninas kṛdhi //
analyzed: asmākam āṅgūṣān dyumninaḥ kṛdhi vājeṣu dyumninaḥ kṛdhi
translated: Make our praises glorious, make them glorious in battles.

original: yasya te pūṣan sakhye vipanyavaḥ kratvā cit santo 'vasā bubhujrira iti kratvā bubhujrire /
analyzed: yasya te pūṣan sakhye vipanyavaḥ kratvā cit santaḥ vasāḥ bubhujrire iti kratvā bubhujrire
translated: O Pūṣan, whose companions in thy friendship, though they be by thought, have quickly enjoyed themselves by thy favour, have quickly enjoyed themselves by thought.

original: tām anu tvā navīyasīṃ niyutaṃ rāya īmahe /
analyzed: tām anu tvā navīyasīm niyutam rāyaḥ īmahe
translated: In accordance with that most recent team of thine, we seek wealth.

original: aheḷamāna uruśaṃsa sarī bhava vājevāje sarī bhava //
analyzed: a heḍamānaḥ uru śaṃsa sarī bhava vājevāje sarī bhava
translated: Be free from sickness, O wide-ruler, be swift, be swift in every contest.

original: asyā ū ṣu ṇa upa sātaye bhuvo 'heḷamāno rarivāṃ ajāśva śravasyatām ajāśva /
analyzed: asyāḥ u su naḥ upa sātaye bhuvaḥ heḍamānaḥ rarivān ajāśva śravasyatām ajāśva
translated: For this, O thou who art to be invoked, be thou present for our help, O thou who hast long hair and goats for thy horses, O thou who hast long hair and goats for thy horses, O thou who art to be invoked.

original: o ṣu tvā vavṛtīmahi stomebhir dasma sādhubhiḥ /
analyzed: ā u su tvā vavṛtīmahi stomebhiḥ dasma sādhubhiḥ
translated: O thou wondrous one, we will turn thee hither with our good hymns.

original: nahi tvā pūṣann atimanya āghṛṇe na te sakhyam apahnuve //
analyzed: nahi tvā pūṣan atimanye āghṛṇe na te sakhyam apahnuve
translated: For, O Pusan, no one surpasses thee, O thou who art free from anger; thy friendship no one can take away.

original: astu śrauṣaṭ puro agnīṃ dhiyā dadha ā nu tac chardho divyaṃ vṛṇīmaha indravāyū vṛṇīmahe /
analyzed: astu śrauṣaṭ puras agnīm dhiyā dadhe ā nu tat śardhaḥ divyam vṛṇīmahe indra vāyū vṛṇīmahe
translated: Let there be hearing. Let us place Agni in the front with our thought. Now we choose that heavenly host, we choose Indra and Vayu.

original: yad dha krāṇā vivasvati nābhā saṃdāyi navyasī /
analyzed: yat ha krāṇā vivasvati nābhā saṃdāyi navyasī
translated: What time, O ye two, ye who are to be invoked, have joined together the new navel in the all-supporting,

original: adha pra sū na upa yantu dhītayo devāṃ acchā na dhītayaḥ //
analyzed: adha pra su naḥ upa yantu dhītayaḥ devān acchā na dhītayaḥ
translated: Hitherward now let our hymns come to the gods, let our hymns come to the gods.

original: yad dha tyan mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtād adhy ādadāthe anṛtaṃ svena manyunā dakṣasya svena manyunā /
analyzed: yat ha tyad mitrāvaruṇau ṛtāt adhi ādadāthe anṛtam svena manyunā dakṣasya svena manyunā
translated: What time, O Mitra-Varuna, ye have taken from the true the untruth, with your own wrath, with your own wrath of Daksha,

original: yuvor itthādhi sadmasv apaśyāma hiraṇyayam /
analyzed: yuvoḥ itthā adhi sadmasu apaśyāma hiraṇyayam
translated: In your own abodes we have beheld that golden one,

original: dhībhiś cana manasā svebhir akṣabhiḥ somasya svebhir akṣabhiḥ //
analyzed: dhībhiḥ cana manasā svebhiḥ akṣabhiḥ somasya svebhiḥ akṣabhiḥ
translated: With our own thoughts, with our own eyes, with our own eyes of Soma.

original: yuvāṃ stomebhir devayanto aśvināśrāvayanta iva ślokam āyavo yuvāṃ havyābhy āyavaḥ /
analyzed: yuvām stomebhiḥ devayantaḥ aśvinā aśrāvayanta iva ślokam āyavaḥ yuvām havyā abhi āyavaḥ
translated: Ye two, O ye who are to be invoked, whom the pious invoke with their hymns, as if inviting the life-giving song, ye two whom the life-giving ones invite with offerings,

original: yuvor viśvā adhi śriyaḥ pṛkṣaś ca viśvavedasā /🔽pruṣāyante vām pavayo hiraṇyaye rathe dasrā hiraṇyaye //
analyzed: yuvoḥ viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ pṛkṣaḥ ca viśva vedasā  pruṣāyante vām pavayaḥ hiraṇyaye rathe dasrā hiraṇyaye
translated: All glories and all food are in you, O you who find all things.🔽Your purifying (waters) flow for you on your golden chariot, O wondrous ones, on your golden chariot.

original: aceti dasrā vy u nākam ṛṇvatho yuñjate vāṃ rathayujo diviṣṭiṣv adhvasmāno diviṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: aceti dasrā vi u nākam yuñjate vām ratha yujaḥ diviṣṭiṣu adhvasmānaḥ diviṣṭiṣu
translated: The wondrous ones move, they extend the vault; they yoke your chariot-oxen in the heavenly rites, free from sin in the heavenly rites.

original: adhi vāṃ sthāma vandhure rathe dasrā hiraṇyaye /
analyzed: adhi vām sthāma vandhure rathe dasrā hiraṇyaye
translated: We place you on the seat of the chariot, O wondrous ones, on the golden chariot.

original: patheva yantāv anuśāsatā rajo 'ñjasā śāsatā rajaḥ //🔽śacībhir naḥ śacīvasū divā naktaṃ daśasyatam /
analyzed: pathā iva yantau anuśāsatā rajaḥ ñjasā śāsatā rajaḥ  śacībhiḥ naḥ śacī vasū divā naktam daśasyatam
translated: Like two charioteers on the path, you who guide the region, you who guide the region directly.🔽O you two rich in power, favour us with your powers by day and by night.

original: mā vāṃ rātir upa dasat kadā canāsmad rātiḥ kadā cana //
analyzed: mā vām rātiḥ upa dasat kadā cana asmat rātiḥ kadā cana
translated: Let your gift never fail us, your gift never fail us at any time.

original: vṛṣann indra vṛṣapāṇāsa indava ime sutā adriṣutāsa udbhidas tubhyaṃ sutāsa udbhidaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣan indra vṛṣapāṇāsaḥ indavaḥ ime sutāḥ adriṣutāsaḥ udbhidaḥ tubhyam sutāsaḥ udbhidaḥ
translated: O bull, O Indra, these juices, juices of the bull, these juices pressed on the stone, these springing (juices), are pressed for you, these springing (juices).

original: te tvā mandantu dāvane mahe citrāya rādhase /
analyzed: te tvā mandantu dāvane mahe citrāya rādhase
translated: Let them gladden you to give (us) great and wondrous bounty.

original: gīrbhir girvāha stavamāna ā gahi sumṛḷīko na ā gahi //
analyzed: gīrbhiḥ gir vāha stavamānaḥ ā gahi su mṛḍīkaḥ naḥ ā gahi
translated: Come, O you who delight in praise, praised with hymns, come to us, well-disposed, come to us.

original: o ṣū ṇo agne śṛṇuhi tvam īḷito devebhyo bravasi yajñiyebhyo rājabhyo yajñiyebhyaḥ /
analyzed: ā u su naḥ agne śṛṇuhi tvam īḍitaḥ devebhyaḥ bravasi yajñiyebhyaḥ rājabhyaḥ yajñiyebhyaḥ
translated: O Agni, do thou listen to us, being invoked, thou speakest to the gods who are worthy of sacrifice, to the kings who are worthy of sacrifice.

original: yad dha tyām aṅgirobhyo dhenuṃ devā adattana /
analyzed: yat ha tyām aṅgirobhyaḥ dhenum devāḥ adattana
translated: When the gods gave unto the Angirases that milch cow,

original: vi tāṃ duhre aryamā kartarī sacāṃ eṣa tāṃ veda me sacā //🔽mo ṣu vo asmad abhi tāni pauṃsyā sanā bhūvan dyumnāni mota jāriṣur asmat purota jāriṣuḥ /
analyzed: vi tām duhre aryamā kartari sacā eṣa tām veda me sacā  mā u su vaḥ asmat abhi tāni pauṃsyā sanā bhūvan dyumnāni mā uta jāriṣuḥ asmat purā uta jāriṣuḥ
translated: Then Aryaman milked her, and the milker is this one. He knows her together with me.🔽Let not those manly deeds of yours, O Maruts, be for us in the past, let not your glories be for us in the past. Let not your wrath be for us in the past.

original: yad vaś citraṃ yugeyuge navyaṃ ghoṣād amartyam /
analyzed: yat vaḥ citram yuge yuge navyam ghoṣāt amartyam
translated: Whatever wonderful thing you have, O Maruts, in every age, new, from the sound, immortal,

original: asmāsu tan maruto yac ca duṣṭaraṃ didhṛtā yac ca duṣṭaram //
analyzed: asmāsu tat marutaḥ yat ca duṣṭaram didhṛta yat ca duṣṭaram
translated: That, O Maruts, is with us, and what is most terrible, what is most terrible, O you who are to be held.

original: dadhyaṅ ha me januṣam pūrvo aṅgirāḥ priyamedhaḥ kaṇvo atrir manur vidus te me pūrve manur viduḥ /
analyzed: dadhyaṅ ha me januṣam pūrvaḥ aṅgirāḥ priyamedhaḥ kaṇvaḥ atriḥ manuḥ viduḥ te me pūrve manuḥ viduḥ
translated: Dadhyañc, the son of Atharvan, the Angiras, Priyamedha, Kaṇva, Atri, Manu, know my birth. They, the former, know my birth.

original: teṣāṃ deveṣv āyatir asmākaṃ teṣu nābhayaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām deveṣu āyatiḥ asmākam teṣu nābhayaḥ
translated: Their course is with the gods, their navel is with us.

original: teṣām padena mahy ā name girendrāgnī ā name girā //
analyzed: teṣām padena mahi ā name girā indra agnī ā name girā
translated: By their order let the mountain bow to me, let Indra and Agni bow to me with the hymn.

original: hotā yakṣad vanino vanta vāryam bṛhaspatir yajati vena ukṣabhiḥ puruvārebhir ukṣabhiḥ /
analyzed: hotā yakṣat vaninaḥ vanta vāryam bṛhaspatiḥ yajati venaḥ ukṣabhiḥ puru vārebhiḥ ukṣabhiḥ
translated: Let the Hotar worship the Vanins, the best of the Vanins, with the bull-like ones, with the many-ruling ones, with the bull-like ones.

original: jagṛbhmā dūraādiśaṃ ślokam adrer adha tmanā /
analyzed: jagṛbhmā dūraādiśam ślokam adreḥ adha tmanā
translated: We have grasped the far-reaching praise of the mountain by ourselves.

original: adhārayad ararindāni sukratuḥ purū sadmāni sukratuḥ //
analyzed: adhārayat ararindāni sukratuḥ purū sadmāni sukratuḥ
translated: The wise one has supported the gifts of the enemy, many abodes, the wise one.

original: ye devāso divy ekādaśa stha pṛthivyām adhy ekādaśa stha /
analyzed: ye devāsaḥ divi ekādaśa stha pṛthivyām adhi ekādaśa stha
translated: Ye gods who are eleven in heaven, who are eleven on earth,

original: apsukṣito mahinaikādaśa stha te devāso yajñam imaṃ juṣadhvam //🔽vediṣade priyadhāmāya sudyute dhāsim iva pra bharā yonim agnaye /
analyzed: apsukṣitaḥ mahinā ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ yajñam imam juṣadhvam  vediṣade priya dhāmāya su dyute dhāsim iva pra bhara yonim agnaye
translated: Who are eleven in the waters, be ye pleased with this sacrifice.🔽To the altar, to the dear abode, to the well-shining one, place the oblation as a womb for Agni.

original: vastreṇeva vāsayā manmanā śuciṃ jyotīrathaṃ śukravarṇaṃ tamohanam //
analyzed: vastreṇa iva vāsaya manmanā śucim jyotīratham śukra varṇam tamaḥ hanam
translated: With thought, as with a garment, clothe the pure one, the light-chariot, of bright hue, the dispeller of darkness.

original: abhi dvijanmā trivṛd annam ṛjyate saṃvatsare vāvṛdhe jagdham ī punaḥ /
analyzed: abhi dvi janmā trivṛt annam ṛjyate saṃvatsare vāvṛdhe jagdham ī punar
translated: The twice-born one, the threefold one, is nourished with food; in the year he has grown, having eaten again.

original: anyasyāsā jihvayā jenyo vṛṣā ny anyena vanino mṛṣṭa vāraṇaḥ //
analyzed: anyasya āsā jihvayā jenyaḥ vṛṣā ni anyena vaninaḥ mṛṣṭa vāraṇaḥ
translated: The bull, the worthy one, with another's tongue, with another has the tree-crusher been anointed.

original: kṛṣṇaprutau vevije asya sakṣitā ubhā tarete abhi mātarā śiśum /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa prutau vevije asya sakṣitau ubhā tarete abhi mātarā śiśum
translated: In the black-moving, swift one, his two mothers are placed, the two carry the child.

original: prācājihvaṃ dhvasayantaṃ tṛṣucyutam ā sācyaṃ kupayaṃ vardhanam pituḥ //
analyzed: prācājihvam dhvasayantam tṛṣu cyutam ā sācyam kupayam vardhanam pituḥ
translated: The one with the tongue turned to the east, the one who destroys, the one who falls from thirst, the one who is to be brought together, the young one, the increaser of the father.

original: mumukṣvo manave mānavasyate raghudruvaḥ kṛṣṇasītāsa ū juvaḥ /
analyzed: mumukṣvaḥ manave mānavasyate raghudruvaḥ kṛṣṇa sītāsaḥ u juvaḥ
translated: The swift ones, the black-backed ones, the young ones, are eager to be set free for Manu, the son of Manu.

original: asamanā ajirāso raghuṣyado vātajūtā upa yujyanta āśavaḥ //
analyzed: asamanāḥ ajirāsaḥ raghuṣyadaḥ vāta jūtāḥ upa yujyante āśavaḥ
translated: The unequalled ones, the swift ones, the swift-moving ones, the wind-driven ones, the swift ones, are yoked.

original: ād asya te dhvasayanto vṛtherate kṛṣṇam abhvam mahi varpaḥ karikrataḥ /
analyzed: āt asya te dhvasayantaḥ vṛthā īrate kṛṣṇam abhvam mahi varpaḥ karikrataḥ
translated: The destroyers of this, O cloud, are delighted with thy sport, the great black terror, the wonderful form of the roaring one.

original: yat sīm mahīm avanim prābhi marmṛśad abhiśvasan stanayann eti nānadat //🔽bhūṣan na yo 'dhi babhrūṣu namnate vṛṣeva patnīr abhy eti roruvat /
analyzed: yat sīm mahīm avanim pra abhi marmṛśat abhiśvasan stanayan eti nānadat  bhūṣan na yaḥ dhi babhrūṣu nannate vṛṣā iva patnīḥ abhī eti roruvat
translated: When he touches the great earth, the ground, breathing upon it, he goes forth, thundering, roaring.🔽He who shines over the brown ones, who bends over them, goes forth roaring, like a bull to his mates.

original: ojāyamānas tanvaś ca śumbhate bhīmo na śṛṅgā davidhāva durgṛbhiḥ //
analyzed: ojāyamānaḥ tanvaḥ ca śumbhate bhīmaḥ na śṛṅgā davidhāva durgṛbhiḥ
translated: Striving for strength, he adorns his own body. Terrible, with horns hard to grasp, he rushes on.

original: sa saṃstiro viṣṭiraḥ saṃ gṛbhāyati jānann eva jānatīr nitya ā śaye /
analyzed: sa saṃstiraḥ viṣṭiraḥ sam gṛbhāyati jānan eva jānatīḥ nityaḥ ā śaye
translated: He gathers to himself the scattered, the scattered, the known, the knowing ones. He lies down, as is his wont, with the known ones.

original: punar vardhante api yanti devyam anyad varpaḥ pitroḥ kṛṇvate sacā //🔽tam agruvaḥ keśinīḥ saṃ hi rebhira ūrdhvās tasthur mamruṣīḥ prāyave punaḥ /
analyzed: punar vardhante api yanti devyam anyat varpaḥ pitroḥ kṛṇvate sacā  tam agruvaḥ keśinīḥ sam hi rebhire ūrdhvāḥ tasthuḥ mamruṣīḥ prāyave punar
translated: They increase again, they go to the divine one. Together they make another form than that of their parents.🔽The she-clouds, with their leader, the rain-cloud, stand up erect, the life-giving ones, for the sake of the rain.

original: tāsāṃ jarām pramuñcann eti nānadad asum paraṃ janayañ jīvam astṛtam //🔽adhīvāsam pari mātū rihann aha tuvigrebhiḥ satvabhir yāti vi jrayaḥ /
analyzed: tāsām jarām pramuñcan eti nānadat asum param janayam jīvam astṛtam  adhīvāsam pari mātuḥ rihan aha tuvigrebhiḥ satvabhiḥ yāti vi jrayaḥ
translated: Sending forth their old age, he goes forth, thundering, producing the highest life, the living, the undecaying.🔽Licking the dwelling place of his mother, he goes forth with his mighty forces, with his strong powers, with his rays.

original: vayo dadhat padvate rerihat sadānu śyenī sacate vartanīr aha //
analyzed: vayaḥ dadhat padvate rerihat sadā anu śyenī sacate vartanīḥ aha
translated: Bearing the life, licking the moving one, the she-cloud follows the paths of the rain-cloud.

original: asmākam agne maghavatsu dīdihy adha śvasīvān vṛṣabho damūnāḥ /
analyzed: asmākam agne maghavatsu dīdihi adha śvasīvān vṛṣabhaḥ damūnāḥ
translated: Shine among us, O Agni, among the wealthy, like a breathing bull, the friend of the house.

original: avāsyā śiśumatīr adīder varmeva yutsu parijarbhurāṇaḥ //
analyzed: śiśumatīḥ adīdeḥ varmā iva yutsu parijarbhurāṇaḥ
translated: Thou hast shone forth, O thou of the house, with thy young ones, like a coat of mail, O thou that art to be praised, when the warriors are eager.

original: idam agne sudhitaṃ durdhitād adhi priyād u cin manmanaḥ preyo astu te /
analyzed: idam agne sudhitam durdhitāt adhi priyāt u cit manmanaḥ preyaḥ astu te
translated: This, O Agni, is well-ordered for thee, better than the ill-ordered, dearer than the dear, from thy mind.

original: yat te śukraṃ tanvo rocate śuci tenāsmabhyaṃ vanase ratnam ā tvam //
analyzed: yat te śukram tanvaḥ rocate śuci tena asmabhyam vanase ratnam ā tvam
translated: What is pure and shining in thy body, by that thou shalt bestow wealth on us.

original: rathāya nāvam uta no gṛhāya nityāritrām padvatīṃ rāsy agne /
analyzed: rathāya nāvam uta naḥ gṛhāya nitya aritrām padvatīm rāsi agne
translated: For our chariot, O Agni, and for our house, give us a boat with constant oars and many feet.

original: asmākaṃ vīrāṃ uta no maghono janāṃś ca yā pārayāc charma yā ca //🔽abhī no agna uktham ij juguryā dyāvākṣāmā sindhavaś ca svagūrtāḥ /
analyzed: asmākam vīrān uta naḥ maghonaḥ janān ca yā pārayāt śarma yā ca  abhī naḥ agne uktham id juguryāḥ dyāvākṣāmā sindhavaḥ ca sva gūrtāḥ
translated: For our heroes and for our wealthy ones, and for the people, may it carry us to safety, and may it be a protection.🔽To our praise, O Agni, let the Maruts come, and the heaven and earth, and the streams, well-praised.

original: gavyaṃ yavyaṃ yanto dīrghāheṣaṃ varam aruṇyo varanta //🔽baḷ itthā tad vapuṣe dhāyi darśataṃ devasya bhargaḥ sahaso yato jani /
analyzed: gavyam yavyam yantaḥ dīrgha ahā iṣam varam aruṇyaḥ varanta  baḷ itthā tat vapuṣe dhāyi darśatam devasya bhargaḥ sahasaḥ yatas jani
translated: Seeking cattle and grain, with long life, they choose the boon of the ruddy ones.🔽Even thus was that wondrous form established for the radiance of the god from whom it was born.

original: yad īm upa hvarate sādhate matir ṛtasya dhenā anayanta sasrutaḥ //
analyzed: yat īm upa hvarate sādhate matiḥ ṛtasya dhenāḥ anayanta sasrutaḥ
translated: When he hurls it down, the thought is accomplished, and the milch cows of truth have brought it forth.

original: pṛkṣo vapuḥ pitumān nitya ā śaye dvitīyam ā saptaśivāsu mātṛṣu /
analyzed: pṛkṣaḥ vapuḥ pitumān nityaḥ ā śaye dvitīyam ā sapta śivāsu mātṛṣu
translated: He lies down in his father's form, ever young, the second time among the seven auspicious mothers.

original: tṛtīyam asya vṛṣabhasya dohase daśapramatiṃ janayanta yoṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: tṛtīyam asya vṛṣabhasya dohase daśapramatim janayanta yoṣaṇaḥ
translated: The ten-minded one they generate for the milking of his third bull, the men.

original: nir yad īm budhnān mahiṣasya varpasa īśānāsaḥ śavasā kranta sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: niḥ yat īm budhnāt mahiṣasya varpasaḥ īśānāsaḥ śavasā kranta sūrayaḥ
translated: When from the depths of the mighty one's form the princes, the lords, are fashioned by strength,

original: yad īm anu pradivo madhva ādhave guhā santam mātariśvā mathāyati //
analyzed: yat īm anu pradivaḥ madhvaḥ ādhave guhā santam mātariśvā mathāyati
translated: When, after the sky, for the sake of the sweet draught, they urge on him who is in the cave, Matariga.

original: pra yat pituḥ paramān nīyate pary ā pṛkṣudho vīrudho daṃsu rohati /
analyzed: pra yat pituḥ paramāt nīyate pari ā pṛkṣudhaḥ vīrudhaḥ daṃsu rohati
translated: When he is led forth from his father's highest abode, then the plants, eager for food, burst forth in bloom.

original: ubhā yad asya januṣaṃ yad invata ād id yaviṣṭho abhavad ghṛṇā śuciḥ //
analyzed: ubhā yat asya januṣam yat invataḥ āt id yaviṣṭhaḥ abhavat ghṛṇā śuciḥ
translated: When both his births and his impulse are set in motion, then he becomes the youngest, pure through his own heat.

original: ād in mātṝr āviśad yāsv ā śucir ahiṃsyamāna urviyā vi vāvṛdhe /
analyzed: āt id mātṝḥ āviśat yāsu ā śuciḥ a hiṃsyamānaḥ urviyā vi vāvṛdhe
translated: Then he enters the mothers, in whom the pure one, uninjured, grows in extent.

original: anu yat pūrvā aruhat sanājuvo ni navyasīṣv avarāsu dhāvate //🔽ād id dhotāraṃ vṛṇate diviṣṭiṣu bhagam iva papṛcānāsa ṛñjate /
analyzed: anu yat pūrvāḥ aruhat sanājuvaḥ ni navyasīṣu avarāsu dhāvate  āt id hotāram vṛṇate diviṣṭiṣu bhagam iva papṛcānāsaḥ ṛñjate
translated: When he has mounted the former ones, the ancient ones, he runs in the newer, the lower ones.🔽Then they choose him as Hotar at the sacrifices in heaven, they strive to win him, as if he were Bhaga.

original: devān yat kratvā majmanā puruṣṭuto martaṃ śaṃsaṃ viśvadhā veti dhāyase //
analyzed: devān yat kratvā majmanā puruṣṭutaḥ martam śaṃsam viśvadhā veti dhāyase
translated: When, much lauded, he goes in every way to the mortal who praises him, through his own will and power, to the gods.

original: vi yad asthād yajato vātacodito hvāro na vakvā jaraṇā anākṛtaḥ /
analyzed: vi yat asthāt yajataḥ vāta coditaḥ hvāraḥ na vakvā jaraṇāḥ anākṛtaḥ
translated: When he hath stood forth, urged on by Vāta, the purifier, unadorned, like a bird of prey,

original: tasya patman dakṣuṣaḥ kṛṣṇajaṃhasaḥ śucijanmano raja ā vyadhvanaḥ //
analyzed: tasya patman dakṣuṣaḥ kṛṣṇa jaṃhasaḥ śuci janmanaḥ rajaḥ ā vyadhvanaḥ
translated: Along the path of him, the ruddy, the black-backed, of pure birth, from the region of the dust.

original: ratho na yātaḥ śikvabhiḥ kṛto dyām aṅgebhir aruṣebhir īyate /
analyzed: rathaḥ na yātaḥ śikvabhiḥ kṛtaḥ dyām aṅgebhiḥ aruṣebhiḥ īyate
translated: Like a car, made by the skilful, he is yoked with the reins, he goes to the sky with his ruddy limbs.

original: ād asya te kṛṣṇāso dakṣi sūrayaḥ śūrasyeva tveṣathād īṣate vayaḥ //
analyzed: āt asya te kṛṣṇāsaḥ dakṣi sūrayaḥ śūrasya iva tveṣathāt īṣate vayaḥ
translated: His black-backed steeds, O thou of wondrous help, are ready for the prize, as for a hero's strength.

original: tvayā hy agne varuṇo dhṛtavrato mitraḥ śāśadre aryamā sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā hi agne varuṇaḥ dhṛta vrataḥ mitraḥ śāśadre aryamā sudānavaḥ
translated: For by thee, O Agni, Varuṇa of sure vow, Mitra, Aryaman, the bounteous Gods,

original: yat sīm anu kratunā viśvathā vibhur arān na nemiḥ paribhūr ajāyathāḥ //
analyzed: yat sīm anu kratunā viśvathā vibhuḥ arāt na nemiḥ paribhūḥ ajāyathāḥ
translated: When thou, all-ruling, art born by thy power, as a felly is born round the spokes.

original: tvam agne śaśamānāya sunvate ratnaṃ yaviṣṭha devatātim invasi /
analyzed: tvam agne śaśamānāya sunvate ratnam yaviṣṭha devatātim invasi
translated: Thou, O most youth- ful Agni, sendest to the worshipper who presses out the juice, the treasure, O God, to the assembly.

original: taṃ tvā nu navyaṃ sahaso yuvan vayam bhagaṃ na kāre mahiratna dhīmahi //
analyzed: tam tvā nu navyam sahasaḥ yuvan vayam bhagam na kāre mahi ratna dhīmahi
translated: Thee, O new, we, O mighty one, will make to prosper, as a charioteer, O thou who hast great treasures.

original: asme rayiṃ na svarthaṃ damūnasam bhagaṃ dakṣaṃ na papṛcāsi dharṇasim /
analyzed: asme rayim na su artham damūnasam bhagam dakṣam na papṛcāsi dharṇasim
translated: Thou hast not neglected, as one who finds his own way, the treasure, the wealth, the good luck, the firm strength.

original: raśmīṃr iva yo yamati janmanī ubhe devānāṃ śaṃsam ṛta ā ca sukratuḥ //
analyzed: raśmīṃr iva yaḥ yamati janmanī ubhe devānām śaṃsam ṛte ā ca su kratuḥ
translated: As one who guides the reins, he guides the two races, the Gods and the people, the wise one in the truth.

original: uta naḥ sudyotmā jīrāśvo hotā mandraḥ śṛṇavac candrarathaḥ /
analyzed: uta naḥ sudyotmā jīra aśvaḥ hotā mandraḥ śṛṇavat candra rathaḥ
translated: And may our well-shining priest, with swift steeds, the delightful, hear us, borne on a beautiful car.

original: sa no neṣan neṣatamair amūro 'gnir vāmaṃ suvitaṃ vasyo accha //
analyzed: sa naḥ neṣat neṣatamaiḥ amūraḥ gniḥ vāmam suvitam vasyaḥ accha
translated: May Agni, the unerring one, lead us by the best paths to what is good, to wealth.

original: astāvy agniḥ śimīvadbhir arkaiḥ sāmrājyāya prataraṃ dadhānaḥ /
analyzed: astāvi agniḥ śimīvadbhiḥ arkaiḥ sāmrājyāya prataram dadhānaḥ
translated: Agni has been praised with powerful hymns, bestowing the ford for universal sovereignty.

original: amī ca ye maghavāno vayaṃ ca mihaṃ na sūro ati niṣ ṭatanyuḥ //
analyzed: amī ca ye maghavānaḥ vayam ca miham na sūraḥ ati niḥ tatanyuḥ
translated: And these wealthy ones and we, the sun has lifted us above the mist.

original: samiddho agna ā vaha devāṃ adya yatasruce /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agne ā vaha devān adya yata sruce
translated: O Agni, well-kindled, bring the gods today, O you with uplifted ladle.

original: tantuṃ tanuṣva pūrvyaṃ sutasomāya dāśuṣe //🔽ghṛtavantam upa māsi madhumantaṃ tanūnapāt /
analyzed: tantum tanuṣva pūrvyam suta somāya dāśuṣe  ghṛtavantam upa māsi madhumantam tanūnapāt
translated: Weave the ancient thread for the offerer who has pressed Soma.🔽You come to the sacrifice, O Tanûnapât, rich in ghee and honey,

original: yajñaṃ viprasya māvataḥ śaśamānasya dāśuṣaḥ //
analyzed: yajñam viprasya māvataḥ śaśamānasya dāśuṣaḥ
translated: of the generous, diligent offerer, the sage.

original: śuciḥ pāvako adbhuto madhvā yajñam mimikṣati /
analyzed: śuciḥ pāvakaḥ adbhutaḥ madhvā yajñam mimikṣati
translated: The pure, purifying, wondrous one anoints the sacrifice with sweetness.

original: narāśaṃsas trir ā divo devo deveṣu yajñiyaḥ //
analyzed: narāśaṃsaḥ tris ā divaḥ devaḥ deveṣu yajñiyaḥ
translated: Narâṣansa, thrice from heaven, the god among the gods, is worthy of sacrifice.

original: īḷito agna ā vahendraṃ citram iha priyam /
analyzed: īḍitaḥ agne ā vaha indram citram iha priyam
translated: O Agni, invoked, bring hither Indra, the wonderful, the dear one.

original: iyaṃ hi tvā matir mamācchā sujihva vacyate //
analyzed: iyam hi tvā matiḥ mama acchā su jihva vacyate
translated: For this thought of mine, O you with a good tongue, is spoken to you.

original: stṛṇānāso yatasruco barhir yajñe svadhvare /
analyzed: stṛṇānāsaḥ yata srucaḥ barhiḥ yajñe su adhvare
translated: The priests, strewing the sacred grass at the sacrifice, with uplifted ladles,

original: vṛñje devavyacastamam indrāya śarma saprathaḥ //
analyzed: vṛñje deva vyacastamam indrāya śarma saprathaḥ
translated: I choose the most god-like protection for Indra, the most extensive.

original: vi śrayantām ṛtāvṛdhaḥ prayai devebhyo mahīḥ /
analyzed: vi śrayantām ṛtāvṛdhaḥ prayai devebhyaḥ mahīḥ
translated: Let the doors, which strengthen holy order, be opened wide for the great gods.

original: pāvakāsaḥ puruspṛho dvāro devīr asaścataḥ //
analyzed: pāvakāsaḥ puruspṛhaḥ dvāraḥ devīḥ asaścataḥ
translated: The doors, which are divine, which are ever open, which are much desired by men, which are pure.

original: ā bhandamāne upāke naktoṣāsā supeśasā /🔽yahvī ṛtasya mātarā sīdatām barhir ā sumat //
analyzed: ā bhandamāne upāke naktoṣāsā supeśasā  yahvī ṛtasya mātarā sīdatām barhiḥ ā sumat
translated: Let the two Dawns, Bhandamāna and Upāka, of fair appearance,🔽The two young mothers of holy order, sit down on the strew, well-disposed.

original: mandrajihvā jugurvaṇī hotārā daivyā kavī /
analyzed: mandra jihvā jugurvaṇī hotārā daivyā kavī
translated: The two divine poets, the two Hotars, with sweet tongue, with quivering tongue,

original: yajñaṃ no yakṣatām imaṃ sidhram adya divispṛśam //
analyzed: yajñam naḥ yakṣatām imam sidhram adya divispṛśam
translated: May they two further this our sacrifice, prosperous, reaching to the sky.

original: śucir deveṣv arpitā hotrā marutsu bhāratī /
analyzed: śuciḥ deveṣu arpitā hotrā marutsu bhāratī
translated: Pure, offered to the gods, the invocation to the Maruts, to Bhāratī,

original: iḷā sarasvatī mahī barhiḥ sīdantu yajñiyāḥ //
analyzed: iḷā sarasvatī mahī barhiḥ sīdantu yajñiyāḥ
translated: Ilā, Sarasvatī, Mahī, may they, worthy of sacrifice, sit on the strew.

original: tan nas turīpam adbhutam puru vāram puru tmanā /
analyzed: tat naḥ turīpam adbhutam puru vāram puru tmanā
translated: That wonderful food of ours, much-invoked, much-desired by itself,

original: tvaṣṭā poṣāya vi ṣyatu rāye nābhā no asmayuḥ //
analyzed: tvaṣṭā poṣāya vi syatu rāye nābhā naḥ asmayuḥ
translated: May Tvaṣṭar open wide for increase of wealth, our kinsman, the navel.

original: avasṛjann upa tmanā devān yakṣi vanaspate /
analyzed: avasṛjan upa tmanā devān yakṣi vanaspate
translated: Sending forth, of yourself, worship the gods, O lord of the forest.

original: agnir havyā suṣūdati devo deveṣu medhiraḥ //
analyzed: agniḥ havyā suṣūdati devaḥ deveṣu medhiraḥ
translated: Agni, the god, the wise one among the gods, purifies the offerings.

original: pūṣaṇvate marutvate viśvadevāya vāyave /🔽svāhā gāyatravepase havyam indrāya kartana //
analyzed: pūṣaṇvate marutvate viśvadevāya vāyave  svāhā gāyatra vepase havyam indrāya kartana
translated: To Pūṣan, to him who has the Maruts, to Vāyu, to the All-gods,🔽Hail! To him who delights in the Gāyatrī, make the offering to Indra.

original: svāhākṛtāny ā gahy upa havyāni vītaye /
analyzed: svāhākṛtāni ā gahi upa havyāni vītaye
translated: Having accepted the offerings made with Svāhā, come to the feast.

original: indrā gahi śrudhī havaṃ tvāṃ havante adhvare //
analyzed: indra ā gahi śrudhi havam tvām havante adhvare
translated: O Indra, come, listen to the call, they call upon you at the sacrifice.

original: pra tavyasīṃ navyasīṃ dhītim agnaye vāco matiṃ sahasaḥ sūnave bhare /
analyzed: pra tavyasīm navyasīm dhītim agnaye vācaḥ matim sahasaḥ sūnave bhare
translated: I bring to Agni a newer and more excellent thought, a hymn of praise, a song of praise, to the son of strength.

original: apāṃ napād yo vasubhiḥ saha priyo hotā pṛthivyāṃ ny asīdad ṛtviyaḥ //
analyzed: apām napāt yaḥ vasubhiḥ saha priyaḥ hotā pṛthivyām ni asīdat ṛtviyaḥ
translated: The swift one of the waters, dear to the Vasus, the proper priest, has sat down on the earth.

original: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomany āvir agnir abhavan mātariśvane /🔽asya kratvā samidhānasya majmanā pra dyāvā śociḥ pṛthivī arocayat //
analyzed: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomani āvis agniḥ abhavat mātariśvane  asya kratvā samidhānasya majmanā pra dyāvā śociḥ pṛthivī arocayat
translated: When he was born in the highest heaven, Agni became manifest to Matariśvan.🔽By his power, by the might of this kindled one, his radiance has illuminated heaven and earth.

original: asya tveṣā ajarā asya bhānavaḥ susaṃdṛśaḥ supratīkasya sudyutaḥ /
analyzed: asya tveṣāḥ ajarāḥ asya bhānavaḥ su saṃdṛśaḥ su pratīkasya su dyutaḥ
translated: His flames are undecaying, his lights are very beautiful, of the one of good appearance, of the one of good form, of the one of good luster.

original: bhātvakṣaso aty aktur na sindhavo 'gne rejante asasanto ajarāḥ //
analyzed: bhātu akṣasaḥ ati aktuḥ na sindhavaḥ gne rejante a sasantaḥ ajarāḥ
translated: Like the rivers, the undecaying, the unaging, the unapproached ones, O Agni, shine forth.

original: yam erire bhṛgavo viśvavedasaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā bhuvanasya majmanā /
analyzed: yam erire bhṛgavaḥ viśva vedasam nābhā pṛthivyāḥ bhuvanasya majmanā
translated: Whom the Bhṛgus have made all-knowing, in the middle of the earth, in the middle of the world,

original: agniṃ taṃ gīrbhir hinuhi sva ā dame ya eko vasvo varuṇo na rājati //
analyzed: agnim tam gīrbhiḥ hinuhi sve ā dame yaḥ ekaḥ vasvaḥ varuṇaḥ na rājati
translated: That Agni, O Gīḥ, lead to your own abode, who alone shines like a king over wealth, like Varuṇa.

original: na yo varāya marutām iva svanaḥ seneva sṛṣṭā divyā yathāśaniḥ /
analyzed: na yaḥ varāya marutām iva svanaḥ senā iva sṛṣṭā divyā yathā aśaniḥ
translated: Whose roar is like that of the Maruts for the sake of choice, like a heavenly thunderbolt let loose like an army,

original: agnir jambhais tigitair atti bharvati yodho na śatrūn sa vanā ny ṛñjate //
analyzed: agniḥ jambhaiḥ tigitaiḥ atti bharvati yodhaḥ na śatrūn sa vanā ni ṛñjate
translated: Agni with his sharp jaws devours, he rejoices like a warrior over his foes, he delights in the woods.

original: kuvin no agnir ucathasya vīr asad vasuṣ kuvid vasubhiḥ kāmam āvarat /
analyzed: kuvid naḥ agniḥ ucathasya vīḥ asat vasuḥ kuvid vasubhiḥ kāmam āvarat
translated: Will Agni be the hero of our hymn? Will the good one with the good ones fulfil our desire?

original: codaḥ kuvit tutujyāt sātaye dhiyaḥ śucipratīkaṃ tam ayā dhiyā gṛṇe //
analyzed: codaḥ kuvid tutujyāt sātaye dhiyaḥ śuci pratīkam tam ayā dhiyā gṛṇe
translated: Will he stimulate the fulfilment of our thoughts? I praise him with this thought, whose face is bright.

original: ghṛtapratīkaṃ va ṛtasya dhūrṣadam agnim mitraṃ na samidhāna ṛñjate /🔽indhāno akro vidatheṣu dīdyac chukravarṇām ud u no yaṃsate dhiyam //🔽aprayucchann aprayucchadbhir agne śivebhir naḥ pāyubhiḥ pāhi śagmaiḥ /
analyzed: ghṛta pratīkam vaḥ ṛtasya dhūrṣadam agnim mitram na samidhānaḥ ṛñjate  indhānaḥ akraḥ vidatheṣu dīdyat śukra varṇām ud u naḥ yaṃsate dhiyam  aprayucchan aprayucchadbhiḥ agne śivebhiḥ naḥ pāyubhiḥ pāhi śagmaiḥ
translated: I strive to Agni, the friend, like one enkindled, whose face is anointed with ghee, the impeller of holy order.🔽Kindling, shining in the assemblies, he sends forth our thought, whose face is bright.🔽O Agni, with thy never-failing, auspicious, safe protections, protect us.

original: adabdhebhir adṛpitebhir iṣṭe 'nimiṣadbhiḥ pari pāhi no jāḥ //🔽eti pra hotā vratam asya māyayordhvāṃ dadhānaḥ śucipeśasaṃ dhiyam /
analyzed: adabdhebhiḥ a dṛpitebhiḥ iṣṭe nimiṣadbhiḥ pari pāhi naḥ jāḥ  eti pra hotā vratam asya māyayā ūrdhvām dadhānaḥ śuci peśasam dhiyam
translated: With thy infallible, fearless, desired, unblinking protections, guard our people.🔽The Hotar goes forth, holding with his thought the upright, pure-shaped vow of him (Agni),

original: abhi srucaḥ kramate dakṣiṇāvṛto yā asya dhāma prathamaṃ ha niṃsate //
analyzed: abhi srucaḥ kramate dakṣiṇa āvṛtaḥ yāḥ asya dhāma prathamam ha niṃsate
translated: turning to the right, he moves towards the ladles which first occupy his abode.

original: abhīm ṛtasya dohanā anūṣata yonau devasya sadane parīvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: abhi īm ṛtasya dohanāḥ anūṣata yonau devasya sadane parīvṛtāḥ
translated: The milkings of holy order have resounded, encompassed in the abode, in the seat of the god.

original: apām upasthe vibhṛto yad āvasad adha svadhā adhayad yābhir īyate //🔽yuyūṣataḥ savayasā tad id vapuḥ samānam arthaṃ vitaritratā mithaḥ /🔽ād īm bhago na havyaḥ sam asmad ā voḷhur na raśmīn sam ayaṃsta sārathiḥ //
analyzed: apām upasthe vibhṛtaḥ yat āvasat adha svadhāḥ adhayat yābhiḥ īyate  yuyūṣataḥ savayasā tat id vapuḥ samānam artham vitaritratā mithas  āt īm bhagaḥ na havyaḥ sam asmat ā voḷhuḥ na raśmīn sam ayaṃsta sārathiḥ
translated: When he dwelt in the lap of the waters, supported, he drank of his own nature what he goes with.

original: yam īṃ dvā savayasā saparyataḥ samāne yonā mithunā samokasā /🔽divā na naktam palito yuvājani purū carann ajaro mānuṣā yugā //🔽tam īṃ hinvanti dhītayo daśa vriśo devam martāsa ūtaye havāmahe /🔽dhanor adhi pravata ā sa ṛṇvaty abhivrajadbhir vayunā navādhita //🔽tvaṃ hy agne divyasya rājasi tvam pārthivasya paśupā iva tmanā /🔽enī ta ete bṛhatī abhiśriyā hiraṇyayī vakvarī barhir āśāte //
analyzed: yam īm dvā savayasā saparyataḥ samāne yonā mithunā samokasā  divā na naktam palitaḥ yuvā ajani purū caran ajaraḥ mānuṣā yugā  tam īm hinvanti dhītayaḥ daśa vriśaḥ devam martāsaḥ ūtaye havāmahe  dhanoḥ adhi pravataḥ ā saḥ ṛṇvati abhivrajadbhiḥ vayunā navā adhita  tvam hi agne divyasya rājasi tvam pārthivasya paśu pāḥ iva tmanā  enī te ete bṛhatī abhiśriyā hiraṇyayī vakvarī barhiḥ āśāte
translated: The two, seeking to unite, that form, the same purpose, the two, eager to distribute, to each other.🔽He, like Bhaga, to be invoked, from us, the charioteer has yoked the two, like reins, together.

original: agne juṣasva prati harya tad vaco mandra svadhāva ṛtajāta sukrato /
analyzed: agne juṣasva prati harya tat vacaḥ mandra svadhāvas ṛta jāta su krato
translated: The two, of the same age, who attend on him, in the same womb, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age, the two, of the same age

original: yo viśvataḥ pratyaṅṅ asi darśato raṇvaḥ saṃdṛṣṭau pitumāṃ iva kṣayaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ viśvatas pratyaṅ asi darśataḥ raṇvaḥ saṃdṛṣṭau pitumān iva kṣayaḥ
translated: Thou who art on every side to be seen, lovely in thy appearance, like a father's abode.

original: tam pṛcchatā sa jagāmā sa veda sa cikitvāṃ īyate sā nv īyate /
analyzed: tam pṛcchata sa jagāma sa veda sa cikitvān īyate sā nu īyate
translated: He whom they ask, he has gone, he knows, he goes with thought, he goes indeed.
