original: tasmin santi praśiṣas tasminn iṣṭayaḥ sa vājasya śavasaḥ śuṣmiṇas patiḥ //
analyzed: tasmin santi praśiṣaḥ tasmin iṣṭayaḥ sa vājasya śavasaḥ śuṣmiṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: In him are the precepts, in him the sacrifices, he is the lord of the strength, of the might of strength.

original: tam it pṛcchanti na simo vi pṛcchati sveneva dhīro manasā yad agrabhīt /
analyzed: tam id pṛcchanti na simaḥ vi pṛcchati svena iva dhīraḥ manasā yat agrabhīt
translated: They ask him, the sage does not ask, as the wise one with his own mind when he has seized (the thought).

original: na mṛṣyate prathamaṃ nāparaṃ vaco 'sya kratvā sacate apradṛpitaḥ //
analyzed: na mṛṣyate prathamam na aparam vacaḥ sya kratvā sacate a pradṛpitaḥ
translated: He does not endure the first word, nor the second, by his wisdom he goes along, not trembling.

original: tam id gacchanti juhvas tam arvatīr viśvāny ekaḥ śṛṇavad vacāṃsi me /🔽purupraiṣas taturir yajñasādhano 'cchidrotiḥ śiśur ādatta saṃ rabhaḥ //🔽upasthāyaṃ carati yat samārata sadyo jātas tatsāra yujyebhiḥ /
analyzed: tam id gacchanti juhvaḥ tam arvatīḥ viśvāni ekaḥ śṛṇavat vacāṃsi me  puru praiṣaḥ taturiḥ yajña sādhano chidra ūtiḥ śiśuḥ ādatta sam rabhaḥ  upasthāyam carati yat samārata sadyas jātaḥ tatsāra yujyebhiḥ
translated: To him go the oblations, to him the swift ones, alone he hears all my words.🔽He who sends forth many, the swift one, who accomplishes the sacrifice, whose thought is unerring, the child has taken hold of the impulse.🔽When he moves about after he has been worshipped, immediately born he goes with his yoked (steeds).

original: abhi śvāntam mṛśate nāndye mude yad īṃ gacchanty uśatīr apiṣṭhitam //
analyzed: abhi śvāntam mṛśate nāndye mude yat īm gacchanti uśatīḥ apiṣṭhitam
translated: He touches the one who is inwardly joyful, for the delight of joy, when they go to him, the most excellent, who is longed for.

original: sa īm mṛgo apyo vanargur upa tvacy upamasyāṃ ni dhāyi /
analyzed: saḥ īm mṛgaḥ apyaḥ vanarguḥ upa tvaci upamasyām ni dhāyi
translated: He, the deer, the wild one of the woods, has been placed by me on this skin of the female antelope.

original: vy abravīd vayunā martyebhyo 'gnir vidvāṃ ṛtacid dhi satyaḥ //
analyzed: vi abravīt vayunā martyebhyaḥ gniḥ vidvān ṛta cit hi satyaḥ
translated: He has declared the ordinances to mortal men, Agni, the wise, for he is true and knows the truth.

original: trimūrdhānaṃ saptaraśmiṃ gṛṇīṣe 'nūnam agnim pitror upasthe /
analyzed: tri mūrdhānam sapta raśmim gṛṇīṣe nūnam agnim pitroḥ upasthe
translated: I sing the three-headed one, the seven-rayed, the unimpaired Agni, in the lap of his parents.

original: niṣattam asya carato dhruvasya viśvā divo rocanāpaprivāṃsam //
analyzed: niṣattam asya carataḥ dhruvasya viśvā divaḥ rocanā āpaprivāṃsam
translated: He who is set down, moving, of the firm one, who has filled all the luminous realms of heaven.

original: ukṣā mahāṃ abhi vavakṣa ene ajaras tasthāv itaūtir ṛṣvaḥ /🔽urvyāḥ pado ni dadhāti sānau rihanty ūdho aruṣāso asya //
analyzed: ukṣā mahān abhi vavakṣa ene ajaraḥ tasthau itaūtiḥ ṛṣvaḥ  urvyāḥ padaḥ ni dadhāti sānau rihanti ūdhaḥ aruṣāsaḥ asya
translated: The great bull has extended over these two, the undecaying one stands high, moving from here.🔽He places his foot on the broad back of the earth; his red cows lick his udder.

original: samānaṃ vatsam abhi saṃcarantī viṣvag dhenū vi carataḥ sumeke /
analyzed: samānam vatsam abhi saṃcarantī viṣvak dhenū vi carataḥ sumeke
translated: The two cows, well-formed, move in different directions, approaching the common calf.

original: anapavṛjyāṃ adhvano mimāne viśvān ketāṃ adhi maho dadhāne //
analyzed: anapavṛjyām adhvanaḥ mimāne viśvān ketām adhi mahaḥ dadhāne
translated: Measuring out the path that does not turn back, placing all the great goals above them.

original: dhīrāsaḥ padaṃ kavayo nayanti nānā hṛdā rakṣamāṇā ajuryam /🔽siṣāsantaḥ pary apaśyanta sindhum āvir ebhyo abhavat sūryo nṝn //🔽didṛkṣeṇyaḥ pari kāṣṭhāsu jenya īḷenyo maho arbhāya jīvase /
analyzed: dhīrāsaḥ padam kavayaḥ nayanti nānā hṛdā rakṣamāṇāḥ ajuryam  siṣāsantaḥ pari apaśyanta sindhum āvis ebhyaḥ abhavat sūryaḥ nṝn  didṛkṣeṇyaḥ pari kāṣṭhāsu jenyaḥ īḍenyaḥ mahaḥ arbhāya jīvase
translated: The wise ones lead the step of the wise ones, guarding the undecaying one with different thoughts.🔽Desiring, they have looked around the river; the sun has become manifest to these men.🔽To be seen, to be desired, to be sought after on the borders, to be desired for great and small for life.

original: purutrā yad abhavat sūr ahaibhyo garbhebhyo maghavā viśvadarśataḥ //
analyzed: purutrā yat abhavat sūḥ aha ebhyaḥ garbhebhyaḥ maghavā viśva darśataḥ
translated: When the all-seeing Maghavan became manifold for these children, for the days.

original: kathā te agne śucayanta āyor dadāśur vājebhir āśuṣāṇāḥ /
analyzed: kathā te agne śucayantaḥ āyoḥ dadāśuḥ vājebhiḥ āśuṣāṇāḥ
translated: How have they, O Agni, the pure ones, given thee, seeking strength, in the waters,

original: ubhe yat toke tanaye dadhānā ṛtasya sāman raṇayanta devāḥ //
analyzed: ubhe yat toke tanaye dadhānāḥ ṛtasya sāman raṇayanta devāḥ
translated: When the gods, bestowing on both the offspring and the child, delight in the Sâman of holy order?

original: bodhā me asya vacaso yaviṣṭha maṃhiṣṭhasya prabhṛtasya svadhāvaḥ /
analyzed: bodha me asya vacasaḥ yaviṣṭha maṃhiṣṭhasya prabhṛtasya svadhāvas
translated: Be thou awake to this word of mine, O thou most youthful, most bountiful, of thine own nature, O thou who art most liberal.

original: pīyati tvo anu tvo gṛṇāti vandārus te tanvaṃ vande agne //
analyzed: pīyati tvaḥ anu tvaḥ gṛṇāti vandāruḥ te tanvam vande agne
translated: They drink thee, they praise thee; I, the worshipper, praise thy body, O Agni.

original: ye pāyavo māmateyaṃ te agne paśyanto andhaṃ duritād arakṣan /
analyzed: ye pāyavaḥ māmateyam te agne paśyantaḥ andham duritāt arakṣan
translated: Those rays of thine, O Agni, which, looking on the blind one, have protected him from evil,

original: rarakṣa tān sukṛto viśvavedā dipsanta id ripavo nāha debhuḥ //
analyzed: rarakṣa tān su kṛtaḥ viśva vedāḥ dipsantaḥ id ripavaḥ na aha debhuḥ
translated: Have protected him, the well-doing one, O all-knowing one; the spiteful enemies have not overcome him, as the gods.

original: yo no agne ararivāṃ aghāyur arātīvā marcayati dvayena /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ agne a rarivān aghāyuḥ arātīvā marcayati dvayena
translated: He who, O Agni, hates us, O thou of evil life, who with double tongue reviles us,

original: mantro guruḥ punar astu so asmā anu mṛkṣīṣṭa tanvaṃ duruktaiḥ //
analyzed: mantraḥ guruḥ punar astu saḥ asmai anu mṛkṣīṣṭa tanvam duruktaiḥ
translated: May his curse be heavy; may he himself be smitten with evil speech.

original: uta vā yaḥ sahasya pravidvān marto martam marcayati dvayena /
analyzed: uta vā yaḥ sahasya pravidvān martaḥ martam marcayati dvayena
translated: Or if a mortal, knowing thy power, O mighty one, reviles a mortal with double tongue,

original: ataḥ pāhi stavamāna stuvantam agne mākir no duritāya dhāyīḥ //
analyzed: atas pāhi stavamāna stuvantam agne mākir naḥ duritāya
translated: From that, O Agni, protect the praiser and the praised; do not deliver us to misfortune.

original: mathīd yad īṃ viṣṭo mātariśvā hotāraṃ viśvāpsuṃ viśvadevyam /
analyzed: mathīt yat īm viṣṭaḥ mātariśvā hotāram viśva apsum viśvadevyam
translated: When Matariśvan churned thee out, the priest, all-possessing, with all the deities,

original: ni yaṃ dadhur manuṣyāsu vikṣu svar ṇa citraṃ vapuṣe vibhāvam //
analyzed: ni yam manuṣyāsu vikṣu svar na citram vapuṣe vibhāvam
translated: Whom they have placed in the dwellings of men, the wondrous form for the light to behold.

original: dadānam in na dadabhanta manmāgnir varūtham mama tasya cākan /
analyzed: dadānam id na dadabhanta manma agniḥ varūtham mama tasya cākan
translated: The giver, they have not deceived my thought. Agni desires my protection and his.

original: juṣanta viśvāny asya karmopastutim bharamāṇasya kāroḥ //🔽nitye cin nu yaṃ sadane jagṛbhre praśastibhir dadhire yajñiyāsaḥ /
analyzed: juṣanta viśvāni asya karma upastutim bharamāṇasya kāroḥ  nitye cit nu yam sadane jagṛbhre praśastibhiḥ dadhire yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: They enjoy all his deeds, the praise of the one who bears the oblation.🔽Even him whom they have grasped in the eternal abode, the worshipful ones have made with praises.

original: pra sū nayanta gṛbhayanta iṣṭāv aśvāso na rathyo rārahāṇāḥ //🔽purūṇi dasmo ni riṇāti jambhair ād rocate vana ā vibhāvā /
analyzed: pra su nayanta gṛbhayantaḥ iṣṭau aśvāsaḥ na rathyaḥ rārahāṇāḥ  purūṇi dasmaḥ ni riṇāti jambhaiḥ āt rocate vane ā vibhāvā
translated: They lead him forth, they seize him for the sacrifice, the horses, as if harnessed to a chariot, eager.🔽The wondrous one overcomes many with his jaws, he shines in the wood, the light-bringer.

original: ād asya vāto anu vāti śocir astur na śaryām asanām anu dyūn //
analyzed: āt asya vātaḥ anu vāti śociḥ astuḥ na śaryām asanām anu dyūn
translated: His flame the wind blows after, like a sharp arrow through the days.

original: na yaṃ ripavo na riṣaṇyavo garbhe santaṃ reṣaṇā reṣayanti /
analyzed: na yam ripavaḥ na riṣaṇyavaḥ garbhe santam reṣaṇāḥ reṣayanti
translated: Whom the enemies, the irrepressible ones, do not deceive, the deceivers, while he is in the womb.

original: andhā apaśyā na dabhann abhikhyā nityāsa īm pretāro arakṣan //
analyzed: andhāḥ apaśyāḥ na dabhan abhikhyāḥ nityāsaḥ īm pretāraḥ arakṣan
translated: The blind, the sightless, have not deceived the visible one. The ever-present ones have guarded him.

original: mahaḥ sa rāya eṣate patir dann ina inasya vasunaḥ pada ā /
analyzed: mahaḥ sa rāyaḥ eṣate patiḥ dan inaḥ inasya vasunaḥ pade ā
translated: He seeks great wealth, the lord of the house, the lord of the house's treasure.

original: upa dhrajantam adrayo vidhann it //
analyzed: upa dhrajantam adrayaḥ vidhan id
translated: The mountains have opened for the one who rushes forward.

original: sa yo vṛṣā narāṃ na rodasyoḥ śravobhir asti jīvapītasargaḥ /
analyzed: sa yaḥ vṛṣā narām na rodasyoḥ śravobhiḥ asti jīva pīta sargaḥ
translated: He who is a bull among men, the lord of the two worlds, whose life-giving creation is known through his fame,

original: pra yaḥ sasrāṇaḥ śiśrīta yonau //
analyzed: pra yaḥ sasrāṇaḥ śiśrīta yonau
translated: Who, moving forth, rests in his own place.

original: ā yaḥ puraṃ nārmiṇīm adīded atyaḥ kavir nabhanyo nārvā /
analyzed: ā yaḥ puram nārmiṇīm adīdet atyaḥ kaviḥ nabhanyaḥ na arvā
translated: He who shines forth like a city of men, a swift horse, a cloud, a river,

original: sūro na rurukvāñ chatātmā //
analyzed: sūraḥ na rurukvām śata ātmā
translated: Like the sun, of a hundred powers, not to be turned aside.

original: abhi dvijanmā trī rocanāni viśvā rajāṃsi śuśucāno asthāt /
analyzed: abhi dvi janmā trī rocanāni viśvā rajāṃsi śuśucānaḥ asthāt
translated: This twice-born one, shining, has stood in the three luminous realms, in all the regions,

original: hotā yajiṣṭho apāṃ sadhasthe //
analyzed: hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ apām sadhasthe
translated: The Hotar, best at sacrifice, in the abode of the waters.

original: ayaṃ sa hotā yo dvijanmā viśvā dadhe vāryāṇi śravasyā /
analyzed: ayam sa hotā yaḥ dvi janmā viśvā dadhe vāryāṇi śravasyā
translated: This is the Hotar who, twice-born, bestows all good things, the desirable,

original: marto yo asmai sutuko dadāśa //
analyzed: martaḥ yaḥ asmai sutukaḥ dadāśa
translated: The mortal who has given to him with good inspiration.

original: puru tvā dāśvān voce 'rir agne tava svid ā /
analyzed: puru tvā dāśvān voce riḥ agne tava svid ā
translated: I call you, O Agni, as a generous giver, you are indeed the friend of the worshipper,

original: todasyeva śaraṇa ā mahasya //🔽vy aninasya dhaninaḥ prahoṣe cid araruṣaḥ /
analyzed: todasya iva śaraṇe ā mahasya  vi aninasya dhaninaḥ prahoṣe cit a raruṣaḥ
translated: Like a refuge from a great pain.🔽Even in the presence of the rich, of the one who has chariots, of the red one,

original: kadā cana prajigato adevayoḥ //
analyzed: kadā cana prajigataḥ a devayoḥ
translated: Never do I turn away from the two who are not divine.

original: sa candro vipra martyo maho vrādhantamo divi /
analyzed: sa candraḥ vipra martyaḥ mahaḥ vrādhantamaḥ divi
translated: That mortal, O Chandramas, the wise one, has greatly increased in heaven,

original: prapret te agne vanuṣaḥ syāma //
analyzed: prapret te agne vanuṣaḥ syāma
translated: May we be the worshippers of you, O Agni.

original: mitraṃ na yaṃ śimyā goṣu gavyavaḥ svādhyo vidathe apsu jījanan /
analyzed: mitram na yam śimyāḥ goṣu gavyavaḥ su ādhyaḥ vidathe apsu jījanan
translated: Whom the cow-loving ones, the well-disposed ones, have generated in the sacrifice, in the waters, like a friend,

original: arejetāṃ rodasī pājasā girā prati priyaṃ yajataṃ januṣām avaḥ //
analyzed: arejetām rodasī pājasā girā prati priyam yajatam januṣām avaḥ
translated: The two worlds have rejoiced in the splendour of the song, in the dear one who offers worship, in the light of the generations.

original: yad dha tyad vām purumīḷhasya sominaḥ pra mitrāso na dadhire svābhuvaḥ /
analyzed: yat ha tyad vām purumīḷhasya sominaḥ pra mitrāsaḥ na dadhire su ābhuvaḥ
translated: What, indeed, of that, O ye two, of the Soma-pressing Purumīḷha, the friends have not made their own,

original: adha kratuṃ vidataṃ gātum arcata uta śrutaṃ vṛṣaṇā pastyāvataḥ //
analyzed: adha kratum vidatam gātum arcataḥ uta śrutam vṛṣaṇā pastyāvataḥ
translated: Do ye find wisdom, and sing praise, and be heard, O ye mighty ones, by the dweller in the house.

original: ā vām bhūṣan kṣitayo janma rodasyoḥ pravācyaṃ vṛṣaṇā dakṣase mahe /
analyzed: ā vām bhūṣan kṣitayaḥ janma rodasyoḥ pravācyam vṛṣaṇā dakṣase mahe
translated: Your stations are adorned, O ye two, in the birth-place of the two worlds, to be proclaimed, O ye mighty ones, for great strength,

original: yad īm ṛtāya bharatho yad arvate pra hotrayā śimyā vītho adhvaram //🔽pra sā kṣitir asura yā mahi priya ṛtāvānāv ṛtam ā ghoṣatho bṛhat /🔽yuvaṃ divo bṛhato dakṣam ābhuvaṃ gāṃ na dhury upa yuñjāthe apaḥ //
analyzed: yat īm ṛtāya bharathaḥ yat arvate pra hotrayā śimyā vīthaḥ adhvaram  pra sā kṣitiḥ asura yā mahi priye ṛtāvānau ṛtam ā ghoṣathaḥ bṛhat  yuvam divaḥ bṛhataḥ dakṣam ābhuvam gām na dhuri upa yuñjāthe apaḥ
translated: When ye bring him to the truth, to the steed, to the priest, to the swift one, to the sacrifice.🔽That great abode, O ye two who are true to the covenant, ye proclaim with great praise.🔽Ye two have made the mighty power of the great heaven, the cow, as it were, the yoke-fellow, the waters.

original: mahī atra mahinā vāram ṛṇvatho 'reṇavas tuja ā sadman dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: mahī atra mahinā vāram ṛṇvathaḥ reṇavaḥ tujaḥ ā sadman dhenavaḥ
translated: Here ye two, with your greatness, move the great enclosure, the dustless milch-cows in the house.

original: svaranti tā uparatāti sūryam ā nimruca uṣasas takvavīr iva //
analyzed: svaranti tāḥ uparatāti sūryam ā nimrucaḥ uṣasaḥ takvavīḥ iva
translated: They sing to the sun, those which have gone to rest, the dawns, as it were, with their swift steeds, to the setting.

original: ā vām ṛtāya keśinīr anūṣata mitra yatra varuṇa gātum arcathaḥ /
analyzed: ā vām ṛtāya keśinīḥ anūṣata mitra yatra varuṇa gātum arcathaḥ
translated: The leaders have sung to you two for the truth, O Mitra, where, O Varuṇa, ye two proclaim the way.

original: ava tmanā sṛjatam pinvataṃ dhiyo yuvaṃ viprasya manmanām irajyathaḥ //
analyzed: ava tmanā sṛjatam pinvatam dhiyaḥ yuvam viprasya manmanām irajyathaḥ
translated: Of yourselves create, and swell the thoughts: ye rule over the sage's hymns that win the prize.

original: yo vāṃ yajñaiḥ śaśamāno ha dāśati kavir hotā yajati manmasādhanaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vām yajñaiḥ śaśamānaḥ ha dāśati kaviḥ hotā yajati manma sādhanaḥ
translated: He who with sacrifices worships you, the sage, the priest, who worships with the hymns that win the prize,

original: upāha taṃ gacchatho vītho adhvaram acchā giraḥ sumatiṃ gantam asmayū //🔽yuvāṃ yajñaiḥ prathamā gobhir añjata ṛtāvānā manaso na prayuktiṣu /🔽bharanti vām manmanā saṃyatā giro 'dṛpyatā manasā revad āśāthe //
analyzed: upa aha tam gacchathaḥ vīthaḥ adhvaram acchā giraḥ sumatim gantam asmayū  yuvām yajñaiḥ prathamā gobhiḥ añjataḥ ṛtāvānā manasaḥ na prayuktiṣu  bharanti vām manmanā saṃyatāḥ giraḥ dṛpyatā manasā revat āśāthe
translated: To him come ye, to the oblation, to the sacrifice: come to the songs, come to our thought, O Aṣvins.🔽Ye, with the sacrifices, first were anointed with milk, ye who are true, in the impulses of the mind.🔽They bring you hymns composed with care, your songs: with heart unwearied ye have gained great wealth.

original: revad vayo dadhāthe revad āśāthe narā māyābhir itaūti māhinam /
analyzed: revat vayaḥ dadhāthe revat āśāthe narā māyābhiḥ itaūti māhinam
translated: Ye have bestowed great life, ye have gained great wealth, O Heroes, by your powers, by your great magic skill.

original: na vāṃ dyāvo 'habhir nota sindhavo na devatvam paṇayo nānaśur magham //🔽yuvaṃ vastrāṇi pīvasā vasāthe yuvor acchidrā mantavo ha sargāḥ /🔽avātiratam anṛtāni viśva ṛtena mitrāvaruṇā sacethe //
analyzed: na vām dyāvaḥ habhiḥ na uta sindhavaḥ na deva tvam paṇayaḥ nā anaśuḥ magham  yuvam vastrāṇi pīvasā vasāthe yuvoḥ acchidrāḥ mantavaḥ ha sargāḥ  avātiratam anṛtāni viśve ṛtena mitrāvaruṇā sacethe
translated: Neither the heavens with days, nor the rivers, O ye Gods, have fulfilled your wish, nor the waters.🔽Ye clothe with fat the garments: your dispensations are without defect.🔽Ye have overcome all falsehood by the truth: by the truth, O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye are joined.

original: etac cana tvo vi ciketad eṣāṃ satyo mantraḥ kaviśasta ṛghāvān /
analyzed: etat cana tvaḥ vi ciketat eṣām satyaḥ mantraḥ kavi śastaḥ ṛghāvān
translated: This also have I known of these: the true hymn, the sage's song, is strong.

original: triraśriṃ hanti caturaśrir ugro devanido ha prathamā ajūryan //🔽apād eti prathamā padvatīnāṃ kas tad vām mitrāvaruṇā ciketa /
analyzed: triraśrim hanti catur aśriḥ ugraḥ deva nidaḥ ha prathamāḥ ajūryan  a pād eti prathamā padvatīnām kaḥ tat vām mitrāvaruṇā ciketa
translated: The four-cornered one, fierce, destroys the three-cornered one; the first divine punishments, enduring, have passed away.🔽The first of those with feet goes without feet; who knows that, O you two, Mitra and Varuṇa?

original: garbho bhāram bharaty ā cid asya ṛtam piparty anṛtaṃ ni tārīt //
analyzed: garbhaḥ bhāram bharati ā cit asya ṛtam piparti anṛtam ni tārīt
translated: The embryo bears even his burden; he nourishes truth, he overcomes falsehood.

original: prayantam it pari jāraṃ kanīnām paśyāmasi nopanipadyamānam /
analyzed: prayantam id pari jāram kanīnām paśyāmasi na upanipadyamānam
translated: We see the departing, the distant one of the two; we do not see the one approaching.

original: anavapṛgṇā vitatā vasānam priyam mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma //
analyzed: an avapṛgṇā vitatā vasānam priyam mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma
translated: The one clothed in the unworn, spread out, dear abode of Mitra and Varuṇa.

original: anaśvo jāto anabhīśur arvā kanikradat patayad ūrdhvasānuḥ /🔽acittam brahma jujuṣur yuvānaḥ pra mitre dhāma varuṇe gṛṇantaḥ //
analyzed: an aśvaḥ jātaḥ an abhīśuḥ arvā kanikradat patayat ūrdhva sānuḥ  acittam brahma jujuṣuḥ yuvānaḥ pra mitre dhāma varuṇe gṛṇantaḥ
translated: The horse born without reins, the young one neighing, flying with its back upwards,🔽The young ones, longing for the thoughtless Brahman, praise Mitra's and Varuṇa's abode.

original: ā dhenavo māmateyam avantīr brahmapriyam pīpayan sasminn ūdhan /
analyzed: ā dhenavaḥ māmateyam avantīḥ brahma priyam pīpayan sasmin ūdhan
translated: The cows, the supporters, have filled the dear one of Brahman with milk in his udder.

original: pitvo bhikṣeta vayunāni vidvān āsāvivāsann aditim uruṣyet //🔽ā vām mitrāvaruṇā havyajuṣṭiṃ namasā devāv avasā vavṛtyām /
analyzed: pitvaḥ bhikṣeta vayunāni vidvān āsā āvivāsan aditim uruṣyet  ā vām mitrāvaruṇāḥ havya juṣṭim namasā devau avasā vavṛtyām
translated: The one who knows the ways should beg as a guest; having invited Aditi, he should protect.🔽To you, O Mitra and Varuṇa, I turn with homage and prayer, O gods, with help,

original: asmākam brahma pṛtanāsu sahyā asmākaṃ vṛṣṭir divyā supārā //
analyzed: asmākam brahma pṛtanāsu sahyāḥ asmākam vṛṣṭiḥ divyā su pārā
translated: Your Brahman is to be overcome in battles for us; your heavenly rain is well-crossed for us.

original: yajāmahe vām mahaḥ sajoṣā havyebhir mitrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ /
analyzed: yajāmahe vām mahaḥ sajoṣāḥ havyebhiḥ mitrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ
translated: We worship you, O Mitra and Varuna, with great accord, with offerings and salutations.

original: ghṛtair ghṛtasnū adha yad vām asme adhvaryavo na dhītibhir bharanti //
analyzed: ghṛtaiḥ ghṛtasnū adha yat vām asme adhvaryavaḥ na dhītibhiḥ bharanti
translated: When the Adhvaryus bring you, O you who are anointed with ghee, with ghee and gifts, with our thoughts.

original: prastutir vāṃ dhāma na prayuktir ayāmi mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktiḥ /🔽anakti yad vāṃ vidatheṣu hotā sumnaṃ vāṃ sūrir vṛṣaṇāv iyakṣan //🔽pīpāya dhenur aditir ṛtāya janāya mitrāvaruṇā havirde /
analyzed: prastutiḥ vām dhāma na prayuktiḥ ayāmi mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktiḥ  anakti yat vām vidatheṣu hotā sumnam vām sūriḥ vṛṣaṇau iyakṣan  pīpāya dhenuḥ aditiḥ ṛtāya janāya mitrāvaruṇā haviḥ de
translated: I offer you, O Mitra and Varuna, praise, not flattery, a good hymn.🔽When the priest anoints you in the sacrifices, the lord, O mighty ones, seeks to please you.🔽The cow has flowed for the truth, for the people, for the offering, O Mitra and Varuna.

original: hinoti yad vāṃ vidathe saparyan sa rātahavyo mānuṣo na hotā //
analyzed: hinoti yat vām vidathe saparyan sa rāta havyaḥ mānuṣaḥ na hotā
translated: When he who worships you in the assembly, the human priest, the one who offers gifts, moves.

original: uta vāṃ vikṣu madyāsv andho gāva āpaś ca pīpayanta devīḥ /
analyzed: uta vām vikṣu madyāsu andhaḥ gāvaḥ āpaḥ ca pīpayanta devīḥ
translated: And in your intoxicating gatherings, the cows and the divine waters have flowed.

original: uto no asya pūrvyaḥ patir dan vītam pātam payasa usriyāyāḥ //
analyzed: uta u naḥ asya pūrvyaḥ patiḥ vītam pātam payasaḥ usriyāyāḥ
translated: And be the first lord of this (sacrifice) for us. Drink the milk of the cow.

original: viṣṇor nu kaṃ vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yaḥ pārthivāni vimame rajāṃsi /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ nu kam vīryāṇi pra vocam yaḥ pārthivāni vimame rajāṃsi
translated: I will proclaim the heroic deeds of Vishnu, who has measured the earthly expanses.

original: yo askabhāyad uttaraṃ sadhasthaṃ vicakramāṇas tredhorugāyaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ askabhāyat uttaram sadhastham vicakramāṇaḥ tredhā urugāyaḥ
translated: Who has established the highest abode, the far-reaching one, the three-versed one.

original: pra tad viṣṇu stavate vīryeṇa mṛgo na bhīmaḥ kucaro giriṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: pra tat viṣṇuḥ stavate vīryeṇa mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ
translated: That Vishnu is praised for his heroism, like a terrible wild animal dwelling in the mountains.

original: yasyoruṣu triṣu vikramaṇeṣv adhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā //
analyzed: yasya uruṣu triṣu vikramaṇeṣu adhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: In whose three strides the whole world is contained.

original: pra viṣṇave śūṣam etu manma girikṣita urugāyāya vṛṣṇe /
analyzed: pra viṣṇave śūṣam etu manma giri kṣite uru gāyāya vṛṣṇe
translated: Let the hymn go forth to Vishnu, to the strong one who dwells on the mountain, to the far-going one,

original: ya idaṃ dīrgham prayataṃ sadhastham eko vimame tribhir it padebhiḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ idam dīrgham prayatam sadhastham ekaḥ vimame tribhiḥ id padebhiḥ
translated: Who alone has measured this vast and extended abode with three steps of his.

original: yasya trī pūrṇā madhunā padāny akṣīyamāṇā svadhayā madanti /
analyzed: yasya trī pūrṇā madhunā padāni a kṣīyamāṇā svadhayā madanti
translated: Whose three full measures of honey, inexhaustible, rejoice in their own nature,

original: ya u tridhātu pṛthivīm uta dyām eko dādhāra bhuvanāni viśvā //
analyzed: yaḥ u tridhātu pṛthivīm uta dyām ekaḥ dādhāra bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: Who alone supports the threefold earth and the sky, and all the worlds.

original: tad asya priyam abhi pātho aśyāṃ naro yatra devayavo madanti /
analyzed: tat asya priyam abhi pāthaḥ aśyām naraḥ yatra devayavaḥ madanti
translated: May I attain that dear path of his, where the men who are devoted to the gods rejoice.

original: urukramasya sa hi bandhur itthā viṣṇoḥ pade parame madhva utsaḥ //
analyzed: urukramasya sa hi bandhuḥ itthā viṣṇoḥ pade parame madhvaḥ utsaḥ
translated: For he is the kinsman of the far-striding one, here is the sweet spring in Vishnu's highest abode.

original: tā vāṃ vāstūny uśmasi gamadhyai yatra gāvo bhūriśṛṅgā ayāsaḥ /🔽atrāha tad urugāyasya vṛṣṇaḥ paramam padam ava bhāti bhūri //
analyzed: tā vām vāstūni uśmasi gamadhyai yatra gāvaḥ bhūri śṛṅgāḥ ayāsaḥ  atra aha tat uru gāyasya vṛṣṇaḥ paramam padam ava bhāti bhūri
translated: We desire to reach your abodes, where the many-peaked, untiring cows are,🔽There shines the highest place of the wide-going, bountiful one.

original: pra vaḥ pāntam andhaso dhiyāyate mahe śūrāya viṣṇave cārcata /
analyzed: pra vaḥ pāntam andhasaḥ dhiyāyate mahe śūrāya viṣṇave ca arcata
translated: To the great hero Vishnu, the protector of the juice, let the hymn go forth, and let us all honour him,

original: yā sānuni parvatānām adābhyā mahas tasthatur arvateva sādhunā //
analyzed: yā sānuni parvatānām adābhyā mahaḥ tasthatuḥ arvatā iva sādhunā
translated: Who, the unerring one, stands in the highest place of the mountains, like a well-trained horse.

original: tveṣam itthā samaraṇaṃ śimīvator indrāviṣṇū sutapā vām uruṣyati /
analyzed: tveṣam itthā samaraṇam śimīvatoḥ indrāviṣṇū suta pāḥ vām uruṣyati
translated: The impetuous one, the swift one's meeting together, Indra and Vishnu, your strong drink, O you of wide dominion, protects.

original: yā martyāya pratidhīyamānam it kṛśānor astur asanām uruṣyathaḥ //
analyzed: yā martyāya pratidhīyamānam id kṛśānoḥ astuḥ asanām uruṣyathaḥ
translated: You protect the mortal man from the burning, from the cutting off of the weak one, when it is being prepared for him.

original: tā īṃ vardhanti mahy asya pauṃsyaṃ ni mātarā nayati retase bhuje /
analyzed: tāḥ īm vardhanti mahi asya pauṃsyam ni mātarā nayati retase bhuje
translated: They increase this his manly power. He leads the two mothers to the place of enjoyment, to the seed.

original: dadhāti putro 'varam param pitur nāma tṛtīyam adhi rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: dadhāti putraḥ varam param pituḥ nāma tṛtīyam adhi rocane divaḥ
translated: The son places the lower and the higher than the father's name, the third, on the light of the sky.

original: tattad id asya pauṃsyaṃ gṛṇīmasīnasya trātur avṛkasya mīḷhuṣaḥ /
analyzed: tat tat id asya pauṃsyam gṛṇīmasi inasya trātuḥ avṛkasya mīḷhuṣaḥ
translated: This and this manly power of his we extol, of the protector, the guileless, the bountiful.

original: yaḥ pārthivāni tribhir id vigāmabhir uru kramiṣṭorugāyāya jīvase //
analyzed: yaḥ pārthivāni tribhiḥ id vigāmabhiḥ uru kramiṣṭa uru gāyāya jīvase
translated: Who with three steps, indeed, has gone over the earthly regions, to go widely for the sake of living.

original: dve id asya kramaṇe svardṛśo 'bhikhyāya martyo bhuraṇyati /🔽tṛtīyam asya nakir ā dadharṣati vayaś cana patayantaḥ patatriṇaḥ //
analyzed: dve id asya kramaṇe svar dṛśaḥ bhikhyāya martyaḥ bhuraṇyati  tṛtīyam asya nakir ā dadharṣati vayaḥ cana patayantaḥ patatriṇaḥ
translated: Two are his steps, the one who sees the light. The mortal man moves quickly, looking at them.🔽No one at all attacks his third. Even the birds flying do not reach it.

original: caturbhiḥ sākaṃ navatiṃ ca nāmabhiś cakraṃ na vṛttaṃ vyatīṃr avīvipat /
analyzed: caturbhiḥ sākam navatim ca nāmabhiḥ cakram na vṛttam vyatīn avīvipat
translated: With four, together with ninety names, he has rolled the wheel, as it were, over the distant ones.

original: bṛhaccharīro vimimāna ṛkvabhir yuvākumāraḥ praty ety āhavam //
analyzed: bṛhat śarīraḥ vimimānaḥ ṛkvabhiḥ yuvā kumāraḥ prati eti āhavam
translated: The one with a large body, the one who measures with the singers, the young boy, has come back to the challenge.

original: bhavā mitro na śevyo ghṛtāsutir vibhūtadyumna evayā u saprathāḥ /🔽adhā te viṣṇo viduṣā cid ardhya stomo yajñaś ca rādhyo haviṣmatā //
analyzed: bhavā mitraḥ na śevyaḥ ghṛta āsutiḥ vibhūta dyumnaḥ eva yāḥ u saprathāḥ  adhā te viṣṇo viduṣā cit ardhyaḥ stomaḥ yajñaḥ ca rādhyaḥ haviṣmatā
translated: Be thou a friendly guest, O Bhava, who craves the offered oil, with wealth of light and spreading fame.🔽Now, O Viṣṇu, let the hymn be honoured even by the wise, and the sacrifice by him who brings oblations.

original: yaḥ pūrvyāya vedhase navīyase sumajjānaye viṣṇave dadāśati /
analyzed: yaḥ pūrvyāya vedhase navīyase sumat jānaye viṣṇave dadāśati
translated: He who bestows on the ancient Creator, on the new-born, on the well-praised Viṣṇu,

original: yo jātam asya mahato mahi bravat sed u śravobhir yujyaṃ cid abhy asat //
analyzed: yaḥ jātam asya mahataḥ mahi bravat sa id u śravobhiḥ yujyam cit abhī asat
translated: Who extols the greatness of his greatness, who surpasses even the yoke-worthy with his fame.

original: tam u stotāraḥ pūrvyaṃ yathā vida ṛtasya garbhaṃ januṣā pipartana /
analyzed: tam u stotāraḥ pūrvyam yathā vidaḥ ṛtasya garbham januṣā pipartana
translated: Ye praisers, as ye know him, cherish the ancient one, the germ of holy order, with your birth.

original: āsya jānanto nāma cid vivaktana mahas te viṣṇo sumatim bhajāmahe //
analyzed: ā asya jānantaḥ nāma cit vivaktana mahaḥ te viṣṇo sumatim bhajāmahe
translated: Knowing his name, proclaim it; we honour, O Viṣṇu, thy great favour.

original: tam asya rājā varuṇas tam aśvinā kratuṃ sacanta mārutasya vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: tam asya rājā varuṇaḥ tam aśvinā kratum sacanta mārutasya vedhasaḥ
translated: King Varuna, and the two Asvins, and the Marut, the Creator, attend on his will.

original: dādhāra dakṣam uttamam aharvidaṃ vrajaṃ ca viṣṇuḥ sakhivāṃ aporṇute //
analyzed: dādhāra dakṣam uttamam ahar vidam vrajam ca viṣṇuḥ sakhivān aporṇute
translated: Viṣṇu supports the best skill, the knowledge of the day, and opens the cow-pen which has friends.

original: ā yo vivāya sacathāya daivya indrāya viṣṇuḥ sukṛte sukṛttaraḥ /
analyzed: ā yaḥ vivāya sacathāya daivyaḥ indrāya viṣṇuḥ su kṛte sukṛttaraḥ
translated: He who is to be chosen for companionship with the divine Indra, Viṣṇu, the more righteous, for the righteous one,

original: vedhā ajinvat triṣadhastha āryam ṛtasya bhāge yajamānam ābhajat //
analyzed: vedhāḥ ajinvat triṣadhasthaḥ āryam ṛtasya bhāge yajamānam ābhajat
translated: The Creator has quickened the noble one who dwells in the three worlds; he has allotted to the sacrificer his share of holy order.

original: abodhy agnir jma ud eti sūryo vy uṣāś candrā mahy āvo arciṣā /
analyzed: abodhi agniḥ jmaḥ ud eti sūryaḥ vi uṣāḥ candrā mahi āvaḥ arciṣā
translated: Agni has awakened, the sun rises from the earth, the dawn and the moon have shone forth for me with light.

original: āyukṣātām aśvinā yātave ratham prāsāvīd devaḥ savitā jagat pṛthak //
analyzed: āyukṣātām aśvinā yātave ratham prāsāvīt devaḥ savitā jagat pṛthak
translated: The two Ashvins have yoked their chariot to travel, the god Savitar has set the world apart.

original: yad yuñjāthe vṛṣaṇam aśvinā rathaṃ ghṛtena no madhunā kṣatram ukṣatam /
analyzed: yat yuñjāthe vṛṣaṇam aśvinā ratham ghṛtena naḥ madhunā kṣatram ukṣatam
translated: When you yoke your strong chariot, O Ashvins, sprinkle our kingdom with ghee and honey.

original: asmākam brahma pṛtanāsu jinvataṃ vayaṃ dhanā śūrasātā bhajemahi //
analyzed: asmākam brahma pṛtanāsu jinvatam vayam dhanā śūrasātā bhajemahi
translated: Inspire our prayer in battles, may we win riches through the hero's deeds.

original: arvāṅ tricakro madhuvāhano ratho jīrāśvo aśvinor yātu suṣṭutaḥ /
analyzed: arvāṅ tri cakraḥ madhu vāhanaḥ rathaḥ jīra aśvaḥ aśvinoḥ yātu suṣṭutaḥ
translated: The chariot of the Ashvins, drawn by swift horses, bearing honey, with three wheels, well-praised, may it come to us.

original: trivandhuro maghavā viśvasaubhagaḥ śaṃ na ā vakṣad dvipade catuṣpade //
analyzed: tri vandhuraḥ maghavā viśva saubhagaḥ śam naḥ ā vakṣat dvipade catuṣpade
translated: May the bountiful one, with three seats, all-fortunate, bring us well-being for our bipeds and quadrupeds.

original: ā na ūrjaṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvam madhumatyā naḥ kaśayā mimikṣatam /
analyzed: ā naḥ ūrjam vahatam aśvinā yuvam madhumatyā naḥ kaśayā mimikṣatam
translated: Bring us food, O Ashvins, anoint us with your whip rich in honey.

original: prāyus tāriṣṭaṃ nī rapāṃsi mṛkṣataṃ sedhataṃ dveṣo bhavataṃ sacābhuvā //
analyzed: pra āyuḥ tāriṣṭam niḥ rapāṃsi mṛkṣatam sedhatam dveṣaḥ bhavatam sacābhuvā
translated: Remove evil, destroy sins, drive away hatred, be our companions.

original: yuvaṃ ha garbhaṃ jagatīṣu dhattho yuvaṃ viśveṣu bhuvaneṣv antaḥ /
analyzed: yuvam ha garbham jagatīṣu dhatthaḥ yuvam viśveṣu bhuvaneṣu antar
translated: You two place the embryo in the worlds, you two are within all existing things.

original: yuvam agniṃ ca vṛṣaṇāv apaś ca vanaspatīṃr aśvināv airayethām //
analyzed: yuvam agnim ca vṛṣaṇau apaḥ ca vanaspatīṃr aśvinau airayethām
translated: You two, O mighty ones, move Agni, the waters, and the trees, O Ashvins.

original: yuvaṃ ha stho bhiṣajā bheṣajebhir atho ha stho rathyā rāthyebhiḥ /
analyzed: yuvam ha sthaḥ bhiṣajā bheṣajebhiḥ atha u ha sthaḥ rathyā rāthyebhiḥ
translated: Ye two are physicians with your healing balms, and ye are charioteers with charioteers' delights.

original: atho ha kṣatram adhi dhattha ugrā yo vāṃ haviṣmān manasā dadāśa //
analyzed: atha u ha kṣatram adhi dhatthaḥ ugrā yaḥ vām haviṣmān manasā dadāśa
translated: And ye, O mighty Ones, bestow the lordship on him who with a heart of faith presents you gifts.

original: vasū rudrā purumantū vṛdhantā daśasyataṃ no vṛṣaṇāv abhiṣṭau /
analyzed: vasū rudrā puru mantū vṛdhantā daśasyatam naḥ vṛṣaṇau abhiṣṭau
translated: Ye Vasus, Rudras, grant us ample room, ye Mighty Ones, be gracious unto us, O ye who move.

original: dasrā ha yad rekṇa aucathyo vām pra yat sasrāthe akavābhir ūtī //🔽ko vāṃ dāśat sumataye cid asyai vasū yad dhethe namasā pade goḥ /
analyzed: dasrā ha yat rekṇaḥ aucathyaḥ vām pra yat sasrāthe akavābhiḥ ūtī  kaḥ vām dāśat sumataye cit asyai vasū yat dhethe namasā pade goḥ
translated: When ye, O wondrous Ones, have sent forth wealth, or come to us with succours that are not to be deceived.🔽Who will give you for this your gracious favour, that ye may come to us with gifts, O Vasus, like a mind that goes its way at will?

original: jigṛtam asme revatīḥ purandhīḥ kāmapreṇeva manasā carantā //
analyzed: jigṛtam asme revatīḥ purandhīḥ kāmapreṇa iva manasā carantā
translated: Make ye to us, O ye of ample wealth, the hymns that are most rich in gifts, as ye move on.

original: yukto ha yad vāṃ taugryāya perur vi madhye arṇaso dhāyi pajraḥ /
analyzed: yuktaḥ ha yat vām taugryāya peruḥ vi madhye arṇasaḥ dhāyi pajraḥ
translated: When the car-warrior of the Tugryas yoked you, the car was stayed in the midst of the flood.

original: upa vām avaḥ śaraṇaṃ gameyaṃ śūro nājma patayadbhir evaiḥ //🔽upastutir aucathyam uruṣyen mā mām ime patatriṇī vi dugdhām /
analyzed: upa vām avaḥ śaraṇam gameyam śūraḥ na ajma patayadbhiḥ evaiḥ  upastutiḥ aucathyam uruṣyet mā mām ime patatriṇī vi dugdhām
translated: I would come to your favour, to your shelter, as a hero to his home with winged steeds.🔽I would preserve the praise of the son of Ucathya: let not these two birds milk me dry.

original: mā mām edho daśatayaś cito dhāk pra yad vām baddhas tmani khādati kṣām //
analyzed: mā mām edhaḥ daśatayaḥ citaḥ dhāk pra yat vām baddhaḥ tmani khādati kṣām
translated: Let not the fuel, cut in ten parts, burn me, when the bound one in his belly eats the earth.

original: na mā garan nadyo mātṛtamā dāsā yad īṃ susamubdham avādhuḥ /
analyzed: na mā garan nadyaḥ mātṛtamāḥ dāsāḥ yat īm su samubdham avādhuḥ
translated: Let not the rivers, most motherly of slaves, harm him, when they have loosened his well-bound bonds.

original: śiro yad asya traitano vitakṣat svayaṃ dāsa uro aṃsāv api gdha //
analyzed: śiraḥ yat asya traitanaḥ vitakṣat svayam dāsaḥ uraḥ aṃsau api
translated: When he, with his three-fold body, has stretched out his head, the slave himself has seized his shoulders and arms.

original: dīrghatamā māmateyo jujurvān daśame yuge /
analyzed: dīrghatamāḥ māmateyaḥ jujurvān daśame yuge
translated: Dīrghatamas, the son of Māmateya, the priest, in the tenth age,

original: apām arthaṃ yatīnām brahmā bhavati sārathiḥ //
analyzed: apām artham yatīnām brahmā bhavati sārathiḥ
translated: became the charioteer of the waters that go to their goal.

original: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī ṛtāvṛdhā mahī stuṣe vidatheṣu pracetasā /
analyzed: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī ṛtāvṛdhā mahī stuṣe vidatheṣu pracetasā
translated: I praise the great heaven and earth, who are true to their vow, in the sacrifices, who are wise in the assemblies,

original: devebhir ye devaputre sudaṃsasetthā dhiyā vāryāṇi prabhūṣataḥ //
analyzed: devebhiḥ ye deva putre su daṃsasā itthā dhiyā vāryāṇi prabhūṣataḥ
translated: who, with the gods, as the sons of the gods, are bountiful in bestowing good things, as they are sought by this prayer.

original: uta manye pitur adruho mano mātur mahi svatavas tad dhavīmabhiḥ /
analyzed: uta manye pituḥ adruhaḥ manaḥ mātuḥ mahi sva tavaḥ tat havīmabhiḥ
translated: And I think of the mind of the father, who is free from hatred, and of the greatness of the mother, who is self-existent, with the offerings.

original: suretasā pitarā bhūma cakratur uru prajāyā amṛtaṃ varīmabhiḥ //
analyzed: su retasā pitarā bhūma cakratuḥ uru prajāyai amṛtam varīmabhiḥ
translated: The parents, who are rich in seed, have made the earth, with the abundant prayers, vast for the sake of offspring and immortality.

original: te sūnavaḥ svapasaḥ sudaṃsaso mahī jajñur mātarā pūrvacittaye /
analyzed: te sūnavaḥ su apasaḥ su daṃsasaḥ mahī jajñuḥ mātarā pūrvacittaye
translated: Those sons, who are well-formed, who are self-powerful, have been born from the great mothers, for the sake of the first thought.

original: sthātuś ca satyaṃ jagataś ca dharmaṇi putrasya pāthaḥ padam advayāvinaḥ //
analyzed: sthātuḥ ca satyam jagataḥ ca dharmaṇi putrasya pāthaḥ padam a dvayāvinaḥ
translated: For the standing one, and for the moving one, the truth is the law. It is the path of the son, who does not go astray.

original: te māyino mamire supracetaso jāmī sayonī mithunā samokasā /
analyzed: te māyinaḥ mamire su pracetasaḥ jāmī sayonī mithunā samokasā
translated: Those magicians, who are well-known, have made the twins, who are of the same womb, of the same origin, and of the same abode.

original: navyaṃnavyaṃ tantum ā tanvate divi samudre antaḥ kavayaḥ sudītayaḥ //🔽tad rādho adya savitur vareṇyaṃ vayaṃ devasya prasave manāmahe /
analyzed: navyam navyam tantum ā tanvate divi samudre antar kavayaḥ su dītayaḥ  tat rādhaḥ adya savituḥ vareṇyam vayam devasya prasave manāmahe
translated: They weave a new thread in the sky, the wise ones, with good hymns, in the midst of the ocean.🔽That excellent grace of the sun god today, we conceive in the impulse of the god.

original: asmabhyaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī sucetunā rayiṃ dhattaṃ vasumantaṃ śatagvinam //
analyzed: asmabhyam dyāvāpṛthivī su cetunā rayim dhattam vasumantam śatagvinam
translated: O heaven and earth, grant us wealth with good thought, with a hundred powers and full of treasures.

original: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaśambhuva ṛtāvarī rajaso dhārayatkavī /
analyzed: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī viśva śambhuvaḥ ṛtāvarī rajasaḥ dhārayat kavī
translated: For these two, heaven and earth, are all-prosperous, the two truthful ones, the two wise ones, supporting the realm.

original: sujanmanī dhiṣaṇe antar īyate devo devī dharmaṇā sūryaḥ śuciḥ //
analyzed: su janmanī dhiṣaṇe antar īyate devaḥ devī dharmaṇā sūryaḥ śuciḥ
translated: The two well-born, inwardly moving, all-pervading, divine, righteous, pure sun is born.

original: uruvyacasā mahinī asaścatā pitā mātā ca bhuvanāni rakṣataḥ /🔽sudhṛṣṭame vapuṣye na rodasī pitā yat sīm abhi rūpair avāsayat //
analyzed: uru vyacasā mahinī asaścatā pitā mātā ca bhuvanāni rakṣataḥ  su dhṛṣṭame vapuṣye na rodasī pitā yat sīm abhi rūpaiḥ avāsayat
translated: The two vast, wide-ruling, imperishable, father and mother, protect the worlds.🔽The two most daring, beautiful, unapproachable worlds, when the father, with his forms, settled them.

original: sa vahniḥ putraḥ pitroḥ pavitravān punāti dhīro bhuvanāni māyayā /
analyzed: sa vahniḥ putraḥ pitroḥ pavitravān punāti dhīraḥ bhuvanāni māyayā
translated: That son, the purifier, the wise one, with his purifying power, purifies the worlds by his magic power.

original: dhenuṃ ca pṛśniṃ vṛṣabhaṃ suretasaṃ viśvāhā śukram payo asya dukṣata //
analyzed: dhenum ca pṛśnim vṛṣabham su retasam viśvāhā śukram payaḥ asya dukṣata
translated: And his cow, the speckled one, and the bull, the very virile one, always yield pure milk.

original: ayaṃ devānām apasām apastamo yo jajāna rodasī viśvaśambhuvā /
analyzed: ayam devānām apasām apastamaḥ yaḥ jajāna rodasī viśva śambhuvā
translated: This one, the best of the gods' attendants, who has produced the two worlds, all-prosperous,

original: vi yo mame rajasī sukratūyayājarebhi skambhanebhiḥ sam ānṛce //
analyzed: vi yaḥ mame rajasī sukratūyayā ajarebhiḥ skambhanebhiḥ sam ānṛce
translated: He who with his own most excellent thought has spread out the two worlds, with his undecaying supports, with his most ancient supports.

original: te no gṛṇāne mahinī mahi śravaḥ kṣatraṃ dyāvāpṛthivī dhāsatho bṛhat /
analyzed: te naḥ gṛṇāne mahinī mahi śravaḥ kṣatram dyāvāpṛthivī dhāsathaḥ bṛhat
translated: O you two, praised by us, make great fame and great lordship for us, O Heaven and Earth. Support the great lordship.

original: yenābhi kṛṣṭīs tatanāma viśvahā panāyyam ojo asme sam invatam //
analyzed: yena abhi kṛṣṭīḥ tatanāma viśvahā panāyyam ojaḥ asme sam invatam
translated: By which (lordship) we may conquer all people in every way. Impel the lordship that is to be protected towards us.

original: kim u śreṣṭhaḥ kiṃ yaviṣṭho na ājagan kim īyate dūtyaṃ kad yad ūcima /
analyzed: kim u śreṣṭhaḥ kim yaviṣṭhaḥ naḥ ājagan kim īyate dūtyam kad yat ūcima
translated: What is the best? What is the youngest? What has come? What is the message that is being brought? What is it that we have said?

original: na nindima camasaṃ yo mahākulo 'gne bhrātar druṇa id bhūtim ūdima //
analyzed: na nindima camasam yaḥ mahā kulaḥ gne bhrātar druṇe id bhūtim ūdima
translated: We do not blame the great family of the pot, O Agni, O brother, we have declared the prosperity of the tree.

original: ekaṃ camasaṃ caturaḥ kṛṇotana tad vo devā abruvan tad va āgamam /
analyzed: ekam camasam caturaḥ kṛṇotana tat vaḥ devāḥ abruvan tat vaḥ āgamam
translated: Make one pot into four. That the gods have said to you, that I have come to know.

original: saudhanvanā yady evā kariṣyatha sākaṃ devair yajñiyāso bhaviṣyatha //
analyzed: saudhanvanāḥ yadi evā kariṣyatha sākam devaiḥ yajñiyāsaḥ bhaviṣyatha
translated: O sons of Sudhanvan, if you will do that, you will become worthy of sacrifice together with the gods.

original: agniṃ dūtam prati yad abravītanāśvaḥ kartvo ratha uteha kartvaḥ /
analyzed: agnim dūtam prati yat abravītana aśvaḥ kartvaḥ rathaḥ uta iha kartvaḥ
translated: When you have said to Agni, the messenger, 'A horse is to be made, a chariot is to be made here,

original: dhenuḥ kartvā yuvaśā kartvā dvā tāni bhrātar anu vaḥ kṛtvy emasi //
analyzed: dhenuḥ kartvā yuvaśā kartvā dvā tāni bhrātar anu vaḥ kṛtvī emasi
translated: A cow is to be made, two young ones are to be made,' O brother, we come to you for that which is to be done.

original: cakṛvāṃsa ṛbhavas tad apṛcchata kved abhūd yaḥ sya dūto na ājagan /
analyzed: cakṛvāṃsaḥ ṛbhavaḥ tat apṛcchata kva id abhūt yaḥ sya dūtaḥ naḥ ājagan
translated: The Rbhus, having done it, asked, 'Where has he been, the messenger who has come?'

original: yadāvākhyac camasāñ caturaḥ kṛtān ād it tvaṣṭā gnāsv antar ny ānaje //
analyzed: yadā avākhyat camasān caturaḥ kṛtān āt id tvaṣṭā gnāsu antar ni ānaje
translated: When he announced the four prepared cups, then Tvastr placed them among the wives.

original: hanāmaināṃ iti tvaṣṭā yad abravīc camasaṃ ye devapānam anindiṣuḥ /
analyzed: hanāma enām iti tvaṣṭā yat abravīt camasam ye deva pānam anindiṣuḥ
translated: When Tvastr said, Let us kill her, those who censured the cup for the gods,

original: anyā nāmāni kṛṇvate sute sacāṃ anyair enān kanyā nāmabhi sparat //
analyzed: anyā nāmāni kṛṇvate sute sacā am anyaiḥ enān kanyā nāmabhiḥ sparat
translated: they make other names for themselves at the pressing, with other names the maiden shall touch them.

original: indro harī yuyuje aśvinā ratham bṛhaspatir viśvarūpām upājata /
analyzed: indraḥ harī yuyuje aśvinā ratham bṛhaspatiḥ viśvarūpām upājata
translated: Indra yoked the two bay horses, the Ashvins yoked the chariot, Brihaspati approached the all-formed one,

original: ṛbhur vibhvā vājo devāṃ agacchata svapaso yajñiyam bhāgam aitana //
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ vibhvā vājaḥ devān agacchata su apasaḥ yajñiyam bhāgam aitana
translated: Ribhu, Vibhvan, Vaja went to the gods, the well-made ones obtained the sacrificial portion.

original: niś carmaṇo gām ariṇīta dhītibhir yā jarantā yuvaśā tākṛṇotana /
analyzed: niḥ carmaṇaḥ gām ariṇīta dhītibhiḥ yā jarantā yuvaśā tā akṛṇotana
translated: With thoughts they brought out the cow from the skin, you two made her young who was growing old.

original: saudhanvanā aśvād aśvam atakṣata yuktvā ratham upa devāṃ ayātana //
analyzed: saudhanvanāḥ aśvāt aśvam atakṣata yuktvā ratham upa devān ayātana
translated: The Saudhanvanas fashioned a horse after a horse, having yoked the chariot they approached the gods.

original: idam udakam pibatety abravītanedaṃ vā ghā pibatā muñjanejanam /
analyzed: idam udakam pibata iti abravītana idam vā gha pibata muñja nejanam
translated: He said, Drink this water, they said, Or rather drink this Muñj-nejanam.

original: saudhanvanā yadi tan neva haryatha tṛtīye ghā savane mādayādhvai //
analyzed: saudhanvanāḥ yadi tat na iva haryatha tṛtīye ghā savane mādayādhvai
translated: If you Saudhanvanas do not like that, you shall rejoice at the third pressing.

original: āpo bhūyiṣṭhā ity eko abravīd agnir bhūyiṣṭha ity anyo abravīt /
analyzed: āpaḥ bhūyiṣṭhāḥ iti ekaḥ abravīt agniḥ bhūyiṣṭhaḥ iti anyaḥ abravīt
translated: One said, The waters are most numerous, another said, Agni is most numerous.

original: vadharyantīm bahubhyaḥ praiko abravīd ṛtā vadantaś camasāṃ apiṃśata //🔽śroṇām eka udakaṃ gām avājati māṃsam ekaḥ piṃśati sūnayābhṛtam /🔽ā nimrucaḥ śakṛd eko apābharat kiṃ svit putrebhyaḥ pitarā upāvatuḥ //
analyzed: vadharyantīm bahubhyaḥ pra ekaḥ abravīt ṛtā vadantaḥ camasān apiṃśata  śroṇām ekaḥ udakam gām avājati māṃsam ekaḥ piṃśati sūnayā ābhṛtam  ā nimrucaḥ śakṛt ekaḥ apābharat kim svid putrebhyaḥ pitarau upāvatuḥ

original: udvatsv asmā akṛṇotanā tṛṇaṃ nivatsv apaḥ svapasyayā naraḥ /🔽agohyasya yad asastanā gṛhe tad adyedam ṛbhavo nānu gacchatha //🔽sammīlya yad bhuvanā paryasarpata kva svit tātyā pitarā va āsatuḥ /🔽aśapata yaḥ karasnaṃ va ādade yaḥ prābravīt pro tasmā abravītana //🔽suṣupvāṃsa ṛbhavas tad apṛcchatāgohya ka idaṃ no abūbudhat /🔽śvānam basto bodhayitāram abravīt saṃvatsara idam adyā vy akhyata //🔽divā yānti maruto bhūmyāgnir ayaṃ vāto antarikṣeṇa yāti /
analyzed: udvatsu asmai akṛṇotana tṛṇam nivatsu apaḥ su apasyayā naraḥ 🔽agohyasya yat asastanā gṛhe tat adyā idam ṛbhavaḥ na anu gacchatha 🔽sammīlya yat bhuvanā paryasarpata kva svid tātyā pitarā vaḥ āsatuḥ 🔽aśapata yaḥ karasnam vaḥ ādade yaḥ prābravīt pra u tasmai abravītana 🔽suṣupvāṃsaḥ ṛbhavaḥ tat apṛcchata agohya kaḥ idam naḥ abūbudhat 🔽śvānam bastaḥ bodhayitāram abravīt saṃvatsare idam adyā vi akhyata 🔽divā yānti marutaḥ bhūmyā agniḥ ayam vātaḥ antarikṣeṇa yāti

original: adbhir yāti varuṇaḥ samudrair yuṣmāṃ icchantaḥ śavaso napātaḥ //
analyzed: adbhiḥ yāti varuṇaḥ samudraiḥ yuṣmān icchantaḥ śavasaḥ napātaḥ
translated: Varuna goes with the waters, the sons of strength, desiring you with the oceans.

original: mā no mitro varuṇo aryamāyur indra ṛbhukṣā marutaḥ pari khyan /
analyzed: mā naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ aryamā āyuḥ indraḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ marutaḥ pari khyan
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aryaman, Indra, Rbhukshan, the Maruts not deprive us of life,

original: yad vājino devajātasya sapteḥ pravakṣyāmo vidathe vīryāṇi //
analyzed: yat vājinaḥ deva jātasya sapteḥ pravakṣyāmaḥ vidathe vīryāṇi
translated: When we shall proclaim in the assembly the mighty deeds of the strong one, born of the gods, the racer.

original: yan nirṇijā rekṇasā prāvṛtasya rātiṃ gṛbhītām mukhato nayanti /
analyzed: yat nirṇijā rekṇasā prāvṛtasya rātim gṛbhītām mukhataḥ nayanti
translated: When they lead forth from the mouth the grasped gift of the one wrapped in fat, in the caul,

original: suprāṅ ajo memyad viśvarūpa indrāpūṣṇoḥ priyam apy eti pāthaḥ //
analyzed: su prāṅ ajaḥ memyat viśva rūpaḥ indrāpūṣṇoḥ priyam api eti pāthaḥ
translated: The goat of good omen, of all forms, goes forth, and enters the path dear to Indra and Pūṣan.

original: eṣa cchāgaḥ puro aśvena vājinā pūṣṇo bhāgo nīyate viśvadevyaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa chāgaḥ puras aśvena vājinā pūṣṇaḥ bhāgaḥ nīyate viśvadevyaḥ
translated: This goat, the share of Pūṣan, is led forth in front of the strong horse, of all the gods.

original: abhipriyaṃ yat puroḷāśam arvatā tvaṣṭed enaṃ sauśravasāya jinvati //
analyzed: abhipriyam yat puroḷāśam arvatā tvaṣṭā id enam sauśravasāya jinvati
translated: When Tvaṣṭṛ impels it with the racer, the dear cake, for renown.

original: yad dhaviṣyam ṛtuśo devayānaṃ trir mānuṣāḥ pary aśvaṃ nayanti /
analyzed: yat haviṣyam ṛtuśas deva yānam tris mānuṣāḥ pari aśvam nayanti
translated: When the men thrice lead the horse around, the sacrificial food, in due season, going to the gods,

original: atrā pūṣṇaḥ prathamo bhāga eti yajñaṃ devebhyaḥ prativedayann ajaḥ //
analyzed: atrā pūṣṇaḥ prathamaḥ bhāgaḥ eti yajñam devebhyaḥ prativedayan ajaḥ
translated: Then the goat goes forth as the first share of Pūṣan, announcing the sacrifice to the gods.

original: hotādhvaryur āvayā agnimindho grāvagrābha uta śaṃstā suvipraḥ /
analyzed: hotā adhvaryuḥ āvayāḥ agnimindhaḥ grāvagrābhaḥ uta śaṃstā su vipraḥ
translated: The Hotṛ, the Adhvaryu, the Āvya, the kindler of the fire, the holder of the pressing-stones, and the praiser, the good priest,

original: tena yajñena svaraṅkṛtena sviṣṭena vakṣaṇā ā pṛṇadhvam //
analyzed: tena yajñena su araṅkṛtena su iṣṭena vakṣaṇāḥ ā pṛṇadhvam
translated: With that sacrifice, well-ordered, well-performed, do ye fill the hollows.

original: yūpavraskā uta ye yūpavāhāś caṣālaṃ ye aśvayūpāya takṣati /
analyzed: yūpavraskāḥ uta ye yūpa vāhāḥ caṣālam ye aśva yūpāya takṣati
translated: Those who set up the sacrificial post, those who carry the sacrificial post, those who carve the top ornament for the horse's post,

original: ye cārvate pacanaṃ sambharanty uto teṣām abhigūrtir na invatu //
analyzed: ye ca arvate pacanam sambharanti uta u teṣām abhigūrtiḥ naḥ invatu
translated: And those who prepare the cooking for the dappled one - may their approval also inspire us.

original: upa prāgāt suman me 'dhāyi manma devānām āśā upa vītapṛṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: upa prāgāt sumat me dhāyi manma devānām āśāḥ upa vīta pṛṣṭhaḥ
translated: He has come forward, my inspiration has been given to me, the wish of the gods, with open back.

original: anv enaṃ viprā ṛṣayo madanti devānām puṣṭe cakṛmā subandhum //
analyzed: anu enam viprāḥ ṛṣayaḥ madanti devānām puṣṭe cakṛma su bandhum
translated: The sages, the seers, rejoice in him. We have made a good friend in the prosperity of the gods.

original: yad vājino dāma saṃdānam arvato yā śīrṣaṇyā raśanā rajjur asya /
analyzed: yat vājinaḥ dāma saṃdānam arvataḥ yā śīrṣaṇyā raśanā rajjuḥ asya
translated: The bridle and bit of the strong horse, the rope and thong that goes through the nose,

original: yad vā ghāsya prabhṛtam āsye tṛṇaṃ sarvā tā te api deveṣv astu //
analyzed: yat vā gha asya prabhṛtam āsye tṛṇam sarvā tā te api deveṣu astu
translated: Or the grass that is first put in its mouth - may all that be for you among the gods.

original: yad aśvasya kraviṣo makṣikāśa yad vā svarau svadhitau riptam asti /
analyzed: yat aśvasya kraviṣaḥ makṣikā āśa yat vā svarau svadhitau riptam asti
translated: The maggots in the horse's raw flesh, or what is stuck to the knife and chopping block,

original: yad dhastayoḥ śamitur yan nakheṣu sarvā tā te api deveṣv astu //
analyzed: yat hastayoḥ śamituḥ yat nakheṣu sarvā tā te api deveṣu astu
translated: Or what is on the hands of the slayer or in the nails - may all that be for you among the gods.

original: yad ūvadhyam udarasyāpavāti ya āmasya kraviṣo gandho asti /
analyzed: yat ūvadhyam udarasya apavāti yaḥ āmasya kraviṣaḥ gandhaḥ asti
translated: What foul smell comes from the entrails when it is being cooked, or what smell there is of raw flesh,

original: sukṛtā tac chamitāraḥ kṛṇvantūta medhaṃ śṛtapākam pacantu //
analyzed: su kṛtā tat śamitāraḥ kṛṇvantu uta medham śṛta pākam pacantu
translated: The slayers make that well-prepared. Let them cook the oblation with the cooked meat.

original: yat te gātrād agninā pacyamānād abhi śūlaṃ nihatasyāvadhāvati /
analyzed: yat te gātrāt agninā pacyamānāt abhi śūlam nihatasya avadhāvati
translated: What flows from your body when it is being cooked with fire, when it is struck on the stake,

original: mā tad bhūmyām ā śriṣan mā tṛṇeṣu devebhyas tad uśadbhyo rātam astu //🔽ye vājinam paripaśyanti pakvaṃ ya īm āhuḥ surabhir nir hareti /
analyzed: mā tat bhūmyām ā śriṣat mā tṛṇeṣu devebhyaḥ tat uśadbhyaḥ rātam astu  ye vājinam paripaśyanti pakvam ye īm āhuḥ surabhiḥ niḥ hara iti
translated: Let it not lie on the ground, let it not lie on the grass; let that be offered to the joyous gods.🔽Those who look upon the cooked horse, and say of it, 'It is fragrant, carry it out,'

original: ye cārvato māṃsabhikṣām upāsata uto teṣām abhigūrtir na invatu //🔽yan nīkṣaṇam māṃspacanyā ukhāyā yā pātrāṇi yūṣṇa āsecanāni /
analyzed: ye ca arvataḥ māṃsa bhikṣām upāsate uta u teṣām abhigūrtiḥ naḥ invatu  yat nīkṣaṇam māṃspacanyāḥ ukhāyāḥ yā pātrāṇi yūṣṇaḥ āsecanāni
translated: And those who attend upon it as a dainty morsel of meat, may their approval also speed it on.🔽The heart, the lungs, the caul of the flesh-cooking pot, the vessels that were used for pouring out the broth,

original: ūṣmaṇyāpidhānā carūṇām aṅkāḥ sūnāḥ pari bhūṣanty aśvam //
analyzed: ūṣmaṇyā apidhānā carūṇām aṅkāḥ sūnāḥ pari bhūṣanti aśvam
translated: The hot embers of the dishes, the spits, the knives, the vessels, surround the horse.

original: nikramaṇaṃ niṣadanaṃ vivartanaṃ yac ca paḍbīśam arvataḥ /
analyzed: nikramaṇam niṣadanam vivartanam yat ca paḍbīśam arvataḥ
translated: The stepping, the sitting, the turning round, and the harnessing of the horse,

original: yac ca papau yac ca ghāsiṃ jaghāsa sarvā tā te api deveṣv astu //
analyzed: yat ca papau yat ca ghāsim jaghāsa sarvā tā te api deveṣu astu
translated: And what he drank, and what he ate of the fodder, all that of thine may it be with the gods.

original: mā tvāgnir dhvanayīd dhūmagandhir mokhā bhrājanty abhi vikta jaghriḥ /
analyzed: mā tvā agniḥ dhvanayīt dhūma gandhiḥ mā ukhā bhrājantī abhi vikta jaghriḥ
translated: Let not the fire burn thee, smelling of smoke, nor the bright, all-devouring, flaming mouth.

original: iṣṭaṃ vītam abhigūrtaṃ vaṣaṭkṛtaṃ taṃ devāsaḥ prati gṛbhṇanty aśvam //
analyzed: iṣṭam vītam abhigūrtam vaṣaṭkṛtam tam devāsaḥ prati gṛbhṇanti aśvam
translated: The gods receive the horse which has been offered, made ready, approved, and consecrated with 'Vashat.'

original: yad aśvāya vāsa upastṛṇanty adhīvāsaṃ yā hiraṇyāny asmai /
analyzed: yat aśvāya vāsaḥ upastṛṇanti adhīvāsam yā hiraṇyāni asmai
translated: The cloth which they spread out for the horse, the upper garment, and the gold ornaments for it,

original: saṃdānam arvantam paḍbīśam priyā deveṣv ā yāmayanti //
analyzed: saṃdānam arvantam paḍbīśam priyā deveṣu ā yāmayanti
translated: The girth, the harness, the bridle, the dear one, they lead to the gods.

original: yat te sāde mahasā śūkṛtasya pārṣṇyā vā kaśayā vā tutoda /
analyzed: yat te sāde mahasā śūkṛtasya pārṣṇyā vā kaśayā vā tutoda
translated: If you have been hurt by the saddle, by the whip or by the goad,

original: sruceva tā haviṣo adhvareṣu sarvā tā te brahmaṇā sūdayāmi //
analyzed: srucā iva tā haviṣaḥ adhvareṣu sarvā tā te brahmaṇā sūdayāmi
translated: like an oblation on a ladle at sacrifices, I appease them all with prayer.

original: catustriṃśad vājino devabandhor vaṅkrīr aśvasya svadhitiḥ sam eti /
analyzed: catustriṃśat vājinaḥ deva bandhoḥ vaṅkrīḥ aśvasya svadhitiḥ sam eti
translated: The hatchet of the horse, bound to the gods, goes to the thirty-four joints of the strong one.

original: acchidrā gātrā vayunā kṛṇota paruṣparur anughuṣyā vi śasta //
analyzed: acchidrā gātrā vayunā kṛṇota paruḥ paruḥ anughuṣya vi śasta
translated: Make the limbs without a gap, cut according to the rule, joint by joint, without missing.

original: ekas tvaṣṭur aśvasyā viśastā dvā yantārā bhavatas tatha ṛtuḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ tvaṣṭuḥ aśvasya viśastā dvā yantārā bhavataḥ tathā ṛtuḥ
translated: There is one who cuts the horse's limbs, Tvashtri; there are two who guide it, so is the rule.

original: yā te gātrāṇām ṛtuthā kṛṇomi tātā piṇḍānām pra juhomy agnau //
analyzed: yā te gātrāṇām ṛtuthā kṛṇomi tātā piṇḍānām pra juhomi agnau
translated: I who make your limbs according to the rule, I offer the portions of the limbs in the fire.

original: mā tvā tapat priya ātmāpiyantam mā svadhitis tanva ā tiṣṭhipat te /
analyzed: mā tvā tapat priyaḥ ātmā apiyantam mā svadhitiḥ tanve ā tiṣṭhipat te
translated: Let not your dear self, when it enters, burn you; let not the hatchet stay in your body.

original: mā te gṛdhnur aviśastātihāya chidrā gātrāṇy asinā mithū kaḥ //
analyzed: mā te gṛdhnuḥ aviśastā atihāya chidrā gātrāṇi asinā mithū kaḥ
translated: Let not the greedy one, cutting too much, make your limbs with holes, like a pair of tongs.

original: na vā u etan mriyase na riṣyasi devāṃ id eṣi pathibhiḥ sugebhiḥ /🔽harī te yuñjā pṛṣatī abhūtām upāsthād vājī dhuri rāsabhasya //
analyzed: na vai u etat mriyase na riṣyasi devān id eṣi pathibhiḥ su gebhiḥ  harī te pṛṣatī abhūtām upāsthāt vājī dhuri rāsabhasya
translated: You do not die, you are not injured; you go to the gods by the easy paths.🔽Your two bay horses with white tails have been yoked; the strong one has mounted the ass's back.

original: sugavyaṃ no vājī svaśvyam puṃsaḥ putrāṃ uta viśvāpuṣaṃ rayim /
analyzed: su gavyam naḥ vājī su aśvyam puṃsaḥ putrān uta viśvāpuṣam rayim
translated: Give us, O strong one, cattle and good horses, and manly sons, and wealth which satisfies all desires.

original: anāgāstvaṃ no aditiḥ kṛṇotu kṣatraṃ no aśvo vanatāṃ haviṣmān //
analyzed: anāgāstvam naḥ aditiḥ kṛṇotu kṣatram naḥ aśvaḥ vanatām haviṣmān
translated: May Aditi grant us freedom from sin; may the horse, the lord, accept our oblation.

original: yad akrandaḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāna udyan samudrād uta vā purīṣāt /
analyzed: yat akrandaḥ prathamam jāyamānaḥ udyan samudrāt uta vā purīṣāt
translated: When thou didst cry aloud as first thou wast born, rising from the ocean or from the dust,

original: śyenasya pakṣā hariṇasya bāhū upastutyam mahi jātaṃ te arvan //
analyzed: śyenasya pakṣāḥ hariṇasya bāhū upastutyam mahi jātam te arvan
translated: The wings of the hawk, the arms of the antelope, the great birth of thee, O steed, is to be praised.

original: yamena dattaṃ trita enam āyunag indra eṇam prathamo adhy atiṣṭhat /
analyzed: yamena dattam tritaḥ enam āyunak indraḥ eṇam prathamaḥ adhi atiṣṭhat
translated: Given by Yama, Trita hath yoked him; Indra first of all mounted upon him.

original: gandharvo asya raśanām agṛbhṇāt sūrād aśvaṃ vasavo nir ataṣṭa //
analyzed: gandharvaḥ asya raśanām agṛbhṇāt sūrāt aśvam vasavaḥ niḥ ataṣṭa
translated: The Gandharva grasped his reins; from the sun the Vasus fashioned the horse.

original: asi yamo asy ādityo arvann asi trito guhyena vratena /
analyzed: asi yamaḥ asi ādityaḥ arvan asi tritaḥ guhyena vratena
translated: Thou art Yama, O steed, thou art Âditya; thou art Trita by the law of the secret (Veda).

original: asi somena samayā vipṛkta āhus te trīṇi divi bandhanāni //
analyzed: asi somena samayā vipṛktaḥ āhuḥ te trīṇi divi bandhanāni
translated: Thou art separated by Soma from (thy companions); they say that three bonds of thine are in heaven.

original: trīṇi ta āhur divi bandhanāni trīṇy apsu trīṇy antaḥ samudre /
analyzed: trīṇi te āhuḥ divi bandhanāni trīṇi apsu trīṇi antar samudre
translated: Three bonds of thine they say are in heaven, three in the waters, three in the ocean.

original: uteva me varuṇaś chantsy arvan yatrā ta āhuḥ paramaṃ janitram //🔽imā te vājinn avamārjanānīmā śaphānāṃ sanitur nidhānā /
analyzed: uta iva me varuṇaḥ chantsi arvan yatrā te āhuḥ paramam janitram  imā te vājin avamārjanāni imā śaphānām sanituḥ nidhānā
translated: Even as Varuna's fetter, O steed, art thou, O horse, where they say is thy highest birthplace.🔽These are thy lower scrapings, O steed, these the places for thy hoofs, O thou who hast a good place to rest on.

original: atrā te bhadrā raśanā apaśyam ṛtasya yā abhirakṣanti gopāḥ //
analyzed: atrā te bhadrāḥ raśanāḥ apaśyam ṛtasya yāḥ abhirakṣanti gopāḥ
translated: Here I have seen thy fair reins, the guardians of truth which watch over (thee).

original: ātmānaṃ te manasārād ajānām avo divā patayantam pataṅgam /
analyzed: ātmānam te manasā ārāt ajānām avas divā patayantam pataṅgam
translated: I have known thee, O soul, by the mind, the bird that flieth in the heaven, the lord of the day.

original: śiro apaśyam pathibhiḥ sugebhir areṇubhir jehamānam patatri //🔽atrā te rūpam uttamam apaśyaṃ jigīṣamāṇam iṣa ā pade goḥ /
analyzed: śiraḥ apaśyam pathibhiḥ su gebhiḥ areṇubhiḥ jehamānam patatri  atrā te rūpam uttamam apaśyam jigīṣamāṇam iṣaḥ ā pade goḥ
translated: I have seen thy head, the bird that spreadeth its wings, by the easy paths, the dustless ones.🔽Here I have seen thy highest form, striving to win food at the foot of the cow.

original: yadā te marto anu bhogam ānaḷ ād id grasiṣṭha oṣadhīr ajīgaḥ //
analyzed: yadā te martaḥ anu bhogam ānaṭ āt id grasiṣṭhaḥ oṣadhīḥ ajīgaḥ
translated: When the mortal man hath followed thy enjoyment, then, O most voracious one, thou hast gained the plants.

original: anu tvā ratho anu maryo arvann anu gāvo 'nu bhagaḥ kanīnām /
analyzed: anu tvā rathaḥ anu maryaḥ arvan anu gāvaḥ nu bhagaḥ kanīnām
translated: The chariot hath followed thee, O steed, the young man, the cows, the portion of the maidens.

original: anu vrātāsas tava sakhyam īyur anu devā mamire vīryaṃ te //
analyzed: anu vrātāsaḥ tava sakhyam īyuḥ anu devāḥ mamire vīryam te
translated: The bands have gone to thy friendship, the gods have measured thy strength.

original: hiraṇyaśṛṅgo 'yo asya pādā manojavā avara indra āsīt /
analyzed: hiraṇya śṛṅgaḥ yaḥ asya pādā manaḥ javāḥ avaraḥ indraḥ āsīt
translated: Golden-horned was he, his feet were of iron, his speed was like that of thought, Indra was below.

original: devā id asya haviradyam āyan yo arvantam prathamo adhyatiṣṭhat //
analyzed: devāḥ id asya haviḥ adyam āyan yaḥ arvantam prathamaḥ adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: The gods have come to his oblation who first mounted the horse.

original: īrmāntāsaḥ silikamadhyamāsaḥ saṃ śūraṇāso divyāso atyāḥ /
analyzed: īrmāntāsaḥ silikamadhyamāsaḥ sam śūraṇāsaḥ divyāsaḥ atyāḥ
translated: They have long bodies, their middle is of stone, they are the swift ones, the heavenly ones.

original: haṃsā iva śreṇiśo yatante yad ākṣiṣur divyam ajmam aśvāḥ //
analyzed: haṃsāḥ iva śreṇiśas yatante yat ākṣiṣuḥ divyam ajmam aśvāḥ
translated: They strive in rows like swans when the horses have stretched the heavenly path.

original: tava śarīram patayiṣṇv arvan tava cittaṃ vāta iva dhrajīmān /
analyzed: tava śarīram patayiṣṇu arvan tava cittam vātaḥ iva dhrajīmān
translated: Thy body, O horse, is eager to fly, thy mind, like the wind, is impetuous.

original: tava śṛṅgāṇi viṣṭhitā purutrāraṇyeṣu jarbhurāṇā caranti //
analyzed: tava śṛṅgāṇi viṣṭhitā purutrā araṇyeṣu jarbhurāṇā caranti
translated: Thy horns are spread abroad in many places: they move, rejoicing, in the woods.

original: upa prāgāc chasanaṃ vājy arvā devadrīcā manasā dīdhyānaḥ /
analyzed: upa prāgāt śasanam vājī arvā devadrīcā manasā dīdhyānaḥ
translated: The courser hath come forward to the banquet, reflecting with a mind directed to the Gods.

original: ajaḥ puro nīyate nābhir asyānu paścāt kavayo yanti rebhāḥ //
analyzed: ajaḥ puras nīyate nābhiḥ asya anu paścāt kavayaḥ yanti rebhāḥ
translated: The goat is led forward: this is his navel. The sages and the singers follow after.

original: upa prāgāt paramaṃ yat sadhastham arvāṃ acchā pitaram mātaraṃ ca /
analyzed: upa prāgāt paramam yat sadhastham arvān acchā pitaram mātaram ca
translated: He hath come forward to the highest place of meeting, to the father and the mother, from afar.

original: adyā devāñ juṣṭatamo hi gamyā athā śāste dāśuṣe vāryāṇi //
analyzed: adyā devām juṣṭatamaḥ hi gamyāḥ athā śāste dāśuṣe vāryāṇi
translated: Today let him go to the Gods as most acceptable: then he will grant good things to the worshipper.

original: asya vāmasya palitasya hotus tasya bhrātā madhyamo asty aśnaḥ /
analyzed: asya vāmasya palitasya hotuḥ tasya bhrātā madhyamaḥ asti aśnaḥ
translated: Of this brown priest, the youngest, I have seen the brother, the middle one, who is Ashna.

original: tṛtīyo bhrātā ghṛtapṛṣṭho asyātrāpaśyaṃ viśpatiṃ saptaputram //
analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ bhrātā ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ asya atra apaśyam viśpatim sapta putram
translated: The third brother of this one, whose back is anointed with ghee, there I have seen the lord of the people, who has seven sons.

original: sapta yuñjanti ratham ekacakram eko aśvo vahati saptanāmā /
analyzed: sapta yuñjanti ratham eka cakram ekaḥ aśvaḥ vahati sapta nāmā
translated: They yoke the chariot with seven horses, with one wheel, one horse draws it, which has seven names.

original: trinābhi cakram ajaram anarvaṃ yatremā viśvā bhuvanādhi tasthuḥ //🔽imaṃ ratham adhi ye sapta tasthuḥ saptacakraṃ sapta vahanty aśvāḥ /
analyzed: tri nābhi cakram ajaram anarvam yatra imā viśvā bhuvanā adhi tasthuḥ  imam ratham adhi ye sapta tasthuḥ sapta cakram sapta vahanti aśvāḥ
translated: The wheel with three naves, imperishable, undecaying, whereon all these worlds are established.🔽Those seven who stand upon this chariot, the seven-wheeled one, the seven horses draw it.

original: sapta svasāro abhi saṃ navante yatra gavāṃ nihitā sapta nāma //
analyzed: sapta svasāraḥ abhi sam navante yatra gavām nihitā sapta nāma
translated: The seven sisters sing together to it, where the seven names of the cows are laid up.

original: ko dadarśa prathamaṃ jāyamānam asthanvantaṃ yad anasthā bibharti /
analyzed: kaḥ dadarśa prathamam jāyamānam asthanvantam yat anasthā bibharti
translated: Who first beheld him when he was born, him who, though without bones, supports the bony frame?

original: bhūmyā asur asṛg ātmā kva svit ko vidvāṃsam upa gāt praṣṭum etat //
analyzed: bhūmyāḥ asuḥ asṛk ātmā kva svid kaḥ vidvāṃsam upa gāt praṣṭum etat
translated: Where is the soul of this our Asura? Where is he who knows to ask the question?

original: pākaḥ pṛcchāmi manasāvijānan devānām enā nihitā padāni /
analyzed: pākaḥ pṛcchāmi manasā a vijānan devānām enā nihitā padāni
translated: I ask in ignorance, with my mind, of the hidden places of the Gods.

original: vatse baṣkaye 'dhi sapta tantūn vi tatnire kavaya otavā u //
analyzed: vatse baṣkaye dhi sapta tantūn vi tatnire kavayaḥ otavai u
translated: On the calf, on the bull, on seven strings have the wise ones spread out the warp and woof.

original: acikitvāñ cikituṣaś cid atra kavīn pṛcchāmi vidmane na vidvān /
analyzed: a cikitvām cikituṣaḥ cit atra kavīn pṛcchāmi vidmane na vidvān
translated: Not knowing, I ask the wise, the sages, not knowing myself, for the sake of knowledge.

original: vi yas tastambha ṣaḷ imā rajāṃsy ajasya rūpe kim api svid ekam //
analyzed: vi yaḥ tastambha ṣaḍ imā rajāṃsi ajasya rūpe kim api svid ekam
translated: He who has stretched out these three worlds, what is that one thing in the form of the unborn?

original: iha bravītu ya īm aṅga vedāsya vāmasya nihitam padaṃ veḥ /
analyzed: iha bravītu yaḥ īm aṅga veda asya vāmasya nihitam padam veḥ
translated: Here let him speak who knows this, who knows the place of the bird's left foot.

original: śīrṣṇaḥ kṣīraṃ duhrate gāvo asya vavriṃ vasānā udakam padāpuḥ //
analyzed: śīrṣṇaḥ kṣīram duhrate gāvaḥ asya vavrim vasānāḥ udakam padā apuḥ
translated: From his head the cows yield milk, clothed in the womb they have reached the water.

original: mātā pitaram ṛta ā babhāja dhīty agre manasā saṃ hi jagme /
analyzed: mātā pitaram ṛte ā babhāja dhītī agre manasā sam hi jagme
translated: The mother divided the truth-knowing father, first they united in thought.

original: sā bībhatsur garbharasā nividdhā namasvanta id upavākam īyuḥ //
analyzed: sā bībhatsuḥ garbha rasā nividdhā namasvantaḥ id upavākam īyuḥ
translated: She, the fearful, filled with the essence of the embryo, the humble ones went to the invocation.

original: yuktā mātāsīd dhuri dakṣiṇāyā atiṣṭhad garbho vṛjanīṣv antaḥ /
analyzed: yuktā mātā āsīt dhuri dakṣiṇāyāḥ atiṣṭhat garbhaḥ vṛjanīṣu antar
translated: The mother was yoked to the pole of the sacrificial fee, the embryo stood in the middle of the yokes.

original: amīmed vatso anu gām apaśyad viśvarūpyaṃ triṣu yojaneṣu //
analyzed: amīmet vatsaḥ anu gām apaśyat viśvarūpyam triṣu yojaneṣu
translated: The calf has moved, and has seen the cow, the all-formed one, in the three yokes.

original: tisro mātṝs trīn pitṝn bibhrad eka ūrdhvas tasthau nem ava glāpayanti /
analyzed: tisraḥ mātṝḥ trīn pitṝn bibhrat ekaḥ ūrdhvaḥ tasthau na īm ava glāpayanti
translated: Bearing three mothers and three fathers, he stands alone, erect; they do not weary him.

original: mantrayante divo amuṣya pṛṣṭhe viśvavidaṃ vācam aviśvaminvām //
analyzed: mantrayante divaḥ amuṣya pṛṣṭhe viśva vidam vācam a viśvaminvām
translated: They consult on the back of yonder sky, the all-knowing speech, which none may hinder.

original: dvādaśāraṃ nahi taj jarāya varvarti cakram pari dyām ṛtasya /
analyzed: dvādaśa aram nahi tat jarāya varvarti cakram pari dyām ṛtasya
translated: The wheel of the eternal law, with twelve spokes, is not turned by old age.

original: ā putrā agne mithunāso atra sapta śatāni viṃśatiś ca tasthuḥ //
analyzed: ā putrāḥ agne mithunāsaḥ atra sapta śatāni viṃśatiḥ ca tasthuḥ
translated: Here, O Agni, the sons, the pairs, stand, seven hundred and twenty.

original: pañcapādam pitaraṃ dvādaśākṛtiṃ diva āhuḥ pare ardhe purīṣiṇam /
analyzed: pañca pādam pitaram dvādaśa ākṛtim divaḥ āhuḥ pare ardhe purīṣiṇam
translated: They call him the five-footed father, of twelve forms, in the highest region of the sky, the purifier.

original: atheme anya upare vicakṣaṇaṃ saptacakre ṣaḷara āhur arpitam //
analyzed: atha ime anye upare vicakṣaṇam sapta cakre ṣaṣ are āhuḥ arpitam
translated: And these other wise ones call him the seven-wheeled, the six-spoked, the fixed one, in the lower region.

original: pañcāre cakre parivartamāne tasminn ā tasthur bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: pañca are cakre parivartamāne tasmin ā tasthuḥ bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: In the five-spoked wheel that revolves, all the worlds are established.

original: tasya nākṣas tapyate bhūribhāraḥ sanād eva na śīryate sanābhiḥ //
analyzed: tasya na akṣaḥ tapyate bhūri bhāraḥ sanāt eva na śīryate sa nābhiḥ
translated: Its nave is heated, bearing a great load; from of old it does not break, the felly.

original: sanemi cakram ajaraṃ vi vāvṛta uttānāyāṃ daśa yuktā vahanti /
analyzed: sa nemi cakram ajaram vi vāvṛte uttānāyām daśa yuktāḥ vahanti
translated: The undecaying wheel we set in motion; ten yoked bulls draw it in the outstretched (sky).

original: sūryasya cakṣū rajasaity āvṛtaṃ tasminn ārpitā bhuvanāni viśvā //
analyzed: sūryasya cakṣuḥ rajasā eti āvṛtam tasmin ā arpitā bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: The eye of the sun moves, covered with mist; in it are all the worlds established.

original: sākañjānāṃ saptatham āhur ekajaṃ ṣaḷ id yamā ṛṣayo devajā iti /
analyzed: sākañjānām saptatham āhuḥ ekajam ṣaṭ id yamāḥ ṛṣayaḥ deva jāḥ iti
translated: The seven are called the twins of the Sakinjās, the six are the Rṣis, the sons of the gods.

original: teṣām iṣṭāni vihitāni dhāmaśa sthātre rejante vikṛtāni rūpaśaḥ //
analyzed: teṣām iṣṭāni vihitāni sthātre rejante vikṛtāni rūpaśas
translated: Their appointed and arranged abodes shine forth, their varied forms in their own places.

original: striyaḥ satīs tāṃ u me puṃsa āhuḥ paśyad akṣaṇvān na vi cetad andhaḥ /
analyzed: striyaḥ satīḥ tām u me puṃsaḥ āhuḥ paśyat akṣaṇvān na vi cetat andhaḥ
translated: They call those true women my men. The blind one who sees not should not discern them.

original: kavir yaḥ putraḥ sa īm ā ciketa yas tā vijānāt sa pituṣ pitāsat //
analyzed: kaviḥ yaḥ putraḥ saḥ īm ā ciketa yaḥ tāḥ vijānāt sa pituḥ pitā asat
translated: The son who is a poet has understood them. He who knows them is the father of his father.

original: avaḥ pareṇa para enāvareṇa padā vatsam bibhratī gaur ud asthāt /
analyzed: avas pareṇa paras enā avareṇa padā vatsam bibhratī gauḥ ud asthāt
translated: The cow, bearing the calf, rose up, with the higher foot below, and the lower foot above.

original: sā kadrīcī kaṃ svid ardham parāgāt kva svit sūte nahi yūthe antaḥ //
analyzed: sā kadrīcī kam svid ardham parāgāt kva svid sūte nahi yūthe antar
translated: She went away, where and how far, to what place? Where does she bring forth, not among the herd?

original: avaḥ pareṇa pitaraṃ yo asyānuveda para enāvareṇa /
analyzed: avas pareṇa pitaram yaḥ asya anuveda paras enā avareṇa
translated: He who knows the higher foot of her, the father, and the lower foot above,

original: kavīyamānaḥ ka iha pra vocad devam manaḥ kuto adhi prajātam //
analyzed: kavīyamānaḥ kaḥ iha pra vocat devam manaḥ kutas adhi prajātam
translated: The one who is thought a sage, let him declare here: from what place was the divine mind produced?

original: ye arvāñcas tāṃ u parāca āhur ye parāñcas tāṃ u arvāca āhuḥ /
analyzed: ye arvāñcaḥ tām u parācaḥ āhuḥ ye parāñcaḥ tām u arvācaḥ āhuḥ
translated: Those that are coming hither they call those going away; those that are going away they call those coming hither.

original: indraś ca yā cakrathuḥ soma tāni dhurā na yuktā rajaso vahanti //
analyzed: indraḥ ca yā cakrathuḥ soma tāni dhurā na yuktā rajasaḥ vahanti
translated: Those, O Indra, and those, O Soma, which ye have yoked, the reins draw them, as with a team, through the region.

original: dvā suparṇā sayujā sakhāyā samānaṃ vṛkṣam pari ṣasvajāte /
analyzed: dvā suparṇā sayujā sakhāyā samānam vṛkṣam pari sasvajāte
translated: Two birds, companions, friends, cling to the same tree.

original: tayor anyaḥ pippalaṃ svādv atty anaśnann anyo abhi cākaśīti //
analyzed: tayoḥ anyaḥ pippalam svādu atti an aśnan anyaḥ abhi cākaśīti
translated: One of them eats the sweet fruit, not eating the other, and looks on.

original: yatrā suparṇā amṛtasya bhāgam animeṣaṃ vidathābhisvaranti /
analyzed: yatra suparṇāḥ amṛtasya bhāgam animeṣam vidathā abhisvaranti
translated: Where the birds of immortality, with unwinking eyes, sing the praises of the immortal gods.

original: ino viśvasya bhuvanasya gopāḥ sa mā dhīraḥ pākam atrā viveśa //🔽yasmin vṛkṣe madhvadaḥ suparṇā niviśante suvate cādhi viśve /
analyzed: inaḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya gopāḥ sa mā dhīraḥ pākam atra ā viveśa  yasmin vṛkṣe madhvadaḥ suparṇāḥ niviśante suvate ca adhi viśve
translated: The guardians of all the worlds, the wise one has entered the house here.🔽In that tree, the honey-eating birds enter and all the birds nest.

original: tasyed āhuḥ pippalaṃ svādv agre tan non naśad yaḥ pitaraṃ na veda //
analyzed: tasya id āhuḥ pippalam svādu agre tat na ud naśat yaḥ pitaram na veda
translated: They say that the sweet fruit is at the top of that tree, but he who does not know his father does not get it.

original: yad gāyatre adhi gāyatram āhitaṃ traiṣṭubhād vā traiṣṭubhaṃ niratakṣata /
analyzed: yat gāyatre adhi gāyatram āhitam traiṣṭubhāt vā traiṣṭubham niratakṣata
translated: What is placed in the Gayatri upon the Gayatri, what is fashioned from the Tristubh the Tristubh.

original: yad vā jagaj jagaty āhitam padaṃ ya it tad vidus te amṛtatvam ānaśuḥ //
analyzed: yat vā jagat jagati āhitam padam ye id tat viduḥ te amṛta tvam ānaśuḥ
translated: And what is placed in the Jagati upon the Jagati, they who know that have attained immortality.

original: gāyatreṇa prati mimīte arkam arkeṇa sāma traiṣṭubhena vākam /
analyzed: gāyatreṇa prati mimīte arkam arkeṇa sāma traiṣṭubhena vākam
translated: He measures the Arka with the Gayatri, the Saman with the Arka, the Vak with the Tristubh.

original: vākena vākaṃ dvipadā catuṣpadākṣareṇa mimate sapta vāṇīḥ //
analyzed: vākena vākam dvipadā catuṣpadā akṣareṇa mimate sapta vāṇīḥ
translated: With the Vak he measures the Vak, the two-footed and the four-footed, the sevenfold speech with the syllable.

original: jagatā sindhuṃ divy astabhāyad rathantare sūryam pary apaśyat /
analyzed: jagatā sindhum divi astabhāyat rathantare sūryam pari apaśyat
translated: He has established the river in the Jagati, he has seen the sun in the Rathantara.

original: gāyatrasya samidhas tisra āhus tato mahnā pra ririce mahitvā //🔽upa hvaye sudughāṃ dhenum etāṃ suhasto godhug uta dohad enām /
analyzed: gāyatrasya samidhaḥ tisraḥ āhuḥ tatas mahnā pra ririce mahi tvā  upa hvaye su dughām dhenum etām su hastaḥ go duh uta dohat enām
translated: The three logs of the Gayatri, they say, by their greatness he surpassed in greatness.🔽I invoke this well-milking cow, may the milker with good hands milk her for us.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ savaṃ savitā sāviṣan no 'bhīddho gharmas tad u ṣu pra vocam //
analyzed: śreṣṭham savam savitā sāviṣat naḥ bhīddhaḥ gharmaḥ tat u su pra vocam
translated: May Savitar pour for us the best of juices; the Gharma has been heated, that also I will tell you.

original: hiṅkṛṇvatī vasupatnī vasūnāṃ vatsam icchantī manasābhy āgāt /
analyzed: hiṅkṛṇvatī vasu patnī vasūnām vatsam icchantī manasā abhi āgāt
translated: She who makes the sound, the wife of the treasures, desiring the calf, has come with her mind.

original: duhām aśvibhyām payo aghnyeyaṃ sā vardhatām mahate saubhagāya //🔽gaur amīmed anu vatsam miṣantam mūrdhānaṃ hiṅṅ akṛṇon mātavā u /
analyzed: duhām aśvibhyām payaḥ aghnyā iyam sā vardhatām mahate saubhagāya  gauḥ amīmet anu vatsam miṣantam mūrdhānam hiṅ akṛṇot mātavai u
translated: This cow, O Asvins, yields milk; may she increase for great good fortune.🔽The cow has moved along, following the calf that is lowing; she has made a sound, the mother, to the head.

original: sṛkvāṇaṃ gharmam abhi vāvaśānā mimāti māyum payate payobhiḥ //
analyzed: sṛkvāṇam gharmam abhi vāvaśānā mimāti māyum payate payobhiḥ
translated: Licking the Gharma that drips, she melts the fat, she fills it with milk.

original: ayaṃ sa śiṅkte yena gaur abhīvṛtā mimāti māyuṃ dhvasanāv adhi śritā /
analyzed: ayam sa śiṅkte yena gauḥ abhīvṛtā mimāti māyum dhvasanau adhi śritā
translated: This is he who moves with that with which the cow, covered, melts the fat, placed on the ashes.
