original: sā cittibhir ni hi cakāra martyaṃ vidyud bhavantī prati vavrim auhata //
analyzed: sā cittibhiḥ ni hi cakāra martyam vidyut bhavantī prati vavrim auhata
translated: She has made the mortal one her own with thoughts; becoming lightning, she has carried off the covering.

original: anac chaye turagātu jīvam ejad dhruvam madhya ā pastyānām /
analyzed: anat śaye tura gātu jīvam ejat dhruvam madhye ā pastyānām
translated: The moving, living, firm one has lain down in the middle of the houses, going like a horse.

original: jīvo mṛtasya carati svadhābhir amartyo martyenā sayoniḥ //
analyzed: jīvaḥ mṛtasya carati svadhābhiḥ amartyaḥ martyena sa yoniḥ
translated: The living soul of the dead man moves about with the offerings, immortal, of the same womb as the mortal.

original: apaśyaṃ gopām anipadyamānam ā ca parā ca pathibhiś carantam /
analyzed: apaśyam gopām a nipadyamānam ā ca parā ca pathibhiḥ carantam
translated: I have seen the guardian, not resting, moving on the paths that go both ways and back.

original: sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīr vasāna ā varīvarti bhuvaneṣv antaḥ //
analyzed: sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīḥ vasānaḥ ā varīvarti bhuvaneṣu antar
translated: He, dwelling in the same place and in different places, moves about in the midst of the worlds.

original: ya īṃ cakāra na so asya veda ya īṃ dadarśa hirug in nu tasmāt /
analyzed: yaḥ īm cakāra na saḥ asya veda yaḥ īm dadarśa hiruk id nu tasmāt
translated: He who made him knows him not; he who looks on him is indeed astonished.

original: sa mātur yonā parivīto antar bahuprajā nirṛtim ā viveśa //
analyzed: sa mātuḥ yonā parivītaḥ antar bahuprajāḥ nirṛtim ā viveśa
translated: He, enclosed in the womb of his mother, has entered into misfortune, with much offspring within.

original: dyaur me pitā janitā nābhir atra bandhur me mātā pṛthivī mahīyam /
analyzed: dyauḥ me pitā janitā nābhiḥ atra bandhuḥ me mātā pṛthivī mahī iyam
translated: The sky is my father, the begetter, the navel here; my kinsman is the great mother earth.

original: uttānayoś camvor yonir antar atrā pitā duhitur garbham ādhāt //
analyzed: uttānayoḥ camvoḥ yoniḥ antar atrā pitā duhituḥ garbham ādhāt
translated: The womb between the two outstretched bowls; here the father has placed the embryo of his daughter.

original: pṛcchāmi tvā param antam pṛthivyāḥ pṛcchāmi yatra bhuvanasya nābhiḥ /
analyzed: pṛcchāmi tvā param antam pṛthivyāḥ pṛcchāmi yatra bhuvanasya nābhiḥ
translated: I ask thee, the farthest end of the earth; I ask where is the navel of the world.

original: pṛcchāmi tvā vṛṣṇo aśvasya retaḥ pṛcchāmi vācaḥ paramaṃ vyoma //
analyzed: pṛcchāmi tvā vṛṣṇaḥ aśvasya retaḥ pṛcchāmi vācaḥ paramam vyoma
translated: I ask thee, the seed of the strong horse; I ask the highest heaven of speech.

original: iyaṃ vediḥ paro antaḥ pṛthivyā ayaṃ yajño bhuvanasya nābhiḥ /
analyzed: iyam vediḥ paraḥ antaḥ pṛthivyāḥ ayam yajñaḥ bhuvanasya nābhiḥ
translated: This is the altar, the farthest end of the earth; this sacrifice is the navel of the world.

original: ayaṃ somo vṛṣṇo aśvasya reto brahmāyaṃ vācaḥ paramaṃ vyoma //
analyzed: ayam somaḥ vṛṣṇaḥ aśvasya retaḥ brahmā ayam vācaḥ paramam vyoma
translated: This soma is the seed of the strong horse; this prayer is the highest heaven of speech.

original: saptārdhagarbhā bhuvanasya reto viṣṇos tiṣṭhanti pradiśā vidharmaṇi /
analyzed: sapta ardha garbhāḥ bhuvanasya retaḥ viṣṇoḥ tiṣṭhanti pradiśā vidharmaṇi
translated: The seven half-embryos of the world's seed, the essence of Vishnu, stand in the sky, in the region of the sky.

original: te dhītibhir manasā te vipaścitaḥ paribhuvaḥ pari bhavanti viśvataḥ //
analyzed: te dhītibhiḥ manasā te vipaścitaḥ paribhuvaḥ pari bhavanti viśvatas
translated: They, the wise, with their thoughts, they, the all-encompassing, are around us on every side.

original: na vi jānāmi yad ivedam asmi niṇyaḥ saṃnaddho manasā carāmi /🔽yadā māgan prathamajā ṛtasyād id vāco aśnuve bhāgam asyāḥ //
analyzed: na vi jānāmi yat iva idam asmi niṇyaḥ saṃnaddhaḥ manasā carāmi  yadā mā agan prathama jāḥ ṛtasya āt id vācaḥ aśnuve bhāgam asyāḥ
translated: I know not what this is that I am. Bound by the noose, I wander with my mind.🔽When I came, the first-born of truth, then I obtained my share of this speech.

original: apāṅ prāṅ eti svadhayā gṛbhīto 'martyo martyenā sayoniḥ /
analyzed: apāṅ prāṅ eti svadhayā gṛbhītaḥ martyaḥ martyena sa yoniḥ
translated: He goes forward to the east, seized by his own nature, the immortal, of the same womb as the mortal.

original: tā śaśvantā viṣūcīnā viyantā ny anyaṃ cikyur na ni cikyur anyam //
analyzed: tā śaśvantā viṣūcīnā viyantā ni anyam cikyuḥ na ni cikyuḥ anyam
translated: They, the ever-moving, the far-extending, the flying, have sought out another, and have not sought out another.

original: ṛco akṣare parame vyoman yasmin devā adhi viśve niṣeduḥ /
analyzed: ṛcaḥ akṣare parame vyoman yasmin devāḥ adhi viśve niṣeduḥ
translated: The Ṛc verses in the highest imperishable sky, in which all the gods sit enthroned,

original: yas tan na veda kim ṛcā kariṣyati ya it tad vidus ta ime sam āsate //
analyzed: yaḥ tat na veda kim ṛcā kariṣyati ye id tat viduḥ te ime sam āsate
translated: He who does not know that, what will he do with the Ṛc? They who know that, they sit here together.

original: sūyavasād bhagavatī hi bhūyā atho vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma /
analyzed: sūyavasāt bhagavatī hi bhūyāḥ atha u vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma
translated: Be thou, O blessed one, in the good pasture, and may we also be blessed.

original: addhi tṛṇam aghnye viśvadānīm piba śuddham udakam ācarantī //
analyzed: addhi tṛṇam aghnye viśvadānīm piba śuddham udakam ācarantī
translated: Eat the grass, O cow, at all times; drink the pure water as thou goest along.

original: gaurīr mimāya salilāni takṣaty ekapadī dvipadī sā catuṣpadī /
analyzed: gaurīḥ mimāya salilāni takṣatī ekapadī dvipadī sā catuṣpadī
translated: The tawny one, thinking, fashions the waters, she with one foot, with two feet, and with four feet.

original: aṣṭāpadī navapadī babhūvuṣī sahasrākṣarā parame vyoman //
analyzed: aṣṭāpadī navapadī babhūvuṣī sahasra akṣarā parame vyoman
translated: The eight-footed, the nine-footed, the thousand-footed, in the highest heaven.

original: tasyāḥ samudrā adhi vi kṣaranti tena jīvanti pradiśaś catasraḥ /
analyzed: tasyāḥ samudrāḥ adhi vi kṣaranti tena jīvanti pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: From her the oceans flow forth, by her the four quarters of the world live.

original: tataḥ kṣaraty akṣaraṃ tad viśvam upa jīvati //
analyzed: tatas kṣarati akṣaram tat viśvam upa jīvati
translated: From her the imperishable flows forth, on that the whole world lives.

original: śakamayaṃ dhūmam ārād apaśyaṃ viṣūvatā para enāvareṇa /
analyzed: śaka mayam dhūmam ārāt apaśyam viṣūvatā paras enā avareṇa
translated: I have seen the smoke of the sacrificial fire, far away, above and below.

original: ukṣāṇam pṛśnim apacanta vīrās tāni dharmāṇi prathamāny āsan //
analyzed: ukṣāṇam pṛśnim apacanta vīrāḥ tāni dharmāṇi prathamāni āsan
translated: The heroes have cooked the speckled bull, those were the first laws.

original: trayaḥ keśina ṛtuthā vi cakṣate saṃvatsare vapata eka eṣām /
analyzed: trayaḥ keśinaḥ ṛtuthā vi cakṣate saṃvatsare vapate ekaḥ eṣām
translated: Three Keśins look around in due season, in the year one of them casts off his skin.

original: viśvam eko abhi caṣṭe śacībhir dhrājir ekasya dadṛśe na rūpam //
analyzed: viśvam ekaḥ abhi caṣṭe śacībhiḥ dhrājiḥ ekasya dadṛśe na rūpam
translated: One of them looks on all with his powers, the course of one is seen, not his form.

original: catvāri vāk parimitā padāni tāni vidur brāhmaṇā ye manīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: catvāri vāc parimitā padāni tāni viduḥ brāhmaṇāḥ ye manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: Four are the measured words of speech, the wise Brāhmaṇas know them.

original: guhā trīṇi nihitā neṅgayanti turīyaṃ vāco manuṣyā vadanti //
analyzed: guhā trīṇi nihitā na iṅgayanti turīyam vācaḥ manuṣyāḥ vadanti
translated: Three are hidden, they do not move, the fourth word of speech men speak.

original: indram mitraṃ varuṇam agnim āhur atho divyaḥ sa suparṇo garutmān /
analyzed: indram mitram varuṇam agnim āhuḥ atha u divyaḥ sa suparṇaḥ garutmān
translated: They call him Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa, and also the divine bird Garuḍa.

original: ekaṃ sad viprā bahudhā vadanty agniṃ yamam mātariśvānam āhuḥ //
analyzed: ekam sat viprāḥ bahudhā vadanti agnim yamam mātariśvānam āhuḥ
translated: The wise call him one, though he is really many, they call him Agni, Yama, and Mātariśvan.

original: kṛṣṇaṃ niyānaṃ harayaḥ suparṇā apo vasānā divam ut patanti /
analyzed: kṛṣṇam niyānam harayaḥ suparṇāḥ apaḥ vasānāḥ divam ud patanti
translated: The black reins, the strong-winged bay steeds, clothed in water, fly up to the sky.

original: ta āvavṛtran sadanād ṛtasyād id ghṛtena pṛthivī vy udyate //
analyzed: te āvavṛtran sadanāt ṛtasya āt id ghṛtena pṛthivī vi udyate
translated: They have turned back from the seat of truth; the earth is indeed shaken by the ghee.

original: dvādaśa pradhayaś cakram ekaṃ trīṇi nabhyāni ka u tac ciketa /
analyzed: dvādaśa pradhayaḥ cakram ekam trīṇi nabhyāni kaḥ u tat ciketa
translated: The wheel has twelve rims, one nave, three spokes. Who knows that?

original: tasmin sākaṃ triśatā na śaṅkavo 'rpitāḥ ṣaṣṭir na calācalāsaḥ //🔽yas te stanaḥ śaśayo yo mayobhūr yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi /
analyzed: tasmin sākam tri śatā na śaṅkavaḥ rpitāḥ ṣaṣṭiḥ na calācalāsaḥ  yaḥ te stanaḥ śaśayaḥ yaḥ mayobhūḥ yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi
translated: In it are placed together three hundred pins, sixty immovable and movable ones.🔽Thy breast which is full of milk, which is pure, by which thou nourishest all good things,

original: yo ratnadhā vasuvid yaḥ sudatraḥ sarasvati tam iha dhātave kaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ ratna dhāḥ vasu vid yaḥ su datraḥ sarasvati tam iha dhātave kaḥ
translated: O Sarasvatî, which bestowest treasures, which findest wealth, which givest well, bring that hither to be distributed.

original: yajñena yajñam ayajanta devās tāni dharmāṇi prathamāny āsan /
analyzed: yajñena yajñam ayajanta devāḥ tāni dharmāṇi prathamāni āsan
translated: The gods worshipped the sacrifice with the sacrifice; those were the first established rules.

original: te ha nākam mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ //
analyzed: te ha nākam mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ
translated: Those mighty ones attend on the vault of heaven, where the ancient Sâdhyas are the gods.

original: samānam etad udakam uc caity ava cāhabhiḥ /
analyzed: samānam etat udakam ud ca eti ava ca ahabhiḥ
translated: This water is the same, both above and below, with the clouds.

original: bhūmim parjanyā jinvanti divaṃ jinvanty agnayaḥ //
analyzed: bhūmim parjanyāḥ jinvanti divam jinvanti agnayaḥ
translated: The Parjanya clouds quicken the earth, the fires quicken the sky.

original: divyaṃ suparṇaṃ vāyasam bṛhantam apāṃ garbhaṃ darśatam oṣadhīnām /
analyzed: divyam suparṇam vāyasam bṛhantam apām garbham darśatam oṣadhīnām
translated: The divine bird, the great crow, the embryo of the waters, the beautiful one of the plants,

original: abhīpato vṛṣṭibhis tarpayantaṃ sarasvantam avase johavīmi //
analyzed: abhīpatas vṛṣṭibhiḥ tarpayantam sarasvantam avase johavīmi
translated: Satisfying with showers from the right, I invoke Sarasvant for help.

original: kayā śubhā savayasaḥ sanīḷāḥ samānyā marutaḥ sam mimikṣuḥ /
analyzed: kayā śubhā savayasaḥ sanīḷāḥ samānyā marutaḥ sam mimikṣuḥ
translated: By what auspicious thing, O young Maruts, of the same age, have they been mixed together?

original: kayā matī kuta etāsa ete 'rcanti śuṣmaṃ vṛṣaṇo vasūyā //
analyzed: kayā matī kutas etāsaḥ ete rcanti śuṣmam vṛṣaṇaḥ vasūyā
translated: By what thought, from where, do these mighty ones sing forth their strength, desiring wealth?

original: kasya brahmāṇi jujuṣur yuvānaḥ ko adhvare maruta ā vavarta /
analyzed: kasya brahmāṇi jujuṣuḥ yuvānaḥ kaḥ adhvare marutaḥ ā vavarta
translated: Whose prayers have the young ones accepted? Who has turned the Maruts to the sacrifice?

original: śyenāṃ iva dhrajato antarikṣe kena mahā manasā rīramāma //
analyzed: śyenām iva dhrajataḥ antarikṣe kena mahā manasā rīramāma
translated: Like a hawk flying in the atmosphere, with what great mind shall we approach them?

original: kutas tvam indra māhinaḥ sann eko yāsi satpate kiṃ ta itthā /
analyzed: kutas tvam indra māhinaḥ san ekaḥ yāsi satpate kim te itthā
translated: From where, O mighty Indra, do you go alone, O lord of the brave? What is your purpose here?

original: sam pṛcchase samarāṇaḥ śubhānair voces tan no harivo yat te asme //
analyzed: sam pṛcchase samarāṇaḥ śubhānaiḥ voceḥ tat naḥ harivas yat te asme
translated: You ask in assembly, O you who are in harmony with the good. Tell us that, O you who have horses, which is yours among us.

original: brahmāṇi me matayaḥ śaṃ sutāsaḥ śuṣma iyarti prabhṛto me adriḥ /
analyzed: brahmāṇi me matayaḥ śam sutāsaḥ śuṣmaḥ iyarti prabhṛtaḥ me adriḥ
translated: My prayers are your prayers, my libations are auspicious. My thunderbolt hurls forth, my rock is set in motion.

original: ā śāsate prati haryanty ukthemā harī vahatas tā no accha //
analyzed: ā śāsate prati haryanti ukthā imā harī vahataḥ tā naḥ accha
translated: They are commanded, they rejoice in the praises. Bring these two bay horses, they carry the praises.

original: ato vayam antamebhir yujānāḥ svakṣatrebhis tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ /
analyzed: atas vayam antamebhiḥ yujānāḥ svakṣatrebhiḥ tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ
translated: From here, yoking ourselves with these most excellent ones, adorning our bodies with our own power,

original: mahobhir etāṃ upa yujmahe nv indra svadhām anu hi no babhūtha //
analyzed: mahobhiḥ etām upa yujmahe nu indra svadhām anu hi naḥ babhūtha
translated: With great things we yoke ourselves to you. O Indra, you have indeed become like our own power.

original: kva syā vo marutaḥ svadhāsīd yan mām ekaṃ samadhattāhihatye /
analyzed: kva syā vaḥ marutaḥ svadhā āsīt yat mām ekam samadhatta ahi hatye
translated: Where, O Maruts, was your own power when ye set me alone in the fight with Ahi?

original: ahaṃ hy ugras taviṣas tuviṣmān viśvasya śatror anamaṃ vadhasnaiḥ //🔽bhūri cakartha yujyebhir asme samānebhir vṛṣabha pauṃsyebhiḥ /🔽bhūrīṇi hi kṛṇavāmā śaviṣṭhendra kratvā maruto yad vaśāma //
analyzed: aham hi ugraḥ taviṣaḥ tuviṣmān viśvasya śatroḥ anamam vadhasnaiḥ  bhūri cakartha yujyebhiḥ asme samānebhiḥ vṛṣabha pauṃsyebhiḥ  bhūrīṇi hi kṛṇavāmā śaviṣṭha indra kratvā marutaḥ yat vaśāma
translated: For I am mighty, strong, exceeding strong, with the weapons of every foe I have subdued.🔽Thou hast done much for us with thy suitable, with thy equal, O Bull, manly powers.🔽For we will do many things, O Most Potent One, O Indra, by our wisdom, O Maruts, when we are minded.

original: vadhīṃ vṛtram maruta indriyeṇa svena bhāmena taviṣo babhūvān /
analyzed: vadhīm vṛtram marutaḥ indriyeṇa svena bhāmena taviṣaḥ babhūvān
translated: I have slain Vritra, O Maruts, by my own power; by my own strength I have become mighty.

original: aham etā manave viśvaścandrāḥ sugā apaś cakara vajrabāhuḥ //
analyzed: aham etāḥ manave viśva ścandrāḥ su gāḥ apaḥ cakara vajra bāhuḥ
translated: I, the thunder-armed one, have made these waters, all shining, easy to pass for Manu.

original: anuttam ā te maghavan nakir nu na tvāvāṃ asti devatā vidānaḥ /
analyzed: anuttam ā te maghavan nakir nu na asti devatā vidānaḥ
translated: No one, O Maghavan, is equal to thee, no god is found to be thy equal.

original: na jāyamāno naśate na jāto yāni kariṣyā kṛṇuhi pravṛddha //
analyzed: na jāyamānaḥ naśate na jātaḥ yāni kariṣyā kṛṇuhi pravṛddha
translated: Neither the unborn nor the born can equal the deeds thou wilt do, O thou that art waxing great.

original: ekasya cin me vibhv astv ojo yā nu dadhṛṣvān kṛṇavai manīṣā /
analyzed: ekasya cit me vibhu astu ojaḥ yā nu dadhṛṣvān kṛṇavai manīṣā
translated: Let the power of even one of them be mine, O Maruts, if I dare to perform this thought.

original: ahaṃ hy ugro maruto vidāno yāni cyavam indra id īśa eṣām //
analyzed: aham hi ugraḥ marutaḥ vidānaḥ yāni cyavam indraḥ id īśe eṣām
translated: For I am mighty, O Maruts, known as Indra, and whatever I undertake, Indra is the lord of these.

original: amandan mā maruta stomo atra yan me naraḥ śrutyam brahma cakra /
analyzed: amandat mā marutaḥ stomaḥ atra yat me naraḥ śrutyam brahma cakra
translated: The Maruts have not rejoiced in this praise of mine, that ye, O men, have made a prayer to be heard by me.

original: indrāya vṛṣṇe sumakhāya mahyaṃ sakhye sakhāyas tanve tanūbhiḥ //
analyzed: indrāya vṛṣṇe su makhāya mahyam sakhye sakhāyaḥ tanve tanūbhiḥ
translated: To Indra, the mighty, to the good sacrificer, as friends with their bodies to my body.

original: eved ete prati mā rocamānā anedyaḥ śrava eṣo dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: eva id ete prati mā rocamānāḥ anedyaḥ śravaḥ eṣaḥ dadhānāḥ
translated: These indeed shine forth for me, bestowing this blameless glory.

original: saṃcakṣyā marutaś candravarṇā acchānta me chadayāthā ca nūnam //
analyzed: saṃcakṣya marutaḥ candra varṇāḥ me chadaya athā ca nūnam
translated: The Maruts, of bright hue, have been praised; now come and favour me.

original: ko nv atra maruto māmahe vaḥ pra yātana sakhīṃr acchā sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ nu atra marutaḥ māmahe vaḥ pra yātana sakhīṃr acchā sakhāyaḥ
translated: What do you, O Maruts, desire of me here? Go to your friends, O friends.

original: manmāni citrā apivātayanta eṣām bhūta navedā ma ṛtānām //🔽ā yad duvasyād duvase na kārur asmāñ cakre mānyasya medhā /
analyzed: manmāni citrā apivātayantaḥ eṣām bhūta navedāḥ me ṛtānām  ā yat duvasyāt duvase na kāruḥ asmām cakre mānyasya medhā
translated: They stir up my wondrous thoughts. I have become acquainted with their truth.🔽When he would serve, as a servant serves, the wise one has made me the means of honour.

original: o ṣu vartta maruto vipram acchemā brahmāṇi jaritā vo arcat //
analyzed: ā u su varta marutaḥ vipram acchā imā brahmāṇi jaritā vaḥ arcat
translated: O Maruts, come to the sage; these prayers of mine, the singer, shall praise you.

original: eṣa va stomo maruta iyaṃ gīr māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vaḥ stomaḥ marutaḥ iyam gīḥ māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ
translated: This is your praise, O Maruts, this is the song of Mandārya, the honourable Kāra.

original: eṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayāṃ vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: ā iṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayām vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: May this go to your bodies for strength. May we find that wealth-giving people.

original: tan nu vocāma rabhasāya janmane pūrvam mahitvaṃ vṛṣabhasya ketave /
analyzed: tat nu vocāma rabhasāya janmane pūrvam mahitvam vṛṣabhasya ketave
translated: Now we will speak of the greatness of the mighty one, the banner of the youthful one.

original: aidheva yāman marutas tuviṣvaṇo yudheva śakrās taviṣāṇi kartana //
analyzed: aidhā iva yāman marutaḥ tuviṣvaṇaḥ yudhā iva śakrāḥ taviṣāṇi kartana
translated: The Maruts, swift in their course, like those who go to battle, the mighty Shakra-like ones, performing mighty deeds.

original: nityaṃ na sūnum madhu bibhrata upa krīḷanti krīḷā vidatheṣu ghṛṣvayaḥ /
analyzed: nityam na sūnum madhu bibhrataḥ upa krīḍanti krīḍā vidatheṣu ghṛṣvayaḥ
translated: They ever play with the son who bears the meath, the joyous ones in their joyous gatherings.

original: nakṣanti rudrā avasā namasvinaṃ na mardhanti svatavaso haviṣkṛtam //
analyzed: nakṣanti rudrāḥ avasā namasvinam na mardhanti svatavasaḥ haviṣkṛtam
translated: The Rudras seek the worshipper who bows to them: the self-strong ones do no harm to him who offers gifts.

original: yasmā ūmāso amṛtā arāsata rāyas poṣaṃ ca haviṣā dadāśuṣe /
analyzed: yasmai ūmāsaḥ amṛtāḥ arāsata rāyaḥ poṣam ca haviṣā dadāśuṣe
translated: To him whose immortal powers have been delighted, to him who brings oblations, they give increase of wealth.

original: ukṣanty asmai maruto hitā iva purū rajāṃsi payasā mayobhuvaḥ //🔽ā ye rajāṃsi taviṣībhir avyata pra va evāsaḥ svayatāso adhrajan /
analyzed: ukṣanti asmai marutaḥ hitāḥ iva purū rajāṃsi payasā mayobhuvaḥ  ā ye rajāṃsi taviṣībhiḥ avyata pra vaḥ evāsaḥ sva yatāsaḥ adhrajan
translated: The Maruts pour for him as 'twere their gifts, many regions, full of sap, and bringing bliss.🔽Who have with their own powers spanned the regions through, and have sent forth their own swift-moving rays.

original: bhayante viśvā bhuvanāni harmyā citro vo yāmaḥ prayatāsv ṛṣṭiṣu //
analyzed: bhayante viśvā bhuvanāni harmyā citraḥ vaḥ yāmaḥ prayatāsu ṛṣṭiṣu
translated: All living creatures fear their sway, the wondrous ones, when they are yoked to their well-ordered cars.

original: yat tveṣayāmā nadayanta parvatān divo vā pṛṣṭhaṃ naryā acucyavuḥ /
analyzed: yat tveṣa yāmāḥ nadayanta parvatān divaḥ vā pṛṣṭham naryāḥ acucyavuḥ
translated: When they, with their impetuous course, make the mountains roar, or, daring, shake the back of heaven.

original: viśvo vo ajman bhayate vanaspatī rathīyantīva pra jihīta oṣadhiḥ //
analyzed: viśvaḥ vaḥ ajman bhayate vanaspatiḥ rathīyantī iva pra jihīte oṣadhiḥ
translated: All trees are frightened at your coming, and the plant bends down as 'twere to be a car-horse.

original: yūyaṃ na ugrā marutaḥ sucetunāriṣṭagrāmāḥ sumatim pipartana /
analyzed: yūyam naḥ ugrāḥ marutaḥ sucetunā ariṣṭa grāmāḥ sumatim pipartana
translated: Ye, O ye mighty Maruts, who are to be well served, who dwell in villages free from harm, accept the favour.

original: yatrā vo didyud radati krivirdatī riṇāti paśvaḥ sudhiteva barhaṇā //
analyzed: yatrā vaḥ didyut radati krivirdatī riṇāti paśvaḥ sudhitā iva barhaṇā
translated: Where your dart flashes, O ye terrible ones, and your axe cuts down the cattle, as 'twere with a well-sharpened axe.

original: pra skambhadeṣṇā anavabhrarādhaso 'lātṛṇāso vidatheṣu suṣṭutāḥ /
analyzed: pra skambha deṣṇāḥ anavabhra rādhasaḥ lātṛṇāsaḥ vidatheṣu suṣṭutāḥ
translated: The Maruts, who are to be invoked at the pressing, whose gifts are unfailing, whose arrows are unerring, who are well-praised in sacrifices,

original: arcanty arkam madirasya pītaye vidur vīrasya prathamāni pauṃsyā //
analyzed: arcanti arkam madirasya pītaye viduḥ vīrasya prathamāni pauṃsyā
translated: They praise the praiseworthy for the drinking of the gladdening drink, they know the first manly deeds of the hero.

original: śatabhujibhis tam abhihruter aghāt pūrbhī rakṣatā maruto yam āvata /
analyzed: śata bhujibhiḥ tam abhihruteḥ aghāt pūrbhiḥ rakṣata marutaḥ yam āvata
translated: Him whom the hundred-handed, the unerring, the swift, the Maruts, whom ye protect, have smitten,

original: janaṃ yam ugrās tavaso virapśinaḥ pāthanā śaṃsāt tanayasya puṣṭiṣu //
analyzed: janam yam ugrāḥ tavasaḥ virapśinaḥ pāthana śaṃsāt tanayasya puṣṭiṣu
translated: Whom the strong, the impetuous, the shapely, the swift, the sons, in the contests, have smitten.

original: viśvāni bhadrā maruto ratheṣu vo mithaspṛdhyeva taviṣāṇy āhitā /
analyzed: viśvāni bhadrā marutaḥ ratheṣu vaḥ mithaspṛdhyā iva taviṣāṇi āhitā
translated: All good things, O Maruts, are in your chariots, your powers are set as in a contest.

original: aṃseṣv ā vaḥ prapatheṣu khādayo 'kṣo vaś cakrā samayā vi vāvṛte //
analyzed: aṃseṣu ā vaḥ prapatheṣu khādayaḥ kṣaḥ vaḥ cakrā samayā vi vāvṛte
translated: Your yokes are in your shoulders, your axles in your paths, your wheels and naves are set in motion.

original: bhūrīṇi bhadrā naryeṣu bāhuṣu vakṣassu rukmā rabhasāso añjayaḥ /
analyzed: bhūrīṇi bhadrā naryeṣu bāhuṣu vakṣassu rukmā rabhasāsaḥ añjayaḥ
translated: Many good things are in the arms of the heroes, on their breasts are ornaments, their girdles are bright.

original: aṃseṣv etāḥ paviṣu kṣurā adhi vayo na pakṣān vy anu śriyo dhire //
analyzed: aṃseṣu etāḥ paviṣu kṣurāḥ adhi vayaḥ na pakṣān vi anu śriyaḥ
translated: These are on their shoulders, on their joints, on their wings, as on a bird, their glories are set.

original: mahānto mahnā vibhvo vibhūtayo dūredṛśo ye divyā iva stṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: mahāntaḥ mahnā vibhvaḥ vibhūtayaḥ dūredṛśaḥ ye divyāḥ iva stṛbhiḥ
translated: The great ones by their greatness, the all-pervading by their all-pervasiveness, the far-seeing, as if by the rays of the sky,

original: mandrāḥ sujihvāḥ svaritāra āsabhiḥ sammiślā indre marutaḥ pariṣṭubhaḥ //
analyzed: mandrāḥ su jihvāḥ svaritāraḥ āsabhiḥ sammiślāḥ indre marutaḥ pariṣṭubhaḥ
translated: The sweet-voiced, the well-tongued, the resonant, the swift, the Maruts, are mingled in Indra with the praises.

original: tad vaḥ sujātā maruto mahitvanaṃ dīrghaṃ vo dātram aditer iva vratam /
analyzed: tat vaḥ su jātāḥ marutaḥ mahitvanam dīrgham vaḥ dātram aditeḥ iva vratam
translated: That is your high power, O nobly born Maruts; your gift is long, like the vow of Aditi.

original: indraś cana tyajasā vi hruṇāti taj janāya yasmai sukṛte arādhvam //
analyzed: indraḥ cana tyajasā vi hruṇāti tat janāya yasmai su kṛte arādhvam
translated: Indra does not pass by with contempt that man for whom you have done a good deed.

original: tad vo jāmitvam marutaḥ pare yuge purū yac chaṃsam amṛtāsa āvata /
analyzed: tat vaḥ jāmi tvam marutaḥ pare yuge purū yat śaṃsam amṛtāsaḥ āvata
translated: That is your kinship, O Maruts, in the next age, when you have helped many to fame, O immortal ones.

original: ayā dhiyā manave śruṣṭim āvyā sākaṃ naro daṃsanair ā cikitrire //
analyzed: ayā dhiyā manave śruṣṭim āvyā sākam naraḥ daṃsanaiḥ ā cikitrire
translated: By this prayer have they obtained hearing for Manu; together the men have been made resplendent with their deeds.

original: yena dīrgham marutaḥ śūśavāma yuṣmākena parīṇasā turāsaḥ /
analyzed: yena dīrgham marutaḥ śūśavāma yuṣmākena parīṇasā turāsaḥ
translated: By which, O Maruts, we may long enjoy, O mighty ones, your favour,

original: ā yat tatanan vṛjane janāsa ebhir yajñebhis tad abhīṣṭim aśyām //
analyzed: ā yat tatanan vṛjane janāsaḥ ebhiḥ yajñebhiḥ tat abhīṣṭim aśyām
translated: when the people have spread out the sacrificial ground with these sacrifices, may I obtain that which they desire.

original: eṣa va stomo maruta iyaṃ gīr māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vaḥ stomaḥ marutaḥ iyam gīḥ māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ
translated: This is your praise, O Maruts, this is your song, of Mandārya, the honoured one, the son of Kāra.

original: eṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayāṃ vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //🔽sahasraṃ ta indrotayo naḥ sahasram iṣo harivo gūrtatamāḥ /🔽sahasraṃ rāyo mādayadhyai sahasriṇa upa no yantu vājāḥ //
analyzed: ā iṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayām vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum  sahasram te indra ūtayaḥ naḥ sahasram iṣaḥ harivas gūrtatamāḥ  sahasram rāyaḥ mādayadhyai sahasriṇaḥ upa naḥ yantu vājāḥ
translated: May this one go to his body for life; may we find the people who give good gifts.🔽A thousand are your streams, O Indra, a thousand are your most excellent gifts, O you who have bay horses.🔽A thousand of riches may we enjoy; may the thousandfold treasures come to us.

original: ā no 'vobhir maruto yāntv acchā jyeṣṭhebhir vā bṛhaddivaiḥ sumāyāḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ vobhiḥ marutaḥ yāntu acchā jyeṣṭhebhiḥ vā bṛhaddivaiḥ su māyāḥ
translated: Come to us, O Maruts, with your aids, with your most excellent, high-sky (powers), O you of great magic.

original: adha yad eṣāṃ niyutaḥ paramāḥ samudrasya cid dhanayanta pāre //
analyzed: adha yat eṣām niyutaḥ paramāḥ samudrasya cit dhanayanta pāre
translated: When their highest teams draw them even beyond the sea's edge.

original: mimyakṣa yeṣu sudhitā ghṛtācī hiraṇyanirṇig uparā na ṛṣṭiḥ /
analyzed: mimyakṣa yeṣu sudhitā ghṛtācī hiraṇya nirṇij uparā naḥ ṛṣṭiḥ
translated: In whom the well-ordered ladle, with the gold-plated handle, and the knife,

original: guhā carantī manuṣo na yoṣā sabhāvatī vidathyeva saṃ vāk //
analyzed: guhā carantī manuṣaḥ na yoṣā sabhāvatī vidathyā iva sam vāc
translated: Move secretly, like a woman among men, their speech like a woman who visits assemblies.

original: parā śubhrā ayāso yavyā sādhāraṇyeva maruto mimikṣuḥ /
analyzed: parā śubhrāḥ ayāsaḥ yavyā sādhāraṇyā iva marutaḥ mimikṣuḥ
translated: The bright, untiring ones, like brothers, the Maruts, have mingled together, like brothers, in the barley.

original: na rodasī apa nudanta ghorā juṣanta vṛdhaṃ sakhyāya devāḥ //
analyzed: na rodasī apa nudanta ghorāḥ juṣanta vṛdham sakhyāya devāḥ
translated: They do not drive away the terrible heaven and earth; the gods accept increase for friendship.

original: joṣad yad īm asuryā sacadhyai viṣitastukā rodasī nṛmaṇāḥ /
analyzed: joṣat yat īm asuryā sacadhyai viṣita stukā rodasī nṛmaṇāḥ
translated: When he is willing to attend upon them, the Asura, the men who are eager to move heaven and earth,

original: ā sūryeva vidhato rathaṃ gāt tveṣapratīkā nabhaso netyā //
analyzed: ā sūryā iva vidhataḥ ratham gāt tveṣa pratīkā nabhasaḥ netyā
translated: He goes like the sun in his chariot, as the arranger, with his appearance like the sky, as the leader.

original: āsthāpayanta yuvatiṃ yuvānaḥ śubhe nimiślāṃ vidatheṣu pajrām /
analyzed: āsthāpayanta yuvatim yuvānaḥ śubhe nimiślām vidatheṣu pajrām
translated: The young men have set the young woman, the beautiful one, the wife in the assemblies, in the good place.

original: arko yad vo maruto haviṣmān gāyad gāthaṃ sutasomo duvasyan //
analyzed: arkaḥ yat vaḥ marutaḥ haviṣmān gāyat gātham suta somaḥ duvasyan
translated: When, O Maruts, you, the singers, the worshippers, the pressers of Soma, delight in the song, in the oblation,

original: pra taṃ vivakmi vakmyo ya eṣām marutām mahimā satyo asti /
analyzed: pra tam vivakmi vakmyaḥ yaḥ eṣām marutām mahimā satyaḥ asti
translated: I will proclaim that praise of theirs which is true, which is the true greatness of the Maruts.

original: sacā yad īṃ vṛṣamaṇā ahaṃyu sthirā cij janīr vahate subhāgāḥ //
analyzed: sacā yat īm vṛṣamaṇāḥ ahaṃyu sthirā cit janīḥ vahate subhāgāḥ
translated: When, in company with you, the impetuous ones, the proud ones, the firm ones, the fortunate women,

original: pānti mitrāvaruṇāv avadyāc cayata īm aryamo apraśastān /
analyzed: pānti mitrāvaruṇau avadyāt cayataḥ īm aryamā u apraśastān
translated: Mitra and Varuna protect from blame, Aryaman the despised.

original: uta cyavante acyutā dhruvāṇi vāvṛdha īm maruto dātivāraḥ //
analyzed: uta cyavante acyutā dhruvāṇi vāvṛdhe īm marutaḥ dāti vāraḥ
translated: And the unmoving things move, the firm things grow: the Maruts, the givers of food, have waxed great.

original: nahī nu vo maruto anty asme ārāttāc cic chavaso antam āpuḥ /
analyzed: nahi nu vaḥ marutaḥ anti asme ārāttāt cit śavasaḥ antam āpuḥ
translated: For never, O Maruts, is there an end of you in us: from afar your power has reached the end.

original: te dhṛṣṇunā śavasā śūśuvāṃso 'rṇo na dveṣo dhṛṣatā pari ṣṭhuḥ //
analyzed: te dhṛṣṇunā śavasā śūśuvāṃsaḥ rṇaḥ na dveṣaḥ dhṛṣatā pari sthuḥ
translated: They, resplendent with mighty power, must be compassed round with difficulty, like a flood, with hatred.

original: vayam adyendrasya preṣṭhā vayaṃ śvo vocemahi samarye /
analyzed: vayam adyā indrasya preṣṭhāḥ vayam śvas vocemahi samarye
translated: May we be most dear to Indra today, tomorrow may we call to us in the battle.

original: vayam purā mahi ca no anu dyūn tan na ṛbhukṣā narām anu ṣyāt //
analyzed: vayam purā mahi ca naḥ anu dyūn tat naḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ narām anu syāt
translated: May he be with us in the great battles: may the Rbhukṣan follow the men's thought.

original: eṣa va stomo maruta iyaṃ gīr māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vaḥ stomaḥ marutaḥ iyam gīḥ māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ
translated: This is your praise, O Maruts, this the song, of the son of Mandārya, of the honoured Kāra.

original: eṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayāṃ vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: ā iṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayām vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: May this come to your bodies for life: may we find the treasure-giving people.

original: yajñāyajñā vaḥ samanā tuturvaṇir dhiyaṃdhiyaṃ vo devayā u dadhidhve /
analyzed: yajñāyajñāḥ vaḥ samanā tuturvaṇiḥ dhiyam dhiyam vaḥ deva yāḥ u dadhidhve
translated: To the sacrifice of the sacrifice, to the race of you who hasten, you who are to be thought of, you who are to be praised by the gods,

original: ā vo 'rvācaḥ suvitāya rodasyor mahe vavṛtyām avase suvṛktibhiḥ //
analyzed: ā vaḥ rvācaḥ suvitāya rodasyoḥ mahe vavṛtyām avase suvṛktibhiḥ
translated: I will turn you hitherward to the welfare of the two worlds, to the great help, with good hymns.

original: vavrāso na ye svajāḥ svatavasa iṣaṃ svar abhijāyanta dhūtayaḥ /
analyzed: vavrāsaḥ na ye sva jāḥ svatavasaḥ iṣam svar abhijāyanta dhūtayaḥ
translated: Those who are born, who are self-existent, self-powerful, who are purified, are born to the food of heaven.

original: sahasriyāso apāṃ normaya āsā gāvo vandyāso nokṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: sahasriyāsaḥ apām na ūrmayaḥ āsā gāvaḥ vandyāsaḥ na ukṣaṇaḥ
translated: The thousand-rayed, like waves of the waters, these cows, to be worshipped, are our sprinklings.

original: somāso na ye sutās tṛptāṃśavo hṛtsu pītāso duvaso nāsate /
analyzed: somāsaḥ na ye sutāḥ tṛpta aṃśavaḥ hṛtsu pītāsaḥ duvasaḥ na āsate
translated: The Somas, when pressed, whose portions are satiated, drunk in the heart, are not to be surpassed as worshippers.

original: aiṣām aṃseṣu rambhiṇīva rārabhe hasteṣu khādiś ca kṛtiś ca saṃ dadhe //
analyzed: ā eṣām aṃseṣu rambhiṇī iva rārabhe hasteṣu khādiḥ ca kṛtiḥ ca sam dadhe
translated: He grasps them on their shoulders as if with a reed, and in their hands he places food and work.

original: ava svayuktā diva ā vṛthā yayur amartyāḥ kaśayā codata tmanā /
analyzed: ava sva yuktāḥ divaḥ ā vṛthā yayuḥ amartyāḥ kaśayā codata tmanā
translated: Swiftly yoked, they have gone to heaven for nothing. The immortals urge themselves with the whip.

original: areṇavas tuvijātā acucyavur dṛḷhāni cin maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: areṇavaḥ tuvi jātāḥ acucyavuḥ dṛḷhāni cit marutaḥ bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: The dustless, greatly born, have shaken off, the Maruts, even the firm ones, with their brilliant appearance.

original: ko vo 'ntar maruta ṛṣṭividyuto rejati tmanā hanveva jihvayā /🔽dhanvacyuta iṣāṃ na yāmani purupraiṣā ahanyo naitaśaḥ //
analyzed: kaḥ vaḥ ntar marutaḥ ṛṣṭi vidyutaḥ rejati tmanā hanvā iva jihvayā  dhanva cyutaḥ iṣām na yāmani puru praiṣāḥ ahanyaḥ na etaśaḥ
translated: Where, O Maruts, do you, with your thunderbolt-like spears, move about in yourselves, as it were, with your jaws and tongue?🔽Like one who has slipped from a bow, in the course of a battle, the Maruts, with many commands, are like the son of Aitaka.

original: kva svid asya rajaso mahas paraṃ kvāvaram maruto yasminn āyaya /
analyzed: kva svid asya rajasaḥ mahaḥ param kva avaram marutaḥ yasmin āyaya
translated: Where, indeed, is the highest region of his greatness? Where is the lower one, O Maruts, in which you rejoice?

original: yac cyāvayatha vithureva saṃhitaṃ vy adriṇā patatha tveṣam arṇavam //
analyzed: yat cyāvayatha vithurā iva saṃhitam vi adriṇā patatha tveṣam arṇavam
translated: When you shake the firmly-knit one, as if it were unsteady, you fly apart with the mountain, the brilliant ocean.

original: sātir na vo 'mavatī svarvatī tveṣā vipākā marutaḥ pipiṣvatī /
analyzed: sātiḥ na vaḥ mavatī svarvatī tveṣā vipākā marutaḥ pipiṣvatī
translated: Your favour, O Maruts, is full of abundance, full of heaven, brilliant, and satisfying.

original: bhadrā vo rātiḥ pṛṇato na dakṣiṇā pṛthujrayī asuryeva jañjatī //
analyzed: bhadrā vaḥ rātiḥ pṛṇataḥ na dakṣiṇā pṛthujrayī asuryā iva jañjatī
translated: Your gift is like the Dakshina of the sacrificers, spreading widely, like the Asura, it resounds.

original: prati ṣṭobhanti sindhavaḥ pavibhyo yad abhriyāṃ vācam udīrayanti /
analyzed: prati stobhanti sindhavaḥ pavibhyaḥ yat abhriyām vācam udīrayanti
translated: The rivers roar, when from the stones they send forth their voice in the clouds.

original: ava smayanta vidyutaḥ pṛthivyāṃ yadī ghṛtam marutaḥ pruṣṇuvanti //
analyzed: ava smayanta vidyutaḥ pṛthivyām yadī ghṛtam marutaḥ pruṣṇuvanti
translated: The lightnings flash on the earth, when the Maruts scatter the ghee.

original: asūta pṛśnir mahate raṇāya tveṣam ayāsām marutām anīkam /
analyzed: asūta pṛśniḥ mahate raṇāya tveṣam ayāsām marutām anīkam
translated: Prisni hath brought forth for great conflict the host of the Maruts, terrible, irresistible.

original: te sapsarāso 'janayantābhvam ād it svadhām iṣirām pary apaśyan //
analyzed: te sapsarāsaḥ janayanta abhvam āt id svadhām iṣirām pari apaśyan
translated: They, the companions, have produced the monster: they have looked around on their own most mighty power.

original: eṣa va stomo maruta iyaṃ gīr māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vaḥ stomaḥ marutaḥ iyam gīḥ māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ
translated: This is thy praise, O Maruts, this the song, O thou of many gifts, of the bountiful son of Mandârya.

original: eṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayāṃ vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: ā iṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayām vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: May this come to thee for the life of thy body: may we find the treasure-giving people.

original: mahaś cit tvam indra yata etān mahaś cid asi tyajaso varūtā /
analyzed: mahaḥ cit tvam indra yataḥ etān mahaḥ cit asi tyajasaḥ varūtā
translated: Even when thou art far away, O Indra, thou art the protector of these: thou art the guardian of the liberal worshipper.

original: sa no vedho marutāṃ cikitvān sumnā vanuṣva tava hi preṣṭhā //
analyzed: sa naḥ vedhaḥ marutām cikitvān sumnā vanuṣva tava hi preṣṭhā
translated: Do thou, the wise, the leader of the Maruts, grant us happiness, for thou art most kind.

original: ayujran ta indra viśvakṛṣṭīr vidānāso niṣṣidho martyatrā /
analyzed: ayujran te indra viśvakṛṣṭīḥ vidānāsaḥ niṣṣidhaḥ martyatrā
translated: They, the all-knowing, have set their weapons in motion, the barriers in the place of mortals.

original: marutām pṛtsutir hāsamānā svarmīḷhasya pradhanasya sātau //
analyzed: marutām pṛtsutiḥ hāsamānā svarmīḍhasya pradhanasya sātau
translated: The Maruts' battle-cry is heard, as they rejoice in the winning of the light, in the gaining of the prize.

original: amyak sā ta indra ṛṣṭir asme sanemy abhvam maruto junanti /
analyzed: amyak sā te indra ṛṣṭiḥ asme sanemi abhvam marutaḥ junanti
translated: That dart of thine, O Indra, is directed against us: the Maruts sharpen the weapon that is to be feared.

original: agniś cid dhi ṣmātase śuśukvān āpo na dvīpaṃ dadhati prayāṃsi //
analyzed: agniḥ cit hi smātase śuśukvān āpaḥ na dvīpam dadhati prayāṃsi
translated: Even Agni, when he is well-kindled, shines forth; the waters bear the ships as on an island.

original: tvaṃ tū na indra taṃ rayiṃ dā ojiṣṭhayā dakṣiṇayeva rātim /
analyzed: tvam tu naḥ indra tam rayim dāḥ ojiṣṭhayā dakṣiṇayā iva rātim
translated: But do thou, O Indra, give us that wealth with thy most powerful bounty, as with a gift.

original: stutaś ca yās te cakananta vāyo stanaṃ na madhvaḥ pīpayanta vājaiḥ //
analyzed: stutaḥ ca yāḥ te vāyoḥ stanam na madhvaḥ pīpayanta vājaiḥ
translated: And those who have delighted in thee, O Vâyu, have been satisfied with the sweet milk, as with strength.

original: tve rāya indra tośatamāḥ praṇetāraḥ kasya cid ṛtāyoḥ /
analyzed: tve rāyaḥ indra tośatamāḥ praṇetāraḥ kasya cit ṛtāyoḥ
translated: In thee, O Indra, are riches most abundant, the leaders of some one's holy rites.

original: te ṣu ṇo maruto mṛḷayantu ye smā purā gātūyantīva devāḥ //
analyzed: te su naḥ marutaḥ mṛḍayantu ye smā purā gātūyanti iva devāḥ
translated: May those Maruts be gracious unto us, who, as it were, have gone before, the Gods.

original: prati pra yāhīndra mīḷhuṣo nṝn mahaḥ pārthive sadane yatasva /
analyzed: prati pra yāhi indra mīḍhuṣaḥ nṝn mahaḥ pārthive sadane yatasva
translated: Come back, O Indra, to the men who long for thee: strive for the great seat on earth.

original: adha yad eṣām pṛthubudhnāsa etās tīrthe nāryaḥ pauṃsyāni tasthuḥ //
analyzed: adha yat eṣām pṛthu budhnāsaḥ etāḥ tīrthe na aryaḥ pauṃsyāni tasthuḥ
translated: When these, with their broad wheels, have stood in the ford, as women stand in the place of men's deeds.

original: prati ghorāṇām etānām ayāsām marutāṃ śṛṇva āyatām upabdiḥ /
analyzed: prati ghorāṇām etānām ayāsām marutām śṛṇve āyatām upabdiḥ
translated: Listen to the shout of the terrible, the untiring Maruts, as they stretch themselves.

original: ye martyam pṛtanāyantam ūmair ṛṇāvānaṃ na patayanta sargaiḥ //
analyzed: ye martyam pṛtanāyantam ūmaiḥ ṛṇāvānam na patayanta sargaiḥ
translated: Who with their floods pursue the mortal who would flee, as debtors flee their creditors.

original: tvam mānebhya indra viśvajanyā radā marudbhiḥ śurudho goagrāḥ /
analyzed: tvam mānebhyaḥ indra viśvajanyāḥ rada marudbhiḥ śurudhaḥ go agrāḥ
translated: For the sake of glory, O Indra, for the sake of all men, win by the Maruts the prizes, the foremost in cattle.

original: stavānebhi stavase deva devair vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: stavānebhiḥ stavase deva devaiḥ vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: With these praises, O God, be thou praised by the Gods: may we find the treasure, the company that gives good gifts.

original: na nūnam asti no śvaḥ kas tad veda yad adbhutam /
analyzed: na nūnam asti no śvas kaḥ tat veda yat adbhutam
translated: Surely there is no tomorrow; who knows that wonder?

original: anyasya cittam abhi saṃcareṇyam utādhītaṃ vi naśyati //
analyzed: anyasya cittam abhi saṃcareṇyam uta adhītam vi naśyati
translated: The mind of another is to be sought after; what has been studied is lost.

original: kiṃ na indra jighāṃsasi bhrātaro marutas tava /
analyzed: kim naḥ indra jighāṃsasi bhrātaraḥ marutaḥ tava
translated: Why do you wish to kill us, O Indra, your brothers, the Maruts?

original: tebhiḥ kalpasva sādhuyā mā naḥ samaraṇe vadhīḥ //
analyzed: tebhiḥ kalpasva sādhuyā mā naḥ samaraṇe vadhīḥ
translated: Be reconciled with them in a good way; do not kill us in battle.

original: kiṃ no bhrātar agastya sakhā sann ati manyase /
analyzed: kim naḥ bhrātar agastya sakhā san ati manyase
translated: Why do you think so much of yourself, O brother Agastya, being a friend?

original: vidmā hi te yathā mano 'smabhyam in na ditsasi //
analyzed: vidma hi te yathā manaḥ smabhyam id na ditsasi
translated: For we know your mind, that you do not wish to give to us.

original: araṃ kṛṇvantu vediṃ sam agnim indhatām puraḥ /
analyzed: aram kṛṇvantu vedim sam agnim indhatām puras
translated: Let them make the altar ready, let them kindle the fires in front.

original: tatrāmṛtasya cetanaṃ yajñaṃ te tanavāvahai //
analyzed: tatra amṛtasya cetanam yajñam te tanavāvahai
translated: There let us prepare for you the sacrifice, the thought of immortality.

original: tvam īśiṣe vasupate vasūnāṃ tvam mitrāṇām mitrapate dheṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: tvam īśiṣe vasu pate vasūnām tvam mitrāṇām mitra pate dheṣṭhaḥ
translated: You are the lord of treasures, O lord of treasures; you are the best friend of friends, O lord of friends.

original: indra tvam marudbhiḥ saṃ vadasvādha prāśāna ṛtuthā havīṃṣi //
analyzed: indra tvam marudbhiḥ sam vadasva adha prāśānaḥ ṛtuthā havīṃṣi
translated: O Indra, speak with the Maruts; eat the oblations in due season.

original: prati va enā namasāham emi sūktena bhikṣe sumatiṃ turāṇām /
analyzed: prati vaḥ enā namasā aham emi sūktena bhikṣe sumatim turāṇām
translated: I come to you with this homage; with a hymn I beg the favor of the swift ones.

original: rarāṇatā maruto vedyābhir ni heḷo dhatta vi mucadhvam aśvān //
analyzed: rarāṇatā marutaḥ vedyābhiḥ ni heḍaḥ dhatta vi mucadhvam aśvān
translated: O Maruts, be pleased with the offerings; remove the dart; set the horses free.

original: eṣa va stomo maruto namasvān hṛdā taṣṭo manasā dhāyi devāḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vaḥ stomaḥ marutaḥ namasvān hṛdā taṣṭaḥ manasā dhāyi devāḥ
translated: This is the praise, O Maruts, with homage, fashioned in the heart, created in the mind, O gods.

original: upem ā yāta manasā juṣāṇā yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā namasa id vṛdhāsaḥ //🔽stutāso no maruto mṛḷayantūta stuto maghavā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: upa īm ā yāta manasā juṣāṇāḥ yūyam hi stha namasaḥ id vṛdhāsaḥ  stutāsaḥ naḥ marutaḥ mṛḍayantu uta stutaḥ maghavā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ
translated: Come hither with your spirit, accepting it, for ye are they who prosper adoration.🔽Praised, be gracious unto us, O Maruts; praised, be most propitious, O ye bountiful.

original: ūrdhvā naḥ santu komyā vanāny ahāni viśvā maruto jigīṣā //
analyzed: ūrdhvā naḥ santu komyā vanāni ahāni viśvā marutaḥ jigīṣā
translated: Upward to us be your soft winds, and the days, O Maruts, all for our victory.

original: asmād ahaṃ taviṣād īṣamāṇa indrād bhiyā maruto rejamānaḥ /
analyzed: asmāt aham taviṣāt īṣamāṇaḥ indrāt bhiyā marutaḥ rejamānaḥ
translated: From that mighty one, from Indra, trembling with fear, O Maruts, I, imploring, have started.

original: yuṣmabhyaṃ havyā niśitāny āsan tāny āre cakṛmā mṛḷatā naḥ //
analyzed: yuṣmabhyam havyā niśitāni āsan tāni āre cakṛma mṛḍata naḥ
translated: To you have been offered the sharp oblations; we have turned them away: be gracious unto us.

original: yena mānāsaś citayanta usrā vyuṣṭiṣu śavasā śaśvatīnām /
analyzed: yena mānāsaḥ citayante usrāḥ vyuṣṭiṣu śavasā śaśvatīnām
translated: By whom the dawns, with their thoughts, shine in the dawns' watches with their strength in all the seasons,

original: sa no marudbhir vṛṣabha śravo dhā ugra ugrebhi sthaviraḥ sahodāḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ marudbhiḥ vṛṣabha śravaḥ dhāḥ ugraḥ ugrebhiḥ sthaviraḥ sahaḥ dāḥ
translated: Do thou, O mighty one, with the Maruts, O bull, bestow upon us glory, strong, with the strong, bestowing strength.

original: tvam pāhīndra sahīyaso nṝn bhavā marudbhir avayātaheḷāḥ /
analyzed: tvam pāhi indra sahīyasaḥ nṝn bhava marudbhiḥ avayāta heḍāḥ
translated: Do thou, O Indra, protect the most manly men; be thou with the Maruts, O thou of easy access.

original: supraketebhiḥ sāsahir dadhāno vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //🔽citro vo 'stu yāmaś citra ūtī sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: su praketebhiḥ sāsahiḥ dadhānaḥ vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum  citraḥ vaḥ stu yāmaḥ citraḥ ūtī sudānavaḥ
translated: Bearing, with those of good guidance, the victory, may we find the moving people, easy to win.

original: maruto ahibhānavaḥ //🔽āre sā vaḥ sudānavo maruta ṛñjatī śaruḥ /
analyzed: marutaḥ ahi bhānavaḥ  āre sā vaḥ sudānavaḥ marutaḥ ṛñjatī śaruḥ
translated: Let your going be variegated, O ye bountiful Maruts, variegated your help.

original: āre aśmā yam asyatha //
analyzed: āre aśmā yam asyatha
translated: O ye of good gifts, that dart of yours, O Maruts, which flies to meet us, is to be entreated.🔽The stone which ye have hurled away, O ye of good gifts, is to be entreated.

original: tṛṇaskandasya nu viśaḥ pari vṛṅkta sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: tṛṇaskandasya nu viśaḥ pari vṛṅkta sudānavaḥ
translated: The bountiful ones have turned away the people from the grass-covered (altar).

original: ūrdhvān naḥ karta jīvase //🔽gāyat sāma nabhanyaṃ yathā ver arcāma tad vāvṛdhānaṃ svarvat /
analyzed: ūrdhvān naḥ karta jīvase  gāyat sāma nabhanyam yathā veḥ arcāma tat vāvṛdhānam svarvat
translated: Make us rise up to live!🔽We will praise that which has grown, like the heavenly Saman, like the sky, with the hymn.

original: gāvo dhenavo barhiṣy adabdhā ā yat sadmānaṃ divyaṃ vivāsān //🔽arcad vṛṣā vṛṣabhiḥ sveduhavyair mṛgo nāśno ati yaj juguryāt /🔽pra mandayur manāṃ gūrta hotā bharate maryo mithunā yajatraḥ //
analyzed: gāvaḥ dhenavaḥ barhiṣi adabdhāḥ ā yat sadmānam divyam vivāsān  arcat vṛṣā vṛṣabhiḥ sveduhavyaiḥ mṛgaḥ na aśnaḥ ati yat juguryāt  pra mandayuḥ manām gūrta hotā bharate maryaḥ mithunā yajatraḥ
translated: The cows, the milch cows, the infallible ones, when they go to the heavenly abode.🔽The bull is praised with the bulls, with the offerings that are to be sweated. The deer goes beyond what is to be offered.🔽The joyful one has rejoiced, the wise one, the priest. The young man, the performer of sacrifices, brings the two (sacrificial portions).

original: nakṣad dhotā pari sadma mitā yan bharad garbham ā śaradaḥ pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: nakṣat hotā pari sadma mitā yan bharat garbham ā śaradaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The priest finds the seat when the abode is measured. He brings the embryo to the abode of the earth.

original: krandad aśvo nayamāno ruvad gaur antar dūto na rodasī carad vāk //
analyzed: krandat aśvaḥ nayamānaḥ ruvat gauḥ antar dūtaḥ na rodasī carat vāc
translated: The crying horse, being led, the lowing cow, the messenger in between, speech moves over the two worlds.

original: tā karmāṣatarāsmai pra cyautnāni devayanto bharante /🔽jujoṣad indro dasmavarcā nāsatyeva sugmyo ratheṣṭhāḥ //🔽tam u ṣṭuhīndraṃ yo ha satvā yaḥ śūro maghavā yo ratheṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: tā karma aṣatarā asmai pra cyautnāni devayantaḥ bharante  jujoṣat indraḥ dasma varcāḥ nāsatyā iva sugmyaḥ ratheṣṭhāḥ  tam u stuhi indram yaḥ ha satvā yaḥ śūraḥ maghavā yaḥ ratheṣṭhāḥ
translated: They, more skillful in their work, bring him the aids, the worshippers, the ones who delight in the gods.🔽Indra, the wonderful one, delights in the wonderful one, like the good-looking Nâsatyas, the charioteers.🔽Praise that Indra who is powerful, who is the hero, the generous one, the charioteer.

original: pratīcaś cid yodhīyān vṛṣaṇvān vavavruṣaś cit tamaso vihantā //
analyzed: pratīcaḥ cit yodhīyān vṛṣaṇvān vavavruṣaḥ cit tamasaḥ vihantā
translated: He who is more to be feared even than the western (enemies), the mighty one, the one who finds, the one who overcomes even the one in darkness.

original: pra yad itthā mahinā nṛbhyo asty araṃ rodasī kakṣye nāsmai /
analyzed: pra yat itthā mahinā nṛbhyaḥ asti aram rodasī kakṣye na asmai
translated: When he is thus with might for men, the two world-halves are too narrow for his body.

original: saṃ vivya indro vṛjanaṃ na bhūmā bharti svadhāvāṃ opaśam iva dyām //
analyzed: sam vivye indraḥ vṛjanam na bhūmā bharti svadhāvān opaśam iva dyām
translated: Indra, like the all-supporting sky, supports the people, as one who possesses power.

original: samatsu tvā śūra satām urāṇam prapathintamam paritaṃsayadhyai /
analyzed: samatsu tvā śūra satām urāṇam prapathintamam paritaṃsayadhyai
translated: In the battles, O hero, I would incite thee, the most distant, to the highest goal,

original: sajoṣasa indram made kṣoṇīḥ sūriṃ cid ye anumadanti vājaiḥ //
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ indram made kṣoṇīḥ sūrim cit ye anumadanti vājaiḥ
translated: The regions, in accord with Indra, in the rapture, who even the lord they delight in with their strength.

original: evā hi te śaṃ savanā samudra āpo yat ta āsu madanti devīḥ /
analyzed: eva hi te śam savanā samudre āpaḥ yat te āsu madanti devīḥ
translated: For thus, O Indra, are the libations, the waters, when they rejoice in thee, O god.

original: viśvā te anu joṣyā bhūd gauḥ sūrīṃś cid yadi dhiṣā veṣi janān //
analyzed: viśvā te anu joṣyā bhūt gauḥ sūrīn cit yadi dhiṣā veṣi janān
translated: Let all the cow be subject to thy will, if thou wilt clothe the people with thy favour.

original: asāma yathā suṣakhāya ena svabhiṣṭayo narāṃ na śaṃsaiḥ /
analyzed: asāma yathā su sakhāyaḥ ena su abhiṣṭayaḥ narām na śaṃsaiḥ
translated: Let us be like good friends, with our own praises, like men with their hymns.

original: asad yathā na indro vandaneṣṭhās turo na karma nayamāna ukthā //
analyzed: asat yathā naḥ indraḥ vandaneṣṭhāḥ turaḥ na karma nayamānaḥ ukthā
translated: Let Indra be present at our worship, like a swift one leading on the work, the praises.

original: viṣpardhaso narāṃ na śaṃsair asmākāsad indro vajrahastaḥ /
analyzed: viṣpardhasaḥ narām na śaṃsaiḥ asmāka asat indraḥ vajra hastaḥ
translated: Let Indra, with the thunderbolt in his hand, be on our side, like the contending men with their hymns.

original: mitrāyuvo na pūrpatiṃ suśiṣṭau madhyāyuva upa śikṣanti yajñaiḥ //
analyzed: mitrāyuvaḥ na pūrpatim su śiṣṭau madhyāyuvaḥ upa śikṣanti yajñaiḥ
translated: Like young men with their friends, they approach with sacrifices the one who is to be served, the lord of the people.

original: yajño hi ṣmendraṃ kaś cid ṛndhañ juhurāṇaś cin manasā pariyan /
analyzed: yajñaḥ hi sma indram kaḥ cit ṛndham juhurāṇaḥ cit manasā pariyan
translated: For Indra is to be served by some one with sacrifice, even by him who is angry, who is going away in his mind.

original: tīrthe nācchā tātṛṣāṇam oko dīrgho na sidhram ā kṛṇoty adhvā //
analyzed: tīrthe na acchā tātṛṣāṇam okaḥ dīrghaḥ na sidhram ā kṛṇoti adhvā
translated: The path is long, but he makes it easy and pleasant for the one who is thirsty for the water of the holy place.

original: mo ṣū ṇa indrātra pṛtsu devair asti hi ṣmā te śuṣminn avayāḥ /
analyzed: mā u su naḥ indra atra pṛtsu devaiḥ asti hi sma te śuṣmin avayāḥ
translated: Do not be among the gods in the battles, O Indra, for there is a great enmity between you and them, O mighty one.

original: mahaś cid yasya mīḷhuṣo yavyā haviṣmato maruto vandate gīḥ //
analyzed: mahaḥ cit yasya mīḍhuṣaḥ yavyā haviṣmataḥ marutaḥ vandate gīḥ
translated: Even the great one who is greedy for the barley offering, for whom the Maruts praise the song,

original: eṣa stoma indra tubhyam asme etena gātuṃ harivo vido naḥ /
analyzed: eṣa stomaḥ indra tubhyam asme etena gātum harivas vidaḥ naḥ
translated: This praise, O Indra, is for you, for us. By this, O lord of bays, find a way for us.

original: ā no vavṛtyāḥ suvitāya deva vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: ā naḥ vavṛtyāḥ suvitāya deva vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: Turn to us, O god, for prosperity. May we find the moving people who give good gifts.

original: tvaṃ rājendra ye ca devā rakṣā nṝn pāhy asura tvam asmān /
analyzed: tvam rājā indra ye ca devāḥ rakṣa nṝn pāhi asura tvam asmān
translated: You are the king, O Indra, and the gods. Protect the men, O Asura, protect us.

original: tvaṃ satpatir maghavā nas tarutras tvaṃ satyo vasavānaḥ sahodāḥ //
analyzed: tvam satpatiḥ maghavā naḥ tarutraḥ tvam satyaḥ vasavānaḥ sahaḥ dāḥ
translated: You are the lord of the good, the generous, the savior for us. You are the true one, the powerful, the giver of strength.

original: dano viśa indra mṛdhravācaḥ sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīr dart /
analyzed: danaḥ viśaḥ indra mṛdhravācaḥ sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīḥ dart
translated: You destroyed the seven fortresses of the Dānus, O Indra, who spoke harshly to the people, in the autumn.

original: ṛṇor apo anavadyārṇā yūne vṛtram purukutsāya randhīḥ //
analyzed: ṛṇoḥ apaḥ anavadya arṇāḥ yūne vṛtram purukutsāya randhīḥ
translated: You gave the young Purukutsa the waters of the R̥ṇo river, which are faultless, and Vṛtra.

original: ajā vṛta indra śūrapatnīr dyāṃ ca yebhiḥ puruhūta nūnam /
analyzed: aja vṛtaḥ indra śūra patnīḥ dyām ca yebhiḥ puruhūta nūnam
translated: The goats, O Indra, the wives of the hero, and the sky, by which, O much-invoked one, you now

original: rakṣo agnim aśuṣaṃ tūrvayāṇaṃ siṃho na dame apāṃsi vastoḥ //
analyzed: rakṣaḥ agnim aśuṣam tūrvayāṇam siṃhaḥ na dame apāṃsi vastoḥ
translated: Protect the Rakṣas, the dry Agni, the young one, like a lion in the house, in the abode of the waters.

original: śeṣan nu ta indra sasmin yonau praśastaye pavīravasya mahnā /
analyzed: śeṣan nu te indra sasmin yonau praśastaye pavīravasya mahnā
translated: Now, Indra, in this place of thine, for the praise of the purifier, by the greatness of thy power,

original: sṛjad arṇāṃsy ava yad yudhā gās tiṣṭhad dharī dhṛṣatā mṛṣṭa vājān //
analyzed: sṛjat arṇāṃsi ava yat yudhā gāḥ tiṣṭhat harī dhṛṣatā mṛṣṭa vājān
translated: Do thou let loose the floods, when thou hast conquered the kine in fight, and stand, with thy bay steeds, daring, and win the prizes.

original: vaha kutsam indra yasmiñ cākan syūmanyū ṛjrā vātasyāśvā /
analyzed: vaha kutsam indra yasmin cākan syūmanyū ṛjrā vātasya aśvā
translated: Bear Kuṭsa, O Indra, in whom thou hast delight. The swift steeds of the wind are his companions.

original: pra sūraś cakraṃ vṛhatād abhīke 'bhi spṛdho yāsiṣad vajrabāhuḥ //
analyzed: pra sūraḥ cakram vṛhatāt abhīke bhi spṛdhaḥ yāsiṣat vajra bāhuḥ
translated: Let the Sun roll his wheel in the conflict. With thy thunderbolt in thy hand thou goest to the foe.

original: jaghanvāṃ indra mitrerūñ codapravṛddho harivo adāśūn /
analyzed: jaghanvān indra mitrerūm coda pravṛddhaḥ harivas a dāśūn
translated: O thou who hast Bay Horses, O Indra, urge the weak-kneed, the deceitful, the niggardly, the enemies.

original: pra ye paśyann aryamaṇaṃ sacāyos tvayā śūrtā vahamānā apatyam //
analyzed: pra ye paśyan aryamaṇam sacā āyoḥ tvayā śūrtāḥ vahamānāḥ apatyam
translated: He who looks on Aryaman as a companion, through thee, O thou with the sharp weapon, shall carry off the offspring.

original: rapat kavir indrārkasātau kṣāṃ dāsāyopabarhaṇīṃ kaḥ /
analyzed: rapat kaviḥ indra arka sātau kṣām dāsāya upabarhaṇīm kaḥ
translated: The sage hath fallen in the battle of the hymns, O Indra, for the Dāsa to trample under foot.

original: karat tisro maghavā dānucitrā ni duryoṇe kuyavācam mṛdhi śret //
analyzed: karat tisraḥ maghavā dānu citrāḥ ni duryoṇe kuyavācam mṛdhi śret
translated: Maghavan hath made three, wondrous in their gifts, in the house of the wicked, to be his friends. He shall overcome the reviler in the strife.

original: sanā tā ta indra navyā āguḥ saho nabho 'viraṇāya pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: sanā tā te indra navyā āguḥ sahaḥ nabhaḥ viraṇāya pūrvīḥ
translated: Those ancient ones and the new ones have come to thee, O Indra, the many, the strong, the cloudless ones.

original: bhinat puro na bhido adevīr nanamo vadhar adevasya pīyoḥ //
analyzed: bhinat puraḥ na bhidaḥ adevīḥ nanamaḥ vadhar adevasya pīyoḥ
translated: Thou hast cleft the forts, O thou who cleftest them, the godless ones. The homage of the weapon of the godless one is slain.

original: tvaṃ dhunir indra dhunimatīr ṛṇor apaḥ sīrā na sravantīḥ /
analyzed: tvam dhuniḥ indra dhunimatīḥ ṛṇoḥ apaḥ sīrāḥ na sravantīḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the shaker, the shaker of the waters, the streams, as of ploughs.

original: pra yat samudram ati śūra parṣi pārayā turvaśaṃ yaduṃ svasti //
analyzed: pra yat samudram ati śūra parṣi pāraya turvaśam yadum svasti
translated: When, O hero, thou carriest us over the sea, do thou carry Turvaga and Yadu in safety.

original: tvam asmākam indra viśvadha syā avṛkatamo narāṃ nṛpātā /🔽sa no viśvāsāṃ spṛdhāṃ sahodā vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: tvam asmākam indra viśvadha syāḥ avṛkatamaḥ narām nṛ pātā  sa naḥ viśvāsām spṛdhām sahaḥ dāḥ vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: Be thou to us, O Indra, in every way the best of men, the most fearless, the lord of men.🔽Do thou, O Indra, give us strength to conquer all our enemies. May we find the people of the well-giving Vr̥ishanas.

original: matsy apāyi te mahaḥ pātrasyeva harivo matsaro madaḥ /
analyzed: matsi apāyi te mahaḥ pātrasya iva harivas matsaraḥ madaḥ
translated: In thee, O Indra, is the great joy, like the joy of the vessel, O lover of bay steeds, the joy of the juice.

original: vṛṣā te vṛṣṇa indur vājī sahasrasātamaḥ //🔽ā nas te gantu matsaro vṛṣā mado vareṇyaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā te vṛṣṇaḥ induḥ vājī sahasra sātamaḥ  ā naḥ te gantu matsaraḥ vṛṣā madaḥ vareṇyaḥ
translated: The strong, the powerful, the vigorous Indu, the best winner of a thousand (spoils), is thine.🔽Let thy strong joy come to us, O Indra, the excellent joy.

original: sahāvāṃ indra sānasiḥ pṛtanāṣāḷ amartyaḥ //
analyzed: sahāvān indra sānasiḥ pṛtanāṣāh amartyaḥ
translated: Be thou, O Indra, victorious, ever-conquering, the conqueror of battles, immortal.

original: tvaṃ hi śūraḥ sanitā codayo manuṣo ratham /
analyzed: tvam hi śūraḥ sanitā codayaḥ manuṣaḥ ratham
translated: For thou, O hero, art the impeller, the winner, of the chariot of men.

original: sahāvān dasyum avratam oṣaḥ pātraṃ na śociṣā //
analyzed: sahāvān dasyum avratam oṣaḥ pātram na śociṣā
translated: With the victorious, O Indra, with thy flame burn the Dâsa, the wicked, as a vessel of wood.

original: muṣāya sūryaṃ kave cakram īśāna ojasā /
analyzed: muṣāya sūryam kave cakram īśānaḥ ojasā
translated: O wise one, thou sendest the sun with thy might, the wheel with thy power.

original: vaha śuṣṇāya vadhaṃ kutsaṃ vātasyāśvaiḥ //
analyzed: vaha śuṣṇāya vadham kutsam vātasya aśvaiḥ
translated: Carry the weapon to Sushna with the steeds of the wind, with Kutsa.

original: śuṣmintamo hi te mado dyumnintama uta kratuḥ /
analyzed: śuṣmintamaḥ hi te madaḥ dyumnintamaḥ uta kratuḥ
translated: For thy joy is most powerful, thy wisdom most glorious.

original: vṛtraghnā varivovidā maṃsīṣṭhā aśvasātamaḥ //
analyzed: vṛtra ghnā varivaḥ vidā maṃsīṣṭhāḥ aśva sātamaḥ
translated: Think of the Vr̥itra-slayer, the finder of room, the best winner of horses.

original: yathā pūrvebhyo jaritṛbhya indra maya ivāpo na tṛṣyate babhūtha /
analyzed: yathā pūrvebhyaḥ jaritṛbhyaḥ indra mayaḥ iva apaḥ na tṛṣyate babhūtha
translated: As thou, O Indra, hast become like water to the thirsty to the former singers of praise,

original: tām anu tvā nividaṃ johavīmi vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: tām anu tvā nividam johavīmi vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: After that, I call upon this Nivida: may we find the moving, ever-waxing people.

original: matsi no vasyaiṣṭaya indram indo vṛṣā viśa /
analyzed: matsi naḥ vasyaiṣṭaye indram indo vṛṣā viśa
translated: You delight us for the sake of good things. O Indu, you urge the strong to the people of Indra.

original: ṛghāyamāṇa invasi śatrum anti na vindasi //
analyzed: ṛghāyamāṇaḥ invasi śatrum anti na vindasi
translated: You stimulate the one who acts violently, you do not find the enemy.

original: tasminn ā veśayā giro ya ekaś carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: tasmin ā veśaya giraḥ yaḥ ekaḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: Place these words in him who is alone among the people.

original: anu svadhā yam upyate yavaṃ na carkṛṣad vṛṣā //
analyzed: anu svadhā yam upyate yavam na carkṛṣat vṛṣā
translated: After him whom the strong one tills like barley, as if it were his own portion.

original: yasya viśvāni hastayoḥ pañca kṣitīnāṃ vasu /
analyzed: yasya viśvāni hastayoḥ pañca kṣitīnām vasu
translated: In whose two hands are all the five treasures of the people.

original: spāśayasva yo asmadhrug divyevāśanir jahi //
analyzed: spāśayasva yaḥ asmadhruk divyā iva aśaniḥ jahi
translated: Place him, the one who hates us, as if he were a heavenly thunderbolt.

original: asunvantaṃ samaṃ jahi dūṇāśaṃ yo na te mayaḥ /
analyzed: a sunvantam samam jahi dūṇāśam yaḥ na te mayaḥ
translated: Destroy the one who does not offer, the one who is greedy, who is not your friend.

original: asmabhyam asya vedanaṃ daddhi sūriś cid ohate //
analyzed: asmabhyam asya vedanam daddhi sūriḥ cit ohate
translated: Give us his wealth, even if it is taken by a lord.

original: āvo yasya dvibarhaso 'rkeṣu sānuṣag asat /
analyzed: āvaḥ yasya dvibarhasaḥ rkeṣu sānuṣak asat
translated: The one whose two powers are in the praises, as if on the heights.

original: ājāv indrasyendo prāvo vājeṣu vājinam //
analyzed: ājau indrasya indo prāvaḥ vājeṣu vājinam
translated: In the race, O Indu, praise Indra, the strong one, in the contests.

original: yathā pūrvebhyo jaritṛbhya indra maya ivāpo na tṛṣyate babhūtha /
analyzed: yathā pūrvebhyaḥ jaritṛbhyaḥ indra mayaḥ iva apaḥ na tṛṣyate babhūtha
translated: Just as you have become like water to the thirsty to the former singers, O Indra,

original: tām anu tvā nividaṃ johavīmi vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: tām anu tvā nividam johavīmi vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: After that, I call upon this Nivida: may we find the moving, ever-waxing people.

original: ā carṣaṇiprā vṛṣabho janānāṃ rājā kṛṣṭīnām puruhūta indraḥ /
analyzed: ā carṣaṇi prāḥ vṛṣabhaḥ janānām rājā kṛṣṭīnām puru hūtaḥ indraḥ
translated: The bull among the people, the leader of the people, the king of the tribes, Indra, invoked by many,

original: stutaḥ śravasyann avasopa madrig yuktvā harī vṛṣaṇā yāhy arvāṅ //
analyzed: stutaḥ śravasyan avasā upa madrik yuktvā harī vṛṣaṇā yāhi arvāṅ
translated: Praised, rejoicing, come to me with help, yoke thy two strong Bay Horses, come hitherward.

original: ye te vṛṣaṇo vṛṣabhāsa indra brahmayujo vṛṣarathāso atyāḥ /🔽tāṃ ā tiṣṭha tebhir ā yāhy arvāṅ havāmahe tvā suta indra some //
analyzed: ye te vṛṣaṇaḥ vṛṣabhāsaḥ indra brahma yujaḥ vṛṣa rathāsaḥ atyāḥ  tām ā tiṣṭha tebhiḥ ā yāhi arvāṅ havāmahe tvā sute indra some
translated: Those, O thou Strong One, which are thy strong, bull-like, horses, O Indra, yoked with prayer, thy bulls, thy chariots,🔽Mount them, come hither with them. We invoke thee, O Indra, to the Soma juice.

original: ā tiṣṭha rathaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vṛṣā te sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni /
analyzed: ā tiṣṭha ratham vṛṣaṇam vṛṣā te sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni
translated: Mount the strong chariot, the strong juice is pressed for thee, the sweet juices are sprinkled.

original: yuktvā vṛṣabhyāṃ vṛṣabha kṣitīnāṃ haribhyāṃ yāhi pravatopa madrik //
analyzed: yuktvā vṛṣabhyām vṛṣabha kṣitīnām haribhyām yāhi pravatā upa madrik
translated: Having yoked thy two strong bulls, O thou strong one of the people, come hitherward on thy two Bays.

original: ayaṃ yajño devayā ayam miyedha imā brahmāṇy ayam indra somaḥ /
analyzed: ayam yajñaḥ deva yāḥ ayam miyedhaḥ imā brahmāṇi ayam indra somaḥ
translated: This sacrifice is for the Gods, this our oblation, these prayers, O Indra, this Soma.

original: stīrṇam barhir ā tu śakra pra yāhi pibā niṣadya vi mucā harī iha //
analyzed: stīrṇam barhiḥ ā tu śakra pra yāhi pibā niṣadya vi muca harī iha
translated: The grass is strewn, come hither, O Sakra, sit down and loose thy two Bays here.

original: o suṣṭuta indra yāhy arvāṅ upa brahmāṇi mānyasya kāroḥ /
analyzed: ā u suṣṭutaḥ indra yāhi arvāṅ upa brahmāṇi mānyasya kāroḥ
translated: O Indra, well praised, come hither on thy car to the prayers of the worshipper of many gifts.

original: vidyāma vastor avasā gṛṇanto vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: vidyāma vastoḥ avasā gṛṇantaḥ vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: May we, singing, find the light of the dawn, may we find the moving people, easy to win.

original: yad dha syā ta indra śruṣṭir asti yayā babhūtha jaritṛbhya ūtī /
analyzed: yat ha syā te indra śruṣṭiḥ asti yayā babhūtha jaritṛbhyaḥ ūtī
translated: If, O Indra, thou hast a hearing for him, wherewith thou hast become a helper to thy praisers,

original: mā naḥ kāmam mahayantam ā dhag viśvā te aśyām pary āpa āyoḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ kāmam mahayantam ā dhak viśvā te aśyām pari āpaḥ āyoḥ
translated: Do not thou burn away our great desire: may I obtain all things from thee, O thou of the people.

original: na ghā rājendra ā dabhan no yā nu svasārā kṛṇavanta yonau /
analyzed: na ghā rājā indraḥ ā dabhat naḥ yā nu svasārā kṛṇavanta yonau
translated: O lord of kings, they have not deceived us, nor have they who are our own sisters in the womb.

original: āpaś cid asmai sutukā aveṣan gaman na indraḥ sakhyā vayaś ca //
analyzed: āpaḥ cit asmai sutukāḥ aveṣan gamat naḥ indraḥ sakhyā vayaḥ ca
translated: Even the waters have been favorable to him. May Indra come to us with his friendship and power.

original: jetā nṛbhir indraḥ pṛtsu śūraḥ śrotā havaṃ nādhamānasya kāroḥ /
analyzed: jetā nṛbhiḥ indraḥ pṛtsu śūraḥ śrotā havam nādhamānasya kāroḥ
translated: Indra, the hero, is the conqueror in battles with men, the hearer of the cry of the needy singer.

original: prabhartā rathaṃ dāśuṣa upāka udyantā giro yadi ca tmanā bhūt //
analyzed: prabhartā ratham dāśuṣe upāke udyantā giraḥ yadi ca tmanā bhūt
translated: He is the supporter of the chariot of the worshipper, the impeller of the songs, if he himself has become so.

original: evā nṛbhir indraḥ suśravasyā prakhādaḥ pṛkṣo abhi mitriṇo bhūt /
analyzed: eva nṛbhiḥ indraḥ suśravasyā prakhādaḥ pṛkṣaḥ abhi mitriṇaḥ bhūt
translated: Thus, with men, Indra, who desires great fame, has become the devourer of the food, the conqueror of the enemies.

original: samarya iṣa stavate vivāci satrākaro yajamānasya śaṃsaḥ //
analyzed: samarye iṣaḥ stavate vivāci satrākaraḥ yajamānasya śaṃsaḥ
translated: In the battle, the food is praised with different voices. The praise of the sacrificer is always accomplished.

original: tvayā vayam maghavann indra śatrūn abhi ṣyāma mahato manyamānān /🔽tvaṃ trātā tvam u no vṛdhe bhūr vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //🔽pūrvīr ahaṃ śaradaḥ śaśramāṇā doṣā vastor uṣaso jarayantīḥ /
analyzed: tvayā vayam maghavan indra śatrūn abhi syāma mahataḥ manyamānān  tvam trātā tvam u naḥ vṛdhe bhūḥ vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum  pūrvīḥ aham śaradaḥ śaśramāṇāḥ doṣā vastoḥ uṣasaḥ jarayantīḥ
translated: By you, O magnanimous Indra, we shall conquer the enemies who think themselves great.🔽You are the protector, you are our prosperity. We shall find the food-giving people, the moving people.🔽I remember the many autumns that have passed, the nights and dawns that have grown old.

original: mināti śriyaṃ jarimā tanūnām apy ū nu patnīr vṛṣaṇo jagamyuḥ //
analyzed: mināti śriyam jarimā tanūnām api u nu patnīḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ jagamyuḥ
translated: Old age destroys the beauty of the bodies. The powerful husbands have gone away from their wives.

original: ye cid dhi pūrva ṛtasāpa āsan sākaṃ devebhir avadann ṛtāni /
analyzed: ye cit hi pūrve ṛtasāpaḥ āsan sākam devebhiḥ avadan ṛtāni
translated: Those who were in the past, who were devoted to truth, who spoke the truths together with the gods,

original: te cid avāsur nahy antam āpuḥ sam ū nu patnīr vṛṣabhir jagamyuḥ //
analyzed: te cit avāsuḥ nahi antam āpuḥ sam u nu patnīḥ vṛṣabhiḥ jagamyuḥ
translated: They have not reached the end, they have not found a resting-place. The wives have come together with the bulls.

original: na mṛṣā śrāntaṃ yad avanti devā viśvā it spṛdho abhy aśnavāva /
analyzed: na mṛṣā śrāntam yat avanti devāḥ viśvāḥ id spṛdhaḥ abhī aśnavāva
translated: The gods do not deceive the weary one when they are entreated. We shall overcome all the enemies.

original: jayāved atra śatanītham ājiṃ yat samyañcā mithunāv abhy ajāva //
analyzed: jayāva id atra śata nītham ājim yat samyañcā mithunau abhī ajāva
translated: Here we shall conquer the hundred-winning race, when the two yoked mates have come together.

original: nadasya mā rudhataḥ kāma āgann ita ājāto amutaḥ kutaś cit /
analyzed: nadasya mā rudhataḥ kāmaḥ āgan itas ājātaḥ amutas kutas cit
translated: The desire of the flowing river has come to me, from here, from yonder, from somewhere.

original: lopāmudrā vṛṣaṇaṃ nī riṇāti dhīram adhīrā dhayati śvasantam //
analyzed: lopāmudrā vṛṣaṇam nī riṇāti dhīram adhīrā dhayati śvasantam
translated: Lopamudra leads the strong one to the bed, the unwearying one sucks the weary one.

original: imaṃ nu somam antito hṛtsu pītam upa bruve /
analyzed: imam nu somam antitas hṛtsu pītam upa bruve
translated: I now address this Soma which has been drunk in the heart, from here.

original: yat sīm āgaś cakṛmā tat su mṛḷatu pulukāmo hi martyaḥ //
analyzed: yat sīm āgaḥ cakṛma tat su mṛḍatu pulu kāmaḥ hi martyaḥ
translated: Whatever fault we have committed, may he be kind to us, for a mortal is full of desires.

original: agastyaḥ khanamānaḥ khanitraiḥ prajām apatyam balam icchamānaḥ /
analyzed: agastyaḥ khanamānaḥ khanitraiḥ prajām apatyam balam icchamānaḥ
translated: Agastya, digging with spades, desiring offspring, progeny, and strength,

original: ubhau varṇāv ṛṣir ugraḥ pupoṣa satyā deveṣv āśiṣo jagāma //
analyzed: ubhau varṇau ṛṣiḥ ugraḥ pupoṣa satyāḥ deveṣu āśiṣaḥ jagāma
translated: The fierce Rishi nourished both races. He went to the gods with true prayers.

original: yuvo rajāṃsi suyamāso aśvā ratho yad vām pary arṇāṃsi dīyat /
analyzed: yuvoḥ rajāṃsi su yamāsaḥ aśvāḥ rathaḥ yat vām pari arṇāṃsi dīyat
translated: Your horses, easy to yoke, move through the realms of space, when your chariot goes around the waters.

original: hiraṇyayā vām pavayaḥ pruṣāyan madhvaḥ pibantā uṣasaḥ sacethe //
analyzed: hiraṇyayāḥ vām pavayaḥ pruṣāyan madhvaḥ pibantau uṣasaḥ sacethe
translated: Your golden purifying (horses) are pouring (water), drinking the sweet (Soma), you two dawn together.

original: yuvam atyasyāva nakṣatho yad vipatmano naryasya prayajyoḥ /
analyzed: yuvam atyasya ava nakṣathaḥ yat vipatmanaḥ naryasya prayajyoḥ
translated: You two have won the prize when the most excellent man, the worshipper, has been defeated.

original: svasā yad vāṃ viśvagūrtī bharāti vājāyeṭṭe madhupāv iṣe ca //
analyzed: svasā yat vām viśva gūrtī bharāti vājāya īṭṭe madhu pau iṣe ca
translated: When your sister, who looks on all sides, bears you, for strength, O you who drink the sweet juice, and for food.

original: yuvam paya usriyāyām adhattam pakvam āmāyām ava pūrvyaṃ goḥ /
analyzed: yuvam payaḥ usriyāyām adhattam pakvam āmāyām ava pūrvyam goḥ
translated: You have placed the ripe milk in the raw cow, the first-born of the cow.

original: antar yad vanino vām ṛtapsū hvāro na śucir yajate haviṣmān //
analyzed: antar yat vaninaḥ vām ṛtapsū hvāraḥ na śuciḥ yajate haviṣmān
translated: When, O you two who are in the wood, you two who are righteous, the pure one, like a bull, worships with oblations.

original: yuvaṃ ha gharmam madhumantam atraye 'po na kṣodo 'vṛṇītam eṣe /
analyzed: yuvam ha gharmam madhumantam atraye paḥ na kṣodaḥ vṛṇītam eṣe
translated: You two have made the sweet hot water for Atri, you have chosen the waters like a flood for searching.

original: tad vāṃ narāv aśvinā paśvaiṣṭī rathyeva cakrā prati yanti madhvaḥ //🔽ā vāṃ dānāya vavṛtīya dasrā gor oheṇa taugryo na jivriḥ /
analyzed: tat vām narau aśvinā paśvaiṣṭiḥ rathyā iva cakrā prati yanti madhvaḥ  ā vām dānāya vavṛtīya dasrā goḥ oheṇa taugryaḥ na jivriḥ
translated: That, O two men, O two Aśvins, is your choice of cattle, like a chariot with wheels turns to the sweet juice.🔽I would invite you two, O wonder-workers, to the gift, like Taugrya to the cow, to the sacrifice.

original: apaḥ kṣoṇī sacate māhinā vāṃ jūrṇo vām akṣur aṃhaso yajatrā //
analyzed: apaḥ kṣoṇī sacate māhinā vām jūrṇaḥ vām akṣuḥ aṃhasaḥ yajatrā
translated: The earth and the waters follow your greatness, your axle, O you two to be worshipped, is worn out by the calamity.

original: ni yad yuvethe niyutaḥ sudānū upa svadhābhiḥ sṛjathaḥ purandhim /
analyzed: ni yat yuvethe niyutaḥ su dānū upa svadhābhiḥ sṛjathaḥ purandhim
translated: When you two, O bountiful ones, send forth your teams, you two create Purandhi with your own powers.

original: preṣad veṣad vāto na sūrir ā mahe dade suvrato na vājam //
analyzed: preṣat veṣat vātaḥ na sūriḥ ā mahe dade suvrataḥ na vājam
translated: The wind, like a leader, sends forth and sends back (the clouds), for the great one gives strength like one of good vows.

original: vayaṃ cid dhi vāṃ jaritāraḥ satyā vipanyāmahe vi paṇir hitāvān /
analyzed: vayam cit hi vām jaritāraḥ satyāḥ vipanyāmahe vi paṇiḥ hitāvān
translated: We also, O you two to be praised, are true worshippers, we unyoke the yoke, for the yoke is set for the prosperous one.

original: adhā cid dhi ṣmāśvināv anindyā pātho hi ṣmā vṛṣaṇāv antidevam //
analyzed: adhā cit hi sma aśvinau anindyā pāthaḥ hi sma vṛṣaṇau antidevam
translated: For you, O Asvins, are not to be blamed, for you are the two mighty ones who come to the worshipper.

original: yuvāṃ cid dhi ṣmāśvināv anu dyūn virudrasya prasravaṇasya sātau /
analyzed: yuvām cit hi sma aśvinau anu dyūn virudrasya prasravaṇasya sātau
translated: For you, O Asvins, are to be invoked in the days of the pressing of the stream of the Rudra.

original: agastyo narāṃ nṛṣu praśastaḥ kārādhunīva citayat sahasraiḥ //🔽pra yad vahethe mahinā rathasya pra syandrā yātho manuṣo na hotā /
analyzed: agastyaḥ narām nṛṣu praśastaḥ kārādhunī iva citayat sahasraiḥ  pra yat vahethe mahinā rathasya pra syandrā yāthaḥ manuṣaḥ na hotā
translated: Agastya, praised among men by men, with a thousand (gifts), like a charioteer, is to be worshipped.🔽When you carry (us) with the might of the chariot, you go as the two Sadasya priests among men, as the two Adhvaryus among men.

original: dhattaṃ sūribhya uta vā svaśvyaṃ nāsatyā rayiṣācaḥ syāma //🔽taṃ vāṃ rathaṃ vayam adyā huvema stomair aśvinā suvitāya navyam /
analyzed: dhattam sūribhyaḥ uta vā su aśvyam nāsatyā rayiṣācaḥ syāma  tam vām ratham vayam adyā huvema stomaiḥ aśvinā suvitāya navyam
translated: Grant us, O Nāsatyas, wealth with good horses, and may we be rich.🔽We invoke that chariot of yours today, O Asvins, with praises, the new one, for prosperity.

original: ariṣṭanemim pari dyām iyānaṃ vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: ariṣṭa nemim pari dyām iyānam vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: May we find the horse that is to be won, the people who give much, going around the sky with unbroken wheels.

original: kad u preṣṭāv iṣāṃ rayīṇām adhvaryantā yad unninītho apām /
analyzed: kad u preṣṭau iṣām rayīṇām adhvaryantā yat unninīthaḥ apām
translated: When, as the two Adhvaryus, you lead forward the two streams of food and wealth, and the waters are lifted up,

original: ayaṃ vāṃ yajño akṛta praśastiṃ vasudhitī avitārā janānām //🔽ā vām aśvāsaḥ śucayaḥ payaspā vātaraṃhaso divyāso atyāḥ /
analyzed: ayam vām yajñaḥ akṛta praśastim vasu dhitī avitārā janānām  ā vām aśvāsaḥ śucayaḥ payaspāḥ vāta raṃhasaḥ divyāsaḥ atyāḥ
translated: This sacrifice of ours has made praise for you, the two who bestow wealth, the two who guide the people.🔽Your horses, the pure ones who drink milk, with the speed of the wind, the heavenly ones, the swift ones,

original: manojuvo vṛṣaṇo vītapṛṣṭhā eha svarājo aśvinā vahantu //
analyzed: manaḥ juvaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ vīta pṛṣṭhāḥ ā iha svarājaḥ aśvinā vahantu
translated: The strong ones with beautiful backs, swift as thought, O Aśvins, may they bring you, the two self-ruling ones.

original: ā vāṃ ratho 'vanir na pravatvān sṛpravandhuraḥ suvitāya gamyāḥ /
analyzed: ā vām rathaḥ vaniḥ na pravatvān sṛpra vandhuraḥ suvitāya gamyāḥ
translated: May your chariot, O ye whose paths are swift, come down to us, with its well-yoked pole, to bring us bliss.

original: vṛṣṇa sthātārā manaso javīyān ahampūrvo yajato dhiṣṇyā yaḥ //
analyzed: vṛṣṇaḥ sthātārā manasaḥ javīyān ahampūrvaḥ yajataḥ dhiṣṇyā yaḥ
translated: The swifter than the mind, the earlier than the worshipper, is he who is your wondrous guardian, O ye Wonder-Workers.

original: iheha jātā sam avāvaśītām arepasā tanvā nāmabhiḥ svaiḥ /
analyzed: iha iha jātā sam avāvaśītām arepasā tanvā nāmabhiḥ svaiḥ
translated: Here, here were they born, and here have they grown great, unspotted with the stain of sin, by their own acts.

original: jiṣṇur vām anyaḥ sumakhasya sūrir divo anyaḥ subhagaḥ putra ūhe //
analyzed: jiṣṇuḥ vām anyaḥ su makhasya sūriḥ divaḥ anyaḥ subhagaḥ putraḥ ūhe
translated: One of you is the victor, the chief of the good sacrificer, the other, O ye of fair forms, is the son of heaven.

original: pra vāṃ niceruḥ kakuho vaśāṃ anu piśaṅgarūpaḥ sadanāni gamyāḥ /🔽harī anyasya pīpayanta vājair mathrā rajāṃsy aśvinā vi ghoṣaiḥ //
analyzed: pra vām niceruḥ kakuhaḥ vaśām anu piśaṅga rūpaḥ sadanāni gamyāḥ  harī anyasya pīpayanta vājaiḥ mathrā rajāṃsi aśvinā vi ghoṣaiḥ
translated: Your Kakubh, O ye who are to be invoked, has gone down to the earth, and comes to your seats, of a tawny hue.🔽The two bay steeds of the one are filled with strength, the two brown ones of the other, O ye Aṣvins, with your shouts.

original: pra vāṃ śaradvān vṛṣabho na niṣṣāṭ pūrvīr iṣaś carati madhva iṣṇan /
analyzed: pra vām śaradvān vṛṣabhaḥ na niṣṣāh pūrvīḥ iṣaḥ carati madhvaḥ iṣṇan
translated: The strong one, the possessor of the autumn, moves on, pouring the sweet juice, sending forth his rays.

original: evair anyasya pīpayanta vājair veṣantīr ūrdhvā nadyo na āguḥ //
analyzed: evaiḥ anyasya pīpayanta vājaiḥ veṣantīḥ ūrdhvāḥ nadyaḥ naḥ āguḥ
translated: The waters of the one are filled with strength, with food, and come to us, rising up, as it were, in garments.
