original: asarji vāṃ sthavirā vedhasā gīr bāḷhe aśvinā tredhā kṣarantī /
analyzed: asarji vām sthavirā vedhasā gīḥ bāḷhe aśvinā tredhā kṣarantī
translated: The two ancient ones have been sent forth by the creator, O ye Aṣvins, flowing in three channels.

original: upastutāv avataṃ nādhamānaṃ yāmann ayāmañ chṛṇutaṃ havam me //
analyzed: upastutau avatam nādhamānam yāman a yāmam śṛṇutam havam me
translated: Favoured with offerings, come to the one who implores you, and listen to my call, as I go to meet you.

original: uta syā vāṃ ruśato vapsaso gīs tribarhiṣi sadasi pinvate nṝn /
analyzed: uta syā vām ruśataḥ vapsasaḥ gīḥ tri barhiṣi sadasi pinvate nṝn
translated: And your praise, O ye who are clothed in red, on the threefold sacred grass, swells the men in the assembly.

original: vṛṣā vām megho vṛṣaṇā pīpāya gor na seke manuṣo daśasyan //
analyzed: vṛṣā vām meghaḥ vṛṣaṇā pīpāya goḥ na seke manuṣaḥ daśasyan
translated: Your bull, O ye Mighty Ones, hath bellowed, like a bull at the she-buffalo, delighting in the cow, delighting in man.

original: yuvām pūṣevāśvinā purandhir agnim uṣāṃ na jarate haviṣmān /🔽huve yad vāṃ varivasyā gṛṇāno vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: yuvām pūṣā iva aśvinā purandhiḥ agnim uṣām na jarate haviṣmān  huve yat vām varivasyā gṛṇānaḥ vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: Like Pusan, O ye Aṣvins, like the Dawn, Purandhi never wearies of the worship of the fire.🔽I call on you, that I may serve you, singing: may we find the treasure-trove, the stall of kine.

original: abhūd idaṃ vayunam o ṣu bhūṣatā ratho vṛṣaṇvān madatā manīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: abhūt idam vayunam ā u su bhūṣata rathaḥ vṛṣaṇvān madata manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: This is the time for you to come, ye Mighty, the chariot that delights the wise, that is strong with horses.

original: dhiyañjinvā dhiṣṇyā viśpalāvasū divo napātā sukṛte śucivratā //
analyzed: dhiyañjinvā dhiṣṇyā viśpalā vasū divaḥ napātā sukṛte śuci vratā
translated: Ye who inspire the thought, ye who are to be adored, ye who are Lords of men, O ye rich in treasure, ye who are Sons of Heaven, of fair vows, of fair deeds.

original: indratamā hi dhiṣṇyā maruttamā dasrā daṃsiṣṭhā rathyā rathītamā /
analyzed: indratamā hi dhiṣṇyā maruttamā dasrā daṃsiṣṭhā rathyā rathītamā
translated: Ye are to be adored as most like Indra, most like the Maruts, most wondrous, most wonderful, most like to chariots.

original: pūrṇaṃ rathaṃ vahethe madhva ācitaṃ tena dāśvāṃsam upa yātho aśvinā //
analyzed: pūrṇam ratham vahethe madhvaḥ ācitam tena dāśvāṃsam upa yāthaḥ aśvinā
translated: Ye bear a chariot full of meath, a chariot decked with gold: on this the Aṣvins come to him who offers.

original: kim atra dasrā kṛṇuthaḥ kim āsāthe jano yaḥ kaś cid ahavir mahīyate /🔽ati kramiṣṭaṃ juratam paṇer asuṃ jyotir viprāya kṛṇutaṃ vacasyave //
analyzed: kim atra dasrā kṛṇuthaḥ kim āsāthe janaḥ yaḥ kaḥ cit a haviḥ mahīyate  ati kramiṣṭam juratam paṇeḥ asum jyotiḥ viprāya kṛṇutam vacasyave
translated: What do ye do, O wondrous Pair, what is your purpose here? The man who offers not is honoured of the folk.🔽Pass by the sinner's curse, pass by the sinner's woe: give light to him who sings your praise, O Wonder-Workers.

original: jambhayatam abhito rāyataḥ śuno hatam mṛdho vidathus tāny aśvinā /
analyzed: jambhayatam abhitas śunaḥ hatam mṛdhaḥ vidathuḥ tāni aśvinā
translated: Destroy the spiteful demons, O ye Rulers, slay the foes, O ye who give the feast, O Aṣvins.

original: vācaṃvācaṃ jaritū ratninīṃ kṛtam ubhā śaṃsaṃ nāsatyāvatam mama //
analyzed: vācam vācam jarituḥ ratninīm kṛtam ubhā śaṃsam nāsatyā avatam mama
translated: For every word of mine, O ye who are to be praised, make ye a treasure-winning word, O ye Nâsatyas, for me.

original: yuvam etaṃ cakrathuḥ sindhuṣu plavam ātmanvantam pakṣiṇaṃ taugryāya kam /
analyzed: yuvam etam cakrathuḥ sindhuṣu plavam ātmanvantam pakṣiṇam taugryāya kam
translated: Ye two have made this floating bridge for Taugry over the rivers, a winged bridge that moves of itself,

original: yena devatrā manasā nirūhathuḥ supaptanī petathuḥ kṣodaso mahaḥ //
analyzed: yena devatrā manasā nirūhathuḥ supaptanī petathuḥ kṣodasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: By which, with a mind directed to the gods, ye have carried him over the great flood, ye who sleep well.

original: avaviddhaṃ taugryam apsv antar anārambhaṇe tamasi praviddham /
analyzed: avaviddham taugryam apsu antar an ārambhaṇe tamasi praviddham
translated: Taugry was cast into the waters, into the fathomless, into the darkness, into the unsupporting (abyss).

original: catasro nāvo jaṭhalasya juṣṭā ud aśvibhyām iṣitāḥ pārayanti //🔽kaḥ svid vṛkṣo niṣṭhito madhye arṇaso yaṃ taugryo nādhitaḥ paryaṣasvajat /
analyzed: catasraḥ nāvaḥ jaṭhalasya juṣṭāḥ ud aśvibhyām iṣitāḥ pārayanti  kaḥ svid vṛkṣaḥ niṣṭhitaḥ madhye arṇasaḥ yam taugryaḥ nādhitaḥ paryaṣasvajat
translated: Four boats, dear to Jaṭha, urged on by the two Asvins, carry him over.🔽What tree is that which stands in the midst of the flood, which Taugry, from below, has seized and embraced?

original: parṇā mṛgasya pataror ivārabha ud aśvinā ūhathuḥ śromatāya kam //
analyzed: parṇā mṛgasya pataroḥ iva ārabhe ud aśvinau ūhathuḥ śromatāya kam
translated: Like the feathers of a flying bird, O ye Asvins, ye have raised up (him) who is to be pitied.

original: tad vāṃ narā nāsatyāv anu ṣyād yad vām mānāsa ucatham avocan /
analyzed: tat vām narā nāsatyau anu syāt yat vām mānāsaḥ ucatham avocan
translated: That, O ye two Nâsatyas, men should follow you, that the two Mânas have spoken this word to you.

original: asmād adya sadasaḥ somyād ā vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: asmāt adya sadasaḥ somyāt ā vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: From this our assembly, O ye who are to be worshipped with Soma, may we obtain the treasure, the wide space, which gives abundant food.

original: taṃ yuñjāthām manaso yo javīyān trivandhuro vṛṣaṇā yas tricakraḥ /
analyzed: tam yuñjāthām manasaḥ yaḥ javīyān tri vandhuraḥ vṛṣaṇā yaḥ tri cakraḥ
translated: Yoke ye that which is swifter than thought, O ye strong ones, which has three seats, which has three wheels,

original: yenopayāthaḥ sukṛto duroṇaṃ tridhātunā patatho vir na parṇaiḥ //
analyzed: yena upayāthaḥ su kṛtaḥ duroṇam tri dhātunā patathaḥ viḥ na parṇaiḥ
translated: By which ye come to the well-built house, ye fly with the three-wheeled (chariot), as if with wings.

original: suvṛd ratho vartate yann abhi kṣāṃ yat tiṣṭhathaḥ kratumantānu pṛkṣe /
analyzed: suvṛt rathaḥ vartate yan abhi kṣām yat tiṣṭhathaḥ kratumantā anu pṛkṣe
translated: When the well-formed chariot moves over the earth, when ye two stand with power over the food,

original: vapur vapuṣyā sacatām iyaṃ gīr divo duhitroṣasā sacethe //
analyzed: vapuḥ vapuṣyā sacatām iyam gīḥ divaḥ duhitrā uṣasā sacethe
translated: Let this song accompany the form of the form-possessor; with the dawn ye are united, O daughters of the sky.

original: ā tiṣṭhataṃ suvṛtaṃ yo ratho vām anu vratāni vartate haviṣmān /
analyzed: ā tiṣṭhatam suvṛtam yaḥ rathaḥ vām anu vratāni vartate haviṣmān
translated: Mount the well-formed chariot, O ye two, which moves according to your ordinances, bringing oblations,

original: yena narā nāsatyeṣayadhyai vartir yāthas tanayāya tmane ca //
analyzed: yena narā nāsatyā iṣayadhyai vartiḥ yāthaḥ tanayāya tmane ca
translated: By which, O Nâsatyas, ye go to the house of the son and of yourselves.

original: mā vāṃ vṛko mā vṛkīr ā dadharṣīn mā pari varktam uta māti dhaktam /
analyzed: mā vām vṛkaḥ mā vṛkīḥ ā dadharṣīt mā pari varktam uta mā ati dhaktam
translated: Let neither wolf nor she-wolf injure you; let not the thief meet you, nor the robber.

original: ayaṃ vām bhāgo nihita iyaṃ gīr dasrāv ime vāṃ nidhayo madhūnām //
analyzed: ayam vām bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ iyam gīḥ dasrau ime vām nidhayaḥ madhūnām
translated: Here is your share, here is the song; these are your honey-basins, O ye Aṣvins.

original: yuvāṃ gotamaḥ purumīḷho atrir dasrā havate 'vase haviṣmān /🔽diśaṃ na diṣṭām ṛjūyeva yantā me havaṃ nāsatyopa yātam //
analyzed: yuvām gotamaḥ purumīḍhaḥ atriḥ dasrā havate vase haviṣmān  diśam na diṣṭām ṛjūyā iva yantā me havam nāsatyā upa yātam
translated: Purumîḷha Gotama, and Atri, O ye Wonder-Workers, call you to their aid with oblations.🔽As one who guides aright the path that is not lost, so Nâsatyas, come to my invocation.

original: atāriṣma tamasas pāram asya prati vāṃ stomo aśvināv adhāyi /
analyzed: atāriṣma tamasaḥ pāram asya prati vām stomaḥ aśvinau adhāyi
translated: We have crossed over to the further shore of this darkness; to you, O Aṣvins, hath been brought this hymn of praise.

original: eha yātam pathibhir devayānair vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: ā iha yātam pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: Come hither by the paths which Gods have travelled, that we may find the treasure-trove, the company that giveth plenteous food.

original: tā vām adya tāv aparaṃ huvemocchantyām uṣasi vahnir ukthaiḥ /
analyzed: tā vām adya tau aparam huvema ucchantyām uṣasi vahniḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: We call on you today, at the rising of the dawn, O Agni, with hymns, to come to us again.

original: nāsatyā kuha cit santāv aryo divo napātā sudāstarāya //
analyzed: nāsatyā kuha cit santau aryaḥ divaḥ napātā sudāstarāya
translated: O Nâsatyas, in the farthest distance, O ye who are to be invoked by all, O ye who are the sons of heaven, to give us good gifts.

original: asme ū ṣu vṛṣaṇā mādayethām ut paṇīṃr hatam ūrmyā madantā /
analyzed: asme u su vṛṣaṇā mādayethām ud paṇīn hatam ūrmyā madantā
translated: O ye mighty ones, rejoice in us: cast down the Pûrus, rejoicing in the waves.

original: śrutam me acchoktibhir matīnām eṣṭā narā nicetārā ca karṇaiḥ //
analyzed: śrutam me acchoktibhiḥ matīnām eṣṭā narā nicetārā ca karṇaiḥ
translated: Hearken to my call with the thoughts of my hymns: ye are to be chosen, O ye Heroes, as the best.

original: śriye pūṣann iṣukṛteva devā nāsatyā vahatuṃ sūryāyāḥ /
analyzed: śriye pūṣan iṣukṛtā iva devā nāsatyā vahatum sūryāyāḥ
translated: O Pûshan, for glory, as a god for the creation of the arrow, O Nâsatyas, for the carrying of Sûryâ.

original: vacyante vāṃ kakuhā apsu jātā yugā jūrṇeva varuṇasya bhūreḥ //
analyzed: vacyante vām kakuhāḥ apsu jātāḥ yugā jūrṇā iva varuṇasya bhūreḥ
translated: Your two Kakuhas are set in motion, born in the waters, as the two yokes of Varuna's wealth.

original: asme sā vām mādhvī rātir astu stomaṃ hinotam mānyasya kāroḥ /
analyzed: asme sā vām mādhvī rātiḥ astu stomam hinotam mānyasya kāroḥ
translated: May that sweet gift of yours be with us: quicken the hymn, ye who are to be invoked by Mâna's son.

original: anu yad vāṃ śravasyā sudānū suvīryāya carṣaṇayo madanti //🔽eṣa vāṃ stomo aśvināv akāri mānebhir maghavānā suvṛkti /🔽yātaṃ vartis tanayāya tmane cāgastye nāsatyā madantā //
analyzed: anu yat vām śravasyā su dānū su vīryāya carṣaṇayaḥ madanti  eṣa vām stomaḥ aśvinau akāri mānebhiḥ maghavānā suvṛkti  yātam vartiḥ tanayāya tmane ca agastye nāsatyā madantā
translated: When, O ye bountiful ones, the men rejoice in you for the sake of your glory and of good hero strength.🔽This hymn, O ye Aṣvins, hath been made for you, O bounteous ones, with praises and fair hymns.🔽Come to the dwelling of Tanas and of Tman, rejoicing in Agastya, O Nâsatyas.

original: atāriṣma tamasas pāram asya prati vāṃ stomo aśvināv adhāyi /
analyzed: atāriṣma tamasaḥ pāram asya prati vām stomaḥ aśvinau adhāyi
translated: We have crossed over to the farther shore of this darkness: to you, O Aṣvins, hath been assigned this hymn of praise.

original: eha yātam pathibhir devayānair vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: ā iha yātam pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: Come hither on the paths that Gods have travelled, and find the people who are rich in horses.

original: katarā pūrvā katarāparāyoḥ kathā jāte kavayaḥ ko vi veda /
analyzed: katarā pūrvā katarā aparā ayoḥ kathā jāte kavayaḥ kaḥ vi veda
translated: Which is the first, which the last of the two? Who knows when the poets were born? Who can tell?

original: viśvaṃ tmanā bibhṛto yad dha nāma vi vartete ahanī cakriyeva //🔽bhūriṃ dve acarantī carantam padvantaṃ garbham apadī dadhāte /
analyzed: viśvam tmanā bibhṛtaḥ yat ha nāma vi vartete ahanī cakriyā iva  bhūrim dve a carantī carantam padvantam garbham apadī dadhāte
translated: They who support the whole world with their own power, the two, like a wheel, revolve as day and night.🔽The two, the many, move along the one who moves, the two, the one with feet, the one without feet, hold the child.

original: nityaṃ na sūnum pitror upasthe dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī no abhvāt //
analyzed: nityam na sūnum pitroḥ upasthe dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī naḥ abhvāt
translated: Protect us, O Heaven and Earth, from the fearful, as the two constant parents their son.

original: aneho dātram aditer anarvaṃ huve svarvad avadhaṃ namasvat /🔽tad rodasī janayataṃ jaritre dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī no abhvāt //
analyzed: anehaḥ dātram aditeḥ anarvam huve svarvat avadham namasvat  tat rodasī janayatam jaritre dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī naḥ abhvāt
translated: I invoke the bountiful, unerring, heaven-bestowing, low-lying, reverent, and prosperous gift of Aditi.🔽May that (gift), O Heaven and Earth, which ye two have generated for the singer, protect us, O Heaven and Earth, from the fearful.

original: atapyamāne avasāvantī anu ṣyāma rodasī devaputre /
analyzed: a tapyamāne avasā avantī anu syāma rodasī deva putre
translated: O Heaven and Earth, who are not heated, who are full of sap, we two shall follow, O ye two Gods' children, the two worlds.

original: ubhe devānām ubhayebhir ahnāṃ dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī no abhvāt //
analyzed: ubhe devānām ubhayebhiḥ ahnām dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī naḥ abhvāt
translated: O Heaven and Earth, who belong to the two sets of gods, who are of two days, protect us, O Heaven and Earth, from the fearful.

original: saṃgacchamāne yuvatī samante svasārā jāmī pitror upasthe /
analyzed: saṃgacchamāne yuvatī samante svasārā jāmī pitroḥ upasthe
translated: The two young maidens, who are united on all sides, the sister and the sister's daughter, in the lap of the parents,

original: abhijighrantī bhuvanasya nābhiṃ dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī no abhvāt //
analyzed: abhijighrantī bhuvanasya nābhim dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī naḥ abhvāt
translated: Smelling each other, the navel of the world, protect us, O Heaven and Earth, from the fearful.

original: urvī sadmanī bṛhatī ṛtena huve devānām avasā janitrī /
analyzed: urvī sadmanī bṛhatī ṛtena huve devānām avasā janitrī
translated: I invoke the two great and true abodes of the gods, the two mothers of the people,

original: dadhāte ye amṛtaṃ supratīke dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī no abhvāt //🔽urvī pṛthvī bahule dūreante upa bruve namasā yajñe asmin /
analyzed: dadhāte ye amṛtam su pratīke dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī naḥ abhvāt  urvī pṛthvī bahule dūreante upa bruve namasā yajñe asmin
translated: Who bestow immortality, O you of fair countenance. Protect us, O heaven and earth, from misfortune.🔽I address with reverence, in this sacrifice, the two vast, wide, far-reaching, bountiful ones.

original: dadhāte ye subhage supratūrtī dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī no abhvāt //
analyzed: dadhāte ye subhage su pratūrtī dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī naḥ abhvāt
translated: Who bestow good fortune, O you of fair countenance. Protect us, O heaven and earth, from misfortune.

original: devān vā yac cakṛmā kac cid āgaḥ sakhāyaṃ vā sadam ij jāspatiṃ vā /
analyzed: devān vā yat cakṛma kad cit āgaḥ sakhāyam vā sadam id jāspatim vā
translated: If we have done anything wrong to the gods, or to a friend, or to a lord of the house,

original: iyaṃ dhīr bhūyā avayānam eṣāṃ dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī no abhvāt //
analyzed: iyam dhīḥ bhūyāḥ avayānam eṣām dyāvā rakṣatam pṛthivī naḥ abhvāt
translated: May this thought of theirs be favorable to us. Protect us, O heaven and earth, from misfortune.

original: ubhā śaṃsā naryā mām aviṣṭām ubhe mām ūtī avasā sacetām /
analyzed: ubhā śaṃsā naryā mām aviṣṭām ubhe mām ūtī avasā sacetām
translated: May the two desirable, manly, and truthful hopes enter me, may the two far-sighted, wise helps attend me.

original: bhūri cid aryaḥ sudāstarāyeṣā madanta iṣayema devāḥ //
analyzed: bhūri cit aryaḥ sudāstarāya iṣā madantaḥ iṣayema devāḥ
translated: May the two bountiful, far-reaching, and generous gods rejoice in this food.

original: ṛtaṃ dive tad avocam pṛthivyā abhiśrāvāya prathamaṃ sumedhāḥ /
analyzed: ṛtam dive tat avocam pṛthivyai abhiśrāvāya prathamam sumedhāḥ
translated: I have spoken this truth first to heaven and earth, to be their witness, O you of good thoughts.

original: pātām avadyād duritād abhīke pitā mātā ca rakṣatām avobhiḥ //
analyzed: pātām avadyāt duritāt abhīke pitā mātā ca rakṣatām avobhiḥ
translated: May the two protectors, the father and the mother, guard me from blame and danger.

original: idaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī satyam astu pitar mātar yad ihopabruve vām /
analyzed: idam dyāvāpṛthivī satyam astu pitar mātar yat iha upabruve vām
translated: Let this be true, O heaven and earth, O father and mother, whatever I tell you here.

original: bhūtaṃ devānām avame avobhir vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: bhūtam devānām avame avobhiḥ vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: The lowest of the gods, with their aids, we will find the treasure, the people, with easy paths.

original: ā na iḷābhir vidathe suśasti viśvānaraḥ savitā deva etu /
analyzed: ā naḥ iḷābhiḥ vidathe su śasti viśvānaraḥ savitā devaḥ etu
translated: May Savitar the god, all-men, come to our assembly with the Iḷās, with fair praises,

original: api yathā yuvāno matsathā no viśvaṃ jagad abhipitve manīṣā //
analyzed: api yathā yuvānaḥ matsatha naḥ viśvam jagat abhipitve manīṣā
translated: So that, like young men, they may delight us: may all the world, by thought, attend our sacrifice.

original: ā no viśva āskrā gamantu devā mitro aryamā varuṇaḥ sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ viśve āskrāḥ gamantu devāḥ mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: May all the gods come to us, to our assembly, Mitra, Aryaman, Varuna, of one mind,

original: bhuvan yathā no viśve vṛdhāsaḥ karan suṣāhā vithuraṃ na śavaḥ //
analyzed: bhuvan yathā naḥ viśve vṛdhāsaḥ karan vithuram na śavaḥ
translated: So that all the increasers may be ours, and make us very mighty, as 'twere by strength.

original: preṣṭhaṃ vo atithiṃ gṛṇīṣe 'gniṃ śastibhis turvaṇiḥ sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: preṣṭham vaḥ atithim gṛṇīṣe gnim śastibhiḥ turvaṇiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: I praise for you your dearest guest, Agni, with praises, accordant, O you who delight in praise.

original: asad yathā no varuṇaḥ sukīrtir iṣaś ca parṣad arigūrtaḥ sūriḥ //
analyzed: asat yathā naḥ varuṇaḥ su kīrtiḥ iṣaḥ ca parṣat ari gūrtaḥ sūriḥ
translated: So that good fame may be ours, and Varuna, and the prince, whom many praise, may give us food and strength.

original: upa va eṣe namasā jigīṣoṣāsānaktā sudugheva dhenuḥ /
analyzed: upa vaḥ eṣe namasā jigīṣā uṣāsānaktā su dughā iva dhenuḥ
translated: I seek with reverence this your conquering Eṣa, the night, like a milch-cow, yielding good things,

original: samāne ahan vimimāno arkaṃ viṣurūpe payasi sasminn ūdhan //🔽uta no 'hir budhnyo mayas kaḥ śiśuṃ na pipyuṣīva veti sindhuḥ /
analyzed: samāne ahan vimimānaḥ arkam viṣurūpe payasi sasmin ūdhan  uta naḥ hiḥ budhnyaḥ mayaḥ kaḥ śiśum na pipyuṣī iva veti sindhuḥ
translated: Measuring the light in the same day, in the same place, in the same milk, in this udder.🔽And may the Ahi Budhnya, the good one, swell for us, like a nurse, the child, the river.

original: yena napātam apāṃ junāma manojuvo vṛṣaṇo yaṃ vahanti //
analyzed: yena napātam apām junāma manaḥ juvaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yam vahanti
translated: By whom we shall honour the son of the waters, the strong ones, who are borne by him, who is swift as thought.

original: uta na īṃ tvaṣṭā gantv acchā smat sūribhir abhipitve sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: uta naḥ īm tvaṣṭā gantu acchā smat sūribhiḥ abhipitve sajoṣāḥ
translated: And may Tvastr come to us, in accord with our princes, to our assembly, to our feast.

original: ā vṛtrahendraś carṣaṇiprās tuviṣṭamo narāṃ na iha gamyāḥ //
analyzed: ā vṛtrahā indraḥ carṣaṇi prāḥ tuviṣṭamaḥ narām naḥ iha gamyāḥ
translated: May Indra, the Vr̥itra-slayer, the leader of men, the most mighty, come hither to us.

original: uta na īm matayo 'śvayogāḥ śiśuṃ na gāvas taruṇaṃ rihanti /
analyzed: uta naḥ īm matayaḥ śvayogāḥ śiśum na gāvaḥ taruṇam rihanti
translated: And our thoughts, yoked with horses, kiss the young child, as the cows kiss the tender calf.

original: tam īṃ giro janayo na patnīḥ surabhiṣṭamaṃ narāṃ nasanta //
analyzed: tam īm giraḥ janayaḥ na patnīḥ surabhiṣṭamam narām nasanta
translated: The songs have generated him, the most fragrant, as wives their husband.

original: uta na īm maruto vṛddhasenāḥ smad rodasī samanasaḥ sadantu /
analyzed: uta naḥ īm marutaḥ vṛddha senāḥ smat rodasī samanasaḥ sadantu
translated: And may the Maruts, with their mighty army, agree together, in accord, to help us.

original: pṛṣadaśvāso 'vanayo na rathā riśādaso mitrayujo na devāḥ //
analyzed: pṛṣat aśvāsaḥ vanayaḥ na rathāḥ riśādasaḥ mitra yujaḥ na devāḥ
translated: The Rishis, the sons of Dyaus, the friends of men, the destroyers of enemies, the gods, with their teams of spotted horses.

original: pra nu yad eṣām mahinā cikitre pra yuñjate prayujas te suvṛkti /
analyzed: pra nu yat eṣām mahinā cikitre pra yuñjate prayujaḥ te suvṛkti
translated: Now when they are to be invoked by their greatness, they are to be invoked by their good hymns.

original: adha yad eṣāṃ sudine na śarur viśvam eriṇam pruṣāyanta senāḥ //
analyzed: adha yat eṣām sudine na śaruḥ viśvam ā iriṇam pruṣāyanta senāḥ
translated: And when their army, in fair weather, is to be sent forth, they send forth all the desert places.

original: pro aśvināv avase kṛṇudhvam pra pūṣaṇaṃ svatavaso hi santi /
analyzed: pra u aśvinau avase kṛṇudhvam pra pūṣaṇam sva tavasaḥ hi santi
translated: Now do ye invoke the two Asvins for help; invoke Pûshan, for he is of good will.

original: adveṣo viṣṇur vāta ṛbhukṣā acchā sumnāya vavṛtīya devān //
analyzed: a dveṣaḥ viṣṇuḥ vātaḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ acchā sumnāya vavṛtīya devān
translated: Vishnu, the friendless one, the wind, the R̥ibhukshan, have turned to the gods for happiness.

original: iyaṃ sā vo asme dīdhitir yajatrā apiprāṇī ca sadanī ca bhūyāḥ /
analyzed: iyam sā vaḥ asme dīdhitiḥ yajatrā apiprāṇī ca sadanī ca bhūyāḥ
translated: This is your thought, O ye holy ones, for us: be it a thought that gives us life and rest.

original: ni yā deveṣu yatate vasūyur vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: ni yā deveṣu yatate vasūyuḥ vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: Who strives among the gods for wealth, may we find the treasure-laden home.

original: pituṃ nu stoṣam maho dharmāṇaṃ taviṣīm /
analyzed: pitum nu stoṣam mahaḥ dharmāṇam taviṣīm
translated: I will praise the father, the lord of great powers,

original: yasya trito vy ojasā vṛtraṃ viparvam ardayat //
analyzed: yasya tritaḥ vi ojasā vṛtram viparvam ardayat
translated: whose son Trita with his strength crushed Vṛtra, the one with broken joints.

original: svādo pito madho pito vayaṃ tvā vavṛmahe /
analyzed: svādo pitaḥ madho pitaḥ vayam tvā vavṛmahe
translated: O sweet father, O honeyed father, we have chosen you.

original: asmākam avitā bhava //
analyzed: asmākam avitā bhava
translated: Be our protector.

original: upa naḥ pitav ā cara śivaḥ śivābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: upa naḥ pito ā cara śivaḥ śivābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Come to us, O father, with your auspicious aids,

original: mayobhur adviṣeṇyaḥ sakhā suśevo advayāḥ //
analyzed: mayobhuḥ adviṣeṇyaḥ sakhā su śevaḥ advayāḥ
translated: the delightful one, the one without enemies, the friend, the one with good gifts, the one without a second.

original: tava tye pito rasā rajāṃsy anu viṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: tava tye pito rasāḥ rajāṃsi anu viṣṭhitāḥ
translated: O father, these juices of yours are spread out along the regions,

original: divi vātā iva śritāḥ //
analyzed: divi vātāḥ iva śritāḥ
translated: like winds in the sky.

original: tava tye pito dadatas tava svādiṣṭha te pito /
analyzed: tava tye pito dadataḥ tava svādiṣṭha te pito
translated: O father, these are yours, the most delicious, O father.

original: pra svādmāno rasānāṃ tuvigrīvā iverate //
analyzed: pra svādmānaḥ rasānām tuvi grīvāḥ iva īrate
translated: The delightful juices are released like strong-necked ones.

original: tve pito mahānāṃ devānām mano hitam /
analyzed: tve pito mahānām devānām manaḥ hitam
translated: O father, in you is placed the great mind of the gods.

original: akāri cāru ketunā tavāhim avasāvadhīt //
analyzed: akāri cāru ketunā tava ahim avasā avadhīt
translated: He has done what is beautiful with a banner. He has killed Ahi.

original: yad ado pito ajagan vivasva parvatānām /
analyzed: yat adaḥ pito ajagan vivasva parvatānām
translated: O father, when you have gone, O Vivasvat, to the mountains,

original: atrā cin no madho pito 'ram bhakṣāya gamyāḥ //
analyzed: atrā cit naḥ madho pito ram bhakṣāya gamyāḥ
translated: then, O sweet father, you should come to us for our enjoyment.

original: yad apām oṣadhīnām pariṃśam āriśāmahe /
analyzed: yat apām oṣadhīnām pariṃśam āriśāmahe
translated: When we obtain the full measure of the waters and plants,

original: vātāpe pīva id bhava //
analyzed: vāta āpe pīvaḥ id bhava
translated: O Vātāpi, be full of food.

original: yat te soma gavāśiro yavāśiro bhajāmahe /
analyzed: yat te soma gavāśiraḥ yava āśiraḥ bhajāmahe
translated: O Soma, we enjoy that which is the head of the cows and the head of the barley for you.

original: vātāpe pīva id bhava //🔽karambha oṣadhe bhava pīvo vṛkka udārathiḥ /
analyzed: vāta āpe pīvaḥ id bhava  karambhaḥ oṣadhe bhava pīvaḥ vṛkkaḥ udārathiḥ
translated: Be full of nourishment, O Vata's son.

original: vātāpe pīva id bhava //
analyzed: vāta āpe pīvaḥ id bhava
translated: Be full of nourishment, O Karambha plant, O full of nourishment, O Vrīhi grain, O full of nourishment, O Udāraṭhi.🔽Be full of nourishment, O Vata's son.

original: taṃ tvā vayam pito vacobhir gāvo na havyā suṣūdima /
analyzed: tam tvā vayam pito vacobhiḥ gāvaḥ na havyā suṣūdima
translated: We, O father, with our words, like cows with their milk, have produced for you this offering.

original: devebhyas tvā sadhamādam asmabhyaṃ tvā sadhamādam //
analyzed: devebhyaḥ tvā sadhamādam asmabhyam tvā sadhamādam
translated: For the gods you are the best enjoyer, for us you are the best enjoyer.

original: samiddho adya rājasi devo devaiḥ sahasrajit /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ adya rājasi devaḥ devaiḥ sahasra jit
translated: Today, kindled, you shine as a god with the gods, O conqueror of a thousand (tributaries).

original: dūto havyā kavir vaha //
analyzed: dūtaḥ havyā kaviḥ vaha
translated: As a messenger, carry the oblations, O wise one.

original: tanūnapād ṛtaṃ yate madhvā yajñaḥ sam ajyate /
analyzed: tanūnapāt ṛtam yate madhvā yajñaḥ sam ajyate
translated: Tanūnapāt, who follows the truth, the sacrifice is bound together with sweetness,

original: dadhat sahasriṇīr iṣaḥ //
analyzed: dadhat sahasriṇīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: bearing a thousand gifts.

original: ājuhvāno na īḍyo devāṃ ā vakṣi yajñiyān /
analyzed: ājuhvānaḥ naḥ īḍyaḥ devān ā vakṣi yajñiyān
translated: To be invoked, to be praised, bring the gods who are worthy of sacrifice.

original: agne sahasrasā asi //
analyzed: agne sahasra sāḥ asi
translated: O Agni, you are the conqueror of a thousand (tributaries).

original: prācīnam barhir ojasā sahasravīram astṛṇan /
analyzed: prācīnam barhiḥ ojasā sahasra vīram astṛṇan
translated: They have spread out the eastern sacred grass with strength, with a thousand heroes,

original: yatrādityā virājatha //
analyzed: yatra ādityāḥ virājatha
translated: where the Ādityas shine.

original: virāṭ samrāḍ vibhvīḥ prabhvīr bahvīś ca bhūyasīś ca yāḥ /
analyzed: virāj samrāj vibhvīḥ prabhvīḥ bahvīḥ ca bhūyasīḥ ca yāḥ
translated: The Virāṭ, the emperor, the prosperous, the powerful, the many, and the greater ones,

original: duro ghṛtāny akṣaran //
analyzed: duraḥ ghṛtāni akṣaran
translated: from afar have let the ghee-drops flow.

original: surukme hi supeśasādhi śriyā virājataḥ /
analyzed: su rukme hi supeśasā adhi śriyā virājataḥ
translated: For the two dawnings are indeed well-ornamented, well-formed, and shining with glory.

original: uṣāsāv eha sīdatām //
analyzed: uṣāḥ asau ā iha sīdatām
translated: Let them both sit here.

original: prathamā hi suvācasā hotārā daivyā kavī /
analyzed: prathamā hi suvācasā hotārā daivyā kavī
translated: For the two divine sages, the Hotṛs, are the first with good speech.

original: yajñaṃ no yakṣatām imam //
analyzed: yajñam naḥ yakṣatām imam
translated: May he accept this sacrifice of ours.

original: bhāratīḷe sarasvati yā vaḥ sarvā upabruve /
analyzed: bhārati iḍe sarasvati yāḥ vaḥ sarvāḥ upabruve
translated: Bharati, Ila, Sarasvati, all of you whom I address,

original: tā naś codayata śriye //
analyzed: tāḥ naḥ codayata śriye
translated: Impel us to glory.

original: tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi hi prabhuḥ paśūn viśvān samānaje /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi hi prabhuḥ paśūn viśvān samānaje
translated: Tvastr, indeed, is the lord of forms, of all animals in common.

original: teṣāṃ na sphātim ā yaja //
analyzed: teṣām na sphātim ā yaja
translated: To their increase do I offer.

original: upa tmanyā vanaspate pātho devebhyaḥ sṛja /
analyzed: upa tmanyā vanaspate pāthaḥ devebhyaḥ sṛja
translated: O tree, pour out the juice for yourself and for the gods.

original: agnir havyāni siṣvadat //
analyzed: agniḥ havyāni siṣvadat
translated: May Agni rejoice in the offerings.

original: purogā agnir devānāṃ gāyatreṇa sam ajyate /
analyzed: purogāḥ agniḥ devānām gāyatreṇa sam ajyate
translated: Agni, the leader of the gods, is consecrated with the Gayatri.

original: svāhākṛtīṣu rocate //
analyzed: svāhākṛtīṣu rocate
translated: He shines in the oblations with the word Svâhâ.

original: agne naya supathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān /
analyzed: agne naya su pathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān
translated: O Agni, lead us by a fair path to wealth, O god, thou who knowest all works.

original: yuyodhy asmaj juhurāṇam eno bhūyiṣṭhāṃ te namauktiṃ vidhema //
analyzed: yuyodhi asmat juhurāṇam enaḥ bhūyiṣṭhām te namauktim vidhema
translated: Keep thou from us the sin that brings misfortune. Most ample adoration will we offer thee.

original: agne tvam pārayā navyo asmān svastibhir ati durgāṇi viśvā /
analyzed: agne tvam pāraya navyaḥ asmān svastibhiḥ ati durgāṇi viśvā
translated: O Agni, lead us by a new path to prosperity, over all difficulties.

original: pūś ca pṛthvī bahulā na urvī bhavā tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ //
analyzed: pūḥ ca pṛthvī bahulā naḥ urvī bhava tokāya tanayāya śam yoḥ
translated: Be the earth rich and wide for our offspring and children, for welfare.

original: agne tvam asmad yuyodhy amīvā anagnitrā abhy amanta kṛṣṭīḥ /
analyzed: agne tvam asmat yuyodhi amīvāḥ anagnitrāḥ abhī amanta kṛṣṭīḥ
translated: O Agni, keep thou from us the evil spirits, the men who serve not the fire.

original: punar asmabhyaṃ suvitāya deva kṣāṃ viśvebhir amṛtebhir yajatra //
analyzed: punar asmabhyam suvitāya deva kṣām viśvebhiḥ amṛtebhiḥ yajatra
translated: Again to us, O god, for prosperity, with all the immortal ones, O worthy of sacrifice, do thou grant room.

original: pāhi no agne pāyubhir ajasrair uta priye sadana ā śuśukvān /
analyzed: pāhi naḥ agne pāyubhiḥ ajasraiḥ uta priye sadane ā śuśukvān
translated: Protect us, O Agni, with unfailing protections, and in thy dear abode, O thou of bright flames.

original: mā te bhayaṃ jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭha nūnaṃ vidan māparaṃ sahasvaḥ //
analyzed: mā te bhayam jaritāram yaviṣṭha nūnam vidat mā aparam sahasvas
translated: Let not fear of thee, O Most Youthful, come to the worshipper, nor any other misfortune.

original: mā no agne 'va sṛjo aghāyāviṣyave ripave ducchunāyai /
analyzed: mā naḥ agne vaḥ sṛjaḥ aghāya aviṣyave ripave ducchunāyai
translated: Do not, O Agni, deliver us to the wicked, to the evil-wishing foe, to the reviler.

original: mā datvate daśate mādate no mā rīṣate sahasāvan parā dāḥ //
analyzed: mā datvate daśate mā adate na u mā rīṣate sahasāvan parā dāḥ
translated: Do not to the greedy, the biting, the greedy one, to the one who injures us, O mighty one, give us up.

original: vi gha tvāvāṃ ṛtajāta yaṃsad gṛṇāno agne tanve varūtham /
analyzed: vi gha tvāvān ṛta jāta yaṃsat gṛṇānaḥ agne tanve varūtham
translated: O Agni, born of the Ṛtas, the singer may win thee, O Agni, for his own protection.

original: viśvād ririkṣor uta vā ninitsor abhihrutām asi hi deva viṣpaṭ //
analyzed: viśvāt ririkṣoḥ uta vā ninitsoḥ abhihru tām asi hi deva viṣpaṭ
translated: For the one who would seize from all sides, or the one who would revile, thou art, O God, the avenger.

original: tvaṃ tāṃ agna ubhayān vi vidvān veṣi prapitve manuṣo yajatra /
analyzed: tvam tām agne ubhayān vi vidvān veṣi prapitve manuṣaḥ yajatra
translated: Thou, O Agni, knowing both, goest to the man who offers, O adorable one, to the one who has come near.

original: abhipitve manave śāsyo bhūr marmṛjenya uśigbhir nākraḥ //🔽avocāma nivacanāny asmin mānasya sūnuḥ sahasāne agnau /
analyzed: abhipitve manave śāsyaḥ bhūḥ marmṛjenyaḥ uśigbhiḥ na akraḥ  avocāma nivacanāni asmin mānasya sūnuḥ sahasāne agnau
translated: Be thou to be obeyed by Manu, to be honoured by the wise, to be worshipped by the priests.🔽We have spoken these words in this Agni, the son of Manu, the impetuous one.

original: vayaṃ sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sanema vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: vayam sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sanema vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: May we, with a thousand Ṛṣis, obtain him, may we find the moving people, the giver of good things.

original: anarvāṇaṃ vṛṣabham mandrajihvam bṛhaspatiṃ vardhayā navyam arkaiḥ /
analyzed: anarvāṇam vṛṣabham mandra jihvam bṛhaspatim vardhaya navyam arkaiḥ
translated: The irresistible bull, the one with the sweet tongue, Brhaspati, I exalt with new hymns.

original: gāthānyaḥ suruco yasya devā āśṛṇvanti navamānasya martāḥ //
analyzed: gāthānyaḥ su rucaḥ yasya devāḥ āśṛṇvanti navamānasya martāḥ
translated: Whose hymns the gods and men, the newly-worshipped one, listen to.

original: tam ṛtviyā upa vācaḥ sacante sargo na yo devayatām asarji /
analyzed: tam ṛtviyāḥ upa vācaḥ sacante sargaḥ na yaḥ devayatām asarji
translated: Him the priests follow with their voices, he whom the pious have not sent forth.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ sa hy añjo varāṃsi vibhvābhavat sam ṛte mātariśvā //
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi añjas varāṃsi vibhvā abhavat sam ṛte mātariśvā
translated: Brhaspati is he, the swift one of the boons, the all-pervading one, has become like Matariçvan in the assembly.

original: upastutiṃ namasa udyatiṃ ca ślokaṃ yaṃsat saviteva pra bāhū /
analyzed: upastutim namase udyatim ca ślokam yaṃsat savitā iva pra bāhū
translated: He who gives the praise, the homage, the rising hymn, the glory, like Savitar, the arms.

original: asya kratvāhanyo yo asti mṛgo na bhīmo arakṣasas tuviṣmān //🔽asya śloko divīyate pṛthivyām atyo na yaṃsad yakṣabhṛd vicetāḥ /
analyzed: asya kratvā ahanyaḥ yaḥ asti mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ arakṣasaḥ tuviṣmān  asya ślokaḥ divi īyate pṛthivyām atyaḥ na yaṃsat yakṣa bhṛt vicetāḥ
translated: His is the strength which is like a terrible wild beast, which is not to be resisted, which is mighty.🔽His glory is sung in heaven and on earth; he has been extended like a horse, the bearer of the sacrifice, the wise one.

original: mṛgāṇāṃ na hetayo yanti cemā bṛhaspater ahimāyāṃ abhi dyūn //
analyzed: mṛgāṇām na hetayaḥ yanti ca imāḥ bṛhaspateḥ ahi māyām abhi dyūn
translated: These his arrows go forth like those of the wild beasts, against the clouds of Brhaspati, the deceiver.

original: ye tvā devosrikam manyamānāḥ pāpā bhadram upajīvanti pajrāḥ /
analyzed: ye tvā deva usrikam manyamānāḥ pāpāḥ bhadram upajīvanti pajrāḥ
translated: Those sinful people who, thinking of thee as a god, live on the good as on the evil.

original: na dūḍhye anu dadāsi vāmam bṛhaspate cayasa it piyārum //
analyzed: na dūḍhye anu dadāsi vāmam bṛhaspate cayase id piyārum
translated: Thou givest not the good to the faithless, O Brhaspati, but the dear one to him who strives.

original: supraituḥ sūyavaso na panthā durniyantuḥ pariprīto na mitraḥ /
analyzed: su praituḥ sū yavasaḥ na panthāḥ durniyantuḥ pariprītaḥ na mitraḥ
translated: The path of him who goes well is like that of him who has good grass; the friend who is well-pleased is like him who is difficult to restrain.

original: anarvāṇo abhi ye cakṣate no 'pīvṛtā aporṇuvanto asthuḥ //
analyzed: anarvāṇaḥ abhi ye cakṣate na u pīvṛtāḥ aporṇuvantaḥ asthuḥ
translated: Those who look upon us as not to be resisted have come, covering the waters, as if they would open them.

original: saṃ yaṃ stubho 'vanayo na yanti samudraṃ na sravato rodhacakrāḥ /
analyzed: sam yam stubhaḥ vanayaḥ na yanti samudram na sravataḥ rodha cakrāḥ
translated: Him whom the hymns of praise approach as the streams their ocean, as the wheels their pivot,

original: sa vidvāṃ ubhayaṃ caṣṭe antar bṛhaspatis tara āpaś ca gṛdhraḥ //
analyzed: sa vidvān ubhayam caṣṭe antar bṛhaspatiḥ taraḥ āpaḥ ca gṛdhraḥ
translated: He, the wise, looks on both sides, Brhaspati, the eagle, and the waters.

original: evā mahas tuvijātas tuviṣmān bṛhaspatir vṛṣabho dhāyi devaḥ /
analyzed: eva mahaḥ tuvi jātaḥ tuviṣmān bṛhaspatiḥ vṛṣabhaḥ dhāyi devaḥ
translated: Thus hath the mighty, the most mighty, the strong, the bull, the god, Brhaspati, been made great.

original: sa na stuto vīravad dhātu gomad vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: sa naḥ stutaḥ vīravat dhātu gomat vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: May he, when praised, bestow on us heroic sons and wealth in cattle. May we obtain the people who give plenteous gifts.

original: kaṅkato na kaṅkato 'tho satīnakaṅkataḥ /
analyzed: kaṅkataḥ na kaṅkataḥ satīna kaṅkataḥ
translated: The Kankata, the Kankata of the Satins,

original: dvāv iti pluṣī iti ny adṛṣṭā alipsata //🔽adṛṣṭān hanty āyaty atho hanti parāyatī /
analyzed: dvau iti pluṣī iti ni adṛṣṭāḥ alipsata  adṛṣṭān hanti āyatī atha u hanti parāyatī
translated: The two invisible Plishis have been destroyed.🔽The invisible one destroys when it comes, and destroys when it goes away.

original: atho avaghnatī hanty atho pinaṣṭi piṃṣatī //
analyzed: atha u avaghnatī hanti atha u pinaṣṭi piṃṣatī
translated: And the one that crushes destroys, and the one that grinds grinds.

original: śarāsaḥ kuśarāso darbhāsaḥ sairyā uta /
analyzed: śarāsaḥ kuśarāsaḥ darbhāsaḥ sairyāḥ uta
translated: The arrows, the sharp arrows, the Darbha grass, the Sairyas,

original: mauñjā adṛṣṭā vairiṇāḥ sarve sākaṃ ny alipsata //
analyzed: mauñjāḥ adṛṣṭāḥ vairiṇāḥ sarve sākam ni alipsata
translated: The Muñja grass, the invisible enemies, all together have been destroyed.

original: ni gāvo goṣṭhe asadan ni mṛgāso avikṣata /
analyzed: ni gāvaḥ goṣṭhe asadan ni mṛgāsaḥ avikṣata
translated: The cows have sat down in the stable, the deer have sat down in their place.

original: ni ketavo janānāṃ ny adṛṣṭā alipsata //
analyzed: ni ketavaḥ janānām ni adṛṣṭāḥ alipsata
translated: The lights of men have been destroyed, the invisible ones have been destroyed.

original: eta u tye praty adṛśran pradoṣaṃ taskarā iva /
analyzed: ete u tye prati adṛśran pradoṣam taskarāḥ iva
translated: These have been seen again, like thieves at the end of the night.

original: adṛṣṭā viśvadṛṣṭāḥ pratibuddhā abhūtana //
analyzed: adṛṣṭāḥ viśva dṛṣṭāḥ pratibuddhāḥ abhūtana
translated: The invisible ones, seen by all, have been awakened, have come to life.

original: dyaur vaḥ pitā pṛthivī mātā somo bhrātāditiḥ svasā /
analyzed: dyauḥ vaḥ pitā pṛthivī mātā somaḥ bhrātā aditiḥ svasā
translated: Heaven is your father, Earth your mother, Soma your brother, Aditi your sister.

original: adṛṣṭā viśvadṛṣṭās tiṣṭhatelayatā su kam //
analyzed: adṛṣṭāḥ viśva dṛṣṭāḥ tiṣṭhata ilayata su kam
translated: Unseen, all-seeing, stand firm, O house, with good luck.

original: ye aṃsyā ye aṅgyāḥ sūcīkā ye prakaṅkatāḥ /
analyzed: ye aṃsyāḥ ye aṅgyāḥ sūcīkāḥ ye prakaṅkatāḥ
translated: Those that are in the shoulders, those that are in the limbs, those that are needles, those that are bent,

original: adṛṣṭāḥ kiṃ caneha vaḥ sarve sākaṃ ni jasyata //
analyzed: adṛṣṭāḥ kim cana iha vaḥ sarve sākam ni jasyata
translated: Unseen, do nothing here. All of you together, go away.

original: ut purastāt sūrya eti viśvadṛṣṭo adṛṣṭahā /
analyzed: ud purastāt sūryaḥ eti viśva dṛṣṭaḥ adṛṣṭa hā
translated: The sun rises in the east, all-seeing, the destroyer of the unseen.

original: adṛṣṭān sarvāñ jambhayan sarvāś ca yātudhānyaḥ //🔽ud apaptad asau sūryaḥ puru viśvāni jūrvan /
analyzed: adṛṣṭān sarvām jambhayan sarvāḥ ca yātudhānyaḥ  ud apaptat asau sūryaḥ puru viśvāni jūrvan
translated: Crushing all the unseen ones and all the witches.🔽This sun has risen, burning all things,

original: ādityaḥ parvatebhyo viśvadṛṣṭo adṛṣṭahā //
analyzed: ādityaḥ parvatebhyaḥ viśva dṛṣṭaḥ adṛṣṭa hā
translated: The sun, all-seeing, the destroyer of the unseen, from the mountains.

original: sūrye viṣam ā sajāmi dṛtiṃ surāvato gṛhe /
analyzed: sūrye viṣam ā sajāmi dṛtim surāvataḥ gṛhe
translated: In the sun I mix poison, a plug in the house of the wine-presser.

original: so cin nu na marāti no vayam marāmāre asya yojanaṃ hariṣṭhā madhu tvā madhulā cakāra //
analyzed: sā u cit nu na marāti na u vayam marāma āre asya yojanam hariṣṭhāḥ madhu tvā madhulā cakāra
translated: He, indeed, does not die, nor do we die, O enemy. His yoke is the most beautiful. Honey has made you sweet with sweetness.

original: iyattikā śakuntikā sakā jaghāsa te viṣam /
analyzed: iyattikā śakuntikā sakā jaghāsa te viṣam
translated: So much as the little bird has swallowed of your poison.

original: so cin nu na marāti no vayam marāmāre asya yojanaṃ hariṣṭhā madhu tvā madhulā cakāra //
analyzed: sā u cit nu na marāti na u vayam marāma āre asya yojanam hariṣṭhāḥ madhu tvā madhulā cakāra
translated: He, indeed, does not die, nor do we die, O enemy. His yoke is the most beautiful. Honey has made you sweet with sweetness.

original: triḥ sapta viṣpuliṅgakā viṣasya puṣyam akṣan /
analyzed: tris sapta viṣpuliṅgakā viṣasya puṣyam akṣan
translated: The Viṣpulinga snakes have eaten the poison plant three times seven times.

original: tāś cin nu na maranti no vayam marāmāre asya yojanaṃ hariṣṭhā madhu tvā madhulā cakāra //
analyzed: tāḥ cit nu na maranti na u vayam marāma āre asya yojanam hariṣṭhāḥ madhu tvā madhulā cakāra
translated: Are they not dead? We are not dead. We have removed the bond of this one. Honey, the sweet one, has made you sweet.

original: navānāṃ navatīnāṃ viṣasya ropuṣīṇām /
analyzed: navānām navatīnām viṣasya ropuṣīṇām
translated: Of the ninety-nine

original: sarvāsām agrabhaṃ nāmāre asya yojanaṃ hariṣṭhā madhu tvā madhulā cakāra //
analyzed: sarvāsām agrabham nāma āre asya yojanam hariṣṭhāḥ madhu tvā madhulā cakāra
translated: Of all the poisons I have seized the name. We have removed the bond of this one. Honey, the sweet one, has made you sweet.

original: triḥ sapta mayūryaḥ sapta svasāro agruvaḥ /
analyzed: tris sapta mayūryaḥ sapta svasāraḥ agruvaḥ
translated: Three times seven are the mayūra birds, seven are the sisters with the upper millstone.

original: tās te viṣaṃ vi jabhrira udakaṃ kumbhinīr iva //
analyzed: tāḥ te viṣam vi jabhrire udakam kumbhinīḥ iva
translated: They have scattered your poison like water-carrying jars.

original: iyattakaḥ kuṣumbhakas takam bhinadmy aśmanā /
analyzed: iyattakaḥ kuṣumbhakaḥ takam bhinadmi aśmanā
translated: So great is the Kusumbhaka. I break it with a stone.

original: tato viṣam pra vāvṛte parācīr anu saṃvataḥ //
analyzed: tatas viṣam pra vāvṛte parācīḥ anu saṃvataḥ
translated: From there the poison is driven away to the farthest end of the year.

original: kuṣumbhakas tad abravīd gireḥ pravartamānakaḥ /
analyzed: kuṣumbhakaḥ tat abravīt gireḥ pravartamānakaḥ
translated: The Kusumbhaka said this, the one flowing from the mountain.

original: vṛścikasyārasaṃ viṣam arasaṃ vṛścika te viṣam //
analyzed: vṛścikasya arasam viṣam arasam vṛścika te viṣam
translated: The poison of the scorpion is harmless, harmless is your poison, O scorpion.
